title: Payments Data Analyst
description: Payments Data Analyst is responsible for developing and maintaining a Payments dashboard and ensuring the integrity of data gathering and reporting between partner vendors and Logix systems. Works with internal and external databases to assist in evaluating our card portfolios and identifying trends. Develops monthly and quarterly reporting of transnational data. Assists with key projects initiated by Payments Division.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.   • Develops knowledge and skills in current tools and practices in the Payments industry. • Monitors, tracks, and creates reports for Senior Management, Loss Mitigation, Consumer Lending, and Sales on payments volume and performance of Payment products. • Works closely with Programming and Digital Channels to extract data and assists Marketing in identifying targets for Payment related campaigns. • Assists in developing recommendations to increase penetration, activation, and utilization of payments channel products and services. • Creates reporting on Credit and Debit Card Rewards program and provides monthly analysis. • Works with Payments Management to develop and produce a quarterly Payments update with data on Logix Payments products and trends in marketplace. • Continuously reviews industry resources for Payments trends and innovations. • Collaborates with Card Services, Programming, Digital Channels, Fraud Risk Management, and Finance on projects and analyses. • Assists VP Payments on Payments related projects and analyses. • Downloads monthly credit and debit card transnational data from card processor and provides to Accounting. • Assists Manager Card Services with weekly card fraud reissues     Education and/or Experience • Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Math, Statistics, or related disciplines. • Must have experience developing and analyzing member transaction trends using statistical analysis and mathematical modeling. • Minimum 3 years of experience performing financial analysis on products or programs. • Must have a thorough knowledge of the Microsoft Office products particularly Excel and Access. Familiarity with Tableau is desirable. • Working knowledge of financial institution operations preferred. • Demonstrated ability to multi-task accurately and timely in a deadline driven environment; ability to work both independently and in a team. • Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate to all levels of employees including senior management. • Must have superior oral, written and presentation communication skills. • Demonstrated ability to work with confidential data and ensure integrity of data. Must also demonstrate conduct consistent with our Corporate Values: Practice open Communication with all levels; Be Accountable by taking ownership of customer issues and responsibility for one’s actions; Foster Teamwork by cooperating and collaborating with other employees; Seek ways to make the workplace Fun for oneself & others; Conduct oneself with Integrity by being honest, trustworthy and ethical in all work activities and interactions; Work with a Service Orientation by having a genuine concern for the needs of one’s customers and by being friendly, professional and following through on commitments; and Demonstrate Humility in all interactions and remember to leave one’s ego at the door when one arrives to work. Logix Federal Credit Union is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran or disability status, or any other status protected by law.https://boards.greenhouse.io/logix/jobs/1161997

title: Senior Manager, Enterprise Applications - BI & Data Analytics
description: Senior Manager of Enterprise Applications – BI & Data Analytics, San Francisco   Axiom, a pioneer in the legal industry and a leading, global provider of technology-enabled legal solutions, is seeking a Senior Manager of Enterprise Applications to join our team in San Francisco.  Axiom Axiom, a recognized leader in the business of law, is a new category of professional services firm and the world's largest provider of tech-enabled legal, contracts, and compliance solutions for large enterprises. Axiom is pioneering change, innovation, and value in one of the world’s largest economies that has not yet fully yielded to innovation and modernization. The Financial Times ranked Axiom #1 in business of law, #1 in innovation in corporate strategy and #1 in innovation in law firm efficiency, while The New York Times said Axiom is “rewriting the law firm business model.” We’re comprised of over 2,000 passionate Axiomites who serve over half the Fortune 100 across 17 offices globally (…and growing!).The Role As a senior member of our Enterprise Applications Team, you will be responsible for defining and overseeing the multi-year data strategy and roadmap to build, establish and mature Axiom’s enterprise-wide data management, governance, and BI/analytics reporting program.   If you believe in being a team player, can collaborate and communicate well with technical and non-technical audiences while bringing a result-driven, focused, high energy, confident, curious, quirky, and most of all fun sense of self, then this is the place for you.   Specifically, this role will: Lead efforts to define and oversee a multi-year technology roadmap to create the long-term technology infrastructure and data platform to deliver BI and analytics capabilities. Provide technical leadership, operational analysis, design, and consultation in areas of enterprise data architecture, data management, and analytics on the EDW and BI Analytics reporting initiative. Play a key role on system and technology decisions in shaping Axiom’s data technology stack and visualization toolset. Partner with business functions to define, design and implement best practices/processes for data governance and management including developing change management processes for new data elements, changing existing data mappings, updating reports, archiving and storage. Maintain all data related relationships; internally with key business partners including but not limited to IT, Finance and Sales Operations and externally with 3rd party data providers. Partner with business functions to identify and execute on data projects to continuously drive Axiom’s data capabilities, inclusive of defining goals & requirements, managing project timelines, budgeting, assigning & allocating resources, coordinating third-parties, managing risks, contingency planning, and communication of status. Initially a hands-on role with opportunity to build own data team to support and drive adoption of data technologies across the company. Own, maintain and support the company’s existing (data marts) and new data solutions ensuring compliance with agreed upon SLAs. Successful Candidates Successful candidates must be fits for Axiom’s unique operating environment and culture: high-growth, innovative, lean, and values-driven. As such, successful candidates must be highly capable in each of the following dimensions (among others): adaptability, curiosity, resourcefulness, analytical thinking/problem solving, proactivity, collaboration, technological savvy, and operating with/through a lean team (for people leaders: must be comfortable in a player/coach role).Beyond these characteristics, here are the required skills, knowledge, capabilities, and education for this particular role: Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or university with a minimum of ten years of related post-graduate work experience in designing, implementing and supporting enterprise data warehouse and BI/data analytics reporting solutions. Familiarity with domestic and foreign privacy laws (GDPR, HIPAA) and data security best practices. Experience with modern data programming language - using it to manipulate and load data (Python) into applications & extracting from applications (Salesforce, Workday and NetSuite OpenAir). Experience with at least one leading BI/Reporting platform (Tableau, Domo). Solid knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language), RDBMS (MS SQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle), database technologies (relational, NoSQL) and data storage capabilities and applications. Knowledge of, or experience using Amazon Web Services. Solid hands on experience in building & operating real-time and batch data pipelines and APIs. Experience with Dell Boomi or Informatica a plus. Ability to succeed in fast paced environments at a high-growth company; comfortable with tight timelines; possessing a sense of urgency. Ability to find creative solutions to problems combined with a willingness to do what one must to ensure timelines & goals are met. Ability to work as a member of a team, lead specialists, manage all aspects of projects, and provide consultancy & support to business customers. Decisiveness, good judgement, strong organization skills, project management skills, strong technical knowledge, excellent oral and written communication skills, and strong interpersonal communication skills. Ability to quickly learn new technologies and keep abreast of the latest technological advances. Exhibits Axiom’s core values: Irresistible, Fresh, Committed & Thoughtful. Legally eligible to work in the country in which the position is located.   Additional Information Axiom is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workforce.

title: Research Data Analyst/Senior Statistician - San Diego
description: DescriptionUnder general supervision, uses multiple statistical software packages to look for outliers and anomalies in the data. Writes and debugs code using several statistical software packages such as R and SAS. Designs, maintains and documents procedures, including methods and summary/conclusions. Interfaces between biostatisticians and all the data used for the analyses. Uses skills as a seasoned, experienced research professional with a full understanding of in-depth statistical analyses and/or research software programming techniques.The incumbent demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Develops, plans and executes a wide range of statistical analyses including multi-variable, mathematical modeling, power and sample size calculations, mixed effect modeling of longitudinal data and non-parametric statistics related to ophthalmic and vision science research. Uses skills as a seasoned, experienced research professional with a full understanding of in-depth statistical analyses and/or research software programming techniques. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.Minimum Qualifications A Bachelor's Degree in related area; and/or equivalent experience/training.Three (3+) or more years of research data analysis and/or statistician experience.Proven expertise in using R, STATA, SAS and/or other statistical software as needed.Experience managing and working with large-scale multivariate longitudinal data-bases.Demonstrated experience preparing and submitting manuscripts for publication.Skills to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner verbally and written.Research skills at a level to evaluate alternate solutions and develop recommendations.Proven experience doing complex statistical programming. Thorough skills associated with statistical analysis and systems programming.Strong skills in project management. Thorough knowledge of research function. Thorough skills in analysis and consultation.Expertise in univariate and multivariate statistical procedures for cross-sectional and longitudinal study designs including linear and logistic regression, mixed effects modeling, and/or Cox proportional hazards.Preferred QualificationsMS or PhD in statistics preferred. SPECIAL CONDITIONSEmployment is subject to a criminal background check.

title: Pricing Analyst
description: Compass Analytics is an innovative FinTech company and leading provider of mortgage pricing and risk management analytics to banks and financial institutions nationwide. We are actively seeking a strong candidate to join our Pricing team in downtown San Francisco or Irvine, CA where the new team member will gain exposure to mortgage capital markets, investor pricing, market data, risk metrics, best practices and contribute to the further development of our industry leading technology.Compass is actively seeking a Pricing Analyst to join its team in its downtown San Francisco or Irvine, CA office. This position may be responsible for: Supporting Lead Pricing Analyst in gathering market and investor data, adding and formatting new investor data and troubleshooting/solving pricing issues Learning Lead Pricing Analyst role and providing backup when necessary Undertaking a lead role in business/pricing projects and communicating effectively with business and IT groups Seeking improvements in processes and recommending solutions to business and IT groups Investor model management Generating risk metrics and maintaining models P/L and hedge position reconciliation Trade executionAs this position may involve trading, the hours required are similar to east coast market hours. Desired Skills and Experience:Requirements: High undergraduate GPA in finance, physics or math program or high GPA in another discipline combined with relevant industry experience. Some experience in mortgage capital markets/secondary marketing is desired though not required - this may include lock desk operations, rate sheet generation, hedge position review and profitability analysis. Candidate must have a strong work ethic and excellent problem solving and analytical skills. Attention to detail and communication skills are a must, as is a capacity to analyze and solve issues quickly. Ideal candidate will be experienced with Excel, SQL, Bloomberg, Thomson Reuters Eikon or other information services. The candidate will be considered for advancement only after displaying proven aptitude, acquisition of business knowledge and ability/willingness to train replacement.Interested candidates should submit a formal resume, cover letter explaining your interest in this position, GPA and SAT (or ACT) scores and must be authorized to work in the USA. Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.Please, no phone calls about this job!Please do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interestsBenefits:Competitive compensation based on experience, health benefits, 401(k) match, commuter benefits, catered lunches and a fun and challenging work environmentCompany Description:Compass provides cutting-edge analytics, real-time advisory and active risk management services to mortgage originators, bankers, traders and investors. Compass' platform is revolutionizing the way mortgages are priced and sold through the use of innovative real-time technology supported by client service, expertise, and guidance. Compass' suite of tools includes CompassPoint™, CompassPPE™, CompassBid™, CompassDirect™, and CompassCommit™. Compass is headquartered in San Francisco and has offices in Washington DC, New York City and Irvine, California. Visit our web site at www.compass-analytics.com for more information.

title: Volunteer: Data Security Risk & Compliance Analyst
description: Only 8% of social enterprises are at growth-stage and beyond (with more than 100employees). This creates a mismatch between the needs of socialenterprises and the behavior of impact investors. The vast majority of socialenterprises are at seed stage or venture stage. But impact investors direct89% of their capital to post-venture, grow-stage social enterprises and large,established, publicly-traded social enterprises. For-profit socialenterprises with high potential impact have had very limited access tovolunteers. Until now there has been no mechanism for individuals in thegeneral public to grant their own time to help change the world by increasingthe chances that fledgling social enterprises can bring transformativesocial innovations to market. CrowdDoing was created to provide such amechanism. Studies show that in addition to raising less capital than theirtraditional venture-backed startup peers, social enterprises have less accessto expertise relevant to their needs than their startup peers do.Responsible for building programs, policies and practices to ensure that the organization complies with industry and government regulatory compliance. Increase security awareness, assess compliance and where necessary, provide support in remediating non-compliant areas.Essential TasksLeverage risk assessment to develop & refine on-going processes and deliverablesReasearch and provide inputs on standards as regulations such as GDPRAct as an advisor to associates and management on specific security requirements, implementations and the impact on business processes, applications and systems as neededAssist in data protection program initiativesCommunicate identified security risks to appropriate parties to ensure a clear understanding of the risks as well as potential mitigations SkillsStrong understanding of security governance, compliance, and risk management principlesAnalytical ability to assess risks, adequacy of controls, and impact upon business processesAbility to work and learn independentlyStrong written and verbal communication skills with all levels of managementAbility to manage multiple tasks concurrentlyThis is a volunteer opportunity provided by VolunteerMatch, in partnership with LinkedIn for Good.Desired Skills and ExperienceThis position requires the following skills: Critical Thinking, Advocacy, Multi-Tasking, Problem Solving, Networking

title: Master Data Analyst
description: *Local candidates only - must live in or near Orange County, CA*Position Requirement Overview: The Master Data Analyst will act as gatekeeper to ensure all critical data elements are in place, using consistent naming conventions and established nomenclature before SKU/Item activation and/or use. Responsibilities: • Responsible for managing workflows and requests for all item master and Bill of Material (BOM) creations, changes and maintenance• Identify areas for data quality improvements and help to resolve data quality issues through process control / improvement and error detection / correction • Collaboration with cross functional departments in the development of the company's master data management business rules and processes in support of operational efficiency• Ensures an efficient and successful change management process by defining and documenting on-going process changes• Conducts data cleansing to identify unused and/or duplicate data for better management and quicker access Qualifications / Requirements: • Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Business or another related field and/or 5 years equivalent work experience preferred• Minimum 3 years’ experience in the Beauty / Cosmetics industry preferred • Working knowledge of SAP ERP / Material Master preferred • Minimum intermediate Excel skills• Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of personnel by phone, in person or written communication • Ability to work under pressure in a detailed, organized manner  *Please send resumes to jobs@senegence.com

title: Business Process Analyst - Data Analytics
description: General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems.We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Business Process Analyst to work within our Aeronautical Systems Earned Value Management System (EVMS) Compliance group in Poway, Ca. This position, under general direction is responsible for conducting full lifecycle process and/or data analysis to include requirements and design activities. A successful team member must demonstrate agile data analytics presentation/delivery techniques and be adaptive to a variety of audiences in written & oral communication.Duties And ResponsibilitiesInterprets data, trends/patterns, analyze results, and translate into content for leadership to drive business decisions.Identifies, defines, and communicates process improvement opportunities to leadership based on data analytics &/or process assessments.Supports the development of performance indicators, monitoring techniques, and process improvements across multiple business function processes.Develops and implements complex databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize ad-hoc and recurring analysis driven reporting.Acquires data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.Identifies, filters, &/or “cleans” data as needed to produce accurate reporting with high integrity results.Turns data into information, information into insight and insight into business decision driven content for consideration by leadership.Participates and leads cross functional efforts as necessary to optimize business process and support with data analysis as required.Serves as a liaison between business users and information technology staff to translate business requirements into functional specifications and lead/assist in the development and modification of reports.Leads &/or assists with quantitative data modeling based on informational needs of the business.Develops analytical competency in super users and subject matter experts throughout the business.Monitors and reports material and project systems integrity and master data anomalies. Supports the development and delivery of training to multiple process areas to drive efficiencies in recurring data driven activities.Prepares business process flows and make recommendations/propose solutions.Ensures issues are identified, tracked, reported and driven to solution in a timely manner.Prioritizes and performs work on multiple cross-functional projects simultaneously.Performs system regression testing as required.Participates in functional/technical testing efforts as needed for solution sustainment.Develops and delivers end user documentation, processes and training as needed by the business unit.Aids users regarding processes and procedures to ensure the business gains efficiencies from reporting &/or data analytics.Performs other duties as assigned or required.The General Atomics(GA) group of companies is a world renowned leader in developing high - technology systems ranging from the nuclear fuel cycle to electromagnetic systems; remotely operated surveillance aircraft; airborne sensors; advanced electronic, wireless, and laser technologies; and biofuels. We offer an excellent opportunity to realize your full potential and fulfill your career aspirations.Join the GA Team where you can make a difference! Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer

title: Senior Analyst - Data & Strategy (Goodreads)
description: Job DescriptionWith over 75 million members, Goodreads is the world’s largest site for readers and book recommendations. As a Top 100 web destination, our mission is to help people find and share books they love. Goodreads members can discover new books by seeing what their friends and members of the community are reading or by using the Goodreads Book Recommendation Engine. Our platform also helps more than 220,000 authors to connect with readers. Goodreads is a subsidiary of Amazon, Inc.Goodreads is seeking a Senior Data Analyst that will support a number of business leaders within Goodreads by becoming their go-to source for data, reporting, insights, and guidance. He/she will guide decisions that impact the company’s future - based on carefully thought-out, well-executed, complex analyses and actionable insights. Do you naturally look for the story or the soul hidden in the numbers and have a knack for translating that story into one that non-analytical minds can grasp and rally behind? If so, read on.The role will require an end-to-end understanding of data and reporting; working with business owners to understand and define their data and analytics needs; working with engineering and possibly external partners to generate, capture, and ingest source data (where necessary), working with data engineering to build ETLs that transform the data into manageable nuggets; building reports and performing analyses to draw insights; and finally working with the appropriate parts of the organization to implement changes based on those insights.ResponsibilitiesUnderstand the Goodreads/Amazon data structures (MySQL/Oracle/Redshift)Partner with Engineering/Data Engineering to improve the quality of existing data and bring additional data sources in lineWrite sophisticated SQL queries to extract data and build complex models (Excel/R/etc.)Build/automate reports/dashboards (in Tableau) that allow the business leaders to get a clear snapshot of their operationsDesign and analyze A/B tests to quantify impact of customer-facing changesPerform complicated analyses to extract learnings and drive insightsCommunicate insights to the business partners, Goodreads leadership, and Amazon stakeholders - emphasizing clarity, completeness, and actionabilityBasic QualificationsBS/BA Computer Sciences, Math, Statistics or related field.5+ years of professional experience in data modeling / advanced business analyticsExperience in ETL and databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasetsProficient in SQL and experience with efficient processing of large data sets. Ability to write sophisticated and optimized queries against large databasesFamiliarity with columnar databases like Redshift; Understand database optimizationExcel - create complex, scalable and robust modelsBusiness Acumen – understand business drivers and have a framework-driven process of analyzing business problems and developing solutionsCommunication – share insights in a way that is easy to grasp and actionable and build relationships to help drive adoption of data- and insights-driven decision makingTableau – build clear and actionable dashboardsExperience conveying key insights from complex analysis in summarized business termsPreferred QualificationsA Graduate degree (MS, MBA, PhD, etc.) in a similar field will be highly valued but is not requiredExperience in predictive modeling/statistics/econometricsProgramming language (e.g. Python) is a plusExperience with Big Data solutions as well as other AWS solutionsLove for reading and connection to the Goodreads missionAmazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation .Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Company - Goodreads LLCJob ID: A634704

title: Sales Data Analyst
description: Job Title: Sales Data AnalystDepartment: FinanceReports to:     Business Analytics & Insights ManagerClassification: Exempt/Fulltime______________________________________________________________________________Position SummaryC. Mondavi & Family’s Business Analytics & Insights team is expanding! As a Data Analyst, who will report into the Business Analytics & Insights Manager, you’ll be part of a team that is focused on using data to drive strategy and insights across the company. You will help the company grow by uncovering new sales, channel, and product opportunities. You’ll work closely with Marketing, Sales, Finance, National Accounts, and the Executive Teams, to lead and partner on projects that center around the ability to enhance the company’s analytic & insights tools and structure. You’ll need to have a hands on approach with a blend of tactical execution coupled with strategic thinking and planning. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to the following:Project lead on company’s data collection and data consumption reporting transition & enhancementEnhance company’s reporting and national / regional / local market insights by utilizing company’s current data sources.Data insights evangelist & report creation partner to Sales, National Accounts, Marketing, Finance, and Executive TeamsEnhance and expand company’s Power BI data reporting & dashboard platformAssist on Distributor SKU level inventory related analysesLead point person for data source and data platform questions, revisions, changes, issue resolution, etc.Assist with current and future partnerships with company’s data & insights vendorsAssist with analyses and recommendations on company’s brand, wholesale, and retail pricing and promotion strategyAssist on company’s Customer Experience measurement projects Qualifications (work experience, preferred skills and education):3 to 5 years’ experience in Beverage Alcohol category in an analytical & insights role OR at least 5 years’ experience in similar role outside of Beverage Alcohol with increasing levels of responsibility Detail-oriented, highly organized Blend of tactical and strategic thinking Strong written and verbal communication skills Proficient with Microsoft Office applications, Power BI / Tableau data visualization platforms, SQL, and Microstrategy Familiarity with industry data sources such as AC Nielsen scan data, TradePulse, iDig, TD Linx, and SalesNav Familiarity with consumer experience measurement platforms such as Qualtrics Resourceful and creative Comfortable with ambiguity Undergraduate degree at a minimum, Graduate degree is preferable

title: Sr. Director - Product Management
description: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 237 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.At PayPal, we are rapidly evolving our Payments Platform, and are looking for a Sr. Director of Product who is experienced in building Platforms at scale and evangelizing the Platform to the developer community.As Head of Product for Payment Platform, you will lead the vision, strategy and execution of Payment Platform. You will build innovative payment platform capabilities that will drive the next growth curve. You will strive for adoption of the payment platform across all of PayPal properties: PayPal, Venmo, Xoom, Braintree. You are passionate about organizing the APIs exposed by the platform to enable easy comprehension and discovery. You will create win-win opportunities working closely with PayPal Business Development and Partner Sales teams to deliver Payment Services.You should be comfortable using your consultative selling and strong relationship-building skills with partners as well as cross-functionally with Sales, Business Development, Product Marketing, Design, Engineering, and Legal teams to launch products that meet the strategic objectives of PayPal and our partners.This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for someone with the DNA to ideate and create new product opportunities for product growth, who thinks deeply about product adoption, and is passionate about bringing these new product capabilities to life.Roles and ResponsibilitiesDevelop and execute product strategy and roadmap for the Payment PlatformWork closely with the executive team, Engineering, Marketing, and Sales to develop and maintain a 3- to 5-year strategic product planIdentify new payment related initiatives / opportunities that enable business expansion for PayPal, Xoom, Venmo, BraintreeDevelop business cases to support new payment initiatives / opportunities by analyzing existing data and researching new dataOptimize product usage, product build and pricing of existing products / partnersDevelop and deliver persuasive presentations including executive, analyst, and press briefings, industry events, webcasts, and trade shows. Be comfortable presenting and frequently interacting with senior executives both inside and outside the company and provide thought leadership towards delightful and personalized customer experiences.Identify key industry trends and strategic opportunities working with partners in the payments space.Partner with engineering teams to express the Payment Platform capabilities in the form of well-organized APIs. Be an advocate for the payment platform capabilities expressed through these APIs.Work cross-organizationally with other product development teams, sales, marketing, customer support, operations, legal, compliance, risk management and finance to ensure alignment with go-to-market activitiesProvide business cases for new and existing products to determine feasibilityWork with stakeholders to guide the release or launch of new products or product innovationsEnsure that roadmap and prioritization processes are well communicated and understood across the organizationGrow and manage a team of product managers to help achieve the vision of the payment platform, and implement/evolve processes as needed to drive platform growthDesired Skills And ExperiencePassion for great user experience, including the experience of engineers integrating with the APIs. Experience with leading APIs as products.Experience with API governance and technologies. Experience with API adoption and driving usage of API in a B2B environment.Experience with leading Payments Products and curiosity of the payments ecosystemMust be a self-motivated, goal oriented individual with excellent organizational skillsProduct Management experience with scalable, performant and highly-available API based SaaS platformsArticulating and evangelizing a long-term product strategyProven experience of managing products especially working with senior leader and partnersExperience working with Global marketsCommunicating with executive management teams, engineering teams, and business partners, with an ability to articulate the right level of detail and knowledge to each audience group, both in written and verbal formA proven track record of success in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple competing and often conflicting prioritiesOutstanding verbal, written, and presentation skills, as well as the ability to persuade, inspire, and motivate others10+ years' experience with Product management.5+ years' experience working with global products in leadership position.Bachelor’s in Engineering or a Business Degree.Previous entrepreneurial experience or MBA is preferred.We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.R0031334

Are you up for the challenge? Join us and make your impact on the future as our Senior Compensation and Commission Analyst, located in our office in San Jose, CA.Are you looking for that next step which can further your career and expand your horizons?Do you thrive on number-crunching and detailed analysis?Is accuracy and attention to detail your middle name?If you answered yes to any of these questions, keep reading………A Day In The LifeSenior Compensation and Commission Analyst will be primarily responsible for administrating A10 Network’s Global Sales Compensation Plan. Resources to evaluate the Sales Incentive Compensation Plan with the purpose to design and recommend a program to the Committee that is aligned with industry standards and corporate goalsManage hire, compensation change and terminationTimely electronically distributing sales compensation plan and individual ExhA to global sales team for acceptanceAnalyzing and preparing quarterly communication skillsExperience with MSFT Access database is a plus but not required.The future of application, cloud, security, and analytics is exploding at A10 Networks.A10 Networks is an equal opportunity employer and a VEVRAA federal subcontractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. A10 also complies with all applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

title: SMB Data Analyst
description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.Facebook seeks a Data Analyst for its Global SMB Publisher Team. Our mission is to bring Facebook's highly targeted, quality ads to publishers around the world, and we're just getting started. We’re a mobile-focused team and our priority is to guide SMB publishers as they adopt the Audience Network. You will use data analysis to develop models and reports that provide insight into the small and medium size publisher base, identify opportunities, and impact the strategy of our Product, Marketing, and Sales teams. title: Master Data Systems Specialist Principal – PSJH
description: DescriptionProvidence is calling a Master Data Systems Specialist Principal – PSJH to Providence Health & Services in one of the following locations: Renton WA, Seattle WA, Portland OR, Beaverton OR, Anaheim CAWe are seeking a Master Data Systems Specialist Principal – PSJH to serve as the most senior Subject Matter Expert (SME) for data domains of Enterprise Master Data Management and Reference Data. This includes integrating Enterprise Golden Records, Source of Truth, Hierarchies, Data standards and mappings into one or more PSJH solutions within and external to Healthcare Intelligence to reduce and avoid silos resulting in simplified data flow for efficient enterprise solutions. Master Data Systems Specialist Principal will partner both at the department and functional levels, including data stewards, to ensure alignment of master data rules and the operations of the application meet all requirements. This role also mentors other Specialist in variety of Master Data domains and Reference Data.In This Position You Will Have The Following Responsibilities Serves as a consultant and leader in collaboration with Data Owners, business and IT stakeholders, Data Stewards, Master Data Systems Architects, and Contractors to determine system business standards, rules, access solutions, and data quality indicators. Define implementation Master Data Management for core data assets including but not limited to Patient, Provider, Payor, and Supply Chain domains Interfacing with end user work groups to understand requirements, and helping to define, develop and implement MDM standard operating procedures within targeted business and data domains Set standards on System level Master Data Management Strategy, Implemention Plans, and Project Phases in collaboration with Master Data Systems Architects Support development of ongoing Master Data and Reference Data Governance & Administration for analytical needs Provide inputs and recommendations to multiple ongoing system level projects including risk management for data management application selections, data source identification, and data source development strategies Develop operational processes, tools, and delivery channels to audit and improve system Master Data and Reference Data QualificationsRequired qualifications for this position include: Master’s Degree in Data Management, MIS, Business Administration, and/or other data-related or healthcare related fields Or equivalent educ/experience. 10 years healthcare data management related disciplines 10 years data analysis, data integration, application integration, report development, or project management skills 8 years software/system development lifecycles 7 years Enterprise Data Warehouse and/or Master Data Management (MDM) - functional and/or technical experiences 2 years MDM tools including but not limited to Siperian/Informatica MDM, IBM Initiate/MDM, Maestro MDS 2 years Understanding of master data management, 360-degree view of data, and golden record concepts 1 year Data profiling using packaged software a plus (Trillium, Informatica DQ Analyst, IBM QualityStage, SAS DataFlux, etc) Deep understanding of meta data sources, master data management practices/technology and how it supports business process, results and data lifecycle. Strong knowledge with master data management tools, data analysis, development of business requirements and reviews, quality assurance and user acceptance testing in rapid sprint cycles. Provides expert-level knowledge of data definitions, data relationships, business rules, data flows, data usage, and data quality indicators. Facilitates improved enterprise understanding of the data. Ability to identify system constraints or gaps in routine business requirements, and effectively communicate issues/risks. Exhibits good listening and strong communication skills. Able to communicate effectively with Data Stewards, stakeholders, project team members and Data Arhitects by providing a concise and balanced perspective. Successful experience working in a leadership capacity with virtual teams. Advanced analytical skills to analyze, define and maintain quality master data. Experience with successful organizational skills including prioritization and time management. title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Mining/Data Analysis/Machine Learning- San Francisco
description: LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume – we transform lives through innovative products and technology.Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.If you are an applied research engineer/scientist with a passion for working on massive semi-structured text and graph datasets, then the LinkedIn Data Team is the place for you. The ideal candidate will have domain experience (data mining, information retrieval, security data science, natural language processing, advanced statistics, and/or machine learning), a strong systems orientation, and experience in building data mining products. The work you put forth will directly impact and fuel LinkedIn’s search relevance, ad targeting, information extraction, and recommendations.Responsibilities:• Work with BIG data, crunching millions of samples for modeling data mining, recommendation, or search relevance solutions.Basic Qualifications:• BA/BS Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning or related technical discipline, or related practical experience.• 2+ years experience in software design, development, and algorithm related solutions.• 2+ years experience programming experience in Java, C/C++Preferred Qualifications:• BS + 5 years of relevant work experience, MS + 4 years of relevant work experience, or PhD +2 years of relevant work experience• Working knowledge in one or more of the following: machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, security data science, advanced statistics or natural language processing.• Experience with iterative, test-driven development.• Experience with configuration management (SVN, GIT, ant, maven, etc.).• Experience with developing and designing consumer-facing products.• Experience with Hadoop, Pig, or other MapReduce paradigms.• Knowledge of internals Lucene/SOLR or other information retrieval systems.• Published work in academic conferences or industry circles.

title: Data Solutions Analyst
description: Req ID 18468Experience Level ProfessionalOther Location(s) N/ARelocation offered YesTravel required NoneCome grow with usAt Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous.Information Management is a department within Capital Group’s Investment Operations with focus on defining Capital Group's investment data strategy to establish a comprehensive set of data capabilities. Our Data Strategy and Operations team is focused on implementing and evolving Capital Group's investment data strategy to enable the full range of business objectives; data for minimizing risk, data for efficient processes, and data for growth and innovation. It also delivers a set of capabilities to source, automate, and curate data assets to enable and enrich core investment and distribution processes, quantitative analytics, reporting and analysis, and advanced analytic efforts such as artificial intelligence.As a Data Solutions Analyst based in Los Angeles, you will partner with different facets of the business to develop solutions that source, structure, curate, and visualize data to enable business operations, insights, and advanced analytics.ResponsibilitiesIdentify opportunities to improve data-use within business processesStrengthen existing partnerships with IT and other business units to develop and deliver enterprise-scale solutions that extract, transform, and integrate investment data from different data sourcesDesign and build business-developed technical solutions in support of data delivery, data enablement, automation, or self-service Leverage the analytics workbench to develop solutions that source, transform, enrich, validate, and load investment management dataProvide requirements and user-acceptance testing for large-scale IT solutions Recognize and adopt best practices in data automation data integrity, test design, analysis, validations, and documentationQualifications2+ years of experience with business intelligence, reporting, and data transformation Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, information technology or other quantitative field requiredAdvanced knowledge of SQL requiredProficient with technical and functional designs for databases, ETL, data warehousing, and reportingProficient with scripting tools for automation such as R, Python, Alteryx, etc.Proficient with reporting/data visualization tools such as Tableau, SSRS, etc.Company OverviewFounded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.39 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers.We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. title: Analyst (JO#4754)
description: The Judicial Council of California (JCC) is accepting applications for the position of Analyst in the Criminal Justice Services (CJS) office located in San Francisco. The ideal candidate is committed and passionate about working on criminal justice policy, is skilled and experienced in research design and analysis, communicates clearly and has a desire to work in a multidisciplinary office. CJS performs a broad range of legal, program, and research functions to facilitate the JCC’s obligations related to criminal justice policy, procedures, and court administration. The analyst will be responsible for leading specific projects. The projects may be well established and ongoing with extensive databases, newly implemented projects, or projects still in the implementation phase. Project management and complex data wrangling and statistical coding in STATA and/or R are required for all projects. The projects that the successful candidate may work on include, but are not limited to: Collaborative Court Evaluation, Pretrial Court Programs, Evidence Based Practice in Probation Supervision, Parolee Reentry Court Programs and Felony Sentencing Trends after Criminal Justice Realignment.The analyst is also responsible for rapid response to information requests from the legislature, the Department of Finance and the Legislative Analyst’s Office, for reviewing and summarizing research, legislative, and policy materials. The Analyst will report to the Supervising Analyst and work collaboratively with the research team to ensure that the highest quality data, analysis and research support are provided to criminal justice policy making bodies and to trial courts.RESPONSIBILITIES   Perform complex research functions; managing multiple projects, and draft legislative and Judicial Council reports.  Respond to special requests for information from Judicial Council staff, the courts, legislature, justice system partners, and the public. Serve as a resource to Associate Analysts and assist in building their programming and statistical skills. Support the Senior Analyst in ensuring the efficient operation of the research unit.          MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Bachelor’s degree and three (3) years of professional, exempt-level analytical experience in program analysis, development, implementation, research and/or evaluation. Additional directly related experience and/or education may be substituted on a year-for-year basis.   OR   Two years as an Associate Analyst with the Judicial Council of California or two years of experience performing the duties of a class comparable in the level of responsibility to that of an Associate Analyst in a California state government entity.   Desirable Qualifications Master’s degree in Public Policy, Public Administration, Criminology, Statistics, Economics, Political Science, or other research field; 1-2 years of experience conducting social science, criminal justice, or public policy research; Experience with R, STATA, Python, or SAS; Excellent written and oral communication skills.     LICENSING AND CERTIFICATIONS − None   OTHER Please note: if you are selected for hire, verification of employment eligibility or authorization to work in the United States will be required.   HOW TO APPLY To ensure consideration of your application for the earliest round of interviews, please apply by 5:00 P.M. on July 25, 2018. This position requires the submission of our official application and resume.To complete an online application, please visit our website at http://www.courts.ca.gov/careers.htm.   Please refer to “Analyst, Job Opening # 4754” on your application materials and all correspondence.The Judicial Council provides reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities who request such accommodation. Reasonable accommodation needs should be requested through Human Resources at (415) 865-4260.PAYMENT & BENEFITS $6,173 - $9,259 per month [Starting salary $6,173 per month]     The Judicial Council strives for work life balance and includes substantial vacation and holiday time. In addition, we offer an excellent benefits package including pension, medical, dental and vision coverage, flexible spending, $130 monthly stipend towards public transit commuting costs, and retirement savings plans.   Some highlights of our benefits package include: Health/Dental/Vision benefits program 13 paid holidays per calendar year Choice of Annual Leave or Sick/Vacation Leave 1 personal holiday per year $130 transit pass subsidy per month CalPERS Retirement Plan 401(k) and 457 deferred compensation plans Employee Assistance Program Basic Life and AD&D Insurance FlexElect Program Pretax Parking Long Term Disability Program (employee paid/optional) Group Legal Plan (employee paid/optional)    The Judicial Council of California Is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Data Analyst
description: From integrating renewables to designing zero net energy facilities to creating accurate energy forecasts and evaluating energy efficiency programs, Itron’s Forecasting and Consulting and Analysis teams make sure our customers stay ahead of a changing energy landscape. And adapting to change is fundamental in today’s utility industry. With decades of in-depth industry insights and expertise, our teams are equipped to help utilities do exactly that.The Data Analyst uses utility data to help customers get actionable insight into their data. Example use cases include theft detection, meter and transformer failure detection, safety issues, energy efficiency applicability, and AMI (Advanced Meter Infrastructure) network health. They are typically assigned to work with one or more gas, electric or water utilities as a master of the Operations Optimizer software suite. Use software tool to find instances of theft, failed equipment, and energy efficiency candidates. Build new tools and algorithms as required. Manage a team of 1 or 2 part-time internet researchers Conduct case reviews, training and algorithm development sessions with customers.Assist customers in theft investigations and troubleshooting faulty equipment. Understand Operations Optimizer theft, meter & equipment failure and energy efficiency algorithms. Understand their applicability to different businesses as well as potential pitfalls. Participate in customer meetingsExperience: This position requires a minimum of 2 years related experience Knowledge of SQL is preferred, not required Ideal candidates should have the ability to program in at least one language other than SQL Enthusiastic about solving open-ended and/or loosely defined problems. Strong people skills - this role is a customer facing position.Education: Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Physics or Business Analytics. Master's degree is beneficialPhysical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit or stand, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel small and medium sized components. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, and to lift weight or exert force up to 50 pounds. The employee in this position works in an environment where they may be exposed to fumes or airborne particles, outdoor weather conditions, there is a risk of electrical shock, and there is vibration. The employee may be required to work with toxic or caustic chemicals, may be subject to higher noise levels, or work near moving mechanical parts.#DICEItron is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, medical condition, veteran status, disability, genetic information, gender identity or other characteristics protected by law. title: Data Science Manager - Customer Experience
description: At Fitbit, our mission is to help people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration and guidance to reach their goals.We started our journey in 2007—as a team of two with one big idea. Since then, we’ve grown to over 1,500 employees, sold over 60mm devices, and built a health and fitness community across the globe. In fact, the Fitbit Community has taken enough steps to walk from the Sun to Pluto! Offering award-winning products, a top-rated mobile app and an easy-to-use online dashboard, Fitbit provides personalized experiences that help our users reach their goals. With a reenergized focus on innovative devices, interactive experiences, and enterprise health we are transforming the way consumers and businesses see health & fitness.From your first steps as a Fitbitter, you will be at the forefront of developing new products. Our culture combines the spirit of startup with the perks of being public. We offer a competitive benefits package and amazing perks like unlimited snacks, Friday happy hours, onsite workout classes, and a strong focus on a healthy work-life balance. As part of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career, contribute your ideas to life-changing products and services, and—above all—have fun doing it.Fitbit’s HQ campus is located in the heart of San Francisco with office locations in Boston, San Diego and around the world. Think you’ve found your fit?What does the job entail. Who they work with?We are specifically looking for a data science lead/manager in SF office to spearhead the challenging modeling and algorithmic development work in the Customer Experience space for Fitbit. You are in charge of managing and developing a group of data analyst to tackle impactful problems such as how to improve customer retention, real time channel steering and recommendations, next best product/service offering, targeted user support, computing a customer engagement score, predicting a customer experience, predicting the likelihood of a customer support request etc. Your efforts will critically impact the growth, efficiency and cost optimization of Customer Experience at Fitbit.What will you need?5+ years industry experience in data analytics and quantitative modeling with significant work experience as a technical contributor. 2+ years experience in managing data science teams. Excellent communication skills with demonstrated success in presenting complex data and analysis in a clear compelling manner that inspires action. Expert in Python and SQL. Must have experience writing production level code. Proficiency working with Spark to process large datasets Experience in Google Cloud Platform tech stack preferred Flexibility and comfort working in a dynamic organization with minimal documentation and process Experience in popular reporting technologies like Tableau, Looker, D3, Highcharts Working knowledge of ETL best practices Keen interest in the health and fitness, wellness and technology industries Fitbit is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, hire, train, promote, pay, and administer all personnel actions without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), sex stereotyping (including assumptions about a person’s appearance or behavior, gender roles, gender expression, or gender identity), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, military or veteran status, genetic information or other statuses protected by law. We interpret these protected statuses broadly to include both the actual status and any perceptions and assumptions made regarding these statuses.San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance Fitbit will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY NO VISA TRANSFERS AVAILABLE AT THIS TIMEKORE1, a nationwide provider of staffing and recruiting solutions, has an immediate opening for a Data Analytics Engineer/Lead: Cloud (AWS a +) + SQL + ETL (any tool, Xplenty a +) &/or data modeling + Visualization (Tableau or Domo a +) + sports/gaming interest; Amazon Redshift, R, Python, SSPS a plus This role will play a key part in cleaning up, building out, and in the implementation of new analytics technologies leveraged to facilitate data democratization, business intelligence reporting and deep analytic capabilities for our organization. That means this position will require a number of different skills from data design and architecture to complex data structures to ad hoc analyses to answer business questions. The right candidate will have technical experience with enterprise data environments as well as a keen analytic mind and ability to answer questions with data and insight.Key Responsibilities: Work with the Sr. Director to define, design and implement analytical data layer schema to support Machine Learning, Business Intelligence and Analytical capabilities. Work with a number of data system types and craft an effective ecosystem such as MongoDB, REST API, AWS Redshift, etc. Conduct ad hoc queries and analyses to answer questions either posed by the business or ones created by you. Effectively communicate project status and analytic findings to all parts of the business. Work with the Senior Director of Analytics to build out the Analytics Stack roadmap and proactively drive implementation. Gather requirements, Project manage and execute, Present updates on infrastructure projects.Skills & Qualifications: A passion or interest in sports! It’s our business…if you don’t like sports in some capacity this might not be the best fit for you! If you have a passion for gaming outside of that, it’s a plus! Degree in statistics, data science, computer science, engineering or similar field is preferred 5+ years of experience working with enterprise data systems and/or analytic and BI data environments.1+ year of experience doing this in a cloud environment is required (any cloud will work, but AWS is a plus) Strong SQL skills are required (any DB works as long as it’s SQL-based) Amazon Redshift experience is a plus (you will access Redshift through SQL though. If you don’t have Amazon Redshift you just have to be willing to learn it) Experience with BI Reporting & visualization platforms with an ability to create data visualizations and dashboards is requiredExamples: Tableau, DOMO, Looker, Chartio, MicroStrategy. However, Tableau and/or Domo would be preferred as that’s what we are using/going to be using) Experience ETL or data modeling is required. Experience with both is preferredAny ETL tools are welcome, but Xplenty would be a plus Experience with data modeling Python and/or R skills are a plus Familiarity with third party data collection platforms like MixPanel, Google Analytics, Apps Flyer, etc. is a plus Experience with SAS, SPSS, R or other statistical/analytical software is a plus Strong analytical skills, problem-solver, and attention to detail. Motivated self-starter, revels in a dynamic, fast changing environment and brings a can-do attitude Excellent communication skills. #JBU

title: Data Analyst (Product)
description: Omada Health is on a mission to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease.Job OverviewThe data team is responsible for building quantitative narratives and data products that empower healthy behavior change for our users and smarter decisions for our stakeholders. We are deeply motivated to learn what works (and what doesn’t) for health behavior change at scale, especially since Omada is paid when we improve clinical outcomes for our users.As a Data Analyst, you will have significant say in what you do and how you do it, and you’ll be backed by a diverse team of analysts, scientists, and engineers from disciplines including epidemiology, economics, statistics, and computer science. Your work will drive business impact, alongside your own intellectual growth, and will ultimately inspire and enable participants in the Omada program to live free of chronic disease.Data Analysts at Omada own projects from end to end, translating raw, complex datasets into meaningful insights, visualizations, and narratives that help our business and clients make critical decisions.Your Impact Build analytic and reporting solutions for cross-functional business partners in product, design, user insights, finance, operations, and engineering Quantify participant and/or health coach behaviors so future product changes are prioritized appropriately and health outcomes are optimally improved Design and build self-service dashboards to measure performance and direct product teams’ efforts towards initiatives with the largest impact Define data to be collected for measuring success of new product features, and work with engineering on proper tracking and instrumentation of data Design and analyze A/B tests for experimental product features Perform ad-hoc analyses for internal stakeholdersProvide tool training and assistance to internal stakeholders to democratize data and champion a data-driven culture Assist in core Data Team initiatives You Will Love This Job If You Are/have Methodical. You put frameworks to unstructured problems Multimodal. You iterate through different presentations of data to better translate a problem and its solution so stakeholders from all backgrounds can understand the data Curious. You ask enough “whys” to get to the root problem of a data request Result-driven. You seek to find the most efficient and effective path to an analysis Business-sense. You know that solving hard problems require contextual understanding to put numbers to good use Detail-oriented. You typically catch “gotchas” before they get you Collaborative. You can work both as part of a team and in a self-directed manner You will be successful in this job if you have: BA/BS in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience 2-5 years of applicable industry experience in data analysis and visualization Experience working on cross-functional teams of engineers, product managers, and designers Confidence with at least 1 analytical tool, such as R or Python Confidence with SQL or other querying language Familiarity with Tableau or other business intelligence tools Expertise in creating clear and concise presentations Expertise in addressing and prioritizing client inquiries Excellent written and verbal communication skill Bonus Points For Experience in writing ETLs Working knowledge of statistics, hypothesis testing, and experimental design Experience working with various types healthcare data, such as claims data, enrollment data, and clinical data Benefits Competitive salary Stock options + extended post termination option exercise window (for Omadans who are with us 3 years or more) Flexible vacation Parental leave Health, dental, and vision Healthy snacks and meals Wellness events (e.g. running club) Community volunteering 401k retirement savings plan About Omada Health: We’ve pioneered digital behavioral medicine: an innovative approach to tackling the growing epidemic of type 2 diabetes, heart disease, and obesity. Our online programs combine world-class science, technology, and design to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. Named one of Fast Company’s “50 Most Innovative Companies in the World,” our team includes passionate and talented individuals. Our approach has been embraced by major employers across the country, including Costco and Iron Mountain, as well as leading health plans, such as Kaiser Permanente and BlueCross Blue Shield of Louisiana.We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Omada is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.
