We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law.SDL2017

title: Health Industries Industry Marketing Leader
description: PwC/LOS OverviewPwC is a network of firms committed to delivering quality in assurance, tax and advisory services.We help resolve complex issues for our clients and identify opportunities. Learn more about us at www.pwc.com/us.At PwC, we develop leaders at all levels. The distinctive leadership framework we call the PwC Professional (http://pwc.to/pwcpro) provides our people with a road map to grow their skills and build their careers. Our approach to ongoing development shapes employees into leaders, no matter the role or job title.Are you ready to build a career in a rapidly changing world? Developing as a PwC Professional means that you will be ready to create and capture opportunities to advance your career and fulfill your potential. To learn more, visit us at www.pwc.com/careers.It takes talented people to support the US firm of the largest professional services organization in the world. Not all of us work directly with external clients. Some of our best people choose to apply their talents inside PwC.As part of Internal Firm Services, you're serving an organization on par with many of our external clients. Our Internal Firm Services team consists of first-rate marketers, human resource professionals, computer technologists, knowledge managers, accountants, financial planners, administrators and leaders. Internal Firm Services staff are the people who make it work for the people who make it work for our clients.Job DescriptionPwC's Marketing and Sales function is a client-centric, high-performing team that drives the Firm's priorities and long-term revenue growth bypassionately positioning PwC as a distinctive brand in the marketplace.The role of Marketing is to develop and execute data-driven strategies to effectively and efficiently understand our customer's needs and interests to increase brand awareness and generate high margin demand. The team enables client serving professionals to meet their short and long-term goals by providing creative and innovative application of deep marketing expertise in areas such as digital, B2B, data analytics, program management, media (including social), thought leadership, and brand.Sector Marketing provides clients across all industry sectors (e.g. Consumer Markets, Financial Services, Health Industries, Technology) with points of view and suggested one-firm solutions to client issues that are specific to the world in which our clients work: their industry and company. The Sector Marketing Team advises sector leadership on marketing and other related strategies that address our clients' issues in innovative and interesting ways, creating an environment that drives sales, enhanced relationships and a stronger PwC brand.Position/Program RequirementsBasic QualificationsQualified candidates must have a proven track record in: Being able to influence senior firm leaders Gain a consensus across multiple practice leaders and stakeholders to affect change Work with marketing peers to create alignment across multiple marketing teamsMinimum Year(s) of Experience: 10Minimum Degree Required: High School Diploma or GEDDegree Preferred: Bachelor's degreeKnowledge PreferredDemonstrates thought leader-level abilities with, and/or a proven record of success directing efforts in the following areas: -Deep understanding of marketing trends and channels that have increased demand generation and brand building at previous organizations; -Working with leadership as a business advisor to influence how the practice engages with the marketplace; -Leading a team successfully through cultural change and development of new skills/knowledge; -Saying no when necessary to all levels of the organization and ability to relate strategy to difficult decisions; -Developing and executing a data-driven, integrated marketing strategy to deliver results against strategic priorities that contribute to developing relationships, building pipeline and increasing brand equity; -Developing of marketing tactics across a wide variety of areas including: brand, digital and social marketing, public relations, analyst relations, thought leadership and sales tools, events, etc., and leading strategy to tie these initiatives together using customer journey principles and marketing automation; -Collaborating with subject matter specialists and leadership to develop messaging platforms and value propositions that are relevant and compelling; -Championing competitive and market research to understand client issues, marketing dynamics and competitive strategies; incorporating this information into marketing activities to drive high impact and differentiated programs; and, -Deep understanding of the Marketing and Sales function, including Sales, Marketing, Brand, and Thought Leadership, as well as a broad understanding of related client service offerings.Skills PreferredDemonstrates thought leader-level abilities with, and/or a proven record of success directing efforts in the following areas: -Creating leading-edge marketing programs; leveraging the latest marketing technologies to deliver an improved client experience e.g. social listening, analytics, etc.; -Evaluating, analyzing and interpreting voice of the customer and market research information from a variety of sources and applying learning to drive marketing strategy; -Completing marketing impact reports including both a quantitative and qualitative analysis on how marketing programs contribute to impact on client relationships, the sales pipeline and brand awareness/equity; -Leading and coaching multiple marketing Directors and their staff through complex situations while applying firm policies and procedures and enabling compliance across the network; -Working across multiple communications platforms, including social media, video and digital; -Building and maintaining relationships with highest levels of leadership, including effectively managing through a matrixed organization; -Utilizing excellent verbal communication, writing, and strategy skills, translating complex concepts into easy-to-understand and compelling messages to support a point of view to leadership that results in innovative marketing approaches; -Developing marketing strategies and plans that deliver positive results in brand awareness and revenue growth; -Assessing marketing needs to allocate a multi-million dollar budget across multiple business units; and, -Influencing senior leadership in order to increase effectiveness of marketing activities thus driving revenue and strengthening brand in the marketplace.

title: Business Analyst
description: Business AnalystThe Business Analyst is a key position in ZypMedia that helps drive revenue and strategy for the company. A multi-faceted role, the ideal candidate will embrace working in a fast paced environment and thrive at thinking analytically about ways to solve problems as ZypMedia scales up. The analyst will interface with sales, engineering and product teams to improve the existing product. The role is highly visible throughout the organization and will give ideal candidates a great platform to grow and be heard amongst leaders in the organization. ZypMedia, a leader in local digital advertising solutions for small and midsize businesses, is seeking an Business Analyst to join its team. ZypMedia has built a leading programmatic advertising platform that connects small and midsize businesses with digital advertising opportunities across more than 50,000 desktop, mobile and connected TVs websites and apps. ZypMedia's proprietary technology and dedicated service organization were built from the ground up to handle the unique requirements of local digital adverting campaigns. ZypMedia partners with TV station groups to offer the ZypMedia product as part of a comprehensive digital advertising solution to their advertising clients. Responsibilities： Drive and gather business requirements, assessments, solutions especially in the areas of data analysis, data extraction/delivery, source/target mappings and reporting. Create Excel & Tableau dashboards & analyses that provide visibility into KPIs, marketing and product effectiveness, and business trends/drivers Work closely with Business Operations, Product, Marketing & Sales, Finance and Engineering teams to solve problems, identify trends, and define key metrics. Able to quickly understand the business process and needs, and translate them into business requirements Detail oriented and be able to think of all the scenarios for functional and non-functional requirements Skills: 1-3 years of analytical experience in an analytics-based consulting role, exploring large data sets in order to answer strategic questions for customers (either as an internal analyst or external consultant) BS/ BA in an analytical field (science, math, engineering, finance, etc.) Strong analytical skills and ability to make fast decisions with limited and noisy data Strong knowledge of the overall ad tech landscape (RTB and DSP experience preferred) High level of proficiency with MS Excel (pivot tables, complex functions; VBA preferred) Familiarity with SQL

title: Ecommerce IT Analyst/ Lead
description: DescriptionWestern Digital®We deliver the possibilities of data. YOU define what’s possible.The IT-Web Technologies team at Western Digital is responsible for delivering unified and engaging web experiences to their customers. We are seeking a highly motivated technical lead/Analyst to build the next generation ecommerce experiences at Western Digital. This includes working with ecommerce and marketing managers for requirement review and analysis as well as working with technical teams to envision end to end solution, design and deliver core components and review implementation from SI partner teams. You will also work closely with project managers, architects, SI partners and business teams to ensure any proposed solution follows industry best practices.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Understand the requirements and processes in great detail. title: Loan Data Analyst & Support Officer
description: Joining Citizens Business Bank means connecting with a team of dedicated associates that continually strive for new and innovative ways to meet and exceed the needs of our customers. As a top ranked bank, life at our company includes a working environment that thrives on collaboration, integrity, and mutual respect for one another. We encourage our associates to ask questions, learn, care deeply, and make an impact. Our dedication to customers and associates is at the core of our business culture and is represented by five core values: financial strength, superior people, customer focus, cost-effective operation, and having fun. Loan Data Analyst & Support Officer SUMMARY: Supports the Department by managing data in the Fiserv Premier loan accounting system, system specifications and integration, application usage, system upgrades and validation, vendor management and research projects. Under general direction, coordinates and conducts research and assessment activities that provide data to support and enhance decision-making and planning, including the management and collection of data as it pertains to loan products and services. Assists with the development and implementation of special projects as assigned.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Include The Following. Complies with and stays abreast of all policies and procedures, as well as, federal and state laws applicable to the job.Create, update, and generate catalogue of Business Analytics reports to improve data quality and the efficiency of data systems. Review and make recommendations on loan activity.Develop integration between the Loan Accounting System and the General Ledger System for new products, as well as, enhancement of current products to ensure system balancing reconciliation.Enter new parameters or changes to loan specifications for the Fiserv Loan Accounting System. Verify data to ensure integrity.Review, analyze, and interpret all Fiserv Premier Updates and instruction bulletins relative to the Loan Accounting System. Communicate all changes to the management team.Responsible for developing and providing training relative to the Fiserv Premier Loan system upgrades, enhancements or changes to policy/procedures.Gather, extract, compile, analyze, and report data. Develop and implement processes for linking and analyzing data from a variety of sources; identify and interpret patterns and trends; assess data quality and eliminate irrelevant data.Assist with the drafting, developing and creation of procedures and job aides.Implement special projects as assigned, including data entry for mass inputs on coding or system changes.Supports Bank compliance efforts by completing compliance and other technical training workshops as assigned, and ensuring that staff members attend/complete compliance training in a timely manner with a passing grade. Provide appropriate training to any member that does not achieve a passing grade.Provide information and backup documentation required from internal and external auditors in support of assessing the risks surrounding the Loan Documentation and Servicing processes and evaluating the overall control structure of the department.Support the Bank’s Vendor Management program by obtaining and monitoring all required data in support of the third party Vendors utilized by LD&SD. Ensure the required information is housed in an up to date fashion on the Vendor Management system used by the Bank.Provide, present and promote The Citizens Experience to all external and internal customers.Responsible for other duties as assigned. Supervisory ResponsibilitiesSupervise department associates in all activities related to job function and provide back up for other supervisors when required. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.EDUCATION And/or EXPERIENCEMaster's degree (M. A.) or equivalent; a minimum of ten years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Language SkillsAbility to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to write speeches and articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and format. Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors.Mathematical SkillsAbility to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.REASONING ABILITYAbility to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.Certificates, Licenses, RegistrationsCurrent driver's license and auto insurance.Computer SkillsMust have personal computer skills and must have extensive knowledge of the Fiserv Loan Accounting System and Laser Pro/Lawyer Pro Documentation System.Software RequirementsMicrosoft Word and Excel, LaserPro, Lawyer Pro, Fiserv and Prime Data.Other Skills And AbilitiesTyping, 10-key, and CRT Skills a must. Ability to work with out constant supervision, to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.Ability to drive 5% of the time.PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to sit and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.WORK ENVIRONMENT The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts and risk of electrical shock. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.Citizens Business Bank is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We provide equal opportunity in all employment matters without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, ancestry, mental and physical disability, medical condition, age, genetic information, national origin, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law, for all qualified applicants and Citizens Business Bank associates.

title: Data Analytics Developer, Customer Success
description: Do you like solving business problems with data? Are you inspired to use data to inform behavior and strategy? Then this is the job for you! With Splunk’s incredible year over year growth, we need to ensure we are aligned for continued growth and scale. Our Customer Success organization needs a creative and skilled analyst to roll up their sleeves (and data) to provide visibility into capacity and effectiveness.As a Data Analytics Developer you will be turning large/disparate sets of data into actionable insights. You will be a designer and implementer of key metrics and analytics for the Customer Success organization. These metrics will be used to understand and drive efficient sales motion, customer success and best practices. The ideal candidate has a demonstrated ability to collaborate with stakeholders, develop target metrics, design a data collection mechanism, and build compelling reports and visualizations. Business decisions will be made from insights gained through the intelligent analysis of data.ResponsibilitiesDesign and maintain reports and dashboards to track and communicate key performance indicators (both leading and lagging KPIs) to all levels of the organizationWork in a team environment to determine behaviors and goals we want to measure and build easy to understand dashboard visualizationsEnsure KPIs align to the company's and organization's initiatives and strategyIdentify key data sources and collection mechanisms to capture and improve data neededConduct modeling to understand correlation between Customer Success services and lagging indicatorsGuide business decisions through interpretation of data trends, develop data visualizations to illustrate key findingsProactively identify opportunities to improve our enablement or execution to reduce ramp and/or increase bookingsProvide enablement to stakeholders on dashboards and reportsMonitor dashboards and reports to ensure continued and consistent useHelp establish and improve the frameworks and processes used to ensure relevance and continued alignment to business requirementsDocument the metrics frameworkRequirementsBachelor’s Degree or equivalent years of similar experience; BA/BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Information Systems is preferred1+ years’ experience in Business Intelligence, data and/or statistical analysisStrong statistical analysis and modeling skillsExperience building rapport with internal and external clientsSolid communication skills with ability to translate complex ideasCustomer service-oriented and open to learning new skillsDesign skills and experience with web designExperience with XML, CSS, SQL/SOQL and RegExHands-on experience with creating data visualizationsUnderstanding of or ability to learn Salesforce reporting and analyticsExpert understanding of Splunk, especially dashboarding and integration with other applications using REST APIExperience or knowledge of Data-Driven Decision-Making (DDDM) approach

title: iPhone Operations Sr. Data Analyst
description: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.It takes deeply dedicated, intelligent and hard-working individuals to maintain and exceed the high expectations for the exciting iPhone brand at Apple. The iPhone Operations team is seeking a Data Analyst to take on the responsibility of improving superior quality and manufacturing goals through statistics, analytics, modeling, and business intelligence tools.DescriptionThe Data Analyst utilizes data, infrastructure and intelligence tools to improve product quality and manufacturing efficiencies by understanding the variables impacting yield. You will drive strategic initiatives for better data collection and reporting, ensure data integrity across multiple data sources, and reduce analysis time through automation and creative solutions. You should have expertise required to understand complex data sets: product testing, parametric big data, manufacturing, robotics and capital equipment. Select and configure appropriate technologies and programming languages required to ensure successful business impact.This position will work closely with Operations, Test Engineering, Quality, Engineering, Product Development, Customer Service, Supplier Quality, Global Supply Managers, Suppliers, Contract Manufacturers, Repair, Fraud Detection, Business Intelligence and IT teams. You will take data from different sources, apply statistical modeling, analyze, interpret its specific meaning, and clearly convey the significance of the assessment, tailored to individual teams, as well as the business as a whole.The position requires a software programming skill set, utilization of statistical techniques, experience understanding data integrity, and implementing automated solutions. You will need to have a grasp of relational database management systems, design, and structured query language.The Role Includes The Following Main Duties Employ statistical techniques with big data initiatives and tools to drive major operational business decisions. Answer complex questions through data, analysis, and clearly communicate findings to multi-functional teams for direction. Influence repair processes and fraud detection improvements by scripting analysis on very high volumes of data at a commodity and parametric level. Seek opportunities to improve data collection, reporting and consumption based on business needs. Regularly collaborate with internal and external information technology teams on resolving data issues, as well as mitigation plans to avoid errors in the future. Participate in strategic capital systems planning.Education DetailsMaster’s or PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Machine Learning, Engineering, or equivalent experience.Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.Key QualificationsExcellent analytical skills, advanced level of statistics with the ability to identify and predict trends and anomalies.Experience in data mining very large data sets, high proficiency in SQL (Teradata, Oracle, or MySQL or other RDBMS).Experience in Hadoop, Hive, HDFS, Spark, AWS Redshift, Presto, and other distributed processing systems preferred.You will have superb software development skills with proficiency in Python, R and libraries such as scikit-learn, scipy, R, NetworkX, Spacy, and NLTKData visualization experience with tools such as: Tableau, JMP, R creating dashboards and presenting data through reports.Proven ability to handle various tasks concurrently and in a timely manner, including large, complex projects.Effective presentation skills and be able to explain complex data and charts in a concise manner to large audiences. Superb communication skills, both verbal and written.Prior experience in Manufacturing, Test, and Consumer Electronics is a plusJobID: 113921156

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: We’re searching for a data-driven individual who is passionate about transforming numbers into impactful insights and actions. Reporting to the Director of Strategic and Corporate Development, you will play a key role in unlocking data at all levels of the organization to inform Strategy. This is a highly cross-functional role, so you will be helping all departments transform processes, scale more efficiently and uncover new opportunities.What You'll DoTransform data to help inform strategic and tactical business decisions across all teams.Help define and track company-wide KPIsProvide transparency into our data via dashboards and reporting.identify and communicate trends and find new ways to utilize our data to benefit the business.Support implementation of strategic business initiatives and major projects by performing additional assignments upon request from management.What We're Looking For3+ years in a data analytics or strategy roleAdvanced experience with SQL, Excel and PowerPoint; Experience with Looker, Tableau or similar BI tool a plusAbility to draw insights from large data sets, and translate that into next stepsExcellent verbal and written skills with the ability to present strong data-driven storylines and content to both general and senior audiencesExceptional attention to detail and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with multiple projects and prioritiesBachelor’s Degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Business, Engineering, Mathematics, or Statistics)About UsProcore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out onWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Perks & BenefitsYou are a person with dreams, goals, and ambitions—both personally and professionally. That's why we believe in providing benefits that not only match our Procore values (Openness, Optimism, and Ownership) but enhance the lives of our team members. Here are just a few of our benefit offerings: competitive health care plans, unlimited paid vacation, stock options, employee enrichment and development programs, and friends & family events.

title: Sr. Manager, Market Intelligence and Insights
location: 345 Encinal Street, Santa Cruz, CA 95060, US
description: Senior Market Intelligence and Insights Manager This is a unique opportunity to make your mark in a newly created role in our Corporate Strategy team at a very exciting time for Plantronics. If you have a passion for strategic market intelligence, connecting the dots to interpret and analyze market data, building a strategic and credible view of the future, and working cross-functionally with Product, Finance, Analyst Relations, and Go-to-Market teams, this role is for you. Reporting to the Vice President, Corporate Strategy, the successful candidate will be adept at synthesizing multiple sources of market data and turning it into meaningful market sizing and insights to build a credible market model and strategic plan, and engender rich strategic conversations that drive decision-making. Developing insights based on strategic data and information, market research, market and industry trends, and other business and market analysis to support senior leadership, investor relations, business development opportunities, strategic planning and execution, will be key. This role requires strong business acumen, strategic thinking, and the ability to maintain a focus on the big picture while applying an exceptional analytical skillset and an orientation for detail, to build long range market models. This role will collaborate across the organization to build the strategic plan, gain alignment with product and line-of-business strategy, and align with the annual financial plan.   Responsibilities: Develop the definitive corporate point of view on market sizing (TAM), addressable market, market share, growth trends and drivers, and long-range forecast, that culminates in the strategic plan Partner with Strategy, Finance, Product and Go-to-Market teams to build the strategic market model and strategic plan (1 – 5 years) Leverage market research data sources to generate comprehensive market, customer and competitive insights and enrich the value of information by cross-referencing and validating. Synthesize market and field intelligence to develop hypotheses on market performance. Identify areas where additional market research or other data is needed Investigate and build market sizing models to support potential new business areas and strategic initiatives Identify meaningful information, analysis and insights to develop a strategic point of view to drive decision-making across the organization Develop regular market intelligence reports for senior management and provide education and dissemination of market information for key stakeholders Support ad-hoc projects by developing customized modeling and reports on markets Support executive leadership in preparing for external and internal communications, including the Board of Directors and Board Strategy Committee   Requirements: Competencies: Great at making the complex simple and creating visualizations that convey key messages. Detail oriented while also being able to tell a story with, and extract insights from, the analysis Strong business acumen with strategic and critical thinking, and a natural curiosity to delve further Strong financial and analytical skills (quantitative and qualitative) to enable solid business judgement Ability to synthesize disparate data sources and connect the dots to provide an integrated point of view, and develop insights and hypotheses Politically savvy, with excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills Experience and comfort communicating effectively with senior and executive leadership Flexibility and agility to adapt to change, and comfortable with ambiguity Demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally, particularly with Product, Finance, Go-to-Market, Analyst Relations and Investor Relations teams Tools: Excellent Excel model-building skills, proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word and Powerpoint), and relevant business analytical tools (Microsoft Dynamics, Hyperion, etc) Experience: Proven background or existing knowledge in the communications industry 10+ years’ experience in a combination of secondary market research, market sizing and market modeling, forecasting, strategic or financial planning, product management, business analytics or a related field. Experience as a research analyst is strongly preferred, and experience in a strategy consulting firm would be advantageous A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, finance or related field. An MBA is strongly preferred.

title: Data Analyst
description: Account Analyst, Data ScienceJob SummaryCJ's Account Analyst is on the Data Science team and works closely alongside Client Development, Product Management, and other internal teams to address business problems through reporting and data analysis. The Account Analyst translates business questions to technical solutions and develops them. A strong candidate will have a passion for deriving actionable information from complex datasets, as well as the ability to work with cross-functional teams to deliver against client and internal goals.The ideal candidate understands marketing channels, how to evaluate their performance and how to ask questions that provide clear definition of problems or hypotheses.Core Responsibilities Master and perform all steps required to conduct advanced analytics and create analysis-ready data sets; including data acquisition from various sources, integration and blending, pre-processing, variable preparation/transformation, and quality control (QA/QC) Work directly with client-facing teams to best utilize CJ's core technology platform to achieve and/or exceed client goals Collaborate with internal stakeholders to translate business problems into technical solutions Appropriately account for the timeliness, quality and accuracy of all assignments Manage multiple projects concurrently Present technical solutions to key internal stakeholders in a formal setting, effectively communicating (verbally and written) key concepts and functionalities Ability to use terminology appropriate to each industry (retail, finance, travel, etc.) Effective at managing client expectations via direct and frequent communication with high quality results Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, economics, mathematics, marketing analytics) or significant relevant coursework/experience 2-4 years' professional experience with data analysis and business intelligence Demonstrated ability to improve performance by deriving actionable insight from complex datasets Strong technical skills and analytic thought process with excellent attention to detail Strong communication skills and desire to work in cross-functional groups. Experience using SQL on large datasets (or related environments like SAS, Hadoop, Python, etc.) Experience creating data visualizations (Tableau, Domo, Cognos, Power BI, etc.) Expertise with Microsoft Office products; including Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Effective organization and time management skills Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills Desirable Qualifications Advanced degree (MS/PhD) in Statistics, Economics or other quantitative discipline Understanding of basic regression and classification models, including limitations of predictive analytics Understanding of basic statistical theory Ability to program in newer and emerging languages; working knowledge of Hadoop and other big data technologies Why CJ Affiliate?We're a great place to work! CJ Affiliate offers ideal career development and growth opportunities where you will hone skills in strategic planning and execution, as well as enhance your negotiation and presentation skills. You will develop partnerships and motivate affiliates, learn technical skills applicable to digital marketing and nearly every other industry, and so much more. CJ Affiliate is a leader because our teams have advanced tools, present creative solutions, execute strategically, and drive high performance.We offer many of the typical benefits like health and dental insurance but we also offer many other great perks like flexible time off, fun activities in our offices, competitive compensation, just to name a few. Our benefits are designed to take care of the whole you and keep you healthy, whether physically, emotionally, financially or socially.CJ Affiliate is a business unit within Conversant and Epsilon which is part of Alliance Data, a top performing Fortune 500 company included in the S&P 500- NYSE: ADS.Ready to Work Hard, Play Hard and Make a difference?Apply now at CJ.com/careers#data-scienceAlliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employerAlliance Data participates in E-Verify

title: Information Security Analyst
description: As the industry pioneer behind Content Performance Marketing, BrightEdge has thoroughly redefined the concept of search engine optimization (SEO) by developing an award-winning platform that precisely measures and optimizes marketing content across online channels. Our cloud-based platform is powered by big data analysis that allows our customers to plan, optimize, and measure campaigns based on real-time content performance. BrightEdge has emerged as the leading international provider of cloud-based SEO Enterprise solutions due to its dynamic and results oriented entrepreneurial culture. BrightEdge is looking for an Information Security Analyst, who will be responsible for preventing, monitoring, and responding to cyber threats and data breaches.Core Responsibilities Perform vulnerability testing, risk analyses and security assessments Conduct internal and external security audits based on standard cybersecurity frameworks from ISO 27002, COBIT, NIST, OWASP and Cloud Security Alliance Monitor network security, intrusion detection and prevention systems Implement and maintain security tools and their infrastructure Document security incidents and remediation details Prepare security audit reports and update policy documents Maintain security operation procedure documents Assist in responding to security audit request from external auditors and customer organizationsWhat it Takes to be Successful Strong passion and interest in cybersecurity Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or EngineeringBenefits & Perks Competitive Salary with Stock Options Medical / Dental / Vision Insurance / PTO Team networking, social events, Friday company lunches Hackathons Release celebrations every 5 weeks Fully stocked kitchens Comfortable working spaces

title: Administrative Analyst/Senior Management Analyst
location: 500 Castro Street , Mountain View, CA 94041, US
description: “Being a Senior Management Analyst for the City of Mountain View provides the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, highly productive environment enhancing your skill set in the rewarding field of public service.” - Robert Maitland, Senior Management Analyst (Purchasing Division) Why Consider Working for the City of Mountain View?It’s simple. You’ll be joining a team of talented professionals in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment dedicated to serving the Mountain View community. At the City of Mountain View, you will work alongside a team of dedicated, focused and highly motivated professionals, who contribute their talents and commitment in providing essential public services to our residents and businesses on a daily basis. About Our TeamWe are seeking highly analytical, highly skilled, and talented individuals to join the Finance & Administrative Services Department (FASD). The City has two vacancies which can be filled as an Administrative Analyst II or Senior Management Analyst. Here is an exciting opportunity for talented professionals to join a great organization and make valuable contributions in the Finance & Administrative Services Department. This recruitment will establish an eligibility list from which current and future vacancies in the classification of Administrative Analyst II/Senior Management Analyst may be filled. You can review the detailed job description for Administrative Analyst II and Senior Management Analyst on the City's website.Administrative Analyst II/Senior Management Analysts in FASD routinely perform financial analysis and may work in one of the following areas of assignment:Review and prepare contracts for City departments Manage cash flows and treasury Purchasing Support the ongoing monitoring of labor compliance, including prevailing wage; and ensure compliance with new legislationWhat You’ll DoProvide development, analysis and implementation of policies, programs, procedures and projects. Review and prepare complex contracts, proposals, request for proposals, and similar documents. Manage assigned programs or projects; schedule, plan, coordinate, evaluate, and report on work progress. Write and present comprehensive, concise, and clear reports, memos, and other communications. May perform complex financial analysis, including calculation of present value, return on investment, life cycle cost, and cost-benefit comparisons. May perform the treasury function of managing banking relationship, cash flow and investments. May perform purchasing function, including bids, negotiations, insurance review, labor compliance and prevailing wage. May perform system maintenance. Who You AreInnovative doer who welcomes challenge, is resourceful and works well both independently and with others.Individual who finds it extremely rewarding to work with numbers and perform extensive research and analysis. Accurate and detail oriented individual who enjoys reviewing complex documents, looks for consistency, and is able to interpret complex legal language. Professional adept at quickly learning new tasks and who thrives in a team-oriented, results-driven, challenging and fast-paced environment. Exceptional communicator (oral and written) with superior interpersonal skills. Multi-tasker who is able to juggle multiple priorities with proven project and time management skills.   What You BringAdministrative Analyst II·       Two years of full-time administrative and analytical experience equivalent to the position of Administrative Analyst I with the City of Mountain View·       Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in public administration, business administration, economics, or a closely related field·       Experience performing financial and data analysis, program/contract management and evaluation; policy development; and report writing is a plus!Senior Management Analyst·       Three years of increasingly responsible professional-level experience performing detail oriented and analytical work in financial and data analysis, program/contract management and evaluation; policy development; and report-writing·       A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in public administration, business or a related field.A California Class C driver's license is required for both positions. Bonus Points!A master’s degree in business or public administration Possession of a certified public accountant license Experience at a governmental agency Experience in purchasing, labor compliance, treasury or contract management

title: Manager / Senior Manager of Analytics
location: 4370 La Jolla Village Drive Suite 310, San Diego, CA 92121, US

commensurate with experience Flexible Work Hours

title: Sr. Analyst, Data Analytics and Data Sciences
description: Job Title: Sr. Analyst, Industry Data Analytics & Data Sciences Requisition Number: 18000294 Location(s): US, Dublin, CARole Summary / Purpose:Epicor's Industry Data Analytics product team seeks a new team member with a passion for translating data into advanced analytics content, and to then generate state of the art data visualizations and appealing customer experiences. Epicor’s industry analytics content and solutions are delivered over the cloud and are based on the broad scale aggregation of data across entire industry ecosystems – including automotive, electrical distribution, and home improvement.Essential Responsibilities: Participate in R&D projects to deliver new products to our markets. You will be assigned to a cross functional team of industry experts, data warehouse engineers, data analysts, statisticians, and product managers. Ensure ongoing calibration and optimization of analytics engines/models and also web/analytics solutions to meet client’s service level objectives. Our solutions are delivered over the cloud. Contribute on a periodic basis to assist in professional services engagements with strategic customers. May require travel to client offices to present analytics concepts and solutions. Leverage an array of software tools to analyze large client and industry datasets. Creativity to go beyond current tools to investigate and deliver best solution to the problem. Qualifications / Requirements: Bachelor’s or graduate degree in statistics/computer science or related field plus a minimum of 2 years applied analytics experience Experience using SQL to analyze large datasets. Exposure to database modeling and data warehousing principles. Experience implementing data science routines in R and/or Python. Experience using data visualization and high volume BI tools such as Tableau and Microstrategy.Desired Skills / Experience: Advanced Degree in an applied mathematics subject such as Data Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics or a related discipline. Academic or industry exposure to B2B or B2C pricing and revenue optimization. Academic or industry exposure to machine learning methods.FOLLOW US ON LINKEDIN - http://www.linkedin.com/company/epicor-software-corp Epicor Software Corporation is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.

title: Senior Data Analyst
location: 300 Montgomery St Suite 900, San Francisco, CA 94104, US
description: Fundbox is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our fast growing data analytics team. The analytics team at Fundbox is central to business decision across all functions. The team translates the wealth of data into actionable insights and strategies for the executive leadership team at Fundbox. In this role you will: PARTNER closely with internal stakeholders, understand requirements and deliver a scalable data solution. You will be integral to brainstorming ideas, ongoing execution, and subsequent insights. You should be expected to step up with little ‘hand-holding’.  Analysts at Fundbox are EMPOWERED to work independently & deliver end-to-end output. OWN the design & performance of tests (A/B, A/A) and experiments that underpin all the decisions at Fundbox.  These decisions span a wide range of pricing and credit decisions to user product experiences Build data EXPERTISE and deep understanding of domain knowledge and own data quality for all allocated areas of ownership Use rich and dynamic reports and dashboard to CONVEY INSIGHTS. Be an ambassador for the analytics team's data-driven culture and eager to serve data to further the effectiveness of Fundbox. Job Requirements Love of data: You should feel empowered by the presence of data and be comfortable getting your hands dirty. Definitive track record of leading cross-functional teams. Able to communicate incisive insights in a succinct fashion – verbally and visually. 3+ years of professional experience working w. SQL and/or other databases. BS / MS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics, preferred. Experienced using Tableau or other software for data exploration & visualization is strongly preferred Familiarity with R / Python is a plus. Love of hummus and whiskey (a plus).

title: Data Analyst/Engineer
description: Jumpshot is a marketing analytics company that helps marketers understand their customer’s entire online lives by analyzing clickstream data from its 100-million customer panel, covering active users in 188 countries on both desktop and mobile. From the key sources of traffic to a site, to the browsing and buying behavior on a site, to where customers go once they’ve left a site, our products reveal the entire customer journey. Jumpshot tracks more than 160 billion monthly clicks, helping companies know what their customers are doing anywhere, anytime they’re online.We are seeking a Data Analyst/Engineer who will utilize strong analytical and programming skills to provide data used to execute and optimize Client and Customer acquisition. The position deliverables include insights from big data deep dives, development of a wide variety of automated reporting structures, analysis of consumer browsing behavior, and more. A strong programming background is a must, along with a passion for data with seemingly unlimited potential.Responsibilities Extract, validate, transform and summarize data generated from databases and big data structures such as the Hadoop distributed file system Analyze business metrics in order to correlate and model data against it Support team members with translating customer requirements into detailed implementation approach Design/create data repository as needed to store and track data Deliver data and insights for customers Review other’s code to quickly diagnose incorrect and inefficient queries Oversee and manage the work of others Requirements Bachelor's degree; Computer ScienceAt least 3 years of programming/scripting languages Scala, Python and SQL Experience with business development and business metrics Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau Experience with database structures, SQL Experience working on the command line, Linux Understanding of internet fundamentals such as URL structure, HTML is a plus Exceptional communication skills; ability to communicate solutions clearly and effectively Can-do attitude with a service-oriented approach, curiosity and investigative mindset Enjoys working with others to help them identify and overcome roadblocks in their progress advanced working knowledge of SQL (HQL a plus) Jumpshot is located in the heart of SOMA in San Francisco, right near AT&T Park, Caltrain, Muni, and lots of restaurants and bars. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, 401(k), regular lunches, and more! We offer the opportunity to be part of a successful, fast growing company. To learn more about us, please visit our website at www.jumpshot.com.If you are interested in applying for this opportunity, please submit your resume or CV, cover letter and salary requirements. All submissions will be evaluated and interviews will be conducted for those applicants who most strongly fit our needs. If you are not contacted for an interview, your resume will remain on file and active for available positions for a period of one year.No phone calls please and no agencies or recruiters.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description: OVERVIEW:We are looking for a Sr. Financial Analyst to join our NetSuite FP&A team. This individual will report to the Senior Finance manager and will work on forecasting, reporting and analytics on critical top line SAAS metrics such as revenue, bookings and renewals . This person will play a critical role working with accounting on month end close schedules and understanding accounting principle and manual journal entries. This person will also help assist quarterly business review (QBR) and involve in long range planning (LRP) working with executives as well as acting a liaison focusing on communication and coordination on the forecasting processes across the five NetSuite regions. To be successful in this role, you will need strong analytical and system skills and would ideally have very solid experience in FP&A/Accounting/Sales finance field. An ideal candidate will have experience forecasting revenue and bookings reporting at a mid to large sized public company, preferably in the software industry or at a company with a subscription revenue model. ResponsibilitiesMonthly and quarterly revenue/renewal forecasting and reporting, and support on month/quarter end close activitiesMonthly and quarterly bookings and renewal & attrition reporting.n depth experience with financial modeling and analysis.Strong experience in data mining analytics on revenue and bookingsHelp coordinate with quarter business review (QBR) and long-range planning (LRP)Communication and coordination on forecast processes between five NetSuite regionsCollaborate with other team members in San Mateo and Manila CANDIDATE PROFILE:BS in Finance or Accounting preferred.MBA or CPA a plus.Cloud or software experience highly preferred.7+ years finance/accounting related experience.Strong interpersonal skills.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.Expert Excel skills are a must.Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.Experience with NetSuite a plus.Data Analyst and revenue forecasting (SAAS revenue) background a plus.

title: Senior Data Analyst - Marketing

title: Sr Business Analyst
description: CallFire’s Sr. Business Analyst position is a great opportunity for a professional analyst with a strong analytically driven background. The Sr. Business Analyst position will be responsible for preparing data and strategically analyzing the CallFire business. This position requires complex analysis skills and will be primarily responsible for reporting on sales performance. The individual will need to strategically understand and report from an abundance of data from multiple systems. Reporting Relationship: The Senior Business Analyst reports to the Chief Data Scientist and the Chief Revenue Officer 5+ years experience in an analyst or data science role at a technology based company. Strong business analysis skills – Work mentality should be driven from a strong understanding of the business first. Strong communication skills - Be able to take complex concepts and boil down into simple easy to understand analysis that includes recommendations. Strong SQL knowledge – Must have ability to query and create data marts, create procedures and write high performance joins. Expert Excel skills – Experience with data modeling and excel graphing skills Project management skills - be able to manage and prioritize effectively between weekly and monthly analysis reporting and quick ad-hoc analysis Problem solving skills - Critical thinking is required in almost every project. Being able to see a clear path to analysis is key to success Creative thinking - Be able to think about potential relationships between data and the business operations. Be able to connect the dots for stakeholders. PowerPoint Presentation experience Strong drive and self-motivated work ethic Strong integrity and ability to stay unbiased in analysis Understanding of sales processes and experience with sales metrics is a big plus. Experience analyzing online web traffic (google analytics or similar) is a plus Experience with Domo a plus Job duties: Take the lead position on creating and analyzing data reports, on sales team activity. Responsible for daily reporting of sales and marketing KPIs. Analyze reports and trends and provide recommendations on a weekly monthly and quarterly basis Create new views of data to consistently improve company understanding of trends and revenue. Provide support for additional Ad-hoc analysis as needed for company initiatives. Lead or participate in projects designated by the Chief Data scientist, CRO, or Director of BI. Projects will include collaboration with multiple departments. Benefits: Fully paid medical (medical, dental, vision) benefits, 50% for families 401 (k) plan Unlimited sick leave Stock options Paid vacation General awesomeness

title: Data Analyst - Finance
description: Snowflake started with a clear vision: make modern data warehousing effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Because traditional on-premises and cloud solutions struggle with this, Snowflake developed an innovative product with a new built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. Snowflake: Your data, no limits.As a Data Analyst for our Finance team, your work is used to uncover insights about the financial operations of Snowflake, helping to drive important strategic decisions. You will join a small, growing finance team and also work with some of the leading data scientists and engineers in the field.We are looking for someone who is passionate about analytics and is able to approach complex problems in an organized and detail-oriented manner. As Finance touches on all aspects of the business, you should be an intellectual athlete who has the desire to learn about customer behavior and the important drivers of various departments.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain company-wide analytics reporting and processes that provide insights to business performance and key company metrics for a fast growing, SaaS-based companyProvide regular, timely reporting and performance monitoring to Finance, Executive Team, and other key business stakeholdersDevelop data collection and appropriate analytical tools, models and processesSynthesize data from various sources such as AWS, ERP, and other internal systemsMeet regularly with sales teams, executive management, and key stakeholders to present analysis and actionable recommendationsThink creatively to find optimal solutions to our complex, often unstructured problemsOur Ideal Candidate Will Have3+ years of experience working with SQL and relational dataSolid understanding of financial and accounting concepts as well as familiarity with SaaS metrics2+ years of experience working with large-scale data3+ years of experience with tools commonly used for data analysis such as Python (numpy, pandas, and scikit), or R.Strong experience with at least one scripting language, such as Python, Ruby, Perl, or Bash.Experience working with Excel, ERP and Financial Planning toolsExperience with business intelligence tools such as Looker, Tableau, Business Objects, or Microstrategy.Familiarity with MPP databases, such as Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Vertica, etc.Experience identifying and debugging data problemsExposure to automating processesExposure to building ETL pipelinesAbout SnowflakeSnowflake Computing, the cloud data warehousing company, has reinvented the data warehouse for the cloud and today’s data. The Snowflake Elastic Data Warehouse is built from the cloud up with a patent-pending new architecture that delivers the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms and the elasticity of the cloud – at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. Snowflake can be found online at snowflake.net .Snowflake has been voted as one of the Bay Area Best Places to Work in 2015, 2016, and 2017. We are a place where people work effectively with the same values and vision. We focus on doing what is right for our customers, shareholders, and employees. We create great products, individually and as a team.Snowflake is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

title: Data Analyst
description: The Data Solutions team is responsible for integrating clients’ portfolios into Addepar, consulting clients on their trickiest portfolio data challenges, and ensuring data quality and timeliness. To fill this role we are looking for individuals who have exceptional analytical skills, portfolio accounting or securities knowledge, excellent verbal, written, and client presentation skills, and bring an engineering approach to all problems they encounter.ResponsibilitiesPartner with data providers and development teams to configure business logic for new financial data integrations Build and maintain integrations that transform custodian data into Addepar Global Financial FormatOnboard new clients by identifying unique portfolio or reporting needs and enabling them in the Addepar systemParticipate in broad company initiatives to stand up new product functionality or servicesCollaborate with our Client Solutions team and Data Engineers to resolve data issues that impact our clientsRequirementsDeep knowledge/experience of the financial industry, securities modeling, post-trade processing or back-office systemsFacility with programming languages such as Java or RStrong SQL or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic toolsFamiliarity with scripting languages (e.g. Python) and understanding of object oriented programming concepts a plusAbility to to problem solve and understand key drivers of Addepar business Adhere to Addepar values and team collaboration mentality Addepar is the financial operating system that brings common sense and data-driven investing to our financial world. Addepar gives asset owners and advisors a clearer financial picture at every level, all in one place. It handles all types of assets denominated in any currency. With customizable reporting, financial advisors can visualize and communicate relevant information to anyone who needs it. Secure, scalable, and fast, Addepar is purpose-built to power the global financial system. Hundreds of single and multi-family offices, wealth advisors, large financial institutions, endowments, and foundations manage over $1 trillion of assets on the Addepar platform. Addepar has offices in Mountain View, New York City, Salt Lake City, and Chicago.At Addepar, we rely on a range of backgrounds, experiences, and ideas. We value diversity, and we’re proud to be an inclusive, equal opportunity workplace.

title: Sr. Data Analyst

title: Senior Director Analytics
description: DescriptionThe Senior Director, Analytics will oversee a large technical and external-facing team that is responsible for the creation and presentation of commercially and campaign-oriented insights to OEMs (including Senior Executives) and their ad agency partners. The primary function is to develop pragmatic strategies for the creation of commercially-oriented insights supported by model and market level analysis of customer behaviors and perceptions relative to the OEM brands and campaign performance data to make recommendations in order to help protect or generate new business. The Senior Director will also be responsible for overseeing a critical impressions forecasting and delivery analytics team that is responsible for partnering with many internal groups including Finance, Marketing, Sales and Product to forecast inventory levels in support of the upfront process and find proactive opportunities for the organization to monetize on inventory and deliver outcomes that matter most to clients. This highly visible role will require that the Senior Director create and nurture partnerships cross-functionally to evangelize and promote a data/insights-driven mentality organizationally. This position proactively supervises Director, manager, and analyst level personnel, and reports to the Vice President of Analytics.Lead the development of the strategy and vision for the sales analytics team; be a key partner to the OEM sales leadership teams in communicating and executing that strategy and visionEnsure that the Sales Analytics leadership team brings commercially-oriented and thought-provoking insights to OEM clients and their ad agencies and prospects for the purpose of driving new revenueLead, consult, coach and drive the team to protect current business revenue by identifying and leveraging the appropriate data and insights internally to help tell a compelling story to the ClientChallenge ad agencies with comprehensive analyses to drive tighter alignment of the brand with their customer segments (tailor market messaging)Deliver insights related to the consumer decision journey across CAMSGPartner cross-functionally to forecast impressions and identify opportunities that proactively improve our ability to anticipate available inventory levels and to monetize that which has been soldBuild internal relationships and collaborate closely with other Cox related degree.Masters/MBA preferred12+ years of combined relevant work experience in strategy, analytics, and consulting with at least 7 years’ experience as leading a team Prior work experience at a publisher, ad agency, or endemic property with exposure to or experience in sales and analytics is desired.Demonstrated understanding of ad agencies, ad campaigns, and campaign management as well as the customer lifecycle and consumer dynamics.Strong analytical skills with basic understanding of statistics, web trends, social media.Must have a desire to partner with Sales to drive new revenue from commercial insight analysis.Ability to be in front of and interact with clients, present effectively, and communicate with presence.Ability to creatively and succinctly articulate insights related to analysis via compelling story telling.Must be able to guide and teach others how to create and deliver compelling stories from analysis output.Experience in working with executives or strategic planning departments to set and/or manage to corporate level strategies a plus. Demonstrated experience in organizing, prioritizing, and coordinating complex team efforts. Experience with business support software applications such as MS Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Project, Visio, etc.) required.Ability to travel ~15%Requires physical ability and mental acuity to execute the duties of the position successfully within required timeframes in order to meet business requirements.About Cox AutomotiveCox Automotive Inc. makes buying, selling and owning cars easier for everyone. The global company’s 34,000-plus team members and family of brands, including Autotrader®, Dealer.com®, Dealertrack®, Kelley Blue Book®, Manheim®, NextGear Capital®, VinSolutions®, vAuto® and Xtime®, are passionate about helping millions of car shoppers, tens of thousands of auto dealer clients across five continents and many others throughout the automotive industry thrive for generations to come. Cox Automotive is a subsidiary of Cox Enterprises Inc., a privately-owned, Atlanta-based company with revenues exceeding $20 billion. title: Principal Data Trust Analyst (Remote OK)
description: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!Role The Splunk Senior Data Trust Analyst works on the Data Trust team with the Sr. Dir of Data Trust and the role is based in San Jose—remote and flexible is welcome. This role works with our data trust organization to ensure strategic alignment and security controls are in place. Are you a tech explorer and adventurer with an unconventional point of view? You will help define the data trust organization based on industry standards, map data flows in/through/out of Splunk, and support a highly dynamic, creative, and diverse organization. Do you want to join a passionate, flexible team who loves security, fun, and fighting for the users?ResponsibilitiesYou will define and publish the overall Splunk Data Trust map.You will research, evaluate, and recommend security technologies that can be applied to technology solutions being developed or maintained internally and/or externally.You will lead the design of information security solutions using industry standard methodologies, regulatory guidelines, and corporate policy.You are an innovator who can create a multidisciplinary strategy to make visible insights contributing to organizational road-mappingYou are technically seasoned and can drive solutions from discovery/inception to sustainable programs.You will participate in cross-domain, multi-functional matrix project teams to implement solutions in a highly collaborative manner.Interested in decreasing risk and clarifying systems? You'll bring not just technical expertise, but emotional and social intelligence to building relationships.You will expertly handle multiple simultaneous tasks, providing consistent record of all activities, while handling confidential work with discretion.You will conduct security assessments for projects, hold security reviews against internal or external solutions that are in process of being created or maintained.You truly enjoy the challenge of solving a difficult and original technical problem gracefully and elegantly.Requirements You have 10+ years of experience as an information security researcher.You have 5+ years of experience working in or directly with an information security team.You have 5+ years of experience in a medium to large sized IT organization, preferably with enterprise software product companies.You have an-depth knowledge of infrastructure security concepts including network devices, firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, identity services, web applications, encryption, forensic analysis, penetration/vulnerability tools, linux/windows/osx, virtualization, desktop/laptop and mobile devices.You understand threat intelligence, discovery, mitigation, remediation and root causes.You are curious, and can write in at least one programming language well.You should be comfortable speaking about information policy formation, information security management, & business risk management.You are self-directed, with the ability to work alone or in teams, with minimal oversight. You drive positive results in odd and sometimes undefined circumstances while adapting your attention to what matters.Working knowledge of IT and public cloud regulatory compliance and audit frameworks including ISO, SOX, NIST, SSAE, HIPAA, PCI, and FedRAMP.You can maintain a complete and interesting level of documentation including diagrams and security standards.You hold a strong ability to effectively engage and communicate as directed with a variety of audiences both technical and non-technical staff.You are able to explain complex systems and technical topics to others.You understand data security, encryption, digital rights management, & data loss prevention intuitively.Fosters and builds a collaborative working relationship with operational and business partners.You may have a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems business administration or related discipline. It is helpful but not required.Please be eligible to work in the United States without company sponsorship.We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Thank you for your interest in Splunk!

title: Research Data Analyst
description: Stanford’sDuties IncludeCollect, manage and clean datasets.Employ new and existing tools to interpret, analyze, and visualize multivariate relationships in data.Create databases and reports, develop algorithms and statistical models, and perform statistical analyses appropriate to data and reporting requirements.Use system reports and analyses to identify potentially problematic data, make corrections, and determine root cause for data problems from input errors or inadequate field edits, and suggest possible solutions.Develop reports, charts, graphs and tables for use by investigators and for publication and presentation.Analyze data processes in documentation.Collaborate with faculty and research staff on data collection and analysis methods.Provide documentation based on audit and reporting criteria to investigators and research staff.Communicate with government officials, grant agencies and industry representatives. - Other duties may also be assigned.Desired QualificationsRelevant experience in economics, health economics, and healthcare.Basic knowledge and demonstrated experience using and applying SAS and STATA analytical software, database management system software, database reporting software, database user interface and query software, and data mining software.Ability to collect data using a variety of methods, such as data mining and hard copy or electronic documentation study, to improve or expand databases.Strong listening, verbal and written communication skills.Ability to manage multiple activities in a deadline-oriented environment; highly organized, flexible and rigorous attention to detail.Ability to use logic to calculate data; efficiently construct a database or scrutinize the form of a question.Ability to work with data of varying levels of quality and validity.Demonstrated ability to produce data in a clear and understandable manner meeting user requirements. Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics or engineering.Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)Substantial experience with MS Office and analytical programs.Strong writing and analytical skills.Ability to prioritize workload.Certifications & LicensesNonePHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:Sitting in place at computer for long periods of time with extensive keyboarding/dexterity.Occasionally use a telephone.Rarely writing by hand. - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.Working ConditionsSome work may be performed in a laboratory or field setting.Work Standards Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, Job Family: Information AnalyticsJob Series: Research Data AnalystJob Code: 4751Grade: GExemption: ExemptSchedule: Full-timeJob CategoryInformation Analytics

title: Product Analyst
description: Quid builds software that augments human intelligence. We're defining a new market and pioneering technology that helps strategic thinkers make decisions in a fraction of the time. Quid algorithms reveal patterns in large, unstructured datasets and then generate beautiful, actionable visualizations.Our mission: We power human intuition with machine intelligence, enabling organizations to make decisions that matter.Quid is looking for a Product Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team.  You will help improve access to data across the organization and guide our interpretation of results.  You are equal parts strategist, analyst, and educator. You love working with data and excel at using your technical skills to solve strategic problems.RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop reports and dashboards to track product performance, user engagement, and/or new featuresExplore data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, and moreWork cross-functionally to compile and communicate key insights, identify product opportunities, and offer recommendations to leadershipUnderstand user-behavioral drivers of product performance at a deep level to shape what Quid provides to usersPartner with Product Managers to define metrics reporting for critical product areas, KPIs and establish a prioritization of workProvide analytical support to the product team to help them use data to inform the product development processAct as primary liaison between BI team and product, coordinating:Updates to KPI methodology/metrics in alignment with overall businessData product request process, to improve our measurement capabilities and data qualityCommunication of data quality issues, between business users and productWorkflow changes to maintain data consistency between product data, Salesforce, and other data toolsSupport overall BI / Ops team projects as needed with analytics requestsSKILLS & EXPERIENCE2 - 4 years related work experience, preferably in a Business Intelligence, Product Analytics or Data ScienceKnowledge of SQL is requiredExperience with Python, Looker (or other data visualization tools), and Salesforce is strongly preferredExperience working with product data for an internet tech or software company a big plusExceptional problem-solving skills and adept communicatorThis is not a technical rolePlease note before submitting your application: As a company, we take hiring very seriously. Interviewing with Quid may include video and phone interviews, written projects, and/or onsite interviews. Although we are unable to follow-up with each and every applicant, we do our best to run a thorough process with whom we identify a potential fit.Quid is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
