You will be working with internal customers in all departments (marketing, finance, operations and customer service) to dig into data insights and develop operation and business metrics using a wide range of tools (Redshift, Looker, Tableau, etc).Responsibilities Own business intelligence and reporting of overall company KPIs and performance metrics by productBuild and utilize tools and processes that will scale our reporting and analytics capabilities and help shape the data roadmapPerform diagnostics and data-driven recommendations to improve overall performanceOwn business forecasts – overall and by productWork with marketing, finance, operations, support teams to help shape and track business objectives with a data-driven approachSupport all cross-functional teams by prioritizing and responding to ad hoc analytics needsQualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or equivalent3 years in a previous position as a data analyst, ideally for a web or mobile-based businessProficient knowledge in SQL and relational databasesProficient knowledge in MS Excel or Google Sheets including formats, charts, tables, functionsExperience in data visualization tools such as Tableau or LookerDemonstrated experience showing strong critical thinking and problem solving skills paired with a desire to take initiativeDemonstrated experience working under pressure, both individually and collaboratively in a team environmentDemonstrated organizational skills and customer focus

title: Data Analyst - Digital Marketing and Web Analytics
description: Our media team is growing, and we are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our integrated Connection Strategy team, working on world-class brands like LEGOLAND, DOLE and William Lyon Homes. As a Data Analyst at Dailey, you will be a key member of a growing team focused on the strategy, execution and analysis of innovative integrated advertising campaigns that drive quantifiable results for our clients. The role requires an individual that is passionate about technology and has a strategic mindset that understands our clients marketing objectives. The Data Analyst will work with closely with integrated groups at Dailey including Media Planning, AdOps, Creative and Account Management as well as participate and present in regular client meetings. Responsibilities: Understand business goals of our clients and their customers and translate them into actionable and impactful reporting and analytics Participate in brainstorming sessions with internal groups at Dailey and our clients Work with large data sets via automated and hands-on data processing to produce structured data sets for analysis Understand the media execution process and optimization abilities, work closely with media planning, buying and creative groups to optimize performance of campaigns Prioritize requests from a multiple stakeholders, create project plans, determine level of effort, and keep to milestones within the plans Work with the Connections Strategy team to establish quantifiable success metrics and attribution models (e.g. KPIs, ROI, ROAS, CPA, engagement, brand lift, MMX, etc) Apply independent critical thinking, summarize insights from analysis, identify next steps and develop implementation plan Mine data for underlying trends, consumer behavior patterns, and marketing triggers that drive results Identify data relationships to bring together full consumer journey insights, utilizing data captured from multiple sources including; sales, brand equity, website/app analytics, paid advertising, paid/organic search, email and social media. Synthesize and convey analytical findings through compelling, client ready presentations and dashboards Monitor viewability, fraud and brand safety metrics of active digital campaigns (via IAS, Double Verify or similar) Validate and audit tagging accuracy against tagging specs and reporting specs Drive the requirements definitions and provide guidance on site tagging structures and tagging strategies ensuring appropriate and accurate tracking and measurement Abide by the specific policies and procedures of our clients, including client specific GDPR requirements. Manage Personally Identifiable Information (“PII”) in accordance with clients Information Privacy Guiding Principles, Privacy Policy and public facing privacy statements on clients websites. Safeguard the company’s intellectual property, data, and assets. Promptly report any known or suspected loss, theft or unauthorized disclosure or use of PII data Meet and evaluate research and analytics vendors Other duties as assignedRequirements: 3+ years of experience in marketing analytics Bachelor’s degree required; Marketing, Communications, Advertising/Media preferred Ability to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to manage data logistics - including data transfers, building data structures, business rules, etc. - to enable project execution Experience creating dashboards using a variety of data sources, data aggregation platforms and visualization tools Prior experience with industry software/services: Marin, Sizmek, Google Analytics, AdWords, DoubleClick, Google Tag Manager, Facebook Ad Platform Experience using BI data visualization tools, such as: Tableau, Dataroma or Google Data Studio preferred Experience with Attribution and Ad Effectiveness Research: Nielsen, comScore, Millward Brown, Vizu, Lucid Experience with Oracle Eloqua (CRM) and Oracle Sales Cloud a plus Familiarity with comScore, Nielsen TV / Online, Simmons, MRI, Kantar, Clear Decisions, Rentrak, and social media analytical tools a plus QA/QC data and report output to ensure accuracy Advanced experience in MS Excel (Pivot Table, VLOOKUPS, SUMIF, etc.) A passion for building automation into process and procedure Exceptional organizational skills, multi-tasking capabilities, time management skills and detail oriented Must have solid problem-solving skills to identify multiple approaches for creating a solution and/or identifying when something could be resolved more effectively Ability to use data to effectively tell a clear story Strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills including presenting to clients

title: Data Analyst, Global Product Analytics
description: Data Analyst, Global Product AnalyticsDescriptionAt Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who help make that possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small.Position SummaryNOTE: MUST be fully authorized to work in the U.S. No OPTs, visa sponsorship, visa transfers or future green card sponsorships.Product Analytics is transforming education, and Pearson is at the forefront of using data to improve teaching and student learning. With over 10 million higher education students annually studying in our MyLabs, Mastering, and other digital learning products, we generate a lot of data. We also have great instructional and assessment content. Our product teams are building adaptive and intelligent learning systems to derive actionable insights about our learners, instructors and institutions. Today, our learning products are delivering personalized experiences worldwide, establishing a powerful foundation for new research and innovation.We are looking for a uniquely talented individual who can turn data into insight and action. A Data Analyst in Global Product Analytics consults with internal customers to understand their business questions, and then delivers analyses to meet those needs. Along the way, instrumentation is specified and deployed, data pipelines and processing defined, and visualizations built. The end results help optimize our customer experience and inform the entire product life-cycle from ideation to launch to constant improvement.We are looking for strong critical thinking skills, the ability to navigate various data environments, hands-on technical ability in data, and a drive to understand our business. The successful candidate will be a thought partner to our customers and will assist them in understanding data and generating further questions. This individual will dig into raw and processed data (backend DBs, Google Analytics, and event/message data), transform information into visualizations using Tableau, R, Excel, etc., and effectively articulate the story behind the data. The role involves close interaction with product management, user design groups, data warehouse developers, data architects, and software development teams. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are critical.High Level Responsibilities Partner with product managers and content teams to prioritize, scope and perform in-depth analyses that drive and inform strategic decisions, especially related to product development and growth initiatives. Develop insights to answer complex questions via thorough and well-designed data analyses using SQL, R, and Tableau and other tools with a focus on product efficacy and the optimization of learning outcomes. Provide thought leadership with internal stakeholders so that they may be able to better leverage insights. Connect with Product and Engineering teams to produce instrumentation to generate insightful measurements on our new and existing products. Work across departments and collaborate with business managers, user experience designers, systems architects, engineering delivery teams, project managers, QA, and operations teams. Identify information and visualizations required to tell a compelling and meaningful story using data; establish baselines and monitor growth or decline in metrics. Contribute to tools, documentation, and instruction to enable our customers to increasingly use data independently. Track and report on the status of deliverables in a project schedule. Serve as a point of contact to our business partners and cross-functional teams for day-to-day management of the Analytics program. Help create and maintain the plan, schedules, and other documentation required to effectively manage deliverables to our customers. Expected Results Effective instrumentation to remediate data gaps Analysis and insights delivered across our products Smart, intuitive data/insight tools that promote data-driven decision making Strong relationships with our internal stakeholders CompetenciesQualifications Leadership in an environment of uncertainty Innovation Sweating the details and delivering results Communicating and managing complexity Working across functions/disciplines Engaging and motivating others Being a team builder/team player Requirements 2 years in a highly analytical or quantitative function Being a strategic thinker, analytical, and detail oriented -- and having excellent problem-solving skills and a strong work ethic. Being a motivated self-starter, an evangelist for a data-driven culture, and desiring a deep understanding of customer needs. Ability and willingness to learn structured and unstructured data systems Experience in developing business requirements for instrumentation with Google Analytics; ability to instrument in Google Tag Manager a plus Proficiency in effective report/dashboard design and standards Familiarity with data preparation, processing, classification, and forecasting Familiarity with the software product lifecycle Ability to write SQL and create data visualizations Experience with Amazon S3, Redshift, Athena, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Google Big Query, Tableau, or JavaScript, are big pluses! A Bachelor’s degree or advanced degree in a technical, business, or math-based field Experience interacting with individuals at all levels, good time management, and solid communication skills. Proven leadership ability to influence and inspire people indirectly, lead by example, and engage and effectively build multidisciplinary alliances Ability to do some travel for planning and team meetings (20%) and frequently use web-based remote video and project collaboration tools NOTE: MUST be fully authorized to work in the U.S. No OPTs, visa sponsorship, visa transfers or future green card sponsorships.Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Primary Location: US-CO-CentennialOther Locations US-MA-Boston, US-NJ-Hoboken, US-CA-San FranciscoWork Locations: US-CO-Centennial-2154 East Commons 2154 East Commons Avenue Centennial 80122Job: Product ManagementOrganization: Global ProductEmployee Status: Regular EmployeeJob Type: StandardShift: Day JobJob Posting: Jun 13, 2018Job Unposting: OngoingSchedule: Full-time RegularReq ID: 1809018Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Software Implementation Analyst
description: Job titleSoftware Implementation AnalystJob Summary:We are seeking a temporary Software Implementation Analyst with strong technical aptitude to collaborate with the UCI Study Abroad Center team through our chosen software solution implementation for study abroad content management in alignment with our mission and goals. Our mission/goal is to be the hub of support and innovation in creating UCI global programs abroad that reach all students, enhance educational outcomes, enhance global collaborations of our faculty, and serve the strategic goals of the university as a whole. The ideal candidate enjoys trouble-shooting software and possesses strong organizational skills and will be comfortable working with Study Abroad Center staff to learn current processes and input them into a new system. The right candidate will have experience with integrating software applications, customer implementations, and good knowledge of technical concepts across the landscape. Incumbent will be responsible for interpreting the current procedures with the help of professional staff, transferring content into a new software management system, and working under the supervision of staff to assure that the system responds to the needs of the office and students we serve. This will involve data entry, editing, clarification of processes, and good written and verbal communication skills.Salary: Hourly $23.58Total Hours: TBDContract Position, 80% - 100%, 6 - 8 monthsJob Duties: Job Essential Function Percent of Time: 100%BUSINESS ANALYSIS Under general direction of the Study Abroad Center Director, the Analyst is responsible for analyzing and documenting the business process and information needs and requirements of the Study Abroad Center. Proactively communicates and collaborates with Study Abroad Center staff to analyze functional requirements and processes. Evaluates information gathered from Study Abroad Center Staff, and other subject matter experts, reconciles conflicts, decomposes high-level information into details, abstracts up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distills underlying true needs.Serves as the conduit between the Study Abroad Center staff and Symplicity Horizons software system. Documents as-is and to-be business processes and requirements, and translates requirements directly into the Symplicity Horizons software system for application configuration.Validate and verify all requirements, making sure they map to the business need being addressed and are approved by the subject matter experts and meet relevant quality standards for completeness and relevance.Identifies and addresses process fit-gap issues. Proposes and achieves acceptance of resolutions. Monitors and tracks the system for issues and errors.Identifies opportunities to enhance tools to enable higher operating efficiencies.Assist in executing and conducting test plans, go-live planning and execution and post go-live support.Consults, implements, and trains so that the team learns to utilize software to its fullest potential.Others duties as assigned.SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:Required:Strong analytical, data management and reporting skills. Demonstrated ability to learn technical systems including networks and databases quickly. Strong communication skills written and verbal with the ability to explain a concept in multiple ways. Demonstrated methodical and detailed approach to problem-solving. Familiar with different text formats to convert easily between Word, PDF, HTML, Notepad, and other systems. Excellent written communication skills. Ability to set priorities, meet timelines, and work independently. Proficiency with standard computer software (i.e. Microsoft Office - Excel). Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to switch back and forth between tasks frequently. Define and document best practices for software implementation and integration and contribute to team knowledge sharing efforts. Desired:Ability to implement and assist on data migrations from customer legacy systems into new software. Understand the study abroad process from application to participation. 1+ years of implementation/consulting experience with Student Information System Business Processes. 1+ years of experience in Higher Ed environment and/or Business Consulting. Familiar with concepts of Student Management lifecycle.HOW TO APPLY: Interested candidates can view additional information and may submit an application and resume online on this webpage: https://staffing2.hr.uci.edu/CSS_External/CSSPage_Welcome.asp and search 2018-0657.

title: Data Analytics Project Lead (Advisor)
description: Job DescriptionAre you looking to make a difference in your career? We’re working on smarter grids, cleaner energy and tools to help people manage energy more efficiently.About ITThe role of IT goes beyond the traditional Information Technology “service provider.” Many of the innovative ideas and projects that shape the company’s future and move SCE forward are dependent on technology. IT employees are at the heart of these projects, collaborating, designing and executing technology solutions that are transforming our industry.Position OverviewThe Data Analytics Project Lead, leads big data analytic projects that require in both subject matter expertise and specialized technical skills in data analytics. These projects will be strategic in nature and require understanding of the major data types, repositories and internal and external sources in use across SCE. Defines problems, collects data, applies advanced economic and statistical concepts, establishes facts and draws valid conclusions. Applies an in-depth understanding of advanced mathematical concepts, establishes facts and draws valid conclusions. Leads the mining of the data for insights, development and implementation of new and advanced forecasting models using advanced statistic and machine learning methods, and educating other analysts and management in OUs about the state-of-the-art in big data analytics. The person in this position is expected to have excellent analytical, statistical, and computing skills. Finally, project management, consulting and communication skills are important for this position as the person in this role interacts heavily with management and both technical and non-technical staff across the company.In this role, the Project lead will work closely and collaboratively with Managers and SMEs in OUs across the company to define, initiate and implement data analytics solutions to meet the needs of strategic use cases.Typical Responsibilities Will Include Acts as a consultant/strategic advisor to other organizational units or departments on the initiation, scoping, development and implementation of big data analytics projects. Advice OU clients of what can and cannot be accomplished by the use of data analytics. Frame the appropriate questions to be answered to solve complex business problems and communicate the insights gained from data analytics. Collaborates with analytic teams across the company on big data analytics techniques and tools to improve analytics capabilities at SCE. Develops advanced knowledge of sources of data and tools available to access information. Accountable for the accuracy and integrity of findings and recommendations. Specifically, works with data scientists and data engineers to analyze large data repositories (e.g. Edison Smart Connect Data Warehouse) using advanced analytical tools such as R, Teradata Studio, Hadoop, SAP HANA; reviews data for quality and consistency, and shares insights with other analysts and business users of the data; coordinates closely with data stewards of data repositories to address any data quality and access issues. Leads the development of analytical solutions using quantitative forecasting, modeling and analysis tools, to produce data to support business processes and decision-making. Tracks the outcomes and monitors the results of implemented use cases and performs after-the-fact analysis. Specifically, monitors performance and supports such systems in collaboration with OU personnel.Directs or performs analytical tasks associated with a critical or analytical project or a number of small projects with many complex features. Specifically, helps lead big data analytics projects including such aspects as: acquire access to, validate, and analyze data collected across the company. Identify how data collected for one purpose can be used to solve business problems in other areasQualificationsMinimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Economics, Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related discipline. Must have project management experience Six or more years of experience in field of data analysis/statistics Proven experience in providing well-reasoned and substantiated recommendations to senior management on strategic mattersDesired Qualifications Familiar with and understanding of analytical techniques such as time-series, regression, neural network, and machine learning models. Demonstrated experience gathering data from different sources and formats (MS Excel, Access, Oracle, SQL, XML, etc.) and compiling it for the ease of analysisExperience working with big data tools and data storage such as SAP HANA, Hadoop, Teradata, etc. Experience using statistical tools for analysis and forecasting. Specialized understanding of one or more electric utility business areas such as Customer Services, Transmission & Distribution, Power Supply, Generation, system operations or planning. Comments Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work directly as employee for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship. Relocation is available for this positionSouthern California Edison, an Edison International (NYSE:EIX) company, serves a population of nearly 14 million via 5 million customer accounts in a 50,000-square-mile service area within Central, Coastal and Southern California. Join the utility leader that is safely delivering reliable, affordable electricity to our customers for over 125 years.SCE is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status.If you require special assistance or accommodation while seeking employment with Southern California Edison, please call Human Resources at (800) 500-4723, and choose option 3 for the Employee Information Center. Representatives are available Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., Pacific time, except Wednesdays when the center closes at 2:30 p.m., and holidays, or (800) 352-8580 (Telecommunications device for the hearing impaired - TTY).

title: Data Quality Analyst (Contract)
description: 1010data combines people, process and technology to fully-democratize data analytics and, in the process, empower the high-definition enterprise that makes smarter decisions and creates optimal business outcomes.An essential tool to more than 850 of the world’s top retail, manufacturing, telecom, government and financial services enterprises including The New York Stock Exchange, Dollar General, P&G, and RiteAid; 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the most complex advanced analytics. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance.1010data ValuesIntegrity: Doing the right things for the right reasonsAgility: Adapting and thriving in a dynamic environmentTeamwork: Combining our strengths to do amazing thingsPassion: Channeling enthusiasm to drive excellenceCreativity: Unleashing curiosity to defy the normAbout The RoleWe are seeking a San Diego based Data Quality Analyst for a 40/hr a week 6-month contract role with the potential to go permanent to help support and expand the capabilities of our ecommerce focused data solutions.Our ecommerce solutions help Fortune 500 consumer brands measure online shopping behavior to understand the consumer journey and the brand’s own competitive performance relative to rivals. Our solutions and accompanying insights provide critical visibility to fuel clients’ ecommerce strategies and tactics.Reporting directly to the head of our Data Quality team, the role specializes in the creation, maintenance, and quality control of product categories used for reporting our ecommerce metrics. You will get to work with big data software and data sets, and ensure the data delivered to internal and external stakeholders is error-free and accurate.What You Will Take On Use industry standard and proprietary tools, along with online research, to build categories containing hundreds of thousands of products.Perform ongoing category maintenance to ensure both in scope and out of scope items are addressed appropriately. Participate in ongoing data auditing and quality control efforts, as well as perform data forensics to identify data anomalies and their root causes. Catalog and report identified issues to management and engineering so they can be fixed. Recommend category structure best-practices to our Sales and Client Insights teams. What You Will Bring Experience with consumer data such as web traffic, shopping behavior, or market trends. Excel mastery and experience analyzing data trends Boolean logic query experience (i.e. IF, AND, OR, etc.)Excellent written and oral communication skills Self-starter, eager to proactively drive change Positive attitude, excited about learning new things Meticulous attention to detail Infectious interest in ecommerce and consumer packaged goods a plus 1-3 years of professional experience Be prepared to site examples of your work in these capacities.This is a 40/hr a week 6-month contract position with potential for FTE. Rate: $25/hr

title: Senior Business Data Analyst Job
description: Requisition ID: 188487Work Area: Software-Design and DevelopmentExpected Travel: 0 - 10%Career Status: ProfessionalEmployment Type: Regular Full TimeCompany DescriptionSAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.Role DescriptionWe are looking for a Product Manager/Business Analyst who can dramatically increase our insight into how customers implement and use our HR products. This is a hands-on role defining data requirements, working with development teams to implement, create and share the insight from the data and help drive action based on that insight.EXPECTATIONS AND TASKSWork closely with Product Management, Operations, and Development teams to define and implement data strategies to create insight into how our customers implement and use our products.Retrieve, manipulate and analyze data from various sources to draw relevant and actionable conclusionsContribute to the design, development, and maintenance of KPIs, reoccurring reports and dashboards to ensure high-level visibility of company performance and planningEnsure data accuracy by validating data, identify any missing data and work with engineering to start capturing the right data for analysisGather requirements from customers, prospects, engineers, sales, other product managers, and professional services consultants, and write detailed product specifications for the engineering teamPerform competitive analysis in determining and prioritizing feature requirements for existing and new productsSupport internal teams (Finance, Sales, Product, Engineering, Operations, Marketing and Customer Success) with data-driven analysis to drive key business initiatives and decisionsEducation And Qualifications/Skills And CompetenciesStrong execution orientation – you get stuff donePassion for business problems and use of data to help solve those problemsStrong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills to effectively prepare and present reports, forecasts, trends and actionable insights to executive, business and technical teams Experience working with engineers to define software products Excellent presentation, oral, and written communication skills. Data visualization expertise a plus. Excellent quantitative analysis skills to take data as input and output actionable recommendations. Experience transforming vague business problems into data-driven questions, identifying and retrieving the relevant data set using multiple data sources Excellent data acquisition and manipulation skills (ability to write SQL, process data in R or Python, data warehousing, Excel) Experience with Software-as-a-Service or Cloud delivery model.Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment. Detail-oriented self-starter with experience working on multiple projects in parallel, excellent followthrough, and the ability to solve unstructured problems 5+ years’ experience as a business analyst or equivalent roleDesireable Skills And ExperienceMBA or a Technical undergraduate degree Experience with enterprise software such as HR/HCM processes or applications including HRIS, Goals and Performance Management, Succession, or other business applications such as CRM, ERP, or financial systems Experience managing or marketing developer-facing productsWhat You Get From UsSuccess is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENTTo harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.EOE AA M/F/Vet/DisabilitySAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.Additional Locations:

title: Senior Internal Auditor
description: Plans, coordinates and executes review processes/activities of the entities of Community Medical Centers (CMC). Works under the general supervision of the Manager and CAECO and follows departmental policies and procedures as well as limited instructions in carrying out daily tasks. Provides audit and risk assessment services. Assists by reviewing the organizations operations, adequacy of internal controls, compliance with laws and regulations, adherence to policy and procedures, safeguarding of assets, and accuracy of reported financial activities. Supports governance by assuring the organization of the state of the control environment. The Senior Internal Auditor must be a self-starter, must possess sufficient skills, training and experience in healthcare to work independently. Must have proficient level in computer knowledge (including but not limited to; All Microsoft applications, report writing applications and other audit tools). Must have high collaborative, communication and writing skills. Knoweldge of Medicare, third-party requirements, CDM, revenue codes assignments, CPT, HCPCS, ICD-9, ICD-10, DRG, and APC classification systems; medical terminology, billing and reimbursement processes and EHR. Must perform duties honestly, confidentially and objectively. Must possess a deep understanding of healthcare and the laws that regulate its delivery. QualificationsExperience and Education:   Minimum Required: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Information Systems/Computer Science or healthcare related field. Five years of experience assessing risk and performing audits (financial, operational, IT and/or compliance) in a healthcare environment. Experience or additional course work in charge master, documentation, coding and billing for hospitals, accounting, auditing, system analysis, programming or computer operations management. Three years of experience assessing risk and performing audits (financial, operational, IT and/or compliance) in a Hospital environment. PREFERRED: Experience with the following applications: EPIC, Electronic Medical Records (EMR), Lawson and Data Analytics and Continuous Monitoring Software Solutions (ACL). LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS PREFERRED: Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) and/or ACL Certified Data Analyst (ACDA).

title: Data Analyst
description: CrowdStrike started with a mission to revolutionize the entire approach companies take to security. CrowdStrike has disrupted the multi-billion dollar endpoint security market with innovative technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering. Our groundbreaking technology ensures that organizations can not only defend themselves but also do so in an efficient and future-proof manner. Today, the company continues to drive major innovations around AI/machine learning, behavioral-based prevention and detection, etc.to stay ahead of adversaries. We are one of the World's Most 50 Innovative Companies according to MIT, and one of Forbes Most Promising Companies. We are valued at over $3 billion dollars and continue to meet explosive global customer demand.We Have Received a Number Of Exciting Awards IncludingJune 2018: Closed over $200 million, led by General Atlantic, Accel and IVP, with participation from March Capital and CapitalG (Google), achieving a valuation of more than $3 billion.April 2018: CrowdStrike Wins SC Award for Best Security Company Second Year in a Row.October 2017: 100 Best Medium Workplaces for 2017 by Fortune magazine.May 2017: Closed $100 million equity financing round, at a valuation of over $1 billion dollar (backed by Accel, CapitalG, and Warburg Pincus).Reporting into the VP/Finance, the Data Analyst will join a small and growing team and will support major projects and initiatives for all things data and reporting related. This proactive team member will be responsible for developing data sets, KPI’s and dashboards highlighting operational and financial KPI’s that drive meaningful, data drive decision making.ResponsibilitiesBuild presentations shared with the Board of DirectorsProduce weekly/monthly/quarterly preparation of KPI’s delivered to the C-SuiteMaintain and report on a portfolio of SaaS metricsProperly categorize deals into the correct revenue and product categoriesLiaison with Sales to forecast bookings from various sourcesLeverage and optimize business applications such as Domo and Salesforce, driving towards reporting automation and data integrityInstitute best practices and scalable processes including data flowHandle a variety of ad hoc analysis requests spanning multiple departmentsRequirementsBachelor's degree in business, statistics, mathematics, accounting, finance, economics or similar, MBA preferredExperience working at a SaaS business, preferably during a sustained high-growth periodAble to effectively communicate across various levels in the organizationExpertise in business applications including advanced Excel, PowerPoint, Salesforce and BI (Domo a plus)Proficient in SQLStrong analytical background and ability to flush out anomaliesCapable of delivering against aggressive timelinesAbility to work in a fast-paced environment and manage through ambiguityA demonstrated history of being a positive team player and desire to get involvedAbility to commute to downtown SunnyvaleCrowdStrike believes that diversity and inclusion among our organization is essential to our success as a global company, and we seek to attract, retain and empower the industries best and brightest from a diverse talent pool.CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Big Data Analytics System Support Engineer
description: The successful Senior Big Data Analytics System Support Engineer candidate will have a very strong technical foundation enhanced by a clear devotion to serving and satisfying customers. This position is a core member of the world-wide Customer Engineering Technical Support Organization, which is tasked with customer delivery, including triage and support of customer cases. This engineer will exhibit broad and deep technical expertise, attention to detail, and enjoy working with customers.The Senior Big Data Analytics System Support Engineer deploys and configures large, complex clustered systems. The successful individual excels at troubleshooting, resolving and documenting findings. Team members also work closely with each other and cross-functionally, for example with development, QA, and sales engineering teams.Principal Job ResponsibilitiesExcel at working directly with customers to plan, implement, and maintain production deployments.Use a systematic approach to proficiently troubleshoot, identify problems, and resolve technical issues requiring understanding of appropriate, to new customers.Contribute to the knowledge base by creating brief symptom/solution articles.Duplicate issues (individually or with QA) to identify bugs, interoperability issues, feature enhancements, and workarounds.Contribute to the direction of Dtex products by providing customer use cases and feature enhancements to product management.Work well individually, as well as in teams servers.Strong Linux knowledge, including networking, performance, and security domainsUnderstanding of SQL and NoSQL databases, e.g. postgresql, ElasticSearchExperience with basic bash and/or python scriptingHands-on experience with large distributed systems from deployment, maintenance, scaling and troubleshooting perspectivesExcellent time management skills and strong sense of urgencyAbility to work alternative schedules depending on customers' needs <span style="color: rgb(51,51,51);font-family: Calibri;font-size: 12.0pt;"<span style="color: rgb(51,51,51);font-family: Calibri;font-size: 12.0pt;"Core Competencies/Skills & KnowledgeStrong Linux server administration experience, including large, clustered, enterprise software deployment, configuration, and maintenanceStrong knowledge of Web Applications, including strong understanding of secure communicationsExperience deploying Enterprise Web ServersExperience working with large scale clustered big-data analytics applications.Understanding of system performance elements in applications running in clustered Linux environments.Good understanding of Windows desktop and server environments, including administration and endpoint application troubleshooting techniques.Understanding of networking administration on Linux and Windows.Understanding of inter-application communication with a particular focus on troubleshooting.Strong, clear, and organized communication skills, both verbal and written.Strong self-starting individual contributorStrong member in world-wide and cross-functional teamsAbility to effectively prioritize and manage multiple customers or projects. Customer acumen to champion the customer problem until resolution.Desire to learn new skills/technologies and remain up-to-date with latest trends. title: Data Quality Analyst
description: The Interpreta solution is a cloud-based solution that provides immediate financial value to healthcare payers and insurers, as well as a high degree of benefit to healthcare providers, while improving patient care and outcomes – delivering a new standard in value and quality. We are currently seeking an a stellar Data Quality Analyst to join our team.Position Summary: This role will be responsible for effective data quality analysis, operation & validation, develop partnerships with numerous business stakeholders, and drive/evolve education related to data governance rules and best practices. In this position, you will support data quality enhancement by implementing data quality control measures and advise on best practices to reduce/resolve data anomalies. A significant part of this role will be carrying out research, defining and documenting best practices, and executing related data quality tasks to support Interpreta in maintaining and managing data accuracy and integrity by proactively analyzing data to support organizational goals.Primary Job Responsibilities: Develop rules and process to control the integrity (accuracy, thoroughness, process compliance) of all data within Interpreta’s databases Directly support and assist in managing data governance by identifying, prioritizing and implementing change while providing status updates measuring impacts across various projects  Support internal teams by providing ongoing & ad-hoc data concierge services and conducting effective research via web / subscribed research sites and present timely information as required  Analyze daily health of the data reporting operations. Identify and develop insight to reduce data quality issues and process gaps Document data dictionaries, specifications and business requirements for key workflows and process points Eval uate data and resolve data quality issues by analyzing gaps in process and source files.  Help identify and develop insight to reduce data quality issues Recommend process improvements & suggest alternatives for continuous enhancement of existing workflow Document business requirements for key workflows and process points Manage business data dictionary for master data and reporting metadata and metrics glossary Perform data analysis related to investigations and data quality control Lead Data Governance process with external and internal data providers to ensure timely, accurate and complete commercial data Manage the identification and implementation of KPIs and metrics to ensure third party compliance to data requirements Manage business priorities while driving process improvements and data quality enhancements Work with ETL developers to ensure timeliness of external data Use data collection tools to clean, merge and manage existing data sets and adhere to data quality procedures to ensure accuracy, integrity and timeliness of dataOther duties as assigned   Job Qualifications/Requirements: 5+ years of demonstrated experience in Business Intelligence and Data Analytics role (prefer Healthcare data management experience) Strong knowledge of data quality management and best practices Advanced SQL and ETL Data Warehouse experience for Business Intelligence (MongoDB a plus) Excellent Excel skills (Pivot tables, VLookups, etc.) Understanding of data requirements gathering and ability to translate business requirements from stakeholders to technical development team Exposure to popular master data management tools and best practices A good general understanding of healthcare operations, along with excellent research skills Must possess strong communication (verbal and written), research and interpersonal skills as well as excellent time-management and organizational skills, with a proven ability to be highly productive and efficient in a team driven environment Must have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, an investigative mentality, organizational and logic skills Experience with managing, monitoring and scoring data quality in a transactional environment Proven capability to gather, manage and synthesize large amounts of information efficiently, effectively and creatively with maniacal attention to detailBackground in report creation and spreadsheet analysisEducation: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Intelligence or a related discipline

title: Network Security Expert, Gartner Research
description: What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.You are always learning and looking to discover what’s next in technology.You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.If this describes you, Gartner is looking for you! Gartner is an upbeat culture based on collaboration, teamwork, integrity and objectivity that values creativity and innovation. As a Gartner analyst, you’ll not only help clients solve complex challenges and deliver on key initiatives, you’ll grow your career and the scope of your impact across industries. We work hard — and we reward success with exceptional opportunity.About this role:This role creates thought leading Network Security (including data center infrastructure and remote access) research to our Gartner for Technical Professionals clients through published research, conversations with client (Inquiry), stage presentations, teleconferences, and client meetings. It is important that you have a vision for how network security will evolve worldwide and at a regional level.What you’ll do:As a Gartner analyst you will meet with clients every day: on the phone, in a video-conference, from the stage at a Gartner event or face-to-face during a sales support visit. In every client interaction analysts help clients solve difficult puzzles that lead to better performance. To support these conversations you will research technology, practices and trends and produce written research for Gartner clients to download and apply.Conduct research and analysis in specific areas of expertise targeting client’s key initiatives.Deliver high quality actionable advice through a variety of media.Write high quality, clear, actionable, advisory research documents.Remain ahead of the curve on developments and issues within these specified areas as well as applicable adjacent areas.Respond to client questions, create materials for and deliver to clients in person, via teleconference, video conference or webinar and event presentationsMaintain the Gartner’s industry leadership reputation by responding to press inquiriesProactively work with the wider sales organization and deliver outstanding sales support in order to retain and grow the businessWhat you’ll need:It helps to be obsessed with your topic! Gartner analysts are correctly viewed as THE experts. This means you need to know your markets, vendors, trends, management practices, etc. and be able to see the forest and the trees. Most Gartner analysts have many years of experience and enjoy solving puzzles.Subject matter expertise in network security, with the ability to demonstrate understanding of the business requirements and opportunities in that marketKnowledge of network security architecture, zoning and value to enterprisesKnowledge of network security mechanisms such as firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, network traffic analysis, network access control, remote access and denial of service protection and how these controls can be implemented to manage risk to the enterpriseKnowledge of network architecture ideas such as software-defined networking and network virtualization and how security controls can be implemented within those contextsKnowledge of the global landscape, and the competitive interplay between incumbents, emerging providers, disruptors and outsourcersDemonstrated superior analytical skills, applying conceptual models, recognizing patterns while drawing and defending conclusions. Strong business and financial acumen as well as analytical skills are required for this positionArticulate and succinct communication skills. Publishing and Speaking engagements an advantageMinimum of 10 years of experience in a research or technology related roleBachelor's or equivalent experience, Master's degree preferredAbility to conduct occasional travel, regionally and globally

title: Clinical Data Analyst
description: The CompanyJUUL's mission is to improve the lives of the world’s one billion adult smokers by driving innovation to eliminate cigarettes. JUUL is the number one US-based vapor product. Headquartered in San Francisco and backed by leading technology investors including Tiger Global, Fidelity Investments and Tao Invest LLC, JUUL Labs is disrupting one of the world’s largest and oldest industries.We’re an exceptional team with backgrounds in technology, healthcare, CPG and biotech, and we’re growing rapidly to deliver on our mission. We’re actively looking to hire the world’s best scientists, engineers, designers, product managers, supply chain experts, customer service and business professionals.Role And ResponsibilitiesLooking for local San Francisco Bay Area applicants. We are looking for a Clinical Data Analyst (CDA) to turn data into information, then information into insight andobservations, with the goal for our business unit to review the pattern of these observations and usethis information when making business decisions. The candidates need to be very curious , whoenjoy diving deep into the material to find observations into a yet unknown question. They need tohave a natural desire to go beneath the surface of a problem. They need to be thinkers who can askthe right (business) questions. We’ll ask this CDA to collect and study data to reveal ways toimprove our business, or databases. The data would involve almost surveys, marketing, sales,research or resources databases. This position involves problem-solving, mathematics, computerskills and studying sets of both unstructured and structured data.We will supply the CDA with data sets, a scenario or problem, and the analyst must regularlypour through data and make observations. The analyst will analyze information from various sourcesthat might help us better understand our situation and then study the information to uncover patternsand outliers. They must be able to identify and interpret patterns and trends, assess data quality andeliminate irrelevant data.The CDA communicates the results of their analysis as a comprehensive report to companydecision makers. He/She designs the report and includes tools that can help those involved easilydigest the data, such as statistics, graphs, images and lists. He/She wouild distribute the report via aface-to- face meeting presentation to SME.The CDA could provide database design services (nice to have, not need to have). They alsocollect data using a variety of methods, such as data mining and hardcopy or electronicdocumentation, to improve or expand databases. Additionally, the data analyst should be able tomake recommendations about the methods used to collect, analyze and manage data to improvedata quality and the efficiency of our systems. title: Data Quality Analyst, Business Intelligence
description: Because you belong at Twilio The Who, What, Where And WhyWho?Twilio is seeking a Data Quality Analyst for BI team with an industry experience and a deep understanding of data usage and lifecycles across a SaaS-based organization. We are looking for someone to build the data quality framework used to identity, compare and resolve data quality problems across various data models managed by BI team. This role will be responsible for the design and implementation of the data quality processes, metrics, alerting and monitoring of critical data sets, dashboards & reports providing insights into data quality using BI/reporting tools. The individual will work closely with data engineers and analysts in the Business Intelligence team, as well as the analysts from various business teams, to ensure the solutions that are developed and implemented are tightly aligned to enterprise business standards and principles. The individual will act as a subject matter expert for the data quality and metrics for critical data sets used by various business users at Twilio. Bachelor's degree in a computer science related field is a minimum requirement.What?An engaging day for you would include evaluating large dataset for quality and accuracy by running complex SQL against various data warehouse and analytical systems. You will determine business impact level for data quality issues, root cause for data quality errors and make recommendations for solutions. You will develop process improvements to enhance overall data quality and execute data cleanup measures. You will maintain a record of original data and corrected data. You will define data quality standards and ensure adherence to those standards. You will resolve all internal data exceptions in timely and accurate manner. In this role, you will work closely with data engineers to correct data quality errors and help build automated monitoring and alerting mechanisms for internal data quality measures and processes that ensures the accuracy of data models, reports and dashboards used across TwilioWhy?Twilio’s Business Intelligence team provides actionable insights to business units and enables fact based decision making. We are a critical and strategic partner to the business and product teams to build true data driven culture at Twilio. Providing accurate and timely insights to our business and product leaders that enables data driven decision making will be essential to this role and to the success of the broader company.Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. The Talent Acquisition team plays an integral role in building small, impactful teams that work closely with our developer community to meet their communication needs.Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Come join us.Where?This position will be located in our beautiful office at 375 Beale Street in San Francisco. You will enjoy our incredible perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, massages, Wednesday Night dinners, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our , who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.
