title: Part-Time Research Analyst (Fixed-Term)
company: Otis College of Art and Design
location: 9045 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-3505, US
description: The Analyst performs a variety of work in support of federal and accreditation reporting which includes analyzing institutional data such as student enrollment, student engagement, and faculty data. The analyst also provides conceptualized interpretive analysis of quantitative/qualitative findings, analytical strategies for new data sets, and prepares statistical reports and surveys. The Analyst will work collaboratively and independently on research project design, data extraction, data collection, database creation, analytical interpretation, and preparation of reports in support of institutional research and effectiveness, strategic planning, and assessment activities for the College. This is a fixed-term, part-time position scheduled to end on August 30, 2019 with no permanent status granted; term may end sooner. The Analyst reports directly to the Director of Institutional Research and Effectiveness.  Job Duties: • Assists with data collection and analysis; ensures data collected is accurate, useful, and timely • Creates and executes queries to extract data from campus databases and external sources.• Maintains records, documents research methodologies, and reviews data collected for in-depth analysis. Performs statistical tests; identifies inefficiencies and makes recommendations.• Determines trends and provides rate analysis on various research studies related to higher education (i.e., retention rates, graduation persistence, etc.) • Reports collected data to internal and external entities (i.e., Department of Education, AICAD, NASAD, US News, Petersons, Princeton Review, and Common Dataset.) Assists in accreditation-related reporting. Ensures that reports submitted are accurate timely. • Maintains current information on websites, social media, handbooks, and/or other marketing materials (i.e., Institutional and Academic Program Dashboards.) May serve as a resource for information-exchange on data collected and general data analyses. • Performs other related duties as assigned.Required Qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree in a related field and two years of progressively responsible experience in technical research or statistical work in the collection, compilation, and analysis of data required; or graduate degree in the social sciences, computer science, economics, statistics, public or business administration, behavioral sciences, education, engineering or related discipline with no work experience.• Adept at understanding basic statistics, statistical tests and statistical software (SPSS preferred).• Strong organizational skills and attention to details; Able to prioritize, multi-task and complete assignments on time. Must be self-directed, reliable, and flexible. • Excellent typing skills with a high degree of accuracy. • Excellent communication skills with a natural ability for diplomacy. Ability to communicate with an ethnically and culturally diverse campus community.• Ability to follow all College policies, procedures, and guidelines including but not limited to safety, civility, information security, and non-discrimination policies and procedures. Preferred Qualifications: • Experience in Institutional Research including interpretation and presentation of data preferred.• Experience using Banner Student Information System, Access, Argos, Power BI, and/or Tableau highly desirable. • Experience creating and executing queries in relational databases preferred.

title: Lead Analyst, Data Analytics
description: In this critical role, you will turn complex data into tangible insights to help drive the success and growth of our products and our company. You will have tremendous cross-functional exposure as you will be partnering closely with our product, business and engineering teams to work on a wide-variety of projects; everything from understanding and visualizing real-world vulnerability data and attack trends related to the thousands of critical applications we protect, to measuring feature usage and identifying opportunities to better showcase the value of our solution to our customers and market. And though you will be expected to build tools and reports, this role is about so much more than creating dashboards – it’s about telling the story of our business and mission in the most compelling and creative way, using data!To be successful in this role you must have a strong combination of both technical data skills and excellent communication skills. You must be able to tackle unstructured problems in structured ways, be passionate about generating hypotheses for business problems, and be brilliant at delivering actionable insights accompanied with a compelling narrative.ResponsibilitiesDesign and build new analytical models and/or enhance existing models, while exploring and researching data relating to key product and business metricsConceptualize, build and maintain dashboards and reports focusing on key metrics and experiments. Build simple and elegant data visualizations for use in internal and external contextsWork closely with product, business and engineering teams; collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues to complete data projects and ensure all parties can leverage data-driven insights, e.g. to improve our understanding of patterns/trends related to product usage and identify new growth opportunitiesDevelop insights for Contrast’s client base using historical data with methods, such as time series analysis, regression, segmentation and clusteringAuthor customer/market facing, data-driven content (reports, whitepapers etc.)Foster a data culture through peer collaboration, training, coaching and moreAbout YouBA/BS or MS degree, preferably in Economics, Math, Statistics, Computer Science or related field3+ years of data analytics experience (business intelligence, data visualization, product analytics etc.) with proven track record of using quantitative analysis to impact key business or product decisionsA passion for data analysis and problem solving; statistics knowledge and hypothesis testing experience Comfortable with SQL, Excel and visualization tools (Periscope, Tableau etc.)Demonstrated ability to gather and process data at scaleStrong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written). Must be able to explain technical concepts and analysis clearly to a wide variety of audiences. Experience authoring content (whitepapers, reports, blog posts etc.)Bonus Points ForTechnical background and programming experience. Experience with R and/or Python is a strong plusApplication security backgroundWhat We OfferCompetitive compensationMedical, dental, and vision benefits401(k)Flexible paid time off We are changing the world of software security. Do it with us.We believe in what we do and are passionate about helping our customers secure their business. We work hard, and we have fun doing it.Solve the impossible.Easy = boring. If you’re looking for a fun work environment and like a challenge, you’ll love Contrast Security.By submitting your application, you are providing Personally Identifiable Information about yourself (cover letter, resume, references, or other employment-related information) and hereby give your consent for Contrast Security, and/ or our HR-related Service Providers, to use this information for the purpose of processing, evaluating and responding to your application for current and future career opportunities. Contrast Security is an equal opportunity employer and our team is comprised of individuals from many diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and locations.

title: Associate Director, Data & Analysis
description: Associate Director – Data & Analysis   Digitas is a highly-caffeinated playground where brilliant minds come together to bring bold, award-winning ideas to life.   The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients.    To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Associate Director—someone who can lead strategic client growth, provide innovative data-driven solutions to marketing challenges, and motivate internal teams to bring marketing ideas to life. Sound like you? Read on.   What you’ll do:   As an Associate Director, you’ll guide teams in driving strategic data-driven growth. You’ll work to surpass client goals through brand campaigns, acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.   Day-to-day, your role includes: Acting as a key partner for the client and internal teams by implementing conceptual data frameworks and developing effective marketing strategies Expanding client work, including building recommended approaches and scope Evaluating new online and offline data opportunities in the form of new sources, new technology, client priorities, partnership, etc. Fostering creative thinking around how we use data, and we could use data to solve unique business challenges in support of all Marketing activities (Media, Creative, CRM, and eCommerce). Managing efficient execution of projects, including the implementation of best practices Building a collaborative team environment, including participation in department-wide training efforts and fostering employee career growth   We’re looking for strong, impactful work experience, which typically includes: 7-9 years of experience in analytics or strategy with an advertising agency, management consulting company, or ad tech company Strong client relationship and communication skills, with experience managing multiple projects across teams Experience managing a team Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem solving skills Experience with modern statistical learning methods (regression techniques, classification models, supervised and unsupervised learning, etc.) Knowledge of digital data technologies (DMPs, Google Analytics, digital pixel tracking, site tagging, etc.) A four-year college degree; advanced degree is a plus Passion for online advertising and emerging trends in the digital landscape The ability to thrive in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment   Got what it takes? We’d love to hear from you.

title: Marketing Analyst
description: The Job The Marketing Insights Analyst reports to the Insights Strategist, and is responsible for configuring campaign tagging, maintaining data trackers, and analyzing campaign performance data. Data is both structured and unstructured, generated from multiple data sources such as Google Analytics, Facebook Insights and Ads Manager, Twitter Ads Manager, and YouTube Analytics. The expectation is to make complex data sets from multiple offline and online channels digestible with clear reports and rich visual formats that are insightful and actionable. The job of the Marketing Insights Analyst entails activities pertaining to, but not limited to:   Day-To-Day Activities: Analysis: Ensure correct implementation of tracking for multiple campaign tactics, as well as the accuracy of the data coming from various offline and online channels; Maintain data trackers and dashboards, organize and synthesize data from multiple channels, and analyze channel performance against campaign objectives; Perform quantitative and qualitative data analyses of paid and organic social media efforts; Run ad-hoc analyses to identify trends and areas of opportunity, and recommend innovative options to optimize social media strategies; Maintain functional expertise in analytical tools, techniques, and other infrastructure requirements. Reporting: Provide online/offline media insights and develop recommendations based on measurement reporting and quantitative and qualitative analyses; Provide clear, comprehensive cross-channel reports on marketing campaign performance using client-approved templates and professional reporting tools; Manage ongoing paid media, social media, and events reports as well as ad hoc deep dives to help strategists and managers optimize efforts; Collaborate with cohorts on the Insights Team to build client reports and support the analytics needs of internal teams. Others: Maintain partner relationships, and manage internal collaboration with key stakeholders to improve behavior change marketing campaign performance; Stay up-to-date on new marketing metrics and measurement tools and technologies; Other duties as required. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree +3 years relevant experience OR 8 years relevant experience OR Master's Degree +1 years relevant experience; Experience working with digital advertising data (display, video, rich media, search, custom units); Experience working with traditional advertising data (TV, radio, OOH, print); Experience working with social media marketing analytics tools and enterprise-level social media management systems (Sprinklr, Hootsuite, Facebook Ads Manager, Facebook Insights, Twitter Ads Manager); Experience working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Omniture, WebTrends); Proven ability to analyze quantitative and qualitative data, including content and sentiment analysis; Experience working with statistical and database tools (R, Python, MySQL, databases,etc.); Proven understanding of database concepts including normalization, and data integrity; Experience presenting data visually through Excel, Powerpoint, MS Access reports, Xcelsius, etc; Experience building multiple reports for different campaigns simultaneously; Experience working with a cross functional team. Preferred Qualifications: Experience working with data from on-the-ground event activations; Experience using Tableau or similar BI tools in creating dashboards and data visualizations; Experience working with statistical and database tools (R, Python, MySQL, databases,etc.); Experience analyzing the results of experimental test design (A/B split, multivariate testing); Experience with public health campaigns and their evaluations; Familiar with Alternative, Country, EDM, LGBT, and Hip-Hop subcultures. Location: San Diego, CA Status: Full-time Position Benefits: Learn more about the benefits of working at Rescue here: http://rescueagency.com/careers/ Travel: Must be able to travel occasionally   If you’re ready to join our team of mission driven talent challenging the status quo, we’d love to meet you! Check out our Careers page at rescueagency.com/careers for more information about what it’s like to work at Rescue, and the benefits that we offer to our team members.   The Fine Print Environment: All business-related environments are tobacco-free. Must have valid driver's license, reliable transportation, and computer and Internet access. Must be available to work non-traditional hours such as late nights and weekends.   Physical Requirements: Able to remain in a sitting position for prolonged periods of time and stoop, bend, reach, climb stairs, and move freely throughout the building for the performance of duties. Able to read from a computer or laptop monitor for several hours at a time including fonts of various sizes from a variety of sources. Able to speak publicly and give presentations on a laptop. Travel nationwide as needed to meet with clients, coworkers, or attend meetings and seminars.   The Application All applications must be submitted through Rescue’s online careers system (unless you qualify to request a reasonable accommodation, as detailed at RescueAgency.com/careers). We do not accept applications via email, mail, fax or in-person delivery. Please send questions to careers@rescueagency.com. Rescue | The Behavior Change Agency is an EEO/Minority/Female/Disability/Protected Veteran Employer

title: Junior Accountant/Financial Analyst
description: STRIVR is using immersive technologies like Virtual Reality (VR) to redefine the way people learn and train for everyday moments in their jobs. Our vision is to empower people to perform at their best by combining real-world experience with cutting-edge technology. With STRIVR spearheading the future of human performance and training, it’s an exciting time to make a big impact!Born out of Stanford University and its world renowned Virtual Human Interaction Lab, STRIVR aims to improve human performance and is used by Fortune 500 companies and elite sports teams worldwide. We have empowered over 200,000 individuals (and counting) to improve with VR since our launch in 2015. The STRIVR team includes industry leaders that have been studying and building VR for 20+ years, data scientists, instructional designers, and former pro athletes. As a culture, we are scrappy, smart and fearless.STRIVR is looking for an Accounting and Financial Analyst to handle the day-to-day accounting processes and financial analysis including reconciliations, reviews of multiple accounts, and preparation of financial statements and other reports. The ideal candidate is passionate about building and maintaining a robust set of accounting practices and financial tools that provide insight into the business and provide leadership the data needed in key decision making. This person will play a vital role in the success of a fast growing company and must be willing and able to adapt to STRIVR’s daily challenges.Responsibilities Record day-to-day financial transactions and complete the posting process Audit and review G/L coding of invoices, as well as appropriate authority level of approvals Interface with customers, vendors, and suppliers regarding collections and payables Capture, track, and report revenue and expenses Perform financial analyses to be used for key activities or decision making Assist in the preparation of various reports for key company stakeholders Collect data and perform research on details of transactions, and ensure work complies with internal policies and external regulations Recommend, assist, and implement valuable processes, system improvements or work flow changes Help with implementation, maintenance and adherence to internal controls Assist with internal and external auditsSkills And Experience Passionate about accounting and finance operations and willingness to roll up your sleeves by digging into detailed account transactions Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities Proven ability to transform large, convoluted data sets into meaningful stories Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Experience with NetSuite, Bill.com, Expensify, and/or Gusto preferred A strong sense of personal integrity, contributing to a culture that values diversity in the workplace Organized, detail oriented, and ability to work with confidential information Creative mind with ability to suggest improvements Shares and exhibits STRIVR’s core values

title: Data Analyst - Science & Technology
description: We are seeking a Data Analyst for our San Francisco office. The position will support Alexandria’s Science & Technology team by analyzing Alexandria’s large amount of proprietary data on the life science industry and publically available data including, but not limited to, VC Funding, government data (i.e. NIH, FDA, CMS) and capital markets. Alexandria’s Science & Technology Team supports Alexandria Real Estate Equities through four main areas – capital markets/industry trends, real estate, venture capital investments and thought leadership. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Improve large scale data analysis, and direct team towards best technology tools to maximize team efforts and data tracking and analysisUse statistical methods/models to analyze data and generate useful business reports for the Science & Technology TeamProvide support for strategic in-depth research studies that require data compilation, analysis, and interpretationWork collaboratively with other members of the Science & Technology Team to identify trends in Alexandria Venture Investments (AVI) and recommend opportunities to leverage proprietary AVI data Use data to create models that depict trends in the life science industry, and amongst Alexandria tenants Work with Science & Technology Team to outline the specific data needs for each business method analysis project Work with IT Business Intelligence team with defining requirements, documenting, testing business dashboards and analytics and new applications In collaboration with Science & Technology team members, conduct research (primarily quantitative) relevant to various disease and therapeutic areas, US healthcare and regulatory activity, and broader trends in the life science and technology industries Analyze short and long-term drivers affecting the life science and technology industries    Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or Predictive Analytics; Masters Degree a plus3+ years' data mining experience5+ years in a data analyst roleUser experience in one or more Business Intelligence tools3+ years’ experience in SAS, R, Python or other statistical modeling language1+ year experience in Informatica Data Quality, IBM InfoSphere or other data cleansing software is a plusHighly developed critical thinking skills and ability to find valuable data where no one else thought to lookAbility to clearly present complex findings verbally, visually and in writingAbility to collaborate effectively with team members across disciplines and in multiple geographic locationsStrong attention to detailSome understanding of life science and technology concepts and the life science industry preferredAbility to work independently and to effectively manage and organize multiple projects concurrentlyCommunicate with co-workers, management, and others in a courteous and professional manner

title: Business Insights Manager
description: About UsOur ambitious goal of helping innovators build a better world with data started in 2009. Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, exceeding $1B in revenue at the end of 2017.The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pure’s technology literally in the driver’s seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation build a fast-growing company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love . For more information on our business, check out the corporate fact sheet .What You Will Be DoingWe are looking for a highly talented Business Insights Manager who can provide analytical horsepower to support key strategic and operational priorities. In this role, you will partner with internal teams across the company to assess and shape decisions that will directly impact the business. If you are motivated, curious, adaptable and enjoy taking on big problems in creative ways we want you.Role & Responsibilities Lead cross-functional projects using advanced data modeling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities. Build, develop and maintain data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics support that drive key business decisions. Lead the design and delivery of reports and insights that analyze business functions and key operations and performance metrics. Examine, interpret and report results of analytical initiatives to partners in leadership, sales, marketing and product teams. Anticipate future demands of initiatives related to people, technology, budget and business within your department and design/implement solutions to meet these needs. Organize and drive successful completion of data insight initiatives through effective management of analyst and data employees and effective collaboration with partners. Communicate results and business impacts of insight initiatives to partners within and outside of the company. Requirements 8+ years of experience monitoring, managing, manipulating and drawing insights from data. Working knowledge of data mining principles: predictive analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on premises and cloud-based data sources. Strong SQL skills, ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries. Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, crafting tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for business users. Experience working with and building databases and dashboards using all meaningful data to inform decisions. Experience using analytics techniques to contribute to company growth efforts, increasing revenue and other key business outcomes. Proven ability to plan and handle numerous processes, people and projects simultaneously Strong programming skills with the following software packages or languages/ tools: R, Python, SQL, SAS, SPSS Statistics and/ or SPSS Modeler, etc. 8+ years of experience in MS SQL SERVER. 5+ years of experience with Tableau. Experience with data tools such as Hadoop, Cloudera, Spark, etc. is a plus. C, C++, JAVA, or other programming languages nice to have. Bachelor's degree in an analytical field - e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Finance. Master’s degree preferred. Excellent organizational, attention to detail, and communication skills. Pure Creates Opportunities for Your Development and Career GrowthAt Pure, we believe that each Puritan is a leader contributing to the success of our business, regardless of role. We offer an assortment of learning options available to all Puritans, including workshops on leadership, management, career development and more! We’re here to change the world and we hope you join us!Popular PerksPure offers an unlimited vacation policy, free lunches, meditation rooms, free yoga classes and employee resource groups to inspire all of our employees to maintain mind and body wellness. Through our Pure Good Foundation, we also offer numerous volunteer opportunities for employees to give back not only to the Bay Area, but across the globe.Pure Is Committed to Equality Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitingops@purestorage.com.

title: Security and Compliance Analyst
description: Gladly is all about putting people at the heart of customer service, as we're creating the platform that let's the world's greatest brands treat their customers as real people, build relationships and deliver happiness. We're small (35 people in Engineering, 85 total) but mighty, closing big customers like JetBlue, Hyatt, and Torey Burch. As we build the platform that changes how leading enterprise companies interact with their customers, we're looking for a security and compliance professional to ensure all data customers entrust to these brands are always protected, private, and secure. We'll also look to our Security and Compliance Analyst to advocate data security on behalf of our internal teams and customers – not because it's the law, but because our company philosophy embraces this attitude and commitment.What You'll Do:The Information Security Compliance Analyst is a key member of our growing Information Security team, responsible for coordination of PCI and SOC audits, control definitions, policy creation and security and awareness training. Success in this role requires a good understanding of information security best practices, ability to understand and communicate risk and controls, strong organization and planning skills, and good communication and writing skills.You will: Analyze and assess potential security threats, and build strategies to mitigate. Keep company up to date on responsibilities regarding security by creating and managing information security and risk management awareness training programs. Identify, evaluate and report on information security risks, practices and projects to all levels of audience. Coordinate and direct all information technology and security related audits for SOC and PCI compliance. Provide guidance and subject matter expertise on processes, controls, and objectives around audit and information security activities, best practices, and process improvements. Maintain our Information Security Policy and Standards documentation and manage waivers to policy/standard. Coordinate all responses to client inquiries regarding the information security program. Create clear, actionable plans, in conjunction with management, detailing specific deliverables, timelines and accountability to resolve information security issue Our ideal candidate should have2+ years hands-on experience as an Information Security and Compliance at a leading security minded enterprise company Exceptional communication, planning and organizational skills to manage various SOC and PCI regulations, controls and audits. Previous ownership of a company's overall information security program, including policy definition, and information security awareness activities.

title: Senior Data Analyst

Strong Excel skills, including deep understanding of advanced formulas, pivot tables and charting/graphing capabilities. Experience in developing requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting, familiarity with data visualization tools, e.g. Tableau Strong communication skills and experience leading and coordinating broad business reviews.Skills/Attributes Desired 7+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role Expert in SQL.Why Centerfield? Competitive salary, and profit sharing bonus 401k match Award winning culture & unprecedented team spirit Take a break when you need it – unlimited PTO Fully stocked break rooms with drinks, snacks Paid volunteer days Monthly team games/competitions/catered lunches Team outings (Ball games, BBQ's, Parties, etc.) Toro the Bull Dog Mascot and Everyone's FriendSDL2017

title: Senior Product Engineer - Data Analyst
description: InterSources Inc provides intelligent Data Solutions, Software Technical Services and project implementation to clients across industries, domains and geographies across USA, Europe and Asia. Our Onshore Innovation Lab and Center of Excellence in San Francisco, along with creation of new products and business models, focuses on development in latest technologies.Requisition Title: Sr. Product Engineer – Data Analyst - Full TimeLanguage: ENCompanyLocation: San JoseState/Province: CaliforniaCountry: United StatesOrganization: USA > ApplicationsWork Location: San Jose - CA, USUS Office: San Jose, CaliforniaVacant position: YesWork experience level : 5-10 ExperiencedEducational level : MasterReason for closure without hire: Job profile change (job grade, experience, education)Requisition Type: Unlimited contractSchedule Type: Full TimeIntroductionThe client brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading Chipmakers – to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Wilton, CT, Chandler, AZ and San Jose, CA.Our client is seeking highly motivated and talented individuals to join our innovative team of engineers and business professionals to accelerate our leadership in delivering design and Manufacturing solutions to our customers. It is the worldwide leader in computational lithography; Brion's Tachyon enables a unique set of capabilities that address the interrelated challenges of design, Photomask making and wafer patterning for semiconductor manufacturing.Job MissionAre you ready for the challenge? Do you want to be part of a team that's changing the way the semiconductor industry operates and opening the gates from “can’t do” to “can do”?Our client is seeking highly motivated and talented individuals to join our innovative team of engineers and business professionals to accelerate our leadership in delivering design and Manufacturing solutions to our customers. It is the worldwide leader in computational lithography; The Tachyon enables a unique set of capabilities that address the interrelated challenges of design, Photomask making and wafer patterning for semiconductor manufacturing.Job DescriptionThis position reports to our FAB Product Engineering Manager and works with the team to solve the challenge of shrinking in critical dimensions from 14nm, and below. Responsibility includes develop and deploy Process Window Optimization products to drive the scanner control solutions to enable our customers to achieve operation excellence in high volume manufacturing environment.Process Window Optimization products enable yield improvement by applying the models and metrology data. Product engineers are the bridge between R&D and customer applications. You will own the application requirements for new products and/or new features, application development, and highly technical 2nd line product support.Product engineers play a key role in shaping and directing product growth and development. You will interact with customers to gain understanding of their technical requirements, effectively translate these requirements onto new product capabilities, conduct new product feasibility studies working with R&D, support ASML’s on-site customer support engineers, and be responsible for new product introductions including educating on-site engineers about new products.EducationM.S. and above in electrical engineering, physics, chemical engineering, IC manufacturing, or process technology related fieldsExperience 2-3 year of experience related to advanced semiconductor Photolithography Strong software skills, familiarity with at least one scripting language for the application such as R, Python, or MATLAB On-job experience in developing data analysis and processing scripts Ability to read scripts from others and make modifications or improvementsDesired Technical Skill On the job experience in wafer fab data analysis for improvement of FDC, APC and SPC Working knowledge of statistical analysis and machine learning on large volume of data and data driven decisions Experience in modeling and simulation, able to develop physics based or empirical models, proficiency in math A strong lithography background with in-depth understanding of imaging, focus, overlay, and Metrology On-the job accomplishment in developing innovative ways (not standard documented procedure) to solving real application issues (not hardware defects)Personal Skills Experience and strong skills in defining, executing, and concluding independent studies based on high level goals, attention to detail Ability to influence others by presenting objective argument backed by data, giving constructive feedbacks, and building consensus and pushing for progress towards positive directions Possess the ability to work effectively with people in different organizations and different regions, with different specialty and skill levelsContext Of The PositionPHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENTThis position primarily works in an office environment. It requires frequent sitting, standing and walking. Daily use of a computer is required. May stand for extended periods when facilitating meetings.The physical demands of the position described herein are essential functions of the job and employees must be able to successfully perform these tasks for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made for those individuals with real or perceived disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job described.Please send your resume to anu at intersourcesinc dot com provided by Dice Senior Product Engineer - Data Analyst,

title: Web Analyst - Platform
description: Job Description The Web Analyst is responsible for enabling a data-driven approach for Nexon’s global game platform. You will help to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), identify tracking needs, collect data and investigate data patterns within the entire platform. You will also be involved in the project development process to help define project KPIs and set up tracking strategies alongside the producers and design team. You will also work closely with platform engineers to support tag implementation.   What You Can Expect To Do In Your New Gig:   Define KPIs and tracking needs for each team and projects in order to gather valuable data for Platform. Create tracking strategies and work closely with engineers in the implementation of tags to ensure the right data is being measured. Build dashboards to monitor KPI trends and help improve team’s performance. Deliver reports and data-driven recommendations to evaluate current services and find opportunities to improve services. Keep up to date on industry analytic trends and help the team utilize analytic solutions to remain competitive in the game space.   Skills & Requirements   Your qualifications include: 4+ years of data analyst or web analytics experience Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Understanding of user-centered design Familiarity using analytics solutions such as Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics. Experience using tagging management solutions. Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, and Metric Insights. Ability to pull data using SQL queries.   We also like to see: Able to use split testing to compare page variants. Experience with web, mobile, and PC application tracking.

title: Senior Data Analyst - eCommerce
description: Senior Data Analyst - eCommerceSan Francisco, CA$100,000-$120,000The CompanyThis emerging Direct to Consumer eCommerce brand is looking to add a Sr. Data Analyst to join the team. They have seen great success through their direct-to consumer model and are ready to bring on a skilled analyst to help continue that growth.THE ROLEWhat you'll do Be the go-to SQL expert in the company. Collaborate with operations, marketing, engineering, medical, and fulfillment teams to identify opportunity areas, translate them into structured analyses, and generate actionable insights Build intuitive dashboards to empower other team members with actionable data Design A/B tests and analyze results to inform strategic decision making Make conclusions from your analysis, present your results, and advocate for proposed next steps to key decision makersAbout You 3-5 years of demonstrated success in a role that required quantitative analysis, synthesizing insights, and using data to support strategic decisions. Confident enough in your analytical skills to take the lead on all things analytics with little oversite or supervision. At least 4 years' experience using either Python or R to build out predictive models. You will need to be the expert on these models, and need to have experience building models to predict LTV and churn, etc.Experience with data visualization tools (Looker or Tableau) and the ability (and desire!) to build out dashboards. Ideally you have worked as part of a large analytics team and understand advanced analytics best practices. Startup experience (you know what kind of hustle is takes working at a scrappy startup-and it excites you!) is a must.Ability to work cross functionally and support teams across marketing, sales, operations, etc.You are a data translator-you can take even the most complex algorithm and explain it clearly to a non-technical audience.Passion for beauty and skincare is a huge plus!BenefitsCompetitive Salary + benefitsHow To ApplyPlease register your interest by sending your CV to Sonia Manssen via the Apply link on this page.KeywordsMarketing Analytics | SQL | Statistics | Consumer Insights | Retail | eCommerce | Tableau | Analytics | B2C | Direct to Consumer | Lift Test | Attribution Modeling | Regression Modeling | R | SAS | Stata | Looker | a/b testing | Segmentation | Acquisition | Retention | Data Science | Python | R | LTV |

title: IT Application Analyst
description: Prime Healthcare is seeking candidates for IT Payroll Application Analyst positions with experience in Lawson’s Human Capital Management (HCM) modules (i.e. payroll, benefits, absence management). The candidate/s will be responsible for all aspects of the assigned Lawson application and any other supporting systems. Reporting to the Project Manager/IT Director, this position partners with Payroll Directors and their customers to analyze work process designs, flows, and improvements to leverage the return on technological capabilities. It requires knowledge of Lawson's HR, PA, BN, PR, LP modules with the primary focus being active use of the system, Implementations as well as support and maintenance. The HRIS Analyst also supports HRIS upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned.Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field or equivalent work experience Three to five years of HRIS or HR generalist experience required Ability to travel up to 50% Strong knowledge of Lawson’s Human Capital Management (HCM) modules including Payroll, Absence Management, ESS, MSS, Crystal Report Writing, and Add-ins. Experience with Lawson HCM system implementation a plus, preferably in a healthcare setting Strong understanding of PR processes and data, including eligibility and enrollment rules, and benefits procedures Experience with HRIS database design, structure, functions, processes and tools Thorough knowledge of MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Knowledge of Kronos or JbDev time clocking system a plus Knowledge of developing interfaces with third party vendors a plus Must enjoy working in a fast-paced and challenging environment with many growth opportunities offered through diverse projects Effective organizational and interpersonal skills including written and verbal communication skills       Other preferred qualifications Three years or more of project management experience Experience in data conversion techniques and methodologies

title: Credit Analyst
description: The Credit Analyst will review and analyze current credit data and financial statements to identify and assess credit risk. This position will assist in spreading financial statements, developing global cash flows, reviewing credit reports, historical payment performance and preparing periodic loan reviews and credit recommendations. Approval, modification and risk grade recommendations.QUALIFICATIONS: Experience as a Credit Analyst at a financial institution requiredProficient spreading financial statements

Magazine as one of the fast-growing companies in the US and one of the "most interesting ad-tech upstarts of the year" by Business Insider.We are changing how industry leaders and consumers think about TV, and we're looking for a Lead Data Analyst who is not afraid to challenge the status quo and would like to make a meaningful impact on our innovative products. title: Lead BI Analyst
description: As the Lead Data Analyst at Manduka, you'll play a key role in analyzing our unique data and driving business decisions across the company. You'll work closely with all business departments to identify data needs, create ETL pipelines, and build rich reporting and analysis. Our primary system of record is Netsuite, and our primary BI tool is Tableau. In your role, you'll work to become familiar with NetSuite, along with other internal system databases, in order to create theappropriate data sources in Tableau for analysis. You'll help understand data needs from differentdepartments, create and maintain the key data sources, and build influential reporting across Manduka. To be successful, you'll need to be comfortable with: Relational databases (setting schema, building tables, indexing keys, etc.)Tableau and Tableau Server (creating dashboards, maintaining automated reports, etc.)Data access management (creating user accounts, setting permissions, monitoring access logs,etc.)ETLs (creating and maintaining data pipelines, writing transformations in SQL) ResponsibilitiesCreate Tableau reports and dashboards.Manage Tableau Server, and our data warehouse.Empower users to add and analyze new data sources.Identify process improvements that can be solved by leveraging Tableau Requirements2+ years experience with Tableau and/or similar BI tools.2+ years experience with Netsuite and/or similar ERP systems.Proficiency in SQL.RecommendationsFamiliarity with Netsuite's API.Profiency in Python or another scripting language.Experience in maintaining production databases.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst Location: Vernon, CAAt Reformation, data is the core of what we do. We are looking for a leader to drive our data and business intelligence strategy. This person will be designing and developing data systems as well as building automated reports for the purpose of tracking key sales metrics, sales and customer performance, forecasting, sales productivity and pipeline metrics. You will use your strong skills in data, business intelligence tools and report design to build best practice reporting & dashboards to increase efficiency and drive improvements in sales processes. The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will work with the BI tools including Big Query, Google Data Suite, and our CRM systems. This role requires an individual with technical background and understanding of sales reporting, sales analytics, data management, business intelligence solutions, superior communication skills and the ability to work and collaborate with key business partners. To be most effective, this person will need to be able to work both strategically and in the details.What You’ll Do: Own Company data analytics, reporting and data dictionary Produce and deliver standardized and custom business intelligence dashboards to support business performance metrics Support and develop data analysis frameworks that will support daily/weekly/monthly operational reporting and executive dashboards Ensure consistent approach to sales reporting globally including report presentation, data consistency, communication and delivery Analyze and present data to high level decision-makers at the company Identify data requirements for specific project or report requests. Includes identifying data mapping and definitions required to fulfill requests Serve as the conduit between the business owners and the engineering team Work with technology team upstream to ensure that systems are set up to capture business-impacting data; focus on data as a product Work with key business partners to understand dashboard requirements and determine consistent presentation method that will help with business needs Develop and maintain data dictionary to ensure consistency across systems, reports and teams Understanding of business intelligence tools and drive consistent usage and understanding of report delivery tools Understand business drivers and strategic business vision and implement reporting solutions that support business requirements; have a keen focus on output and data visualization geared toward driving insight and action Train the trainers; teach company to self-serve using available data toolsWhat You’ll Need: Bachelor's degree 5+ years of experience in BI, sales reporting and analytics Analytical, strategic thinker with vision, with the ability to execute on priorities Ability to effectively work under pressure and to meet challenging targets Strong communication and presentation skills Strong interpersonal and influencing skills, with the ability to build credible relationships with multiple functions Microsoft Excel Big Query, Google Data Studio SQL knowledge Ability to identify and pursue new improvement opportunities in line with business plans Requires an excellent understanding of standard business practices related to Sales OperationsWho you are: You thrive in a fast-paced, results and team-oriented environment. You LOVE being hands-on and solving problems - you don’t see this as a task; it’s a passion. You have a passion for sustainability and want to be part of a team driving eco-goodness within fashion. You’re the type of team member who is willing to pick up slack and do the unglamorous tasks to help grow the company. Eager to be an integral part of the team that defines the culture of Reformation.   Benefits & Perks: Health, vision, and dental insurance for eligible employees Paid vacation, sick, holidays & volunteer time-off for eligible employees Mission based company + casual and entrepreneurial work environment Clothing discount, dog-friendly office, company events + parties and much more   To Apply: Please submit your resume and a short cover letter telling us about yourself and why you are a great fit for Reformation! The Reformation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status

Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Avitas Systems delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of digital industrial.Avitas Systems offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. San Ramon, BostonGE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening.

title: Marketing Analyst
description: Marketing AnalystOne of The Sage Group's clients is looking for looking for a Marketing Analyst to lead and own all analytics and reporting for the Marketing function. This candidate will work directly with the marketing and data teams to offer insights into the performance of the marketing and sales funnel across the various channels, stages and campaigns. They will develop an analytics framework to identify and measure KPIs, build models and methodologies to standardize metrics, and create reports and dashboards to track them. This candidate will proactively analyze the data to detect trends, patterns, opportunities and risks and communicate them to the leadership team with dashboards and regular reporting. Company is a well-funded 3 year old consumer product company providing products that make a big difference for young families, specifically for women and babies.                                           **Only considering local candidates at this time** Job Responsibilities: Analyze the data architecture, identify gaps in marketing data and campaign tracking and collaborate with the data team to fill these gaps Create a reporting framework by identifying KPIs across the various channels and campaigns and implement real-time dashboards and reports Develop ways to measure marketing attribution, contribution and ROI Work with the marketing team members to identify reporting needs and develop reporting requirements for BI dashboards Assist with market segmentation, look alike modeling, campaign analysis and optimization. Generate compelling insights and provide actionable data to the marketing team Be a thought leader and expert in marketing analytics Requirements: 3+ years experience as an attribution analyst or sales strategy consultant Fairly knowledgeable in inbound and outbound marketing campaigns and tactics A strong understanding of lead-scoring, segmentation, revenue and pipeline attribution, revenue influence and ROI Expert in Google & Facebook Analytics Strong in Google AdWords & Google Tag Manager Strong understanding of growth channels like paid media, email, website and affiliates Exceptional analytics skills - you ask the right questions, define the relevant metrics, collect and process the required data, and present the conclusions in a digestible format for varied audiences Expert in Excel, analytics tactics like Vlookups, pivot tables and joins. SQL knowledge is a big plus. Working experience with attribution tools (E.g., Adobe, GA 360, VIQ, LeadsRx etc.) Basic understanding of landing pages, digital marketing and advertising Ability to package data into relevant insights and communicate them effectively Self-motivated, and persuasive, with a warm and nurturing personality Duration: 6 months/Contract-to-hire Location: Mountain View, CA

title: Data Analyst - Contracts
description: Elevate’s Customer, a Leading Global Payments Company, is looking for a Contracts Management System Data Analyst/Paralegal to work full-time at its offices for eight weeks to assist with data cleanup efforts as they prepare the Company's contracts to migrate from one system to another.The right applicant will assist with preparing the Salesforce/Apttus environment with regard to contract data clean-up, rationalization, mapping, file preparation, validation, etc. (accounts, parent/child agreements, amendments, etc.). This individual will also participate in the data mapping during our “planning and construction” phase of implementation to ensure our new Apttus environment will be successful.You Might Be The Right Person If You Have experience working as a contracts analyst/administrator. Pay attention to detail – find and correct record data matching specified criteria. Have a solid understanding of database concepts & data structures (data types, object references, primary key, etc.). Have stamina and the ability to examine tens of thousands of rows in Excel spreadsheets. Have the ability to work with current technical and process/legal experts to classify and correct/prep data for migration. Work well independently as well as with teams. Have the ability to juggle multiple projects and demands, and the ability to learn quickly.Are able to work independently while exercising great judgment and attention to detail. Are looking to be a part of the next generation of legal services and influence the way these services are delivered, consumed, and measured. Specifically You Will Help create a valid list of vendor codes.Help ensure a current and accurate of vendors. Help ensure all contracts will have the correct association mapping for Parent and child agreements (e.g. MSAs and SoWs). Help resolve orphaned amendments & addendums by locating the correct parent contract prior to content migration. Help identify the latest executed contract document when multiple exist. Help identify unneeded/expired agreements. Help identify existing/copies of agreements to prevent duplication of content during the contract migration phase. Help research/prepare contracts from network drives--removing duplicates between subfolders to avoid duplication. Help in renaming contract files on network drives to match standard convention (i.e., Party Name_Agreement Type_Effective Date.*) Help in preparing import files and mapping files for import into new system. Help in validating and correcting import files test loaded into new system. Experience Intermediate+ level in Excel – V-lookups, formulas, data validation, filtering working with large volumes of data. Basic understanding of contract lifecycle management process & data. Tech savvy – ability to quickly learn to navigate SAP CLM and Salesforce, run reports, open/evaluate record data & associated files. Detailed contract analysis, ability to review contract language to ensure SAP CLM documents are being mapped correctly into the new system. Qualifications Bachelor's degree. Elevate’s Achievements And Distinctions IncludeElevate is the law company. We provide consulting, technology and services to law departments and law firms. Our global team of lawyers, engineers, consultants and business experts improve efficiency, quality and outcomes for customers worldwide. Ranked on the Inc. 5000 list of Fastest-Growing Private Companies two years in a row. Ranked as a top Global Services Provider by Chambers & Partners three years in a row. Lead Partner of the FT Innovative Lawyers Awards. title: Anti-Piracy Data Analyst
description: Clarivate Analytics clients are the trailblazers and risk takers who come up with life-changing ideas. We’re looking for our own trailblazers to help us keep providing clients some of the world’s most trusted brands, spanning scientific and academic research, patent analytics, pharmaceutical and biotech intelligence and IP management.We’re an independent owned company with a rich heritage and a bold entrepreneurial mission. If you’re excited by the thought of helping people and organizations go from new ideas to life-changing innovations faster, we’re excited to consider you for a position at Clarivate. MarkMonitor, part of Clarivate Analytics, is the global leader in enterprise brand protection and offers comprehensive solutions and services that safeguard brands, reputation, and revenue from online risks. With end-to-end solutions that address the growing threats of online fraud, brand abuse, and unauthorized channels, MarkMonitor enables a secure Internet for businesses and their customers. The company’s exclusive access to data combined with its patented real-time prevention, detection and response capabilities provide wide-ranging protection to the ever-changing online risks faced by brands today.Opportunity SummaryAs our Data Analyst, you will have the awesome responsibility of leveraging large data sets, turning analysis into actionable intelligence and reporting for MarkMonitor customers, sales, and services within the Anti-Piracy department. Working with Fortune 500 clients and internal stakeholders in a collaborative team atmosphere, you will be responsible for ensuring the integrity of client delivered data and quality of client projects. Additionally, you will be integral to generating weekly, monthly and custom ad-hoc reports and data-driven analysis.Role ResponsibilitiesGenerate standard and customized reports;Perform quality analysis to ensure data integrity;Coordinate with other team members to solve ad hoc requests;Review client deliverables and data to ensure a high level of quality and accuracy;Formulate and effectively communicate data-driven recommendations;Synthesize data into meaningful deliverables;Communicate clearly to internal and/or external clients;Assist management and team members as needed.Minimum RequirementsBachelors Degree in Business or Computer Science or equivalent work experience;5+ years of professional experience in an office environment;Mid to advanced level Microsoft Excel skills/knowledge (including pivot tables);Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills;Excellent verbal and written communications skills;Excellent time/deadline management skills;Proficiency in Structure Query Language skills/knowledge;Self-motivated, flexible, and adaptable to client & organizational changes;Ability to work independently with minimal supervision;Experience working in a globally geo-diverse company.Winning QualificationsIntermediate SQL programming skills;Strong experience interacting with external clients;Understanding of methods and trends of the Internet;Passionate about film, TV, video games and music;Working knowledge of DMCA and applicable copyright laws;Working knowledge of file-sharing technologies;The ability to leap large data sets in a single bound;Last, but not least, the soft skills: Detail-oriented, remain highly effective under pressure, and capable of meeting tight deadlines.About MarkMonitorMarkMonitor—the world leader in brand protection—safeguards the revenues and reputations of more than half of the Fortune 100 brands in the rapidly evolving digital world. Using a SaaS delivery model, advanced data technology, and domain expertise, MarkMonitor addresses Domain, Brand, Piracy, and Fraud risks that brands face due to the web's anonymity, global reach, and shifting consumption patterns for digital content, physical goods, and services.Headquartered in San Francisco, MarkMonitor, part of Clarivate Analytics maintains the autonomy of a small company, with the additional benefits of stability and extended customer reach that comes with being part of a large company. Thanks to our startup roots, we continue to be a fun, casual, and creative place to work, and continually attract people who are bright, ambitious, confident, and customer-focused with a strong desire to win. We hire the best, and, as part of Clarivate Analytics, are free of any hiring biases.It is the policy of Clarivate to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Clarivate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Network Affliate Analyst
description: It's great to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At First Place for Youth we’re committed to bringing passion and Client (Youth) focus to the business of making a meaningful impact. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to value our employees, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is investment in others. We value in creating an environment so that each one of us can succeed in our personal and professional goals.   JOB SUMMARY: The Network Affiliate Analyst is a member of the Evaluation and Learning Department team, and works in close partnership with staff within the Network Affiliate Department of First Place for Youth. This person provides data integrity, analysis, and reporting support to First Place for Youth network affiliate partners. Primary responsibilities of the Network Affiliate Analyst include building and maintaining the reporting infrastructure for the organization. This includes information system development and integration, use of Structured Query Language (SQL) to code and document scripts/ stored procedures, as well as developing reports within First Place for Youth’s performance management system, iLearning system and business intelligence software platforms (Qlik). The Network Affiliate Analyst provides some back-end maintenance of performance management and relational database systems (e.g. AWS or similar), and is also responsible for responding to data requests that require advanced reporting capabilities; conducting data quality activities that ensure accurate and appropriate use of data and quality control of database activities; producing data integrity reports; and working with program staff to correct any data errors. The Analyst performs data mining activities, develops database management system capabilities, and fine tunes existing databases and data systems. The Analyst is responsible for producing data reports and analyses for Network Affiliate partners, ensuring the quality of the organization’s data, producing datasets for external evaluation projects, providing data entry support to direct service staff, and maintaining confidential data files. The Network Affiliate Analyst reports to the Vice President of Evaluation and LearningWhat is the Network Affliate Analyst expected to do:Create new SQL reports within Apricot and QlikTroubleshoot, manage and modify existing advanced SQL Reports in Apricot, Qlik and the Algorhythm ilearning system Assign and manage Apricot, Qlik and other Network Affiliate user accounts. Producing and disseminating all Network Affiliate reports (in Apricot and Qlik), including operations, performance management and data quality reports Collaborate with Network Affiliate staff and managers to ensure accuracy and reliability of agency data, and full compliance with internal and external data standardsExplore and facilitate the development of cross-system data transfer procedures, including data interface, migration and export projectsImplement reporting integration and diversification projectsProvide consultation and oversight of on-going Apricot back-end system restructuring and refinement efforts Attend Network Affiliate Meetings and site visits as needed Work collaboratively with other members of the Evaluation and Learning teamOther duties as assignedQUALIFICATIONS:  Masters’ degree in Computer Science, Stats or Applied Analysis field with minimum three years of experience OR Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 5 years’ experience and strong applied knowledge of SQL and relational database development and management.Experience providing remote database and data reporting support in a social service agency preferredComputer literacy with Windows, MS Office, Visio, Internet Explorer and other basic software applicationsStrong Microsoft Excel, Access, VBA, etc. performance management and business intelligence software experience desiredExtensive experience in the back-end maintenance of performance management and relational database systems, AWS (or similar)  and dimensional models. Knowledge of data migration and mining procedures Ability to effectively monitor numerous data related details and accurately identify any errors or missing information Ability to generate data reports that are fully accurate in a timely manner Ability to work well under pressure, multi-task, and handle complex situations in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a positive attitude, patience, and tact.Good to have : Advanced SQL skills, including complex joins, subqueries, common table expressions, and stored procedures. Advanced programming experience (Java, Python) Experience in creating dashboards or visualizations (Qlik/Tableau/D3) is preferred Use of version control (Git, SVN or other tools / methodologies) is a plusBasic experience in ETL development, Applications (Talend, Informatica, Pentaho); Parameterization; Scripting Languages (Python, Perl, etc.); etc.Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies is a plus.

title: Security Governance Analyst
description: Western Asset views information security as one of the top risks that the Firm must manage & has developed a program to identify, assess and address the information security challenges facing the Firm. This is achieved through deploying industry-leading technologies and a comprehensive program to safeguard Western’s information systems, assets & data.As an experienced Information Security Analyst you will be a key player in this program, responsible for ensuring that the governance and risk assessment elements of the program are operational and mature, providing key input to both the day-to-day operation of essential security oversight while expanding the scope and effectiveness of the controls.With broad involvement in the security program, this role is focused specifically on: Risk assessment: conducting risk assessments and interfacing with the enterprise risk program. Holding risk owners accountable for remediation actions. Monitoring and assessing IT risk.Collaboration: interacting with all parts of the organization including parent company and affiliated companies on cyber practices and projectsThird party security: Conducting due diligence of IT and business partner vendorsSecurity initiative coordination: coordination of security and business initiatives that impact Western’s security. description: SummaryThe Data/Analytics Architect will be accountable in the full lifecycle of reporting solutions providing business customers with strategic, tactical, and operational insights. The individual will be responsible for end to end solutions including strategy development, design patterns, product selection, technical implementation, and configuration of reporting solutions. The role will work with stakeholders and strategic partners to identify data warehousing and analytics requirements and opportunities. The individual will serve as the front-line resource in managing reporting requests and requirements for the Commercial organization. The individual will create and maintain the processes for deploying new reporting solutions and functionality into production, enhancing current production solutions and providing consistent quality service levels to internal and external customers. This role will interact regularly with business customers to capture and understand reporting and data change requests, help define and clarify requirements, define and propose appropriate solutions, and provide guidance for development of the reporting solution to the development team. The individual will perform quality review of developed solutions and ensure proper user acceptance. This role requires extensive collaboration within Sales Operations, as well as with cross-functional colleagues in Marketing, Market Access, Sales, Finance, and Compliance.ResponsibilitiesMaintain the production Business Intelligence products and solutions, including resolving production issues and responding quickly to priority problems.Perform intake review and assist in prioritization of reporting requests.Analyze reporting change requests and define technical specifications for efficient development.Identify opportunities for self-service and educate the business on self-service capabilities.Analyze data and data requirements regarding reporting solutions, ensure data quality and match-back to core systems transaction results.Maintain documentation of reporting solutions, data mapping, data dictionary, and reporting standards.Perform quality review of new and existing reporting solutions. Coordinate end user review and acceptance of the developed solutions.Support IT goals and objectives by working closely with management team to deliver value to the business.Ensure resources are available for reporting activities.Ensure available data and reporting solutions meet customer needs.Meet established key milestones related to assigned major projects.Steward of presentation and data consumption standards.Participate in developing and ensuring compliance with architecture principles and standards for the various systems and components based on design patterns.Leads Product Selection process for Data/Reporting/Analytics tools and processes. QualificationsB.S. Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or similar subject.15+ years in Information Technology.8+ years developing reporting or technical solutions (i.e. data warehouses, ETL, stored procedures, data marts, reports, dashboards).Thorough understanding of modern data warehouse architecture and business intelligence.Thorough understanding of systems integration and enterprise architecture principles.Extensive experience with industry leading BI tools (e.g.Tableau, ClikView, etc.).Working experience with end user Report design, development and implementation.Demonstrated ability to drive to deadlines, balancing multiple priorities, and ensuring quality standards.Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and innovative thinking skills.Excellent organization and prioritization skills with strong ability to multi-task and shift focus as necessary to meet deadlines.Excellent interpersonal listening, verbal, and written communication skills. Ability to communicate technical details to technical and non-technical resources. Ability to interact effectively with people at all levels and functions across the business.Able to communicate complex messages, accurately understand specific needs of intended audience and tailor communication accordingly, detail oriented with ability to understand big picture impact.Able to work collaboratively across expertise areas and functions; seeks to advance higher goals; highly regarded across stakeholders both at senior and junior levels; inspires trust at all levels; patient-centric, and passionate about innovation and discovery.Demonstrated working knowledge and understanding of pharmaceutical sales data (e.g. IMS Health, Symphony Healthcare Analytics, etc.), marketing and sales operations, financial data, business principles, processes and technology.Demonstrated working knowledge of healthcare organization landscape, relationships and affiliations, etc.Working knowledge of data modeling and various database applications (e.g. Netezza, Oracle).Demonstrated proficiency in writing SQL queries to answer business questions.Demonstrated extensive computer proficiency with desktop software in a Windows environment including Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel (VBA) and Microsoft PowerPoint.Demonstrated excellence with organizational, planning and cross-functional project management, written and verbal communication, and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail, personal initiative and ability to work independently in a dynamic fast paced environment with minimal supervision.Demonstrated ability to proactively evaluate existing strategies and recommend changes, when appropriate.

title: Data Engineer
description: DescriptionData EngineerIn this role, you will support Tesla’s firmware organization in building out data pipelines that will utilize large-scale data sets from our vehicle fleets to quantify product performance, and thereby inform engineering efforts. You will collaborate with teams developing our data platforms, vehicle firmware, service, reliability, and others to continually expand insights into our products and improve the customer experience.Role And Responsibilities Build data pipelines to support large scale data analysis and data visualizations. Develop methods for analysis of vehicle usage trends at scale. Provide development teams insight into vehicle usage & performance in real world environments. Generate reports for development, management, and executive teams to inform decision-making. Collaborate across teams to gain insights into how products will perform for customers, and advocate continual improvement.Required Experience B.S. or higher degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or similar. 2+ years’ experience working in a data engineering or analyst role. Proficiency in: Python, SQL, data visualization. Experience with ETL pipelines, database design and implementation. Experience with big data ecosystem (Spark, Hadoop, etc.), software development best practices, data analysis at scale. Ability to identify and communicate data-driven insights efficiently. A passion for data! Nice To Have Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB. Experience with Airflow. Experience with Tableau, and/or other visualization libraries. Experience with front-end development.

title: Financial Analyst
description: Job DescriptionThe Financial Analyst reports to the Director of Business Planning and Analytics and will interface with senior leadership in the organization. The primary focus of this position will be supporting the Vehicle Purchasing team, working as a business partner to maximize financial performance in this area of the business. The Finance Analyst will be responsible for data mining, ad–hoc analysis, financial modelling to support operations, research and extensive data analysis.The Financial Analyst must possess knowledge of ad-hoc reporting through advanced Excel work, SalesForce, Access Databases, SQL Server, Oracle Business Intelligence, large data extracts through ODBC connections, and ability to pick up new data structures quickly. This position will work with large amounts of “Big Data,” so comfort with data is essential for success. Along with the reporting/data responsibilities, this individual must be able to communicate effectively with operations in determining reporting needs and standardization.Essential FunctionsOperational Performance & Best Business Practices Learn the operations, commercial and financial aspects of the business to be able to pull relevant data to optimize performance. Become completely conversant with all technical/operational aspects of the reporting systems within an accelerated timeframe. Understand and identify more efficient work processes, working closely with the VP of Vehicle Purchasing and other business leaders. Function as project leader to manage a broad range of adhoc projects. Act as single point of contact for all Vehicle reporting related inquiries from the business. Provide documentation (where needed) for training , modifications, and solutions in regards to the reports developed. Support all departments interacting with the reporting systems: Operations, Commercial, and Accounting. Participate in cross functional and cross divisional teams; develop strong interpersonal relationships and resolve issues jointly. Develop custom ad-hoc reporting from the different operational databases through Excel, Access, SalesForce. SQL and Oracle Business Intelligence. Must have advanced knowledge of Excel and excellent oral and written skills to be successful in this role. Must be able to tell a story with the data. Must be able to work independently, with minimal supervision. Interpersonal ContactsDirect contact with Director of Business Planning and Analytics, VP Vehicle Purchasing, COO, Sales, Executive Management, IT, and Finance/Accounting employees. Communicates via face-to-face, telephone, and electronic interaction.Qualifications Bachelor Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related field, or equivalent experience. Strong communications skills. Must be able to “Tell the Story” with data, and present to all levels of the organization. Highly motivated and a self-starter. Able to learn through training, experimentation in test environments and shadowing personnel. Must have organizational skills, analytical skills and research skills in resolving, at times, complex problems. PLEASE NOTE: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required.All U.S. applicants must be 18 years of age or older and all Canada applicants must be 16 years of age or older.Schnitzer Steel Industries, Inc. participates in e-verify for all U.S. new hires.Schnitzer Steel Industries, Inc. administers a pre-employment drug screen and background check for U.S. new hires.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Schnitzer Steel Industries, Inc. does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, marital status, disability status, national origin or ancestry, veteran status, age, prior industrial injury, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other protected status under local, state or federal law.
