title: Data Quality Analyst
description: Overview Of ResponsibilitiesReporting to the Director of Research, working full-time, 8:30am to 5:00pm, you will be contributing to the success of SCS by: Developing and implementing strategies for monitoring, trouble-shooting, ensuring data quality and verifying that new data can be added easily, with attention to accuracy, and links to existing data. Working proactively and collaboratively with others to plan and implement policies and processes to support ad-hoc and ongoing data reporting and analysis requirements. Reviewing and cleansing data within our client and services management system (Salesforce) and our volunteer management and fundraising system (Live Impact). Performing after-the-fact Quality Assurance reviews as well as cleaning and reviewing of data for loading into multiple systems and meeting reporting requirements. Assisting with and managing formal (survey) and informal (interviews, focus groups, check-in surveys, etc.) data collection efforts to ensure high quality administration and analysis. Working across all programs operated by SCS, such as coordinating with client services leaders for both food distribution and financial assistance to review issues of data quality to improve processes, systems, or training to address issues of internal data quality; working with the finance team to resolve data issues with donations, grants, or other sources of financial records; and coordinating with the development, communication, and grant writing/reporting teams to review and address data quality issues around reporting, outreach, and planning. Entering and maintaining high-quality data within our client and services management system (Salesforce) and our volunteer management and fundraising system (LiveImpact). Supporting the full range of SCS programs and activities, including working with the client services teams responsible for food distribution and financial assistance to ensure accurate and efficient tracking of program activities and outcomes; working with the finance team to ensure that information related to funding and funding sources is accurately tracked and readily available; and coordinating with the development, communication, and grant writing/reporting teams to review and address data needs to support reporting, outreach, and planning.Qualifications / Required SkillsYou would be a great match for this role if you are: Very organized and have great attention to detail. Dependable and self-motivated. Experienced with database management. Excellent IT skills are essential and a familiarity with Salesforce is desirable. (Familiarity with a scripting language, e.g. Python, or data manipulation tools, e.g. R, is a plus.) Able to work independently with minimal supervision. Able to prioritize workload, balance multiple projects and perform in a fast paced, frequently changing environment. Proficient in Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Access. Able to review and interpret financial documents. Open to learning new things and taking on projects outside of current core competencies. Skilled with both verbal and written communications and able to work collaboratively to resolve problems with diplomacy and professionalism. A college graduate with a Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent work experience developing relevant skills).Founded in 1970, Sunnyvale Community Services (SCS) is an independent, nonprofit emergency assistance agency in the heart of Silicon Valley. Our mission is to prevent homelessness and hunger in our local community. We provide financial aid, food, case management, referrals, and other support, helping to stabilize families and support their goals of self-sufficiency. Our assistance prevents homelessness, hunger, malnutrition, and untreated medical conditions.

title: Data Analyst
description: Hulu is a premium streaming TV destination that seeks to captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking and embracing fun. It’s a mission that takes some serious smarts, intense curiosity and determination to be the best. Come be part of the team that’s powering play.SummaryHulu’s Reporting and Data Access Team is seeking a Data Analyst who will be an exceptional addition to our Data and Metrics organization. As a Data Analyst at Hulu, you will be responsible for turning data into information, information into insights and insights into key business decisions, that steer the strategic direction of the company. The right person for this role thrives in a fast-pace environment, loves problem-solving and is a strong communicator. If you are someone who gains personal satisfaction from transforming data into knowledge for business insights, then this is a great role for you.What You’ll DoBuild data visualizations and cross-functional reporting that conveys key performance metrics, significant trends, and relationships across multiple data sourcesIn conjunction with Program Management, act as the main liaison between diverse business units reliant upon data and associated metrics and the relevant engineering teams within Hulu’s technology organization.Use internal and external analytics tools, SQL, scripting languages to access and analyze multivariate dataInterface with engineering and business units to drive key operational metrics and KPI/s for enabling business success and value-addition within data and analytics domain.Translate business functional requirements into technical specifications for the associated engineering teams, by working with the relevant program managers.Develop and foster a culture of transparent dialogue with the business community and engineering leadership for strategic agility in decision making.Provide first line of triage and troubleshooting expertise to business units and key stakeholders regarding data questions.Collaborate with Data teams and Program Management to design process improvements for a diverse set of internal and external tools, responsible for accessing and delivering business data.Operationalize support requests across the business community by mapping to the relevant data teams with specific guidance on success criteria and relative priority.Provide educational and training resources for help with reporting and data access.WHAT TO BRINGA Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, MIS, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, etc.4+ years of experience as an analyst in a data and analytics domain Jedi SQL skills for complex querying, analysis, performance optimization, and persisting dataStrong understanding of data warehousing concepts, design, modeling and familiarity with data engineeringExperience working in a ‘big-data’ environment (Hadoop, Hive, Presto, BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.)Experience working with web analytic tools (particularly: Google Analytics, Google Search Council, etc.)Experience with data visualization coupled with strong story telling skills for technical and non-technical audiencesStrong working knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, MicroStrategy, etc.Experience taking vague requirements and transforming them into crisp deliverablesIntense curiosity, high intellectual and analytic horsepower, relentless pursuit of data-driven insightsDemonstrated ability to work across technical and business stakeholdersStrong motivation and ability to work independently and as a team leaderAbility to mentor both technically and professionally junior team membersExceptional written and oral communication skillsEffective presentation skills across a diverse audienceAbility to identify and appropriately escalate issues to leadership for directionNICE-TO-HAVESFamiliarity with Data Science concepts a plus

title: Improvement Data Analyst - Strategic Improvement Core Operations (BUS INTEL SPEC 3) - 16222
description: At UCSF Health, our mission of innovative patient care, advanced technology and pioneering research is redefining what’s possible for the patients we serve – a promise we share with the professionals who make up our team.Ranked by U.S. News & World Report as the number one hospital in California – and among the top five in the country – UCSF Health is committed to providing the most rewarding work experience while delivering the best care available anywhere. In an environment that allows for continuous learning and opportunities for professional growth, UCSF Health offers the ideal atmosphere in which to best use your skills and talents.Department DescriptionThe Strategic Improvement Office is accountable for driving strategic and value programs within UCSF Health to support a culture of continuous process improvement (CPI), innovation, high value care and a learning health system.Job SummaryThe Improvement Analyst position in UCSF Health’s Strategic Improvement Office is responsible for assisting the transformation of clinical and operational processes by accessing relevant health system data sources (including APeX EMR data) and providing analytic insight of areas of improvement. The Improvement Analyst brings analytic skills to bear on largely unexplored or misunderstood financial, quality and operational data to develop insights on where and how to focus organizational or departmental improvement efforts, and to evaluate if/how improvement efforts are affecting performance indicators and outcomes.They use knowledge of financial, clinical systems and industry practices to turn generalized opportunities into specific tactics, and advises operational leaders and their teams on how to connect key metrics to the work performed. In collaboration with improvement teams, the Improvement Analyst will be part of a systematic approach to enhancing the quality of patient care, using evidence-based practices and critical thought to improve systems, processes, and patient outcomes.The Improvement Analyst has strong technical skills with a variety of data sources and architectures, has been involved with complex projects, and has experience to understand and communicate with non-technical users. Projects involve relationships with a variety of teams, including physicians, nurses and frontline staff, Business Intelligence and IT, Quality, Population Health Analytics and Decision Support Services: interest and excitement in partnership across the continuum is critical.Healthcare reform and systems management paradigms have driven a substantial increase in the variety and volume of data; this is a growth-oriented opportunity to implement healthcare analytics at UCSF Health and transform the way we deliver care.Required Qualifications Three to five years experience in business intelligence reporting, data mining, data analysis, and/or statistical analysisBachelor's degree in quantitative social science, management information systems, or related area, and / or equivalent combination of experience / trainingThorough knowledge of business intelligence functions, analytics, industry standards and best practicesHighly proficient in all MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access), database applications, and analytical software (such as Tableau, R, or others)Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to manage complex information, assess problems, and develop and effective solutionsStrong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey complex information in a clear, concise manner; ability to produce high-quality reports and documentationStrong interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with a broad range of professional and technical staffProven ability to serve as a technical resource providing advice and counsel on business intelligence issuesStrong initiative and ability to work independently as well as in a team environmentDetail oriented, with ability to manage time and organize competing prioritiesDiscretion, confidentiality, tact, and ability to deal with sensitive data involving patient health informationAbility to demonstrate excellent judgment, attention to process and detailThe flexibility to orient and work at all UCSF Medical Center locationsPreferred Qualifications Master’s degree in statistics, epidemiology, public health, operations research, computers/systems engineering or other relevant field OR equivalent work experienceCertified in at least one Epic Clarity module (preferred: Ambulatory or Inpatient)Thorough knowledge of relevant internal databases, BI applications and tools, such as APeX/EpicProficient in SQL programmingFamiliarity with health care environmentLicensure/Certification N/ALiving Pride StandardsService Excellence Demonstrates service excellence by following the Everyday PRIDE Guide with the UCSF Medical Center standards and expectations for communication and behavior. These standards and expectations convey specific behavior associated with the Medical Center’s values: Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Diversity and Excellence, and provide guidance on how we communicate with patients, visitors, faculty, staff, and students, virtually everyone, every day and with every encounter. These standards include, but are not limited to: personal appearance, acknowledging and greeting all patients and families, introductions using AIDET, managing up, service recovery, managing delays and expectations, phone standards, electronic communication, team work, cultural sensitivity and competency.Uses effective communication skills with patients and staff; demonstrates proper telephone techniques and etiquette; acts as an escort to any patient or family member needing directions; shows sensitivity to differences of culture; demonstrates a positive and supportive manner in which patients / families/ colleagues perceive interactions as positive and supportive. Exhibits team work skills to positively acknowledge and recognize other colleagues, and uses personal experiences to model and teach Living PRIDE standards.Exhibits tact and professionalism in difficult situations according to PRIDE Values and PracticesDemonstrates an understanding of and adheres to privacy, confidentiality, and security policies and procedures related to Protected Health Information (PHI) or other sensitive and personal information.Demonstrates an understanding of and adheres to safety and infection control policies and procedures.Assumes accountability for improving quality metrics associated with department/unit and meeting organizational/departmental targets. Work Environment Keeps working areas neat, orderly and clutter-free, including the hallways. Adheres to cleaning processes and puts things back where they belong. Removes and reports broken equipment and furniture.Picks up and disposes of any litter found throughout entire facility.Posts flyers and posters in designated areas only; does not post on walls, doors or windows.Knows where the Environment of Care Manual is kept in department; corrects or reports unsafe conditions to the appropriate departments.Protects the physical environment and equipment from damage and theft.The flexibility to orient and work at all UCSF Medical Center locations is required.Equal Employment OpportunityThe University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. Further information about the University of California, San Francisco, is available at diversity.ucsf.edu. UCSF seeks candidates whose skills, and personal and professional experience, have prepared them to contribute to our commitment to diversity and excellence, and the communities we serve.

title: Marketing Analyst
description: More than 200 million people come to Pinterest to discover and do what they love. The Consumer and Creator marketing team is committed to sharing the value of Pinterest with strategic audiences to deliver against the evolving business needs.We’re looking for an experienced Marketing Analyst to join the team and work hand in hand to shape how programs are measured, identify optimization opportunities and scale. This work will occur across different marketing strategies and channels (paid ads, experiential, organic social, etc.) and the ability to understand the interconnectivity within integrated programs will be essential.What You’ll Do Define and measure short and long-term program success, including what metrics to focus on and why Play a pivotal role in designing, building and executing dashboards and surveys to help data-driven decision making Conduct data analyses to measure the effectiveness of multi-channel marketing campaigns against every stage of the marketing funnel such as regressions, factor analyses, t-tests and ANOVAs Oversee insights reporting, including generation of reporting templates, applying expertise and perspective not just analysis and communicating data/recommendations in a compelling way Work cross-functionally to compile and communicate key insights and offer recommendations to stakeholders at all levels of seniority What We're Looking For 5+ years of marketing analyst experience in a fast-paced, data-driven environment Expertise in marketing attribution modeling and measurement, across multiple channels Experience creating measurement methodologies and dashboards Strong data storytelling skills and the ability to communicate them cross-functionally Experience with Excel, SQL, Google Analytics, comScore, and Tableau - ability to tap into Pinterest’s data pipeline will be key to success

title: Data Analyst
description: Do you love using data to monitor and improve product performance and communicate impact? You might be theRISC (Rewards, Incentives, Survey, and Campaigns) team’s next Operations Data Analyst!Rally Health’s RISC team administers reward programs, health assessment surveys, and runs campaigns all aimedat empowering people to take charge of their health and achieve their personal goals.With an incentives and rewards platform processing hundreds of millions of dollars a year we seek a sharp analystwho can work with our data to ensure accuracy, answer product questions, communicate value to clients, andmeasure and improve our performance to make sure that we are effectively delivering incentives and drivinghealth improvements. This is a fast-paced, high profile role that is crucial to the well-being of our users and thesatisfaction of our clients.In addition to principal responsibilities for data support of the Rewards/Incentives products, the RISC analyst willalso occasionally work on investigations and analyses with Survey and Campaigns data.As the RISC Data Analyst, you will be the go-to team member for data and investigations essential to thefunctioning of these product areas, using a mixture of BI tools, direct querying, and data analysis to supportoperational needs.Roles & Responsibilities Conduct ad-hoc data analyses and queries to support product capabilities Monitor operational dashboards and use data analysis to investigate issues Investigate and answer questions with data Help define and monitor key business and operational metricsRequired Skills 1-3 years of experience as a data analyst or equivalent Strong proficiency with SQL, including the ability to work with complex data structures Intermediate level Python or R Thorough understanding of data schemas and structures Strong proficiency using Excel to analyze data An inquisitive mind and keen business acumen Strong attention to detail Excellent communications skills with and about data Proven ability to manage competing priorities simultaneously Adaptable, proactive, energetic and willing to learn and deliver on a variety of tasks and responsibilities Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment focused on continuous product innovationNice to Have Experience with Hadoop/Hive/Spark and big data environments Experience scripting in Bash or similar Experience querying MongoDB Experience building dashboards and visualizations in Tableau, or ability to quickly get up to speed

title: Data Analyst
description: About NinthDecimalNinthDecimal is the marketing platform powered by location data. It harnesses this data to build a precise understanding of consumers' physical world behavior. Fortune 500 companies and marquee brands activate this customer intelligence through audience targeting, measurement, insights and data licensing solutions. By filling the gap in understanding how consumers spend the majority of their time, NinthDecimal provides marketers a new model of the customer journey for impactful engagement.NinthDecimal introduced the mobile industry to one-to-one audience targeting with the launch of our Location Graph™, the first platform to build audiences using historical location data. The subsequent launch of our Location Conversion Index® offered marketers the first mobile measurement solution beyond the click that could accurately measure incremental lift. NinthDecimal is now leading the way in exposing mobile audiences across the digital ecosystem, bringing advanced performance and measurement to all the ways the brands want to engage their audience.Position SummaryThe Responsibilities For This Position Include These ActivitiesWe are looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing custom analytics team. Analysis of large data sets to derive factbased decisions of high-value business problems for the various business units, such as research analysts, product managers, data scientists, marketing and ad operations teams; Supporting Research & Insights team to produce actionable insights and datadriven recommendations for business and monetization strategies. Apply business analytics through ad-hoc reporting and custom scripting to drive optimization of various ad campaigns; Prepare data sets using python/scala/sql for targeting, reporting and data science research Ensure data quality of all inbound and processed data Create visualization to illustrate data trends Lead A/B testing processes, create and evaluate user segments and performance metrics, come up with the databased recommendations Contribute in the design, tuning, performance and maintenance of raw and normalized data so that data can be leveraged by stakeholders in a timely fashion by the appropriated reporting toolsQualifications Required Extreme passion for data quality Expert in python or scala Expert in building and optimizing complex SQL, preferably in Postgres, Mysql. Familiarity with the columnar database concepts. Expert in data manipulation in multi-billion records data size Be an excellent communicator and a leader able to articulate complex decisions to the cross functional team Strong sense of business application and urgency Advance degree in CS, Math or related subject is preferred Familiarity with the digital media / advertising industry is a big plus Experience with Hadoop based technologies, such as Hive, Spark is a nice to have Familiarity with high level languages such as python, R, pig, java is a nice to haveWhat's in it for you? 100% mobile revenue growth year over year - the company is a great acquisition target This role is crucial for the company's future Be the lead of the most disruptive revolution in the mobile advertising industry Work with wicked smart people in the hottest area of modern business – mobile/local/social targeting Excellent benefits and stock option planNinthDecimal CultureNinthDecimal, a name as interesting as its people. We are passionate about everything we do, whether it's working, telling the NinthDecimal story at industry events, playing our highly competitive ping-pong games, or participating in Beer Fridays. We come from a background of companies like, YP, TiVo, CNET, AOL, comScore, BrightRoll, Walmart, Coca Cola and many we just picked up out of college. Together we have created a company that is awesome, inspiring, innovative, fast-passed, nimble, and forward thinking.Sound like a company you want to work for? We are looking for smart, hungry, humble people who are truly passionate about building a great company! If you are looking for a place to put your handprint and make an impression – NinthDecimal wants you! For immediate consideration, please submit your resume to http://NinthDecimal.com/jobs.NinthDecimal is an AA/EEO employer that actively pursues and hires a diverse workforce.SDL2017

title: Strategic Data Analyst
location: 240 S Cedros Ave, Solana Beach, CA 92075, US
description: Job Overview As the company’s Strategic Data Analyst, you will work directly with members of the senior leadership team on projects that will shape the company’s strategy and direction. Primary Duties and Responsibilities: Query and analyze large sets of data from multiple sources to develop actionable insights Mine, combine, normalize, and enhance data; deal with imperfect data Apply statistical techniques to build forecast models Collect data and perform statistical analysis Perform analysis to Assess performance of key business metrics including revenue, and pricing, and service performance Perform data analysis to support proposals for customer-specific RFPs Perform detailed analysis to support negotiations with key vendors Develop expertise on industry, market trends, and competitive landscape A successful candidate will: Have the desire to join a fast paced, early stage startup Swiftly adapt to and thrive in a rapidly evolving environment Proactively find innovative and unique solutions to problems Exhibit meticulous attention to detail and quality Learn new tools and techniques quickly   Recommended Knowledge/Experience Proven working experience as a data or business data analyst (pricing experience preferred) Deep experience with reporting packages (Excel, Tableau, etc.), relational databases (SQL), and/or development (Python, R, etc.) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Exposure to data models, database design, and data mining BS in Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

title: Global Compensation Analyst
description: Flexport is looking for a Global Compensation Analyst who will propel us into our next phase of rapid growth. Reporting to the Head of People Operations, this is a new role on our People team and is responsible for leading the development, implementation, and maintenance of global compensation programs and initiatives.What You’ll Do:Implement and support Flexport’s global compensation philosophyDesign, build, and lead global compensation programs including base pay and short- and long-term incentives while ensuring alignment with our compensation philosophyOwn and evolve the job structure, compensation structure and plan design as business needs changeLead the market benchmarking process for all compensation elements, including survey selection, submission and analysesPartner with our People Business Partners and functional leaders to perform job leveling and job matching for new and existing job functionsLead our semi-annual compensation reviews that are tied to our performance management processAdminister our short-term incentive plans which may include monthly, quarterly or annual payment cyclesPerform ad-hoc compensation analyses, benchmarking, data modeling, reporting, and problem-solving as neededPerform regular audits of the HCM data to verify accuracy and ensure consistent global application of job and pay structures and plansWhat you'll need:Bachelor’s degree and 4+ years of experience in a Compensation Analyst role supporting a global workforceExperience supporting compensation initiatives in a global organization, with preferred knowledge of international pay practices and legislationDemonstrated strong partnership with People team stakeholders, including Talent Acquisition and People Business PartnersStrong quantitative analysis skills and working knowledge of statistical analysisProficiency in the Google application suite; advanced Google Sheets / Microsoft Excel skillsThorough understanding of US employment law governing compensation (such as FLSA, minimum wage, etc.)Foundational knowledge of international pay practices and employment law impacting compensation, preferably in China and EU countriesExperience using Radford compensation surveys Strong working knowledge of HRIS or HCM systems desiredWhere you'll work:Our flagship office is on Market Street. We’re dog-friendly. We do a lot of 1:1s at the beautiful Yerba Buena Gardens and, as a truly global company, we don’t let geography slow us down. We rotate hack-a-thons and move Flexporters all around the world.Investing your time with Flexport means having an immediate impact, all over the world. You’re empowered to do what’s best for everyone and trusted to make the right decisions when and where you need them. Join our collective of entrepreneurs and improve the world’s experience in global trade.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst, Finance
description: About ThriveWholesome products at wholesale prices. Thrive Market is a membership e-commerce platform on a mission to make the world’s highest quality natural and organic products affordable for every American family. For $60/year, Thrive members get access to their favorite healthy snacks, supplements, home, beauty, and baby products at 30-50% off retail value—all shipped to their front door. As part of our Thrive Gives initiative, each paid membership on the site also sponsors a free membership for a low-income family.THE ROLEOur team is growing, and we are seeking a Finance oriented Data Analyst to help us uncover, analyze and communicate key business metrics that drive strategic decisions. You'll work cross-functionally between our Data and Finance Teams to make evidence-based recommendations, build out business case scenarios, track performance and opportunities, and more.ResponsibilitiesPerform rapid prototyping of experimental solutions and develop scalable solutions Build and own business intelligence dashboards and disseminate key reports to our Finance TeamBuild and refine business models such as forecasting, inventory, pricing strategies, logistics (shipping/fulfillment) optimizations, customer personalization and segmentation strategiesWork on analyze large eCommerce data sets (clickstream and order data to name a few)Find ways to use data to empower team members across the business to take action in real-timeQualificationsAcademic background in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or similar fieldPrevious experience in eCommerce is a plus, but not required2+ years of work experience with proven track record of data analyticsExperience with Redshift, large data ETL and advanced SQL Experience in statistics and multivariate regressionStrong data visualization skills; and familiarity working with Tableau or similar technologiesAbility to simply and persuasively communicate key insights to non-technical stakeholdersIntellectual curiosity and a strong sense of initiative Ability to demonstrate flexibility and integrity: be able and willing to work hands on, independently or with a small team providing leadershipWe OfferCompetitive salary (DOE) + equityUnlimited vacation timeFree Thrive membershipMedical, dental and vision plans to choose fromStocked kitchen and fridges with Thrive-type foodsOnsite gym & showersLots of weekly eventsCatered lunchesCasual atmosphere and great people to work with

title: Data Analyst - Revenue
description: Hundreds of millions of pageviews, natural language processing, real-time user analytics, header bidding… these are just a few of the challenges we face at Stanza. To the consumer, Stanza is a seamless calendar integration, allowing users to sync their favorite interests and events such as concerts, sporting events, movie releases, esports, etc. With partners such as Warner Brothers, NBC Sports, CBS, NFL, NBA, NHL, NCAA, Twitch and many more, Stanza is becoming the default way to embed and share event calendars on the web.We are redefining the purpose of calendar with one core value in mind: Your Time Matters. This leads us to a larger vision to redefine the calendar as the new discovery platform - the most natural way to find, remember and act on the things that you truly care about spending your time on. Beyond adding events to calendars, we provide intelligent recommendations around content or transactions associated with those events helping users answer the question of “what’s next”.Stanza is backed by top tier venture investors and is headquartered in San Francisco.The Data Analyst - Revenue role is primarily responsible for data collection / reporting and monitoring / identifying trends related to our Stanza revenue performance. You will work cross-functionally with all key stakeholders for revenue, including our business, product and engineering teams.Responsibilities Support Sales and Account Mgmt teams through daily collection and interpretation of programmatic ad revenue and affiliate revenue date Timely reporting of any revenue trends affecting publisher clients so Account Mgmt can proactively reach out to clients to help resolve any issues Perform ad hoc data queries around revenue, as needed by Sales and Account Mgmt teams Build out a larger data analysis framework that help automate queries in the long runHelp make recommendations and optimizations related to CPM, yield and any other metrics tracking revenue performance Qualifications Prior experience writing SQL/database queries to extract data from our various systems Knowledge and experience performing advanced analysis in a statistical computing language (e.g. Python, R, SAS) Familiarity with our BI tool, Periscope, is a bonus Ability to cleanly and effectively report on findings and analyses BS or MS in a quantitative field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Sciences, Engineering, CS) is a plus

title: Business Systems Analyst-Retail
description: Position: Business Systems Analyst – Retail ApplicationsLocation :San Francisco CA US 94105Duration : 3 months CTH Job Description : Client's IS&T Applications department requires a Business Systems Analyst to provide support for the retail merchandising systems business area. S/he will work as the liaison between business partners and the IS&T group in order to support existing systems and provide analysis for systems implementation, upgrade and enhancement projects. The position requires knowledge in retail, wholesale and/or international business processes with experience in merchandise planning, assortment planning, initial allocation and replenishment systems. The successful candidate must be able to demonstrate an ability to perform analysis of key requirements and clearly communicate alternatives and recommendations to decision-makers. This person must be able to respond quickly to support issues, evaluate alternatives and create and execute against an action plan. The Business Systems Analyst must be able to prepare and execute testing plans to ensure high quality results. This person will be required to document business and functional/technical specifications for system development based on user requirements and must be able to provide support through Fiscal Month/Quarter/Year End cycles and peak periods.   Responsibilities:•Communication: Collaborate with IT project team members and business partners to understand and analyze business requirements and processes. Experienced with capturing business processes and functional requirements using standard requirement & modeling techniques.•Adaptability: Possesses the ability to balance and align focus based on the business objectives of all stakeholders at a project level, while managing expectations and internal customer commitments.•Problem solving: Is able to identify practical solutions to business issues and problems. Can evaluate business solutions to determine ability to meet all stakeholder needs within project boundaries. Is able to diagnose root causes of business issues, problems and potential opportunities and develop process and functional solutions.•Business acumen: Is able to formulate probing questions to elicit business knowledge from the stakeholders. Has practical knowledge in the functional area being impacted by the project, or has the ability to quickly acquire a solid understanding. Demonstrates a broad understanding of the retail value chain, accounting principles and industry applications. Understands how core processes deliver value and meet the organization’s defined business objectives.•Financial Knowledge: Has the ability to understand the financial impact of a project or support process on the organization’s bottom-line. Able to quantify costs, savings and risks for a given project, feature or change request. Has the ability to perform and present cost/benefit and risk analysis and identify potential trade-offs of competing solutions.•Program/Project Process and Data Management expertise: able to estimate Business Analyst tasks / activities. Is able to determine project areas where BA resources are needed and what BA activities need to be provided. Has a general understanding of Change Management concepts, tools and techniques. Has a general understanding of Business Process Management concepts, tools and techniques. Is able to meet project schedule deadlines. Job Requirements : Education:•Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field•Six Sigma, Lean or other business process improvement training or education looked upon favorably Experience•3-5 years of relevant experience in Retail, Wholesale, and/or International with focus in building/supporting business capability solutions preferably in the apparel industry.•Demonstrated competency writing queries using Oracle/ MS SQL. Experience with report writer tools like SAP Business Objects or MicroStrategy a plus.•Previous experience with Oracle Retek Merchandising Systems, JDA Allocation, and/or Product Lifecycle Management applications.•Communications: Strong communicator at all levels of the organization. Excellent written and verbal communication skills; excellent presentation skills; very strong in one-on-one communications within small and large groups.•Achievement Orientation: Knowledge of how the delivery of IT solutions can enable achievement of business requirements. Skills required include innovative problem solving; decision-making; risk taking; execution expertise.•Service Orientation: Working comprehension of research methods to evaluate stakeholder requirements and responses. Skills required include partnering; proactive problem solving; scanning for and sharing business information. Knowledge of the company’s business practices and direction as well as familiarity with the company’s products and resources.

title: Data Engineer
description: Greenfly is a platform to collaborate with your most important relationships to create and share authentic and compelling digital content. We are seeking a Data Engineer who will help build out and maintain analytics and reporting across Greenfly. We’re looking for the right balance of technical acumen, analytical thinking and storytelling ability to bring our data to life across product, marketing, sales and finance.As a Data Engineer, you will be combining product usage data, behavioral data, business systems data, transactional data and third party data into an analytics pipeline that drives all of the critical business decisions we make. This role will have an immediate impact on every aspect of a rapidly growing business. You will have decision making abilities to suggest and improve on our current services and architecture to ensure we are working on the best solution possible. You will be passionate about working with datasets and be someone who loves to bring data together to answer complex business questions that deepen our understanding of our customers and usage of the platform. You will architect and own the data landscape, working closely with our product, engineering and executive leadership teams to implement solutions designed to improve the success of the Greenfly platform. You will be comfortable building data frameworks from the ground up. Responsibilities Partner with Product and Executive leadership to frame and prioritize business opportunities, identifying where data insights can provide the biggest impact Partner with Product and Engineering teams to drive implementation of data tracking Perform both standardized and ad-hoc data analysis, reporting, and modifications via SQL, Mixpanel and Google Analytics Use analytics to influence product development, surfacing data around product usage and customer behavior Create and deliver reporting for key areas of the business, including weekly, monthly and quarterly operational reports Drive a culture of accountability, measurement and experimentation Qualifications BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline Industry experience as a Data Engineer or related role (e.g. Software Engineer, Business Intelligence Engineer, Data Scientist, Business Analyst) with a track record of manipulating, processing and extracting value from datasets At least 3+ years of professional work experience Proficiency in SQL Experience with analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc.) Experience with log aggregation and extraction (Elasticsearch) and Business Intelligence reporting tools (Tableau, etc.) a plus Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate with both technical and business teams Passion for facilitating internal and external customer satisfaction Outstanding leadership skills with a focus on driving quality output Equally capable of working as part of a team or independently Curious minded and driven to build the best products! About Our Work Our product delivery teams are pretty small (a few engineers, a designer, and a product manager), so there's a lot of meaningful collaboration. We believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. We believe in measuring everything, taking advantage of our amazing continuous deployment system to ship code early and often. We believe in a blameless culture based on trust and a commitment to learning. Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Greenfly's values. We like candidates who are curious, enthusiastic, and have a generous spirit. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a fun place to work. Come do the best work of your life at Greenfly.

title: Director SEC Reporting & Commission Accounting (AMGA635)
description: Req # AMGA635Job Status Full Time RegularFunctional Area FinancePosition OverviewPosition SummaryThe Director of SEC Reporting and Commission Accounting reports to the Assistant Controller and will play a critical role in ensuring the integrity, consistency and application of GAAP world wide, including accounting policies, practices, and systems. He/she will be a key member of the financial team at Fortinet, and will take on a wide range of responsibilities and work in a number of areas, including SEC Reporting, M&A support, equity investments, real estate investments, treasury and stock comp as well as a variety of ad hoc projects. The successful applicant will lead the Company’s filing of various SEC documents such as Form 10K, 10Q, 8Ks, and other ad hoc filings, including Investor Presentations. He or she will also prepare internal management presentations for members of the Audit Committee and executive team. In addition to reporting, this position offers the opportunity to leverage an extensive background of technical accounting and SOX with the intensity, dynamics and rapid change of a high-growth technology company. This individual will have the capacity to drive reporting and technical excellence, while supporting the development of practical business processes and solutions. The Director of SEC Reporting will have a background in applying and teaching others about new GAAP as well as existing GAAP requirements, be detail oriented and have strong organizational and relationship building skills. This position requires matrix management and strong communication capabilities to educate finance and non- finance personnel.Major Responsibilities Reporting Bring leadership and vision to all aspects of accounting, reporting, processes and SEC compliance. Responsible for timely preparation and filing of annual and periodic SEC filings on Forms 10-K and 10-Q, including review of SEC filing timeline, supervise data gathering process, updates to document specifically around new disclosures and MD&A sections, review of EDGARization and XBRL tagging. Responsible for the timely review of other SEC filings on Forms 8-K and S-8, working with legal team as needed. Review in conjunction with legal of the annual proxy statement. Responsible for the quarterly Audit Committee packages, press releases and financial statements, earnings conference call scripts and other financial data summaries for investor relations including analyst presentations and responses to financial questions. Proactively lead the analytical process of comparing disclosures of competitors or other technology companies in order to improve consistency and comparability. Work with legal, investor relations and management to assess potential changes/improvements and lead the preparation of disclosures. Preparation or review of US GAAP and SEC disclosure checklists to ensure compliance of external financial statements and disclosures.Proactively monitor current FASB and SEC activities and evaluate the impact of adopting new accounting standards.Accounting and Compliance Be responsible for updating research and analysis of ASC 606 Commissions & Disclosures, and other technical accounting issues and their application to internal and external reporting. Summarize the resulting analysis and conclusion for both executive review and to record in the general ledger. This will include annual calculation of key assumptions relevant to ASC 606 commissions accounting, testing of key reports for completeness and accuracy, booking journal entries, and providing the SEC reporting team relevant disclosure support. Account for share-based compensation arrangements, including valuation of awards and calculation, analysis and benchmarking of expense. Responsible for the statements of cash flow, earnings per share, and equity roll-forward. Responsible for effectiveness of internal controls where identified as a process owner; implement and maintain reporting procedures to comply with internal control requirements. Support the relationship and work product of Company’s external auditors (Deloitte).Operational and Strategic Work with the Director of Technical Accounting, Assistant Controller, and Controller to set priorities and work with senior management and the regional teams on various initiatives. Conduct cross-functional trainings on accounting policies, etc Assist with other special projects, as requiredCommunication Support with the preparation of quarterly audit committee presentations, other audit committee related reports, and external investor presentations Effectively communicate with all levels of the organization, third party service providers, including external auditors Provide accounting/disclosure advice to world-wide finance personnel Develop and maintain working relationships across Finance, Legal, Investor Relations, and other organizations.This position requires a relationship-driven individual who will contribute to Fortinet’s overall success. The position requires an individual who can support constant change, be flexible and adapt in an evolving fast paced work environment and often work under tight deadlines with changing requirements.Key relationships ControllerAssistant ControllerDirector of Technical AccountingSr. Manager of Commissions AccountingCFOGC, SVP HRVice President Revenue AccountingInternational Controller, APAC, Canada and LATAM controllersSr. Director, Internal AuditVP, Corporate Financial Planning and AnalysisVice PresidentTaxSr Directors of Inventory, Services Accounting, Incentive Compensation, Stock Compensation, General LedgerExternal AuditorsEssential Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance; CPA required.At least 10 years of experience with at least 6 years of experience at Big 4 public accounting firm, preferred. EEOC / AAP Accommodation: If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact Fortinet, Inc at (408) 235-7700 of accommodations@fortinet.com for assistance.EEO: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

title: Software Engineer
description: Are you interested in joining a fast growing company focused on the intersection of data management, AI, and operational efficiency? At Gemini, we don't just provide the technology to collect and manage data - we go a step further to connect data points and provide advanced analysis that keeps pace with growing data volumes. Automate data management and discover of relationships to reduce analysis time and analyst workload. As part of our engineering team, our approach towards solving IT management using modern tech is not about pouring old wine in a new bottle. We are using practical and useful ways of leveraging these advanced concepts into a meaningful practice that makes complex tasks simple, provides significant clues to the analysts and operators, and empowers users to focus on high level tasks while enabling AI to pick the grunt work.Skills Required: Scala, Java or Python (at least 2 out of 3) Spark - working knowledge in using Spark preferably with Scala and it’s DataFrame/DataSet APIs Knowledge in using Kafka or similar messaging/stream processing engine Working knowledge in using Spark MLLIB is highly desirable Working knowledge using Clojure is highly desirable Working knowledge in using NodeJS is highly desirable

title: Business Analyst/Clinical Programmer
description: A global leader in medical devices is seeking for a Business Analyst/Clinical Programmer to join their headquarters in Irvine!  Responsibilities: Liaise with clinical project teams to gather clinical report, data needs and requests to ensure that all requirements are communicated between the team and the requestor(s).Participate in the requirement collection, design, development, testing, validation and maintenance of clinical study reports, and data deliverables for multiple clinical studies (databases) according to the department SOPs.Liaise with the validation team to ensure report deliverables are released in accordance with rules and regulations and in corporate compliance.Work effectively with cross functional teams and participate in meetings.Work with project teams to provide support for data activities, such as global report generation and management.Work as a liaison between report users and the Clinical I.T. groups to review, assess and propose solutions and/or suggestion for improvements in the various systems.Develop reports and data listing primarily using SAS.  Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree required (Computer Science, Information Systems or related discipline) along with clinical experience 1+ years working knowledge of the Medidata Rave EDC system or other EDC system (Inform, Oracle Clinical). 5+ years working as a report business analyst; liaising with customers and documenting report requirements. 5+ years developing reports and data listing using SAS 2+ years developing reports in Medidata Rave Business Objects, or other reporting tools (Cognos, SQL Server Reporting Service, Oracle Reports, Spotfire, etc.) Proven ability to produce complex clinical study reports using SAS Adherence to department SOPs and a regulated environment

title: Associate Operations Analyst
location: 1201 K Street, 14th floor , Sacramento, CA 95814, US
description: The California Dental Association (CDA) is an innovative membership-based organization that’s committed to the success of dental professionals in service to their patients and the public. Founded nearly 150 years ago by a small group of dentists, CDA has grown to become the single largest membership in the American Dental Association and a constant trusted resource for California dentists. CDA supports 27,000 members through all stages of their careers by offering dedicated expertise and services, including cutting-edge education, tools for the business side of dentistry, legislative advocacy and access to dentist-focused insurance. Bring your best to CDA and enjoy generous pay plus a benefits package that includes medical/dental/vision, 22 days of vacation, 401(k) matching, profit sharing and education reimbursement. In addition, CDA offers with a robust employee wellness program, casual Fridays, and learning and leadership opportunities. To learn more about working at CDA, visit cda.org/careers.   As a part of the Membership team, your mission is to help CDA connect all whom qualify to CDA’s membership benefits, on-demand. This position provides back-office Membership operational support, including troubleshooting data anomalies, extracting data, researching operational processes and data, training internal staff, and running bulk data operations on our association management systems. This position is the go-to expert for Membership operations and related support.   Essential Functions – must be able to perform with or without a reasonable accommodation   Membership Operations Support Monitor and fulfill ad-hoc requests, especially researching user experience and operational questions, troubleshooting data, resolve complex data anomalies, designing and extracting data exports, configuring dashboards and report schedules, and training users on our association management system (Aptify), data, and documentation. Monitor and fulfill recurring requests, such as acquire and upload bulk imports, process data quality reports, and produce non-automated recurring reports. Manage and update Membership data, such as billing products, pricing, discounts, membership plans, and dental schools. Research and resolve complex Membership data issues, including investigating deep into database tables, user data, system behavior, business intent, and rules. Work closely with operational teams and cross-functional teams to understand their data and operational needs, including recommending data sets, filters, and how to use the data.    Mastery of Membership Subject Matter Continuously learn about and master Membership subject matter, including all business processes and procedures, policies, data, and association bylaws affecting Membership.   Continuous Improvement on Data Quality and Bulk Imports Propose, collaborate, design, request, test, document, train, configure, and schedule enterprise-wide automated data quality checks, processes, and procedures. Propose, collaborate, design, request, test, document, train, configure, and schedule data management features, such as changes to bulk import processes and procedures.   Non-Essential Functions Write documentation, including on processes, procedures, troubleshooting guides, modules, data dictionaries, etc. for the purpose of retaining and sharing knowledge, aid innovation teams, and aid operational teams that use the content related to Membership. Collaborate with the Business Systems Analyst and IT to identify opportunities for operational or data management improvements, evaluate designs and their impact on operations and Membership data, and support implementation. Performs other duties as assigned   Required Education, Licenses & Experience 2+ years of experience in data analysis, working with databases, and report creation 2+ years of experience writing documentation, preferably business processes, procedures, and/or data dictionaries 2+ years of experience providing support, such as fulfilling many small requests in a queue Intermediate capabilities of Microsoft Applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, SharePoint, and Outlook) Monitor queues and execute assignments under general supervision Learn quickly about complex systems, operations, and rules Retrieve and aggregate data from multiple sources Present data in clear and actionable formats Listen, clarify and facilitate discussions about support requests and assignments Identify and resolve problems and propose solutions Provide precise and accurate work product (detail oriented) Organize files and content for re-use, tracking, and usability Perform with short-term deadlines in a fast-paced and changing environment Handle multiple assignments, including prioritizing and focusing on completion Estimate capacity, turnaround, and turnaround issues to requestors and manager Follow and adhere to standards, policies, processes, etc. Raise suggestions for operational improvement, especially data-driven ideas Clearly identify and document complex business processes Excellent with logic, such as with if-then and and-or operations in Excel Excellent customer service skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent understanding of how relational databases function   Preferred Education, Licenses & Experience Associates or Bachelor’s Degree Association Management System (AMS) or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) experience Ability to write SQL coding   Working Conditions       Occasionally (1-33%)             Frequently (34-66%)               Constantly (67-100%) Constantly sitting

title: Data and Insights Analyst, Oath
description: Oath, a subsidiary of Verizon, is a values-led company committed to building brands people love. We reach over one billion people around the world with a dynamic house of 50+ media and technology brands. A global leader in digital and mobile, Oath is shaping the future of media.Oath Entertainment and Studios is looking for a passionate, data-driven individual to compliment the analytics team. This is a highly visible role that will help support key initiatives and operations. As a data analyst, you’ll be diving deep into terabytes of data to identify trends, opportunities and make recommendations that will have a meaningful impact on the business. You will partner with internal stakeholders to define and improve upon key performance indicators and develop reporting solutions and dashboards that will be used across the organization. This role will be reporting to the Manager of Audience Insights and Analytics.Responsibilities Develop standardized dashboards and reports with an emphasis on automation and scalabilityConduct data analysis and research initiatives that help identify content consumption drivers and opportunitiesDefine, create, monitor, and improve key performance indicators (KPIs) to aid in decision making and overall strategyIdentify data requirements and validate data inconsistencies with the Data Engineering teamSupport monthly and quarterly programming reviews with data pulls and visualizationsServe as data SME and a resource for reporting and ad hoc requestsCommunicate and present actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders Qualifications 3+ years of experience in an analytics roleBachelor’s degree with a concentration in Business, Mathematics, Finance, or Economics preferredHands-on experience with building dashboards using Looker, Tableau, or MicrostrategyExpertise in creating and automating reports and charts using Excel or Google SheetsProficiency with SQL querying languages. Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Amazon Redshift, or Google BigQueryExceptional analytical and quantitative skills with an ability to interpret and summarize data that drive actionable solutionsStrong communication and presentation skills. Experience working with multiple teams.Passionate for all things data, self-motivated, and results-oriented with a strong level of service Nice-to-Haves Applied Statistical and machine learning knowledgeFamiliarity with R and Python programming languagesExperience in Entertainment/Media industry Oath is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on, age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category. Oath is dedicated to providing an accessible environment for all candidates during the application process and for employees during their employment. Please let us know if you need a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or participate in the application process.Currently work for Oath? Please apply on our internal career site.

title: UX Researcher, Digital Marketing
description: Join our team and experience Workday!It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day One of our core values is fun.Job DescriptionThe UX Researcher & Analyst will work within Workday’s Digital Marketing Optimization team to deliver data-driven user experience enhancement programs that produce tangible business outcomes. The UX Researcher & Analyst will work on projects for corporate websites, campaign landing pages and other externally facing digital experiences. S/he will play a critical role in developing plans and research to support A/B testing, usability studies, personalization and other optimization activities. Experience developing and leading usability studies and leveraging analytics data to drive digital experiences is a must.The UX Researcher & Analyst should possess exceptional ability to analyze and study complex and technical user challenges and needs and to communicate clear data-driven guidelines that support the creation of clean, focused, user-centric solutions.Responsibilities Own the UX research and analysis of the end-to-end user experience across Workday.com— from the big picture down to specifics of user conversion and experience flows Partner with diverse constituencies within Workday to develop a nuanced understanding of business goals and needs in order to help deliver research that has a meaningful business impact Deliver projects that clearly and persuasively communicate the UX strategy and the reasoning behind it These projects include deliverables such as testing plans, research protocols, research findings, web persona definition, workflows, wireframes, page maps, interaction and behavior specs, and more Work with UX and Visual Design counterparts to maintain and enhance website experience, aesthetics, standards and brand integrity Collaborate across departments to test features and hypotheses and rapidly integrate feedback into design iterations in order to create user experiences that can be mapped directly to the business Apply a data driven approach to user experience, establish baseline metrics, success criteria and perform data analysis and testing to inform optimization efforts Stay abreast of industry best practices and trends for UX design and processes Possess a deep understanding of UX processes, methodologies, and the interplay between business requirements, user research, testing, branding, visual design, accessibility, and technologyQualifications 8+ years UX strategy and research experience or 6+ years with a Master’s degree Strong understanding of responsive design and mobile device platforms and production practices Demonstrates confidence, expertise, and insights to shape strategy and drive key business decisions as it relates to UX design Strong understanding of UX design principles and design thinking process (human centered design) In-depth understanding of how UX design approaches impact SEO and other inbound marketing channel results Familiarity with web production technologies (HTML, CSS, JS, etc.) Very strong attention to detail, organizational skills, ability to listen thoughtfully, and assess and synthesize data Very strong communication skills with natural ability to articulate and defend strategic recommendations and run work sessions Strong verbal and written skills to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders Very strong collaboration skills with cross-departmental groups of stakeholders and openness to feedback from multiple sources Ability to balance UX theory with practicality of business objectives and guidelines Industry knowledge and experience with B2B marketing and SaaS software is a plus Bachelors degree Your portfolio will demonstrate creative problem solving solutions and display an ability to help deliver simple, intuitive, and engaging user experiences. It must also be clear which aspects of the displayed projects you worked on.

title: Data Analyst (Healthcare - Provider Side/Managed Care - Required)
description: JOB SUMMARY In this role, you will provide reporting, research, analytical and technical support through reviewing, extracting and using data from different source systems and the data warehouse.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESCreate analytic reports on a regular basis that assist in identifying: clinical outcomes, revenue opportunities, quality of care issues, supporting quality improvement projects and initiatives, and more. Perform statistical Population Health utilization, cost and quality analytics to develop total cost of care targets. Support and inform clinical, network and efficiency improvement initiatives through complex analytics and financial modeling. Performing analytics to support provider benchmarking and high-performance network development and management. title: Security Governanace Analyst
location: 385 East Colorado Boulevard , Pasadena, CA 91101, US
description: Western Asset views information security as one of the top risks that the Firm must manage & has developed a program to identify, assess and address the information security challenges facing the Firm. This is achieved through deploying industry-leading technologies and a comprehensive program to safeguard Western’s information systems, assets & data.   As an experienced Information Security Analyst you will be a key player in this program, responsible for ensuring that the governance and risk assessment elements of the program are operational and mature, providing key input to both the day-to-day operation of essential security oversight while expanding the scope and effectiveness of the controls. Responsibilities: With broad involvement in the security program, this role is focused specifically on: Risk assessment: conducting risk assessments and interfacing with the enterprise risk program. Holding risk owners accountable for remediation actions. Monitoring and assessing IT risk. Collaboration: interacting with all parts of the organization including parent company and affiliated companies on cyber practices and projects Third party security: Conducting due diligence of IT and business partner vendors Security initiative coordination: coordination of security and business initiatives that impact Western’s security. Execution of ongoing security projects Program and policy management: input and support into the overall security program. Drafting, reviewing and keeping current policies Regulatory: staying current with legislation and regulatory requirements impacting security, including performing gap analyses between guidelines and practice Audit: interface with audit process including internal audit, external audits and client based audits Reporting: input and support into management reporting   Competencies:   Must be familiar with: International Standards Organization (ISO/IEC) 27001/27002 National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cybersecurity Framework Other security frameworks and industry best practices Must an excellent communicator and able to build and maintain effective working relationships Must have experience conducting risk assessments Must have experience developing information security policy Familiarity with fixed income business processes, technologies and services and CISA/CISM/CISSP would be an advantageQualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field is required.

title: Data & Analytics Training Coordinator
description: Where good people build rewarding careers.Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.Job DescriptionData Discovery and Decision Science (D3) is the research and analytics organization at Allstate. We are solving some of today’s most complicated analytics problems, making the lives of our Allstate colleagues easier and more productive, and driving our mission to deliver perfect insurance solutions to our customers. We are avid about learning and applying new tools and techniques to get the most value from our massive data resources.Got a passion for service? For developing people? For training? Across the enterprise? We’ve got just the role for you!The D3 Talent and People Analytics team is focused on strengthening data and analytic talent across the enterprise and within D3. We also work to create value for the Human Resource function at Allstate. We’re proud of the role we play fostering an analytics-driven culture.The Data & Analytics Training Coordinator plays a significant role in three mission-critical areas. We’re developing training for leaders across the company. We’re helping to build a team of “citizen data scientists” in many business units. And we’re taking care of our own in D3 with a robust onboarding program.The role will give you an opportunity to develop and shape your vision on using education to change our culture. And you’ll build essential skills in leading through influence, planning, project management and communication. The role will expose you to leaders at all levels while giving you the opportunity to stay close to your technical roots. And you’ll be surrounded by team members with a wide range of skills to serve as thought partners.Responsibilities Development and execution of enterprise-wide training for mid and senior level leaders in partnership with HR and external vendor Develop and launch approach to provide training to analysts across the enterprise Manage, update and refine department training program Develop robust technical curriculum Engage volunteers within D3 and across the enterprise to deliver programsJob Qualifications Degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, finance or related discipline; Master’s or PhD preferred Familiarity with coding and advanced modeling techniques Experience working with team members from different business units and with different skill sets Ability to translate complex technical concepts for less-technical audiences 2+ years of team or people leadership preferred Teaching or training experience preferredThe candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®. As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component.For jobs in San Francisco, please click "here" for information regarding the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.For jobs in Los Angeles, please click "here" for information regarding the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.It is the policy of Allstate to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, disability, and citizenship status as a veteran with a disability or veteran of the Vietnam Era.

title: Data Analyst-Banking (W2, individual corps and 1099 candidates only) - San Francisco

requiredRelevant experience acceptable as a member of a financial institution or consulting firm.Requires knowledge and proven experience in Agile/SCRUM.Must possess excellent verbal and written a minimum of supervision.Must possess strong interpersonal and organizational skills.Professional Skill / CompetencyExpert at managing by influence to achieve goals through departments and staff not title: Customer/Email Segmentation Manager
description: Title:Customer Segmentation Manager 8258151 Location: San Francisco Duration: 3 Months -------------- Will be part of the Digital Performance and Growth/Test and Learn team “Tealium Audiencestream” – current system that sits on top of website a tracks user data as they navigate/access the site – previous experience with this system, in particular, is not required but would be ideal. It is imperative that this candidate understands building logic of Segmentation “and/or” statements, “you/I” statements, as well as solid knowledge for how databases work and pull data to interpret customer groups In terms of background, we can be open to previous titles they’ve held, as long as they’ve utilized other marketing segmentation tools, etc. This person can come from email service provider backgrounds, business analyst, data analyst, marketing, marketing analytics, etc. Someone who just understands how to group the data and how it is pulled and interpreted. title: Senior Analyst
description: At AKQA we believe in the imaginative application of art and science to create beautiful ideas, products and services. With an entrepreneurial and collaborative approach, we design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination, delivering impressive returns for our clients. Clients include Clorox (including Burt’s Bees, Brita, and others), Gap Inc., Clif Bar, and Wynn Resorts.From our location in San Francisco's SOMA district - the epicenter of the Bay Area's technology industry - AKQA offers our staff the opportunity to produce meaningful work for world-class companies in one of the world's most vibrant and beautiful cities.Data science is one of the fastest growing disciplines at AKQA, with executive support, a big data stack, and a wide range of capabilities including user experience insight and applied machine learning. The Senior Analyst has 3 – 5+ years of digital media, analytics and data science expertise; experience in a client service oriented role; and the ability to produce thoughtful presentations that create an impact.The Senior Analyst will be working closely the AKQA Media and Search teams. title: Data and Insights Analyst
description: Description The Customer Insights & Analytics team partners with Mintigo’s Engineering, Customer Experience, Product, Marketing and Salesorganizations to generate actionable insights using Mintigo’s Predictive Marketing Platform.
