title: HR Analyst
description: About IRhythmiRhythm is a leading digital healthcare company focused on the way cardiac arrhythmias are clinically diagnosed by combining our wearable bio-sensing technology with powerful cloud-based data analytics and machine- learning capabilities. Our goal is to be the leading provider of first-line ambulatory ECG monitoring for patients at risk for arrhythmias. iRhythm’s continuous ambulatory monitoring has already put over 1 million patients and their doctors on a shorter path to what they both need – answers.About This RoleWe are looking for an HR Analyst to join our growing HR Operations team based in our San Francisco, CA Headquarters. This role will have a specialized area of focus in reporting and analytics. You will be responsible for the creation of reports, global dashboards, and analytics using talent data across multiple systems that will be used organization wide. This role requires strong collaboration with stakeholders in all parts of the company to assess and understand reporting and analytics needs and develop sustainable and scalable reports, reporting solutions, and processes to meet those needs.As a member of the HR Operations Team, you will be responsible for training the HR Team on reporting, processes, and providing general operations support. This role will report to and work closely with the Sr. Manager of HR Operations, and contribute to the ongoing achievement of our HR roadmap and goals.Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To Collaborate with Human Resource Business Partner’s, Talent Acquisition, IT, Subject Matter Expert’s, and business leaders to ensure reports and dashboards meet current and ongoing needs. Develop weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual, and specialty reports and analysis as needed. Evaluate data from multiple sources, reconcile differences and provide a consistent approach and interpretation to results. Identify trends and patterns through data and develop recommendations to support business objectives. Develop sustainable and scalable tools and processes to ensure accuracy of master data and train HR on tools and processes to ensure ongoing data integrity. Conduct regular audits to ensure data accuracy and employment law compliance are met Develop and implement best in class solutions for reporting and presenting data to the business. Lead and/ or support HR audits, system implementations and new program research and analysis. About You BA in HR or related field preferred 5+ years HR Experience in HR Operations, Shared Services, and/ or Reporting & Analytics Broad understanding of HR and key functional areas Experience with HRIS and ATS Systems; preferably UltiPro and Greenhouse Previous working experience with ADP products preferred Advanced MS Office skills using Excel and PowerPoint, experience with Tableau is a definite plus Former SOX and/ or other compliance experience is preferred Robust analytical skills, strong business acumen, and experience with data visualization principles Proven ability to learn on the fly and maintain composure in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment. Strong team orientation and collaborative style. Excellent process management, planning, and organizational skills. Resilient and determined to ensure projects and deliverables are achieved. High integrity and ethics in handling confidential information. Excellent oral and written communication skills required. Attention to detail and commitment to excellence. Ability to travel domestically as needed; approximately 20-25% of the time What’s In It For YouThis is a full-time position with competitive salary package and excellent benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, paid holidays and paid time off.iRhythm also provides additional benefits including 401K (w/ company match), an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, annual organizational/cultural committee events and more!FLSA Status: ExemptRhythm Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (M/F/V/D).

title: Data Analyst, Testing & Optimization
description: Responsibilities Analyze A/B and Multivariate test data and provide actionable recommendations for business stakeholders Provide recommendations on key metrics and segments to determine if an experiment is successful Run exploratory analysis of site performance and customer data to identify key areas of the site that can be optimized Ensure experiment data qualify by maintaining and improving data to identify key areas of the site that can be optimized Ensure experiment data quality by maintaining and improving data integrations between internal and external tools Work closely with product management to create new feature test plans and decision trees in order to drive a “test and learn” culture within the organization Lead planning and execution of campaign and channel measurement, across all company publisher channels Lead Multivariate and A/B testing as an ongoing discipline to constantly improve campaign audience targeting, partner placement and messaging Collect and analyze data to be used in several ROAS models, including Marking Mix and Multi Touch Attribution Lead demand curve analysis and category and media investment scenarios Drive customer segmentation analysis, including acquisition and retention measurement and LTV projections Lead cross-device customer mapping to better understand the path of a customer Leverage propensity modeling to help guide customer-centric targeting and retention strategies Lead research projects to test elements of creative that are optimal for given audiences Set-up measurement studies and performance tracking in partnership with key media partners to enhance our view of the customer Recommend optimal channel mix, category mix and device mix for a given campaign goal Measurement Insights is responsible for collaborating with a business segment to determine long-term vision and provide analytical support and guidance Analyst large data sets to develop multiple, complex custom models and algorithms to drive innovative business solutions and work on large project teams in order to provide analytical support and guidance to a large project team (for example, email targeting, business optimization, consumer recommendations) across company Media Group Build learning systems to analyze and filter continuous data flows and offline data analysis Combine data features to determine search models Conduct advanced statistical analysis to determine trends and significant data relationships Experience in omni- channel marketing, attribution and ROI measurement, especially for awareness focused online advertising and TV campaingsRequirements Master’s degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Economics or related fields preferred Ability to use quantitative methods to answer tough questions Understanding of experimental design and testing methodologies Able to manipulate and draw insight from large complex, multi-dimensional data sets (SQL, R, Python etc.) Excellent communication and relationship-building skills, with a high attention to detail Fantastic communicator who is able to take the rocket science explanation and distill into simple business metrics for the general consumer Experience with Mobile channel measurement Strong analytical and quantitative skills and ability to translate findings into actions that align to the needs of the business Strong organizational skills, with the ability to effectively manage projects, communicate effectively, and be a self-starter Demonstrated thought leadership and relationship building/management with internal stakeholders and external partners Experience in data visualization across multiple tools such as Tableau, Thoughtspot, Looker and Domo Experience and passion for working in fast-paced agile environment BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience 4+ years of experience in campaign measurement and/or integrated marketing strategy Experience working across various internal stakeholders including Marketing, Finance and Engineering Knowledge of the changing digital media landscape, including innovative measurement techniques for Mobile, Social and Search Well versed in Advertising technology, including 3rd party ad-serving and tag management solutions and programmatic ad buying platforms Extensive experience with A/B and Multivariate test design and implementation Practitioner of Multi-touch attribution techniques Action-oriented analysis and recommendations; Focused on business outcomes to drive all priorities and accountability Traditional Marketing Mix experience Experience leading customer segmentation strategy and LTV analysis, with emphasis on the Omni-channel customer Significant experience communicating technical material to range of audiences

title: Staff Software Engineer – Data Mining/Data Analysis/Machine Learning
description: LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume – we transform lives through innovative products and technology.Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.If you are an applied research engineer/scientist with a passion for working on massive semi-structured text and graph datasets, then the LinkedIn Data Team is the place for you. The ideal candidate will have domain experience (data mining, information retrieval, security data science, natural language processing, advanced statistics, and/or machine learning), a strong systems orientation, and experience in building data mining products. The work you put forth will directly impact and fuel LinkedIn’s search relevance, ad targeting, information extraction, and recommendations.As a Staff Software Engineer, you will be an agile architect in the design, development, and support of the most visible Internet-scale features and infrastructures at LinkedIn.Responsibilities:• Work with BIG data, crunching millions of samples for modeling data mining, recommendation, or search relevance solutions. • Provide technical leadership, driving and performing best engineering practices to initiate, plan, and execute large-scale, cross functional, and company-wise critical programs.• Identify, leverage, and successfully evangelize opportunities to improve engineering productivity. Basic Qualifications:• BA/BS Degree in Computer Science or Machine Learning or related technical discipline, or related practical experience.• 4+ years experience in software design, development, and algorithm related solutions.• 4+ years experience programming experience in Java, C/C++.Preferred Qualifications:• BS + 8 years of relevant work experience, MS + 7 years of relevant work experience, or PhD + 4 years of relevant work experience• Experience in designing and building infrastructure and web services at large scale.• Expertise in one or more of the following: machine learning, data mining, security data science, advanced statistics, information retrieval, or natural language processing. • Experience with iterative, test-driven development.• Experience with configuration management (SVN, GIT, ant, maven, etc.).• Experience with developing and designing consumer-facing data based products • Experience with Hadoop, Pig, or other MapReduce paradigms.• Knowledge of internals Lucene/SOLR or other information retrieval systems.• Published work in academic conferences or industry circles. Candidates may be invited to present a talk on their work as part of the interview process.

title: Data Analyst - REMOTE
description: About UsWe are a growing company with a solid customer base, excellent compensation and benefits, and a collaborative yet flexible work environment. If you enjoy challenging projects, using new technologies to deliver innovative business solutions, and you're interested in working for an entrepreneurial company, we may have a home for you.We are looking for Data Analyst to join our CX solutions team. At PTP, we value aptitude and creativity as well as experience. We are a diverse organization and are looking for bright, passionate and committed professionals who strive to be the best at what they do.Responsibilities Work with large amounts of data to find trends and areas for improvement based on business and operational goals Drive business and technical requirements in order to improving data analysis Present findings with an ability to write and speak clearly while communicating complex ideas Requirements A bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics or related field Strong math and analysis skills Experience with statistical tools like R, SAS, Matlab, SPSS, Stata and reporting tools such as HighCharts Experience writing SQL queries Desired Unix Groovy or PERL Working knowledge of JSON Salary is DOE and is extremely competitive. We are able to offer relocation assistance to the right candidate.

title: Business Finance Analyst
location: 1201 Marina Village Pkwy, Alameda, CA 94501, US
description: The Business Finance Analyst is responsible for the day-to-day administration of the budget planning system, including analyzing and creating reports and refining existing reports. In addition, the Business Finance Analyst will be responsible for generating and distributing multiple weekly and monthly reports to the parent company as well as other internal partners of the organization. Principal Duties and Responsibilities:Administer and be the business "owner" of our planning system (IBM Cognos - TM1), with responsibility for the accuracy and integrity of the data, as well as having a deep understanding of the data and how it can be used.Develop and enhance reports before deployment to production environment.Support required weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reporting to parent company and other internal partners.Works with internal partners to understand their reporting requirements.Provides TM1 support and technical assistance to end users and other departments as needed.Generates ad hoc reports and regular datasets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries and scripts. Integrate data from multiple sources to produce requested or required data elements.Report to and collaborate with the Director of Financial Planning and Analysis.Job Requirements:4-year degree in Computer Science or Finance preferred.2+ years’ experience as data analyst/report writer or in a related field.Strong technical skills including PC and Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced level skills in Excel.Strong SQL skills, including writing/editing stored procedures.Experience with creating user-friendly financial reports and using formulas to access data cubes.Ability to read, analyze, and interpret financial reports and respond to common inquiries.Professional, customer service-oriented attitude and demeanor.Excellent organizational and time management skills, strong attention to detail, high regard for accuracy and output of quality work.Effective and creative problem-solver with strong initiative and excellent follow through.High sense of urgency with demonstrated ability to work independently and make effective decisions in a timely manner.Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a strong attention to detail and accuracy; ability to interact with and support multiple levels of the organization, including top management.Ability to work productively, autonomously and with minimal direction.  Ability to work collaboratively in a group and be an actively engaged team member.Ability to manage multiple concurrent tasks, meet deadlines as assigned. Ability to be effective and flexible in stressful situations (i.e. unexpected problems, tight deadlines).

title: Sr. Sales Incentives and Analytics Analyst
description: At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.Thanks to our ongoing expansion, we have an opening for a dynamic Sales Incentives and Analytics Analyst to join our team. You will be a critical member of the Sales Strategy and Operations team who owns our monthly commissions process across Global Field Operations. In addition, you will help support the design of our sales incentives, perform quota attainment reporting and forecasting, and help analyze relevant field performance measures.If you are passionate about using data to drive business results and you are looking for an opportunity with a dynamic, fast-paced organization, this could be a great fit.Responsibilities Comp Administration: You will administer commission calculations on a monthly basis for the Field Ops organization (direct sales reps, channel / alliances, customer success managers, sales development reps, sales engineers, GTM leadership, professional services). Incentive Analytics: You will own all monthly quota attainment related critical metrics (e.g. quota attainment distribution / histogram, rep productivity, stack ranks, earnings attainment, etc.) Executive Presentations / Rep Performance Reviews: You will present quarterly attainment and productivity reviews to the Chief Revenue Officer, SVP of WW Sales, and Area Vice Presidents. Implement Early Warning Systems: You will actively lead field performance by forecasting attainment monthly and identifying areas for improvement (i.e. pipeline needs, conversion rates, renewal rates, etc). Provide recommendations, as needed, for mid period incentives based on actual / forecasted results. Incentive Design: You will develop recommendations that improve the structure and components of compensation plans across all functions within Global Field Ops. You'll also present final recommendations to our Chief Revenue Officer, SVP of WW Sales, Chief Finance Officer, and VP of Finance. Perform look back analyses to assess the effectiveness of our compensation plans.Desired background BS/BA required. 1 to 2+ years of work experience in Sales Compensation Administration, Sales Operations, Compensation Design, Compensation related Analytics, or similar field in SaaS organizations. Experience with the Xactly Incent compensation platform. Power user proficiency with the MS Office suite (especially MS Excel and MS PowerPoint). There will be an Excel Test as part of the interview process. Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions, and craft recommendations and results into easily digestible messages, communications, and executive presentations. Very strong executive presence and engagement skills. Highly collaborative style with ability to influence and to adjust on the fly to new demands with a sense of urgency. Ability to thrive in a dynamic start-up environment. We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Stock options Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads) Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do. Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

title: Sr. Data Management & Integration Analyst
description: OverviewFor more than 40 years, East West Bank has served as a pathway to success. With over 130 locations across the U.S. and Greater China, we are the premier financial bridge between the East and West. Our teams of experienced, multi-cultural professionals help guide businesses and community members on both sides of the Pacific looking to explore new markets and create new opportunities. And our sustained growth and expertise in industries like real estate, entertainment and media, private equity and venture capital, high-tech and aviation help build sustainable businesses and expand our employees’ potential for career advancement.Headquartered in California, East West Bank (Nasdaq: EWBC) is a top performing commercial bank with an exclusive focus on the U.S. and Greater China markets. With assets of $37.7 billion, we’re ranked among the 30 largest banks in the United States and currently top 5 in “America’s 100 Best Banks” by Forbes, a list where we've consistently been in the top 15 since 2010. With a strong foundation, an enterprising spirit and a commitment to absolute integrity, East West Bank gives people the confidence to reach further.East West Bank is seeking a Data Management & Integration Analyst. The Data Management & Integration Analyst is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining solutions for managing and integrating data between operational systems, data repositories, and reporting and analytical applications. This position provides strong analytical and technical supports, and interacts with project teams, IT teams, and business stakeholders to drive business intelligence and data strategy across a wide range of projects.Responsibilities Work with business and technology teams to accurately gather and interpret requirements, specifications, data models, etc., for developing data integration, and reporting solutions.Act as liaison between IT and Business Units to provide solutions and business requirements for internal application development.Provide business requirements (logics) for report automation.Maintain functional and technical artifacts including design documents, data mappings, data architecture, data models and data dictionaries.Work with the database development and business intelligence teams to design, implement, and support end-to-end data solutions.Assess and document source data and quality, and coordinate with the business and technology teams to identify and resolve issues. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Information Systems and Computer ScienceExperience with an object oriented Language, such as C#, Java, or Python.Experience both consuming and contributing to a MS SQL Server hosted data warehouse.Strong proficiency with ExcelAnalytical and problem solving skills including troubleshootingAble to work under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlinesWell organized with meticulous attention to detailCan-do attitude, self-motivated and strong work ethicSelf-driven to identify areas of improvementMust be team-oriented with experience working on interdepartmental team projectsProduct knowledge inLoansDepositsBanking operations OptionsApply for this job online ApplyShareEmail this job to a friend ReferSorry the Share function is not working properly at this moment. Please refresh the page and try again later.Share on your newsfeed Connect With Us! Not ready to apply? Connect with us for general consideration.East West Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Reasonable accommodations for disability are provided to applicants and employees in accordance with applicable law.

title: Growth Data Analyst
description: We are looking for a data-driven individual to help us build out our marketing analytics capabilities and leverage data to help make our growth and marketing teams smarter.You will be instrumental in helping us design and implement key reports, and alerts about our marketing activities. This would involve selecting data management partners, working with large databases, and providing analyses to support growth and marketing team members. A key part of your work will revolve around building out the systems and strategy to provide insights into our media efficiency, customer journeys and user behavior. You will work on not only performing analyses but helping to structure our data architecture and ongoing data strategy. Responsibilities: Build SQL queries and reporting from existing data warehouse Help design and implement marketing stack architecture to get the right data to the right teams. Build API connections from data sources and ETL processes to our data warehouse Monitor and ensure ETL processes are completed as designed Build reports and dashboards using Tableau or similar to visualize data in easily digestible format for several audiences Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Build and maintain alerts structure that allows partners insight into changes in data. Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Work with cross functional teams to facilitate answering new queries as they arise Collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, operations, and customer support.  Requirements: 1-2 years experience in analytics, consulting, or other relevant role plus BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer or Data Science, Information Management or Statistics Or MS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer or Data Science, Information Management or Statistics Working knowledge of R, SQL and Python Programming experience (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Ability to thrive in fast paced, ever changing environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience working in ecommerce, media, or a startup environment a plus Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, HighCharts) a plus     We offer a competitive salary.This position is based in our San Francisco, CA office. US work authorization required.

title: Senior Product Analyst
description: Planning world domination? What a coincidence, we are too! With VRV recently reaching 1.5M registered users in less than one year, and Crunchyroll topping the 1M subscriber milestone; the team at Ellation is just getting started. We’re looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our team in San Francisco. Our offices in San Francisco, Tokyo, and Chișinău develop the product, design, engineering, marketing and content for Crunchyroll and VRV -- we are media and technology experts, and we lead with our digital-first DNA to create experiences for our passionate communities.   About you: Ellation is searching for a strategic analyst to join our Product Strategy team. This Product Analyst will be passionate about analyzing internal data, market trends, and sourcing data from various systems to offer long-term recommendations for our product roadmap. Responsible for both U.S. and International Markets, this Product Analyst will be responsible for planning and providing concise interpretations gathered from complex data. The OTT (Over-The-Top) Media Industry has emerged rapidly across the globe, therefore the ability to remain flexible with ambiguity in a dynamic environment is crucial to this role. This is a highly visible position that will interact with all product levels of Ellation. Responsibilities: Conduct Market Research to support international product growth for both VRV and Crunchyroll platforms Compile competitive analysis reports to include: feature sets, price points, market overlap and market differentiation Understanding of Product Management processes and interacting with Product Managers across the entire organization Business Analysis: Run complex Data Queries with SQL Query Builder & Knime to forecast Market Behavior trends Data visualization & working with external data sets Qualifications: 3+ years experience in Product Analysis for a Digital Media company or similar industry Experience with Data Analytics, BI, or Data Warehouse queries with modern SQL tools Familiarity with communicating product management functions such as Agile & Scrum, Sprints, Stand-Ups Familiarity with software project management tools such as JIRA Has worked in cross-functional team environments with product managers, designers, engineers and business teams MBA or similar degree (Data Analytics, Data Mining, Data Science) Benefits: Competitive salary Contribute to multiple open source products Employer-sponsored training and certifications Opportunity to participate in industry conferences Medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD, and life insurance Health care and dependent care FSA 401(k) plan with employer match Employer paid commuter benefit On-site gym, showers, yoga, and meditation classes Catered lunch and dinner 4 days per week Fun, passionate and skilled co-workers Pet-friendly environment

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Digital Platform
description: We Are EAAnd we make games - How cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. That's why we employ the most creative and passionate people in the industry.Fly your starfighter against the Empire. Score the winning goal.Yup - It's the coolest job on the planet!The Challenge AheadYou will utilize your outstanding organizational, communications, analytical and problem-solving skills in delivering results through collaboration with our business partners in the EA Digital Platform team (EADP) and teams in Technology Operations, Procurement, Global Sourcing, Accounting and Corporate FP&A. This position reports to the Finance Manager of EADP based in Redwood Shores, CA.What This Senior Financial Analyst Will Do At EAThis role will oversee Opex budgeting and spending for a portion of EA’s rapidly growing EADP team, which is central to achieving our company’s digital strategy. You will be managing costs across Commerce & Identity, Gameplay Services, System Testing and Developer Experience.You will need to have a strong foundation in traditional FP&A responsibilities including:Business Partnering – be the finance liaison to facilitate business owners’ successFinancial Reporting – lead financial reviews, conduct variance analysisMonthly and Quarterly Close – prepare accrual and reclass entries to reflect accurate accountingFinancial Modeling – analyze financial data to identify trends, savings opportunities, and ROIYou should also be able to use creative technical solutions to drive complex report development and reverse engineering of existing tools and reports leveraging large data sets.EA’s next great Senior Financial Analyst also needs to have:EducationalBachelor’s degree with a preference for Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, or AccountingExtra considerations for Graduate degrees4+ years’ experience in finance or business analytics, preferably supporting a technology organizationAccounting experience is a plusTechnicalExpert Excel knowledge and experience (there is a test!)Business Intelligence and visualization tools i.e. Power BI, Tableau, etc.One or more of the following preferred:Data Modeling and analyticsVBA experienceStructured Query Language (SQL)Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) and report cubes Communication and Critical ThinkingStrong overall communications, presentation, facilitation and diplomacy skillsDemonstrated ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, high volume, deadline-driven environmentBusiness acumen with understanding of functional linkages and ability to build strong professional relationships with business partners in both operational and financial rolesCreative problem-solving skills, ability to prioritize and work independentlyExcellent interpersonal and conflict resolution skillsAbility to balance multiple demands and work both independently and as part of a teamProfessionalism in dealing with all levels of management, staff and vendorsComfortable with ambiguous problems and independently developing solutionsStrong organizational skillsWhat's in it for YOU? Glad you asked!We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives on creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the “work hard/play hard” credo every day.EA is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description: Argo AI was founded to tackle one of the most challenging applications in computer science, robotics and artificial intelligence with self-driving vehicles. Argo AI is developing and deploying the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning and computer vision to help build safe and efficient self-driving vehicles that enable these transformations and more. The challenges are significant, but we are a team that believes in tackling hard, meaningful problems to improve the world.With offices in Pittsburgh, the Bay Area of California, Southeastern Michigan and Central New Jersey, we are building a high-performance team that is excited by complex engineering challenges and is passionate about making transportation safer, more affordable and accessible for all.The Senior Financial Analyst will serve as the point-of-contact to multiple engineering budget owners, managing monthly spend forecasts to budget, partnering on contract reviews, and building dashboards of key metrics. This individual will utilize financial analysis to inform data driven decision-making by our leadership team. This role requires incredible attention to detail, the ability to deliver in a high-growth, fast-paced environment, and the flexibility to support ever changing business needs.In addition to engineering support, this Senior Financial Analyst will partner with the Director of Real Estate; developing financial models for construction spending, tracking spend against budget, building monthly executive presentation decks, and partnering with accounting for appropriate expense recognition.You must possess strong relationship building and communication skills and understand the importance of data integrity and data visualization. Building reporting from the ground up and iterating to meet constantly developing needs should be something that excites you!What You’ll Do Partner with multiple budget owners from around the company Develop forecast models and processes for updating inputs for your business areas Report monthly budget vs actuals status & full year projections vs budget to business partners Investigate and explain variances in actuals versus forecast Collaborate with the accounting team to ensure material accuracy of monthly actual balances Perform ad hoc analysis Build and manage key metric dashboards Calculate and monitor value add / return on investment for multiple processes / projects What We’re Looking For Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or equivalent experience MBA preferred Experience working in a fast growing technology company or department Experience in related industry: tech, auto, hardware preferred Experience managing real estate financials preferred 3-5 years experience building financial forecast and budget models Experience with database management and / or other dashboarding Ability to adapt to a rapidly evolving environment Accounting knowledge a plus Netsuite experience preferred At Argo AI, we have a strong emphasis on creating a highly effective team environment. Thus, we seek candidates that can work effectively with others across a broad range of disciplines.Argo AI is an equal opportunity employer that believes in diversity as a strength.At Argo AI, You Can Expect Stellar Perks To Support Your Best SelfWe know it takes competitive benefits to fuel a team that works hard and enjoys the challenge. Full, high quality health/dental/vision insurance 401(k) plan with employer match Unlimited vacationCompetitive compensation packagesFlexible work locationsFree parking Catered lunches and snacksFitness reimbursementCommuter reimbursement Professional development reimbursement

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description: Snowflake started with a clear vision: make modern data warehousing effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Because traditional on-premises and cloud solutions struggle with this, Snowflake developed an innovative product with a new built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. Snowflake: Your data, no limits.As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will be a key player in supporting Snowflake’s financial planning processes as it relates to sales bookings and partner with our Sales organization to provide analytical support to executive leadership . The role will be hands-on in analyzing actual results to develop everything from historical trend analysis to models that can guide our forecasts.We are looking for someone who is passionate about finance and an eye for detail. You are comfortable analyzing financial information and business metrics to support and inform decision making. You are collaborative, with a strong understanding of finance, and capable of helping the company translate business decisions into financial projections to help scale and grow our evolving business.ResponsibilitiesBuild dynamic forecasting models for bookings and revenue to support business decisions and explore financial impacts of potential opportunitiesFacilitate the preparation, reporting and analysis of Sales’ annual budgets, quarterly forecast and monthly estimatesCraft reports for business leaders on a regular basis that provide insight into current quarter results compared to forecast and budgetWork with business leaders to establish and track key operating metricsPerform ad hoc financial analysis to support management and business decisionsAssist in the preparation of board materialsOur Ideal Candidate Will Have4-6 years of relevant work experience at a high growth technology company and/or in an investment banking environmentExperience working with a sales organization highly preferredStrong analytical skills, including superior financial modeling - need to have the ability and passion to build complex financial modelsBachelor’s degree with strong academic record, preferably in finance or economicsAbility to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environmentExceptional attention to detail and sound business judgementDetermined and resourceful; independently capable of seeking information, solving complex problems, compiling resources and delivering results Self-starter who is highly motivated to learn quickly and be a good team playerExcellent verbal and written communication skills About SnowflakeSnowflake Computing, the cloud data warehousing company, has reinvented the data warehouse for the cloud and today’s data. The Snowflake Elastic Data Warehouse is built from the cloud up with a patent-pending new architecture that delivers the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms and the elasticity of the cloud – at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. Snowflake can be found online at snowflake.net .Snowflake has been voted as one of the Bay Area Best Places to Work in 2015, 2016, and 2017. We are a place where people work effectively with the same values and vision. We focus on doing what is right for our customers, shareholders, and employees. We create great products, individually and as a team.Snowflake is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Lumentum’s commercial lasers enable advanced manufacturing techniques and diverse applications including next-generation 3D sensing capabilities. title: Data Analyst
description: Job DescriptionAuto manufacturers (OEMs) spend over $40B annually on consumer incentives. TrueCar wants to make that spend more effective, while at the same time providing exclusive savings to users of TrueCar sites. TrueCar is investing in our OEM Solutions and Insights team as a key priority for growth. The Analyst, OEM Insights & Solutions role offers a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of this entrepreneurial initiative. We’re looking for an enthusiastic and analytical solution-driver who thrives on engaging with data to help our business understand and grow our auto manufacturer incentive programs. This is an outstanding opportunity to dig deep into a key TrueCar priority, integrate data from a wide variety of internal and external sources, and produce compelling insights for growth.About The JobOwn all aspects of analytics, reporting, optimization insights and forecasting for TrueCar OEM incentive programsDevelop analytics and reporting capabilities for new OEM programs as they launchGather data from various sources, including TrueCar business intelligence, Omniture, TrueView, automotive data providers, and OEM to develop well-rounded and robust analysis on current programsProduce client-ready reporting covering program performance for both internal audiences and OEM clients, including monthly reporting to OEMs summarizing performanceUnderstand program results from key marketing and product initiatives and articulate the key drivers of program success or needs for improvementLeverage insights created by the OEM team into actionable recommendations to improve program performanceCreate program forecasts for current and prospective OEM programs. Present to key stakeholders (executives, finance, OEMs) and track performance vs. projections.Work closely with OEM client solutions managers to create proposal presentations for new OEM programsCollaborate with developers and data scientists from the business intelligence team to build a data infrastructure that supports OEM analyticsWhat You Need3-5 years corporate experienceBA or BSStrong analytical background, with experience identifying trends and key takeaways from dataStrong understanding of user needs in report and forecast requestsAbility to analyze, organize, and integrate large amounts of complex data into clear and concise presentations and status reportsOutstanding attention to detail and time-management skillsIn-depth knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPointExperience analyzing online metrics using MicroStrategy, Omniture or similar business intelligence tools requiredNice To HavePassion for the automotive and internet industries a plusDegree with coursework in a quantitative discipline (e.g. statistics, mathematics, econ, engineering)Location(s):Santa Monica Offices

title: Analyst
description: We are looking for a quantitative focused researcher that loves digging through and analyzing data to understand our users. You should be prepared to mind meld with our data stores to gain user insights. If that is you, then you will be joining our existing analytics team but with a more data driven angle to help understand what motivates our users. This requires working with our Business Intelligence, Customer Service, Product teams, and Design teams to help create relationships and a good workflow (don’t worry, they don’t bite). You will identify and investigate patterns in our data to inform, teach, and inspire product owners and design teams. So, if you want the opportunity to further improve Blizzard’s Shop and e-commerce, we would love to chat.ResponsibilitiesHelp the team understand user patterns using both internal and 3rd party data.Define problems and opportunities through analysis of current behaviors combined with product goals.Create and show solutions to create tagging strategies and work with engineering to ensure the right data is being measured.Deliver and follow through using Dashboards, reports and data-driven recommendations to evaluate designs and inspire new ideasRequirementsSerious passion for user-centered design.A minimum of 3 years’ experience as an Analyst, Researcher, Data Scientist or similar.Examples of study designs and analytics strategies.Examples of easily digestible story-based reports.Experience using Tableau, Google Analytics, Excel Power Pivot, and Google Tag Manager.Experience setting tagging strategy and implementing tags with tag managing solutions.Experience with web, mobile, and PC application tracking.Experience with specialized visualization tools (Tableau, Qlikview, Metric Insights, etc).Experience pulling data with SQL.Experience running A/B tests.Experience creating user focused KPI’s.A degree in Stats, Information Science, Social Science, Informatics, CS, MBA, Math, or related.Loves puppies (kittens, badgers, or other related juvenile animals are also ok).

title: Senior Manager of Marketing Data & Analytics
description: Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that combines content management, commerce, and customer insights. The Sitecore Experience Cloud™ empowers marketers to deliver personalized content in real time and at scale across every channel—before, during, and after a sale. More than 5,200 brands—including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, Dow Chemical, and L’Oréal—have trusted Sitecore to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.Position SummaryYou will take a leading role in the transformation of Marketing to a fully data-driven organization. Working cross-functionally, you will help develop and implement our data strategy including demand analytics in-depth, full understanding and analysis of our customer and prospect databases, collection and analysis of KPIs across marketing functions, and regular discussion with business leaders on understanding and taking action from our data.You will also develop and drive a customer database strategy by analyzing our current prospect and customer databases; identify gaps in our account or contact data; work with marketing leadership to develop a segmentation strategy; and develop and implement a data quality and governance program.You will develop a vision for data, analytics and insights in Marketing and the roadmap to execute the vision. Working with internal, external and cross-functional resources, you will deliver the technical infrastructure for data execution while providing ongoing business value through data-driven insights. You will form a close partnership with the IT’s BI group to ensure that Marketing data is accurately stored and reported in our global BI database. You will work in close alignment with each functional head in Marketing to ensure that operational metrics and KPIs are collected, stored, reported and regularly used for driving business improvements. Demand generation is our primary focus in Marketing, but you will also deliver KPI measurement across all Marketing functions including Content, Product, Enablement, Communications, Field and Web.You must be an excellent communicator able to report to all levels of the organization from the Board to the front-line. You must also be able to create alignment and collaboration across functions and teams. As a global company, you will need to manage internal customers and stakeholders around the world. Although you are technically capable, you have a proven ability to engage and drive insights in a business context.Responsibilities Drive the transformation of Marketing to a data-driven organization. You will be the owner of the vision and execution roadmap.Partner with the Marketing leadership to build robust KPI and reporting infrastructure to provide a regular cadence of transparency to Marketing operations and effectiveness. Drive ongoing improvements by identifying insights from the data.Develop and execute a customer database strategy by analyzing our customer and prospect databasesOwn and derive business insights from marketing analytics and functional KPIsDevelop and deploy a global CMO dashboard that provides clear understanding of all marketing functions and drills-down to specific objectives and measuresManage internal and external resources to execute the data, analytics and reporting requirements of all Marketing functionsDevelop demand metrics in-depth including multi-touch, cost-per-lead, velocity and related lead generation analyticsIn partnership with other Marketing functional leads, develop a segmentation strategy to support prospecting, nurturing, lead reconstitution, personalization and testingWork with IT to incorporate Marketing data to our global BI infrastructureIntegrate the Sitecore Experience Platform’s intelligence tools to our analytics processes Job Qualifications 7 or more years of marketing analytics, especially in a B2B environment 2 or more years of experience managing teamsExperience working in a matrix environment where creating collaboration and influence are required for generating resultsProven track record of creating improved business results through analytics, data and insightsExperience with managing and reporting on campaigns and activities in a B2B demand waterfall environmentExperience with marketing automation, testing and optimization and segmentation technologiesExperience and capability with SQL, Excel BI Tools, and data visualization tools such as Tableau or PowerBIAfter an offer is made and accepted, E-verify will be utilized to establish your identity and employment eligibility as required by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.
