title: Data Analyst
description: About UsCrossover Health is a healthcare organization attempting to redefine how healthcare is practiced, delivered, and financed. We design and deliver the inspiring environments, experiences, and relationships that mobilize people to engage and excel in their health. A passionate commitment to the patient experience creates the magic behind what we do. Crossover Health is currently seeking an experienced Reporting Analyst II for our corporate office in San Clemente.Job DescriptionDesigns, develops and programs methods, processes, and automates systems to consolidate and analyze structured & unstructured diverse data sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for Business Intelligence, Data Scientist, client services and Clinical Operations. Interacts with Business Intelligence, Data Scientist, product and service teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments. Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources. Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources. Develops models/simulations in support of pricing strategy.Job DutiesOperational Excellence (90%)Ensures effective operations across Clinic Operations and Corporate entities through the development, testing and deployment of online reporting tools and queries, including:New scripts and extension of capabilities of the current scripts to enable data extraction, analysis for all clients and and internal teamPerformance of testing to facilitate improvement in processing time, reliability and overall scripting standardizationAssist other business intelligence team members with the design and implementation of online versions of reporting tools, including dashboards and scorecards, utilized by clinic and client based field teamsCollaborates with the Business Intelligence team on software and improved system processesEnables coordination of population health analysis programs through collaboration with clinical teams in clai-ms-based analysis and analysis of other data sets to inform population health workflowsLeverages administrative and clinical data analysis to inform, influence and support Crossovers stakeholders in operationalizing operational and clinical improvementsProducts/Services (10%)Performs critical analysis in support of products necessary for expansion of services, including referral management, secondary care products, and related services.Education And ExperienceRequired Education, Experience and Skills:Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Physics, Economics or Computer Science, or equivalent experience.Minimum of 2 years of experience in data science and/or data analytics.SkillsExperience with Python 3.x (libraries such as Pandas, Dataframes, Numpy, and Scikit-learn).Data visualization experience (Tableau and Keynote).Experience with structured and unstructured data setsExperience in modeling and simulation, particularly cost modelingMySQL data extraction, transformation and loading.Quantifying and presenting results in laymen’s terms.ReportingThe Reporting Analyst reports to the Business Intelligence Manager.

title: Senior Manager, Customer Analytics
description: About Good Eggs At Good Eggs, we’re changing the world by changing the way we eat. We're revolutionizing how local food is sourced, bought and enjoyed—inspiring our community to cook and eat with the seasons. We connect people who love food directly with people who make it by delivering the most incredible food, straight to Bay Area homes, 7 days a week on the same day it’s ordered.The people who join us must share our commitment to making real, positive change. Because the better we work, the better the world we all live in. Here you’ll have the opportunity to build relationships—not only with each other—but with farmers, local food producers, and with our devoted community of customers. You’ll reduce our customers’ carbon footprints and improve the entire food ecosystem while you're at it. You’ll collaborate with and learn from your teammates and eat family-style lunches with them every day. About the roleReporting to the VP of Growth, you will grow and lead the consumer analytics team. You will partner with marketing, community, and product to understand digital user behavior across our site and app and interaction with marketing channels, providing insights and making proactive recommendations.  You will partner with the leads across the growth pillar in defining and answering questions, deriving analytical insights, communicating recommendations, and building a team culture that prioritizes data-informed decision-making. You will manage analysts building and tracking the primary growth metrics for the company by owning the growth dashboards and tracking the top level growth metrics. Your ability to tell stories with data in a way that resonates with technical and non-technical audiences alike will enable you to influence future consumer strategy at Good Eggs.  A strong analytical foundation, quantitative research experience, and SQL skills are a must. We face totally new and unique issues every day as we grow, and we’re looking for someone who will get their hands dirty and think creatively to craft solutions.   Major responsibilities Fuse large, disparate data sets with analytic concepts to inform consumer segment decisions, propensity models, marketing performance forecasts and cohort analyses Work on defined quarterly projects that provide data-driven analyses, insights, and recommendations for strategic business decisions in our growth initiatives. Manage and build out a small growth analyst team to aid in your work as well as own the growth teams metrics and reporting. Lead the growth roadmap for data maintenance and creation of new databases, partner with the data platform team to implement enhancements, and build and maintain Mode Analytics dashboards. Advise on testing and optimization of campaigns or initiatives. Requirements 6+ years of experience in a related and analytical role. 1-2 years of management experience Background in customer analytics (segmentation, churn prediction, propensity modeling) Proven problem solving and critical thinking skills Strong communication and business partnering skills, with experience clearly explaining complex concepts to people at all levels of an organization and across business and engineering teams A self-starter attitude with the ability to effectively prioritize and handle multiple projects at once, and roll with the punches as our needs, team, and company evolve. Airtight analytical acumen, including demonstrable SQL skills and Excel/Google Sheets modeling. Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Finance, Engineering), or equivalent experience. Prior experience in a growing operational startup or ecommerce/marketplace environment is a plus.

title: Business Process Analyst - Los Angeles, CA
description: As The Wonderful Company accelerates and pushes to expand its reach across our business, we are embarking on a digital and technological transformation to ensure our data, processes and technology support our ambitious goals. This is a highly visible effort, led by our company owner, with significant attention and investments over a multi-year timeframe. As part of this effort we are looking to build out, our IT Project Management Office(PMO).The Business Process Analyst is responsible for process modelling and change control of current and future business processes. This important customer-facing role will be responsible for conducting remote and on-site meetings for mapping process flow, identifying pain points and opportunities for improvements. The Business Process Analyst is responsible for training the user teams on business process terminology, modeling, symbols, and workflow. This role is responsible for documenting and compiling the process maps, evaluate their applicability to different business units, improvise them to create a central repository of all process maps that apply to all Wonderful businesses.This is the perfect opportunity for someone with a business process mapping and improvement background, experience and/or education to get involved in a large business transformation and ERP implementation initiative at the Wonderful companies.Here's What You'll DoResponsibilities may also include the following and other duties may be assigned: Plans and conducts business process mapping and optimization sessions Train users on process mapping tools and methodologies Interview, observe and collaborate with teams to effectively identify and decompose process information Develops and maintains current and future state process maps and narratives in a consistent format across businesses/departments. Facilitates the standardization of business processes and metrics across different businesses and product lines of The Wonderful Company Propose changes to business process in line with best practices (i.e. identify missing steps, steps that are duplicates/redundant, better way to sequence step than the order in which they are currently performed). Submit draft deliverables as each is complete, for review and approval. Hold debrief meetings with each department/business to provide clarifications and to address open issues/action items. Plans and conducts IT systems and reporting requirement collection sessions Collaborates with partner and IT teams in translating process maps and requirements during the design, build and testing phases of software systems Develops and presents status and metrics to executive teams Organizes, leads and facilitates cross-functional project and business teams Measures the performance of future state process after implementation. Reports the performance metrics to the executive members and plans continuous improvements. Surveys and analyzes best practices for business processes and software systems. Performs cost and benefit analyses.Minimum RequirementsHere's what you'll bring to the table: Bachelor's degree 5+ years' work experience or Master's Degree and 3+ years' of work experience Experience working in consumer products, food and beverage industry Business process mapping and management experience Experience providing work direction, coaching and guidance to project teams Detail oriented with the drive to follow through on critical and time sensitive tasks Advanced Microsoft Word, Excel & Power PointNice To Have Business process mapping experience for consulting companies in the past. Experience in ERP/Cloud Application Implementation Projects Microsoft Project, Visio and SharePoint Experience in ARIS process modelling tool Lean and/or Six Sigma Greenbelt or Blackbelt Certification Previous experience of working on multiple process mapping and business transformation projects. Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, team-oriented environment with multiple work streams and projects simultaneously Demonstrated achievement-oriented self-starter.Here's What We'll Bring To The Table Competitive benefits package including Medical (including 24/7 online access to a physician), Vision, Dental, and 401k with match eligibility. Subsidized gym membership. On-site subsidized high end cafe offering farm to table meals and snacks. Free on-site yoga classes and other wellness-focused activities. Wonderful Giving (Free tobacco cessation programs. Work-Life balance. All the FIJI Water and Wonderful snacks you may want in the office. Discounted tickets to various LA attractions. We are bicycle-friendly, with newly installed bicycle racks available to all LA-based employees.Headquartered in Los Angeles, The Wonderful Company is a privately held $4 billion global company dedicated to harvesting health and happiness around the world through its iconic consumer brands. The company's 9,000 employees worldwide are dedicated to bringing consumers everywhere the freshest, most wholesome pistachios, almonds, citrus and pomegranates; bottling the finest water and wines; and creating colorful bouquets that are sure to touch the heart. This commitment is reflected in the company's market share: Wonderful Pistachios is America's No. 1 tree nut brand and one of the top-selling salty snacks; Wonderful Halos is the No. 1 mandarin orange in America; POM Wonderful is the No. 1 100% pomegranate brand in America; FIJI Water is America's No. 1 premium bottled water brand; Teleflora is the No. 1 floral delivery service through local florists; and JUSTIN Wine has the No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon in California. A 2016 Nielsen study evaluating the familiarity, quality, and momentum of more than 2,500 leading brands revealed that Wonderful Company products dominated the top 10 lists of consumers across all generations, more than any other consumer goods company.The Wonderful Company's connection to consumers has health at its heart and giving back in its DNA. The company has a long-standing commitment to corporate social responsibility, including more than $120 million invested in environmental technologies and sustainability research, $45 million in charitable giving and education initiatives every year, $30 million toward the construction of a new charter school campus in California's Central Valley, and innovative health and wellness programs, including two new, free primary care clinics for employees and their dependents.To learn more about The Wonderful Company, its products and core values, visitThe Wonderful Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and with opportunities for advancement. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or other protected categories.

title: Business Data Analyst
description: Position: Business Data AnalystLocation: Thousand Oaks, CA 91320Duration: 12+ monthsTop 3 Skill Sets Data visualization expertise with financial data Programming expertise with financial and portfolio data (cost and resource) Excellent soft skills (working well in teams, etc)Ideal Candidate- Has background in pharmaceuticals or Biotech that has worked in finance or business operations with experience in research forecasting, portfolio planning, and expense analytics.Job DescriptionThe position will require the individual to build and implement data infrastructure and reporting for portfolio planning and provide technical expertise in business data analytics along with project management services (as mentioned below). The individual will create dashboards and data models to support prioritization of projects and resources. The individual will work in a matrixed environment to gather requirements and design solutions to enable both portfolio planning/prioritization as well as resource utilization and forecasting.SkillsTechnical expertise with data management and analytics (both theory and application), experience with financial analytics and analytical solutions design, project management experience, works well in teams and in a matrix environment. Tableau analyst experience is a must.Daily responsibilities: gathering requirements and designing solutions for business analytics, leading the execution of the reporting workstream in support of the Translational Sciences Product and Portfolio Management implementation.EducationRequired:Finance, Portfolio Management experience, Data analytics and visualization, ProgrammingEducationBSc, MBA preferred, 5-7 years in Business Data Analytics and handling Financial Data

title: Marketing Business Analyst
description: Care.com is the largest and fastest-growing technology platform for online care services, helping families, businesses, and corporate employees find high-quality care for their kids, pets, parents, and homes. We’re seeking innovative, entrepreneurial, and genuinely nice people to join our collaborative team. If that describes you, we want to hear from you! A career at Care.com offers countless ways to grow and have a real effect on a young, exciting company.   Overview Care.com's Marketing Team is looking for a Marketing Business Analyst to act as the primary data interpreter, analyzing and reporting on marketing programs and campaigns. As a Marketing Business Analyst, you will dive deep into our digital acquisition data and campaigns to uncover actionable insights and make recommendations that will influence the company’s strategic decisions. This position works within the marketing team to deliver business results and grow our customer base through data-driven insights and optimizations. You will define and measure high level ROI and provide recommendations for how to improve our customer acquisition and retention strategies. You will provide recommendations on spend allocation by channel based on the ROI of each. This role requires strong analytical skills, prior experience with performance marketing and the ability to clearly communicate recommendations based on your findings.   Specific Duties/Responsibilities: Analyze acquisition performance deliver actionable insights and recommendations based on CAC, LTV and ROI projections Proactively identify risk and opportunities for investment, constraint, or reallocation across the marketing channels that include, but not limited to: TV, Google Adwords, Bing, Facebook, Offline, etc. Develop reporting to monitor LTV and ROI Lead incremental CAC testing and provide spend recommendations based on the findings Outline goals and metrics for performance channels for both the offline and online space including TV Analyze large, complex marketing datasets in order to produce actionable insights Mine member data and explore external data sources to find, segment and target prospective and existing customers to drive growth and lifecycle marketing efforts Analyze Web site behavior using Web analytics tools to determine areas of site improvement Monitor data across all data sources, proactively identifying any accuracy issues and initiating corrective action to address and/or resolve any issues that ariseRequired Skills:You have experience with digital marketing channels and key problems (lifetime value, attribution, etc.) Microsoft Excel proficiency, including pivot tables, look up functions and charts Experience with SQL or similar relational database language Excellent analytical skills with the ability to distill complex thoughts and strategies into simple, actionable recommendations You have experience with experimentation, mix analysis, and cohort analysis Entrepreneurial mindset (self-motivated, tenacious, resourceful, no handbook necessary) Strong verbal and written communication and the ability to communicate highly complex ideas in a simple effective manner   Education/Other Pre-requisites: Understanding of Google Analytics; strong skills in MS Excel; experience with Blueshift, Amplitude, Branch or Kochava a plus Motivated to work hard in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment to help our growing business and to foster team culture Ability to effectively manage time, prioritize tasks and work within deadlines with little supervision Experience with R, Python, or related programming language preferred Knowledge of A/B testing and statistical principles (e.g. regression) preferred BA/BS in marketing, business, data science, or related major

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Salesforce
description: About The Job Senior Business Systems Analyst - Salesforce Job DescriptionWe’re looking for a “solution-minded” Business Systems Analyst that has a passion for data and is excited to work and build on the Salesforce platform. This role will be responsible for delivering enhancements to how we capture, manage, and analyze data across all of our processes so that the company’s leadership can derive insights to increase revenue.The Senior Business Systems Analyst will cover a broad range of topics, including: Rethink legacy processes with the goal of optimizing for better data collection and data management without slowing down our sales/marketing processesDevelop solution for existing processes that are responsible for sub-optimal data collection and enrichment.Rethink and optimize our data governance strategyOptimize our Gainsight implementation to predict churn and drive add-on ordersSupport the company’s initiatives related to the expansion of the Data Lake & Analytics capabilities This is a challenging role. The projects will have a noticeable and immediate impact on the company’s reporting and decision making process.Responsibilities Manage roadmap: Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business requirements, and systems goalsManipulate large sets of data; be comfortable with using tools for data enrichment, enhancement and correction such as Demand Tools, SQL database etcFacilitate discussions among business owners to determine the best solution to roadmap of enhancements through working sessions, new process mapping, and process redefinitionsDocument business process flows and requirements for the roadmap of enhancementsLead the delivery of key enhancements by directly making configuration changes in Salesforce or Developing the requirements / design specifications and delivering it to our internal development team for completionIdentify test criteria and test new functionality/enhancements Required Skills Track record of managing large data sets: extracting large data set out of Salesforce and reinserting it back as a different objectExperience with Demand Tools, Tableau integration with SalesforceExperience with SQL, Python a plusDegree in Computer Science, MIS, Math, Physics or comparable technical degreeMinimum of 5 to 7 years experience as a business systems analyst on the Salesforce platformKnowledge of Boomi a big plus but not requiredStrong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices and methodologiesFlexible and adaptable in regards to learning and understanding new technologiesExcellent problem-solving, analytical and investigative skillsAbility to conduct research into software-related issues and productsHighly self-motivated and directedKeen attention to detailProven analytical and problem-solving abilities OptionsApply for this job online ApplyShareEmail this job to a friend ReferSorry the Share function is not working properly at this moment. Please refresh the page and try again later.Share on your newsfeed

title: Economic Data Analyst
description: About The RoleTrulia is seeking a Data Analyst to join our Housing Economics Research team. If you are passionate about telling stories through data, have experience crunching large datasets, have gone deep with spatial data, are curious about issues related to housing, real estate or cities, and are looking to expand your analytical toolkit we would love to hear from you. In this position, you will have the opportunity to: Develop new competencies Create high-visibility products Collaborate with multi-discipline areas Grow your career Pitch new ideas Work on meaningful initiatives See products through the entire process Use the latest technologiesYou will use your analytical skills, enthusiasm for telling stories through data and knowledge of economics and statistics to build Trulia's brand and credibility. You will work closely with the rest of the research team to respond to data requests, conduct analysis on housing trends, and build data that drives local insight into neighborhoods. In partnership with the Trulia's Public Relations and Communications team, you will develop data and content for the research blog.About The TeamTrulia's research team is comprised of economists and analysts passionate about telling stories concerning the housing market using a wealth of proprietary and publicly available data. We work closely with our PR and Communications team to build Trulia's brand and credibility through original content on our research blog and as media spokespeople. Our research has been covered by premier news outlets such as the Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg, the New York Times and The Atlantic's CityLab.Who you are You have an undergraduate or Master's degree in the social sciences or a quantitative field (e.g. economics, political science, urban studies, statistics, applied math, or engineering). You have 1-3 years of work experience in economic analysis, real estate, data science, quantitative research, or urban analytics. You have strong analytical skills including expertise in Excel, comfort using SQL and an understanding of relational databases, fluency in GIS, and experience using a scripting language such as R or Python. Experience with geospatial analytics software such as QGIS or PostGIS, or packages such as PySAL or GeoPandas. You are well-versed in economic theory and statistical methods, either through coursework or on-the-job experience. You have demonstrated experience deriving insights from large, complex datasets, including publicly available microdata. You have strong written and verbal communication skills and enjoying working with multi-functional teams. You are passionate about housing, real estate, or urban affairs.Bonus Have experience creating compelling data visualizations using Tableau, D3, or Carto. Familiarity with command line tools and version control. Building and maintaining internal databases.Get to know usAt Trulia, we believe that when it comes to finding a home, what’s outside the front door is just as important as what’s behind it. That’s why we go beyond the typical listings and source insights straight from locals. We offer over 34 neighborhood map overlays to give people a deeper understanding of what living in a home and neighborhood is really like. We’re committed to helping people discover a place where they’ll love to live and where they will feel more connected to the community and to each other. It’s why we strive every day to help build a more neighborly world. Launched in 2005, Trulia is based in San Francisco and is owned and operated by Zillow Group.Zillow Group is owned, fueled and grown by innovators who help people make better, smarter decisions around all things home. We encourage one another at every level, and our efforts are supported by employee-driven, world-class benefits that enable us to enjoy our lives outside the office while building fulfilling careers that impact millions of individuals every day.Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

title: Program Financial Analyst
company: Composite Engineering, Inc., a Kratos Defense & Security Company
description: The Program Financial Analyst supports Program Management in coordinating and managing financial planning and control activities in accordance with the Company’s Earned Value Management System (EVMS) and contract requirements, including analysis of weekly and monthly actual costs incurred against budgeted, variance analysis, estimates to complete, and preparation of Management Review Packages. The Program Financial Analyst works directly with Program Management and is focused on assisting Programs in forecasting, understanding Program Financial variances and providing solution alternatives. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Establishes, monitors, and evaluates EVMS policies, methods, operating procedures and practices as well as organizational compliance and performance. Works with Program Management to develop revenue recognition methodology on contract items, forecasts, baselines, schedules, contract logs, baseline change requests, and variance analysis. Presents with analysis monthly program financial results. Participates in program reviews with internal staff and/or external customers. Coordinates and advises program management, functional managers, control account managers and executive management on EVMS principles. Works closely with IPTs and program team to provide financial support. Prepares and presents EVMS and financial reports and recommendations to management. Works with all departments to provide financial analysis and guidance on any and all new projects. Consults with Program and Cost Account Managers to develop variance analysis and corrective actions associated with earned value management reporting. Coordinates with Contracts, Program Management and finance to monitor contract value change, funding, and issues of work authorization. Improves program cost reporting (internal & external), budgeting, and cost collection processes and systems. Reconciles inconsistencies between cost reporting data and EVMS results. Provides budgetary and forecast inputs related to revenue and margin projections to corporate planning. Ensures integrity of data reported between all systems: CINCOM, COBRA, and budget systems. Maintains Financial Policies and Procedures. Develops justification, reviews, and approves monthly revenue recognitionRequired Experience:   Program Financial Analyst Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting or Finance. 5-7 years work experience with Financial Analysis, Earned Value Management Systems experience may be required depending on position Strong working knowledge and experience with all financial functions including Cost Reporting, Estimating, Cost Management, and Operating Plan/Forecast preparation. Working knowledge of Earned Value Management (EVMS), including CPR (formats1-5) and CFSR reporting may be required. Knowledge of all contract types: CPFF, CPA/IF, FFP, FPI, T&M & IDIQ. Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, Word and MS Project. May be required to obtain and maintain a U.S. security clearance at the appropriate level (requires U.S. Citizenship).WORK ENVIRONMENT / PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Primarily office environment: desk, telephone, keyboard/mousing/writing and interface with internal personnel. Routine sitting and use of computer/telephone/copier equipment, some walking and reaching, active listening and thinking. While performing the duties of this job the employee is regularly required to sit, hold, grasp, type, talk, and hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. May work extended hours or weekends, especially around Month End and Fiscal Year End closing cycle.   Office and/or manufacturing environment.   Some local travel may be required.

title: Payroll Specialist
description: The BBSI Payroll Specialist position is a key member of business unit that consults on a broad range of organizational and management Key Performance Indicators relevant to the Business Owner and Business Unit (BU) goals. The primary objectives of the Payroll Analyst is to process perfect and timely payrolls, and most importantly, delivers timely and relevant information to BU Members and contribute to the revenue retention and profitability of the Branch. This person must demonstrate strong business acumen, and possess an entrepreneurial spirit with a genuine desire to proactively and consistently deliver value to our clients and internal teams. This position reports to the Area Manager and works in partnership with other positions within the business unit and branch. ResponsibilitiesAct as business owners’ advocate Drive Tier movement within client companies Run perfect and timely on- and off-cycle payrolls for multiple client companies Become an expert in new client onboarding, BBSI payroll, CRM (Salesforce), timekeeping and HRIS systems. Identify systems options to achieve better results for clients and BU members Perform on-site client payroll training, HRP web training and use of all feature functionalities relevant to client. Perform relevant culture improvement planning with client stakeholders, based on Owner Vision. Ensure client has been trained to understand EDD tax refunds payable to BBSI after relationship conception. Perform EFTs, aging follow up, net calculations, EDD benefit audits, and benefits billing administration Become subject matter expert and Data Analyst of relevant pay related and claims related information. Specifically: support Injured Worker Management to drive data to BU members in order to prevent litigation and drive cultural improvement in client companies by driving injured worker care to return to work status, and claims closure. Become subject matter expert on client data, including by not limited to: Turnover, ongoing or seasonal headcount fluctuation; Time & attendance including, but not limited to bridges, import & export requirements, and standard & custom reporting requirements of client companies. Ensure client stakeholders are fully trained on HRP Web, including but not limited to data entry and file maintenance to include employee on-boarding, changes and terminations. Continue ongoing client training as new technology and feature functionality becomes available. Full utilization of CRM as designed by BU protocol. Successful execution of CORE responsibilities, as designed by BU protocol Full ownership of duties listed above and other duties and responsibilities as assigned Qualifications 5+ Years payroll experience in a high volume, fast paced environment Impeccable business acumen and the ability to interact with external clients CPP preferred Associates or Bachelors Degree required

title: IT-Data Analyst / Bl Analyst
description: Job Description Data Analyst who can model multidimensional data sets, with the ability to answer key business questions and learnings, identifying opportunities and areas for improvement. Must be analytical and creative, very comfortable with business intelligence tools and the ability to organize data in a digestible and meaningful format. Must be proactive and able to articulate learnings at all levels from both a business and technical perspective. Must be able to demonstrate design and development of data model as well as reports. Must be able to create and maintain design documents of data and reports.Core Responsibilities Include Apply your knowledge of quantitative analysis, data mining and data visualization to facilitate understanding of our users Analyze conversion and engagement funnels to identify improvement opportunities Provide insights for tests to improve core company business metrics Collaborate closely with Product, Growth and Engineering teams Establish and build processes to create a data-driven culture Create experiments and drive understanding of user behaviors, macro trends and business processes Inform and influence decisions on product, marketing and launches Build and analyze data dashboards and reports Provide recommendations on how to improve key metricsQualifications 5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or BI Analyst. Advanced knowledge of and experience with data analysis Experience working in SQL with the ability to work on several business applications and writing MS SQL queries. Knowledge & experience using business intelligence reporting tools such as MS SSRS. Knowledge & experience using VB/VBA to create custom reports through ODBC. Knowledge & experience using Python or C# . Power BI or Tableau experience is a plus. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Ability to work with cross-functional teams and disciplines. Degree of BS or BA.

title: Business Analyst
description: If you are looking for a challenging position at an innovative company, this could be a great opportunity for you. Mission Bell is an architectural millwork company that is changing the way the Bay Area looks at wood, and we are adding to our growing company. Take a look below to see of our Business Analyst opportunity is a good fit for you!What Mission Bell Brings To You Competitive pay Certified Great Place to Work We pay 90% of the cost for medical insurance We pay 100% of vision and dental for the employee 401k retirement options - with employer contributions Eleven days paid vacation - increases at your 2nd, 5th and 10th year What Our Business Analyst Will Do Run KPI’s for the Supply Chain and Manufacturing Departments Management of actions to improve KPIs, both inside the company and with the supply base using DMAIC process model Perform comprehensive supply and demand analysis to predict material shortages Aid in assessing manufacturing processes and address process related questions and issues with a view to increase speed and capacity Partner with IT to represent operations as we transition from legacy systems to a best in industry MES/MRP system Produce thought leadership in the field of analytics to grow organization’s utilization of data to make intelligent business decisions Here's What You Need 3+ years of analyst experience Bachelor’s degree in a related field required Advanced Excel (macros, pivot tables), SQL and SQL server management studio; Vizio, Tableau/Power BI Python, R, C#.NET is highly desired Six Sigma Green Belt or higher is highly desired Manufacturing/Supply Chain experience is highly desired Experience with growing companies is highly desired

title: Data Network Analyst - The California State University
description: Description(Job #18-40) Network Analyst-12-Career, Data Network Analyst, $4,372-10,478/month. Appointments will be determined by education and experience. Expected starting salary range is between $5,000-$6,000/month. This is a full-time, benefited, 12-month, exempt position with a one-year probationary period in Information Technology Services.The Place: Known for its quality academic programs and its hands-on approach to learning, Humboldt State University has a well-earned reputation as one of the best primarily undergraduate public universities in the United States. The residential and rural campus of 7,500 students is nestled between mountains, giant redwood trees, and breathtaking Pacific Ocean beaches. The local area offers many outdoor recreation opportunities as well as a full range of dining, cultural, and entertainment opportunities, all without the hassle and expense of a major metropolitan area. Local K-12 schools consistently rank in the top 10% in the state, and the local produce is second to none. Humboldt State University also benefits from being part of the world’s largest university system, the 23-campus California State University (CSU).The Job: This is an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic and creative environment. The successful candidate will become part of a small, highly skilled team with responsibility for managing a campus-wide wired and wireless network. Over the next year we will be doing some exciting proof of concept mesh networking work and migrating VPN services to our Palo Alto firewalls. Duties include:Troubleshooting wireless throughput problems that are slowing down classroom video streaming;Working with a cross-functional team of specialists to find the best way to roll out a new service to the campus;Adding wired or wireless network capacity to buildings;Using network management tools to investigate security incidences; andConfiguring firewalls to allow traffic to pass.Minimum Qualifications: A basic foundation of knowledge and skills in technical, information network systems, including a working knowledge of telecommunications and transmission technologies, including network architecture, topologies, protocols, programming applications, and interfaces appropriate to the defined work area and assignments. This foundation would normally be obtained through a bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, industrial technology, telecommunications, or a related technical field, or through equivalent training and experience. Maintaining a valid California driver license and the willingness and ability to work irregular hours as a part of an on-call rotation are conditions of employment.Required Knowledge, Skills And AbilitiesThorough knowledge of telecommunications and transmission technologiesAbility to demonstrate competence in independently applying technical judgment to standard and nonstandard applications and systems, solving a wide range of problems and developing practicable and thorough solutionsEffective communication and listening skillsDemonstrated commitment and/or experience promoting and fostering a working environment that is supportive of individuals from diverse backgroundsWorking knowledge of current data networking systems, protocols, and industry standards and a solid grounding in TCP/IP fundamentalsAbility to configure routing on a set of switches and routersAbility to interpret monitoring reports and resolve connectivity and throughput problems as they impact servicesAbility to configure VLAN tagging and routing protocolsAbility to install and troubleshoot network support services: DHCP, RADIUS, DNS, etc.Ability to work independently on long term projectsAbility to design and implement network architecture and topologyAn understanding of the dynamics of diversity in higher education and a demonstrated ability to incorporate this understanding, as appropriateAbility to move and carry 50 lbs.Ability to work in confined spaces and on laddersAbility to distinguish colors sufficiently to correctly punch down and terminate cablesPreferred QualificationsTwo years of relevant experience performing duties associated with the duties listed aboveBICSI CertificationExperience with Alcatel Lucent EquipmentExperience working in an enterprise network environmentPalo Alto Networks firewall experienceExperience working with Enterprise Aruba Wireless ControllerApplication Procedure: To apply, qualified candidates must electronically submit the following materials through Interfolio:https://apply.interfolio.com/52544Letter of InterestResume or Curriculum VitaeContact information for at least three professional referencesHSU Employment History Form (https://forms.humboldt.edu/employment-history-form)(NOTE: This form replaces the HSU Employment Application form, which should no longer be used. Download the HSU Employment History Form and save it as a PDF file prior to filling it out. If the form is filled out on line (accessed via a web browser), content WILL NOT be saved.The Human Resources & Academic Personnel Services office (located in Siemens Hall room 212) has a computer station and front office staff available for applicants requiring assistance.Application Deadline: The deadline to submit application materials is 11:59 p.m. on Wednesday, August 1, 2018. To be notified in the event this recruitment re-opens for a subsequent review of applications, send an email to careers@humboldt.edu that includes the job number (18-40) and applicant’s last name in the subject line of the message.HSU is committed to enriching its educational environment and its culture through the diversity of its staff, faculty, and administration. Persons with interest and experience in helping organizations set and achieve goals relative to diversity and inclusion are especially encouraged to apply.It is the responsibility of the applicant to provide complete and accurate employment information. Incorrect or improperly completed applications will not be considered for vacancies. Any reference in this announcement to required periods of experience or education is full-time activity. Part-time experience or education--or activities only part of which are qualifying--will receive proportionate credit. In accordance with applicable Collective Bargaining Agreements, preference may be given to the campus applicants covered by these agreements. However, positions are open to all interested applicants, both on and off campus.Evidence of required degree(s), certification(s), or license(s) is required prior to the appointment date. A background check (including a criminal records check, employment verification, and education verification) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with the CSU. Certain positions may also require a credit check, motor vehicle report, and/or fingerprinting through Live Scan service. Adverse findings from a background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for the position.Humboldt State University is committed to achieving the goals of equal opportunity and endeavors to employ faculty and staff of the highest quality reflecting the ethnic and cultural diversity of the state. Additional information about Humboldt State University can be found at www.humboldt.edu.Humboldt State University is a Title IX/Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected status.Compliance with the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act (CANRA) and CSU Executive Order 1083 Revised July 21, 2017 (EO 1083) is a condition of employment. CSU employees in positions with duties that involve regular contact with children or positions which supervise such employees are designated as Mandated Reporters under CANRA and are required to comply with the requirements set forth in EO 1083. Upon appointment to this position, the successful candidate(s) will be notified of and required to acknowledge their CANRA reporting status.Additionally, all CSU staff and faculty receive training annually on their obligations in responding to and reporting incidents of sexual harassment and sexual violence. You will be notified by email when you are required to take this mandated training.

description: Our client -a global software and services firm is currently hiring for Senior Analyst Relations Specialist   as per details below The Analyst Relations Specialist will collaborate with experts in product management, engineering, sales, marketing and communications to build and nurture strong internal relationships critical to engaging with leading analyst firms and influencers. Good communication, both verbal and written.Good collaboration and interpersonal skills./ Good presentation skills.Executive presence to counsel senior management regarding the market, competitive landscape and analyst outlook. Must have the tenacity, determination and patience to challenge conventional thinking and processes.

title: Sr. Business Analyst – Supply Chain
description: Job DescriptionThermo Fisher Scientific is seeking a talented Business Systems Analyst for Supply Chain and Manufacturing. Must be self-confident, assertive and self-motivated. The individual will be both hands-on and lead teams to plan, design and implement effective business and systems solutions for optimization of supply chain operations. This includes gathering and analyzing data in support of proposed projects and systems requirements. The individual will craft and manage the roadmap for supply chain systems by partnering with supply chain leaders and operations to drive business value and continuous improvement. Will also lead new system implementations.Qualifications (required)Background in planning, developing, implementing, and maintaining SIOP systems for demand planning, manufacturing resources planning, distribution resource planning, procurement, and direct sourcing.Experience with Oracle VCP including Demantra and ASCPStrong leadership skills demonstrated by managing teams and projects for system implementations.Strong analytical and problem solving skills and ability to mentor and develop those skills in others.Experience with manufacturing systems and integration manufacturing with SIOPStrong data analysis skills including data standardization, data clean up, and data consolidation.Experience partnering with business stakeholders to create project proposals including high level system design and cost to achieve10+ years’ experience in software development (SDLC) as a team lead, project manager and/or systems analyst. The majority of those years should include experience end to end in SDLC for the full duration of projects.7+ years’ experience with manufacturing execution systems (MES) architectureBachelor's degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field. MS and/or MBA preferred.Other Qualifications (not Required But a Plus)Life Science industry backgroundSoftware development experience and understanding of Oracle technologiesPractical experience in project management and/or implementing and leading Agile Scrum planning and developmentExperience with GMP manufacturingExperience with Camstar and TrackSYS MESPMP Certification or Scrum Master CertificationOther Skills:Strong written and oral communication skills including the ability to communicate with internal customers and all levels of management in a non-technical manner.Strong customer focus and proven ability to build strong working relationshipsProvide guidance and consultation to supply chain and manufacturing teamsAbility to organize, disseminate information efficiently, gain consensus and set expectationsStrong time management and prioritization abilities, taking ownership and follow up of issuesAbility to lead teams and contribute to the overall success of a team as well as work independently and handle multiple tasks.Must be self-confident, assertive and self-motivated.If you are an individual with a disability who requires reasonable accommodation to complete any part of our application process, click here for further assistance.Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

title: Senior Research Analyst
description: Senior Research Analyst San Francisco, Redwood City We don’t just collect data, we connect data. YouGov is an international data and analytics group with the ambition to become a unique part of the global internet infrastructure - like Google for search, Facebook for social, Amazon for retail, we want it to be YouGov for opinion. Our value chain is a virtuous circle consisting of a highly engaged online panel, innovative data collection methods and powerful analytics technology. From the beginning we had one simple idea: the more people are able to participate in the decisions made by the institutions that serve them, the better those decisions will be. We are a global online community for millions of people, and thousands of organizations, to engage in a continuous conversation about their beliefs, behaviors and brands, and provide a more accurate portrait of what the world thinks.   We are searching for a Senior Research Analyst to interpret data, create reports and make recommendations based upon the research findings. The Senior Research Analyst applies qualitative and quantitative techniques to interpret the data and produce substantiated recommendations.   What will I be doing day to day?Market Research Analysts will analyze primary market research data and manage projects in their day-to-day role Communicating with staff to understand business objectives Designing questionnaires and moderator guides to ensure the necessary data is captured Managing research projects throughout the process Conducting in-depth data analyses using traditional and advanced methods Authoring reports in PowerPoint or Google Slides that identify key findings and actionable recommendations   What do I need to bring with me?Bachelors Degree (or higher) and previous market research required Detail oriented who can also multi-task, handling many different projects Must possess problem-solving skills using deductive reasoning and understanding Strong analytic and critical thinking skills Exceptional writing abilities Advanced Expertise with Excel, specifically using vlookups, pivot tables and VBA Expertise with PowerPoint, Google Docs, Sheets and Slides Experience using SPSS, SAS or R is required   Some additional information . . . This is a full time role based in San Francisco, CA.

title: Accounting Analyst (Accounts Payable)
location: 11858 La Grange Avenue 2nd Floor, Los Angeles, CA 90025, US
description: About Us ExED (www.exed.net) is a nonprofit organization that fosters the development and management of high performing charter schools. We believe that every child should have access to a high-quality public education, especially children in educationally underserved communities. ExED is the only nonprofit service provider in Southern California and operates offices in Los Angeles and San Diego. ExED works with more than 100 charter schools serving more than 44,000 students. ExED provides a range of services that support both new and existing charter schools, including facility financing services; "CFO" services such as accounting, budgeting, financial reporting, payroll processing, and public funding compliance; and compliance and data management services. These services help our clients operate efficiently, build financial plans to meet short-term and long-term objectives, and secure affordable facilities all of which enable school leaders to spend more time working to improve student achievement at their school. Position Overview The Accounting Analyst position is based in ExED's Los Angeles office  - which is comprised of over 65 team-members who work with charter schools to ensure their success. The position offers a detailed-oriented, highly organized professional opportunity to apply accounting knowledge in a unique way - by helping charter schools efficiently allocate and manage their public dollars. The Accounting Analyst will work in a collaborative, team-based environment with an Accounting Associate, Accounting Manager, and Vice President of School Finance, who oversees the operations of the entire team. The Accounting Analyst's primary responsibility will be Accounts Payable. Primary Responsibilities Accounting & Payroll: Coding and entering invoice and reimbursement information into accounting system. Reviewing vendor invoices, fulfilling check requests, scanning and storing documents, and maintaining vendor, school employee and accounting files. Responding to client and vendor inquiries and requests for information. Assisting in payroll processing and preparing journal entries as needed. Assisting in other activities, such as preparing monthly financial statements and completing compliance documents required for government oversight. Completing other duties as assigned. Financial Reporting: Prepare all financial reporting to the public chartering agencies of clients. Prepare monthly financial statements for client schools. Prepare information requested by auditors at year-end. Be able to explain journal entries made. Client Management: Directly interface with charter school clients to address inquiries and provide process guidance. Train school site office managers on accounting procedures and internal controls. Visit client sites and assist on ad hoc or special projects as needed. Education and Experience Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or related field. Prior experience in AP preferred. Knowledge of GAAP, business principles and standard operating practices. Knowledge of accounting systems required. Knowledge of MIP preferred. Computer skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint). Team player with a demonstrated ability to initiate and maintain effective and cooperative professional relationships. Strong organizational skills; a self-starter who can prioritize and multi-task. Strong writing and communication skills. Strong analytical skills. Interest in and commitment to public education. Compensation and Benefits Compensation is commensurate with experience, please be sure to submit your requirement. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability and a 403(b) retirement package and a generous vacation, sick, and holiday allocation. To Apply Please submit your resume, cover letter, and salary expectations via our online application system. ExED is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Data Analyst/Scientist - San Francisco
description: Data Analyst/ScientistSan Francisco, CADataFull-timeEverlane is seeking a Data Analyst/Scientist to join our Data and Analytics team, where you’ll use data to help us build a better understanding of how our product works, who our customer are, and what drives our company’s growth.As a team, we lean on a full-stack set of methodologies and tools to solve these problems, taking a data science problem from an initial open ended question to the eventual business implementation of a model. The subject areas that you will impact span the entire company, from helping our digital product team evaluate new opportunities of improvement on our website, to building models around the purchase preferences of our customers. The Job Work with business stakeholders to create metrics and self service reporting around key questionsCreate and deploy custom models to understand a diverse set of business problems including customer preferences, marketing performance, and inventory patternsDesign and analyze rigorous experiments aimed at understanding customer behaviorEnsure the integrity of the vast data sources feeding our analyticsThe Qualifications BA/BS degree in a quantitative or computing focused degree4+ years of experience wrangling and analyzing large datasets to solve open ended business problemsExpertise in R, Python, or another data science suitable languageExpertise in SQL extending to knowledge of database design and warehousing conceptsStrong fundamentals in statistics and probability, including formal statistical modeling and experimental designStrong communicator, especially when distilling complex concepts for a general audienceAble to translate qualitative questions into an analytical framework, including recognizing when simplicity is for the bestNice to have: working on data problems in a distributed framework, i.e. Spark, Hadoop At Everlane, we’re rethinking the way retail works. We have no middlemen taking their cut and no brand markups. Instead, we design our own luxury basics and sell them exclusively at a fraction of the traditional retail price. Since launching in November 2011, Everlane has attracted over 1,300,000 members and has been featured in The New York Times, New York Magazine, The Economist, Elle, and GQ.Please note before submitting an application: as a company, we take hiring very seriously. Interviewing with Everlane may include video and phone interviews, written projects, and/or on-site interviews. Although we are unable to follow-up with each and every applicant, we do our best to run a thorough process for candidates with whom we identify a potential fit.Everlane provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

title: Brand Manager, New Product Development and Commercialization
description: Who we are: Navitas (Nah-V'-tas) is Latin for energy, and it certainly describes how we operate. We're a fast moving, hard-working, friendly crew who care about our team just as much as we care about the superfood plants that feed and sustain us. Fast growth means hard work and the need for lots of superfoods. Our blenders are always mixing up superfood concoctions to keep us going and we take every opportunity to tell you about the benefits of our many products. We cultivate an environment where we each get a chance to be ourselves and do the work we enjoy. We like to eat superfoods and practice yoga at the office just as much as we love a good sports game and happy hour. Most importantly, we are all aligned around the premium, organic superfoods we create and making them available to more people. Our team of over 100 is based in Marin County, California, just 20 minutes north of the Golden Gate Bridge. Our 50+ products are now sold at more than 5,000 stores in the US, Canada and abroad. Position Summary: The Brand Manager of New Product Development & Commercialization manages the product development pipeline from concept to commercialization, they develop product briefs, analyze market opportunities and work with a cross functional team to bring products through a complete launch cycle. This role is responsible for the status of budget, contracts and timelines related to new product development projects. The Brand Manager works with the VP of Marketing and other members of the brand and sales teams to develop the product launch plan and product messaging including measuring performance post launch. The role incorporates strategic planning, project management, packaging development, consumer research, contractor management, vendor relations, business analysis and consumer marketing.Primary ResponsibilitiesStrategic Planning - Assist in developing a short and long-term product development timeline that represents our brand as a pioneer in the superfood space and also caters to current consumer needs. Responsibilities include: NPD strategic planning, analyzing market data pre and post launch, maintaining product development pipeline timelines and deliverables and executing a market launch plan. Project Management- Develop overall project timelines around key marketing initiative. Help ensure open communication and smooth workflow between marketing and cross-functional divisions (e.g., sales, operations, graphics). Develop new products from concept to commercialization using the gate process, facilitating cross functional communication on project status, holding cross functional team members accountable for deliverables and moves team toward accomplishing established deadlines and goals. Manage junior team members or outside contractors or vendors as related to NPD needs and projects. Build launch plans for the marketplace including developing talking points, launch decks, sales tools, facilitating recipe development. training aides and training materials. Business Analysis- Monitor and analyze branded and competitive activity by utilizing point of purchase data (SPINS), including distribution, sku performance, pricing, and category trends. Monitor sales activity, work with the Data Analyst to analyze results and identify areas of risk and opportunities. Develop recommendations based on findings. Marketing Mix- Present marketing initiatives (consumer and trade) for new products. Assist in development and execution of the annual marketing plans to increase sales, product awareness, velocity and profitability. Builds sales decks and sell in materials for new products. Ensure compliance with brand standards along various points of execution and plan development. Budget- Manage marketing budget as it relates to NDP process and marketing of new products. Evaluate ROI for program opportunities, make recommendations for reallocation of funds throughout the year based on priorities and current insights. Creative Development: Help manage the graphic team’s activities and projects, providing direction for necessary marketing materials and packaging development. Manage product packaging process and timeline based on production needs.   Job QualificationsPassionate about natural food products, our consumers and superfoods. Inspired by Navitas Organics brand positioning and look and feel. Must have a minimum of 5 years of experience in Brand Marketing. 1-3 years of consumer-packaged goods brand management experience (Natural Foods space preferred) 1-3 years’ experience in Product Development or Product Commercialization Bachelor’s degree required, MBA preferred Understanding of the following areas: packaging, advertising, promotions, coupons, point-of-sale marketing Familiarity with traditional trade channels: natural, food, drug, mass, club Experience working with point of purchase data (Spins, Nielsen, IRA) Experience managing multiple projects from concept through completion while working with various, cross-functional, internal and external groups to deliver meaningful results on time and on budget with limited direction Experiencing leading the creative process, writing copy and giving creative direction to a team Highly organized with strong, proven project management skills Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Ability to anticipate needs, innovate, multi-task and excel in a fast-paced environment Advanced level knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Thrives in an entrepreneurial environment, can be scrappy, creative & resourceful while also building structure and process. Hands-on team player who can also operate independently Self-confident, collaborative, knowlegeable and an analytical thinker Ability to handle daily work details accurately, as well as other projects, and dive-in and learn the business Our Values, in word and deed

title: Business Analyst/Data Analyst
description: *NOTE: AT THIS TIME WE CAN ONLY SUPPORT GREEN CARDS OR US CITIZENS* Description Company: Astreya Partners are at the cusp of the new way of working.  We provide IT services and Managed Performance to some of the most exciting companies on the planet.  Our delivery model helps our clients be Positively productive by matching exceptional people to on-site teams delivering world class IT service.  With engineers in over 30 countries and 70 cities around the world we are a truly global company working with truly global clients.   Role Description: As part of our customer's ITS organization, CorpOps is responsible for delivering a world-class support experience to employees. The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for implementing the team's operational support strategy by working directly with service owners and engineers across our organization to catalogue and assess services, document support designs, prioritize, and implement processes to support the applications they manage. In addition, this individual will help craft our customer's critical incident response strategy. Your main duties and responsibilities: Partner with stakeholders to identify, curate, and maintain a catalogue of services, process designs, and runbooks Conduct quantitative/qualitative analysis on the performance of critical  IT management processes and develop recommendations to improve service delivery Lead efforts to improve, automate and align with current processes to deliver world class support to our internal users Develop processes and training to support services Curate and maintain accuracy and consistency of related support documentation and runbooks (Self help articles, macros, training material, support flows, & other documentation) Business reporting for both standard and adhoc requests Development of Metrics and KPI’s to measure performance Your qualifications:5+ years relevant work experience in IT operations or related field Knowledge of IT Service Management best practices and ITIL frameworks Excellent communication skills with the ability to work with technical/non-technical audiences at all levels of the organization Strong business acumen with experience in operations, analysis and project management 2+ years of direct experience working on projects or initiatives relating to data discovery, prep or maintenance Demonstrated customer service experience and/or strong interpersonal skills ITIL v3 Foundation preferred Relevant SQL and Tableau experience What can Astreya offer you? Working with some of the biggest firms in the world as part of the Astreya delivery network Employment in the fast growing IT space providing you with brilliant career options for years to come Introduction to the new ways of working and awesome technologies Career paths to help you establish where you want to go A company-wide mentoring program to advise you along the way Online training courses through CBT-nuggets to upskill you Performance management system to provide you with meaningful, actionable feedback Dedicated management to provide you with a point of leadership and care Internal promotion focus.  We love to build people from within. Numerous on-the-job perks Peer Recognition Astreya Partners, Inc. is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. We evaluate qualified applicants on merit and business needs and not on race, color, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status or any other factor protected by law.

title: Compensation Analyst
description: Position SummaryTotal Rewards is an essential element of the Marqeta experience and Compensation is at the core of our rewards programs. The Compensation Analyst is an integral part of the People team and responsible for evolving, managing and supporting all facets of our rewards programs. As a Compensation Analyst, you will work closely with the People and Finance teams as well as key functional leaders to develop and maintain compensation programs that enable Marqeta to attract, retain, and motivate our team. You will help lead the strategy, design, communication, , implementation, and administration of our compensation programs that range from job leveling/matching, submitting salary surveys, merit process planning, analytics and compliance. You will use your strong analytical and data-driven mindset to ensure accuracy, competitiveness and insights for our overall rewards strategy. This position is also responsible for supporting various aspects of our HRIS, people analytics, organizational dashboards and other high-impact efforts as we scale. Our Compensation Analyst will be charting the path for the future of the Compensation function in this unique opportunity to design scalable processes and workflows that optimize Marqeta’s compensation strategy for efficiency and growthPrimary Responsibilities Perform analyses evaluating Marqeta’s pay practices in the context of our market and industry, establishing competitive program design and providing insights around building best-in-class compensation strategies. Conduct research and detailed analytics/modeling; interpret data and internal equity to assess and determine the company’s competitive position and formulate optimal business-oriented pay recommendations. Continuously assess compensation levels utilizing knowledge of prevailing rates, internal equity, types of wage incentive systems, and special compensation programs for professional, technical, sales, operational, managerial, support and executive roles. Administer compensation programs and initiatives, including annual merit review and focal planning, variable/bonus pay cycles, sales compensation, off-cycle promotions, etc. Partner closely with Finance to support Equity administration. Generate reports and conduct ad-hoc analyses with highly responsive timelines. Audit jobs for content and prepares sound job descriptions. Reviews requests for new or revised job classifications to determine appropriate salary grade assignment. Conduct audits to ensure compliance with local and national labor laws and company policies. Design, develop and document internal processes that deliver quality compensation programs while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. Lead all efforts in compensation survey participation; collect and analyze competitive information to determine company’s competitive position, find innovative new sources for comp data and practices, and remain current on trends. Provide guidance to the entire leadership team with regard to compensation practices, trends and policies. Reviews existing and proposed statutory requirements governing compensation administration and recommends appropriate action plans. May prepare special studies and recommendations on topics like incentive comp, bonuses, sales compensation or stock options. Help lead and support international expansion comp strategies and processes. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements relating to minimum wage and overtime pay, and consistency with administrative policies and practices. Regularly audit FLSA status of existing positions. Perform periodic review and update of job descriptions to incorporate developments in industry standards, compensation and alignment with operational requirements. Perform other duties and contribute to special projects as needed. Who We're Looking For 3-5 years of relevant practitioner experience managing compensation and reward programs in a hi-tech company Exceptional analytical, mathematical, computation and data visualization skills Confident presence and ability to interact with and present to the leadership team Deep knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite; must have advanced Excel skills (e.g., if/then statements, VLOOKUP’s, pivot tables, formulas); Macros knowledge helpful Knowledge of new market data sources Undergraduate degree in business, accounting, human resources, or related field Sales incentive compensation experience preferred Certified Compensation Professional® (CCP®) preferred International expansion experience a plus Demonstrated ability to act with discretion, confidentiality and good judgment Self-starter with strong ability to manage their own time and competing priorities Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing Strong interpersonal skills that both engender trust and respect and enable candid conversations. Genuine comfort with and enthusiasm for the fast-paced, start-up environment and associated ambiguity at times.PerksBe a member of an exceptional team - we’re growing and your career with us will too! Rich suite of benefit plans - Employee premiums paid 100% Generous Paid Time Off plan Market-leading fully paid Parental Leave Retirement savings - 401k plan with a Company match Meaningful Equity Quarterly Hack Weeks to support and reward innovation Beautiful downtown Oakland office in a great location, with stunning views of Lake Merritt Conveniently located close to public transportation Open, transparent culture that includes weekly All Hands meetings, Lunch-and-Learns, all-company offsite, etc. Commuter and Parking monthly subsidy Fully stocked kitchen, catered lunches twice a week, breakfast on Fridays, and more. Access to corporate gym membership rates and other discounts and employee perks!

title: Digital Analyst
description: Hudson & Marshall is seeking an experienced Digital Analyst to join the growing data and analytics program in our Irvine CA office. Under the direction of senior leadership, the Digital Analyst will deliver on performance reporting and deep dive analysis projects with a focus on timeliness, accuracy and insight. This role will be instrumental in exploring new measurement frameworks, driving insights across all areas of the business and delivering enhanced performance visibility to our client relationships. If you are intellectually curious and like to balance exploratory analysis with the daily guiding of business operations, then we’d like to talk with you.Responsibilities IncludeEngage across all levels of the organization in fielding, refining and delivering on reporting and analytical projects.Work within standardized measurement guidelines, with an appropriate leeway for analytical exploration, to support and evolve business performance.Other duties as assigned.Local applicants will be given preference.Minimum Requirements Include3 to 5 years of analytical experience; marketing, real estate and/or online auction a plus.Strong SQL querying skills; sub-queries, ranking functions, etc.Master in Excel.You are an entrepreneur trapped in an analyst’s body. You think outside the lines, see what’s on the other side of the mountain before you’ve reached the summit and take pride in finding the hidden paths to success.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Able to learn new tools quickly.Preferred Qualifications5+ years in a Senior Analytics role with demonstrated experience dealing with attribution modeling, financial modeling, forecasting and/or cohort analysis.Advanced SQL skills.Strong presentation skills.Hudson & Marshall is the Nation’s Online Real Estate Auction Powerhouse, and we’ve built our industry reputation over the last 50 years on success, ingenuity, and hard work. We have sold more than 150,000 properties nationwide, with more than $5 billion of real estate sold just in the last five years. Hudson & Marshall’s specialized services and customer-centric approach have positioned it as a recognized leader in real estate auctions, with results that exceed the industry average.Together with our Fortune 500 parent company, Fidelity National Financial (FNF), we provide a results-driven, full service auction platform providing foreclosure and REO auction services that are fully integrated with FNF’s family of products and technologies.

title: Data Analyst
location: 357 Castro St Suite 200, Mountain View, CA 94041, US
description: What are we looking for?We are looking for a technically savvy database-oriented Analyst or Data-Engineer with good people skills and the ability to pick up new business concepts and technologies.The ideal candidate will possess:• A strong to very strong working knowledge of SQL.• An ability to write and troubleshoot complex SQL procedures.• The desire to understand business events through data. • An understanding of Data Warehousing and ETL techniques.• High level understanding in at least one scripting language such as Ruby, Shell, Python.• An interest in learning large data set processing with MapReduce/Hadoop/Pig/etc.• Linux skills are a plus.• Good client relations skills strongly preferred.Who are we?Raybeam, Inc. is a software engineering and consulting company focused on strategic consulting, business intelligence, and online/database marketing for the past fifteen years. We have offices near Boston and San Francisco and support a strong list of clients including Google, Facebook, Microsoft, eBay, Disney, One Kings Lane, Beachbody and Hilton Worldwide.What do we do?We provide technology solutions by architecting and developing enterprise systems using a variety of programming languages, tools and platforms. This can range from building data warehouses, to web applications to implementing reporting platforms. We work in small teams, own the projects that we work on, and have direct input into the business decisions of our clients.What do you get from working for Raybeam?• A fun, supportive work environment that promotes camaraderie and growth.• The chance to travel and network with important figures in the industry.• The chance to have input into business decisions of our clients.• The opportunity to learn technologies that you've always wanted but never had the chance.If you are interested in the position please click on the link to begin the application process.Please note that Raybeam, Inc. is currently unable to provide sponsorship and we will only consider local candidates. Recent grads are encouraged to apply, and an MBA is desirable. This is a full time contract role. Thank You.
