title: Data Analyst - VOD
description: Data is central to Twitch’s decision-making process. The Product Analyst program at Twitch is a critical component our data-driven decision- making. As an analyst in the program, you will be working closely on the ground floor with your team, crafting the way product performance is measured, defining what questions should be asked, and defining analytics methods and tools to support the growing business. The data analyst program is a rotation within Twitch that will give you deep grounding in our platforms and products. The program is designed to give you an edge to jump into [long-term], operating roles at Twitch including data science, product management, and technical program management.For this role, we are looking for a data analyst to join our Product Analyst program to support the VOD (Video-on-Demand) team in the Consumer Experience organization. The Consumer Experience organization’s mission is to enable Twitch creators to make a living entertaining and educating their fans. In a typical week or month, you will be responsible for data instrumentation, dashboard/report building, metrics reviews, and ad hoc analysis.ResponsibilitiesEvangelize data knowledge and insights: lead communications with your team leads and other teams, collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues to complete data projects and ensure all parties can use the insights to further improve. Maintain a customer-centric focus: strive to be a domain and product authority through data, develop trust amongst your peers and leaders, and ensure that your team has access to data to make decisions.Able to prioritize and execute in ambiguous scenarios work with stakeholders and mentors to distill the problem, adapt your tools to answer complicated questions, and identify the trade-offs between speed and quality of different approaches.Build analytical frameworks to measure team success: partner with cross-functional teams to define success metrics, craft approaches to track the data and identify errors, quantify and evaluate the data, then develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these critical metrics.Operationalize data processes - provide the team with ad-hoc analysis, automated dashboards, and self-service reporting tools so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the businessRequirementsAt minimum 2+ years of industry experience in a data role of a relevant fieldExceptional SQL skills. Your ability to tap into our data pipeline will be the key to your successData Fluency - You can use data to help someone understand their business performanceAnalytical Toolkit - You can use different methods to analyze results, including time series analysis, experimental analysis, and data visualizationBonus PointsTechnical background and programming experienceStatistics knowledge and hypothesis/significance testing experienceA/B testing experiencePassion about online communities, games, and TwitchPerksFull benefits, including medical, dental, vision and life 401(k) savings plan with a company matchCatered daily lunch and dinners (and hearty breakfasts three times a week)Unlimited snacks and drinksMonthly in-office massagesCorporate gym membershipCommuter benefitsFlexible time off policyWeekly happy hours and opportunity to attend one gaming event or tournamentTop of the line technology to help you build your own workspaceTwitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at: http://twitch.tvWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: The RoleDescriptionAs a Senior Data Analyst on the Finished Vehicle logistics team, you will be responsible for providing analytics support to the Outbound logistics team.Responsibilities Work closely with operations team members to define and develop key performance indicators, measuring operational performance and outcomes. Analyze key drivers of logistics performance and identify prioritized actions for reducing vehicle dwell time, optimizing lane transit time, and minimizing vehicle re-routings and exceptions. Establish systematic ways to gather data and reinforce or modify existing assumptions, for example by making the routing guide a data-driven product. Experience or capacity to build models, query data across multiple SQL databases, and conduct rigorous quantitative analysis. Work closely with third party logistics providers to quantify milestones and goals, and develop reporting triggers based on partner performance. Determine optimal benchmarks to enable operations decision-making: for example, when to send low-density shipments. Conduct network capacity analysis and resiliency studies: which failure points are more likely, and which portions of the network are robust. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, supply chain, data science, or mathematics; or equivalent experience or evidence of exceptional ability. 5+ years’ experience working with ERP systems design and launch, business analytics, or robust quantitative analysis. Exceptional analytical skills with regards to logistics analysis, data manipulation, and the ability to create information from data. Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate with technical team members is essential. Experience or capacity to build data models, query data sources, clean data, and synthesize analysis in clear language, accessible to both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to define problems, collect relevant data, extract meaning from data, and draw logical and coherent conclusions.

title: Data Analyst III, Business Insights
location: 1055 West 7th Street , Los Angeles, CA 90017, US
description: DUTIES:The Data Analyst III of Business Insights is responsible for supporting short and long term operational and/or strategic business initiatives. This role will develop, enhance, and maintain operational information and models that will have an impact on business decisions. Through the application of data analytics, joining disparate data sources, and working with raw data, this role will work to deliver valuable insights and recommendations to improve operational performance. The Data Analyst III of Business Insights will work in a highly matrixed environment, working closely with senior leaders, management, and line staff to understand root cause, propose recommendations for improvement, and develop solutions on key business challenges. This position will serve as a mentor to team members. QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS EDUCATION:Required: High School DiplomaPreferred: Associate's or Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Finance, Engineering, Math, Physics, Economics and other related technical disciplines.EXPERIENCE: Required: With High School Diploma: At least 10 years of collecting, manipulating, and analyzing data in business and/or finance Preferred:With Associate's Degree: 7 years of collecting, manipulating, and analyzing data in business and/or financeWith Bachelor's Degree: 5 years of collecting, manipulating, and analyzing data in business and/or financeWith Master's Degree: 3 years of collecting, manipulating, and analyzing data in business and/or finance

title: Data Analyst, Digital Marketing
description: PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play —it’s also the Best Place to Work. We’ve thrilled gamers since 1994, when we launched the original PlayStation. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in interactive and digital entertainment. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.Title : Data Analyst, Digital MarketingDescriptionWhether you are working on innovative new hardware like PlayStation VR, AAA software like God of War, or disruptive network service products like PlayStation Vue, you will take part in the complete marketing experience, as you are involved in every facet of ideating, executing, analyzing, and optimizing our digital campaigns. From determining target audiences, designing test strategies, and communicating with internal or external partners, you will help shape the way that we communicate with gamers to grow our loyal PlayStation customer base.Be part of building the Paid Media and CRM Analytics team at Sony Interactive Entertainment (SIE) - a new team built behind dedicated leadership and deep investment in people and technologies. This role sits within the Marketing organization that oversees marketing for SIE’s entire portfolio of products and services.You will be generating actionable insights from complex customer data to drive growth in product engagement and customer lifetime value across all stages of the customer lifecycle. You will lead the way in helping the team develop a deep understanding of its current and potential customers. Your primary goal will be to ensure that we design and execute data-driven lifecycle marketing strategies that drive measurable growth in usage, cross-sell and customer retention/loyalty for all target segments. To achieve this goal, you will be responsible for identifying and communicating key customer insights and trends across multiple products within our portfolio.You will be making an impact on marketing decision-making but also shape the customer experience. You will be a key stakeholder providing strategic guidance to the management and maintenance of our marketing tech stack, and bring data-driven thought leadership to our marketing efforts by conducting analysis and developing testing strategies that provide insight into the key drivers of digital marketing performance.Marketing at SIE starts and ends with the gamer. Our job is to demonstrate how PlayStation truly is the Best Place to Play.ResponsibilitiesDefine and implement customer segmentation and profiling strategiesTranslate business challenges into testable hypotheses, own/manage execution, tracking and results in ways that change the way we do businessManage, mine and analyze a broad array of quantitative and qualitative data assetsLead the application of insights to influence marketing strategies that drive measurable growth in customer acquisition and ongoing retention/satisfaction.Compile analyses for reports and conduct presentations to a broad audience, including marketing leadership, to shape strategic and operational decisionsEnsure the enforcement of legal and privacy standards for managing dataWork across numerous internal and external marketing automation platforms (Sales Force Marketing Cloud, DMPs, Publisher and Social Partners, etc)Minimum QualificationsSQL programming experienceExperience with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe AnalyticsExperience with data visualization software such as TableauMinimum 3-5 years experience working with relational databasesMinimum 5-7 years marketing analytics experienceWell versed in spreadsheet modeling and presentation-making skills that effectively present data in a compelling way, both verbal and written, to influence marketing decisionsA passion for and the belief in the power of making data-driven decisionsA demonstrated interest in digital entertainment and gamingBA/BS degreePreferred QualificationsExperience in the video game industryProfessional experience working at, or with, a media or digital agencyExperience using algorithmic attribution models for media optimizationAdvanced degree in a related field (MBA, Statistics, Economics, etc)

title: Technical Data Analyst, Search Capacity
description: Job DescriptionThe Amazon Search team creates powerful, customer-focused search solutions and technologies. Whenever a customer visits an Amazon site worldwide and types in a query or browses through product categories, Amazon Search service go to work. We design, develop, and deploy high performance, fault-tolerant, distributed search systems used by millions of Amazon customers every day.As a Technical Data Analyst in the Search Capacity team, you will:Scale the Amazon Search service by working closely with service owners in engineering and operations to understand the service in depth and drive optimal scaling and capacity planning.Identify and track key performance metrics around efficiency and costs.Manage planning, ordering, and budgeting for hardware and other computational resources.Develop and improve tools for automating the foregoing responsibilities wherever possible.Analyze resource utilization and performance test data to identify variables impacting performance and scalability. Develop models for required hardware resources to meet current and future SLAs.Basic QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in a data-oriented field like basic sciences, Economics, Finance, Engineering, or Statistics.At least one year industry experience in analyzing and reporting on structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.At least one year experience in identifying metrics and KPIs, gathering data and presenting decks, dashboards, and scorecards.Programming ability in at least one of SQL, Python, Perl, or Java.Strong quantitative reasoning and analytical skills, using spreadsheet tools like Microsoft Excel.Ability to communicate succinctly, clearly, and effectively.Preferred QualificationsPast experience in capacity planning or performance measurement methods.Exposure to business intelligence (Quicksight, Tableau, or Microsoft Power BI) and statistical tools (R or MATLAB).Experience with log file processing and shell scripting on Unix systems.Hands-on experience in dealing with engineering or financial data using desktop or web-based tools.Experience working with large-scale distributed software systems.Experience in predictive statistical modeling.Company - Amazon.com Services, Inc.Job ID: A677121

title: Clinical Operations, Data Analyst
description: Our goal is to make the human genome practically useful for life-altering decisions.We invented the Counsyl Test, a breakthrough diagnostic intended for parents planning to start a family. The test won the Wall Street Journal Innovation Award for Medicine, was named one of Scientific American’s “Top 10 World Changing Ideas”, was featured in the New York Times -- and is now prescribed by physicians for over 3% of all the births in the United States. We’ve also since added a bevy of tests to our repertoire such as our Prenatal Screen (Prelude), and our Inherited Cancer Screen (Reliant) to better serve a wider base of customers.Few if any have done genetics on this scale before. As a data scientist, you will play a critical role in building an efficient, reliable, and data-driven vertically-integrated genetics organization.What You'll DoBuild structured reports that can be automatically re-run to monitor critical laboratory parameters for process control and regulatory compliance.Statistical modeling and process debugging to develop new assays and new technology in the lab.Assist in data analysis, modeling, and reporting for scientific publications.Cross-functional analysis: work with the business and sales development teams to optimize revenue using our large corpus of historical sales and insurance data.Coordinate between the clinical laboratory, science, and operations teams to optimize the cost-effectiveness of the business.About YouMS or higher in Chemistry, Biology, Physics, Engineering or a similarly quantitative field; or significant prior experience in related work.You have experience analyzing data from molecular biology or biochemistry experiments. Experience working with Next Generation Sequencing data is a plus.You have a strong background in statistics and probability; experience with statistical modeling and machine learning is a plus.You are experienced in a statistical programming environment like Python or R, and are familiar with both statistical computation and data visualization in your environment of choice (e.g., matplotlib, ggplot2, etc.). Experience with modern web development is a plus. Experience with only Excel (or other spreadsheet tools) is insufficient.You have experience with NGS as well as using Python for data analysis. You have experience with SQL. You are well versed in statistical analysis. Process control background is a plus.Advanced degrees will be favoredCounsyl is a health technology company that offers DNA screening for diseases that can impact men, women and their children. The Counsyl philosophy is simple: screen for diseases where advanced knowledge makes a difference in health outcomes, whether it’s changing a behavior, pursuing preventative measures, or simply preparing for what lies ahead.The Counsyl team includes an accomplished group of problem-solvers — top engineers, scientists, and designers — who are taking the lead on building the modern clinical laboratory. Scientific rigor, custom robotics, and software are at the heart of every Counsyl product, resulting in better, faster and more affordable screens that are broadly accessible. Beyond the laboratory, Counsyl offers doctors and patients a technology platform for results delivery in real time, with on-demand access to board-certified genetic counselors.The company has raised a total of $102 million and is privately backed by Pilot Growth Equity, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Founders Fund, Felicis Ventures, David Drummond, and other high profile investors.Counsyl does not accept unsolicited resumes. Further, any resumes submitted to us without a signed contract will become the property of Counsyl, Inc.Counsyl, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Counsyl is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Counsyl are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Counsyl will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Counsyl encourages applicants of all ages.

title: Epic Application Analyst
description: This position will specifically support scheduling and registration and all ancillary functions in the clinics, the cancer center, and outpatient rehab***Position SummaryReporting to the Epic Leadership team, the Application Analyst primary role is to have a complete working knowledge of assigned EPIC application, to include an understanding of the assigned department workflows for the associated EPIC build, upgrade and release process. The Application Analyst will act as the primary support contact for the EPIC application and coordinate issues that arise in their area of responsibility. They will perform workflow analysis, data collection and report issues associated with the EPIC software. The Application Analyst will build in the EPIC system and as part of this process they will understand and analyze the end user and business operation needs. The Application Analyst will review the software, coordinate updates and collect information regarding potential system enhancement needs. The Application Analyst will serve as a liaison between EPIC staff, end users, third parties and technical staff. The Application Analyst will work with end users by participating in training and troubleshooting issues and questions. The analyst will participate in the creation of test plans and testing of application changes and upgrades.The Application Analyst will be required to follow IT Change Control processes, create support documentation following standard IS protocols and have working knowledge of HIPAA and other IT security and privacy best practices.The Application Analyst may be required to participate in an on call rotation as determined by their Manager and perform other duties as assigned.MinimumEDUCATION / TRAINING / EXPERIENCE: Enrolled in a Bachelor's program or has a Bachelor's degree in any field OR has Information Technology experience OR has experience in a healthcare related field.Desired Previous systems/application support and analysis in the healthcare industry Understanding of Epic or other hospital applications Prior information systems experience, including system installations/upgrades, analysis & support of clinical or business information systems, workflow development.DesiredLICENSES / CERTIFICATIONS: EPIC CertificationSkills / Knowledge / AbilitiesThe Application Analyst will have or develop an understanding of the organization and the EPIC user community for their assigned area. The ability to lead meetings, prioritize, maintain issues lists and manage project plans is necessary. This person must be able to apply logic to the analysis, development and implementation of complex workflow and information system solutions and be able to successfully implement these solutions in assigned area. Organizational and multi-tasking skills are essential for working in a complex and varied work environment. Conflict management skills are necessary to resolve conflicts within and among departments and disciplines throughout the Organization and with physicians. Change management skills are necessary to lead implementations that will result in significant changes to work flow process for associates, physicians, and physicians' office staffs throughout the organization. Knowledge of operations and regulatory requirements pertaining to assigned areas of responsibility.

title: Business Data Analyst
description: Position SummaryWe’re seeking a Senior Business Analyst with expertise in Data Analysis and Data Requirements Management to join our Global Tax Platform (GTP) team. Data is the core asset of GTP, and the work of our Data Mapping and Modeling team is crucial to the success of the overall platform. You will partner comprehensive data analysis with structure business analysis techniques to enable the effective design and implementation of a global data model. EY is on a journey to leverage its success as a leader in the industry and bring best in class service and offerings to its tax practice. GTP is at the forefront of this effort, and you will play a critical role bringing technology and automation to a traditional practice.Essential Functions Of The Job Lead BA accountable for elicitation, analysis and documentation of business, stakeholder, solution and transition requirements driving data models for the assigned program(s). Responsible for leveraging appropriate techniques such as data flow diagrams, data mining and data modeling techniques to gather, analyze, and report Tax and Finance data requirements as a member of a data modeling delivery team. Work closely with product owners and other subject matter experts to understand business and technology strategies affecting and affected by their Tax and Finance data. Plan and actively manage the BA requirements management strategy; communicating, driving and managing the business analysis effort for each project in the Program throughout all phases of the ATTG project lifecycle Actively manage requirements traceability for impact and coverage analysis throughout the program Provide guidance and oversight on effective utilization of Business Analysis techniques in compliance with organizational standards Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities Ability to clearly articulate both problems and propose solutions Proactive approach to identifying issues and presenting solutions and options, and where appropriate, leading to resolutionKnowledge And Skills Requirements Excellent verbal and written communication skills Experience working effectively and building relationships with and between teams, external vendors and internal clients at varying executive levels TAX or Finance domain knowledge with a strong understanding of databases and data analysis. Experience leading other BAs to provide analysis and requirements, ensure consistency, accuracy and quality of BA deliverables on larger initiativesApplication of project management techniques to develop, execute and manage BA efforts across multiple initiatives Proficient application of industry-standard, structured business analysis techniques (i.e., user stories, use cases, UML/logical modeling, BABOK, etc.) to govern and control projects under various software development methodologies (i.e., Waterfall, Agile, RUP, etc.) Hands on experience with requirements management, modeling, and change control software(s)Supervision Responsibilities Works with limited direction and oversight Provide supervision and direction to team members and staffOther Requirements Occasional overnight travel may be requiredJob Requirements A bachelor's degree (computer science, engineering, accounting, finance preferred) or equivalent work experience. Master's degree preferred 8-10years of relevant experience Management experience a plus CBAP certification preferredEY, an equal employment opportunity employer (Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Disabled), values the diversity of our workforce and the knowledge of our people.

title: Deal Origination & Research Analyst
description: This position is for a pre-MBA private equity deal origination & research Analyst who will help source new investment opportunities.  This individual will participate in all aspects of a data-driven business development process including industry/market research, investment thesis development, deal origination & qualification, building relationships with intermediaries & other referral sources and marketing. The Analyst will be part of a three-person team also comprised of a Principal / Group Head and Associate. The role is intended to be a 2-3 year assignment with advancement opportunities for exceptional performers.  The Analyst that joins ClearLight Partners must possess a strong record of academic achievement, demonstrate initiative, and have a high level of self-motivation, maturity, and entrepreneurial curiosity. Further, successful deal origination Analysts will be outgoing and competitive, with a passion for the art and science of human connection to generate investment opportunities.  We’re looking for candidates with 0-3 years of experience in sectors that nurture analogous skill sets including consulting, expert networks, corporate development, wealth management or roles with a high value-added business development requirement. A working knowledge of financial statements and strong PowerPoint skills will also be important to the position.  Additionally, successful Analyst candidates will possess the following attributes:   Strong research and analytical abilities with keen attention to detail Good interpersonal skills that would be effective in strengthening existing, and attracting new, firm relationships Excellent work ethic & efficient time management skills Experience working with a CRM database (e.g. SalesForce) Strong GPA from a top-tier college or university Demonstrated leadership ability as evidenced by participation in competitive athletics, entrepreneurial endeavors, serving as a member of student government and/or other extra-curricular achievements Presently located in or having ties to Southern California are preferred

title: Data Analyst
description: Data AnalystThe Role.As an Enjoy Data Analyst, you'll provide deeper analysis and valuable insights to unlock opportunities and drive informed business decisions. Evolve the data platform with user-friendly tools, solutions and dashboards so that relevant information can be efficiently gathered and easily interpreted by business teams.Responsibilities Build and implement Data Solutions to help drive strategic business decisions leveraging insights Align with leadership team, product managers, business teams and partners to set priorities based on analysis and results to implement and optimize business processes and solutions Own Insights Roadmap and deliverables working with cross-functional teams Support scoping complex data-centric projects across multiple teams and systems and execute on deliverables and iterate to drive bias to action Effectively use data to tell stories, communicate key insights through internal reports, presentations and dashboards to drive business decisions Evaluate and quantifies the effect of experimentations and various tests through data analysis and statistical methods, and makes data-driven recommendations Share weekly business performance with the leadership teamAssist business teams in defining, tracking and optimizing processes, tools, and dashboards for better planning and management of the business Helps analyze the effectiveness of new solutions to inform whether to double down, pivot, or eliminate a new feature or process Goes above and beyond a specific problem to finding all possible explanations Partners with other analysts to create consistency in analysis and reporting Desired Candidate Skills And Experience. BS or MS in Engineering, Math, Statistics, Analytics, or Finance5+ years experience working in a fast paced environment as a data analyst or data scientist.Excellent quantitative skills and a deep understanding of statistical methods, and an ability to inspire confidence in data-driven decision making Experience working with Data Warehouse(how we organise data), Business Intelligence Solutions (Tableau etc., Databases (SQL), Postgres etc), Programming (Python, XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) Experience with running A/B tests and familiar with Experimentation platforms Proficient with Google Analytics, Hotjar and similar Web Analytics products Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) Understanding of eCommerce and Retail will be a big plus Exhibit general curiosity to go deeper to understand business problems and surface interesting facts

title: eCommerce Data / eCatalog Analyst
description: eCommerce Data / eCatalog AnalystWeb Shop Manager, an E-Commerce company located in Kearny Mesa, is looking to expand our data team! We’re looking for a talented, detail-oriented, hard-working individual who enjoys a challenge. You’ll gain great exposure working with our team and with our clients. Your primary role will consist of manipulating product data, documenting how-to guides, and working with our clients to troubleshoot data discrepancies. We will provide extensive one-on-one training to help you grow. This is not a data entry position!Responsibilities Use Excel to standardize and structure product data into our format Research products to ensure data accuracy Contact clients to troubleshoot data discrepancies Coordinate projects with other departments Maintain departmental records of progress and completed work Qualifications Strong Excel skills (able to manipulate product data) Ability to troubleshoot difficult data formats Excellent listening, verbal and written communication skills VBA experience is a plus Automotive knowledge is a plus E-Commerce product data experience is a major plus Perks For This Role The excitement of a startup environment in a solidified company Beautiful laid back office environment in sunny San Diego Regular delivery of fresh fruit, snacks, and drinks Potential future management experience Company outings and events Starbucks next door We absolutely love coming into work every day, at Web Shop Manager we work with an amazing team on some really incredible projects (other people think so too since they keep giving us awards). Our core purpose is to help our clients realize their dreams of success online while taking care of all of all the complex technical aspects of their business.Web Shop Manager offers a competitive compensation and benefits to its employees including commission, PTO, health insurance, 401K, and holiday pay. We are an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Marketing BI & Data Analyst
description: HomeLight is changing the face of real estate one homeowner at a time. We empower consumers to use real agent performance data to make a more informed choice on the biggest financial decision of their lives. Our proprietary, machine learning algorithms analyze over 30 million transactions from 2 million agents to determine the best agents to meet clients' specific home buying or selling needs. We are looking for a Marketing Analyst who will be responsible for delivering key business intelligence initiatives that have a direct impact on HomeLight’s marketing programs - both digital ads, consumer & lifecycle marketing, and offline advertising such as TV ads.     You will work on projects with marketers, product managers, operations, the executive team, and even our PR team (e.g., finding stories in the data for journalists) that require you to have flexible quantitative skills. You will communicate your findings in presentations, build dashboards and visualizations, and be the go-to person for questions for the marketing & growth team. As a result of your work you will develop a deep understanding of the business and act as subject matter expert on consumer and marketing models and key metrics.   What You’ll Do:Analyze data, develop prototype using report and dashboard tools upfront in the project lifecycle thereby validating the requirements, eliminating ambiguity and providing early visibility to business on the final solution Use statistical analysis or data mining tools to analyze data, identify insightful trends, and interpret the technical data into meaningful recommendations for other executives You will exhibit a high level of expertise in helping driving the data strategy across multiple channels (website and apps, surveys, testing, market research etc). You will support the business ad hoc data requests through either SQL query or quick report or dashboard and analyze large quantities of data using Python, VBA or R to drive growth strategies based on profitability, market potential and sales trends You will create new quantitative statistical models to reduce the overall operation cost of the business   You Have:BA/BS degree in a quantitative field, Masters in Analytics, Finance and Statistics preferred 2 years of experience in a business intelligence business analyst role in an online ecommerce or online business environment 2-4 years experience writing and tuning SQL queries and building reports/dashboards.  This experience has allowed you to not only to drill down deeply into the data looking for insights but also to help others on the team gain access to more insightful data (e.g., dashboards). If you can supplement or mostly replace SQL with Python, that’s a plus but not necessary. Strong quantitative skills and a basic understanding in statistics (e.g., when you find an interesting pattern, you can figure out when it is just noise). We are not, however, looking for someone with an extensive background in machine learning and advanced statistics. Mid-level expertise in advanced web analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research preferred Knowledge in Excel, VBA and other scripting languages (e.g., Python, R etc.) The Perks: Medical, vision, dental, and paternity/maternity benefits. 401(k) Commuter benefits Flexible time off policy Catered lunches and snacks Corporate gym membership Company events: happy hours, bowling, bocce league, etc.

title: Quality Control / Business Analyst
location: 303 2nd Street Suite 750, San Francisco , CA 94107, US
description: About the Position: The Quality Control/Business Analyst is an organized, data & tech savvy, and detail-oriented candidate with strong desire to work at a growing start-up. This individual must possess a “can do” attitude, the hunger to learn quickly, and know-how to balance multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. The Client Success team serves as a strategic business partner to our clients, facilitating high quality operations to support the ongoing success of TrueAccord. This associate level role is an opportunity to join a high potential, well funded, and growth start-up which will present a great deal of opportunity for growth.  The candidate will have an opportunity to transition into an account management or data analyst function. He/She will start by focusing on TrueAccord's largest and most important client, and subsequently roll out their function to other clients. Continuous education courses (e.g., SQL) is supported. This is an hourly non-exempt role. Requirements: Process driven individual, with the ability to understand the inner workings of complex systems and integrations. Ability to conduct detailed analysis flag anomalies, investigate issues, and coordinate cross-functional resolutions Comfortable with detailed oriented work in large set of data and multiple daily reports Attention to detail, committed to producing excellent quality resultsLearn to write basic queries to analyze data accuracy and reliability Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to run through lists of controls and monitor steps with limited oversight Passionate with the drive to learn on the job from other team members and “doing” Drive to develop a strong grasp of the debt collection process and industry guidelines Bring a positive, collaborative, team-oriented attitude to the office and your clients every day!Responsibilities: Reviewing exception reports, data variances and errors in operational processes in order to flag anomalies or errors Manages and executes daily controls to ensure TrueAccord is meeting client policy and procedures requirements and knowledge or curiosity to learn coding language, ideally SQL Intermediate proficiency with Excel for data analysis (pivot, lookup, etc.) Prefer past experience working at a high-growth technology company Applicants with a desire and drive to learn Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion TrueAccord is an equal opportunity employer. title: Data Engineer
description: Data EngineerUniversity of San FranciscoJob Summary:The University of San Francisco collects vast amounts of data across its e-learning assets as well as its physical plant. Help us extract meaningful signal from this data by developing a world-class data warehouse, so we can bring data-driven improvement to student retention, operational efficiency, organizational management, and many other domains. The Department of Integrations & Analytics in the Information Technology Services Division is hiring a full-time Data Engineer to develop the University's data warehouse.Job Responsibilities:? Schema design and data modeling, especially dimensional modeling ? Writing and maintaining ETL pipelines from an array of diverse web applications ? Working with University staff and other stakeholders to identify and upload new data sources into the data warehouse ? Implementing health checks, tests, and other means to ensure the reliability of the data warehouse ? Working with S3, Redshift, and other AWS services ? Researching and understanding the complex datastores behind various higher education e-learning web applications ? Using a workflow scheduler like Airflow to manage the ETL pipelines ? Opportunity to expand into machine learning and predictive analytics ? Opportunity to take the data warehouse to the next level of scale with Hadoop, Spark, Kafka.Minimum Requirements: 2+ years experience in the role of data scientist/data engineer/data analyst Excellent SQL skills Excellent algorithm and programming skills (language isnt important) Bachelors or Masters Degree in computer science or related from a four-year university, or a degree in data engineering from a tech bootcamp, or equivalent experience Passion for working in higher education Experience using Git and working in a software team Experience with Linux command lineAdditional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:? Workday Certification ? Experience of other HR Technology tools. ? Experience and understanding of Human Resources data. ? Business, Process, and Data Analysis skills ? Excellent communication and interpersonal skills ? Good negotiation and facilitation skills ? Ability to work pro-actively and independently within a project frameworkFor information on how to apply, please visit the following link: www.usfjobs.comEEO PolicyThe University of San Francisco is an equal opportunity institution of higher education. title: Data Network Analyst
description: CSU Job Listing DetailsPrintable versionE-Mail this listingCampusHumboldtJob ID: 18-40Job TitleData Network AnalystAppointment TypeProbationaryTime BaseFull-TimeDate PostedJuly 18, 2018Closing DateAugust 1, 2018Link To Apply Onlinehttps://hraps.humboldt.edu/staff-employmentCampus Employment Homepagehttp://www.humboldt.edu/jobsDescription(Job #18-40) Network Analyst-12-Career, Data Network Analyst, $4,372-10,478/month. Appointments will be determined by education and experience. Expected starting salary range is between $5,000-$6,000/month. This is a full-time, benefited, 12-month, exempt position with a one-year probationary period in Information Technology Services.The Place: Known for its quality academic programs and its hands-on approach to learning, Humboldt State University has a well-earned reputation as one of the best primarily undergraduate public universities in the United States. The residential and rural campus of 7,500 students is nestled between mountains, giant redwood trees, and breathtaking Pacific Ocean beaches. The local area offers many outdoor recreation opportunities as well as a full range of dining, cultural, and entertainment opportunities, all without the hassle and expense of a major metropolitan area. Local K-12 schools consistently rank in the top 10% in the state, and the local produce is second to none. Humboldt State University also benefits from being part of the world's largest university system, the 23-campus California State University (CSU).The Job: This is an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic and creative environment. The successful candidate will become part of a small, highly skilled team with responsibility for managing a campus-wide wired and wireless network. Over the next year we will be doing some exciting proof of concept mesh networking work and migrating VPN services to our Palo Alto firewalls. Duties include: Troubleshooting wireless throughput problems that are slowing down classroom video streaming; Working with a cross-functional team of specialists to find the best way to roll out a new service to the campus; Adding wired or wireless network capacity to buildings; Using network management tools to investigate security incidences; and Configuring firewalls to allow traffic to pass.Minimum Qualifications: A basic foundation of knowledge and skills in technical, information network systems, including a working knowledge of telecommunications and transmission technologies, including network architecture, topologies, protocols, programming applications, and interfaces appropriate to the defined work area and assignments. This foundation would normally be obtained through a bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, industrial technology, telecommunications, or a related technical field, or through equivalent training and experience. Maintaining a valid California driver license and the willingness and ability to work irregular hours as a part of an on-call rotation are conditions of employment.Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Thorough knowledge of telecommunications and transmission technologies Ability to demonstrate competence in independently applying technical judgment to standard and nonstandard applications and systems, solving a wide range of problems and developing practicable and thorough solutions Effective communication and listening skills Demonstrated commitment and/or experience promoting and fostering a working environment that is supportive of individuals from diverse backgrounds Working knowledge of current data networking systems, protocols, and industry standards and a solid grounding in TCP/IP fundamentals Ability to configure routing on a set of switches and routers Ability to interpret monitoring reports and resolve connectivity and throughput problems as they impact services Ability to configure VLAN tagging and routing protocols Ability to install and troubleshoot network support services: DHCP, RADIUS, DNS, etc. Ability to work independently on long term projects Ability to design and implement network architecture and topology An understanding of the dynamics of diversity in higher education and a demonstrated ability to incorporate this understanding, as appropriate Ability to move and carry 50 lbs. Ability to work in confined spaces and on ladders Ability to distinguish colors sufficiently to correctly punch down and terminate cablesPreferred Qualifications Two years of relevant experience performing duties associated with the duties listed above BICSI Certification Experience with Alcatel Lucent Equipment Experience working in an enterprise network environment Palo Alto Networks firewall experience Experience working with Enterprise Aruba Wireless ControllerApplication Procedure: To apply, qualified candidates must electronically submit the following materials through Interfolio:https://apply.interfolio.com/52544 Letter of Interest Resume or Curriculum Vitae Contact information for at least three professional references HSU Employment History Form (https://forms.humboldt.edu/employment-history-form)(NOTE: This form replaces the HSU Employment Application form, which should no longer be used. Download the HSU Employment History Form and save it as a PDF file prior to filling it out. If the form is filled out on line (accessed via a web browser), content WILL NOT be saved.The Human Resources & Academic Personnel Services office (located in Siemens Hall room 212) has a computer station and front office staff available for applicants requiring assistance.Application Deadline: The deadline to submit application materials is 11:59 p.m. on Wednesday, August 1, 2018. To be notified in the event this recruitment re-opens for a subsequent review of applications, send an email to careers@humboldt.edu that includes the job number (18-40) and applicant's last name in the subject line of the message.HSU is committed to enriching its educational environment and its culture through the diversity of its staff, faculty, and administration. Persons with interest and experience in helping organizations set and achieve goals relative to diversity and inclusion are especially encouraged to apply.It is the responsibility of the applicant to provide complete and accurate employment information. Incorrect or improperly completed applications will not be considered for vacancies. Any reference in this announcement to required periods of experience or education is full-time activity. Part-time experience or education--or activities only part of which are qualifying--will receive proportionate credit. In accordance with applicable Collective Bargaining Agreements, preference may be given to the campus applicants covered by these agreements. However, positions are open to all interested applicants, both on and off campus.Evidence of required degree(s), certification(s), or license(s) is required prior to the appointment date. A background check (including a criminal records check, employment verification, and education verification) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with the CSU. Certain positions may also require a credit check, motor vehicle report, and/or fingerprinting through Live Scan service. Adverse findings from a background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for the position.Humboldt State University is committed to achieving the goals of equal opportunity and endeavors to employ faculty and staff of the highest quality reflecting the ethnic and cultural diversity of the state. Additional information about Humboldt State University can be found at www.humboldt.edu.Humboldt State University is a Title IX/Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected status.Compliance with the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act (CANRA) and CSU Executive Order 1083 Revised July 21, 2017 (EO 1083) is a condition of employment. CSU employees in positions with duties that involve regular contact with children or positions which supervise such employees are designated as Mandated Reporters under CANRA and are required to comply with the requirements set forth in EO 1083. Upon appointment to this position, the successful candidate(s) will be notified of and required to acknowledge their CANRA reporting status.Additionally, all CSU staff and faculty receive training annually on their obligations in responding to and reporting incidents of sexual harassment and sexual violence. You will be notified by email when you are required to take this mandated training.SDL2017

title: Inventory Control - Data Analysis
description: ﻿Located in sunny Southern California, PAFCO is a global, innovative food manufacturing company with 40 years of success. High quality products and integrity contribute to its steady growth, allowing PAFCO to consistently outperform competitors. PAFCO is dedicated to fostering the professional growth and development of its associates. Learn more about the company at www.pafco.net .We are currently looking for an outstanding supply chain IC Data Analysis to join our growing team! This person will be tasked to execute inventory strategies set forth by the Supply Chain team, track product shipments, and provide real-time inventory information. If you are professional, great with people, self-driven and entrepreneurial then we want to hear from you. This hands-on position will be responsible for developing and executing Company inventory plans that will enable the Company to meet sales and service objectives. For the right individual, PAFCO offers an outstanding compensation and benefits package, exceptional training, and a tremendous career opportunity.Position PurposeThe supply chain IC Data Analyst monitors movement of product in and out of our warehouse and distribution center. The clerk will keep records of product movement, reconcile inconsistencies, create reports, review processes, ensure policies are followed, and address discrepancies. The successful applicant needs to have excellent record-keeping abilities, must be detail-oriented, and have effective organizational and reporting skills.Although not required, a bachelor's degree is highly desired and preferred for this position.Compensation will be based on a combination of education, experience and job qualifications.Principal AccountabilitiesYou MUST be good in Math.Inventory reconciliation: analyze and amend discrepancies between counted physical inventory and system inventory dailyInvestigate inventory procedures: investigate receiving, inventory movement, production processes, and billing procedures to assist in inventory reconciliation as necessarySuggest process improvements: understand current state procedures and provide suggestions to improve warehouse efficiencies and reduce inventory varianceCreate reports and documentation: generate reports within Excel to provide inventory status reports to track progress of issues and inconsistenciesSKILLS And ATTRIBUTESBe a role model for Integrity, Courage and Conviction;Adapts to changing business needs, introduces new ways of thinking and behaving, applies new ideas. Comfortable to manage ambiguity;Practical /pragmatic approach to problem solving & timely solution execution;Manage conflicting priorities within tight deadlines;Excellent interpersonal skills;Strong collaboration skills to get things done within a matrix organization;Excellent networking skill to build internal and external networks.LOCATION :Local candidates only: Los Angeles, CALIFORNIA area.EducationPreferred: a four year college degree in business administration, statistics, applied mathematics or related discipline, with a minimum 3.40 GPA.Located in sunny Southern California, PAFCO is a global, innovative food manufacturing company with 40 years of success. High quality products and integrity contribute to its steady growth, allowing PAFCO to consistently outperform competitors. PAFCO is dedicated to fostering the professional growth and development of its associates. Learn more about the company at www.pafco.net.PAFCO is an Equal Opportunity/ Drug Free Employer.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description: Gensler is a global architecture and design firm grounded in the belief that design strategy optimizes business performance and human potential. Our 5,000+ practitioners networked across 46 offices use global perspective and local presence to innovate at every scale. Whether we are refreshing a retailer’s brand, planning a new urban district, or designing a super tall building, we strive to make the everyday places people occupy more inspiring, more resilient, and more impactful.­­­Your RoleThe Data Platform Team is seeking a talented Data Analyst with strong experience working in SQL Server and T-SQL. In this position, you will have the opportunity to intimately learn, understand and enhance the data behind the firm’s operating structure. This role is based in our Oakland office, will be responsible for analyzing multiple data sets and ensuring accuracy and timeliness in the Datawarehouse. The ideal candidate has a proficient understanding of financial data and is able to analyze and solve data issues quickly.What You Will DoMonitor and analyze large transactional datasets in SQL ServerEnsure data is consistent and accurateIndependently investigate data anomalies or inaccuracy patterns to solve data problems to ensure that all data is up-to-dateServe as the subject matter expert (SME) for SQL datawarehouseAssist with writing and performing data auditsCommunicate and participate in integration discussions with users and data providersManage and maintain Data Dictionary for SQL Datawarehouse Your QualificationsBachelors’ degree in Computer Science, System Engineering, Accounting, Finance or related fields3+ years-experience in a related position; experience in professional services a plusHighly proficient at SQL, especially T-SQL. Experience in Azure Sql DataWarehouse a plus.Highly skilled in critical thinking, deductive reasoning, data analysis and problem solvingUnderstanding of financial and project accounting dataProficient in using Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, Power PivotStrong organization skills, detailed oriented, and able to work independentlyExperience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environmentExcellent verbal and written communication skillsSelf-confident with a positive, up-beat attitudeLife at GenslerAt Gensler, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From curated art exhibits to internal design competitions to “Well-being Week,” our offices reflect our people’s diverse interests.We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability, wellness programs, flex spending, paid holidays, and paid time off. We also offer a 401k, profit sharing, employee stock ownership, and twice annual bonus opportunities.As part of the firm’s commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.Gensler is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participant in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Gensler will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Data Warehouse Programmer Analyst - Decision Support Services (DATA SYS ANL 4) - 16242 - San Francisco
description: At UCSF Health, our mission of innovative patient care, advanced technology and pioneering research is redefining what’s possible for the patients we serve – a promise we share with the professionals who make up our team.Ranked by U.S. News & World Report as the number one hospital in California – and among the top five in the country – UCSF Health is committed to providing the most rewarding work experience while delivering the best care available anywhere. In an environment that allows for continuous learning and opportunities for professional growth, UCSF Health offers the ideal atmosphere in which to best use your skills and talents.Department DescriptionShared Services supports UCSF Health Finance and other organizations within UCSF Health. Data Warehouse and Application (DWA) is a group within this department that provides information for integrated reporting/analysis and supports the AllScripts EPSi system.Omniview is an integrated data warehouse supplied by sources external and internal to UCSF Health. Its data and associated business rules are integrated into a hybrid Inmon/Kimball architecture housed in MS SQL Server using SQL Server Integrated Services (SSIS) as the ETL tool and SQL Agent as scheduler. Current internal sources include APeX (via CLARITY – Hospital Billing, Professional Billing, ADT, Inpatient, etc.), costing/budget from EPSi, IR Solution’s Incident Reporting System, PeopleSoft GL, HBS Time & Attendance, UCSF Payroll, patient care data from Nursing Performance Improvement surveys via Salesforce and McKesson’s PFM.External sources include Clinical Indicator data from Vizient, payroll (ADP, TriNet, Right Sourcing, WFX, ZeroChaos, etc.) and OSHPD (inpatient, ambulatory and ED data for all California hospitals).EPSi provides UCSF Health with financial (cost, budget, etc.) and patient information. Among some of DWA’s EPSi responsibilities are security, maintenance and the processes that feed it information from various systems.Job SummaryThis position supports Finance’s data warehouse (Omniview) by working with stakeholders and data consumers/providers to determine the requirements, processes and architecture of the data. Primary activities include the design, implementation, testing, documentation and support of data models within Omniview (and its associated data marts) along with the ETL processes that produce useful business intelligence capabilities for UCSF Health.The data warehouse staff performs various functions that require multiple skill sets - SQL, data modelling/profiling, DBA skills, SSIS package programming, MS Team Foundation and effective communication with SMEs (Subject Matter Experts). The needs of the organization for integrated analysis/reporting in the clinical/financial domains are acquired through frequent SME interaction and a fundamental understanding of the data and its business rules.A working knowledge of the source’s backend data structure and the ability to access the data from the frontend presentation layer, as well as its backend, is paramount. This knowledge allows the staff to modify the architecture of Omniview so that the data can be integrated and an automated ETL process can be created.This involves data profiling, determining any commonalities with Omniview, incorporating the data into Omniview, updating its data model and metadata, ensuring referential integrity via foreign key constraints throughout the data model and building an automated ETL process. Coordination with the support groups of the source systems is crucial to ensure that access can be achieved and guaranteed on an ongoing basis.These groups are both internal (IT, ISU, Patient Safety, etc.) and external (University Health Systems Consortium, Legacy Data Systems, ZeroChaos, etc.).Required Qualifications Five years of experience in a Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence environmentDemonstrated experience designing, developing and supporting database applicationsThorough working knowledge of testing practices and application debugging and troubleshooting proceduresAbility to identify, assess impact and develop recovery strategies for application or system failuresDemonstrated ability to identify and implement critical maintenance fixes and to isolate and correct malfunction, including interface problemsDemonstrated ability to research, evaluate and implement new technologies and softwareAbility to use creative problem-solving skills and apply effective technical solutionsWorking knowledge of Relational Database design and data modeling skillsWorking knowledge of the Kimball Data Warehouse Dimensional ModelWorking knowledge of the Inmon Data Warehouse ModelAdvanced working knowledge of SQL Server’s T-SQL languageAdvanced working knowledge of SQL Server’s Integration ServicesWorking knowledge of SQL Server SecurityAbility to work in an Agile environmentDemonstrated ability to work with technical and non-technical staff to identify user requirements and translate them into technology-based solutionsExcellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to prepare and deliver formal and informal documentation, presentations, and training to a variety of end usersExcellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to set own priorities to coordinate multiple assignments with fluctuating and time-sensitive deadlinesAbility to foster and maintain positive and professional working relationshipsAbility to effectively handle interpersonal interactions at all levels and respond appropriately to conflicts and problemsThe flexibility to orient and work at all UCSF Medical Center locationsPreferred Qualifications EPIC certified in one or more CLARITY Data ModulesDegree in computer science or related fieldFamiliarity with: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPPA) General ledger systems Allscripts EPSi QlikViewWorking knowledge of: Windows authentication and other security protocols MS Windows Server Oracle DBMS EPIC Hyperspace EPIC data model MS Team Foundation Previous experience in healthcare Familiarity with BI tools such tableau or SSRS Licensure/Certification N/ALiving Pride StandardsService Excellence Demonstrates service excellence by following the Everyday PRIDE Guide with the UCSF Medical Center standards and expectations for communication and behavior. These standards and expectations convey specific behavior associated with the Medical Center’s values: Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Diversity and Excellence, and provide guidance on how we communicate with patients, visitors, faculty, staff, and students, virtually everyone, every day and with every encounter. These standards include, but are not limited to: personal appearance, acknowledging and greeting all patients and families, introductions using AIDET, managing up, service recovery, managing delays and expectations, phone standards, electronic communication, team work, cultural sensitivity and competency.Uses effective communication skills with patients and staff; demonstrates proper telephone techniques and etiquette; acts as an escort to any patient or family member needing directions; shows sensitivity to differences of culture; demonstrates a positive and supportive manner in which patients / families/ colleagues perceive interactions as positive and supportive. Exhibits team work skills to positively acknowledge and recognize other colleagues, and uses personal experiences to model and teach Living PRIDE standards.Exhibits tact and professionalism in difficult situations according to PRIDE Values and PracticesDemonstrates an understanding of and adheres to privacy, confidentiality, and security policies and procedures related to Protected Health Information (PHI) or other sensitive and personal information.Demonstrates an understanding of and adheres to safety and infection control policies and procedures.Assumes accountability for improving quality metrics associated with department/unit and meeting organizational/departmental targets. Work Environment Keeps working areas neat, orderly and clutter-free, including the hallways. Adheres to cleaning processes and puts things back where they belong. Removes and reports broken equipment and furniture.Picks up and disposes of any litter found throughout entire facility.Posts flyers and posters in designated areas only; does not post on walls, doors or windows.Knows where the Environment of Care Manual is kept in department; corrects or reports unsafe conditions to the appropriate departments.Protects the physical environment and equipment from damage and theft.The flexibility to orient and work at all UCSF Medical Center locations is required.Equal Employment OpportunityThe University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
