title: Talent Acquisition Analyst
description: Help Us Enhance Patient Care Across America   Vituity Team. We innovate using our diverse business, analytic, and communications skills to tackle the challenges of today’s complex healthcare landscape. We reward excellence in our mission to enhance patient care across the health care continuum. We collaborate, cooperate, and celebrate our unique contributions because we know we can achieve more together than we can alone.   From our administrators and management consultants to our recruiters, data and financial analysts, developers, and marketers—we help the providers and hospitals we serve improve patient outcomes, operational efficiencies, revenue, and job satisfaction.   As a member of the Vituity team, you’ll put your skills to work helping our providers improve the care of the 6 plus million patients our providers treat annually in over 250 practices throughout the United States. You’ll have the recognition and support you need to grow professionally. And you’ll have the opportunity to discover work you really love in a family oriented company that wants you to succeed.   We are actively searching for a Business/Data Analyst with a strong understanding of talent acquisition and recruiting. This person will work with talent acquisition leadership, marketing and others to optimize utilization of metrics and analytic data. They will also develop benchmarking and data-driven insights for enterprise-wide talent acquisition strategies and initiatives. We are looking for someone who can deliver recruiting predictive analytics, ROI analysis and recommendations that will enable our leaders to make informed business decisions, drive productivity and efficiencies to reduce or control costs. This is a great opportunity for someone looking to grow their career in analysis and talent acquisition!  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to…Create routine reports and prepare analysis of recruiting trends for existing programs and new initiatives.Design and recommend key metrics for talent acquisition operations to better align resources and drive better decision makingIdentify, analyze and forecast trends into meaningful visualizations and develop presentations for leadership as needed.Produce and present monthly and quarterly talent acquisition analysis reports to support business line data activity reporting needs.Work with TA Managers to develop and maintain user dashboards that display real time and on-demand KPIs for the Talent Acquisition and Talent Sourcing and Operations teams.Collaborate with the sourcing team to routinely audit and evaluate new job boards, search engine optimization and assess new posting/advertising opportunities across the enterprise.Interact and partner with external sourcing vendors to support sourcing strategies as neededProvide ad hoc reporting and analysis as needed.  Our Ideal Candidate Profile…   Bachelor’s Degree with a concentration in human resources, business, information systems or related area.Two years of experience developing reports in an enterprise reporting tool with proficient knowledge of databases and business systems.Strong technical aptitude; advanced skills with various applications and systems including MS Office, Excel and at least two years of experience in recruitment ATS and/or HRIS technology.Excellent interpersonal communication skills (oral and written) with proven data visualization and presentation skills.Enthusiasm for data and analysis; previous experience using research, data, and external information sources to support decision making.Strong understanding of predictive analytics and other business-related data analysis strategies.Team player, high sense of urgency, desire to learn and grow.Self-directed, independent thinker with strong analytical skills and business acumen.    Why Vituity?   When you work at Vituity, you share your talents with an awesome team that makes coming to work empowering and fun. That’s why our employees have voted us a Best Place to Work in the Bay Area for nine years. That and some pretty incredible benefits: •         Competitive benefits package: Superior health plan options, best in class 401k plan (with a very generous company match like you’ve never seen before), 3 weeks paid vacation in your first year, tuition reimbursement policy, paid sabbaticals, and more! •         A Culture of Caring: Vituity not only like working together, but care about one another personally and professionally. We host fun staff activities, health and wellness programs, employee recognition programs, and so much more. •         Location, Location, Location: We are located in the Emeryville Watergate business park overlooking the San Francisco Bay -- just minutes away from San Francisco and the East Bay.   Your Life. Your Career. Your Success. Apply Today!   Vituity is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Associate Director of IT (REQ.  28342)
description: Under the general supervision of the Director of the Summer Sessions and International Education Office Information Technology (SSIEO IT), the Associate Director of IT will lead the data collection and analysis efforts for SSIEO, will be the primary liaison between SSIEO IT and SSIEO business units, will ensure business continuity, and will serve as the second in charge of SSIEO-IT. S/he will play a key role in identifying the priorities for requests coming from all business units, and will make sure that deadlines and priorities are set and communicated to the business units for all day-to-day requests. The Associate Director will document different processes for future reference.Serving as business and data analyst, the Associate Director will work closely with the SSIEO Marketing team and the business units to understand the data needs for the entire SSIEO, run queries and reports, help analyze the data to meet those needs. The incumbent will work closely with the project manager to understand the business requirements and assist with Quality Assurance (QA) testing, and guide users to perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT). S/he will also assist in troubleshooting production problems, and contribute to the evolution of Business and Data Analyst best practices, tools and techniques.Responsibilities include:1)             Research data organization, data security, privacy and data analysis needs in higher education setting2)             Become an expert in UCLA security and privacy policies and ensure proper data collection and storage practices are utilized3)             Become an expert in the data models for the UCLA's central student and financial systems as well as SSIEO's numerous local databases4)             Meet with constituents to determine data needs5)             Run queries and analyze data6)             Provide basic statistical analysis7)             Serve as the liaison between the business units and the IT8)             Prioritize and complete day-to-day tasks independently9)             Provide front line support and service for SSIEO business units10)           Elicit requirements using interviews, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis11)           Participate in testing developed software or new process flow12)           Perform quality assurance testing of system configuration and application development efforts to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of project13)           Provide testing guidance to business units14)           Assist developers to resolve production issues15)           Assist with user access requests and setup16)           Participate in project meetings to review project deliverables and timelines17)           Determine scope and participate in establishing priorities for system changes18)           Contribute to user experience standards, and best practices19)           Define user interface requirements in collaboration with developers20)           Promote best practices and communicating reasoning behind design decisions21)           Produce sketches, workflow diagrams, wireframes and mock-ups22)           Present work to the business units for review and feedback23)           Maintain a high awareness of industry issues and trends, particularly in regard to accessibility, usability and emerging technologies, with a view to incorporating these in future projects24)           Participate in the overall management of SSIEO as a member of the management team and serve as head of IT in the absence of the Director25)           Other duties as assigned Required:·         Demonstrated skill in eliciting and developing data requirements, specifying and designing inputs and outputs, producing system and programming specifications and requirements and recommending modifications to existing programs and processes. Ability to overcome obstacles and to meet deadlines.·         Demonstrated experience in designing user interfaces and applications.·         Demonstrated analytical, project management, and data analysis skills. Ability to analyze operational and organizational systems; define the problem or objective; identify relevant concerns, factors, or problems; formulate logical and objective conclusions. Recognize alternatives and their implications; propose alternatives; and implement procedural changes to get desired result.·         Working knowledge of SQL, SQL Server, MS Office suite.·         Demonstrated knowledge and experience with database tools including MS Access and MS SQL Server Management Studio.·         Demonstrated ability to prototype and design elegant UI solutions to represent data reports. Experience with user interface design patterns and proficient in wireframing and prototyping tools.·         Experience developing data analysis artifacts, such as tables and charts.·         Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with diverse groups of administrators, campus constituents, and management.·         Skill in setting priorities, meeting competing deadlines, and handling varying requirements and job complexities.·         Ability to write comprehensive, well organized, grammatically correct, and lucid reports, proposals, instructional/technical documentation, and technical reports concerning feasibility studies, systems requirements and design, detailed processing requirements, and programming specifications. Ability to overcome obstacles and to meet deadlines.·         Detailed knowledge of PC software including MS Office Suite.·         Familiarity with desktop publishing and graphic software.·         Ability to independently set priorities that accurately reflect the importance of job responsibilities.·         Ability to complete a heavy workload in a timely manner and with competing and diverse requirements and the pressure of deadlines.·         Ability to perform with constant interruptions and distractions.·         Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with co-workers, administrators, staff, faculty, students and vendors.·         Flexibility to accept new or special assignments on short notice to enable the department to cover essential functions or meet organizational goals. Preferred:·         Ability to define testing procedures and to carry out such procedures rigorously.·         Knowledge of data analysis processes and techniques.·         Working knowledge of .NET, Visual Basic, VB Script, VBA, ASP, and JavaScript.·         Detailed knowledge of federal and state laws and University of California policies regarding privacy and public information; working knowledge of student record policies and procedures.·         Experience with web development languages of HTML, CSS and JavaScript/jQuery.

title: Administrative Assistant / Data Analyst - Driver Messenger Supporting the DEA
description: A Data Analyst/Driver Messenger Executes The Following DutiesFocused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security, FSA, a rapidly growing joint venture owned by trusted solutions providers Engility and AECOM, has a vacancy for a Data Analyst/Driver Messenger supporting the DEA. This position provides administrative support to the Drug Enforcement Administration San Francisco Field Division as part of DEA's Administrative Support Unit. Data Analyst/Driver Messenger is the job title; the duties are administrative/clerical. Provide organization and management of case files Review data (completeness of information, proper execution) Extract data from data base Obtain additional information from other investigative agencies/data base Establish/maintain physical file Prepare notices/advertisements Receive, suspense petitions, claims, process sharing requests Reconcile inconsistencies Prepare declarations Gather information and organize investigative package Verify case files and case tracking system Maintain internal status information on the disposition of all forfeited assets Assure information is accurate and perform analytical computations necessary to process data Conduct and reconcile inventories Distribute and receive documents Assist lead analyst or official in obtaining/collecting all documents/information to complete case file Provide administrative information and assistance concerning case to other investigative agencies, local law enforcement agencies, US Attorney, and other DOJ processing units, and higher headquarters Extract data from agency data base for management and program reports Perform word processing relevant to case documentation Perform data entry relevant to case Some offices require a Data Analyst to occasionally perform driver and messenger activities specifically related to Asset Forfeiture Program Operation of Government vehicles, Contractor vehicles in performance of contract requirements, and seized conveyances in the custody of the Government Delivery of messages, documents, packages and mail to business concerns or Government offices Delivery of seized assets (including high value and confidential) in accordance with approved Government requirements Maintaining a log of items received and delivered Forfeiture Support Associates (FSA), LLC is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote qualified persons in all job titles without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender, HIV status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation (including gender expression and identity), veteran status, family leave status or any protected group status as defined by applicable law.

title: Sr. Financial Data Analyst
description: Responsible for National Cost accounting production and reconciliation processes. Performs technical analyses on costed data to insure data quality. Use technical skills including SAS & SQL, to compile complex analyses, using relational data bases such as IDR and Value Tracker. Familiar with KP operations and financial/clinical systems such as Oracle and Epic/Clarity. Understands principals of cost accounting and possesses technical skills to tap into various source systems to research issues when appropriate. Develops, interprets and implements financial concepts for financial planning and control. Performs technical analysis to determine present and future financial performance. Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts. Performs economic research and studies in the areas of return, depreciations, working capital requirements, investment opportunities, investment performance and impact of governmental requirements.Essential Functions:• Prepares financial reports and conducts comprehensive analyses with written summaries to management. • May be accountable for the coordination, compilation and distribution of financial data. • Performs financial analysis upon identification of variances, and coordinates with junior analysts' variance analysis process as defined. • Participates in the planning and development of regional, departmental and/or functional budgets. • May be responsible for budget system completion and high level reviews. • Participates in and/or leads projects of moderate to complex scope as assigned.Basic Qualifications:Experience• Minimum five (5) years of financial analysis or related experience.Education• Bachelor's degree in finance related field, OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. • High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required.License, Certification, Registration• N/A  Additional Requirements:• Broad application of financial analysis principles, theories, and concepts in applicable discipline, plus working knowledge of other related fields. • Advanced proficiency in PC based word processing and spreadsheet applications, including advanced functions such as graphics, pivot tables, macros and database management. • Thorough knowledge of financial analysis policies, practices and systems. • Complete understanding and application of financial analysis principles, concepts, practices, and standards. • Highly developed knowledge of finance theories such as present values theory/cash flow analysis and accounting principles. • Able to formulate finance study designs and prepare and conduct professional presentations. • Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment.Preferred Qualifications:• Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, writing skills, communication skills, consulting skills and presentation skills• Must be strong with SQL/SAS• Must work well under deadlines and but be able to multi task• KP Business knowledge and clinical data familiarity (HealthConnect)• Hospital operations a plus

title: Business Data Analyst
description: About The Business Analyst RoleWe’re looking for someone to join our Business team to help manage our growing strategic planning and analysis needs. This function will have a direct impact on achieving the company’s operational and financial objectives. The Business Analyst will work with our Finance, operations, and engineering teams to understand business issues, define analyses, and build tracking and monitoring solutions to enable us to improve our financial performance.We aren't your average tech startup; our business model brings up diverse and interesting challenges in areas from delivery logistics to software design to marketing research, and we’re looking for someone to help us wrangle them. This is a great opportunity for someone interested in joining a growing organization in a high impact position to help solve analytical problems. We face totally new and unique issues every day as we grow, and we’re looking for someone who will get their hands dirty and think creatively to define our solutions. A strong analytical foundation and modeling experience are a must.Responsibilities codifying top-level business flows and models developing financial models and forecasts analyzing current and past financial data and performance identifying trends and forecasts, recommending actions monitoring variances cost analysis process; provide recommendations to improve financial performance, establishing policies and procedures maintain database for backup data and keep financial reports up-to-date Help with automation of accounting systems The Ideal Candidate Has A passion for improving local food systems and changing the world. Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Finance, quantitative discipline or equivalent experience. 5+ years of experience in a related and analytical role Airtight quantitative skills, including demonstrable SQL skills and Excel modeling Understanding of accounting principles and business administration Experience modeling and analyzing business events Strategic thinking Why work for Good Eggs? Deepen your knowledge of locally produced food by engaging with our producer and eater community. Incredible work environment with passionate, accomplished team members. Locally-sourced team lunches made by our on-site chef, regular happy hours, and employee discounts on amazing local food! Most of all--- Good Eggs offers an opportunity to use your energy, creativity, and enthusiasm to participate in building a better food system. We're looking for folks who are passionate about our mission, talented and driven to change the world. If that sounds like you, get in touch!

title: Data Analyst (Python / SQL )

As a reputable company in the IT staffing industry, you can trust us to place you in the right position. We currently have an opportunity for a Data Analyst in Mountain View, CAMain Responsibilities Use in-house tools to review self-driving scenarios (e.g. xview). Build tools for data analysis using Python and SQL. Build dashboards using database queries. Write reusable data analysis software. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in engineering or other technical field 1-5 years of data analysis experience and/or completed a thesis-based Master's degree Written database queries (SQL) Written Python (numpy, matplotlib) Written scientific or technical reports. A thesis for an advanced degree is a plus. Interest and willingness to write reusable data analysis software Our Benefits Package Includes Comprehensive Medical Benefits Competitive Pay, 401K Retirement Plan And Much More About TekPartnersTekPartners is one of the fastest growing private staffing firms in the United States. As experts in the industry, our team continues to match proven talent to the right job opportunity every day.TekPartners is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: BI Analyst
description: The BI Analyst role will define, design, develop, test, analyze, and maintain analytical solutions that meet Progenitiy’s financial, operational and clinical requirements in order to provide actionable intelligence. The BI Analyst is required to collaborate with various business sponsors to determine their analytical needs. They are also required to analyze if a new solution is required or a current solution has the required information to fulfill the request. This position will work closely with the BI Architect to ensure proposed solutions maintain the architectural integrity of the entire BI stack, which includes backend data structures, ETLs from source systems, data quality routines, and information delivery via analytical tools.RESPONSIBILITIES:Strategy & Planning Determines analytical requirements by analyzing client operations, applications, workflows and available data elements within our production data marts. Develop analytical solutions that meet requirements outlined by the user that are also fully compliant of all regulatory requirements. Documents SOP for technical support and customer use. Prepares users for success by conducting training and on-going learning sessions. Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations. Collaborate with developers, programmers, and designers in conceptualizing and development of new software programs and applications specifically around analytical requirements. Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures, looking for opportunities where data and analytics can improve operational efficiencies. Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments. Assist in defining analytical development project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation. Research, identify, analyze, and fulfill requirements of all internal and external program users. Operational Management Liaise with network administrators, systems analysts, and software engineers to assist in resolving problems with company systems. Write code and configure all database and analytical related tools according to specifications. Design, run and monitor tests on new and existing analytical solutions for the purposes of data quality, performance improvement, and general debugging. Generate statistics for management and team members regarding performance and usage. Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines. Train IT personnel on analytical solutions structure and design. Install software/tools as required. Provide guidance to business analyst on leveraging technology to analyze data. Design analytical solutions and processes that comply with all IT CAP, CLIA, HIPAA, Hitech and SOX compliance regulations. Comply with the Progenity's Polices/Procedures protecting patient information and the confidentiality of the information in accordance with the Federal and State regulations, including CAP, CLIA, HIPAA, Hitech and SOX. REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor of Science (or equivalent experience) is required. Extensive experience in developing analytical solutions for a diverse organization. Excellent coding and development skills with T-SQL. Extensive experience with Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL and Microsoft Windows Server OS environments. Thorough understanding of platforms such as .NET Framework and Java. Prior experience interviewing end-users for insight on functionality, interface, problems, and/or usability issues. Hands-on experience developing test cases and test plans. Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws. Able to communicate effectively with non-technical staff and with members of interdisciplinary teams. Flexible and adaptable to learning and understanding new technologies. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to conduct research into software-related issues and products. Highly self motivated and directed. Keen attention to detail. Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. To apply, please send resume to HR@progenity.com

title: Product Data Analyst (Blockchain)
description: A fast-growing Blockchain company based in the Bay Are are looking a Product focused Data Analyst to join a growing team   Skills: You will do deep data dives and track metrics around our product in order to understand how it is being used, how recent changes have affected metrics, and where optimization opportunities are for our business and product. You will also work on data-analytic projects with marketing, life-cycle, operations, the executive team that require you to have flexible quantitative skills. You will communicate your findings in presentations, build dashboards and visualizations, and be the go-to person for questions about data. Work closely with product manager and product design team.   Experience: • You have an excellent product sense and 5+ years industry experience in product analytics. • Given that you will work across a variety of domains in this role, the ideal person would also have some experience in business, marketing or operations analytics but that is not as important as product analytics. • You should have strong SQL skills which will not only enable you to drill deeply down into the data looking for insights but to also help others on the team gain access to more insightful data (e.g., dashboards). If you can supplement or mostly replace SQL with Python, that’s a plus but not necessary. • Given that this role will require you to present your findings, visually in dashboards and in presentations, and to work with people across teams, it is critical that you are an excellent communicator. • Ideally, you would have experience either with visualization tools, or Pythonic approaches to data visualization. • You should also have strong quantitative skills and a basic understanding in statistics (e.g., when you find an interesting pattern, you can figure out when it is just noise). We are not, however, looking for someone with a background in machine learning and advanced statistics. • You should be able to work independently and take ownership of your projects.   Compensation: Circa $150,000 base To find out more get in touch with william@intelletec.com

title: Data Analyst
description: Data driven decision-making is an integral part of life at Wish. It drives our success with customers and merchants. We’re looking for talented Data Analyst to continue to drive decisions company-wide through the use of statistical modeling and machine learning, who are passionate about using data to help drive informed product and business decisions for the company.You will enjoy working with one of the richest social e-commerce data sets in the world, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products on a regular basis. You should have an extensive background in a quantitative field, a strong research background, and experience working with large data sets. You should be results-driven, highly motivated, and have a track record of using data analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and the success of a product.What You'll DoApply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, machine learning, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our products.Partner with Product Engineering and Operations teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities.Work alongside the Product Managers on the Product team to analyze the results of A/B experiments.Make recommendations on new experiments to run based on the data, and work alongside the engineering team to make sure features are engineered with data tracking in mind.Inform, influence, support, and execute our product decisions, product launches, and business strategies.Who You Are4+ years experience doing quantitative analysis, preferably for a web or mobile companyBA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or other technical fieldExperience in SQL or other query languages. Development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)Understanding of statistics and machine learning techniques (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions, decision trees, clustering, etc.)Experience manipulating data sets through statistical software (ex. R, SAS) or other methodsExperience with distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)Experience with data visualizationCompany DescriptionWish is transforming the way the world shops by offering a convenient and personalized mobile shopping experience. Our mission is to offer an unlimited selection of affordable quality goods to be accessible for everyone on a global scale. Wish selectively brings together world-class talent with a passion for connecting relevant products to the global population.Learn More About UsIntro to WishOur CEO discusses WishCrunchbaseRecruiting VideoWish values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at hrteam@wish.com . For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: IT Procurement Analyst
description: Job Description The Supplier Operational Delivery & Performance Analyst is responsible for collecting and analyzing data related to services delivered from our Application, Infrastructure and Service-based Suppliers.The primary goals will be to evaluate the efficiency of Suppliers and assess the performance metrics and the resulting efficiencies.The Analyst will need to be familiar with the technical environment, which describes all of the services that are necessary to deliver services to Farmers. Additionally, the position assesses the Supplier’s compliance with contract terms & conditions, Service Level Agreements (SLA’s), Operational Level Agreements (OLA’s) and reports on the status of all deliverables at a tactical level. Essential Job Functions60% Duties: Supplier Engagement Support IT technology Suppliers and contracts by assessing processes, policies and services performed Collaborate with managers and Suppliers to analyze performance metrics to support changes to IT and Business decisions Engage Business Management Team to ensure proper coding of invoices and generation of aging and accrual reports Engage Strategic Sourcing and Procurement department to ensure SOW’s and contract compliance Analyze contracts to determine total spend and ROI on Business Cases Gather data on Supplier health and strength in a Strategic Supplier Profile Produce ad-hoc Supplier reports Provide sourcing advisory and system support Actively analyze and recommend actions for supplier’s performance metricsSupports monthly reporting regarding all contracted services and uptime operational commitments. Supports yearly mapping exercise linking all processes to significant Infrastructure and application delivery items associated with the Managed Services SOW’s. Deliver audit report to OCIO for interpretation and discussion with Supplier associated at strategic level standards. 35% Duties: Key Sourcing Metrics and Escalation Engage Suppliers to drive benefits based on Farmers requirements Aligning metrics, gaining convergence and thinking short-term and long-term goall Problem-solving and collaborating with different teams in engineering, analytics, and account management Build and improve processes that will improve data flow management Support audit reports delivered to the OCIO for interpretation and discussion with Supplier at strategic level standards. Gather data for analysis to drive recommendations on key Supplier performance as to time, quality, scope, budget, capacity and responsiveness from a tactical level. Gather data to assess appropriate key Supplier performance metrics at a tactical level in collaboration with the OCIO. 5% Duties: Pursue Professional Development Maintain professional interactions with other IT Governance professionals. Requirements Excellent excel skills required3-5 yrs Vendor Mgmt Experience Required

title: CRM SALES ANALYST
description: Position Summary:  Job SummaryThe Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Sales Analyst will be responsible for the management and maintenance of the CRM system. Management of the CRM systems includes, but is not limited to, ensuring the sales process is accurate as it pertains to data entry and the recording and entry of 7 or more different deal types. The CRM Sales Analyst will also assist, train and coach the entire sales team in North America on systems usage, tracking of all deal related financials, monitoring of all sales input processes, and generation of reports that will assist the sales executives as well as the sales professionals make better business decisions. This position is a direct report to the Vice President of Sales, and will be the CRM Sales Analyst point of contact between North America Sales and our international partners.ResponsibilitiesManage all aspects of the multi-faceted sales process as it pertains to the CRM system.Work closely with the Vice President of Sales, and assist with the training and coaching on the CRM system to all new and existing sales employees.Provide day-to-day support to the Vice President of Sales, Pre-Sales Team, Sales Directors, and Sales Team in all matters that pertain to the CRM system.Provide recommendations on processes that will enhance the CRM systems as it relates to employee usage.Ensure that the CRM system can accurately support and match the assigned sales territories commensurate with the sales professionals.Participate and represent the Vice President of Sales on conference calls, face to face meetings as well as written correspondences.Responsible for creating and updating department reports, PowerPoint presentations, pipeline reports, and spreadsheets for data associated with Sales deal activity.Perform other duties and ad hoc projects as required by the Vice President of Sales.Assisting with the qualification process by gathering information over the phone or via email from potential clients and or stakeholders. QualificationsMinimum 3-5 years of sales support related experienceBachelor’s Degree in business or equivalent

title: Clinical Data Analyst
description: Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation's largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members in five health plans, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.Mission: L.A. Care's mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.DUTIESThe individual supports quality and process improvement activities by producing healthcare outcome measurements that are used for internal and external reporting, the tasks including data warehouse building, data quality assurance, process programming, specification documentation and report developing.The clinical data analyst applies technical skills to design, develop, and generate ad hoc or production reports that may evolve into complex data analysis/data integration projects that this individual may be responsible for maintaining. The complex data analysis/integration projects are those which may require periodic maintenance on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, biannual, or annual basis. The individual works with Information Systems analysts when ongoing reports can be accurately transferred for production.The individual interprets and documents both written and verbal specifications. The individual takes basic instructions or specifications and interviews the client for complete details sufficient for writing data queries based for ad hoc and ongoing health care measures. The individual must comprehend the relationships between the field elements in encounters and claims, membership, and provider databases.The individual is a key resource to the HOA department on application use. The individual supports the functions related to quality improvement activities inclusive of quarterly reports that demonstrate health care outcomes in comparison to targets or national averages/percentiles published by recognized organizations such as NCQA and CDC. Analytic skills include the ability to identify data aberrations and recognize data patterns that impact quality.Qualifications And RequirementsEDUCATIONRequiredHigh School DiplomaPreferredAssociates, Bachelor's, or Master's Degree in Health Sciences, Statistics, Information Systems or other related field.LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONSPreferredSAS CertificationCHDARequiredEXPERIENCEMedium to Advanced SAS programming skills.Demonstrated ability to use relational databases for the purpose of generating ad hoc reports.The ability to work well in a team setting with individuals having professional backgrounds in the technical and/or clinical fields.Must demonstrate the ability to work independently and seek solutions proactively.Able to apply critical thinking in evaluating priorities/solutions.PreferredDemonstrated ability to take responsibility for making sure requested projects meet the client's needs with respect to data accuracy, format, and timeliness.L.A. Care Offers a Wide Range Of Benefits Including Paid Time Off (PTO) Tuition Reimbursement Retirement Plans Medical, Dental and Vision Wellness Program Volunteer Time Off (VTO)

title: Financial Analyst
description: Fisher & Paykel Healthcare is a world leader in the design, manufacture and marketing of medical devices, exporting to over 120 countries globally. We are a company with a consistent growth strategy, providing an expanding range of innovative devices for use in respiratory care, acute care, surgery and the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea.About the role: Located in Irvine, California We need someone with a strong background drawing data from multiple sources to make business recommendations with the bigger picture in mind. Your previous experience could be as a Forecast Analyst, Financial Analyst, Pricing Analyst or Operations Analyst – anything that involves calculations and predictions based on a robust understanding of both the detailed numbers and the broader business context. Great Excel skills and familiarity with business intelligence tools will be expected. You will need to be prepared to roll up your sleeves and crunch numbers yourself – but you’ll also be expected to present and defend findings to senior management, to work closely with all areas of the business, and to be a safe pair of hands without the need for close supervision. You will be comfortable managing projects and processes involving multiple people from different departments. Your critical thinking skills will be excellent. Previous experience in the healthcare industry – particularly at a large medical device company, GPO or distributor – is desirable but not required.   This role has responsibility for: Analyze, interpret, develop and produce reports to enable effective strategic planning and decision making which supports business unit profitability. Maintain up to date and accurate sales results in all reporting systems. Provide input to sales and marketing team regarding the predicted effectiveness of multiple promotional scenarios and impact to sales forecast in order to monitor overall business impact. Produce reports to fulfill management requests for sales information and product groups to investigate and understand trends. Check, validate and verify reports to ensure accuracy of data and enable informed decision making by the business. Develop and implement forecasts to plan for growth. Provide GPO analysis and deliver logical pricing conclusion. Recommends actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; studying proposed changes in methods and materials. Consult with management to guide and influence long term and strategic decision making within the broad scope. Develop financial models, conduct benchmarking and process analysis. Skills and Experience: Bachelor’s degree in finance, business or other applicable field Master’s preferred 3-5 years’ experience in financial analysis/forecasting or equivalent Cognos or TM1 Experience preferred Strong organizational and project management skills Demonstrated problem solving ability Advance computer and financial modelling skills to establish coherent structure of reporting Excellent communication skills Strong business acumen SQL Experience SAP Business Objects   In return, we will offer you an opportunity to work as part of a dedicated and energetic sales team at a company with a fantastic culture of commitment to our employees and customers. You'll have an opportunity to participate in a rewards and benefits program which offers medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, employee stock purchase plan. We relentlessly focus on improving patients' lives and strive to provide a high quality of life for our employees. Play a part and apply now! Fisher & Paykel Healthcare is an equal opportunity employer. The Company's policy is not to discriminate, nor allow any employee to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, including veterans and disabled veterans.Fisher & Paykel Healthcare participates in E-Verify.

title: AVP, Data & Analytics - Vacaville
description: Job DescriptionPrimary Objectives: Fosters value creation from the use of the organization’s data assets, as well as the external data ecosystem. Ensures best in class managing and delivering of data.Turns data into actionable insights that drive business value. Acts as data strategist and adviser; steward for improving data quality; and evangelist for data sharing. Ensures data is consistent, accurate and accessible for regulatory and business purposes.Creates value through data exploitation and envisioning data-enabled strategies, as well as enabling business outcomes through analytics, data and analytics governance, and enterprise information policies. Shortens the distance between questions and data-driven answers.Ensures enterprise information policies and governance programs align with relevant regulatory, legal and ethical mandates.Supervisory RelationshipsReports directly to the SVP/CIO.Overall supervisory responsibility for the Data and Analytics staff.Principal ResponsibilitiesServes as a trusted advisor/expert to internal business partners on advanced analytic and big data issues. Partners with leadership team to understand current and future data needs. Organizes and leads centers of excellence related to data governance and analytics.Builds a team of data practitioners to enable and support a culture of data sharing and repurposing. Provides leadership, coaching, professional development and day-to-day support to staff. Ensures staff has the skills and training necessary to successfully complete assigned tasks and responsibilities. Interviews prospective employees and coordinates the selection and hiring process of new employees. Troubleshoots issues and provides hands-on support as needed, to ensure the smooth, efficient operations of the department. Assists staff in developing methods and procedures to improve efficiencies and ensure project details are designed with the appropriate requirements and achieved on time. Drives the development and deployment of the organization’s data and analytics platform for digital business. Leads the strategy and the development of data and analytics products and is a champion for a data-driven, decision-making culture.Institutes and standardizes the use and governance of data and algorithms used for analysis, analytical applications and automated decision making. Oversees the review, refinement and streamlining of the organization’s analyzing efforts resulting from the consolidation of various functions into a holistic organization.Institutes an approach for enterprise information management to identify, prioritize and executes the data and analytic initiatives that align to the organization’s strategies and business outcomes.Develops and maintains controls on data quality, interoperability and sources to effectively manage risk associated with the use of data and analytics.Works with the IT management team to oversee the integration and staging of data and the development and maintenance of the data lakes, data warehouses and data marts, for use by analysts throughout the organization.QualificationsBA/BS in Business Administration, Computer Science or Data Analytics or related field or equivalent experience.Minimum 7 years of relevant experience, advanced business knowledge and general management and leadership experience leading business or functional teamsMinimum 5 years of progressive leadership experience in leading cross-functional teams, enterprise-wide programs/projects or directing the allocation of resources.Extensive experience building and leading a data organization or practice, as well as successful experience advocating for data and driving business value from data across a business.Experience in management and leadership roles, ideally with a blend of technology and operations experience and a strong business orientation and acumen.Experience with data warehouse planning and design, preferably in the financial sector.Experience working with senior teams in defining outcome prioritization/definition as it relates to data. Broad business experience within financial services preferred.Skills & AbilitiesExcellent business acumen and interpersonal skills; able to build relationships and work across business lines at all levels of the organization to influence and effect change.Expert knowledge of information systems and data lifecycle management best practices and methodologies.Demonstrated leadership; proven track record of leading complex, multidisciplinary teams to deliver solutions.Understanding of how to utilize big data environments.Innovation and a willingness to challenge traditional paradigms with an eye to raising the game towards an analytics organization.Proven data literacy – the ability to describe business use cases/outcomes, data sources and management concepts.Broad experience desired, but not essential, in multiple domain areas, such as data warehousing, business intelligence, data governance, data architecture, data integration, data strategy, data quality management, and regulatory compliance.Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences (both verbally and written).Company DescriptionWhy TCU? Headquartered in Vacaville, California, Travis Credit Union is a not-for-profit, cooperative financial institution serving those who live or work in Solano, Yolo, Sacramento, Placer, San Joaquin, Stanislaus, Napa, Contra Costa, Alameda, Sonoma, Colusa, and Merced Counties. Currently, Travis Credit Union is the 14th largest credit union in California, with more than 206,000 members and over 3.06 billion in assets. TCU members can access their accounts at 23 convenient branch locations, at 35,000 free CO-OP Network® ATMs, through secure, easy-to-use Online Banking, our mobile app for Apple® iPhone® or by telephone using our Call-24 Phone Banking. As one of the leading financial institutions in Solano, Contra Costa, Yolo, Napa, and Merced Counties, Travis Credit Union's strength lies in its faithful commitment to its members; its solid, secure history; and its long-standing track record of dedicated service.BENEFITS We offer medical, dental, vision, life insurance, FSA, vacation/sick/holiday pay, matching 401(k) with 100% vested immediately, educational assistance and annual bonus for all regular full-time employees. Plus a few fun perks like our gym, ping pong table, and a rest and relaxation room that are available at Corporate Headquarters.Why else? We are an EMPLOYER OF CHOICE! We have AWESOME employees! We believe in promoting from within whenever possible and developing our staff. We are passionate about helping people and believe in our mission, "We are dedicated to building lifelong relationships with our members to help them achieve their financial goals." It's quite simple. Travis Credit Union is a great place to work!To view a more detailed job description, learn more about TCU and apply, visit: www.traviscu.org/careers/We are an EMPLOYER OF CHOICE in the Communities we serve.TCU is a drug-free workplace. Pre-employment screening is required.Visit www.traviscu.org for a full list of our current openingsEOE/Individual with Disability/Veteran Status

title: Staff Quality Systems Engineer
description: The CompanyStryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. More information is available at www.stryker.com .The DivisionStryker’s Neurovascular division is focused on advancing the practice of less invasive stroke therapies through its Complete Stroke Care solutions. The business is dedicated to providing innovative stroke products and services for ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke, and committed to providing clinical education and support to help physicians deliver better patient outcomes. Products include: stent retrievers, detachable coils, stents, balloons, guidewires and microcatheters.In March 2018, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that for the eight consecutive year has been named as one of the 2018 FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For, rising to 16th place out of 100.Our missionTogether with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better.Who we wantAchievers. High stamina performers who thrive on being busy and productive.Problem Solvers. People who use the right tools to develop innovative and robust solutions to challenges. Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.Learners. People with a great desire to learn and continuously improve.Communicators. Those who are can easily put their thoughts in to words and deliver compelling presentations.Owners. Team members who take accountability personally; who say what they do and do what they say.What You Will Do In This RoleAs the DPO (Division Process Owner) for Document Control and Change Management, you will take a leading hands-on role in the implementation of the new Global document management system. This will include coordination of migration of legacy data, identification of key resources and initial system training.On completion of the roll out, you will assume the role of primary change analyst, chairing the Change Review Board and leading the assessment of change on the QMS.In addition to this, you will also support a range of Quality System improvement projects and activities, including identification and implementation of meaningful quality metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) across the Division, NC/CAPA ownership, participation in the EU MDR initiative and also in the Internal & External Audit programs.What you needBachelor’s degree with a minimum of 4 years in Quality/Regulatory Affairs environment with 2 years experience in interacting with regulatory agencies (FDA, BSi, etc.) Strong knowledge of Quality Systems (e.g. Document Control, Change Control, NC/CAPA, Audits, Management review, Quality Planning)Demonstrated knowledge of FDA regulations, MDSAP program, as well as of European and international regulatory/industry guidelines/standards, and ability to interpret and applyStrong organization and project management skills, and the ability to operate in a high paced environment.Work From Home: NoTravel Percentage: Up to 25%Stryker Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Stryker is an EO employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability.Stryker Corporation will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

title: Localization Data Analyst - Onsite in Los Gatos, CA
description: Moravia is looking for a Data Analyst to work onsite for our client based in Los Gatos, CA. The Localization Data Analyst is a role for a candidate who has both project coordination and data manipulation skills. In this role, you will be moving our data and finance tracking model from multiple spreadsheet documents and raw data dumps into a clean, templated model. You will create reports and dashboards on the aggregated data to start tracking trends and other information. You will help us create a clean and organized framework for invoice tracking, data tracking and basic reporting. In addition to managing the data, you will use your coordination skills to run small projects that support our translation audit and data capture process. Part of this work will require data tracking. We are looking for someone who is resourceful, inquisitive and comfortable asking questions. A successful candidate is comfortable in a fast-paced environment and able to work independently with sufficient instructions.  RequirementsB.A. degree in Finance or Accounting a plus.2+ years of previous work experience, ideally in an internet company.2+ years of project coordination or management experience, localization project                    management experience is a plus.Experience and comfort learning and using different kinds of spreadsheet tools (i.e.              Microsoft, Google or other online tools).Solid experience performing data analysis (Excel pivot tables and charts) and creating        reports.Experience using SQL.Well-versed in data visualization, Tableau knowledge a plus.  TasksCapture and synthesize disparate invoicing elements from multiple sources.Align documentation for both invoice processing and data tracking.Perform analytics on the raw data and provide regular reports on them.Prepare all data reports for dashboarding. Job InformationHourly, non-exempt position. 40 hours per week. W2 payroll position. 6 months contract. Onsite in Los Gatos, CA. If you are ready to combine your passion with work reach out to us!Thank you,Moravia Recruiting Team

title: Data Analyst
description: The Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining data integrity and building data reports to provide visibility to Bank activities and customer profiles. This position provides data-driven insights in the form of ad hoc analyses, presentations, and automated reports, and encompass marketing, product, and finance analytics.Demonstrates knowledge of, adherence to, monitoring and responsibility for compliance with state and federal regulations and laws as they pertain to this position including but not limited to the following: GLBA(Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act), Regulation Z (Truth in Lending Act), Regulation DD (Truth in Savings Act) Regulation B (Equal Credit Opportunity Act), Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Dodd Frank Act), Elder Abuse Laws, Bank Secrecy Act in conjunction with the USA PATRIOT Act, Anti-Money Laundering and Customer Information Program, Right to Financial Privacy Act (state and federal) and Community Reinvestment Act.Manages master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.Provides quality assurance of imported data.Processes confidential data and information according to guidelines.Manages and designs the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.Supports the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.Supports initiatives for data integrity and normalization.Assesses tests and implements new or upgraded software and assists with supporting strategic decisions on new systems.Generates reports from single or multiple systems.Troubleshoots the reporting database environment and reports.Trains end users on new reports and dashboards.Provides technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; inspires the trust of others; works ethically and with integrity; upholds organizational values; accepts responsibility for own actions.These specifications are general guidelines based on the minimum experience normally considered essential to the satisfactory performance of this position. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required to perform the position in a satisfactory manner. Individual abilities may result in some deviation from these guidelines. Bachelor’s degree from a college or university; and/or at least three (3) years of experience and/or training in project management preferably within the financial services industry; or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Educational experience, through in-house training sessions, formal school or data management or related curriculum. Speaking, reading and writing in Korean is a plus. Ability to deliver bilingual customer service in Korean, Gujarati, Urdu, Hindi, Chinese, Vietnamese, or Spanish is a plus. Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.We will consider for employment all qualified Applicants, including those with Criminal Histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Consulting Data Analyst
description: Description: Under close supervision, this position exists to assist the organization in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. This position functions both as an analyst and as a statistical analytics and/or report programmer.Essential Functions Develops reports with accurate, easy to read, useful information. Designs and generates tracking and monitoring tools. Designs and enhances databases. Designs menu systems that are effective and user-friendly. Participates in the development of outcomes and process measures, including technical specifications, to enable population measurement, guideline implementation, and evaluation. Maintains complex statistical routines, which may include the use of SAS, macros, vendor software, and software written by self and others. Tests and maintains data integrity.

title: G&G Data Analyst/ GG Support Analyst
description: G&G Data Analyst/ GG Support AnalystFULL TIME Work Location (City & State): SFO,CAPosition Description GG Support Analyst Must Have GG Data Management expertise with one or more of the following applications Petrel, Open Works , Arc Map, and Studio Manager Data loading experience with Petrel, andor Studio Manager Petrel Studio Manger user support experience Data migration between Landmark SIS Schlumberger applications. a Data migration Between Open Works Petrel. b Data migration Between Petrel Studio Manager repositories c Data migration Between Petrel WPH Knowledge of how to work with the following data types well, log, picks, seismic, horizons, faults, grids, and surfaces. title: Data Analyst - Local Candidates ONLY
description: *Considering candidates local to Orange County, CA ONLY* Do you want to work for a BLUE CHIP, publicly traded powerhouse in Orange County?? If yes, keep reading! Based in Irvine, CA we are one of the leading real estate marketplace platforms on web and mobile in the US. We receive a trillion gigabytes of raw data a month and are in need of talented Data Analysts to extract and transform the data into usable information. The ideal candidate will have experience working with raw data and must be proficient with ETL, SSIS and SQL.What you’ll be doing: Transform, cleanse and manipulate extremely large raw data sets into usable information Prepare detailed specifications from which conversion programs will be written   What you need: 2+ years of professional experience as a data analyst Proficient with ETL tools and SSIS Experienced with SQL to aggregate, gather and manipulate data Experience working with large RAW data sets Advanced Microsoft Access and Excel experience Experience transforming, cleansing and manipulating raw data Nice have: Experience with Real Estate Public Records or Appraisal Data Passionate about DATA   Reasons to join us: Competitive base salary (70k - 80k) Generous stock option package Unlimited Cold Brew/Mochas/Cappuccinos/Americanos Unlimited PTO Award winning benefits Amazing work environment, yoga, gym memberships, game rooms, and much much more!

title: Marketing Data Analyst
location: 4225 Executive Square Suite 700, La Jolla, CA 92037, US

title: Jr Business Analyst
company: Staffigo Technical Services - IT Staffing & IT Consulting Company Based in Chicago
description: Job SummaryLooking for high powered and quantitatively oriented IT Business Analyst to support the Projects in IT Domain. Analyst will be required to analyze specific business problems and drive value in strategic areas of business.What You Will Get To Do Typically the customers would be Senior Managers / Directors from different Domains located in US, Latin America, and Asia Pacific. The analyst would typically handle a high impact project at any time which should result in bottom line impact. Most of the work would be around business understanding, data understanding, guiding junior analysts in data preparation, working with the statistical team to create models if required and result presentation.The analyst would be required to understand the business model, business brief, and the information available for analysis. Adhoc requirements would need to be fulfilled from time to time as well. High Level of Business analysis skills is necessary. Basic Requirement Graduate degree in Computer Science.Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science. Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.

title: Data Analyst II
description: Job DescriptionData Analyst is responsible for pulling data to support trending of product complaints and medical device reports utilizing data that resides in the complaint handling database for all product lines.This will include detailed data reports (e.g. graphs, charts, tables) prepared for routine trending, senior management reviews, ad-hoc requests, and cross-functional requests as needed (e.g. Regulatory, Quality Engineering, R&D). The Data Analyst will establish and maintain complex reporting formulas and templates using reporting tools such as Excel and other databases (e.g. Business Objects).This individual will work with the Data Analytics engineers and analysts to develop methods, templates, and reports for the Regulatory reports. With the new European Medical Device Regulations (EU MDR) being rolled out, the monitoring of product performance (such as customer complaints) will increase significantly. To produce accurate, long-term performance data sets, mining of current and legacy databases will be required. This will require extensive use of Business Objects, Excel (including macros and pivot charts), MS Access, Word, and PowerPoint. Collaboration with the technical experts writing the responses will also be required, often under a tight deadline. This individual should have prior experience with medical devices, European medical device regulations (but not an expert), as well as a willingness to learn about Abbott products.Company DescriptionTekwissen is HIRING!
