title: Senior Data Analyst
description: "The front page of the internet," Reddit brings over 330 million people together each month through their common interests, inviting them to share, vote, comment, and create across thousands of communities. Come for the cats, stay for the empathy.We are looking for a Data Analyst to work with Ads & Monetization team. You will work closely with Ads & Monetization team to understand how our data can be used to tell a compelling story to brands. In addition to strong analytical skills, this person has a solid business acumen and understanding of what is important to advertisers.Responsibilities Analyze conversations actions across Reddit's 50,000 interest-based communities, and convert into insights that help brands drive awareness, consideration, and purchase. Build dashboards that help ads & monetization team tell detailed stories about product effectiveness. Partner with Marketing to build data-backed marketing narratives. Collaborate with various cross-functional stakeholders, including Sales, Marketing, Sales Operations, Ads Engineering, and Finance, to improve data quality and access. Be a part of the Data Science org, leveraging and contributing to the vibrant knowledge base, shared across a community of world-class data experts. Qualifications BA in a quantitative major (mathematics, statistics, economics, finance) 3-5 years of experience in quantitative analytical roles. Proficiency with SQL. Familiarity with statistical analysis and programming languages (e.g., R / Python)

title: Commercial Real Estate Market Analyst I
description: Commercial Real Estate Market Analyst IJob DescriptionMa­rket AnalystCoStar Market AnalyticsOverviewCoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information in the United States. The firm has developed a number of extraordinarily successful, industry leading products that provide our clients with highly detailed commercial property, availability and transaction data. Clients in the U.S. and U.K. use our software tools to aggregate this information on their own in an effort to understand market conditions and trends, develop strategies and assist their decision making.Over the past two years, CoStar has invested more than $1 billion to create the industry-leading marketing platform for apartments. This investment has also revolutionized the nature of the apartment information CoStar can offer to its information consumers. Today, CoStar collects more than 30 million rent observations per month and maintains a dataset of more than 400 million rent observations, positioning CoStar as the essential provider of information and analytics on multifamily trends via the CoStar Market Analytics (CMA) product.To deliver this information, CoStar employs a growing team local Market Analysts responsible for the data integrity, analysis and written commentary for their market.Roles and ResponsibilitiesThe Commercial Real Estate Market Analyst is responsible for producing meaningful, relevant, and insightful analysis of real estate market conditions for inclusion in CoStar’s product offerings. This content will take various forms, including 1) written narratives in CoStar’s market and sub-market reports; 2) visual content included in presentations about the market; 3) verbal discussions about the market with CoStar customers; and 4) written and visual content sent to the media.This position is located in San Francisco.Analyze market data and draw insightful conclusions.The Commercial Real Estate Market Analyst is responsible for utilizing all the data available at CoStar and to manipulate, aggregate and organize this data to uncover trends, patterns and other insights of interest to the commercial real estate industry.Maintain well-written, timely CRE market and sub-market reports.One of the primary work products of the Commercial Real Estate Market Analyst is written analysis and commentary on sub-markets and markets covered by CoStar. This commentary should be relevant, insightful, interesting and thought provoking to CoStar clients.Regularly review CoStar data for accuracy, timeliness and quality.The Commercial Real Estate Market Analyst is responsible for monitoring CoStar data for the metro, reviewing for accuracy, and ensuring errors and outliers are corrected in a timely manner.Translate analysis and insights into meaningful presentations and deliver them to the market.Working with the Market Economist in the metro, the Commercial Real Estate Market Analyst will participate in in-person market updates to CoStar clients and industry groups, focusing on economic and CRE trends in the market.Qualifications5+ years of experience working in real estate, with familiarity of the local market.College degree, preferably in economics, finance, or real estate; graduate degree preferred.Firm understanding of economic theory and principles and their application to the real estate industry.Demonstrated writing skills; ability to write effectively and in large volumes.Strong data and analysis skills, in particular using MS Office.Good communication skills.Strong work ethic and ability to work in a team environment.Client orientation, a desire to help clients succeed.Must be legally authorized to work in the USCoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

title: UDAAP Program Data Analytics & Emerging Risk Team - Analytics Consultant 5
description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We're looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you'll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas credit risk, operational risk and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.Wells Fargo Compliance is the company’s compliance second line of defense function, providing company-wide leadership, standards, support, and independent oversight to ensure that all business groups abide by applicable laws, rules, regulations and regulatory guidance (regulatory requirements), meet compliance responsibilities, and manage compliance risks. Wells Fargo Compliance credibly challenges management decisions, business processes and activities, and evaluates and assesses adherence to applicable regulatory requirements. It provides appropriate analysis, reporting, and escalation to senior management and the Board of Directors, sets minimum standards for the company, and gives advice, guidance, and support for compliance risk management activities across the enterprise.The Responsible Banking Compliance Team is part of the Consumer Compliance Team and is responsible for compliance risk oversight of UDAAP and Fair Lending across the enterprise.This is an exciting opportunity for an Analytics Consultant to join the Responsible Banking Compliance team in a critical role to assist in the development and implementation of the UDAAP Data Analytics and Emerging Risk Team in support of an effective and sustainable enterprise UDAAP Compliance Program. This person will play a key role in developing, implementing and executing a sustainable, defined program for data analytics to proactively identify areas of emerging UDAAP risk, and to establish ongoing reporting on UDAAP risks and related issue management. This team will coordinate across the enterprise to work with business, risk and compliance leaders to fully implement a program to effectively identify emerging areas of emerging UDAAP risk, taking into account regulatory expectations and risk management practices. This position will be responsible assisting the UDAAP data analytics and emerging risk program in the development of key metrics, data analytics process development and senior executive dashboard creation, supported by well-defined and sustainable processes, appropriate methodology, and to develop effective UDAAP compliance reporting for the enterprise. This position will play a critically important role in identifying UDAAP risks across the enterprise.The UDAAP Analytics Consultant 5 will play a significant role in the development of a data analytics and emerging risk program in support of an effective and sustainable enterprise UDAAP Compliance Program, and will assist in taking implementation through to sustainable business as usual with an effective and sustainable program.This role is responsible for Performing highly complex activities related to business analysis and/or modeling. Providing insights, developing analytical strategies, performing analytical support and/or modeling regarding a wide array of business initiatives. Application of analytical methods. Lead/performs very complex analyses where issues must be identified and solutions identified or designed and that generally span multiple databases and involve very complex analytical methodology and design. Initiates and leads projects to plan, architect and implement solutions Consults with clients/partners to identify and define business issues and recommend analytical approaches and solutions Leads cross-functional business project and/or virtual teamsSpecific duties for this position include, but are not limited to Assist in the formulation and implementation of procedures for the analysis of reporting and underlying data from multiple vantage points and data sources to proactively identify area of potential risk, as well as analysis of data quality for improvement and development of metrics for ongoing monitoring of potential risk. Assist in the development, implementation and ongoing execution of a data analytics and emerging risk program focused on proactively identifying potential risks in large, highly complex business areas across the enterprise. Assist in the coordination with senior compliance and business leaders, including heads of businesses, Wells Fargo Audit Services and the Law Department to develop and implement the UDAAP data analytics and emerging risk program, including coordination to identify emerging risks. Assist in the formulation and implementation of procedures and controls in support of the data analytics and emerging risk program, as well as the process to identify emerging risks. Coordinate with New Business Initiatives (NBI) Process, working with enterprise systems of record (i.e. SHRP, RANBI), Third Party Compliance Oversight team in developing and implementing reporting an anal. Make key decisions guided by broad enterprise policies and objectives and guidance from compliance leadership, and coordinating activities across multiple businesses and risk areas, involving multiple systems and operating platforms. Support strong and constructive relationships with regulators and WFAS. Effectively manage change and creating a culture of “compliance awareness” where all team members share in accountability.Preferred locationsNC – Charlotte; CA – San Francisco; MN – Minneapolis; IA – Des Moines; OPEN to other locations throughout the U.S.Required Qualifications8+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modelingDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsA BS/BA degree or higherExperience with governance and oversight requirements for regulatory and risk reportingExperience communicating in both written and verbal formats with senior executive-level leadersLeadership skills including the ability to influence effectively in a matrix environmentExperience successfully escalating complex issues and tracking follow-through to completionExposure to Wells Fargo s Shared Risk Platform (SHRP)Ability to work with limited supervisionExperience developing improvement processes and implementation strategiesLeadership skills including; coaching, training, and mentoringSolid negotiation skills4 + years of SQL Server SSIS, SSRS and SSAS experience Knowledge and understanding of analytical methods used to measure and communicate key performance metrics (KPIs)4+ years of Tableau experienceOther Desired Qualifications Ability to build and maintain repeatable reporting processes and routines Ability to leverage data from front end user systems to design reports that assist the team to identify potential risk Advanced consulting and negotiation skills with multiple levels of management Excellent operational skills and experience executing on implementation of complex initiatives Excellent skills in coordinating across many business lines and working in an environment with multiple systems and processes Certifications or additional training applicable to areas of responsibility Advanced Excel experience including the use of macros Ability to produce high level summary analysis reports and dashboards in a meaningful and understandable format for senior leadershipDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.Reference Number 5420183-2

title: Oracle Financial Functional Consultant
company: City and County of San Francisco
location: 1 Dr Carlton B Goodlett Place , San Francisco, CA 94102, US
description: The Controller’s Systems Division is actively seeking PeopleSoft Functional Anlayst.  The Controller’s Systems Division designs, developments, delivers and supports enterprise applications that are used by over 35,000 active City employees, 75,000 retirees and 25,000 city suppliers. These applications are referred to as SF Employee Portal, SF People & Pay, SF Financials, SF Procurement, SF Learning, and SF Reports and Analytics systems. Collectively, these applications deliver mission-critical services to 55 City Departments, eliminating the need for hundreds of independent legacy systems and customized applications; improving the standardization, transparency, and efficiency City’s business processes; and enhancing the City’s ability to supports its current, future and past workforce. This position will primarily support the General Ledger and Commitment Control modules. There are opportunities to learn and support other financial modules, such as accounts payable and receivable, grants and billing, project costing, asset management, cash management and expenses.Position Description: This position will perform and participate in a range of analytical tasks including: Provide analytical and functional support for PeopleSoft Financials & Supply Chain Management system (the system) to ensure system and data integrity as well as control and reliability; Diagramming policies and processes of the business practices and requirements; linking business processes with the setup and business rules of the new financial system; requirements gathering, fit/gap analysis; identify functional processing and reporting requirements; complete end-user testing and documentation; research and analyze governmental accounting policies and standards and City accounting policies and regulations to recommend modifications, enhancements or improvements to the system; generate reports to ensure compliance; perform analyses of financial data to recommend proper internal control and procedures for review and input in the system; prepare system and user documentation and training materials for user workshops; develop, test, document, and prepare report templates, extracts, and databases for financial reporting, system monitoring, analysis, and troubleshooting; analyze trends in financial and statistical data and related reports/analyses to ensure accurate recording, reporting and control in the system; may direct complex financial or operational activities; this position will interact with financial, systems and management staff across the City; performing other duties as assigned.   Required Education:An associate degree in computer science or a closely related field from an accredited college or university OR its equivalent in terms of total course credits/units [i.e., at least sixty (60) semester or ninety (90) quarter credits/units with a minimum of twenty (20) semester or thirty (30) quarter credits/units in computer science or a closely-related field]. Required Experience:Three (3) years in the information systems field, including system analysis, business process design, development and implementation of business application solutions or IT project management. Desirable Qualifications: PeopleSoft Financials 9.2 experience with the following modules: General Ledger, Commitment Control and Asset Management. Experience with setting up PeopleSoft Charts of Account, Commitment Control and General Ledger configuration with Version 9.x experience in a public sector environment. Strong technical knowledge of the PeopleSoft Financials configuration options, table structure and data model. Sub-Module to Ledger Reconciliation as well as KK module Reconciliation. Professional IS Business Analyst work experience in the Public Sector (Government or Nonprofit). Advanced-level skills in accounting, reporting, budgeting, general ledger, asset management systems analysis methodologies and techniques including requirements gathering and documenting; preparing functional specification documentation, system and user testing techniques and documentation, process flow and diagramming. Three (3) years of experience analyzing, creating, documenting functional business/application solutions with clients and/or end users for large complex systems. This experience must include. Working knowledge of formal software development life cycle methodologies; Working knowledge in developing and executing application test plans; and Demonstrated expertise in utilizing appropriate tools for analyzing data, documenting processes, developing and testing prototype solutions (for example SQL, Excel, Visio, MS Access).

title: Certified EPIC Clin Doc Stork System Analyst
description: Are you Certified EPIC Clin Doc Stork System Analyst who is ready to take on new challenges, propel your career and join a prestigious and reputable non profit hospital in beautiful coastal San Francisco Bay Area? If so, this is the perfect opportunity for you!The Medical Center is still growing and financially stable and they are currently looking to fill a Certified EPIC Clin Doc Stork System Analyst. The Certified EPIC Clin Doc Stork System Analyst will work in a growing medical center that has served communities in the South San Francisco Bay Area for more than 50 years. The Certified EPIC Clin Doc Stork System Analyst will join a team that strives to provide superlative care by focusing on patients’ needs by incorporating the latest, proven medical technology and attracting the best medical staff and affiliated physicians.Utilizing knowledge of clinical operations, the Certified EPIC Clin Doc Stork System Analyst will lead, coordinate, review, analyze, and maintain clinical systems, including specification gathering, configuration, testing, modification, activation and ongoing support. The Certified EPIC Clin Doc Stork System Analyst will manage requests and works with end users (physicians, nurses, pharmacists, Patient Accounts, HIM etc.) to identify current operating procedures, define request requirements, perform data collection and analysis, identifying problems, and opportunities for process improvements.The Certified EPIC Clin Doc Stork System Analyst will lead evaluation of applications and application usage to best meet the needs of the organization. This position provides specialized technical and operational knowledge and support to management, supervisors and staff throughout the hospital in order to successfully meet goals related to the development and effective use of relevant systems in operational areas. Mentors junior informatics or analyst staff on the principles of informatics and system implementationFor more than half a century, the hospital has a reputation for high-caliber physicians, innovative services and a powerful commitment to meeting the needs of the community. The hospital will offer a comprehensive benefits package and excellent Bay Area salary. Join now!Certified EPIC Clin Doc Stork System Analyst, Resolute EPIC Analyst, Resolute EPIC Improvement Analyst, EPIC Operations Improvement Analyst, EPIC Performance Improvement Manager, EPIC Operations Analyst Coordinator, Jobs, Californiafenny@cmcwest.com

title: Sr. Client Data Analyst (Sell-side, Customer Success)
description: Rakuten Interactive, the digital transformation platform and digital consultancy of Rakuten Inc., is hiring a Sr. Data Analyst in a unique, horizontal role across Rakuten sister companies and within the startup-minded Interactive team.The Sr. Client Data Analyst will have much more material responsibilities and growth opportunities beyond one buried deep within an engineering organization. Here, the role is both the evangelist of our proprietary data, solutions, and technologies and the knowledge nexus of product, sales, and pre-sales.Based in our USA HQ in San Mateo, CA, this role reports to the VP of Data Solutions of Rakuten Interactive, and early on, is embedded within the Rakuten Slice organization for on-boarding. Rakuten Slice is the largest online post-purchase panel for analytics, insights, and trends with a Tier-1 engineering and data science capability.There is a phased growth plan for our candidate to move from the Rakuten Slice product to predictive forecasting, with a new, undisclosed product to be able to action previously scorecard, sales/share-only data.We are creating new, premium data products at Rakuten Interactive and immediately moving to PoC and integration externally for clients and internally across the global organization.This is a fantastic opportunity as data employee #1 to get in at the ground level of building a new venture within one of the world's most respected Internet companies. It is an incredible amount of work and undertaking, but the products are fresh, the team is new, and the growing opportunities are at a hockey stick pace.Please only apply if you are more than capable. We look forward to your application.Quickly, About Rakuten Slice (Slice Technologies) Acquired by Rakuten in 2014 Most comprehensive online shopping data anywhere Highest fidelity commerce data: 3B+ item data, 6M+ panelists, 600+ merchants UPC/ASIN level collection Long tail merchant data such as Dollar Shave Clubs of the world Rich attribution across ride share, meal delivery, travel, and 3rd party sellers4 Main Expectations Principal coverage of Rakuten Slice, from product introductions, to qualified customers' Q&A, and ultimately, customer success: how can we help you after you purchase the product Advisory and subject matter expert of data across all our customers, clients, and partnerships Be able to publish white-papers and thought-leadership on future data trends for consulting and Rakuten leadership Work amongst VP Sales, Director of Technical Pre-Sales, Consulting, and Product Marketing as a partner to build product roadmap and solve problemsWhat We're Looking For 2-3+ years of experience in market research, business intelligence (Tableau, Forrester, IDC, Gartner backgrounds are a plus), used to fast-paced and dynamic business settings Being able to build and analyze data sets; taking these into custom reports and storytelling Data visualization (Tableau, Domo) and being able to learn our own stack: Vibrant Data Professional services: report creation, modeling, trend forecasting and interpreting data for clients Fast learning: Source, ingest, and synthesize product knowledge from various businesses and partners End-to-end: Sit at the sales discussion table, jump in to client proposals, and be able to support clients after contract stageSkills And Qualifications Exceptional in data query languages (SQL used here) Experience with statistical packages: R, MATLAB, SPSS, SAS, Stata a big plus Market competitive skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint (this can be further taught by our consultants) Exciting communication skills: cut to the cash for C-level executives and being able to be precise and engaging to convince customers and internal stakeholders Client-ready confidence as a subject matter expert: masterful at engaging Webinars, quick to answer client queries, and trusted as an advisorTeam Fit Hard worker: we are building at a start-up pace. This is not a standard 11-4PM Silicon Valley job Incredibly patient as a teacher and our subject matter expert on data, Passionate about technology, pride in solving problems and architecting solutions Personality of self-learning, self-criticism, and consistent improvement No politics: fair and balanced judgementEducation Masters degree of STEM highly preferred BS/BA (no concentration restriction) at the minimum with experience in solving complex problems, reiteration, and effective visual/verbal communication Udacity nanodegree candidates are very welcome, as Rakuten is a global hiring partner of UdacityThis is an accelerated and thoroughly vetted process for qualified candidates. No external agencies please. Compensation commensurate with experience. Proud EOE/M/F/D/V/SO.Only apply from this original link if referred from elsewhere:https://jobs.lever.co/rakuteninteractive/b7ef0090-88b9-4743-a931-1ea32653177cRakuten Interactive is the digital transformation platform and consultancy within the world's leading innovation company, Rakuten, Inc. We build enduring digital businesses for the mid-market and F1000 with data-driven insights, customer acquisition, personalized advertising, and solutions-led business strategy. Our digital consulting domains are Financial Services, Retail, and Cybersecurity & Privacy — and we are absolutely hiring.Rakuten, Inc. (TSE: 4755) is a global leader in internet services that empower individuals, communities, businesses and society. Founded in Tokyo in 1997 as an online marketplace, Rakuten has expanded to offer services in e-commerce, fintech, digital content and communications to more than 1 billion members around the world. Since 2012, Rakuten has ranked in the top 30 of Forbes Magazine's annual "World's Most Innovative Companies" list. The Rakuten Group has over 14,000 employees, and operations in 29 countries and regions. For more information visit http://global.rakuten.com/corp/.Rakuten is the Main Global Partner of FC Barcelona, one of the world's most valuable sports teams, and the official sponsor of 2016-2017 NBA Champions, the Golden State Warriors.

title: Financial Analyst 2, Product Line Finance
description: Financial Analyst, Product Line FinanceLumentum (NASDAQ: LITE) is a market-leading manufacturer of innovative optical and photonic products enabling 3D sensing optical networking and commercial laser customers worldwide. Lumentum’s optical components and subsystems are part of virtually every type of telecom, enterprise, and data center network. Lumentum’s Commercial Lasers enable advanced manufacturing techniques and diverse applications including next-generation 3D sensing capabilities. Lumentum is headquartered in Milpitas, California with R&D, manufacturing, and sales offices worldwide.Lumentum is an Equal Opportunity Employer, EOE/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Individual with DisabilityProduct Line finance is a strategic part of Lumentum’s Finance Organization. The Finance team actively partners with product lines and is an integral part of the decision making process from start to finish. Analysts impact all aspects of the business: New product strategy, project prioritization, R&D execution, product cost improvement and sales.This position supports our high growth 3D sensing and Lasers product lines which have a product portfolio that enables mobile 3D sensing applications as well as cutting edge Laser technologies. The candidate will forge strong business partnerships to support strategic decisions, including driving the annual strategic planning process. He/she will work day to day with the PLM/R&D Leaders and senior management to advise them on all financial matters regarding the business.Responsibilities will include critical analysis to support decision-making while working directly with our key business partners. Projects could include effective R&D resource allocation, new product financial analysis, product cost optimization and end to end new product data analytics. In addition the analyst will play a critical part in the annual planning, quarterly budgeting and monthly close processes. The analyst will also have close collaboration with other groups within and outside of finance to help improve overall product line profitability throughout the year.Qualifications 0-3 years’ experience in high tech public companies Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Business related Excellent analytical, organization and communication (both written and verbal) skills with the ability to work independently and interact effectively with all levels of management Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and manage deadlines accordingly Demonstrated detail-oriented work ethic High degree of sensitivity and discretion in working with confidential information, required Strong computer skills, with intermediate to advanced level Excel skills Oracle R12, Tableau, Hyperion experience is idealPrimary LocationUS-CA-MilpitasWork LocationsMilpitas-HQ, CA USAJobFinanceOrganizationUS BUScheduleFull-timeEmployee StatusRegularJob TypeStandardJob PostingJul 20, 2018, 3:07:30 PM

title: Data Management Sr. Analyst
description: We are Farmers!Join a team of diverse professionals at Farmers to acquire skills on the job and apply your learned knowledge to future roles at Farmers. Farmers Insurance also offers extensive training opportunities through the award winning University of Farmers named by Training magazine amongst top 10 corporate training units in the world. Start your career at Farmers today!Job Summary Responsible for the collection, preparation and reporting of statistical data including technical support for tools and/or other analytic processes used for specified lines of insurance. Essential Job Functions Collects and organizes statistical data for internal and/or external reporting purposes.Develops and prepares reports using data from various sources of information.Evaluates information being reported for consistency, completeness, accuracy and reasonableness.Maintains and provides support for existing tools and applications used in the analyses of information.Communicates with actuaries, accountants, product managers and I/T staff regarding data requirements and/or business requirements involving new reports or applications.Maintains and updates information necessary for data dictionary and other metadata requirements.Promotes safety at all times and complies with safety/ergonomic standards as outlined in relevant company published manuals.Performs other duties as assigned. Physical ActionsRequired job duties are essentially sedentary work consisting of occasional walking, standing and lifting and/or carrying 10-lbs. maximum and seeing.Physical EnvironmentRequired job duties are normally performed in a climate-controlled office environment.Education RequirementsFour year college degree with at least a minor in a quantitative or analytic subject.Experience RequirementsOne year of relevant professional business experience.Special Skill Requirement Excellent quantitative and analytic skills.Proficient PC skills, including word processing and spreadsheets.MS Excel (advanced level)SQL / SAS (intermediate level)Data Governance Standards and PrinciplesVBAKnowledge in MS products (SharePoint, PowerPoint, Visio, Word)Good communication and presentation skillTableau experience is a plusSAP BOProject ManagementFarmers is an equal opportunity employer, committed to the strength of a diverse workforce.]]>Primary LocationUnited States-California-Woodland HillsOrganizationFarmers InsuranceJobStrategic Management & AdministrationScheduleFull-timeJob Posting07/12/18

title: Research Data Analyst/Senior Statistician
description: DescriptionUnder general supervision, uses multiple statistical software packages to look for outliers and anomalies in the data. Writes and debugs code using several statistical software packages such as R and SAS. Designs, maintains and documents procedures, including methods and summary/conclusions. Interfaces between biostatisticians and all the data used for the analyses. Uses skills as a seasoned, experienced research professional with a full understanding of in-depth statistical analyses and/or research software programming techniques.The incumbent demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Develops, plans and executes a wide range of statistical analyses including multi-variable, mathematical modeling, power and sample size calculations, mixed effect modeling of longitudinal data and non-parametric statistics related to ophthalmic and vision science research. Uses skills as a seasoned, experienced research professional with a full understanding of in-depth statistical analyses and/or research software programming techniques. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.Minimum Qualifications A Bachelor's Degree in related area; and/or equivalent experience/training. Three (3+) or more years of research data analysis and/or statistician experience. Proven expertise in using R, STATA, SAS and/or other statistical software as needed. Experience managing and working with large-scale multivariate longitudinal data-bases. Demonstrated experience preparing and submitting manuscripts for publication. Skills to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner verbally and written. Research skills at a level to evaluate alternate solutions and develop recommendations. Proven experience doing complex statistical programming. Thorough skills associated with statistical analysis and systems programming. Strong skills in project management. Thorough knowledge of research function. Thorough skills in analysis and consultation. Expertise in univariate and multivariate statistical procedures for cross-sectional and longitudinal study designs including linear and logistic regression, mixed effects modeling, and/or Cox proportional hazards. Preferred QualificationsMS or PhD in statistics preferred.SPECIAL CONDITIONSEmployment is subject to a criminal background check.

title: Project Manager and Analyst - Corporate Travel Support
description: Project Manager and Analyst - Corporate Travel Support*Position located virtually with a preference for candidates in the Pacific time zone*The Project Manager & Analyst will support key initiatives aimed at driving greater efficiency, productivity, revenue opportunities. This role will support the Corporate Travel Account Management and Corporate Travel Operations leaders while reporting directly to the regional Senior Vice President. The role will have core deliverables and project based work requiring analytical & project management acumen. Diversity in projects will require the successful candidate to have the ability to work independently to achieve set objective/deliverable as well as the ability to work effectively across teams and departments. Scope and objectives will vary, requiring the candidate to be versatile and a self-starter, requiring a high degree of creativity, problem-solving, quick-learning aptitudes. A depth of knowledge working with data and presentations is essential (XLS pivot tables, charts/graphs, BCD analytics tools, PowerPoint; Tableau experience a plus).In addition to project based work, the Project Manager & Analyst will design, create and maintain KPI measurement, business and ROI modeling, benchmarking and trending data from client and internal perspective, ad hoc reporting and analytics.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesBusiness & ROI ModelingDrives continuous improvement through business process reengineeringResponsible for working with other teams within the company to improve efficiencies and introduce improvementsAdvising senior management.Define and implement best practices across the region as related to specific projectsRoutine / ad hoc reporting & analysisMonitor and track the status of each initiative, engage appropriate local resources, and escalate as needed to ensure initiative successData analysis; gathering data from different sources, building of reports/summaries to enable specific analysis & research esp. with the focus on re-work reductionManage client recovery efforts by understanding the requirements, gaps, and pulling in the necessary people to resolve the issues quickly and to the customers' expectationsProject ManagementLeads communication plans to align organizations across the business through change management, adoption, and effective communicationsLead or support various process improvement initiatives and other special projects designed to improve business effectivenessSchedule and/or participate in all meetings and conference calls related to each projectConstruct data analysis to support decision making and recommendationsCreate project work plans and result action plans. Ensure progress is made in line with project times linesDeliver successful project outcomes and yield results established in project objectivesReview business initiatives from an unbiased positionoServe as a process and/or product subject matter expert as necessaryDocument any identified required changes, and communicate them to the relevant third parties/colleagues.QualificationsEssentialIntermediate to Advanced skills in MS Office tools, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, TableauMust be able to produce high-quality work as part of a fast-paced, dynamic teamSystematic, disciplined and analytic approach to problem solving and detail oriented.Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities with minimal supervisionExcellent organization skills with demonstrated follow-through on goals, plans and projectsAbility to think both tactically and strategicallyCapable of identifying customer needs -- listening to information, asking probing questions, applying knowledge, crafting solutionsCapable of problem solving - anticipating, analyzing, and resolving issues at both a strategic and functional levelPreferredProject management and/or project/process implementation experience is a plusTravel industry experiences is highly desired

title: Website Data Analyst
description: Lamps Plus, the nation's largest lighting retailer, has a company culture that fosters a collaborative work environment focused on mentorship and professional development. Our company offers its employees exceptional hands on experience, opportunities for growth, work-life balance, and competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401k, employee discounts, recreational discounts, and credit union membership.Lamps Plus is looking to add a Web Data Analyst to be a key part of the team driving improvements in our customers' experiences and website conversion rates. In this role, you will be responsible for analytical and database research for our website optimization team. You will use data to expose new opportunities to improve the customer experience through changes in our product, services, and processes. The ideal candidate will have a working knowledge of SQL queries and is able to work with data in Python in order to dig deep and provide valuable insights about oJob DescriptionUses website analytics, database research & statistics platforms to improve customer experience and conversion performance on our website.Perform database analysis using a variety of tools including SQL, Python, and Tableau to better under our customers buying habits and shopping experiencesUse statistics to find actionable correlations in our dataMake recommendations to improve customer experience (reduce bounce rates, increase conversions, funnels, flows).Works with analytics team to verify analytics accuracy and proper analytics tag implementation.Performs competitive analysis to identify opportunities.Coordinates, conducts, and moderates usability tests and prepare written analysis.Works with UX designers to test proposed look and feel designs and recommend features, functionality, and specific interactions based on analysis of business goals and user needs.Job RequirementsBachelor's degree in Business, Psychology, Economics, or related field.Strong analytical skillsUnderstanding of SQL QueriesComfortable using Python for data analysisWorking understanding of Tableau or Google Data Studio preferred, but not requiredExperience with Google AnalyticsAdvanced computer proficiency skills using Excel (Pivot Tables, Vlookup, etc.)Excellent written and verbal communication skillsRegular job attendance is required in accordance with a regular schedule established for the position by the supervisor.Lamps Plus is an Equal Opportunity Employer.LAMPS PLUS: Corporate Headquaters - Chatsworth, CA20250 Plummer StTelephone: (818) 886-5267Fax: (818) 886-1011

title: Senior Data Analyst

The Senior Data Analyst helps support all aspects of analytic initiatives from conception to completion.Responsibilities Apply expertise in data analysis, data mining, and data visualization to see beyond the numbers and help build strategies behind the numbers Provide SQL programming, under general direction, in the execution of data analysis that will contribute to the final project deliverables Manage the data pipeline from flat file sources to datawarehouse processing Appropriately account for the timeliness and quality of all assignments Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to manage data logistics - including data transfers, understanding data structures, business rules, etc. - to enable project execution QA/QC data and report output to ensure accuracy Assist in development of analyses and insights, providing content and writing of key observations Participate in presentation of reports to key internal and external stakeholders, effectively communicating the key findings and recommendations Manage multiple projects concurrently Support the creation of compelling presentations that provide actionable insights and recommendations Prioritize and monitor project progress relative to timeline and scopeMinimum Qualifications Bachelor or Master's degree in a quantitative discipline (statistics, economics, mathematics, marketing analytics) Minimum 2 years of experience in marketing analytics field Proficient in SQL; minimum 3 years' experience Development experience in any scripting language (Python, C#, SAS, etc.) Experience manipulating data sets through statistical softwares (Python, R, SAS, etc.) Solid planning, priority setting, and project management skills with experience managing multiple projects concurrently Excellent verbal and written communication skills Successful developing relationships within and across functional teams (including statistical, technical, and marketing resources) Highly motivated and collaborative Strong technical skills Acute attention to detail (QA/QC) Effective organization and time management skillsDesirable Qualifications Advanced degree (Master's/PhD) in Statistics, Economics or other quantitative discipline Ability to program in newer and emerging statistical languages; title: Financial Analyst
description: The Financial Analyst is a non-traditional finance position providing gold standard support to the Sales department for JUSTIN Vineyards & Winery, and Landmark Vineyards. The Analyst is responsible for providing analyses to internal customers in the Sales department as well as within the Finance organization.The Analyst is responsible for all aspects of their analyses: formulating the plan, determining the data requirements, extracting and manipulating the data, conducting the analyses, determining the conclusions and then communicating those to the working team in a concise and organized fashion. One of the most important aspects of the job is to take a very large quantity of customer data and analytic results and condense it down into a coherent story with clear, easy to follow conclusions and implications. The Analyst will regularly interact with the Sales leadership, as well as the Senior Management, and must be able to do so in a confident and professional manner.Here's What You'll Do Efficiently compile, organize and analyze complex financial information and raw data; interpret data to explain past financial performance and project future results. Aid in the development of various budgeting and forecasting templates for global sales functions; prepare and oversee preparation of departmental budgets and forecasts. Develop complex reports for forecasting, sales trends, and financial results analysis. Develop metrics to assess, monitor, track and improve discounts/promotion effectiveness. Develop reports to assess, monitor, track and improve the allocation / inventory relationship as it pertains to current and future sales. Collaborate with Sales customers to monitor budget adherence and ensure proper financial decisions. Create and provide sales templates to facilitate sales retention, growth and management Independently manage other ad-hoc finance/sales projects as assigned. As part of completing these responsibilities, it will be necessary for the Analyst to build and maintain strong relationships with members of the Sales team. This position also requires actively partnering with cross-functional teams throughout the organization in order to understand changes in the competitive environment, promotional offers, production, and our own products to inform their findings. Here's What You'll Bring To The Table Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, Statistics or a related field is preferred 2-4 years of relevant experience in FP&A or related field; experience in CPG/beverage or Wine industry is a big plus Proficient with Microsoft Office; strong Excel and PowerPoint a must Hands-on / Roll up your sleeves approach, working with the team to produce high quality work products; we are a detail-oriented organization and will drill to invoice-level data when needed Meet all deadlines/deliverables; we are a fast-paced environment with strict timetables to ensure we complete all assigned work Candidates must be comfortable with constantly shifting priorities Outstanding verbal/written communication, presentation, organizational and teamwork skills are required Ability to build and maintain customer relationships, especially with sales team; works well with others, collaborative and cooperative Self-starter with ability to work independently high sense of urgency and entrepreneurial spirit Strong and meticulous analytics and strategic thinking skills Collaborative team player strong relationship-building, and active partnership with cross-functional teams Ability to interact with department leadership and senior executives in a confident and professional manner. Here's What We'll Bring To The Table Competitive benefits package including Medical (including 24/7 online access to a physician), Vision, Dental, and 401k with match eligibility. Subsidized gym membership. On-site subsidized high end cafe offering farm to table meals and snacks. Free on-site yoga classes and other wellness-focused activities. Wonderful Giving ( Free tobacco cessation programs. Work-Life balance. All the FIJI Water and Wonderful snacks you may want in the office. Discounted tickets to various LA attractions. We are bicycle-friendly, with newly installed bicycle racks available to all LA-based employees. FIJI® Water, natural artesian water bottled at the source in Viti Levu (Fiji islands), is the No. 1 premium bottled water in the United States. FIJI Water, known for its iconic square bottle, soft mouth feel and unique mineral profile, is the water of choice among discerning consumers and top chefs. Widely available at fine restaurants and hotels, all major retail channels and through a convenient home/business delivery service, FIJI Water has expanded globally to more than 60 countries. To discover Earth's Finest Water, please visitThe Wonderful Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and with opportunities for advancement. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or other protected categories.

title: Product Data Analyst
description: Job DescriptionA fast-growing Blockchain company based in the Bay Are are looking a Product focused Data Analyst to join a growing teamWhat You’ll DoYou will do deep data dives and track metrics around our product in order to understand how it is being used, how recent changes have affected metrics, and where optimization opportunities are for our business and product. You will also work on data-analytic projects with marketing, life-cycle, operations, the executive team that require you to have flexible quantitative skills. You will communicate your findings in presentations, build dashboards and visualizations, and be the go-to person for questions about data. Work closely with product manager and product design team.Who You Are You have an excellent product sense and 2+ years industry experience in product analytics. Given that you will work across a variety of domains in this role, the ideal person would also have some experience in business, marketing or operations analytics but that is not as important as product analytics. You should have strong SQL skills which will not only enable you to drill deeply down into the data looking for insights but to also help others on the team gain access to more insightful data (e.g., dashboards). If you can supplement or mostly replace SQL with Python, that’s a plus but not necessary. Given that this role will require you to present your findings, visually in dashboards and in presentations, and to work with people across teams, it is critical that you are an excellent communicator. Ideally, you would have experience either with visualization tools, or Pythonic approaches to data visualization. You should also have strong quantitative skills and a basic understanding in statistics (e.g., when you find an interesting pattern, you can figure out when it is just noise). We are not, however, looking for someone with a background in machine learning and advanced statistics. You should be able to work independently and take ownership of your projects.

title: Database Analyst
description: 2rbConsulting is seeking an experienced Database Analyst for a contract role with a well-known health insurance provider in San Francisco, CA.   Our client is a nonprofit health plan provider dedicated to providing Californians with access to high-quality health care at an affordable price. It's the third-largest health plan provider in the state and is dedicated to transforming the healthcare industry. Headquartered in San Francisco, with 18 additional offices across California, they are proud to service over 4 million members and employ more than 6,000 people.   This role requires the successful candidate to be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship and work with 2rbConsulting as a W-2 employee.     Overall Responsibilities: Responsible for participating in data requirements gathering and performing complex data analysis Perform root cause analysis from one to multiple sources Responsible for presenting issues, options, and recommendations to various audiences Create and/or update existing Source-to-target mapping (STTM) documents Ensure that STTM documents follow the company’s process and procedures   Qualifications Include: 5+ years of experience as a Database Analyst 3+ years of prior work experience with Source-to-target mapping (STTM) Extensive experience with Informatica Analyst and Information Governance Catalog Extensive experience with data requirements gathering analysis Highly proficient in SQL skills and experience with Data warehouse Experience performing data profiling using SQL Strong ability to perform root cause analysis and complex data analysis Experience in the healthcare industry is required Bachelor or master’s degree in Computer Science   If this opportunity sounds like a good match for you, please submit your resume for immediate consideration. Candidates selected for these contract opportunities will be required to take a background check and drug screen.  Qualified applicants with arrest records and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, State and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability status and any other classification protected by Federal, State and local laws. You will also be required to work directly with 2rbConsulting as a W-2 employee, no 1099 or 3rd Party Candidates will be accepted.

title: Data Analyst - Growth Team
description: Planning world domination? What a coincidence, we are too! With VRV recently reaching 1.5M registered users in less than one year, and Crunchyroll topping the 1M subscriber milestone; the team at Ellation is just getting started.Ellation is searching for a Data Analyst to join our Growth Team. As a key contributor, you will have the opportunity to directly impact the company’s growth. This role offers tremendous growth opportunity and is perfect for for individuals looking to refine their skills and team responsibilities over time.Benefits On-site gym, showers, yoga, and meditation classes Medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD, and life insurance Opportunity to participate in industry conferences Employer-sponsored training and certifications Contribute to multiple open source products Catered lunch and dinner 4 days per week Fun, passionate and skilled co-workers Health care and dependent care FSA 401(k) plan with employer match Pet-friendly environment Paid commuter benefit Competitive salary About You 3+ years in a Data Analyst role with 2+ years of Data Mining experience Experience in composing SQL queries to mine internal data Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Engineering or Sciences Able to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team Experience in analyzing A/B testing experiments Curious about user behavior & product UX Strong attention to detail and enthusiasm What To Expect On a Daily Basis Build and maintain recurring reports to evaluate performance of our product KPIs and guide strategic decision making Identify and recommend new ways generate (or save) revenue through our Crunchyroll and VRV platforms Generate useful business reports to assist leadership in measuring and articulating results Conduct ad-hoc analysis and build complex financial models to drive actionable insights Create Data Models that depict trends in the customer base and consumer population Assist with the creation of key presentations (experiment results, leadership reports) Support decision-making with the product org and cross-functional departments Utilize statistical methods and tools to analyze data Please beware of recent scams to online job seekers. Those applying to our job openings will only be contacted directly from @crunchyroll.com and @ellation.com email accounts. If you have any questions of the authenticity of an Ellation or Crunchyroll job offer, please contact jobs@crunchyroll.com before giving away any personal information.About CrunchyrollCrunchyroll is the world’s largest destination for anime and manga, boasting a global community of more than 25 million registered users and over 1 million subscribers. Fans connect through the most complete anime library including "Naruto Shippuden," "Attack on Titan," and “Dragon Ball Super,” events such as Crunchyroll Movie Nights, Crunchyroll News, and can purchase related merchandise through its online store. Through its app on game consoles, set-top boxes, mobile devices and more, Crunchyroll delivers content from leading media producers directly to viewers translated professionally in multiple languages. The service is available for free or through a premium offering that allows users to watch ad-free with access to simulcasts—top series available immediately after Japanese broadcast.Fans can also view Crunchyroll on VRV, an audience-focused aggregation platform featuring premium SVOD channels and a curated house channel, VRV Select.About EllationEllation, Inc. is a transformative entertainment company and home of industry-leading platforms Crunchyroll andVRV. With majority investment from Otter Media, a joint-venture between AT&T and The Chernin Group, Ellation operates at the intersection of technology and media to redefine the next wave of media interaction and consumption -- breaking down barriers to content experiences for passionate fans around the world. Ellation’s offices in San Francisco, Tokyo, and Chișinău develop the product, design, engineering, marketing and content that brings our communities of passionate fans together.About VRVVRV is a leading audience-focused aggregation platform featuring premium SVOD channels including Crunchyroll, Funimation, Rooster Teeth, and Shudder, alongside a curated house channel, VRV Select. Created to provide fans with a next-gen entertainment experience, VRV offers immersive content experiences in a digitally-driven environment via bundled subscription, a la carte subscription, or ad-supported options. As a platform, VRV helps partners extend their reach and distribute their premium content through a high-quality, branded experience on mobile, web, and popular living room devices.

title: Business Data Analyst
description: The Business Data Analyst will support the intel team manager to ensure that the full life cycle of various business aspects are reinforced efficiently. The Analyst will provide leadership and support mainly focused on the management of data and information centered on the teams work products.The Analyst is responsible for the process of inspecting, cleaning, validating, transforming and modeling data with the goal of discovering useful information, suggesting conclusions and supporting decision making focused on growth and attainment of goals.### Essential Functions The functions listed describe the business purpose of this job. Specific duties or tasks may vary and be documented separately. The employee might not be required to perform all functions listed. Additional duties may be assigned, and functions may be modified, according to business necessity. All assigned duties or tasks are deemed to be part of the essential functions, unless such duties or tasks are unrelated to the functions listed, in which case they are deemed to be other (non-essential) functions. Employees are held accountable for successful job performance. Job performance standards may be documented separately, and may include functions, objectives, duties or tasks not specifically listed herein. In performing functions, duties or tasks, employees are required to know and follow safe work practices, and to be aware of company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations. Employees are required to notify superiors upon becoming aware of unsafe working conditions. All functions, duties or tasks are to be carried out in an honest, ethical and professional manner, and to be performed in conformance with applicable company policies and procedures. In the event of uncertainty or lack of knowledge of company policies and procedures, employees are required to request clarification or explanations from superiors or authorized company representatives.The Essential Functions Include Represent Pinkerton core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence. Support team manager in overall database case management process, procedures and requirements. Lead and support data driven projects including; Data entry. Database case management audits. Data and gap analysis. Database query configuration. Conduct User Acceptance Testing (UAT). Provide business data analysis and identify technical solutions to challenges that impact the business. Handle approved requests for data audits, metrics and report generation. Manage and oversee BI Dashboard activities, projects, requests and tasks. Draft data queries, reports and metrics and obtain approvals prior to publishing. Provide support to the manager in implementing data driven projects by performing project proposal reviews. Conduct business data analysis, gather data requirements, draft project plan and obtain approvals. Utilize, update and manage project tool to represent the current status of projects. Conduct project coordination, implementation, and supervision as well as provide project status updates and communications to the manager. All other duties, as assigned.### Minimum Hiring StandardsAdditional qualifications may be specified and receive preference, depending upon the nature of the position. Must have a High School Diploma or GED. Must be willing to participate in the Company pre-employment screening process including drug testing and background investigation. Must be at least 18 years of age. Must have a reliable means of communication (i.e., email, cell phone). Must have a reliable means of transportation (public or private). Must have the legal right to work in the United States. Must have the ability to speak, read, and write English.### Education/ExperienceBachelor degree with three to five years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company.### Competencies Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Able to carry out responsibilities with little or no supervision. Attentive to details and accuracy. Able to work in a fast paced environment under multiple deadlines and competing priorities. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Able to analyze complex situations and recommend solutions. Serve as an effective team member. Strong customer service and results orientation. Computer skills; Microsoft Office.### Working ConditionsIn Addition To Other Demands, The Demands Of The Job IncludeWith or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to perform effectively all essential functions. Must undergo and meet company standards for background and reference checks, drug testing, and behavioral selection survey. Maintain composure in dealing with authorities, executives, clients, staff, and the public occasionally under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations. Exposure to sensitive and confidential information. Regular computer usage. Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently. Must be able to see, hear, speak, and write clearly in order to communicate with employees and/or customers. Manual dexterity required for occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment. Close and distance vision and ability to adjust focus. Evenings and weekends, as required, to ensure the successful completion of work assignments. Travel, as required.EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabilities

title: Data Analyst – CRM & Analytics
description: Tailored Brands, Inc.’s purpose is to help our customers love how they look. We accomplish this by providing a personal, convenient, one-of-a-kind shopping experience with compelling products and world-class service. We help fulfill this mission by providing our employees with an engaging and inclusive workplace focused on teamwork, growth and respect.We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Data Analyst, CRM & Analytics to join our Marketing department in Fremont, CA.We are building a world-class analytics function at Tailored Brands. In this position, you will play a critical role in supporting the development of analytics and reporting capabilities foundational to the success of the marketing organization.Primary Responsibilities • Perform high-quality, accurate data analyses for various stakeholders in all business lines • Expertly extract, cleanse, and package data sets from various customer and marketing databases for the purpose of analytics projects • Develop a strong understanding of the data source and reporting systems and databases, and associated data relationships • Become the steward for assuring integrity & quality in the definition and production of analytics data • Maintain proactive and responsive communications with leadership and stakeholders • Develop sufficient documentations to allow team and processes to scaleDesired Skills and ExperienceSkills, Abilities, Experience & Qualifications• Fluent in SQL, SAS and relational database such as Oracle and Teradata• Ability to query complex data warehouses and aggregate data for strategic reporting• Experience in report analysis and development using business intelligence tools such Tableau, Business Objects, and Microstrategy• Experience standardizing and transforming a variety of data sets to prepare them for analysis• Experience with Qualtrics and survey research a plus• Experience with Python, R, or another scripting language a plus• Understanding of quantitative & qualitative market research, customer segmentation, and brand measurement methods a plus• Strong team player with high aptitude, problem solving skillsWork Environment, Physical & Mental Demands• Ability to work at least 40 hours per week from the Company’s Fremont, California corporate office with flexibility based on project needs• Exerts up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount frequently to move objects.

title: Customer Insights Data Analyst - Post Sale Support
description: Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the world’s creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world. Team DescriptionOur Business Strategy & Operations team sets and drives key business initiatives across the company. We complement and support product, engineering, sales, and marketing teams across three critical areas: corporate and business unit strategy, business planning and sales operations, and business systems and tools development.Role DescriptionThe Insights team is the analytics engine behind our global sales organization. We are leveraging the power of big data to help our customers accelerate how they transform their business. As a collaborative and entrepreneurial team, we focus on finding breakthrough insights and building transformative internal products and tools, within a creative and fun environment.We're looking for a Data Analyst to partner with our sales and customer success teams to answer key questions about how our customers are using Dropbox, and the value they’re getting out of our product. We solve challenging problems and boost business growth through a deep understanding of user behaviors with applied analytics techniques and business insights. An ideal candidate should have robust knowledge of the enterprise sales cycle. ResponsibilitiesProgrammatically access, clean, analyze, and visualize large data sets (> 1M rows). Perform analytical deep-dives to craft a unique storyWrite complex SQL queries and optimize them for faster runtime performanceExtract actionable insights from large, multi-dimensional customer behavior data sets. Effectively convey the “so what” and implications of complex concepts to customersDevelop plug-and-play processes to automate and scale common data requestsIdentify key metrics and build executive-facing reports to track Dropbox deploymentWork with cross-functional teams (including Value Management, Customer Success, Sales, and Data Science) to rapidly execute and iterateUnderstand what matters most and prioritize ruthlesslyRequirementsBachelors’ or above in CS, Engineering, Physics, Math, Statistics, Business, Economics or related field2-5 years of experience using analytics to drive key business decisions; examples include business/product/marketing analytics, business intelligence, strategy consultingExtensive experience with SQL and large datasets. Additional experience with either python plus numpy or panda, or RDeep understanding of statistical analysis, common quant techniques like regression etc, experiment designProven track record of being able to work independently and proactively engage with business stakeholders with minimal directionStrong verbal and written communication skillsBenefits and Perks100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time off Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

title: Data Operations Lead
description: Job DescriptionA thriving, cutting-edge medical device company with a wide and growing range of highly innovative healthcare product is seeking a Data Operations Lead to Join their Team Worldwide Company operating in 120 countries around with our largest sales office in Irvine, California. Full Time, Direct Hire, 87K+ AnnuallyOur success is due to a supportive and friendly culture that fosters collaboration. You will reap the rewards of working for an organization with a consistent growth strategy ensuring an expanding range of innovative devices for use in respiratory care, acute care and the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea.Responsibilities Responsible for leading day to day data operations and ensuring compliance with both the organization's policies and North American data strategy by translating strategic objectives into tactical execution plans/steps. Manage the Data Steward team, whose responsibilities include data acquisition/cleansing/entry, software implementation/enhancement support, reconciliation of data submission errors/data error remediation and workflow/contract management. Through collaboration with Master Data Analyst, formulate, implement, and enforce proper data collection and data management policies and procedures to ensure completeness, accuracy and timeliness of critical data sources. Work closely with departments/stakeholders throughout the organization to define, set and manage Service Level Agreements and/or translate their data needs into tactical requirements. Participate in project meetings, providing input to project plans and providing status updates as needed. Execute data quality processes as needed, ensure data reconciliations are performed according to set standards. Create and maintain positive, cohesive work environment. Interview and hire personnel, as needed. Serve as point of contact for external business partners, as needed, to collect feedback, work through data discrepancies or communicate status updates. Advocate for data-driven practices and culture of continuous improvement.Qualifications Bachelor's degree 2+ years of Data Operations and/or cross functional leadership experience. 2+ years of experience with ERP and/or data integration software products Excel: Intermediate-to-Advanced Knowledge of: Healthcare Industry standards and requirements; contract management processes and procedures; master data management, governance and data quality best practices Preferred 2+ years' experience with MS SQL Server Hands-on experience with contract management processes and procedures Hands-on experience with master data management and data quality programsPerks! In return, we will offer you an opportunity to work as part of a growing data team with a passion for building a data-driven culture at a company with a fantastic culture of commitment to our employees and customers. title: Transaction Advisory Services Senior - Valuation and Business Modeling - Business Modeling/Data Analytics
description: Competitive business today is all about making intelligent, informed decisions. As a Business Modeling Senior you’ll help make that happen. You will be an important part of our diversely talented, highly experienced team and work at the forefront of high-profile transactions. Our team of strategic advisors sits at the heart of a global Valuation & Business Modeling network of specialists who deliver high quality advice to our clients.The opportunityEY has an established industry leading Valuation and Business Modeling group. We advise our clients on strategic financial decisions including buy vs build, strategic options, deal structure, predictive analytics. You have the opportunity to develop your career through a broad scope of engagements, mentoring and formal learning. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.Your Key ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior within Business Modeling you're likely to spend your day to day working on complex financial decisions, working with management on parts of the strategic client decisions and acquisitions and regularly undertake creation of financial models using data analytics techniques for strategic priorities.Skills And Attributes For Success Strong financial modeling skills. Strong Excel skills. Ability to learn new data analytics tools and related software, including data visualization and database skills. Excellent business English skills - both writing and verbal. Excellent problem solving skills. Intellectual curiosity. To qualify for the role you must have A bachelor's degree in business, finance, or accounting and at least 2 years of related financial modeling work experience; or a graduate degree and at least 1 year of related work experience. Strong financial modeling skills and the ability to create financial models based on clients strategic financial business plans. Superior financial modeling skills in MS Excel with additional experience in any of the following preferred MS Access; SQL Server; Data Visualization applications (e.g. Tableau, MS Powerview); Statistical packages (e.g. MATLAB, SPSS); VBA; C#. Excellent analytical, communication, organizational, interpersonal, and teaming skills. Ability to manage project expenditures against budget and revenue. Ability to provide sound guidance to team members to ensure the completion of work deliverables. Up to 60% travel when necessary. Ideally, you’ll also have Experience with a venture capital, investment banking, commercial banking, or national valuation firm. CFA or CPA certification or significant progress towards these certifications. What We Look ForWe are looking for candidates who are highly motivated, analytical, logical thinkers with a passion for business modeling and have a very strong attention to detail. Being a strong team player is critical with the ability to adapt to changing requirements or deadlines in support of our clients goals.What Working At EY OffersWe offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, both pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 3 weeks of vacation plus 10 observed holidays and up to 3 paid personal days, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most recognized and engaging leaders in the profession. Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career. The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you. About EYAs a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.EY, an equal employment opportunity employer (Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Disabled), values the diversity of our workforce and the knowledge of our people.

description: Senior Business Intelligence AnalystREF#: 31463CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS InteractiveJOB TYPE: Full-Time StaffJob ScheduleJOB LOCATION: Burbank, CAAbout UsCBS Interactive is the premier online content network for information and online operations of CBS Corporation as well as some of the top native digital brands in the entertainment industry.
