With over 1 billion users visiting our properties every quarter, we are a global top 10 web property and one of the largest premium content networks online.Check us out on [1] The Muse, [2] Instagram and [3] YouTube for an inside look into 'Life At CBSi' through employee testimonials, office photos and company updates.ReferencesVisible links https://www.themuse.com/companies/cbsinteractive https://www.instagram.com/cbsinteractive/?hl=en https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAvGapyifCtUlmNTagAl_sQ Brand/Division OverviewDESCRIPTION:We are the Central Audience Development and Acquisition team. We work closely with all CBSi brands (CBS, CBS News, Sports, CNET, GameSpot, TVGuide, et al.) to develop, promote and amplify the very best content and products of what CBSi produces every day.Role DetailsCBSi Central Audience Development and Acquisition team is seeking a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to play a highly visible and important role providing the business with the highest quality insights for decision making. From helping to frame the initial questions, shaping the data and analyzing to presenting recommendations based on the results. The BI Analyst is able to understand the problem facing the business and come back with an insightful solution.Your Day-to-Day Updating marketing campaign tracking reports. Working with internal and external partners. Managing campaign initiatives with all stakeholders. Reviewing off-the-shelf web analytics packages, directly querying in SQL against the data warehouse, and using analytics software. Effectively communicating with all levels of the organization and promote and defend the recommendations they are making. Partnering closely with product management to ensure reporting needs are met. Proactively identifying opportunities for analysis and optimization. Providing analyses and recommendations regarding programming, site performance, financial performance, and advertising effectiveness. This position reports to the Senior Director of Analytics and Operations in the Business Intelligence Group. Supporting marketing team in pushing data products initiatives to completion Creating, maintaining, and continuously improving process workflows to better fit the business Key Projects Collaborating with marketing attribution vendors to ensure quality data and providing actionable insights to optimize paid marketing efforts Working with data science team to develop and implement propensity model for key marketing initiatives Developing requirements for API data ingestion with marketing managers while coordinating with data team and push to completion What You Bring To The TeamQUALIFICATIONS:You have BA/BS in statistics, mathematics, economics, or 3 -5 years experience in web analytics, media industry preferred Strong ability to derive insights from data. Thorough understanding of data modeling and relational databases Experience and enthusiasm with large, raw data sets High degree of initiative and ability to learn and very enthusiastic about data Excellent communication skills Ability to work quickly and accurately on multiple projects concurrently Must successfully pass a background check You might also have Experience working in the tech industry preferred; experience working in the Consumer Technology, Gaming or Digital Media industries a plus Eeo StatementEqual Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Senior Financial Analyst

We hire the best people in the business to:Build and enhance our proven security platformBlend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architectureAnalyze new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intelCollaborate with customers to help solve their toughest security challengesWe are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most. That’s why we’re a leader in next- generation cybersecurity—and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner. We believe in hiring the best the brightest and cultivating a culture of collaboration and appreciation. As we continue to grow and expand globally, we understand that hiring the right people and treating them well is key to our success! We are a multi-national company with locations in 10 countries, with each location contributing to Proofpoint’s amazing culture!

title: Volunteer: Financial Data Analyst Blockchain
description: Only 8% of social enterprises are at growth-stage and beyond (with more than 100employees). This creates a mismatch between the needs of socialenterprises and the behavior of impact investors. The vast majority of socialenterprises are at seed stage or venture stage. But impact investors direct89% of their capital to post-venture, grow-stage social enterprises and large,established, publicly-traded social enterprises. For-profit socialenterprises with high potential impact have had very limited access tovolunteers. Until now there has been no mechanism for individuals in thegeneral public to grant their own time to help change the world by increasingthe chances that fledgling social enterprises can bring transformativesocial innovations to market. CrowdDoing was created to provide such amechanism. Studies show that in addition to raising less capital than theirtraditional venture-backed startup peers, social enterprises have less accessto expertise relevant to their needs than their startup peers do.Role name Financial Data Analyst BlockchainMin Qualifications Required Bachelors / MastersMin Experience Required 1+Experience or Knowledge in a specific subject or area required Blockchain provide data analysis of cryptocurrency tokens along with economics/statistics/fnance evaluation.Essential TasksAnalyze tokens in the market and provide a quantitative search on the sameHave an up to date information of the tokens and share the same with the teamDocument the analysis and present it to the teamSkills & CompetenciesComputational fnance, fnancial engineeringAbility to work efectively and cross-functionally with partners and executive management, while exhibiting superb communication skillsAble to communicate technical analyses and summarize data results in a clear, concisemannerAble to meet deadlines and deliverablesTakes ownership of and responsibility for the quality of the work performedSoftware tools & Program knowledge Knowledge on python is a plusThis is a Assistance, Financial Planning

title: Data Analyst
description: The CompanyCommon Securitization Solutions (CSS) is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our team of talented professionals in Pasadena, California.How many times in your career do you get the opportunity to do something that’s never been done? To create something that will change an entire industry? CSS is building the Common Securitization Platform to issue and manage mortgage securities. We’re looking for people who can walk in two worlds – a start-up environment where development is collaborative and rapid ; and a production environment where we run and monitor the performance of the platform. Longer-term, this platform could serve the entire US housing finance industry. Sound transformative? It is. Come join us and help create something remarkable .ResponsibilitiesJob Information We are seeking a talented Data Analyst who has experience in performing the following activities.Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities. Document and maintain business and functional requirements. Communicate with clients and stakeholders using data to clearly describe a problem or solution. Collaborate with development teams and managers to create database solutions. Ensures that application design is scalable and maintainable. Ensures that all deliverables are thoroughly documented QualificationsEducation Bachelor's Degree or equivalent required Minimum ExperienceA minimum of 7 years of relevant working experience Specialized Knowledge And SkillsGood understanding of RDBMS concepts, especially with Oracle database environment. Be able to understand data models, application modules and be able to document data mapping and create database development requirements/specs. Strong hands-on skills in SQL development and be able to create ad-hoc queries to meet business needs. Experience working with large data sets, producing and clearly explaining data analysis findings to clients and managers. A strong track record of on-time project delivery for large, cross-functional projects Excellent oral and written communication skills, strong customer focus, ability to juggle many tasks and projects in a fast pace environment. Employment As a condition of employment with Common Securitization Solutions, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation, which may also include a credit check for positions in some areas of our business.Common Securitization Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Sr. Data Analyst, Direct Mail
description: Sr. Analyst – Direct Mail   AAG rewards hard work, promotes from within, supports career development and fosters a fun and friendly work environment. If this sounds like a company you are interested in joining, please review the job description below.  A successful candidate will be able to use their data analysis skills combined with their understanding of what drives direct mail performance to deliver insights that can drive improved results. By monitoring performance of existing direct mail tactics at a granular level the Sr Analyst will be able to recommend improvements in direct mail targeting, changes to mailing strategy and as a result help to maximize the value created by the mailing investment.   Key Responsibilities: Analyze performance data and provide intelligent synthesis, interpretation and appropriate action plans based on conclusions Develop regular reporting on metrics and provide ongoing recommendations based on data Monitor performance of past mailings and targeting models to extract actionable insights for future mailings Manage and execute mailing name selection for each mailing in a timely and high quality manner to enable regular mail drops Complete tasks as assigned by the Manager Design, develop, publish and maintain dashboard Write queries, views, or stored procedures to extract data Create scripts for importing, exporting, analyzing, mapping and converting data     Requirements / Qualifications: Demonstrate the ability to learn new software applications in an efficient manner Critical-thinking skills and the ability to identify trends in the data and come up with key takeaways and recommendations Thorough knowledge of SQL relational database theory and practice Proficiency in MS Office Excel (Pivot tables, Power Pivot, formulas, VBA) Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills Demonstrated ability to develop and implement applications using a programming language, especially SQL Manage large complex datasets across multiple platforms. Evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile Experience in supporting and interpreting reporting using Business Intelligence tools (Tableau Experience a plus) Ability to handle dynamic workload, balancing short and long term projects Ability to interpret analytical results into meaningful business terms and translate business needs to programming and data modeling Ability to communicate clearly and effectively to business and technical audiences in both spoken and written formats Must have experience working with direct mail analytics and large data sets

title: Product Data Analyst
description: Why work at Grindr?Now More Than Just An App, We’re a Family Of Lifestyle Brands With The Shared Mission To Connect LGBTQ People With The World Around ThemSince 2009, Grindr has built the world’s largest social network for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. Grindr – The location-based social app that started it all. Over 3 million people use Grindr daily, from every country on the planet. INTO – A digital magazine dedicated to queer perspectives: news, culture, commentary, video, and more. Grindr for Equality (G4E) – Our social mission to promote justice, health, and safety for LGBTQ individuals around the globe. Gaymoji – A one-of-a-kind collection of over 500+ stickers available on iOS, Android, and in the Grindr app. Slumbr – An event series for the high-minded partygoer, combining fashion, music, and art. Behind the brands, Grindr is an inclusive and passionate family of thinkers, innovators, leaders, and most importantly, doers. We’re fueled by endless curiosity, constant collaboration, and a knack for crossing every finish line – all within an agile growth environment. We also enjoy tons of perks, great social events, and stunning views from our HQ in West Hollywood.SummaryGrindr is seeking an experienced, outgoing and confident Data Analyst to join our Product Team. The leader in this data-intensive role will focus on in-app user behavior and partner with our Product Owners, Product Designers and Data Scientists/Engineers to analyze our users (behavioral, quantitative, qualitative, regional, free, subscriber, etc.) in order to measure results, identify problems, surface opportunities, cultivate insights, inform decisions and support recommendations. This leader is also responsible for reporting on the health and efficacy of both existing & new products during their lifecycle via creation, measurement, and analysis of product KPIs.Responsibilities Find, pull, crunch, and interpret large amounts of historical and predictive data from a variety of sources to develop insights, make recommendations and answer key business questions. Track both general and specific business activity and provide clear, compelling reports and presentations on a regular basis. Provide expert knowledge and recommendations internally and externally on digital media measurement and analytic reporting using common industry platforms and tools. Integrate market research data with customer data to create stories and viewpoints that support sales opportunities and client business objectives. Partner with product teams to support analytical product development and innovative new features. Help identify new feature development opportunities (regional and/or global) Measure performance and efficacy of existing features Recommend methods of monetization and identify opportunities to drive user engagement Improve the overall user experience (efficiency, funnels, flows) Identify new ways to grow existing Daily Active Users (free & paid) Identify new ways to monetize products and grow advertising and subscription revenue Identify ways to improve app response time and performance Help optimize user flows and conversion funnels Perform competitive analysis and design effective qualitative surveys Design, implement and analyze A/B tests and test user hypotheses Requirements Proven experience with native mobile apps on both Android and iOS required 3-4 years experience in sales/marketing analytics capacity, within e-commerce, digital advertising or media buying organizations a plus 3-4 years experience in data visualization platforms (Tableau, Looker, Periscope, etc.) Highly proficient with SQL or other data manipulation languages Advanced skill level using Excel Experience with cloud data extraction/manipulation (S3, AWS platforms) Passion for facilitating internal and external customer satisfaction Ability to thrive in a demanding environment while prioritizing multiple tasks and meeting tight deadlines Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal with a focus on quality Equally capable working as part of a team or independently Curious nature, filled with initiative, addicted to follow-through Familiar with Agile team methodologies and ceremonies Experience with metrics and marketing platforms like Apptimize, Localytics, AppBoy, Google Analytics, Fabric/Crashlytics Benefits & Perks 100% covered medical, dental and vision insurance Generous Parental Leave Unlimited sick policy Competitive Salaries 401(k) Catered lunch, every day Stocked kitchen Free on-site parking Casual dress environment Grindr is an equal opportunity employer Recruiting firms that submit resumes to Grindr without first entering into a written contract will not be entitled to any compensation on candidates referred by that firm.

title: Enterprise Data Architect
description: Global Eagle is a leading provider of satellite-based broadband connectivity, television and entertainment services, content and data analytics to aviation, maritime, enterprise and government markets. Global Eagle offers a fully integrated portfolio of rich media content and high-speed connectivity solutions for airlines, private jets, cruise lines, commercial ships, super-yachts, ferries, enterprise, government and military installations worldwide with proprietary performance-enhancing technologies and exclusive access to premium media. With 1,500 employees on six continents and leading global satellite and ground networks, the company delivers exceptional service and concierge support to its customers.Find out more at www.globaleagle.comRole Summary Data is a vital asset to Global Eagle (GEE) as it transforms itself into a globally integrated organization. The Enterprise Data Architect is a hands-on practitioner sitting in the Enterprise Data Services organization partnering with Enterprise Architecture, other IT peers and business stakeholders to define and execute an enterprise data architecture and design that supports the organization’s business strategy.Global Eagle is transforming its applications and data layers to better control the acquisition, validation, quality and distribution of data across GEE’s many mission critical applications and legacy systems. The Enterprise Data Architect will set the overall data architecture and design for GEE and lead efforts that build components of architecture ensuring movement towards the defined future state. This role will architect, design and lead implementation of data models, meta-data models, data flows as well as data services in alignment with Enterprise Architecture standards.This role will have extremely deep, hands-on expertise in data architecture, design and implementation of Data Lake, Data Warehouse (cloud), Business Intelligence, MDM, Meta Data management and System Interfaces. We are looking for an enthusiastic and energetic leader who is self-driven, results-oriented and has working knowledge of key functional areas such as Finance, Supply Chain, and Sales & Marketing – preferably in media/entertainment settings; and deep knowledge of data architecture best practices to support them. Reporting to Sr. Director of Enterprise Data Services this role is key lead player for the organization. Key ResponsibilitiesIn collaboration with Sr. Director of Enterprise Data Services, define and implement the strategy and roadmap for Data and Analytics platforms including the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), Enterprise Data Lake, Enterprise Data Analytics and Enterprise Data Service platforms.Create overall data architecture roadmap and work with other architects and business stakeholders to aggressively transition to the future state.Collaborates with other IT departments to ensure delivery of solutions and data integration with GEE architecture and quality standards.Lead the development of data requirements, principles, models and designs for the future-state data architecture, data flows and data services based on a solid understanding of GEE’s business requirements.Lead plan and programs to develop and maintain the enterprise data architecture across the organization.Lead efforts to report and improve business performance through data-centric solutions and capabilities.Work on highly complex projects that require in-depth knowledge across multiple architecture domains.Prepare conceptual and logical subject area models and implementation-level details.Develop and communicate data architectural policies, standards, guidelines, and procedures.Explain and advocate data technology strategy. Aligns data strategy with business goals.Develop a communication plan for data architecture at the enterprise level.Provide data strategic consultation to business and IT leaders.Ensure recommendations are based on business relevance, appropriate timing, and deployment.Monitor compliance related guidelines, regulatory guidelines and emerging industry standards to determine their impacts on Enterprise Data architecture.Participate in the Enterprise Architecture review board and ensures that data service solutions are compliant with target-state architecture models. Manage exceptions to data architectural standards at an enterprise level.Consult with project teams to fit projects to enterprise data architecture, as well as to identify when it is necessary to modify the enterprise data architecture.Advise on options, risks, costs versus benefits, system impacts, and technology priorities.Work with Director of Enterprise Data Service to drive the Data governance processes.Direct the research and evaluation of emerging data technology, industry, and market trends.Approve data technology tools and components used within the enterprise.10% domestic and/or international travel may be required.In Addition, You Will Also Be Able To DemonstrateYou have experience working in partnership with external consultants and strategic technology partnersYou can demonstrate effectiveness at driving short-term actions that are consistent with long-term goalsYou have a deep understanding of current industry-standard data architecture, platforms and solutions that support global businesses and experienced in applying current and emerging technology trends (e.g. Big Data)You will have superb social skills, be excellent at influencing and motivating individuals and teams, and be able to communicate high level concepts to senior leadersYou are self-motivated, with a "can do" attitude and an ability to make progress when faced with ambiguityExperience in working across cultures, in different countriesPassion for progress, however, hold strong opinions lightly.Qualifications/ExperienceBachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, computer engineering, system analysis, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.A minimum of 15 years of experience in IT, with at least 10 years in information systems design and implementation of Data Warehouse (cloud and on-prem), BI, Data Lake, Data Integration, MDM etc. is required.Hands-on experience with a Hybrid Big Data ecosystem is highly desirable.Understanding of AWS Cloud-hosted data solutions and Snowflake is preferred.3 to 5 years’ experience as data analyst is highly desirable.Knowledge of Oracle OBIEE, Oracle ODI and Hyperion EPM products is desirable.Knowledge of Oracle EBS, Sales Force, Oracle HCM, Contract management products would be plus.System integration experience, including data interface design, ELT, ETL, Virtualization, SOA, API etc.Expertise in data-modeling and information classification expertise.Understanding of common information architecture frameworks and information models.Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to business needs.Ability to analyze project, program and portfolio needs and to accurately determine the resources needed.Knowledge of problem analysis, structured analysis and design, and programming techniques.Excellent communicator and collaborator across multiple technical and business stakeholders and leaders.Excellent facilitation and presentation skills.Track record of remaining unbiased toward specific technologies or vendors.Strategic thinker, keeping big picture in mind while ensuring execution excellence.Comfortable working in a global, highly-matrixed and fast paced IT environment.Work ConditionsOvertime hours as required.Sitting for extended periods of time.Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse and other computer components.Lifting and transporting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers, devices, and peripherals.Be flexible with seating arrangements.Please note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: DescriptionThe Senior Data Analyst is part of GumGum’s Business Intelligence (BI) team, whose primary responsibilities include building and owning KPI reporting for the company, identifying opportunities for system and workflow optimization, and using quantitative arguments to support business decisions. The Senior Data Analyst will focus their attention on monitoring KPIs and deciding what KPIs are important to track as well as working across several teams requiring complex analysis and reporting. The ideal candidate should be an enthusiastic and flexible team player, with a strong analytical and creative mind that thrives in a fast-paced startup environment.ResponsibilitiesWork with other teams within the organization to build, develop and maintain KPIs, monitor them and report on major changes, explain projects and changes to the system that have impacted the KPIs, and ensure overall company performance is in line with expectations.Provide ad-hoc reporting, build and maintain publisher guarantees, rate cards, help identify reasons for data discrepancy and troubleshoot revenue related issues.Provide regular updates to management and make suggestions on changes to improve the current frameworks in place. Lead optimization initiatives with other teams including Publisher Development, Engineering, and Sales Planning.Identify changes that would result in performance improvements and lead complex analysis projects from beginning to end: plan the project, build the analysis through reports, query and combine multiple datasets, perform A/B multivariate tests to drive KPI improvement, etc.Summarize, document, and present analysis findings to senior level executives, both internal and external.RequirementsBA/BS required, preferably in an analytical field (e.g. Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or Finance)Proficiency in SQL (Redshift, Druid, Athena)Excellent Communication SkillsAdvanced Excel Skills4+ years of experience in fields of analytics requiredFamiliarity with Looker, Salesforce, JIRA requiredKnowledge in R is a plusAbility to think strategically and creatively. Thinking outside of the box and making logical assumptions and connections is incredibly importantPerksStock options401k, great medical/dental plans/monthly fitness stipendUnlimited vacation policy/generous Paid Family LeaveOn-going learningGreat company culture, co-workers, and monthly happy-hoursAnnual company retreatsLocated in hotbed of tech startups, just blocks from the beach!

title: Consumer Online Mobile Banking  Manager- Digital Channels
description: Fremont Bank founded in 1964, is one of the oldest independently owned banks in the Bay Area and is one of the top rated mid-tier banks in the nation. Voted a Top Workplace for 2017 and for the past seven consecutive years, Fremont Bank has an immediate opening for a Consumer Online Mobile Banking Channel Manager - Digital Channels in Hayward, CA. Position Overview   The Consumer OLB Mobile Banking Channel Manager will be responsible for creating, managing, and executing the strategic roadmap during the product lifecycle for the consumer online and mobile banking. The role will provide leadership over the execution of initiatives, daily operations, and management to ensure the solutions to market are aligned with the operational and strategic goals for Fremont Bank.Roles and Responsibilities:Direct lines of business decision making responsibility for consumer online and mobile banking strategy, vision, and execution to impact key performance indicators for the company. Manage overall customer experience and adoption for the digital products and services. Provide strategic direction and drive enhancements to improve user experience. Develop business plan based on in-depth understanding of (1) voice of the customer; (2) competitive analysis; (3) profitability; (4) product life cycle; (4) vendor/platform capabilities; and (5) operational support Acts as the sponsor for key digital initiatives, responsible for demonstrating value and ROI to stakeholders across the enterprise Manages product teams through the full product lifecycle Ensures compliance, data security and quality policies are met with all deliverables Manage the deliverables of the Digital Banking Business Analyst to coordinate and implement vendor software releases and stay abreast of vendor roadmaps and enhancements. Partners closely with peer organizations, marketing, product development, customer contact center, user experience and technology to evolve the digital platform Identifies opportunities to digitize the full lifecycle process Inspires the organization on aspects of design thinking, technology utilization and its application to Fremont Bank Encourages Agile methodologies for product and technology development Facilitates the execution of a consistent multi-channel strategy (ATM, Branch, Digital and Contact Center) and influences portfolio level investment in adherence to brand guidelines Develop business cases and perform cost/benefit analysis as needed to secure buy in for enhancements and initiatives. Prioritize product requirements and operational tasks to ensure audit, regulatory and security controls are met. Manage a portfolio of projects to enable the bank to meet the digital needs of its customers and prospective customers and serve as primary business point of contact for implementation activities; working closely with key partners to meet scheduled milestones. Develop and manage KPI’s and success metrics for digital products and services Interface with Training & Development to create and modify training for assigned digital products/services. Understand all aspects of the internal and external environment including customer met/unmet digital needs through research efforts, in-depth understanding of voice of the customer, industry trends, vendor/platform capabilities and best practices for servicing the digital needs of our customers. Minimum QualificationsBS/BA required; MBA preferred Demonstrated technical acumen and an ability to work with the technology organization to align product and technology roadmaps 10+ years combined experience in Digital (Online/Mobile) Channel management or eBusiness. 5+ years experience in financial services industry or related experiences 5+ years experience managing people in a direct reporting structure and strength in managing cross-functional matrixed teams Strong networking skills and ability to build highly collaborative relationships at the executive level Ability to innovate and transform an industry by applying best practices from other industries, thinking non-traditionally Sets the strategic vision and gains alignment with other parts of the organization Make business decisions based on analysis and recommendations. Ability to effectively negotiate and arrive at successful solutions with key stakeholder groups. SkillsStrong customer-focused design and UX principles Broad experience in project management models and their application to different projects, including Agile, Waterfall, and Scrum Positive, team-oriented and enthusiastic attitude Superior analytical skills and ability to synthesize data and draw conclusions. Demonstrated interpersonal and relationship management skills; ability to work well as part of a cross-functional team and lead across the organization at multiple levels. Ability to influence diverse, cross functional team to success without direct authority over the team. Excellent verbal, writing and presentation skills. (Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Visio)APPLY: https://fremontbank.csod.com/ats/careersite/JobDetails.aspx?site=1&id=1455     OREMAIL -ranjana.joshi@fremontbank.com

title: Subscriber Data Analyst II
description: Hulu is a premium streaming TV destination that seeks to captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking and embracing fun. It’s a mission that takes some serious smart, intense curiosity and determination to be the best. Come be part of the team that’s powering play.SummaryHulu’s Finance team is seeking a Subscriber Data Analyst who will be an exceptional addition to our Subscriber Growth and Experience FPandA team. The team partners closely with the Product and Tech organization to provide data-driven insights and recommendations. And as a Subscriber Data Analyst at Hulu, you will play an integral role in helping the team access, organize, and analyze large, custom data sets in order to generate these insights to our business partners. In doing so, you will gain exposure to the Product and Tech sides of the business. The right person for this role is very experienced with SQL, has strong analytical skills, sets a high bar for him/herself, and is eager to learn more. If you are someone who thrives in a team environment and would enjoy partnering with teams across Hulu to solve complex problems, then this is a great role for you.What You’ll DoDive deep into the data to identify areas of opportunity that will increase subscriber growth and improve user experienceUse SQL to extract data that will inform high-impact analyses and decisionsEnrich financial models and complete ad hoc projects that help prioritize initiatives and generate solutions to interesting questionsCollaborate with the Product, Marketing, Distribution and Tech teams to support projects that impact multiple business groups and directly affect our user baseLeverage large sets of data to extract insights that will inform the strategic direction of the company around acquisition opportunities, retention tactics and user flowsWHAT TO BRING2-4 years of experience in Data Engineering or Data Analysis role Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Business or other quantitative fieldExtensive experience with SQL and data collection in a Big Data environmentExcellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly present findingsOrganized, self-driven and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment across multiple stakeholdersA drive to learn more about Big Data and how it impacts BusinessNICE-TO-HAVESExperience providing data and analytical support to Product and Tech organizationsExperience in Subscription business Experience in the Media or Technology fieldExperience working with Big Data platforms such as Hive/PrestoExperience working with Tableau or other data visualization tools Experience with statistical analysis tools (R, SAS) or programming languages Advanced MS Excel and PowerPoint skills

title: Sr. HRIS Analyst (HR Analyst (HRIS) 3
description: Lumentum (NASDAQ: LITE) is a market-leading manufacturer of innovative optical and photonic products enabling optical networking and commercial laser customers worldwide. Lumentum’s optical components and subsystems are part of virtually every type of telecom, enterprise, and data center network. Lumentum’s commercial lasers enable advanced manufacturing techniques and diverse applications including next-generation 3D sensing capabilities. title: Product Marketing Manager, Big Data Analytics, Google Cloud
description: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Seattle, WA, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USAWhether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.Google has been at the forefront of big data analytics and Artificial Intelligence (AI) innovations. In this role, you’ll be responsible for driving product marketing for Google Cloud big data analytics products, including Cloud Dataproc and upcoming offerings. Big data processing solutions play a critical role in our strategy and are a major point of differentiation for our cloud. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to make sure the world understands the value of Google Cloud big data analytics solutions.Data is your special super-power, and you know how to use it to spark interest and tell a story. You have the ability to analyze and diagnose complex technical and business challenges, formulate product marketing strategy, and influence engineering in product roadmap and investment areas. You possess technical skills combined with excellent written and verbal communications skills. You are equally at home building compelling product narratives as you are going head-to-head with industry influentials and analysts.Success in this role will require the development of strong working relationships and interactions with customers, leaders, engineering teams, and other product and marketing groups across Google.Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.Responsibilities Define, prioritize and land the end-to-end marketing strategy for Google Cloud Platform's big data processing products. Collaborate with product management, partnerships, sales and engineering functions to define and deliver the technology value proposition, marketing narratives and core marketing contents. Build world-class, inspiring technology showcase assets that excite customers. Drive awareness of Google Cloud Platform data analytics solutions in the market and engage with key influencers. Design innovative marketing campaign strategy and partner with engineering to develop and/or deliver industry leading product demonstrations for major events, including executive keynotes. QualificationsMinimum qualifications: Bachelors degree in a technical/marketing field or equivalent practical experience. 7 years of technology or software marketing experience. Preferred Qualifications Experience in building creative assets and marketing content. Experience in planning and actioning multiple, complex marketing programs including budget management. Experience in the data analytics and Hadoop/Spark data processing space Demonstrated ability as a product or technology advocate, with the ability to collaborate with engineering and marketing teams. Excellent communication and organizational skills. At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.To all recruitment agencies Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other company location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Sr. Data Scientist - Engine Data Analytics
description: Who We AreAt Criteo, we connect 1.4 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to determining what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 45 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 90 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.Your mission Contribute to the development of a high-performance marketing product for the CPG (consumer packaged goods) industry. Build and improve the precision of our prediction models, used in to rank our ads in real time within 10ms. Gather and analyze data to extract valuable information relevant to prediction models. Identify key prediction problems and propose innovating solutions. Report, visualize and communicate results.What You'll BringMS degree in Software Engineering or related field.3+ years of experience with data analysis or modeling.2+ years of programming experience in Java, Scala, C++ or C#.2+ years of data processing experience.Passion for building exceptionally high quality prediction models, algorithms, creative problem solving, empowerment, agility, teamwork and superb communication.Curiosity and drive - you love solving the hardest problems.Criteo R&D Culture Empowerment – We believe in hiring the best engineers in the industry and then letting them get on with what they do best – designing, coding and releasing state of the art software. Mobility – In our Voyager program our engineers get to pick which team they want to work on for 2-4 weeks, boosting collaboration, networking and maybe even leading to switching teams. Agility - We work in a fast pace environment where we build and release stuff frequently to deliver value soon and adapt to changes quickly. Variety – We have many ways to get your code to production including our Hackathon, 10% projects, Voyager and more. Multicultural – We have engineers from all over the world for you to interact and exchange ideas with.Our culture keeps evolving, and you will be expected to contribute actively with new ideas to complement and enhance the existing programs that include friction-less internal mobility, 10% time, mentoring, technical talks, hackathons, conferences, etc. Are you up to the challenge?At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst – Finance
description: DescriptionSenior Business Intelligence Analyst – FinanceFinance | Santa Clara, CA, United StatesOrganization: Financial Systems and ControlsThe FSG team is key to Chegg’s ability to perform the accounting close, generate the company’s financial reports and pass audits. It is a team composed of business intelligence analysts, business systems analysts and process analysts who primarily support the Finance and Accounting departments.Role: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst – FinanceThe role will require developing and maintaining a set of reports using Tableau and Domo. It also will require using Chegg’s ETL tooling to create and maintain the data marts supporting the reports, in Amazon Redshift. The ideal candidate for this position must have deep knowledge in Enterprise Data Warehousing, strong SQL querying and ETL skills as well as experience with BI tools such as Tableau and Domo. Chegg is also streaming data to its data warehouse, so experience in that domain will be valued.This person will work closely with the engineering teams as well as with the Finance community. This analyst will have exceptional communication skills, as the role will be interacting with both technical and business-oriented staff.ResponsibilitiesOwn, develop, improve, test, UAT and maintain timely and accurate ETLs and reports for the Finance, Accounting and Tax departments. Develop and manage timely sanity checks to ensure the quality of the information provided. Identify problems and root causes. Propose fixes and design data audits to ensure against problem recurrence.Manage the financial data relationships, mappings and definitions in partnership with Chegg’s Business Intelligence and Finance departments.Participate in the technology roadmap for Business Intelligence at Chegg.Ability to effectively manage multiple projects and prioritize simultaneouslyEager to learn new skills and capabilities to improve for the futureEncourages and motivates collaboration and pro-actively works with others to solve problems and achieve resultsRequirementsBachelors in Information Systems or equivalentExcellent SQL skills; MySQL, Oracle SQL and Redshift SQL.Experience with ETL or data streaming tools is a requirement.Tableau and/or Domo hands-on experience a must.Must be able to work out of our Santa Clara officePreferredFamiliar with Amazon Databricks, Spark and Kinesis strongly desiredFamiliar with NetSuite Connect a plusFamiliar with Anaplan reporting or other CPM tool a plus.Excel wizardry a plus.An Ideal Candidate Should BePassionate about producing high-quality deliverables.Detail-oriented and results driven.Extremely eager to take responsibility and to deliver results.About CheggAs the leading student-first connected learning platform, Chegg's Student Hub makes higher education more affordable and more accessible, all while improving student outcomes. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, CA with offices in San Francisco, New York, Portland, India, Israel, Berlin, and Ukraine. Chegg Student Hub Services Include: Chegg Study, Tutoring, Writing Tools, Math Help, Test Prep, Careers Search, Internship Admissions, and College Admissions.Video Shorts - Life at Chegg: https://jobs.chegg.com/Video-Shorts-Chegg-ServicesCertified Great Place to Work!: http://reviews.greatplacetowork.com/cheggFor More Information: https://jobs.chegg.com/Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

title: Senior Data Quality Tester PSJH
description: Providence St. Joseph is calling a Senior Data Quality Tester – PSJH to one of the following locations: Anaheim CA, Portland OR, Beaverton OR, Seattle WA or Renton WA.We are seeking a Senior Data Quality Tester – PSJH to develop, improve, and report the status of the organization's Quality Management System (QMS) to senior management, to establish organizational quality assurance standards, and coordinate Quality Assurance activities with QA management, project managers, and portfolio leaders.In This Position You Will Have The Following Responsibilities The Data Quality Tester is responsible for validating information used for data driven decision making The DQ Tester is an active participant in the development and implementation of policies and procedures required to manage data and ensure the consistency, accuracy, and completeness of data under their oversight Validate consistency, accuracy, and completeness of all data under Data Quality oversight. Develop and execute action plans to support data cleanup/improvement initiatives Perform a regular analysis of data and recommend improvements for data cleanup Support the Data Quality program – identify and recommend improvement initiatives. This may include changes to business processes to improve the quality of data and fill gaps in data. Work with stakeholders and management to regularly review and update mapping of data. Required Qualifications For This Position Include Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Business Management, Information Services, Healthcare Informatics, *Equiv educ/exp: Quality Assurance, process, software, engineering, Healthcare data management, or Healthcare Informatics. 6+ years experience in a quality assurance related position that had similar primary duties in addition to education requirements. 5 years Experience as Healthcare Analyst 5 years Experience with one database applicable programming environment: (MS SQL, Oracle, MySQL, etc.) 3 years Demonstrated ability to lead others or manage multiple projects through completion. Demonstrated understanding of modern data quality concepts and best practices.Super user experience using, managing, or supporting data quality tools. Current on industry trends and topics relating to applied informatics, test management, software development, and industry best practices. Healthcare experience Strong analytical skills: ability to boil down a complex problem into a plan of action with clear deliverables and milestones. A proven ability to coordinate and monitor technical activities and projects. General understanding of Lean, Six Sigma, or other continuous improvement methodology. General understanding of ITIL or other IT frameworks. Proficiency with the MS-Office suite of products. Preferred Qualifications For This Position Include Current professional or technical certification(s) relevant to role: (ISTQB, PMI, Lean, Six Sigma, Epic, Healthcare certifications, etc.).Formal education or training in data quality, quality assurance, integration, software development, server and application development, or equivalent.Project mgmt professional Six sigma black belt certification Epic certification Microsoft certified professional Current, industry related, professional or technical certifications areProject Management (PMI) experience and certificationsSoftware development experience and certification. Healthcare experience and certifications Software development experience and certifications Certification specific to software development, systems engineering, networking, security, ERP, Epic, Lean, Six Sigma, Epic, Healthcare certifications, etc or other healthcare application certifications St. Joseph Health (SJH) is an integrated healthcare delivery system sponsored by the St. Joseph Health Ministry and organized into three regions: Northern California, Southern California, West Texas/Eastern New Mexico.SJH provides a full range of care from facilities including 14 acute care hospitals, home health agencies, hospice care, outpatient services, skilled nursing facilities, community clinics, and physician organizations.SJH maintains a 'continuum of care,' matched to the diverse needs of the urban centers, smaller cities and rural communities in three statesFor the third year in a row in 2009, the Gallup Organization awarded St. Joseph Health its highest honor - the Great Workplace Award.SJH provides exceptional benefits, opportunities for advancement and relocation within the system.St. Joseph Health is comprised of four core values: Service, Excellence, Dignity, and Justice are the guiding principles of all we do.Excellent Compensation Program And Benefits Provided.St. Joseph Health (SJH) provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.In addition to federal law requirements, St. Joseph Health (SJH) complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.Positions specified as “on call, per diem” refers to employment consisting of shifts scheduled on as “as needed basis” to fill in for staff vacancies.

description: Responsibilities Extensive experience conducting software vendor analysis activities, including gap-build analysis, technology and platform evaluations, and implementation risk assessment. Experience with JIRA is a plus. Proven ability to prioritize, multi-task, and manage multiple complex bodies of work in a fast paced work environment Confident, self-aware team player open to receiving/providing feedback to peers and colleagues Ability to establish strong relationships with all levels of an organization Perceptive, critical thinker with the ability to solve challenges creatively Experiencing working in an agile work environment is a plus Comfort with analytical and data analysis tools including Excel

title: Data Analyst
description: At the Wonderful Company, we believe in investing in California's South San Joaquin Valley communities where 4,000 of our employees and their families live. In California's Central Valley, where rates of chronic disease are disproportionately high and educational outcomes are consistently poor, we are developing extensive and innovative wellness and education programs.Wonderful Education strives to provide the youth in the South San Joaquin Valley communities with experiences and opportunities -- from preschool through college graduation -- that lead to a promising future. Wonderful Health & Wellness is creating a sustainable culture of physical and emotional well-being through an enhanced primary care model that integrates medical, behavioral health and social services; our goal is to ensure that healthy choices are an integral part of our employees' everyday lives at home, at work, and within the communities in which they live.The Wonderful Company is seeking a Data Analyst to provide leadership in analytics, reporting, and business intelligence capabilities to enable "data-driven" decision making for furthering Wonderful Education's mission: to build strong pathways to prosperity for the children and young adults in the Central Valley, where we farm and process our consumer products. This position requires a hungry and driven, early-career leader looking for the next step in their career.The ideal qualified candidate will lead development, implementation, and oversight of collection of data as well as analysis and reporting of metrics, key indicators, and results across our various Wonderful Education programs, to drive performance, accelerate positive student outcomes, and maximize impact. This role will also assist the Director of Strategy in developing dashboards, insights, presentations, and strategic initiatives. This position is located in Central Valley, California and will require occasional travel throughout the Central Valley and to our Los Angeles company headquarters on our corporate jet.Here's What You'll Do Manage, gather, report and analyze all student participation and performance data related to Wonderful Education's programs to increase operational efficiency and accelerate student outcomes Gatekeep student data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and database integrity Research comparative statistics and data as needed Provide data, analysis, and insights for speeches, presentations, collateral, marketing, and leadership initiatives Develop and implement program dashboards to present data through charts, graphs, maps, and infographics to facilitate decision making and achievement tracking for Wonderful Education programs Work with the Wonderful Education programs team on executing company and group initiatives, assisting with change management, tracking key performance indicators Assume and execute additional responsibilities as assigned Central Valley, CA based and open to 20-30% regional travel per week Reports to Director of Strategy, Wonderful Education A Little Bit About Your Work-style Adheres to a culture of professionalism, operational excellence and drive for results Demonstrates independence by driving projects with limited oversight, anticipating next steps, and leverages strong business judgement Prioritizes changing demands, multi-tasks, and meets deadlines in a dynamic environment Communicates effectively and has strong attention to detail Here's What You'll Bring To The Table Bachelor's degree required with preferred concentration in business, information technology, data science, analytics, or engineering Minimum two years of experience with data analysis, reporting, and/or project management Experience in education and academic student data a plus MBA desirable Outstanding Microsoft Excel skills and experience with business intelligence tools Ability to work under pressure in a dynamic environment with little direction Strong project management skills, having managed and successfully completed diverse projects Superior cross-functional collaborator with the ability to build relationships within an organization Strong analytical and quantitative skills as well as attention to detail Demonstrated experience working with geographically dispersed teams Excellent communication, analytic and problem-solving skills; sound business acumen and strategic thinking The Wonderful Company gives approximately $10-$15 million annually to educational programs throughout California's Central Valley. We invest in preschools, a K-12 charter school, Agriculture Career Prep programs, college scholarships, school grants, arts education, summer camps, and parent training. We have a track record of organic and acquisition growth resulting in phenomenal performance.Here's What We'll Bring To The Table Competitive benefits package including Medical (including 24/7 online access to a physician), Vision, Dental, and 401k with match eligibility Subsidized gym membership Wonderful Giving ( Headquartered in Los Angeles, The Wonderful Company is a privately held $4 billion global company dedicated to harvesting health and happiness around the world through its iconic consumer brands. The company's 9,000 employees worldwide are dedicated to bringing consumers everywhere the freshest, most wholesome pistachios, almonds, citrus and pomegranates; bottling the finest water and wines; and creating colorful bouquets that are sure to touch the heart. This commitment is reflected in the company's market share: Wonderful Pistachios is America's No. 1 tree nut brand and one of the top-selling salty snacks; Wonderful Halos is the No. 1 mandarin orange in America; POM Wonderful is the No. 1 100% pomegranate brand in America; FIJI Water is America's No. 1 premium bottled water brand; Teleflora is the No. 1 floral delivery service through local florists; and JUSTIN Wine has the No. 1Cabernet Sauvignon in California. A 2016 Nielsen study evaluating the familiarity, quality, and momentum of more than 2,500 leading brands revealed that Wonderful Company products dominated the top 10 lists of consumers across all generations, more than any other consumer goods company.The Wonderful Company's connection to consumers has health at its heart and giving back in its DNA. The company has a long-standing commitment to corporate social responsibility, including more than $120 million invested in environmental technologies and sustainability research, $45 million in charitable giving and education initiatives every year, $30 million toward the construction of a new charter school campus in California's Central Valley, and innovative health and wellness programs, including two new, free primary care clinics for employees and their dependents.To learn more about The Wonderful Company, its products and core values, visitThe Wonderful Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and with opportunities for advancement. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or other protected categories.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Does uncovering hidden insights in data give you life? Do you often find yourself saying “but was the difference statistically significant?”, even to your friends? Is r/dataisbeautiful one of your favorite subreddits?Then we want to meet you. Updater’s Data team is a new function made up of Analytics and Data Engineering, working together with a mandate to use data to improve business outcomes and to make Updater a data-driven company. Partnering with teams across the organization, Data enriches customer experience and helps develop new products, drives strategy and discovers insights, evangelizes data-driven decision-making, and facilitates data access and education, all to achieve Updater’s vision of being the leading platform for the relocation industry.As the Senior Data Analyst, you’ll be on the front lines working with stakeholders across the organization to perform analysis, make business recommendations, build reports, provide data education, and build data-based logic into our products. If you love getting up to your ears in data and aren’t satisfied until a project is driven to meaningful impact, we want to work with you!Example Projects Partner with our Product team to define in-product recommendation engine logic. Collaborate with our SVP of Strategy & BizDev to demonstrate the value of our mover information to potential business partners and drive significant revenue. Work with other Data team members to choose and build-out the model for a BI tool, facilitating data access for team members across Updater. Partner with our Success and Engineering teams to build a data quality anomaly detection system to help keep our data clean and maximize one of Updater’s company-wide KPIs. What We Expect From You 3+ years experience as an analyst in a fast-paced work environment; proven ability to drive material business impact through analytics. Empathy: you strive to see the world from your customers’ point of view in order to anticipate their needs. Humility: you have an opinion, but aren’t afraid to be proven wrong, and are open to suggestions on what tool or technique is best to most efficiently solve a problem. Strong communication: you’re as comfortable talking with our SVP of Strategy & BizDev as you are with our Director of API Engineering. Comfortable with ambiguity: you’re used to being asked open-ended questions and whittling them down to questions that can be answered by hard data. Expert SQL & Python skills. Practical knowledge of statistics. Experience with modern BI tools (Looker, Periscope, Mode, etc). Bonus Points For Experience setting up and administering a BI tool. Experience implementing a data education program. Experience building and selling a data product. About UpdaterUpdater makes moving easier for the 17 million households that relocate every year in the US. With Updater, users seamlessly transfer utilities, update accounts and records, forward mail, and much more. Hundreds of the most prominent real estate companies in the US (from real estate brokerages to multifamily and relocation companies) rely on Updater’s real estate products to save clients hours with a branded and personalized Updater moving experience.Headquartered in New York City, Updater has raised nearly $100 million from leading investors, including SoftBank Capital, IA Ventures, Commerce Ventures, Second Century Ventures (the strategic investment arm of the National Association of Realtors®), and more. Updater ranked #3 on Crain's 2016 Best Places to Work in NYC, ranking as the highest rated tech company on the list. For more information, please visit www.updater.com.Updater is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, actual or presumed belonging to an ethnic group, or any other legally protected status. title: Sr. Data Analyst
description: Do you want to have an impact? It starts with the Data. We absorb billions of data points a day and transform into a Full Resolution Identity graph. As part of an early stage team, you will make an impact doing outstanding analysis and building powerful dashboards. You will dig into the data to uncover insights and influence decision making across the organization. If you are a results oriented, motivated individual that wants to work on bleeding-edge technology, we saved you a seat on our team!What You'll Do Identify opportunities to perform analysis that provide actionable insights to partner teams. Create and maintain automated reports and tools that empower others. Collaborate with cross functional teams to provide recommendations based on data driven insights. Effectively communicate data insights and methodology to a diverse set of stakeholders. Develop frameworks for analysis and build models to help solve complex problems for the business. What You Bring To The Table 2+ Years work experience doing analysis for a technology company. Experience with Hadoop Ecosystem and willingness to learn more (Hive, Spark, Presto… ect.). Fluency in SQL. Experience with relational databases (Mysql,Vertica, Redshift… ect.). Experience with BI Reporting & Visualization tools. Knowledge of Tableau a big plus. You have a deep understanding of statistics and interest in predictive modeling. You enjoy digging through data and discovering the right metric or graph that you could build a story around. You are a pro-active self starter with a willingness to learn and adjust in a fast-paced working environment. What's In It For You Contribute to a fast-paced, high-growth company that will challenge you, and which was recently featured in Forbes, Fortune, TechCrunch, and AdWeek.Have a huge impact in the hottest growth area in digital advertising.Get rewarded with competitive pay, benefits, and pre-IPO stock options.Work with fun, intelligent people in a great work environment.Enjoy gourmet coffee, free lunches, sweet & salty snacks, and keg.Medical (PPO and HMO options), dental, and vision coverage.Flexible Spending Account (FSA) benefit.Life and disability insurance.401K savings plan.Attractive vacation, sick, gym/health, and holiday benefits.An excellent work culture of fun, respectful, open minds, diversity, and teamwork.The Drawbridge “X” Factor Sure we’ve got the usual requisite stuff like happy hours, brown-bag talks, free lunches, snacks, and more, but what sets Drawbridge apart is the authentic sense of community. We actually like hanging out together, whether we’re working to move the company forward, or getting to know each other a little better – in and out of the office. Our culture makes us excited to come to work, and we know that this strength helps us attract talented individuals who go above and beyond. If you’re different, you’ll fit. As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Drawbridge is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard to race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion, or any other unlawful factor. Drawbridge complies with all applicable laws, including those regarding consideration of qualified applicants with criminal histories (such as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance). We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our Drawbridge participates in E-Verify. Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: Drawbridge does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any Drawbridge employee. Drawbridge will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered the property of Drawbridge.
