Develop a detailed understanding of the Client Service Department’s (CSA) workflows and current technology solutions that support them Partner with the CSA team in evaluating processes, anticipating requirements, and identifying opportunities for application or workflow enhancements Perform detailed data analysis and testing as necessary Work closely with IT Department, as well as 3rd party vendors, to support software applications and initiativesQualifications/Skills Experience on the Eagle PACE/STAR platform Minimum 5 years of experience on project teams in the financial services industry, ideally within a buy side organization Proficient in data analytics and SQL Understanding of financial instruments Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Detail-oriented, organized, highly motivated individual interested in working in a team environment Experienced Project Management Skills Excellent interpersonal and oral/written communication skills Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment 4 year college degree provided by Dice financial services, Eagle PACE/STAR platform, data analytics, SQL SDLC, requirements, testing

title: Data Analyst
description: Want to help millions of people turn their travel dreams into reality? Want to join a team of talented travel technologists, digital marketers and fintech experts? Read on and apply!At UpLift, you’ll Work with the Data Analytics team and cross functional teams to define, implement, and grow core metrics Create, maintain, and automate solid datasets and insightful dashboards to track core metrics and extract business insights for all partners Analyze large-scale structured and unstructured data to identify business opportunities and optimize product performance Design and analyze experiments for both new partner onboarding process and product feature improvement Convert the results into actionable recommendations, craft compelling stories, and evangelize data-driven business decisions Basic QualificationsRequirements BA/BS degree in quantitative fields Strong experience in one or more of the following SQL, RDB, NoSQL, and big data Fluency in one or more programming languages (Python, R, shell script, etc.) Fluency in one or more cloud data platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) 1+ years experience with project management and working cross-functionally with engineering, product, and sales teams Preferred Qualifications Advanced degree in quantitative fields Excellent interpersonal, communication, writing, presentation, statistical & data analysis skills Familiarity with data visualization and/or BI tools (Looker, Tableau, Sisense, etc.) Fintech experience Benefits Health and Dental Insurance Covered Equity and 401k offered Easy commute across from Menlo Park train station Free lunch, everyday

title: SAP Data Process Analyst
description: 6+ month contract opportunity in Hercules, CA to work with management to ensure data management initiatives and sustaining processes are aligned with the strategic business objectives of the corporation. Responsible for implementing the Corporate Data Policy, the Data Quality Program, and supporting compliance and audit of data for Sarbanes-Oxley and other regulatory requirements within their data domain. Although technical skills are nice, they are not the key to this position. Having an understand of the customer set and vendor set up business process is the focus. Someone who has lived a day-in-the-life of order management, account receivable, procurement or accounts payable.​ These are the end users this person will be working with every day. No data migration is involved in this position.     Responsibilities and environment:   • Review SAP MDG customer and vendor create and update change requests for adherence to global design and data quality. • Work with DMO Manager to ensure the alignment of the IT support systems to Business Data requirement • Support Data Management Office in establishing and enforcing standard methodologies for the data components of Business Projects • Monitors compliance with data security requirements by the Custodians and approves data access requests for Custodians • Provide leadership for definition, approval, publication and maintenance of the Corporate Data Policy and supporting guidelines, standards and procedures for their data domain • Provide authority to Data Custodians to create and enforce data quality and data process standards • Sponsor definition, approval and execution of the Corporate Data Quality Program for their data domain • Develop recommendations for data programs and initiatives relative to their data domain for input to the funding processes • Assist with the resolution of Data integration issues • Recommend adjustments to data policies and procedures as necessary to improve key performance indicators • Field calls from Data Custodians and users within their business area. Resolves routine data problems • Identify root causes of data quality problems within their business area and identifies sustainable solutions • Develop and performs independent data quality analyses relevant to Customer/Vendor Master domain • Ensure Data Custodians are kept informed of changes in data standards and processes • Train Custodians on proper updating and use Customer/Vendor Master Data

title: Senior Security Engineer - Cloud Services
description: The RingCentral environment is dynamic, success-driven, team-oriented and committed to providing world class service for its customers. Do you have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment? We are looking for candidates with an entrepreneurial spark!We’re not a phone company; we’re a cloud business-solutions provider. We've thrown out the old PBX along with its rigid rules and eliminated the complexity and unnecessary expense of managing business communications the old way.RingCentral’s Infrastructure Operations team is responsible for monitoring, maintaining and upgrading the backend infrastructure on which we deliver our cloud-based unified communications services to customers all over the world. RingCentral Cloud Operations is engineered for 99.999% uptime with domestic and international geo-redundant data centers. As a RingCentral Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, deploying, maintaining and supporting the x86 virtualization environment including the underlying servers and storage systems at RingCentral.RingCentral is a leading Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS) provider, offering an innovating suite of telephony, contact center, video conferencing, and collaboration products for enterprise, mid-size companies, and small businesses.  Job Description:This is a great opportunity to work at a rapidly growing, market leading Unified Communications as-a-service company. RingCentral provides Voice-over-IP (VoIP), hosted PBX, voicemail, SMS, e-fax, and HD video meeting solutions for business.As a Senior Security Engineer at RingCentral, your primary responsibilities are to design, implement, and oversee a comprehensive security infrastructure, security monitoring, DFIR, and threat intelligence program for RingCentral’s global cloud service, corporate and development environments. Additional responsibilities include utilizing strong leadership and creative skills to innovate and improve security operations processes, developing the program to manage various alarms and alerting tools, generating actionable analysis and threat intelligence from tools, logs, and other data sources, ensuring strong documentation is in place to support ongoing SOC activities, and training and mentoring other Security, Operations and IT personnel.  Successful Candidates will:Have proven skills in network and system security / administration, security monitoring, incident response, intrusion analysis and computer forensics, analysis of malicious code and exploitsHave expert knowledge of the diverse methods and technologies used to protect web/mobile/desktop applications, SaaS infrastructure, and dataThink critically, work well under pressure, and possess strong analytical, written, verbal, and interpersonal skillsDemonstrated track record of quality processes in candidate’s work historyBe strongly self-motivated with an aptitude for both individual and team-oriented work  Responsibilities:Train security analyst and other incident respondersDesign and implement security infrastructure and logging for production, corporate and development environmentsDesign and implement a security monitoring, digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) program for a global cloud services environment.Identify threats and potential areas for abuse in applications, specifying solutions, verifying through testing, and determining the necessary technical solution and project oversight based on riskWork with software development teams to secure development environmentsMonitor security events, analyze and investigate alarms, and maintain day-to-day operational activities of a secure cloud environment.Review events, alarms, logs, and interpret data.Conduct investigations of alarms and incidents.Engage teams within and outside of RingCentral to mitigate and resolve casesProcess development, implementation, and improvementGenerate threat intelligence and conduct pro-active threat researchLead incident response activities and security investigations, triage and prioritize investigation activities, and introduce incident management best practices.Ensure RingCentral is in compliance with applicable Federal and global laws and regulations regarding the monitoring of information and response to security incidentsGenerate and maintain relevant documentation and audit artifactsManage various monitoring toolsIdentify and track suspicious system activityEstablish and report on monitoring and DFIR metricsWork with ISPs, carriers and partners to respond to events, conduct investigations, and minimize incidentsProvide post mortem reporting for security incidents and recommendations to prevent recurrenceIdentify trends and patterns, summarize key findings, and recommend process and system enhancements.Collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Engineering, Operations, Support and Product Management to enhance tools, processes, and detection methodsReview issues escalated by other Security team members and provide guidance on resolution.Manage and respond to escalations from internal and external parties within designated service levelsEducate internal team members and external parties on DFIR and monitoring processes and proceduresContract review/assisting legal with contractsProvide assistance to Sales and PMM teams in answering customer RFIs  Qualifications:4+ years in a security engineering or SOC role in a cloud services environmentBA/BS degree or 4 years equivalent experience in diverse security, DevOps and operations rolesExpert knowledge of protocols and troubleshootingStrong knowledge of IDS, SIEM, vulnerability management, anti-malware protection, case management, and related tools and practicesExpert knowledge of common security monitoring, analysis (DFIR), and incident response techniquesStrong knowledge of virtualization and expert knowledge of Linux / Windows / MacOS operating systems including strong command line skillsExperience investigating security incidents and successfully leading incident response activities across cross functional teams and geographiesExperience bringing security designs and secure development practices into Agile development environments, QA teams, and Product, through implementation (MRDs, PRDs, coding style guides, user stories, technical specifications, verification and testing methods, etc.)Strong knowledge of secure application architectures, encryption technologies, cryptography and key management, authentication and control of application permissions, and implementation of sameKnowledge of network, VoIP and web related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, HTTPS, SIP, RTP) and security capabilitiesKnowledge of web, VoIP and mobile application development and programming languages including Java, C++, Objective C. Previous programming experience, and experience working with product managers, QA teams, and application developersSolid knowledge of various compliance and regulations for the protection of customer personal information and credit card information. (Examples include but are not limited to PII, PCI, and CPNI)Automation skills. Knowledge of powershell, python, packet analysisPeriodic travel requiredThis role participates in on-call rotations  Preferred Skills/Experience:Any combination of the following SANS GIAC Certifications:GCIA (GIAC Certified Intrusion Analyst)GCIH (GIAC Certified Incident Handler)GCFA (GIAC Certified Forensic Analyst)GNFA (GIAC Certified Network Forensic Analyst)GCFE (GIAC Forensic Examiner)GASF (GIAC Advanced Smartphone Forensics)GICA GCTI (GIAC Certified Cyber Threat Intelligence)GPEN (GIAC Certified Pentester)GWAPT (GIAC Certified Web Application Pentester)GPYC (GIAC Certified Python Coder)Experience using Qulays, Tripwire, Sourcefire, AlienVault, ELK, Hadoop, Tableau, HUE, Incapsula, Juniper (routers, firewalls, J-Flow), Syslog, packet capture, and Windows Event Log tools and infrastructureExperience with security laws and frameworks such as HIPAA, PCI-DSS, and othersKnowledge of current hacking techniques, malicious code trends, botnets, exploits, malware, DDoS, and data breach eventsExperience with operations and service quality management processes such as ITILExperience automating security tasks, including scripting, programming and/or SecDevOpsExperience working with global teamsExperience working with industry groups such as FIRST, NSIE, DSIE, and DNS-OARCAbility to thrive in start up environment. We want candidates with that entrepreneurial spark!        Now, a little more about us... We:   Are gurus at multi-tasking and work in a very fast-paced environment. Are a high energy with a great mix of experienced entrepreneurs, talented engineers, dynamic sales and operations and marketing professionals. We don’t do laundry or provide house-cleaning services as we promote work-life balance but we do stock the kitchen with complimentary beverages, snacks, and provide lunch and breakfast goodies. Provide a comprehensive benefits package including medical/dental coverage, 401K, and life insurance Are conveniently located off 101/280 and 92 in Belmont, CA.   The RingCentral environment is fast paced, high octane, success driven, team oriented, and is committed to growing the business in a virtually untapped market. We’re looking for awesome individuals like you to join us!     RingCentral is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Lead Data Analyst, Experimentation
description: The CompanyWant to be part of a fantastic and fun startup that’s revolutionizing the online travel advertising space? Want to join a data science team that's growing fast and making a big impact on the business? Come join us at Sojern!On the Deloitte Fast 500 for five years running, Sojern applies technology to the travel advertising space, delivering $10B in bookings for the thousands of hotel, airline, and cruise companies that make up our customer base.The TeamIt is an exciting time to join the data science team at Sojern: business is booming, and the team plays a key role in Sojern's mission by automating, analyzing, modeling, testing and optimizing the way we target potential travelers with the most relevant and timely travel ads.The RoleWe are looking for a data analyst with experience leading A/B testing efforts to: Develop a deep understanding of Sojern media products, optimization algorithms, and audience building techniques across programmatic display, video, native, SEM, facebook, and meta search. Work closely with product and operations teams to identify and prioritize performance optimization experiments and lead ideation, design and implementation of A/B tests. Own the backlog of experiments and communicate the test and learn roadmap along with key findings to leadership teams. Document, design, properly setup, and execute experiments within and across multiple digital advertising platforms to drive incremental performance. Analyze Sojern’s rich travel data sets using SQL and Python/R to help understand customer behavior, develop POV’s, motivate experiments, and drive decision-making. Be our go to expert on controlled experiments including power analysis and significance tests. Become a key part of our data science team, bridging our product goals and the science of controlled experiments. Requirements Demonstrated Project Leadership Experience -- You will drive multiple testing initiatives, prioritizing tests, planning next steps and taking business context into consideration Technical Proficiency -- SQL and one of Python/R are necessary. Experience with Tableau is a bonus. MS in CS/STEM or another Quantitative Discipline Excellent Communication Ability -- including experience with presenting experimental findings to leadership Collaborative Spirit -- Working with and influencing teammates, customers, and partners from different cultures and backgrounds to execute against shared goals Ad Tech or E-Commerce Experience -- 4+ years of experience with data science and controlled testing techniques as applied to Ad Tech or E-Commerce Test and Learn Mentality -- Leading A/B testing means that you’re open to everyone’s input, and letting the results of a well-crafted experiment inform next steps Company CultureAt Sojern, culture is king. We keep the stress low, the dress casual, and the work interesting. No one is counting your vacation days, we trust (and encourage!) our employees to take the time they need. We regularly eat out as a team, provide the hardware you’ll need, and otherwise let you dig in!Recognized on the Top Company Cultures list by Entrepreneur Magazine, Sojern is headquartered in San Francisco, with teams based in Dubai, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Mexico City, New York, Omaha, Paris, Singapore, and Sydney. For more information, visit www.sojern.com.

title: Senior Data Analytics Software Engineer
description: We are now looking for a Senior Deep Learning Data Analytics Engineer:NVIDIA is hiring senior engineers to scale up its AI infrastructure. You will need to have strong programming skills, a solid knowledge of traditional big data technologies, experience working with heterogeneous data types at scale, past experience collaborating with teams to understand and interpret their data, and excellent communication and planning skills. You and other specialists in this team will help advance NVIDIA's capacity to build and deploy leading solutions for a broad range of AI based applications such as autonomous vehicles, healthcare, virtual reality, graphics engines and visual computing.What You'll Be DoingCollaborate with AI infrastructure and deep learning teams to gain an in-depth understanding of their data and compute.Build and implement data mining and analytics pipelines to measure performance, trends, and targets for deep learning and AI infrastructure services.Programmatically compute complex data and smart analytics to help AI researchers and leaders make data driven decisions for data collection, data diversity, and training. What We Need To SeeYou have a BS or MS in Computer Architecture, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related data intensive Engineering Degree with 3+ years of relevant experience in big data analytics and technologies.Strong programming background that incorporates best practices like data structures, design patterns, OOP, and test drive development.Deep experience with big data analytics, ETL, data warehousing, and databases.Proven experience in collaborating with multiple teams to collect and process large amounts of data, building microservices and RESTful APIs.A solid technical foundation and experience in traditional big data technologies and databases (MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, Presto, Spark, AWS EMR, AWS S3, Cassandra, etc.).You possess strong programming skills in Python and scripting tasks (Bash, etc.) and are adept in using Linux and typical development tools.Highly motivated with strong interpersonal skills, you have the ability to work successfully with multi-functional teams, principles and architects and coordinate effectively across organizational boundaries and geographies.Ways To Stand Out From The CrowdAdvanced expertise in programming languages like C, Go, and Python.Knowledge of Hive, Presto, and Spark SQL, and other structured data search and query languages.Experience with Jupyter, Apache Zeppelin, and related visualization that help provide data insights.Strong understanding of Docker and orchestration systems such as Kubernetes.With highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, Nvidia is widely considered to be one of the technology industry's most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working with us and our engineering teams are growing fast in some of the hottest state of the art fields: Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Autonomous Vehicles. Are you a creative and autonomous computer scientist with a real passion for distributed systems and parallel computing? If so, we want to hear from you.NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.#deeplearning

title: Data Analyst (Pocket)
description: We’re looking for a passionate, driven, and experienced data analyst to work with our world-class Data & Analytics team.At Pocket we love what we do, but more importantly we are building something that millions of people love, too. Pocket has become essential to how people discover and consume content worthy of their time and attention on any device and on their own time. If you are passionate about using technology to improve people's lives, we believe Pocket has challenges in front of us that will excite you.With millions of people discovering and consuming content across the Pocket platform, our community generates one of the most unique and interesting sets of data on the web. Furthermore, Pocket’s small size will allow you to work on diverse analysis instead of being limited to supporting any one business group. If you are interested in applying your data analysis skills to help each and every one of Pocket’s teams make timely, data-driven decisions, then Pocket might be the place for you!We're a small team that has the resources of a large company (Pocket was acquired by Mozilla in 2017) and that means lots of opportunity to own projects from start to finish that have tremendous impact on hundreds of millions of users, across many different devices and platforms.Come work with us and make a big impact.What You’ll Do Conceptualize, build, and maintain dashboards and reports focusing on key metrics and experiments Collaborate with product, business, and engineering teams across Pocket to support their data needs and refine their understanding of it Explore and research data relating to key product and business metrics Create simple and elegant data visualizations designed to communicate insights clearly What You Already Have BA/BS in a quantitative field 2+ years of experience in data analysis or statistics/math Can demonstrate advanced SQL knowledge and are comfortable wrangling large data sets into easy to comprehend analysis and visualizations Experience with a data visualization tool (e.g. Mode Analytics/Chartio/Tableau) Enjoy communicating insights concisely, accurately, and meaningfully to a diverse audience Have a passion for helping anyone and everyone understand complex topics Any Python/R/Apache Spark experience considered a plus About PocketLearn more on our blog. To learn more about the Mozilla acquisition of Pocket, please visit our blog.Mozilla is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity throughout our recruiting and hiring process and is dedicated to growing diversity in our workplace.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst
description: Data AnalystTop 1 professional social media networking site is looking for the best candidate in data analysis areaLocation: Sunnyvale, CADuration: 6-month contract (highly possible to be extended to 18-month or even be converted to FTE)Our analytics team leverages big data to develop and deliver data-driven tools, metrics, insights, and ultimately drive the company’s monetization efforts. We’re looking for a creative and technical candidate who is passionate about mining big data, turning data into insights, and making an impact through creative storytelling and timely actions. This role will be focusing on product security areas.Responsibilities Create and automate reports and dashboards to track business metrics for Security areas ETL data, clean and validate data when needed Monitor trend metrics and quickly identify the root cause of an anomaly Analyze and draw insights from data and make recommendations based on the analysis Develop and improve predictive models to optimize user experience and operational efficiency Partner with cross-functional teams to lead or contribute to large-scale projects as well as ongoing operational activities Craft compelling stories, make logical recommendations, drive informed actions Perform Ad-hoc analytics tasks Required Skills And Experience Strong technical skills: Proficiency with SQL/relational databases (Teradata, Oracle etc.) Experience in data analysis in Hadoop/HDFS and Hive/Pig Experience with Python, JavaScript or other scripting languages, web development (a plus) Candidates must have a strong business mindset, logical thinking, and problem-solving skills Excellent communications skills are required. Candidate must be able to explain complex problems to a variety of audience. Candidate must be able to drive meetings, presentation, and lead discussions 1~3 years hands-on experience in business/data analytics A successful candidate needs to have a strong passion in analytics and curiosity to learn new skills in a fast-paced environment Preferred Skills Experience with Tableau or other visualization tools Advanced degree in quantitative fields - Computer Science, Engineering, Operational Research, Statistics, Economics, etc.

title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
description: Loot Crate was founded in 2012 around a simple idea: put the awesomeness of Comic-Con in a box. Today, we ship some of the coolest geek, gaming, and pop-culture collectibles and accessories to a subscriber base in the hundreds of thousands (with no signs of slowing down) making us one of the top subscription box services in the world! We’ve assembled an amazing team of passionate, ambitious, impossibly nerdy people who cultivate our amazing fan community, provide support of the highest caliber, and generally just sit there radiating niceness. We’re always on the lookout for fun, hard-working new people to join our team and make Loot Crate even better.The Business Intelligence Data Analyst will be an integral part of the Loot Crate team and will be responsible for analyzing and synthesizing data across all functions of the company. The BI analyst will work with Loot Crate's database architect to build out and populate Loot Crate's database and will support multiple departments in analyzing and synthesizing the data into a meaningful decision-making tool. This role will develop meaningful KPI reporting dashboards to support business unit decision-making and performance tracking and will also be asked to work on various ad-hoc analysis projects, develop conclusions supported by data and research, and present these findings to Loot Crate's executive team.Responsibilities Detailed analytics & reporting to support executive decisions and workflows Including gathering business requirements, project planning, implementing logical design and data modeling Perform statistical and other data analysis to inform decision making and drive continual improvements Reconcile data inconsistencies and ensure data integrity Work with team members from various departments to provide department-level advanced data analysis and reporting Work with web development team to ensure seamless new tool integrations and ensure continued data integrity Provide strategic recommendations for streamlining current reporting workflow Provide user training and support for Loot Crate's business intelligence software Requirements 2-5+ years of relevant experience Degree in Data Science, Business Intelligence or Information Management, Statistics, Business, Computer Science or a related field is preferred Experience analyzing large data sets Experience in e-commerce or retail is a strong plus Enthusiasm for gaming, pop culture, and anything geek a strong plus Proficiency in SQL preferred Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint Passion for analyzing large data sets, pattern recognition, and seeking better ways of doing things Strong organizational and time management skillsDetail oriented with good interpersonal skills and ability to work as an effective team member with a broad array of people from multiple departments Effective presentation and communications skills Excited to work in a fast-paced, rapidly growing business

title: Site Reliability Engineer (Data Analytics Company)
description: Our client is in the search for a Site Reliability Engineer to help scale the largest data analytics software in recent years. Our client is a data analytics company with VC-Backing from Google Venture amongst other big Sand Hill Road investors! They are in the search for an experience engineer who truly understands the SRE paradigm and is able to demonstrate a proven track record of working in a high available, high data traffic environment!   As the Site Reliability Engineer, you will be part of a small SRE team and you will be responsible for managing, scaling, and automating, production Kubernetes clusters. As an SRE will also be writing automation code for managing, expanding, measuring, pod operations, network configuration, node replacement. You will not be an operator, rather you will be an experience software engineer focused on operations. You will be conducting many activities such as deep diving troubleshooting around Kubernetes and Docker.   The Site Reliability Engineer will have extensive experience in the field automation and containerisation, amongst other highly sought-after skills/experience: You must have hands experience on Docker & Kubernetes production clusters. Making huge contributions in the Docker or Kubernetes open source community is a huge advantage! You must have strong development/automation skills and therefore, must be comfortable writing Python, Golang or Java code You must have in-depth understanding of the internals of Kubernetes cluster management, orchestration, networking, ingress, and Docker packaging!   If you are a highly experienced Site Reliability Engineer based in San Francisco and is looking for an onsite SRE role with an incredibly innovative start-up then apply today and a member of the Harrison Clarke team will be in touch!   By applying and submitting your resume, contact details and any other personal information, we will process your personal data in accordance with our Privacy Policy. For more information on our Privacy Policy, please click here: https://www.harrison-clarke.com/privacy-policy/

title: IT Business Analyst
description: The IT Business Analyst is crucial role in creating and maintaining the strategic partnership between business needs and technology delivery in a development environment. They will be responsible for developing business requirements and related business rules based on business group needs. The IT Business Analyst will work closely with business partners and subject matter experts in the definition, testing, training, implementation and support of functional requirements. They will identify requirements via industry standard analysis techniques such as data flow modeling, workflow analysis and functional decomposition analysis. The IT Business Analyst will solicit requirements through interviews, workshops, and/or existing systems, documentation or procedures.Major Duties and Responsibilities: Understands organization's projects.Assists in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.Understands the necessity of project standards and applies them consistently.Prioritizes multiple tasks effectively.Understands the appropriate for resolution.Perform tier 1 SAP support and escalate as needed.Proactively seeks opportunities to broaden and deepen knowledge base and proficiencies.Shares acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels.Anticipates needs before they arise and presents solutions to management that encompass issues at hand.Understands expectations that were set and recognizes when issues/events may affect delivery.Proactively initiates, develops, and maintains effective working relationships with team members.Demonstrates the ability to cooperate with a variety of people and achieve results.  Required QualificationsEducation:Bachelor's degree in a technology related field or other related field OR four (4) years experience in building and specifying mission title: Product Manager, Data and Analytics
description: At Blend, we’re dedicated to improving lending. We’re an enterprise technology company, and our product affects the most important purchase most people will make in their lifetime—their home. For homebuyers, our product means a clear, guided path to a new home. For lenders, it means modern, easy-to-use tools that automate repetitive tasks and let employees spend their time helping customers. By aligning and modernizing this archaic industry, we believe everybody wins. We need someone who’s driven to tackle hard problems—the harder the better. We’re motivated by the fact that our product won’t just affect the lives of a few people in the Bay Area—it affects people all over America, not to mention a foundational part of the U.S. economy. Founded in 2012 by former Palantir leaders, we’re currently backed by Greylock, Founders Fund, Andreessen Horowitz and other prominent investors. As a Data & Analytics Product Manager, you will lead the vision, strategy, and roadmap for Blend’s data infrastructure, reporting, and tools that empower every Blend employee and our customers to leverage data and measure success of their respective domain. You will be the lead advocate for the importance of data and foster a data-driven culture. You will be responsible for having a deep understanding of the key business drivers to Blend’s success and ensuring other Product Managers have the appropriate resources and tools to measure the impact of new feature launches and ongoing product health metrics. You will interface closely with Blend’s customers to understand their business needs and develop a roadmap to support external tools and reporting that gives them a deep level of understanding about their business.Blend is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity, inclusion, and belonging. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.ResponsibilitiesWorking closely with Blend’s Product Management, Client Operations, Customer Success, and Engineering teams to understand their needs, requirements, and goals to drive the Data & Analytics team’s vision, strategy, and roadmap Serve as the data and analytics domain expert, evangelizing data literacy and building a suite of tools to empower every Blend employee to make data-informed decisions Provide support and expertise to other Product Managers in defining KPIs and technical data requirements to ensure each new project launches with proper tracking enabling each team to measure success of their respective product Interface with Blend’s customers to understand their needs and synthesize requirements to build data and reporting tools that empower them to leverage data to drive success of their business Own the roadmap and priority of Blend’s data infrastructureRequirements5+ years of experience building analytical tools or data product as a Product Manager Experience working with SQL, business intelligence tools, A/B testing, and building data infrastructure on a large-scale consumer or SaaS product Ability to clearly define product and business KPIs in support of company goals and strategic outcomes Understanding of the technical architecture of data pipelines, warehousing and tracking systems Strong communication skills that build and foster cross-team collaboration and alignment on key outcomes and objectives Deep understanding and empathy for users Willingness to get your hands dirty conducting data analysis, building dashboards, and supporting internal and external data requests Nice to HavesPast experience working with Tableau or Apache Airflow Experience building and shipping data products powered by machine learning

title: IT Vendor Management
description: We are Farmers!Join a team of diverse professionals at Farmers to acquire skills on the job and apply your learned knowledge to future roles at Farmers. Farmers Insurance also offers extensive training opportunities through the award winning University of Farmers named by Training magazine amongst top 10 corporate training units in the world. Start your career at Farmers today!Job SummaryThe Supplier Operational Delivery & Performance Analyst is responsible for collecting and analyzing data related to services delivered from our Application, Infrastructure and Service-based Suppliers. The primary goals will be to evaluate the efficiency of Suppliers and assess the performance metrics and the resulting efficiencies. The Analyst will need to be familiar with the technical environment, which describes all of the services that are necessary to deliver services to Farmers. Additionally, the position assesses the Supplier’s compliance with contract terms & conditions, Service Level Agreements (SLA’s), Operational Level Agreements (OLA’s) and reports on the status of all deliverables at a tactical level.Essential Job Functions 60% Duties: Supplier Engagement Support IT technology Suppliers and contracts by assessing processes, policies and services performed Collaborate with managers and Suppliers to analyze performance metrics to support changes to IT and Business decisions Engage Business Management Team to ensure proper coding of invoices and generation of aging and accrual reports Engage Strategic Sourcing and Procurement department to ensure SOW’s and contract compliance Analyze contracts to determine total spend and ROI on Business Cases Gather data on Supplier health and strength in a Strategic Supplier Profile Produce ad-hoc Supplier reports Provide sourcing advisory and system support Actively analyze and recommend actions for supplier’s performance metricsSupports monthly reporting regarding all contracted services and uptime operational commitments. Supports yearly mapping exercise linking all processes to significant Infrastructure and application delivery items associated with the Managed Services SOW’s. Deliver audit report to OCIO for interpretation and discussion with Supplier associated at strategic level standards.35% Duties: Key Sourcing Metrics and Escalation Engage Suppliers to drive benefits based on Farmers requirements Aligning metrics, gaining convergence and thinking short-term and long-term goals Problem-solving and collaborating with different teams in engineering, analytics, and account management Build and improve processes that will improve data flow management Support audit reports delivered to the OCIO for interpretation and discussion with Supplier at strategic level standards. Gather data for analysis to drive recommendations on key Supplier performance as to time, quality, scope, budget, capacity and responsiveness from a tactical level. Gather data to assess appropriate key Supplier performance metrics at a tactical level in collaboration with the OCIO.5% Duties: Pursue Professional Development Maintain professional interactions with other IT Governance professionals. Continue ongoing education and certification programs. Continue engagement and attendance at industry seminars, conferences, etc. Governance, Information Technology Infrastructure Trends, Supplier Management and Insurance. Performance Management and Career Development / TrainingPhysical ActionsRequired job duties are essentially sedentary work consisting of occasional walking, standing and lifting and/or carrying 10 lbs. maximum, and seeing.Physical EnvironmentRequired job duties are normally performed in a climate controlled office environment.Education RequirementsBA degree in Business Administration or BS degree in IT (or relevant work experience) preferredExperience RequirementsThree to five years of experience managing Supplier contracts Three to five years in finance and accounting or other similar fiscal assessment position preferred One to three years of experience in IT or supporting and IT organization. Must be familiar with the technical environment, which de scribes all of the services that are necessary to deliver services to Farmers.Special Skill RequirementExcellent verbal and written communication skillsFarmers is an equal opportunity employer, committed to the strength of a diverse workforce.]]>Primary LocationUnited States-California-Woodland HillsOrganizationFarmers InsuranceJobInformation TechnologyScheduleFull-timeJob Posting05/23/18

title: Data Analyst
description: At Mojio, we’re connecting the cars of today for the journeys of tomorrow. Backed by leading investors including Amazon and Deutsche Telekom, Mojio is driving the global adoption of its connected car technology via its growing portfolio of mobile network operator customers, including T-Mobile in the US, Austria and Czech Republic, Bell, Rogers and Telus in Canada, and Telekom Deutschland in Germany. With more than 7 billion miles worth of real-world driving data, we have created one of the largest and fastest-growing big data pools in the automotive industry. If you’re interested in joining us on our mission to give every vehicle a voice, apply now!Who you areYou have data-driven mindset and are passionate about deriving interesting facts from massive amount of data using analytical skills and tools to drive engineering decisions. You should be capable of building solutions that provide actionable inferences from field data sets & ability to communicate it to a wide audience. The role requires ability to collaborate with multiple teams and identifying new opportunities to take on emerging engineering challenges.Education DetailsBachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Operation Research, Software Engineering or equivalent from top accredited universities.Key Qualifications2-5 years of experience in a mixture of data analyst work and software engineeringExperience querying SQL and NoSQL databases such as SQL Server, MongoDb, ElasticSearch, and DocumentDbExperience working with one of the Cloud Service providers such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud PlatformExperience in software development methodologies and working knowledge in Scala/Python and/or any other programming languages (C#, Java, R, C/C++)Experience with analytical tools supporting data evaluation and report creation, as well as querying large, complex data setsDemonstrated track record of creating and building complex evaluation tools for assessing/tracking product performance and learning associated user behaviors.Familiarity with Spark/Hadoop or similar frameworks.Flexibility and comfort working on a dynamic, fast-growing effort with minimal documentation and process.Aptitude to deal with ambiguity, and enthusiasm to help solve difficult issuesAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, gender identity, social orientation, nor on the basis of disability. Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.

title: Product Analytics
description: At its core, Addepar is a data company. We’re building interoperability and transparency across hundreds of financial systems, and creating more powerful and robust financial applications on top of that platform. Addepar’s platform aggregates data from largest financial institutions in the world and provides design-driven web-based software for wealth advisors, asset managers, and financial institutions. Addepar handles all types of assets in any currency so investors and advisors can better understand their clients' portfolios and have a clearer financial picture at every level, all in one place. With scalable and customizable reporting, financial managers can visualize and communicate relevant portfolio analyses and performance metrics to anyone who needs it. Addepar has offices in Silicon Valley, New York and Salt Lake City.The product analytics function at Addepar is responsible for empowering data driven decision-making to enhance its product offerings. This includes a full end-to-end product analytics cycle from product concept ideation, to tracking and launching, and to validation of how the product improves client lifetime value. We influence the core decision making of each product development step.As a analyst / sr analyst / manager of product analytics, you are responsible for the analytics of one of the product areas. You will interact directly with key stakeholders, understand business needs and form your own analytics framework, analyze data, communicate findings, and ultimately influence product decisions. In this role you will have the opportunity to interact with different functional areas within the business, dive deep into product usage data, and influence decision-making in a fast-paced, high-growth FinTech company.A successful candidate has a track record of providing analytics solutions that impact product and business decisions, which include product and marketing analytics. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are capable of self-direction.ResponsibilitiesPartner with product managers in formulate success measurement and socialize them.Own the monitoring of product/launch performance and proactively communicate findings.Work closely with product engineers in data tracking setup.Work closely with data warehouse engineers in data pipeline optimization.Perform exploratory data analysis with the goal of finding product improvement features that can drive additional value for clients.Prioritize analysis resources and set expectations with partner team based on broader business priorities.Partner with product, engineering, and business teams to help shape the future of data-driven decision-making at Addepar.RequirementsExceptional analytical, problem solving and communication skills.3+ years of experience in analytics, data warehousing, or related role.Experience with SQL/relational databases.Experience using Python to process and analyze data.Experience with analytical/BI tools supporting data analysis, reporting, and visualization.BS or above degrees in quantitative fields - Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics or related fields.At Addepar, we rely on a range of backgrounds, experiences, and ideas. We value diversity, and we’re proud to be an inclusive, equal opportunity workplace.

title: SAN FRANCISCO Campus Recruiting 2018 - I&D - Data Analyst
description: About CapgeminiWith more than 190,000 people, Capgemini is present in over 40 countries and celebrates its 50th Anniversary year in 2017. A global leader in consulting, technology and outsourcing services, the Group reported 2016 global revenues of EUR 12.5 billion (about $13.8 billion USD at 2016 average rate). Together with its clients, Capgemini creates and delivers business, technology and digital solutions that fit their needs, enabling them to achieve innovation and competitiveness. A deeply multicultural organization, Capgemini has developed its own way of working, the Collaborative Business ExperienceTM , and draws on Rightshore� , its worldwide delivery model.Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com .Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory or environmental demands may be referenced in an attempt to communicate the manner in which this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, Capgemini will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship.ResponsibilitiesAs part of the Capgemini Technology Services Group, this person will be responsible for the full systems lifecycle from requirements gathering through implementation of data analysis solutions. This person will work closely with our clients and must demonstrate professional knowledge to ensure that the work products and deliverables are of the highest caliber to ensure client satisfaction. This person will also apply subject matter expertise to identify, develop, and implement techniques to improve engagement productivity, increase efficiencies, mitigate risks, resolve issues, and optimize cost savings and efficiencies for each client.Click the following link for more information on your rights as an Applicant :http://www.capgemini.com/resources/equal-employment-opportunity-is-the-law JobProgrammer/AnalystScheduleFull-timePrimary LocationUS-CA-San FranciscoOrganizationI AND D US(Includes Data Modeler, Data Miner.) Responsible for importing, cleaning, transforming, validating and modeling data with the purpose of understanding and drawing conclusions from data (may be presented in charts, graphs, and/or tables). Also, design and develop relational databases for collecting and storing data and build and design data input and data collection mechanisms.Required Skills And ExperienceYou are responsible for data related activities such as data extraction, profiling, cleansing, de-duplication, standardization, conversion, transformation and loading, data mining, warehousing, archiving and reporting. Responsible for all activities required to ensure optimum performance and data integrity of databases in production environments, in line with the requirements. Responsible for providing support of server based databases in development and test environments including database software installation, database creation, performance and capacity design, backup and recovery design, security design, providing Analytical feedback as appropriate. Qualifications: 1-4 years experience, Bachelor’s Degree. Should have progressing skills in Software Engineering Techniques, Software Engineering Architecture, Software Engineering Lifecycle and Data Management. Should have baseline skills in Business Analysis, Business Knowledge, Software Engineering Leadership, Architecture Knowledge and Technical Solution Design.

title: Data Visualization Specialist - Consultant (Tableau or Alteryx) - San Francisco, CA
description: Do YOU have a passion for working with Data? Do you love working in machine learning, real-time analytics, or Big Data? Interested in learning and utilizing different technologies without limitation? We are looking for a Data Expert that will help our clients evaluate and implement big data and advanced analytics solutions in the Cloud and on-premise. At Clarity Insights, we specialize in providing Data & Analytics expertise that result in real and measurable business outcomes. We are passionate about data, problem solving and driving value to make a difference with our clients.Clarity Insights is the largest independent professional services firm focused exclusively on data analytics solutions. Our Data Visualization Practice is expanding and looking to develop in multiple US Regions. Clarity’s Delivery Practices have one vision: to drive better business outcomes through data and analytics. We provide data analytics advisory consulting services. We believe that nothing sells like great delivery, and are committed to our people and client delivery excellence. With continuing, aggressive growth plans for the next five years, Clarity is seeking outstanding data analytics leaders to successfully qualify, propose, close and lead client solution delivery.As a Data Visualization Specialist at Clarity Insights, you would be responsible for exceeding client expectations through superior implementation, delivery and management of technology products and solutions.What will I be doing everyday?Responsible for collaborating with the business analyst to develop business requirements and translating requirements into a technical solutionAnalyze and defines tasks, data flows, and dependenciesDevelop and maintain advanced reporting, analytics, dashboards and other BI solutions using Tableau and/or AlteryxResponsible for identifying and communicating design and scope issues to the stakeholdersConduct design reviews and oversee QA functions for the information delivery applications, including ensuring that system and integration test plans are developed and executedCreate other technical deliverable artifacts needed for project implementationDevelop and delivers knowledge transfer to the clientBasic Qualifications2+ years of background developing Data Visualization solutions using Tableau and/or AlteryxExcellent client interaction, problem solving & communication skillsUnderstanding of data modeling techniquesExperience working with relational databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Netezza, Teradata) is requiredExperience using Tableau and/or Alteryx for the creation of dashboards, standard reports and ad-hoc reportsExperience working with multiple disparate data sources in Tableau and/or AlteryxExperience with advanced Tableau and Alteryx topics such as complex calculations, table calculations, parameters, geographic mapping, and performance optimizationFamiliar with Data Visualization best practicesTravel to the client on a weekly basis is required. Normal weekly schedule is M-TH travel to client location (U.S. based)Preferred QualificationsStrong experience writing complex SQL Experience implementing Data Visualization solutions using HadoopWhy Clarity Insights, Why Consulting and Why Now?We don’t try to be everything to everybody all the time. We specialize in Data & Analytics and will remain a platform and tool agnostic company so you can grow technically throughout your career. It sounds ridiculous but you actually need to be 100% technical and 100% business with strategy because we don’t hire non-communicative robots who have a one size fits all approach. We often could speak to a CFO or Head of Underwriting about a business or finance problem, and based on the need for real-time and affordable scalability, we can outline – in terms they can understand – why they should think about a cloud solution for big data and analytics. If we step across to the DevOps lab, we can easily pick up on a conversation about Apache committers, OSF, full stack development, microservices, containers and much more. We’re not trying to boil the ocean. We want to grow from 400 people to 1700 people in 4 years to take the market an accessible set of consulting skills. We have a lot of fun together. Most people join here and stay here for the people. That said, we are popular so we do rack up some travel miles. I have a million things to share about why that may change and why that must stay the same for now, but here’s a suggestion – if you LOVE Cloud Computing for Big Data and/or Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, etc we should talk.Clarity Solution Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We believe in treating each employee and applicant for employment fairly and with dignity.GLDR

title: Senior Data Analyst (Customer Experience)

title: Market Research Business Analyst
description: Refer your friends for a referral bonus, using this link . HELPING OUR CLIENT GROW GREAT BRANDSMarket Research Analyst Los Angeles, California As a Market Research Analyst at Kantar Millward Brown, you’ll leverage your expertise and our best-in-class study solutions to provide business insights that matter to our clients. Our client management team is seeking an insights pro to partner across teams to translate data into compelling stories, manage account project activities, and nurture relationships with our clients through day-to-day interaction. This is an incredible growth opportunity, to build your capabilities in research and position yourself for expanded career opportunities. Kantar Millward Brown is a leading global research agency specialising in advertising effectiveness, strategic communication, media and digital, and brand equity research. The company helps clients grow great brands through comprehensive research-based qualitative and quantitative solutions. Kantar Millward Brown operates in more than 55 countries and is part of WPP’s Kantar group, one of the world’s leading data, insight and consultancy companies. Learn more at www.millwardbrown.com.KEY OUTCOMESAs Market Research Analyst, Your Responsibilities Will IncludeProject Management.Manage account activities, partnering across departments to ensure smooth delivery. Activities include: logic checking deliverables, creating shells for analysis, invoicing, uploading database forms, managing timelines, ad hoc requestsInsights Delivery.Craft compelling stories, working with your account lead to translate data into insights that address key client business issues.Client Management.Interacting with clients on a day-to-day basis, professionally responding to client needs, questions, solving business problems that drive client satisfaction.CAPABILITIESTo Succeed In This Role, You’ll Need3+ years’ experience in a quantitative research role where you’ve interacted directly with clients.Proven ability to use logical reasoning and excellent communication skills (verbal and written) to create data-driven insights for clients.Experience using basic quantitative analytical techniques such as regression and factor analysis.A flair for nurturing and building relationships with clients and internal stakeholders.Natural curiosity, a can-do attitude and comfort with ambiguity.Strong detail-orientation with ability to manage multiple work streams.JOIN USAt Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

title: Research Data Analyst 3
description: DescriptionServes as contributor to the design of the Computational Cancer Analysis Laboratory (CCAL) environment and software platform and infrastructure including software strategies, software development processes and resources with a high degree of autonomy. Provides leadership and direct participation as representative in high-level center-wide or nation-wide research collaborations.Serves as lead contributor in the design of our next-generation Precision Medicine paradigm involving multi-omics data. Develops advanced computational algorithms for analyzing cancer omics data. Mentors, guides, and fosters undergraduate and graduate students learning about computational cancer biology and participating in group activities.Minimum Qualifications A Bachelor's Degree in related area; and/or equivalent experience/training.A minimum of three (3+) years or more of relevant experience.Thorough skills associated with statistical analysis and systems programming. Demonstrated skills in project management. Proven research skills at a level to evaluate alternate solutions and develop recommendations. Skills to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner both verbally and in writing. Proven experience with statistical and data management programming (R, Python, C, Jupyter) and the use of statistical software for database management, quality assurance and data analysis. Thorough knowledge of oncology and/or genomics terminology. Thorough knowledge of methods applicable to clinical, epidemiological investigation. Demonstrated experience conducting quantitative research. Experience and a proven track record of successful application of a broad range of statistical data analysis methods, including generalized linear and additive models, mixed effects models and other multivariate methods, network analysis techniques, Bayesian methods, power and sample size calculation, statistical methods for genomics and sequence analysis (including next generation sequencing platforms). SPECIAL CONDITIONSEmployment is subject to a criminal background check.

title: Senior BI Data Analyst
description: Warner Bros. Technology Data Intelligence Department seeks a Senior Business Intelligence Data Analyst for the Data Analytics and Visualization team. The Data Analytics and Visualization team is responsible for collecting, aggregating, analyzing and reporting across all media data. Our goal is to provide insights and enable data driven decisions to our Warner Bros. Theatrical, Television, Home Entertainment, Digital Networking Groups, DC Entertainment and Corporate divisions.What part will you play?As a Senior BI Data Analyst , you will serve as a key liaison with business clients to support their reporting and analytic needs . You will require hands-on experience working in large scale business intelligence and data platforms. You will be working with business clients and vendors to gather requirements, prototype, architect, test, and deliver high quality Business Intelligence solutions. You will be executing test plans, performing quality reviews, supporting operations in an agile environment.You instill confidence in the solutions you deliver and ensure that the insights provided are accurate, reliable, and easy to digest at all levels. You will work directly with the WB Data Engineering Team to deliver holistic solutions against our many Data Warehouses and our Big Data Platforms.It’s essential the analyst has passion for data and can continuously understand and anticipate the growing business needs, identify areas to where complexity can be reduced, proactively introduce new ideas that help improve process efficiency and leverage data to improve effectiveness across our platforms and business units.The successful candidate is an innovative individual who can see beyond the obvious, think broadly and looks for opportunities to collaborate with the Business units and internal Technology Solutions Team members. BUSINESS ENABLEMENT – Work with business users from all levels to elaborate and document business requirements, priorities. Define key performance indicators (KPI), and deliver BI solutions. Participate in project estimation process with cost-benefit analysis. Partner with the Data Engineering Team for developing and delivering solutions. Work with business and development teams to design, and document dashboards, alerts, and reports.BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE APPLICATONS – Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources. Maintain the data asset catalog. Work with ETL development team to develop, understand and interpret logical and physical data models. Design security and access restriction for the database and Business Intelligence environment and manage upgrades and maintenance as needed.PRODUCTION SUPPORTS and VENDOR MANAGEMENT - Coordinate with the business users during project implementations and continue to function as a key point of contact for future analytics and data questions and issues. Oversee the ongoing development and operations of the business intelligence applications. Oversee and monitor work of 3 rd party support organization, provide technical review and direction to developers. Ensure business users questions and issues are resolved in a timely fashion. Conduct audits with data warehouse to ensure accuracy of information. Keep management, project managers, team members and business stakeholders informed of critical issues, project status and system status.APPLY AND SET STANDARD – Recommend and enforce Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence standards, best practices and architecture for enterprise data warehouse, data marts and analytical applications systems. Lead knowledge management and coordinate the development of necessary project documentation.RESEARCH - Identify and provide input to new technology opportunities that will have an impact on the Enterprise wide BI systems. Apply your learnings to what you build. Rapidly deliver on concepts through prototypes that can be presented for feedback.TRAINING - Develop training materials. Educate and train users, including executives, to transform data into action oriented information and help others be successful stewards of our tools. Enable everyone at Warner Bros. to be an analyst through the Self-Service BI model. What do we require from you? Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Business Management or specialized training/certification. Or equivalent work experience.6+ years of relevant experience:Delivering business intelligence solutions.In-depth knowledge of the Media & Entertainment industry and multiple business functional areas is a plus.Working with large scale Enterprise Data Warehouse such as Teradata, Redshift, Oracle and/or SQL Server databases.Demonstrable skills building business intelligence and advanced analytics solutions.Working in an Agile development environment.Research product and technical data in order to recommend products, technologies, and processes for ongoing projects.Expert in Tableau Data Visualization tool.Able to design, build, maintain & deploy complex reports in Tableau.Experience integrating Tableau into another application or native platforms is a plus.Expertise in Data Visualization including effective communication, appropriate chart types, and best practices.Proven ability to deliver business intelligence solutions in a fast-paced environment.Strong background in data relationships, modeling, semantic layer and mining.Proficient in data wrangling languages such as SQL or Python.Experience with Redshift, Teradata or other parallel database.Experience working with complex and large volumes of data.Experience with Hive, Spark, Scala is a plus.Experience with R and/or SAS is a plus.

title: Senior MDM/Data Warehouse Analyst
description: SummaryThe MDM/Data Warehouse Analyst ensures consistency of strategic shared data and information to improve data quality, accessibility and security of master data and relevant transactional data within the Commercial organization. This position requires extensive collaboration within Sales Operations, as well as with cross-functional colleagues in Marketing, Market Access, Sales, Finance and Compliance.ResponsibilitiesContribute to the creation, maintenance and enforcement of master data management policies, processes and procedures.Ensure resources are available for data management activities.Collaborate with business units to identify and acquire new strategic data sources.Lead and manage external relationships with vendors, consultants and commercial partners in efforts to create data standards and business rules, creating and maintaining consistent reference data, master data definitions and critical data elements.Ensure consensus in identifying data elements associated with common business terminology, researching sources, definitions, and managing them within the master repository as the enterprise source of record.Publish relevant data to appropriate users in the organization, and monitor the published data sources for usage, relevance and quality.Collaborate with Legal and Compliance to ensure published data meets all applicable legal and compliance requirements.Ensure available data and information assets meet customer needs.Create and manage business metadata for published data sources to ensure that it is easily discoverable, and meaningful to data users.Maintain the integrity, quality and completeness of master data with responsibility for collecting, evaluating and appropriately resolving issues and problems with data; prioritize and communicate issues to impacted individuals.Ensure data documentation is properly developed and maintained.Be an active advocate of data management.Endorse good data management practices, use them, and share them.Meet established key milestones related to assigned major projects.Manage vendors and resources to provide support of business intelligence, data quality, and data management systems and applications.Manage data from specialty pharmacies, wholesalers and other distributors.Support sales operations processes such as alignment, roster and incentive compensation.Quality, accuracy, timeliness, accessibility and security of master data within the Commercial organization based in part on feedback from key customers and cross-functional colleagues. QualificationsB.S. Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or similar subject.7+ years of relevant work experience, including a minimum of 3 years of project and/or people management.Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively interact with all levels of staff including senior management.Demonstrated working knowledge and understanding of pharmaceutical sales data (e.g. IMS Health, Symphony Healthcare Analytics, etc.), marketing and sales operations, financial data, business principles, processes and technology.Demonstrated working knowledge of healthcare organization landscape, relationships and affiliations, etc.Working knowledge of data modeling and various database applications (e.g. Netezza, Oracle).Demonstrated proficiency in writing SQL queries to answer business questions.Demonstrated working knowledge of pharmaceutical industry legal and compliance restrictions as they relate to the handling and publishing of data sources, i.e. HIPAA, AMA PDRP, etc.Demonstrated working knowledge of document management software tools.Background in Data Warehouse Architecture, Business Intelligence and ETL.Demonstrated ability to understand data architectures and systems and effectively communicate issues, nuances and impacts to a non-technical audience.Demonstrated extensive computer proficiency with desktop software in a Windows environment including Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel (VBA) and Microsoft PowerPoint.Demonstrated excellence with organizational, planning and cross-functional project management, written and verbal communication, and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail, personal initiative and ability to work independently in a dynamic fast paced environment with minimal supervision.Demonstrated ability to proactively evaluate existing strategies and recommend changes, when appropriate.

title: Business Operations Analyst
description: About UsAppDynamics is the Application Intelligence company. With AppDynamics, enterprises have real-time insights into application performance, user performance and business performance so they can move faster in an increasingly sophisticated, software-driven world. Our integrated suite of products is built on our innovative, enterprise-grade App iQ Platform that enables our customers to make faster decisions that enhance customer engagement and improve operational and business performance. AppDynamics is uniquely positioned to enable enterprises to accelerate their digital transformations by actively monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing complex application environments at scale which has led to proven success and trust with the Global 2000.About The RoleAs a growing business operations team, we are looking for someone who will play a key role in defining and shaping how our team interacts with functions throughout the company. We work with senior leaders in areas such as Sales, Marketing, Engineering, Product, Customer Success to identify key business issues and work to solve them using data and analytics. An ideal candidate will be able to lead every stage of an engagement from requirements gathering, project management, data integration and preparation, analysis, visualization, and presentation. This role is a high-impact, high-visibility role that will help foster a data-driven culture throughout the organization.About YouYou love data. You consider yourself a ‘full-stack’ analyst that can guide an initiative or analysis from start to finish. You understand that it’s necessary to put in the work up front to build validated, scalable data pipes to reap the analytical benefits later. You are a self-starter that can be highly productive with minimal oversight on a day-to- day basis. You excel at collaborating with partners, corralling resources, distilling complex issues into structured problems, managing priorities, and delivering results. Most importantly, you have a positive attitude and are motivated to work hard in a dynamic environment.ResponsibilitiesIdentify key metrics and build dashboards to track progressCreate automated processes to clean, analyze, and report dataPerform analytical deep-dives to generate insights and solve business issuesPartner with teams across the company to set and manage shifting prioritiesTranslate business needs into requirements for new data integrations and common data assetsDevelop project plans and roadmaps to support strategic initiativesEnable data-driven decision-making at all levels of the companyExperience And Skill RequirementsBS / BA in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics or similar quantitative field(5+ for Sr. Bus Ops Analyst 2+ for Bus. Ops Analyst) years solving business problems in Sales, Product, or Customer Success (e.g., product/feature usage, customer behavior analysis, web analytics)Proven record of developing and analyzing complex data sets using SQL or similar toolsExperience using business intelligence tools such as Tableau, GoodData, or LookerProven interpersonal and project management skills, with the ability to take on multiple projects with contending prioritiesStrong written and verbal communication skills, including experience delivering insights to senior-level executivesAbility to automate tasks or prototype a solution in a scripting language like Python or R a plusPerksAboutWe know that the award-winning culture at AppDynamics is something to brag about, but here are more reasons that make you excited to get out of bed to come in the morning, likeJust a noteNote to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: AppDynamics does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. AppDynamics will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of AppDynamics.AppDynamics is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other unlawful factor. AppDynamics complies with all applicable laws, including those regarding consideration of qualified applicants with criminal histories (such as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance). If your disability makes it difficult for you to use this site, please contact talent@appdynamics.com. AppDynamics participates in E-Verify.

Collaborates by providing data and analytics that contributes to alignment of strategic planning, budgeting, program review, and assessment to support achievement of institutional goals, and contributes the WSCUC accreditation process.QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, the applicant must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. creating impactful presentations  Experience with UAT  Ability to write moderately complex SQL queries  Benefits: Medical and DentalVision  FSA & Aflac Benefits  Paid Vacation  Paid Holidays  *Sponsorship not available. *Local candidates only.
