title: Solutions Architect
description: About: Primer In the News Fortune - http://fortune.com/2017/10/24/walmart-ai-startup-primer/ Axios - https://lnkd.in/gaHQzuA The Role: Solution Architect A Solutions Architect will have the unique role of leveraging their engineering skills to solve individual customer problems. You will regularly engage with customers in both pre-sales and post-sales fashion to scope and prototype the solution, lead the implementation/deployment, and address obstacles that might hinder them from being successful with the product. Using your ability to detect problems before they happen, and size-up new technical concepts quickly, you will enable customers to understand and experience the value of the product.   To succeed in this role, you need to enjoy problem solving, especially in new environments where you don’t have all the context. You should be curious enough about your work, not settling for “good enough”, but instead “is there a better way to do this?” Having a background in site reliability or devops will be an asset to you in working in this role. Strong people skills are also important as you will be working closely with customers.     The organization: Solutions Architecture Primer is an artificial intelligence company that organizes and analyzes text-based data sources, and generates analyst-grade natural language summaries for a variety of industries. Our objective is to help our customers understand the world around them -- whether it is emerging geopolitical events, development of a product line or area of research, or monitoring a portfolio of companies’ financial performances. The Solutions Architecture team is a jack-of-all-trades organization that serves as the interface between the customers and the company. Our charter is: (1) scope and deploy Primer’s suite of NLP/NLG solutions to our customers; (2) prototype new technologies and concepts to meet the needs of the customer; (3) maintain our current customer relationships and seek opportunities to improve customer usage and satisfaction; and (4) channel customer feedback and usage patterns back to Primer to drive future product development. Responsibilities: Support the ideation and implementation of solutions and feature sets for the customers, partner with Primer’s product and engineering organizations to create and deliver. Act as a full-stack everything: data scientist, engineer, and customer liaison for Primer. Partner with product and engineers at Primer to identify and prioritize new feature and algorithmic development based on customer engagement and feedback. Build ways to analyze and understand customer engagement and product performance through modeling and data visualization.   Requirements: BS or MS in computer science, engineering, or other quantitative field. 5-7+ years of professional experience in the areas of developing and deploying enterprise software solutions, solutions architecture, and customer implementation. 3-5 years experience with DevOps / SRE technologies and best practices. 3-5 experience with the major cloud providers such as AWS, GCE, Azure. Experience with Docker and Elastic stack Understanding of security practices such as PCI, SOX, FedRAMP. Ability to communicate effectively to diverse audiences with strong written and verbal skills. Ability to learn quickly, maintain positive attitude under pressure, and have fun all at the same time! Ability to think about solutions from a customer perspective, establish conceptual connections between requirements and solutions. Excellent communication skills – you will be the face of Primer to customers’ organizations.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Req ID 18467Experience Level ProfessionalOther Location(s) N/ARelocation offered YesTravel required NoneCome grow with usAt Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous.Full Time Associate HighlightsCompensation We target the upper quartile of the market for total cash compensation, including base salary and bonuses. We also take a pay-for-performance approach, rewarding each associate commensurate with their contribution to the organization.Benefits In addition to health, life, and retirement benefits starting from day-one, you will have access to a wealth of additional benefits, ranging from tuition assistance to ample paid time off.Professional Development We provide guidance on specific topics that you and your manager can discuss during your monthly one-on-one meetings that are completely tailored to you as an individual. Our Data Strategy and Operations team is focused on implementing and evolving Capital Group's investment data strategy to enable the full range of business objectives; data for minimizing risk, data for efficient processes, and data for growth and innovation. It also delivers a set of capabilities to source, automate, and curate data assets to enable and enrich core investment and distribution processes, quantitative analytics, reporting and analysis, and advanced analytic efforts such as artificial intelligence.As a Senior Data Solutions Analyst based in Los Angeles, you will serve as an investment management data expert. You will provide direction to Analysts and Associates and assist them in completing their assignments. You will participate in the training and development of other associates and serve as a positive role model and mentor.ResponsibilitiesProvide guidance on prioritizing data requirements within a business unitEvaluate new and alternative data sources and new integration techniquesContribute to data models and designs for the data warehouseWork with complex data structures and provide innovative ways to solution for complex data delivery requirementsPrototype complex reporting and/or data visualization solutions in partnership with IT and other business unitsEstablish standards for documentation and ensure your team adheres to those standardsInfluence and develop a thorough understanding of standards and best practices used by your teamQualifications5+ years of experience with business intelligence, analytics, reporting, and data transformation Demonstrated experience in translating unstructured business problems into clearly defined requirements frameworkBachelor's degree requiredAdvanced knowledge of SQLAdvanced knowledge technical and functional designs for databases, ETL, data warehousing, and reportingAdvanced knowledge scripting tools for automation such as R, Python, Alteryx, etc.Advanced knowledge with reporting/data visualization tools such as Tableau, SSRS, etc.Company OverviewFounded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.39 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers.We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Clinical Data Analyst
description: OverviewWe are currently searching for an experienced Clinical Data Analyst to join a well-known client’s team located East Bay, California. The Clinical Data Analyst will works collaboratively with clinical project team staff to meet project deliverables and timelines for clinical data acquisition, quality checking and reporting.Responsibilities Implement the data management portions of clinical research projects Review study protocols and assist site coordinators, investigators, and field clinical staff in collecting data to meet the protocol requirements in a timely manner Identify, track, and resolve queries Utilize reports to track study progress and ensure timeliness and quality expectations are met Ensures completeness, correctness and consistency of clinical data and data structure Support project teams for assigned projects Support DM Lead in reviewing eCRF design, user acceptance testing, release and maintenance Support team in data review, and monitoring of data management documents and activities Support team to achieve data reconciliation, database lock and final reporting Support medical coding and review Coordinate resolution of team level data management issues Assist other Data Management staff with operational tasks on other studies as appropriate Perform other tasks as assigned by ManagerEXPERIENCE Minimum of 5 years of relevant data management experience in biotech or pharmaceutical industry (CRO experience included)Experience as data manager/analyst/reviewer Experience with coding medical terms preferred CRO management experience or data management experience at a CRO preferred Experience with Electronic Data Capture - Medidata Rave experience preferred Knowledge of FDA regulatory requirements/GCP guidance Computer proficiency and technical aptitude with the ability to use Microsoft products Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment with associates Capability of effective planning and priority setting Ability to manage several complex projects simultaneously while working under pressure to meet deadlines Excellent communication and organization skills Ability to work independently and in team environment Strong attention to detail Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)EDUCATION Bachelor's degree in Sciences (Biology, Computer/Statistics, etc.). Life Sciences preferred. Without degree, additional related experience is requiredTo be a best-fit your strengths must include Strong Communicator. You will have extensive correspondence that relies on you being conversant in regulatory guidelines and clinical terminology.Organized. You’re an efficient time-manager and can handle the pressure of meeting multiple strict deadlines.Ability to work independently and with a team: You will be collaborating and often contributing to discussions amongst internal teams; you also work effectively without a lot of support or structure.Problem-Solvers. As an action-oriented self-starter, you’re eager to apply your expertise in diagnosing inefficiencies, determining root causes, and recommending solutions to complex challenges. Personable. You establish and nurture highly effective relationships with colleagues and key stakeholders that support and advance project goals and objectives.Credible. Thorough understanding of clinical methodologies and providing sound analytical support, you quickly establish credibility as a reliable resource.About Advanced ClinicalAdvanced Clinical is an award-winning clinical development organization that provides global services including CRO, Functional Support, Quality & Validation, Patient Recruitment and Retention, and Strategic Talent Acquisition solutions for pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device organizations. Our mission is to deliver a truly better clinical experience for our clients and candidates. To learn more about Advanced Clinical which has been named to Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces, Chicago’s Best and Brightest Companies, and Best of Staffing Talent & Client, visit http://www.advancedclinical.com. Regarding your applicationPlease know that every completed application is carefully reviewed by the Advanced Clinical recruitment team. We understand the time commitment that is needed to prepare an application, so we respect your effort by thoughtfully reviewing and responding to each application. In return, we ask for your patience as careful review takes time, and we may not be able to respond to every application immediately.It is Advanced Group’s practice not to discriminate against any employee or applicant because of sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation or sexual preference, pregnancy or maternity, genetic information, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law. If you have a disability or handicap and would like us to accommodate you in any reasonable way, please inform your recruiter so that we can discuss the appropriate alternatives available.

title: Senior Marketing Analyst
description: About Bill.comBill.com is the leading business payments network, with 3 million members paying and getting paid over $52 billion per year.  Bill.com saves companies more than 50% of the time typically spent on financial back-office operations and helps businesses get paid 3 - 4 times faster by automating end-to-end payment processes.  The company is the choice of 4 of the top 10 U.S. banks; leading accounting software providers QuickBooks Online and Xero; and over 50 percent of the top 100 U.S. accounting firms.  It is the only business payments solution endorsed by the American Institute of CPAs (AICPA). The recipient of more than 70 awards, Bill.com proudly received multiple PC Magazine's Editor's Choice Awards and CEO René Lacerte was recently recognized as an E&Y Entrepreneur of the Year.  Mission:We are looking for a passionate Marketing Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Marketing Analyst will gather, organize, aggregate and analyze large sets of data from multiple sources and report on marketing results - including, website user behavior, digital campaign results, A/B testing insights, and marketing channel results relative to financial plan.  The Senior Marketing Analyst will develop corporate dashboards, compile performance metrics, make recommendations based upon the data, and present the information in a clear and concise manner to senior management. Additionally, the role will help drive operating and strategic decisions through financial modeling, reporting, and ad hoc analyses.  This position will report to the VP of Marketing. The position collaborates with colleagues on the extended marketing, sales, product management, finance and business teams.Professional Experience/Background to be successful in this role:Minimum Education, Experience & Training Equivalent to:Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration with concentration in: Information Management, Finance, Marketing, OperationsMinimum 5-7 years of business intelligence analyticsKnowledge of statistics, statistical analytical, and data analysis tools (e.g. SPSS, SQL)Proven experience in building dashboards and implementing new reporting systemsKnowledge of and experience with reporting query tools and databases, website analytics, including analyzing A/B tests, referring traffic sources, and driving optimization insights and recommendations Prior experience helping recommend and helping drive implementation of new reporting databases and dashboardsQualifications (Skills & Abilities):Outstanding written and verbal communication skills and high level of comfort presenting analysis and information to business colleagues and executivesExperience with experimental design and statistical data analysis, with a drive toward actionable insights not just dataExperience in 1 or more data-focused marketing channels with a focus on customer acquisitionExpert in MS Excel and MS PowerpointExperience creating reports with the following tools: SalesForce, MixPanel, Google Analytics, Marketo, DatoramaRequired:Salesforce, Google AnalyticsHighly desirable: Datorama, Mixpanel, Marketo Exceptional problem solving and analytical skills, in particular, understanding of website and digital media optimization; strong attention to detailAbility to manage multiple tasks against deadlines and adapt to a changing and fast-paced environmentPassion, energy and enthusiasm to drive results with a team-oriented approach; must be self-motivated and proactiveExpected Outcomes:Create and implement business reports to track business results and progress, while providing data driven business insights and recommendations to optimize and improve resultsDevelop, compile and maintain a marketing reporting dashboard and supporting analysesLeverage data and trends to develop forecasts and fiscal year budget planningWork with technical team to establish website user behaviour and segmentation tracking requirements to support analysis of website conversion results and product engagement funnelsSupport implementation and analysis of website tests (A/B and multivariate) and drivers of user engagement and trial conversionsDevelop and provide ongoing ad hoc business reporting to marketing channels owners using data mining and data query techniques as neededCompile data from 3rd party platforms and other tools such as SQL, Marketo, and SalesforcePartner with System and Data analysts across the organization to implement data collection systems/tools, data definitions and processes that optimize data quality and reporting efficiency; document data flows and user guidelines; troubleshoot and resolve data reporting issues Contribute to organization-wide initiatives as a marketing subject area expertIdentify opportunities for improvement in business processes and toolsSupport ongoing analysis and monitoring of business performanceBill.com Culture:Humble – No egoFun –  Celebrate the momentsAuthentic – We are who we arePassionate – Love what you do   Dedicated – To each other and the customer

title: Insights Analyst
description: This position is responsible for gathering direct and indirect data, analyzing the data and subsequently providing recommendations based on the data analysis. The incumbent in this position will identify and quantify opportunities to improve the customer experience, increase customer loyalty, and engrain customer centricity into all business decisions. The Insights Analyst will support aspects of VOC research studies, will be responsible for ad hoc customer data analysis, and will collaborate with other Customer Experience team members to support active projects.How You Will Make An ImpactAssists with the customer insights process from survey design to implementation to analysis and reporting. Supports the approach of providing insightful and actionable recommendations for improvements based on VOC feedback and business metrics. Assists with the tracking/reporting of data on a daily, weekly, monthly basis to assess campaign performance and recommend related strategies. Translates results from data into clear and actionable insights that are relevant to business goals. Researches and recommends what additional data should be tracked in order to establish actionable customer experience metrics that represent what matters most to Delta customers. Ensures that customer insights are disseminated, understood, and used as the basis for development and enhancements of innovative products and services. Working with the Manager, Customer Experience, measures improvements resulting from those enhancements.Partners with data provision and technology teams to determine primary and secondary data sources to enhance analysis, takeaways, and targeting. Assesses trends and insights using multiple data sets and large amounts of data; synthesizes direct and indirect data into a cohesive, actionable story for internal teams.What We're Looking ForBA or BS is required. Graduate level degree is a plus. BA/BA + minimum of 2 years in consumer research studies or Graduate degree + a minimum of 1 year experience in research studies is required.Prior work experience in data analysis and systems and demonstrate a fundamental knowledge of the technology involved to operate these systems. Experience using web analytics tools to gather insights help guide development teams on best tools and methods to implement and use to gather insights. Experience with Google Analytics. Experience with programming, data mining, or visualization programs such as Tableau, Qualtrics, SPSS, and text analytics packages. Experience with SQL a plus.Benefits & Perks12 days starting vacation plus 11 holidays and your birthday off!100% paid for medical option, dental and vision.Onsite gym and or gym discount and fitness incentive.Flexible work arrangements.Culture of learning: Substantial tuition reimbursement to improve your skills.Career growth: We love promoting from within. Strong commitment to work/life balance. Technology allowance.Social responsibility and volunteer opportunities.If you think this sounds like you, let’s chat. We would love to tell you more!ABOUT Delta DentalAs the first company to specialize in dental insurance, we are passionate about oral health and its importance to future generations. Our core purpose is the advancement of oral health care to our customers, partners and consumers through dental insurance programs and philanthropic efforts.We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation’s largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.Delta Dental provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Delta Dental complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Senior Manager, Product Data Management / PLM - Advanced Technology
description: The purpose of this role is to lead the development, implementation and continuous improvement of strategies to standardize processes, policies and systems for effectively and efficiently managing Product Data from product conception to retirement, and to lead and manage a team of Business Analysts dedicated to the improvement of business processes and systems.Essential Job FunctionsProvide thought leadership and direct Business Analysts who are engaged in servicing internal customers such as R&D, Manufacturing Engineering, Global Supply Chain, Quality and Regulatory. Establish and maintain product data standards, processes, procedures and policies for Edwards. Design, develop and implement processes to ensure compliance to standards. Ensure continuous improvement and compliance of Product Data Management processes (Ex. ECR process, Product Development Workflow, Administrative Change Notice, Design Control and Design History File management, etc.). Develop and implemented new processes and capabilities to transform how product data are created, edited, deleted and obsolesced. Partner with CAD Engineering, PCS, IT and other cross-functional SMEs to ensure new capabilities are seamless across the value chain. Create awareness, illustrate best-practice processes to manage product data and influence SMEs, Managers/Sr. Mgrs./Directors, Sr. Directors, VPs and others to embrace and evangelize “data centric” vs. “document centric” product data management. Lead, empower, motivate and build a high performing Business Analyst team. Develop talent necessary to transform product data management and support growth.Manage project and/or departmental budget, forecasting and reconciliation.Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Required Education/Skills/ExperienceA BS in Engineering, preferably Mechanical, Bio-Medical, Industrial or Manufacturing or relevant experience.A Master’s in Engineering and/or MBA would be a plus.12+ years of experience in R&D, Manufacturing Engineering, Quality or Document Control in the medical device (preferred), aerospace or automotive industry. Hands-on experience working in New Product Introduction (NPI) and Design Transfer from R&D to Manufacturing highly desirable.Experience in business process improvement utilizing process improvement methodologies such as Lean principles, Six Sigma, SIPOC, DMAIC, etc. Green Belt and/or Black Belt certified would be a plus.Experience developing business cases, justify and prioritize investments.Experience with product data management (PDM), product lifecycle Management (PLM) and enterprise resource planning (ERP) tools is a plus.Exceptional communication skills with the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations.The ability to act as liaison conveying information needs of the business to IT for business processes and work flow automation.Strong analytical, problems solving, situational analysis and decision making abilities.Team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward direction that is best for Edwards.Must be able to independently (without much supervisor direction), develop alternative solutions to solve both strategic and operational business challenges, recommend solutions and create stakeholder buy-in and team alignment.About EdwardsEdwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world's leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs over 10,000 individuals worldwide.For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it's our life's work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life. Edwards is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.Job FunctionOperationsPrimary LocationUSA-USA-California - Irvine

title: Data Analytics Instructor
description: Are you an experienced data analyst who is passionate about education and making an impact? Do you love empowering others to find life-changing opportunities? Then this may be the position for you!We Have Hired More Than 900 Instructors And Teaching Assistants To Support Our Students, And Along The Way, We Have Never Changed Our Model For The Experiences That Define a Successful InstructorAt Trilogy Education Services, we create innovative programs to train new audiences for careers in the digital economy. Our programs have been in existence since October 2015, and since that first class, we've launched an additional 300 classes across the nation. Tutoring TA Mentor Coaching a little league Volunteering (for literally anything) Meetups (running your own or attending one) Publishing an article Conducting guitar lessons (or any instrument) Theater Experience Stand-up Comedy You'll notice above that prior teaching experience isn't a prerequisite for success as an Instructor. If you bring knowledge, strong communication, and a positive energy to the classroom, you're going to help students along their transformative path to a successful and rewarding career.We'll provide the guidance, training, lesson plans, and tools to support you on your journey of impacting lives in the classroom.Check out the program details here.Must HavesSkills & Requirements At least 5 years of experience recommended Bachelor's Degree Tech Skills Python Pandas Matplotlib Beautiful Soup HTML5 CSS3 D3 Leaflet SQL, noSQL Tableau Machine Learning, Hadoop What You Will Do Follow detailed lesson plans that are taught in classrooms across the country Support students individually as they go through an emotional roller coaster Infuse empathy, support, and encouragement into all educational materials you create Logistics 24-week program Mon/Wed/Sat OR Tue/Thu/Sat Schedule Weekday Classes: 5:45 - 10pm (includes office hours and break) Saturday Classes: 9:30 - 2:30pm (includes office hours and lunch break) Other Perks Maintain your current career while teaching Nonstop learning Plenty of room for advancement Ongoing training and a culture of investing in employee growth University .edu email address (discounts!)

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Loot Crate was founded in 2012 around a simple idea: put the awesomeness of Comic-Con in a box. Today, we ship some of the coolest geek, gaming, and pop-culture collectibles and accessories to a subscriber base in the hundreds of thousands (with no signs of slowing down) making us one of the top subscription box services in the world! We have assembled an amazing team of passionate, ambitious, impossibly nerdy people who cultivate our amazing fan community, provide support of the highest caliber, and generally just sit there in radiating niceness. We are always on the lookout for fun, hard-working new people to join our team and make Loot Crate even better.As the Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for providing analysis to the Growth team so that they can make better informed business decisions in improving the experience and the conversion of the Loot Crate website. Through your efforts, the growth managers will gain a better understanding of the performance of their growth initiatives. To thrive in this position, you must focus on solving the business problem at hand through data and analysis.Responsibilities Provide timely reports and analysis to the growth managers Become a Loot Crate data subject matter expert Provide feedback of initiatives taken by growth managers Success Factors An integral partner for the marketing team Subject matter expert in growth management data Consistent improvement in conversion analysis Qualifications 5+ years of relevant experience working with data and relational databases Degree in business, mathematics, statistics, or engineering Natural curiosity in business and solving problems through data

title: Financial Systems & Data Analyst
description: Position OverviewSLAC National Accelerator Laboratory Controller's Office seeks a highly motivated Financial Systems & Data Analyst to support our PeopleSoft Financial, SAP Concur travel and expense management, and Timekeeping systems. Reporting to the Finance Systems Business Analyst Team Lead, this position is also expected to collaborate with business process owners and IT development teams to resolve system issues, participate/contribute to project planning, system testing, and enhancements and liaise with external vendors or partners in support of business systems.In addition to core duties, specific responsibilities include the following: Provide expertise in PeopleSoft Financial systems including various core modules, data tables, and reporting tools. Perform complex query and data analysis for supporting key deliverables in the Controller's Office. Create and execute test plans and test scripts. Prevent data integrity issues and provide report assistance to users. Assist the Controller's Office with other reporting requirements, as needed. Develop, maintain and present key performance indicators and other metrics by extracting relevant data pulls, summarizations, comparisons, and analysis to ensure business processes are efficient and streamlined. Conduct in-depth qualitative and quantitative analysis to solve problems, make recommendations to discover new approaches or applications.Job PurposeSpecify requirements and/or design solutions for business information systems and incorporate new technical systems to improve work-flow, production, efficiency and effectiveness. May serve as project lead.CORE DUTIES*: Translate business processes into system requirements and/or development of systems solutions. Analyze new business requirements; assist with feasibility of enhancement requests, system functionality, current system use and user needs. Specify functional analysis and design and work with developers and analysts to recommend solutions and resolve system issues. Review, research and evaluate software to determine its usefulness and appropriateness as related to existing or proposed business systems; assist or develop preliminary and detailed system design documentation. Perform testing of new systems, upgrades and patching of existing systems; plan, conduct and document results of testing. Develop instructional materials, training and job aids. Advise users requiring assistance in solving complex problems or issues regarding management and business systems. Analyze data and provide data sets to users for analysis. May include development of operational and analytical reports for end users. Liaise with external vendors or partners in support of business systems, which may include system development, implementation and/or operations. Coordinate the implementation of new or modified business systems. - Other duties may also be assignedMinimum RequirementsEducation & Experience:Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, Information Systems, and minimum five years relevant experience including: PeopleSoft 9.2 (Proficiency in AP, AR, AM, Contracts, Billing, Project Costing & GL) Data analysis to include development of KPIs and metrics.Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Knowledge of, computer system capabilities, business processes, and workflow. Experience with enterprise applications and understanding of database driven applications. Strong understanding of the software development life cycle. Knowledge of principles and techniques used in conducting management studies and in systems analysis. Current knowledge of rapidly changing computer technology. Skill in conducting interviews and facilitating group meetings. Skill in developing and conducting training programs. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to bridge functional and technical resources by communicating effectively with individuals of varying systems expertise and business needs. Strong listening, negotiation and conflict resolution skills. Ability to design and document complex business systems. Proven problem solving and analytical thinking and ability to approach problems logically and systematically.Certifications And LicensesNoneSLAC Employee Competencies Effective Decisions: Uses job knowledge and solid judgment to make quality decisions in a timely manner. Self-Development: Pursues a variety of venues and opportunities to continue learning and developing. Dependability: Can be counted on to deliver results with a sense of personal responsibility for expected outcomes. Initiative: Pursues work and interactions proactively with optimism, positive energy, and motivation to move things forward. Adaptability: Flexes as needed when change occurs, maintains an open outlook while adjusting and accommodating changes. Communication: Ensures effective information flow to various audiences and creates and delivers clear, appropriate written, spoken, presented messages. Relationships: Builds relationships to foster trust, collaboration, and a positive climate to achieve common goals.Job-Specific Competencies Resilient: Ability to work calmly and effectively in pressure situations, self-directed and tenacious in resolving issues and questions without prompting. Tech Savvy: Comfortable learning and adopting new technologies. Optimizes Work Processes: Strong organizational skills and detail oriented, understanding that capturing and reporting data accurately can impact others.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*: Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks. Frequently sit, grasp lightly/fine manipulation. Occasionally stand/walk, use a telephone. Rarely writing by hand, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds. - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of the job.Working Conditions Work extended hours.Work Standards Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations. Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for environment, safety and security; communicates related concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned. Meets the applicable roles and responsibilities as described in the ESH Manual, Chapter 1—General Policy and Responsibilities: http://www-group.slac.stanford.edu/esh/eshmanual/pdfs/ESHch01.pdf Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer and supports diversity in the workplace. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital or family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. All staff at SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory must be able to demonstrate the legal right to work in the United States. SLAC is an E-Verify employer.Final candidates are subject to background checks prior to commencement of employment at the SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory.Internal candidates, who are selected for hire, may require degree verification and/or credit checks based on requirements of the new position.For Clery Act Information click here: http://www.stanford.edu/group/SUDPS/safety-report/security-authorities.shtmlSDL2017

title: Risk Operations, Senior Associate
description: Instacart is building the best way for people anywhere in the world to shop for groceries. Since Instacart started in 2012, we’ve launched same-day delivery in over 200 markets across North America, currently serving more than 65% of US households and aiming for 80% by the end of 2018! We are laser focused on delivering groceries to our customers from their favorite stores in as little as an hour. This is an extremely difficult problem to master, but we are making it happen with a combination of technology and operational expertise. Our platform is extremely complex and scaling rapidly, processing millions of transactions in real-time each day. We solve incredibly difficult problems to create an experience for our customers, shoppers, and partners that is absolutely magical.Are you passionate about uncovering unusual patterns? Do you find it exciting to dig into data to get to the root of these patterns and problems? As a Senior Associate on our Risk Operations team, you will do both to identify the areas of greatest impact to Instacart’s user experience and financials as it relates to customer and shopper transactions. You will be responsible for defining, executing and optimizing day to day processes & policies intended to mitigate these issues in an effort maintain a safe and stable platform for all users. Each day you will need to make critical & sensitive decisions, acting quickly while always maintaining strong attention to detail. It’s important to appreciate that you will be operating in a very dynamic environment which requires always having an eye towards improvement.Responsibilities Develop deep subject matter expertise in fraud and other key indicators that may result in potential vulnerability/risk on the Instacart platform Understands our risk systems and supports analysis that surfaces patterns, trends, and bugs that help inform our fraud policies and processes while directly impacting the business Effectively communicate analysis & findings through analytical and reporting frameworks that includes recommendations for next steps Investigate complex situations and potential fraud Investigate scammers, scrapers and fraud cases and while recognizing fraudulent/suspicious trends Create & maintain detailed documentation of operational procedures Optimize supporting processes through multiple iterations, helping to standardize to the point of near-automation Work cross functionally on analyzing risk associated with new products, marketplaces, and payment methods Skills Ability to analyze large sets of data to drive business decisions, policies, processes and strategy around risk mitigation Advanced Excel & SQL skills are a must Strong risk and fraud domain knowledge/intuition Detail Oriented - you do your due diligence when completing a task whether it’s one-off analysis, an ongoing investigation, or a broader project Ability to learn and adapt to new technologies Ability to multi-task, organize and work with rapidly changing priorities – you will support multiple high impact initiatives that help mitigate any risks we encounter Solid judgment and a strong moral compass with expert written and verbal communication skills Ability to independently lead small scale projects or initiatives that impact your team Experience Bachelor's Degree or equivalent (economics, math) 2-5 years of applicable experience, (financial analysis, e-commerce, payments, fraud / risk, management consulting, or data-driven project management) Interest and ability to self-serve, investigate, and get the data required to make quick and effective decisions Organized execution-oriented operator & analyst with a mindset of continuous improvement Understanding and empathetic to the challenges of setting up a new business. Strong communication and writing skills with attention to detail, grammar, brand tone, and voice Positive attitude and fortitude to work through ever-changing and dynamic operational conditions A sense of humor -- our work is serious, but we have fun doing it! Benefits Talented and collaborative coworkers who will both push and support you Market competitive salary, equity Medical, dental, vision benefits and 401(k) retirement plan Take what you need vacation (and we really mean it) 16 weeks maternity leave / 8 weeks paternity leave so you can truly bond with your child Free lunch and dinner in the office; fully stocked kitchen and snack pantry Complimentary Instacart Express membership (free Instacart delivery!) Resources

title: Human Resources Data Analyst
description: Education Required: Skills Required: If you are a versatile, flexible, organized professional who enjoys analyzing data and developing solutions; if you have a passion for detail and accuracy; if you have the willingness to enthusiastically work within constantly changing priorities and want to join a great Company, we’re looking for a Human Resources Professional to join our team. As an integral part of the Corporate Human Resources Team, the ideal candidate will support various functions throughout HR, primarily in the areas of data analysis and record administration.Skills/Experience Required Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel and WordStrong sense of organization with a passion for detail and accuracyCapable of exercising discretion with sensitive informationExperience supporting day-to-day delivery of HR services and responding to general employee questions related to company policies and procedures.A positive and proactive attitudeExcellent written and verbal communication skillsFlexibility, versatility, and willingness to enthusiastically work with constantly changing prioritiesA minimum of three years directly relevant experience in Human ResourcesBachelor’s degree preferredExperience with databases and large data sets preferredProficiency with social media tools preferred Responsibilities: This position will play an important role that impacts business operations across the Company. The successful candidate will be responsible for a broad variety of tasks, including, but not limited to:Analyzing data related to our recruiting processes, updating job postings on various external websites, recommending strategies and generating content for social media outlets, identifying internal and external recruitment trends and recommending solutionsAssisting with various reporting requirements, research projects, and special projectsCreating, updating, and filing employee records including Company HRIS and employee personnel filesAssisting with day to day HR administrationProviding support to other Corporate Headquarters staffParticipating as needed to support Company events Benefits: We offer competitive salaries commensurate with education and experience. We have an excellent benefits package that includes: Comprehensive health, dental, life, long and short term disability insurance100% Company funded Retirement PlansGenerous vacation, holiday and sick pay plansTuition assistanceTecolote Research is a private, employee-owned corporation where people are our primary resource. Our investments in technology and training give our employees the tools to ensure our clients are provided the solutions they need, and our very high employee retention rate and stable workforce is an added value to our customers. Apply now to connect with a company that invests in you.

title: Data Visualization Specialist - Consultant (Tableau or Alteryx) - San Diego, CA
description: Do YOU have a passion for working with Data? Do you love working in machine learning, real-time analytics, or Big Data? Interested in learning and utilizing different technologies without limitation? We are looking for a Data Expert that will help our clients evaluate and implement big data and advanced analytics solutions in the Cloud and on-premise. At Clarity Insights, we specialize in providing Data & Analytics expertise that result in real and measurable business outcomes. We are passionate about data, problem solving and driving value to make a difference with our clients.Clarity Insights is the largest independent professional services firm focused exclusively on data analytics solutions. Our Data Visualization Practice is expanding and looking to develop in multiple US Regions. Clarity’s Delivery Practices have one vision: to drive better business outcomes through data and analytics. We provide data analytics advisory consulting services. We believe that nothing sells like great delivery, and are committed to our people and client delivery excellence. With continuing, aggressive growth plans for the next five years, Clarity is seeking outstanding data analytics leaders to successfully qualify, propose, close and lead client solution delivery.As a Data Visualization Specialist at Clarity Insights, you would be responsible for exceeding client expectations through superior implementation, delivery and management of technology products and solutions.What will I be doing everyday?Responsible for collaborating with the business analyst to develop business requirements and translating requirements into a technical solutionAnalyze and defines tasks, data flows, and dependenciesDevelop and maintain advanced reporting, analytics, dashboards and other BI solutions using Tableau and/or AlteryxResponsible for identifying and communicating design and scope issues to the stakeholdersConduct design reviews and oversee QA functions for the information delivery applications, including ensuring that system and integration test plans are developed and executedCreate other technical deliverable artifacts needed for project implementationDevelop and delivers knowledge transfer to the clientBasic Qualifications2+ years of background developing Data Visualization solutions using Tableau and/or AlteryxExcellent client interaction, problem solving & communication skillsUnderstanding of data modeling techniquesExperience working with relational databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Netezza, Teradata) is requiredExperience using Tableau and/or Alteryx for the creation of dashboards, standard reports and ad-hoc reportsExperience working with multiple disparate data sources in Tableau and/or AlteryxExperience with advanced Tableau and Alteryx topics such as complex calculations, table calculations, parameters, geographic mapping, and performance optimizationFamiliar with Data Visualization best practicesTravel to the client on a weekly basis is required. Normal weekly schedule is M-TH travel to client location (U.S. based)Preferred QualificationsStrong experience writing complex SQL Experience implementing Data Visualization solutions using HadoopWhy Clarity Insights, Why Consulting and Why Now?We don’t try to be everything to everybody all the time. We specialize in Data & Analytics and will remain a platform and tool agnostic company so you can grow technically throughout your career. It sounds ridiculous but you actually need to be 100% technical and 100% business with strategy because we don’t hire non-communicative robots who have a one size fits all approach. We often could speak to a CFO or Head of Underwriting about a business or finance problem, and based on the need for real-time and affordable scalability, we can outline – in terms they can understand – why they should think about a cloud solution for big data and analytics. If we step across to the DevOps lab, we can easily pick up on a conversation about Apache committers, OSF, full stack development, microservices, containers and much more. We’re not trying to boil the ocean. We want to grow from 400 people to 1700 people in 4 years to take the market an accessible set of consulting skills. We have a lot of fun together. Most people join here and stay here for the people. That said, we are popular so we do rack up some travel miles. I have a million things to share about why that may change and why that must stay the same for now, but here’s a suggestion – if you LOVE Cloud Computing for Big Data and/or Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, etc we should talk.Clarity Solution Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We believe in treating each employee and applicant for employment fairly and with dignity.GLDR

title: Senior Mobile Data Analyst
description: The TeamThe Professional Services team delivers premium services that deepen the value of App Annie core platform offerings. We solve client-specific mobile business challenges with premium services such as: insights, analyses and reports, advisory and integration services.The PositionAs a Sr. Mobile Analyst, you will work closely with clients to deliver actionable insights and recommendations by understanding customer challenges and applying App Annie’s world-renowned mobile market data combined with the latest mobile industry trends.In 2017, on average, consumers spent nearly 3 hours a day in apps on their phone. Furthermore, consumers typically download 3 new apps and use 40 different apps each month. Apps are becoming a critical channel for brands to: directly engage with customers and deliver more personalized experiences; drive sales; and, deliver superior customer service. Join the company that is helping some of the world’s biggest brands transform their business through apps.You will Work collaboratively with the client to uncover customer needs and challenges. Conduct research and analysis by combining App Annie’s data with that from external sources and deep knowledge of the mobile landscape to uncover actionable insights and recommendations that addresses customer challenges. Deliver customized reports and presentations to clients. Clearly communicate and present findings and recommendations to clients. You Have BA/BS degree or equivalent experience 1+ years experience as a mobile data analyst or consultant. Ideally 2+ years of data consulting experience. Proficient with SQL, Excel and Powerpoint. Experience with advanced tools like R and Python are a plus, but not required. Strong analytical, quantitative and research skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze, create, and present insights from data analysis to client stakeholders and executives. Intellectual curiosity and deep interest in the app, mobile, and tech space. Resourcefulness to find relevant and credible external information on your own. Manage overlapping projects and deadlines within a dynamic, challenging work environment. Strong collaborator who works well cross-functionally across multiple teams. Ability to think on your feet and handle challenging questions in a meeting environment. Motivated self-starter who’s always to looking to improve. Fully fluent in speaking, reading, and writing English. Skills in other languages a plus. What do we offer?Competitive compensation. All the tech tools you need to succeed: a new smartphone and Mac laptop. Catered lunches Monday through Thursday, snacks, fruit, good coffee and other stuff to help you get through the day. A 401(K) plan to help you plan for your future. Great health, dental and vision insurance packages to fit your needs to ensure you’re happy and healthy. A yearly fitness stipend that will keep you up and moving. Commuter benefits that make getting to and from work a breeze. Employee referral bonuses so you’ll get the opportunity to work with friends (and get some extra cash in your pocket!). About App AnnieApp Annie delivers the most trusted app market data and insights for your business to succeed in the global app economy. Over 1 million registered members rely on App Annie to better understand the app market, their businesses and the opportunities around them. The company is headquartered in San Francisco with 450 employees across 15 global offices. App Annie has received $157 million in financing, including from investors such as Sequoia Capital, Institutional Venture Partners, IDG Capital Partners, e.ventures, Greenspring Associates, and Greycroft Partners.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
company: Care1st Health Plan - Yes, its all about you.
description: General Summary: The position works as part of the Care1st Financial Planning and Analysis team as the Markets Finance liaison to Corporate Finance and works diligently with internal departments, Actuarial, & Markets Finance LOB teams to ensure timely and accurate reporting, forecasting, and analysis.   The Senior Financial Analyst will prepare, analyze and review finance and accounting data, transactions and reports, including ad hoc requests from various departments and projects. This role will be heavily involved in the annual budgeting process and periodic forecasts.  In addition the Analyst will collaborate on projects with other departments to analyze, model, and quantify various initiatives for management review and decision making.   Essential Functions and Key Responsibilities (in descending order of importance):   % of TimeResponsibility 25Works with the Manager of Financial Planning and Analysis to create and implement the annual budgeting process and quarterly re-forecasting process including a calendar, templates and guidelines for departments to use. Develop financial models; collect and evaluate data, analyze results. May gather, analyze, prepare and summarize recommendations for financial plans.   25Performs technical analysis to determine present and future financial performance. Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts. Design and produce analyses/reports for department and/or management. Summarizes and presents complex financial information to senior management. 15Produce performance reports on Medi-Cal and Medicare LOBs, modeling of reimbursement rates, evaluation of financial contract modifications and compiling and monitoring key managed care statistics. 10Develops, interprets and implements financial concepts for financial planning and control 10May perform economic research and studies in the areas of revenue/expense, depreciations, working capital requirements, investment opportunities, investment performance and impact of contractual agreements. 5May summarize detailed revenue/expense data compare summarized claim data against fee schedules and contracts. 5Research and prepare evaluations on a variety of projects/problems (financial, statistical, operational and cost/benefit analyses). 5Follow and conduct audit processes and review internal controls to ensure financial transactions are accurate, timely and comply with accounting standards, principles and company policy.     Minimum and Preferred Qualifications: Typical education and experience required and preferred, including licensing requirements, special training and certifications.   Experience: 5-10 years financial planning and analysis experience. Experience in managed care strongly desired. Healthcare industry experience a plus.   Education: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or a related field   License/Certification/Special Training: N/A   Skills/Abilities:   Demonstrates specialized depth and/or breadth of financial analysis and strong working knowledge of related disciplines   Contributes to the development of new concepts and techniques. Recognized as a technical expert across the company , Prior health plan experience strongly preferred/required   Expertise in administrative planning, forecasting, and variance analysis   Ability to provide creative ideas about how to reduce administrative costs   Ability to use computers and related software applications with comprehensive knowledge of process/report automation, manipulation of large datasets, and data extraction using various software and accounting/financial systems. Role Essentials: Advanced proficiencies in Microsoft Office Excel, PowerPoint, Access, and Word. Role Desirables: Oracle Hyperion Essbase, Hyperion Planning, and PL/SQL Developer. Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).   Ability to lead a number of results-oriented project teams to successful completion within designated timeframes   Ability to develop complex models to evaluate financial impact and levels of risk associated with strategic alternatives   Ability to professionally interact and communicate with employees at all levels, as well as external contacts   Ability to work with internal business partners to provide information, respond to questions, and to resolve complex problems and issues   < > May provide work direction to lower level employees in discipline

title: Sr Business Analyst
description: Sr Business AnalystAccount Manager - Glas LLCCompany InformationGlas, LLCwww.glasvapor.comGlas, LLC is an extremely fast growing, manufacturing company in a high growth segment of the electronic cigarette industry. The company and brand are highly regarded and considered one of the leaders in high quality luxury devices and premium e-liquid.Over the course of the last two years, we have developed excellent manufacturing capabilities and an extremely vast domestic and international distribution network of brick-and-mortar stores and online retailers.Keys to Glas-Branded Success - Our PhilosophyA-List Players & Fierce Company CultureWe hire for talent and train for expertise. We love our company, our whole team does, and it shows in the finished product and the service we provide to every single customer and end-user.Best-in-Class SystemsFrom CRM to AI Marketing Platforms, we use some of the best systems in the world to drive our business and the results speak for themselves in terms of service rate and product availability.Data-Driven DecisionsWith a focus on market analytics and business intelligence, everything we do is based on quality research and highly-targeted, accurate data. It shows in the product and flavor development and in our territory-specific product launch strategies.Our Guiding Principles Collaboration: Leverage collective genius Leadership: The courage to shape a better future Quality: What we do, we do well! Deliver a WOW experience Stay focused & always do what you say you’re going to do Open and honest communication Be passionate and determined Be adventurous, creative, and open minded Think long term Committed to Greatness Celebrate Success!Role And ResponsibilitiesAs a consumer centric company, our ability to analyze data, forecast, and create accurate financial models are a top priority here at Glas. We are looking for a Sr Business Analyst to help us review current business and forecasting models, and creating financial models for new company initiatives, including market-specific product launches and strategic partnership viability.This role requires the ability to lead high impact, high visibility work and to go both broad and deep simultaneously.The candidate will work across all areas of the organization, including Sales & Marketing, Finance, Operations, & Supply Chains to accumulate, assimilate, and parse data, creating models and forecasts, and helping to create efficiencies company-wide. Key takeaways from analysis will include analytical insights on customer, product, sales, & marketing trends. The candidate will assist in help estimating the end-to-end impact of sales & marketing decisions, and manufacturing and supply chain changes. Someone who enjoys understanding and improving business processes and systems is ideal.Core Activities Will IncludeAnalyzing financial data and creating financial models for new products and business segmentsGrow financial performance through analysis of financial results, forecasts, variances, and trends.Reporting on financial performance and create recommendations to be presented to executivesCreating financial reports, forecasting, and operational tracking metricsAnalyzing past results, identifying trends, and make recommendations for improvementsWork closely with the accounting team to ensure accurate financial reporting and decision supportEvaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecastsRecommend actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; study proposed changes in methods and materialsIdentifying and driving process improvements, including creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools and Excel dashboardsIncreasing productivity by developing automated reporting/forecasting toolsMarket research, data mining, business intelligence, and valuation compsPersonal And Professional Qualifications3+ years of business finance or other relevant experience5-10 years overall work experienceHigh proficiency with financial modeling and techniquesStrong fluency with Excel formulas and functionsBA, BS or B.Com degree required (Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance/Economics)Strong analytical and data gathering skillsGood business acumenOutstanding structured and critical thinking skills and a passion for understanding complex issues with a data driven approachSolid communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionallyInnate drive to get things done and improve business outcomesGlas LLC was founded in Los Angeles in January of 2014 and is now one of the premiere e-cigarette hardware and e-liquid companies around the world in a high growth segment of the consumer products industry. We represent the very best of our industry, following a set of core values: a commitment to excellence, innovation, passion, and integrity - all of which has driven Glas to become an internationally recognizable, award-winning brand.Our sales & marketing office is located in West Los Angeles, with our manufacturing base here in Southern California, and distribution points all over the world. Our products are sold in 15+ countries and over 3,500 stores worldwide. Our brand is highly regarded with a strong reputation for producing incredible products thanks to our exquisite hardware, incredible flavors, iconic packaging, and unparalleled customer service.

title: Data Analytics Manager
description: Manager, Product Data AnalyticsOverviewBlue Shield of California is looking for an experienced individual to manage the Product Data Analytics team in our Product Strategy group to support development of Blue Shield of California’s product analytics and reporting capabilities. Under general supervision of the Director, Product Strategy, the Manager, Product Data Analytics will lead a high performing team of data analysts to identify, develop and implement project deliverables such as business requirements, report templates and structure, database support and design, and stakeholder engagement.ResponsibilitiesPlans and establishes goals and objectives for the department or inpartnership with the department lead.Has direct impact on the immediate or short-term operational resultsof the department.Has budgetary responsibility and/or manages certain processes or projects within department’s budget.Supervises the development and design Tableau dashboards reports utilizing data from multiple sources for management review and presents dashboards to various levels of management.Critically review and revise reports and reporting sources for update and enhancement.Supervise requirements discovery efforts with stakeholders and key business partners to identify and analyze business needs, process, data, and integration requirements for the applications.Collaborate with other technical and service platform support teams to identify, analyze, and recommend improvements to the current state aimed at leveraging enterprise resources.Work with key business partners to identify and incorporate best practices from Subject Matter Experts to drive consistency of business rules and data analysis. Supply consultative advice to data analysts regarding standard reporting business rules.Define and document business requirements and provides analysis of business needs. Socialize business requirements with technical teams and obtains sign off from key stakeholders.Identify systems and operational deficiencies and recommends solutions to streamline procedures for more effective reporting.Develop and deliver stakeholder and user training.Oversees UAT testing to ensure accuracy, completeness and report/system design and implementation.RequirementsThree to five years of supervisory experience including managing direct reports and project teamsBachelor’s degree or equivalent is required; Master’s degree is preferred. Three to five years of working with Tableau reporting tools (Desktop, Server) including experience standing-up Tableau Server environments, required. Tableau certification highly desirable.Experience working with business reporting and/or product analytics and performance metrics and supporting the development of key performance metrics.Three to five years of experience working with SQL, SAS (or similar tool), and ETL and data warehousing concepts.Experience with data modeling and design. Highly skilled in interpersonal and verbal and written communications, presentations, analytics and problem-solving.Strong understanding of Blue Shield products, services and organization. Understanding of the Product Strategy team’s goals and objectives.Experience with Scrum/Agile development practices. Experience using JIRA and/or other project management systems to manage projects and backlogs.Advanced knowledge of PC related software applications, including Excel, Visio and PowerPoint.Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California is focused on transforming health care by making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 3.5 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution. We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.Physical RequirementsOffice Environment - roles involving part to full time schedule in Office Environment. title: Workday IT Business Analyst and System Administrator
location: 100 N Sepulveda Blvd 12th Floor, El Segundo, CA 90245, US
description: Position Summary: Looking for an IT Business Analyst and System Administrator to support HR Business with Workday HRIS implementations. Responsibilities: Analyze, design, evaluate, modify, test, and implement Workday functionality in coordination with the HR. Lead system update process, including making appropriate recommendations to process owners, leading configuration and testing, and training end users, when appropriate. Conduct research and analysis regarding trends, patterns, and issues to identify opportunities and solve problems. Work closely with department leadership to fully maximize and enhance the system. Ensure consistent delivery of established service level agreements through active, ongoing management. Ensure that system is configured accurately to support end user business needs. Configures and troubleshoots integrations with third parties. Partner with stakeholders to implement process modifications that support changing business and compliance requirements. Manage the ongoing maintenance and data integrity of existing systems, including all integrations and reports.Requirements: 3-5 years experience with HRIS systems (core HR, payroll and tax, time and attendance, recruiting, on-boarding, benefits, compensation, performance management, talent management, workforce management) Workday Business Analyst experience - requirements elicitation, use case documentation, process flows etc Workday Systems Administrator experience - configuration, reporting, and maintenance Workday Systems Integration experience - Workday Integration Cloud Connect Package experience with out of the box connectors such as Salesforce, Kronos, SSN Verification, Background Check, Payroll, etc. Experience with web service based APIs and the Workday Integration Cloud platform. Experience migrating a company from a legacy on-premise and/or cloud based HRIS solution to a Workday solution.We offer an excellent benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, paid vacation, educational reimbursement, and a superior 401K/profit-sharing plan. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Drug Testing employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, or basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.
