title: Independent Subcontractor -- Healthcare Data Analytics
description: Here's a sample of the kind of work you will be doing for our clients:Perform data-focused operational assessments in a wide range of areas, including health plan operations, ambulatory and acute care, system management, and care coordination relative to reporting.Conduct comprehensive data analyses, find the root causes of the rejections and issues, and interpret business requirements, data, and performance reports to identify opportunities for performance and process improvements.Lead cross functional teams from clinical, technical and operations in the development of enterprise-wide data analytics and clinical informatics strategies, phased implementation plans, and business case development.Assist our clients gain valuable insight using data from disparate sources to improve patient satisfaction, enhance population health and reduce cost of care.Develop and lead the implementation of quality initiatives, data reporting requirements, data governance, policies and procedures that support efficiency and effectiveness for clinical and non-clinical staff within the client's organization and across the continuum of care.Design, build, and enhance data systems and applications to better serve specific reporting requirements. Research and design effective and innovative analytics strategies to measure and improve departmental and organizational goals in operations, finance, and clinical. We are seeking motivated, talented independent subcontractors to work and collaborate on client projects. We have found that people with the following attributes tend to excel in these specialized roles:Proficiency in the creation of complex analytical models, trend analysis, report design and development.Ability to facilitate consensus across functional, departmental and organizational boundaries.Excellent written, interpersonal, communication and presentation skills, including ability to present complex technical concepts in a clear, concise manner to audiences with varying levels of technical understanding.A high degree of self-motivation, integrity, versatility and flexibility.Working knowledge of Tableau, Power BI, plus other BI and data visualization tools, data warehouses.Advanced computer skills, such as SQL, MS-Office, and data mining techniques.10 or more years of directly related Data driven experience in healthcare and/or health plans.Some consulting experience highly desired.Willingness to travel on the West Coast preferred.Bachelor's Degree required. Master's Degree, PMP, RN or other clinical expertise, and Lean Six Sigma Certifications are a plus About UsFreed Associates is a boutique healthcare consulting firm specializing in engagements for health systems, physician practice groups, health plans and related healthcare organizations based in California. Since 1991 our clients have looked to us to ensure that their initiatives are completed successfully and without drama. We're expanding our subcontractor resources to meet consistent demand for our services.Our team consists of top-notch industry professionals who know health systems, acute care, ambulatory care, and health plan operations. We focus on meeting our clients' needs by helping to solve their problems. We offer a broad range of consulting services to address operational, regulatory, technology, transformational, and management needs. Our clients depend on us to organize the project with a clear path to developing the deliverables and delivering on their desired outcome.Our clients are major healthcare providers and payors located in California. Our client contacts are typically the CEO, CFO, CIO, VP, and Director of these organizations. We provide a wide array of services to our clients, so versatility and flexibility are attributes we seek and value highly.For ConsiderationPlease submit resume to URL in this posting.Locations We are looking for independent subcontractors located throughout the state of California, particularly San Francisco Bay Area, Los Angeles metropoliltan area, Sacramento. We are proud to be recognized by the San Francisco Business Times as one of the Best Places To Work in the Bay Area in 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2016, 2017!PI103323671

title: Manager, Applications Development, Data & Analytics
description: Manager, Applications Development, Data & Analytics will work closely with multiple teams across Business and IT to deliver enterprise data architecture to achieve enterprise strategic goals for data governance and data analytics, as well as provide support to the functions of the Data Governance Office.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesManage the team to implement integrated enterprise-wide data architecture and data analytics solutions.Deliver a data analytics architecture that achieves data automation, reconciliation, traceability, lineage and transparency and provides actionable, timely and accurate data to drive business insights around technology enablement, digital transformation and enterprise intelligence.Provide data analytics services to help business partners solve business problems, drive value, and gain strategy and insight from information. Use advanced data analysis techniques and architectures that leverage technology to process large volumes of data to perform complex computations in a scalable, reproducible and automated manner.Support data governance in managing the data custodian function, including the collection, storage, usage and quality of information; data dictionary, data lineage, and data reconciliation; and enterprise data governance tools and software.Manage and motivate teams with diverse skills and backgrounds. Consistently deliver quality services by monitoring progress and active management of deliverables. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge.Collaborate with business and technical managers during project execution for scope, budget and planning management.Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or a related field and 5 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate related work experience; or a Master's degree in Computer Science, Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or a related field and 4 years of related work experience.Must have 5 years of recent hands-on experience using advanced analytics, machine learning or artificial intelligence to solve business problems.Must have 5 years of experience managing a team of developers, analysts, and engineers, including project management.Must have 3 years of recent hands-on programming experience in at least 2 of the following R, Python, SAS, SPSS, and/or other analytics tools and languages.Must have 3 years of recent hands-on experience with SQL, RDMS, and modern data platforms, and Data Visualization skills using Tableau, Power BI, Spotfire, and/or D3.js .Benefits & Perks12 days starting vacation plus 12 holidays and your birthday off!100% paid for medical option, dental and visionOnsite gym and or gym discount and fitness incentive Flexible work arrangementsRetirement benefits along with 401kCulture of learning: Substantial tuition reimbursement to improve your skillsCareer growth: We love promoting from within Strong commitment to work/life balance Technology allowanceSocial responsibility and volunteer opportunitiesIf you think this sounds like you, let’s chat. We would love to tell you more!ABOUT Delta DentalAs the first company to specialize in dental insurance, we are passionate about oral health and its importance to future generations. Our core purpose is the advancement of oral health care to our customers, partners and consumers through dental insurance programs and philanthropic efforts.We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation’s largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.Delta Dental provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Delta Dental complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: IT Auditor & Data Analyst
description: Come to where everything is wide open, where we like our opportunities big and our lives balanced. If you are looking for a career opportunity with a growing, well-respected $6 billion dollar community-focused bank, check out what we are looking for to see if your skill-set and experience could be a fit.We are open to varying levels of experience for the right person, be it 1-3 years, 3-5 years, or 5+ years as we are looking for someone to join our team who is able to have a positive impact and is looking to be a part of something great. Take a look at the job description and let us know if you could be that person.Position Title: IT Auditor & Data Analyst or Senior IT Auditor & Data AnalystDepartment:Internal Audit Position Summary:  Under the direction of the IT Audit Manager, the IT Auditor and Data Analyst role will focus on helping the Internal Audit Department become more data driven in the delivery of its services. The IT Auditor and Data Analyst will consult with Internal Audit team members to develop and apply data analysis strategies to enhance audits and ongoing monitoring activities. The IT Auditor and Data Analyst will be the point person for Internal Audit’s use of various data marts and reporting tools. The IT Auditor and Data Analyst will write complex programs and ad hoc queries by utilizing enterprise data to fulfill audit data analysis requirements. The IT Auditor and Data Analyst will ensure that all code is developed in a well-structured manner, functions as required, is validated, includes sufficient comments, and is easy to maintain and reuse. The IT Auditor and Data Analyst will also be responsible to develop and apply data analysis strategies to enhance audits and ongoing monitoring activities using Computer-assisted audit techniques (CAATs) or computer-assisted audit tools and techniques (CAATTs). These tools may include ACL, Data warehouse, and Hyperion Report Writer. The IT Auditor and Data Analyst brings structure to each data analytic request and translates requirements into an investigative approach to probe for hidden questions and trends within the data. The IT Auditor and Data Analyst will routinely interact with business line data owners and/or users across the bank to understand and obtain relevant data sources. The IT Auditor and Data Analyst will engage with the audit teams and stakeholders to understand each data source and build appropriate data analytic routines to aid Internal Audit in independently monitoring business risks and performance. In addition to responsibility for implementing Internal Audit’s Data Analytics Methodology, the IT Auditor and Data Analyst is responsible for the timely execution of audits of information security and distributed systems information technologies, processes, and related activities, risk-based internal audits in accordance with the annual audit plan, as well as assisting with other audit matters and projects. The IT Auditor and Data Analyst will perform tests of the company’s internal controls and processes to ensure that they are adequate, functional and adhere to regulatory requirements, established organizational policies and procedures and acceptable industry practices. Work performed will include coverage of critical areas of technology including operating systems, networks, and application processing environments and information security and identification and assessment of key risks and controls.Some of the Major Responsibilities: Develop and maintain Internal Audit’s Data Analytics Methodology. Develop the framework and procedures of the department’s data analytics and ensure department team members are aware of the data analytics framework and its application and relevance to their audit projects. Maintain and execute the inventory of data analytics routines for continuous audit of other defined activities, including the development and ongoing management of data models as needed. Participate in the planning of audits and provide support to Internal Auditors in the execution of audits requiring data analytics. Discuss results from the data analytics with the audit team and business line stakeholders. Conducts training sessions to audit team members on tools and data sources used to perform data analytic routines. Acts as the liaison between the Internal Audit, Business Intelligence, and IT departments. Assist in conducting internal audit risk assessment and the development of the annual audit plan. Assist in developing internal audit scope, performing IT audits (e.g. IT General Controls reviews), analyzing and evaluating information technology (IT) security risks and controls and developing written reports of IT and business risks, control descriptions, findings, and IT risk reduction recommendations. Demonstrate appropriate professional skepticism by asking clarifying questions and analyzing information presented by management. Ensures adherence to professional audit standards. Assess internal controls and identify deficiencies based upon analysis of the audit evidence prepared and develop recommendations to address the relevant risk. Prepare audit working papers in appropriate formats that clearly demonstrate the testing, objective, and work performed. Document and maintain sufficient supporting documentation of tests of control design and operating effectiveness and compliance with policies and procedures. Work with management to develop agreed-upon action plans that will assist in meeting the company’s goals and objectives, while enhancing the overall internal control environment Assists in the tracking of testing results and remediation of findings as a part of an ongoing Internal Audit program. Performs other duties as assigned.Education, Experience, And Other Skills Required: Bachelor's degree in accounting, business, information systems, computer science, or related field preferred. Preferred Professional certifications include CIA, CPA, ACL, CISA, CISM, CISSP, PMP, or Commissioned Bank Examiner designation. Experience developing data analysis routines and documenting data extraction, transformation, and loading processes. Strong working knowledge of data analytics and programming tools (e.g. ACL, Excel, Data Warehouse, Report Writers, Tableau, R-Studio, SQL Developer etc.) and concepts (e.g. CAAT, trend analysis, data visualization, reasonability analysis, and regression analysis) required. Experience in IT risk and compliance areas such as IT/IS Internal Controls, End-User Computing, Application Security, Network Security, Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery, Mobile/Web-based applications, Change Management/SDLS, M&A Implementation, FFIEC guidelines, IT Privacy, IT Vendor Management, etc. a plus. Knowledge of the new COSO framework, Sarbanes Oxley, FDICIA, FFIEC, GLBA, COBIT, NIST, ITIK, and similar requirements a plus. Experience in performing multiple projects and working with varying team members/Ability to adapt and change quickly and multi-task.

title: Enterprise Data Governance Analyst
description: The Enterprise Data Governance Analyst provides operational support for the coordination and execution of data governance activities to drive adoption of enterprise data governance capabilities across Blue Shield of California. This position requires the ability to effectively collaborate within his/her own department and across broad parts of the organization.The Enterprise Data Governance Analyst will support the Director of Enterprise Data Governance in performing the following:Responsible for defining data quality standards and rules to ensure data is compliant with defined quality requirements within their assigned domain.Partner with IT & Business teams to develop, refine and implement data rules using SQL and data quality tools.Promote participation and buy-in from business areas for data governance activities.Monitor and report on aggregated data governance metrics and activities and develop presentation material and meeting minutes.Execute key data governance processes - intake/demand and prioritization process, issue management process, and monitoring processes.Responsible for gathering, or assisting with gathering information requirements, developing business glossaries.Analyze gathered information and metrics for trends, risks and issues and report findings to Director of Enterprise Data Governance or Data Owners and Data Stewards.Assist with preparation of material for regular core team and key governance forums (e.g. Enterprise Data Governance Steering Committee, Data Steward Council) to review progress and initiatives with key constituentsPerform impact analysis of regulatory, business, and system changes on the Enterprise Data Governance program, respective data domains ,and relevant data governance policies and procedures within the context of enterprise data governance.Responsible for building and sustaining the day-to-day relationships and communications with business partners at various levels of the organization, including data governance leads, key business stakeholders, other Data Governance Analysts, as well as other internal and external resources.Monitor adherence to data governance policies and standards, drive continuous improvement, manage non-compliance issue escalations, provide training and communication. Participate in regular data governance team, project, and leadership meetings as needed.8+ years experience with data governance, master data management, and data quality processes and procedures.Ability to understand internal and external drivers for changes to data governance policies.5+ years in business analysis or data analysis.Possesses advanced knowledge and experience large-scale data architecture, master data management or similarprojects or programs of significant complexity.Proficient on querying and extracting data from repositories such as Netezza, Oracle, SQL Server, etc.Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.Attention to detail and data accuracy.Proven team player with strong interpersonal skills.Excellent presentation, written, and verbal communication skills which bring clarity and precision at all levels within the organization.Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to recognize and comprehend complex issues, policies, regulatory requirements and industry information affecting the business environment.Experience in healthcare is a plus.EducationEducation/Requirements: BS or MS or equivalent experience.Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California is focused on transforming health care by making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 3.5 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution. We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.Physical RequirementsOffice Environment - roles involving part to full time schedule in Office Environment. Based in our physical offices and work from home office/deskwork – Activity level: Sedentary, frequency most of work day.Please click here for further physical requirement detail.JobBusiness Systems AnalysisPrimary LocationUnited States of America-California-El Dorado HillsOrganizationBlue Shield of CaliforniaScheduleFull-timeJob PostingJul 17, 2018, 6:40:18 PMExternal hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Qualified applicants with arrest records and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, State and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability status and any other classification protected by Federal, State and local laws.

title: Data Analyst - Marketing
description: SurveyMonkeyFounded in 1999 and based in San Mateo, California, SurveyMonkey is the world’s leading platform for turning people’s voices and opinions into actionable data — People Powered Data. Whether it’s with customers, employees, or a target market, SurveyMonkey helps curious individuals and companies — including 99% of the Fortune 500 — have conversations at scale with the people who matter most. It’s People Powered Data that allows them to understand not only “what” is happening, but “why.” SurveyMonkey’s 700+ employees throughout North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific are dedicated to powering the curious.The RoleSurveyMonkey is looking for a Data Analyst, Marketing to support our CEM(Customer Engagement Marketing) team. As a data analyst on our team, you will lead efforts that analyze our data to capture business insights, attributes and behaviors that help us optimize our customer engagement strategy through email and in-product messaging. This person will play a key role in determining next steps on testing, driving engagement within the product, communication optimization, and drive long term revenue for SurveyMonkey.To be successful in this role you must be a strategic analytical thinker who is able to do independent analysis and provide recommendations to improve performance as well as have an interest in the creative side of marketing. In addition to SQL skills and experience with large databases the ideal candidate must have experience automating reporting ideally through Tableau and familiarity with marketing automation tools, ideally Salesforce and Responsys.Responsibilities Create, modify, and assemble SQL reports to satisfy evolving data requirements. Work with Business Intelligence and Data Engineering teams to ensure that data remains timely and accurate.Develop and manage marketing dashboards to measure “reach and engagement” across multiple marketing channels including content, SEO, Paid (SEM, Display, etc), CRM, and any other activities driving engagement and conversion.Help colleagues in marketing and business development to frame and answer critical questions. Be able to understand this data and proactively investigate abnormal activity.Analyzes marketing campaigns and make recommendations to improve campaign performanceWork with Business Intelligence and Data Engineering teams on database integration and manage data feeds between Responsys, Salesforce, and Datawarehouse systems to insure data integrity, reliability, and a good customer experience.Support Marketing team in conceiving, setting up, and executing tests. Perform ad hoc analysis to answer strategic business questionsRequirements 2+ years of experience in reporting and analytics fields Experience with at least one analytics and visualization tool such as Tableau A strong intuition for crafting raw data and analysis into well-written and persuasive content Understanding of marketing processes and best practices Attention to detail and ability to QA multiple data sources Passionate about leveraging technology and analytics to make performance marketing more efficient, effective and personalized Excellent analytical and problem-solving capability Proficiency in SQL and statistical calculations Ability to synthesize large amounts of data into understandable management summaries and make strategic recommendations.Desired Skills Experience with Google Analytics a plus Experience with an ESP(Responsys, Eloqua, etc) a plus At SurveyMonkey, we offer competitive salaries, medical/dental benefits, PTO, 401k, paid holidays and parental leave, and equity compensation.SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Financial Planning Analyst
description: Job Summary The Financial Planning Analyst will be the "go to" coordinator for KPI tracking and Forecast management. This position will work closely with a cross functional team made up by Product development, Marketing, Finance and Business Intelligence. Therefore, stellar communication and collaboration will be key for success. Project management and forecasting capabilities (ex. time series & trend analysis forecasting) are required strengths in this role. You'll help the team in key planning cycles such as budgeting, Greenlight process, quarterly business reviews and more. If this is your expertise and what excites you, keep reading. Responsibilities: Coordinate models for forecasting user growth, user acquisition spend, revenue for our current and future games within our portfolio Work with key stakeholders in Production, Marketing, Data & Monetization to model different scenarios to drive decisions on go-forward plans regularly Be the point person/project manager to finalize forecasts and model On a monthly basis, track actual data/KPIs to compare against initial forecast Reforecast based on actuals, historical KPIs and trends. Collaborate with Finance to manage version control, final model distribution and vet all projects prior to distribution to key stakeholders Drive report automation where applicable, drive efficiencies through standardization, and put other time saving optimizations in place Research and recommend tools and methodologies Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a quantitative/analytic field (e.g., business, economics, finance etc.) 5+ years’ experience in a quantitative analytical role; Senior Data Analyst, Financial analytics Revenue forecasting experience, in a similar industry preferred Expert with Excel and PowerPoint, an understanding of relational databases, hands on experience using SQL to query and visualization in Tableau Comfortable with interacting with various stakeholders and cross functional dialogue Comfortable being the project manager/analyst but not the subject matter expert Reporting and presentation skills Passion/interest for the mobile gaming / F2P space

title: 1235152 - Data Analyst - OpenDNS Finance
description: What You'll DoThe Cisco Security Business Group (SBG) Finance team is growing and looking for a talented Data Analyst to come aboard. As a Data Analyst for our Finance team, your work is used to uncover insights about the financial operations of Cisco, helping to drive important strategic decisions.You will develop and maintain security business group (SBG) analytics reporting and processes that provide insights to business performance and key company metrics for a fast growing, SaaS-based department.You’ll provide regular, timely reporting and performance monitoring to Finance, Executive Team, and other key business stakeholders.You’ll develop data collection and appropriate analytical tools, models and processes.You will synthesize data from various sources such as AWS MySQL, Oracle ERP, SFDC, Zuora, and other internal systems.You’ll think creatively to find optimal solutions to our complex, often unstructured problems.Who You’ll Work WithCisco's OpenDNS Umbrella enables the world to connect with confidence on any device, anywhere, at any time. We do this by crafting powerful security solutions that are easy to deploy and simple to manage. We are a company of engineers and technologists passionate about delivering a better Internet. At OpenDNS, we seek bright, committed team members who are excited about contributing to a company which has a vibrant and energetic culture. Working within OpenDNS means being surrounded by passionate, intelligent and creative people who are resolved to disrupt the Internet security industry with endless innovation, world-class research and unrivaled products and services.As part of Cisco's OpenDNS, you’ll be joining a finance team that has a hands-on impact on the growth of the business. This close-knit team interacts with all aspects ofWho You AreYou are passionate about analytics and are able to approach complex problems in an organized and detail-oriented manner. As Finance touches on all aspects of the business, you should have the desire to learn about customer behavior and the meaningful drivers of various departments.Our minimum requirements for this roleYou have 3+ years of experience working with SQL and relational data, with a solid grasp of financial and accounting concepts as well as familiarity with SaaS metrics.You have 2+ years of experience working with large-scale data.You bring strong experience with at least one scripting language, such as Python or Ruby.You have experience working with Excel, ERP and Financial Planning tools, experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Business Objects, or Birst and experience identifying and debugging data problems.You have exposure to automating processes and building ETL pipelines (using tools like Informatica).Why CiscoAt Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us!#WeAreCisco

title: Public Relations Director - Insights and Analytics
description: Golin is an integrated agency with PR, digital and content at its core. With 50 offices around the world and 60 years of experience, Golin’s purpose is to create change through relevant, brave work worthy of awe and action. “Go All In” is the agency’s ethos and commitment to bravery over mediocrity. We Go All In. In everything we do. We believe we have the power to inspire real results and we work tirelessly every day to do just that.  Our agency is at the center of the marketing universe with expertise ranging from brand-building and cutting edge digital content, to corporate reputation, healthcare advocacy and measurement. Our client roster includes many of the largest CPG, retail, food, healthcare technology and consumer service companies in the world.Golin is seeking a Director of Insights & Analytics to play a key role in contributing to one of the fast-growing, sought-after teams in the agency.  As part of the Insights & Analytics team, the Director will work directly with our  team to flawlessly execute research and analytics reports that go beyond the data dump and derive actionable insights that directly inform client work. The ideal candidate is as unique as our insights and analytics team. Part digital analyst, part creative problem solver, he or she is a true hybrid, with a deep understanding of digital and social analytics, as well as the ability to tell stories with data and synthesize findings from a variety of different sources.  What you will do: Execute social listening research and measurement assignments with minimal supervision Think strategically and be insightful with the ability to tell a story that converts data into actionable insights Tabulate and analyze data, pulling out crisp insights and recommendations Develop research reports and presentations Monitor and evaluate digital and social media results on a daily/monthly/annual basis in coordination with client and account team goals, as well as benchmarks Gather data from assigned sources (e.g. Talkwalker, Factiva, Sysomos, Quid, Twitter Analytics, Hoot Suite, Facebook Insight) in a methodologically sound manner Manage social media coverage coding and analysis, write strong Boolean taxonomies Communicate to account team and end clients on project developments, timelines, and results Demonstrate a strong interest in and understanding of social media metrics and trends Be change-agent within our agency, helping to propose new, innovative approaches to analytics and measurement that push our clients to think differentlyWhat you have:8-10+ years of experience in digital analytics, market research or related field; agency experience preferred Advanced analytical skills with proven understanding of statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations Comfort interpreting a variety of different data sources from qualitative research to primary survey data to secondary data sources and creating one cohesive story Working with and creating databases and dashboards utilizing all relevant data to inform decisions. Experience with tools including Talkwalker, Quid, Radian6, Sysomos, Crimson Hexagon, Brandwatch, Traackr, Visible, Spredfast and others. Being able to write strong Boolean taxonomies is a pre-requisite Time management skills and the ability to juggle multiple deliverables and timelines at once Must be able to quickly learn new tools and databases Excellent writing and presentation skills Account planning or secondary language skills a MAJOR PLUS

title: Health Data Analyst Informatics, Experienced
description: Reporting to the Director of Clinical Technology & Optimization, Health Data Analyst Informatics will integrate into one of our “tiger teams” partnering directly with our state-wide provider partners defining the future care delivery model. These teams will baseline operations, capturing key performance data, then implement new technologies, redesign process and change organizational structures to make the future a reality. The Health Data Analyst Informatics will also be responsible for partnering with our Networks team to support the baselining of new provider partners capabilities and performance, then analyze the data to help develop improvement road maps tied to our mutual objectives. The Analyst’s specific focus will be to observe, and capture performance data on our clinical partners. They will then provide analytics to help the team understand how health care is valued, utilized and provided in the provider setting. Through this process they will also work with the Data analytics team to understand patient level health utilization/outcome, provider performance measures, risk-adjusted revenue optimization, medical cost management, and behavior attributes on patient/provider engagement. Participate in initial meetings with client or project lead to define the scope of the project. Provide insight and expertise on defining the data models, including knowledge of the capabilities and flexibility of different models. Take detailed notes on client calls, to ensure accurate information collected to determine project and data scope Interview and assess clinical operations and health programs to identify sources of dataProvides analytical support through the analysis and interpretation of data to understand performance of a process or specific service delivering care to membersWork directly with providers to clarify project scope and be resource for provider to answer performance / data related questions Prepares documents, correspondence and other communication materials to convey information to appropriate audiences internally and/or externally.Responsible for adjusting or recommending enhancements in systems and processes to solve problems or improve effectiveness of clinical operations or health programsOnce new solutions are implemented, analyzes actual results against plan and forecast and recommends interventions where appropriate. Identifies opportunities for improvement and notifies management of issues and problems requiring immediate attention.Identify data anomalies and exceptions as observed in project deliverables (reports, analysis). Understand the reasons and impacts of data anomalies and exceptions on the analysis in order to explain these issues to senior staff or project lead. Think through data issues and formulate possible solutions. Communicate data anomalies with project and client team and provide insight, expertise and direction on address issues regarding the data anomalies. Project manage multiple tasks on different projects simultaneously to include the following: organize project work flow and delegate project tasks to junior staff; manage the quality and timeliness of project deliverables; ensure client deliverables are client ready.Knowledge And Experience Requires a bachelor’s degree in science, social science, MIS, computer science, public health, health services research or business. MPG, MBA, MS, MA preferred. Requires 1-3 years of experience in Health Care (managed care, academic, or government payer), demonstrated ability to work with all clinical coding systems (e.g., ICD10, CPT, DRG, LOINC, RxHUB).MS Office, esp. Excel and Access, Unix, SQL/PL-SQL,SAS, R, Python. Must be able to modify programs or scripts developed by others. Requires practical knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.Preferred Qualifications Strong customer-facing experience, preferably with clinical staff, and community health professionals, and government agencies Knowledge of healthcare data management concepts and regulatory/compliance policies (HIPAA, IRB, etc.).Understanding of electronic medical record systems (EPIC, Cerner, etc.)Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California is focused on transforming health care by making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 3.5 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution. We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.Physical RequirementsOffice Environment - roles involving part to full time schedule in Office Environment. title: Business Analyst
description: Job Function SalesPrimary Location United States-California-Van NuysSchedule Full-timeJob Type PermanentPosting Date Jul 3, 2018Job DescriptionHave a knack for numbers? Perfect.Interpreting sales data with analytical takeaways and recommendations is an integral role within our Sales department. At AB, a Business Analyst is a highly visible position, working closely with top leaders of the organization and various cross-functional work groups. This is a highly specialize role with a plethora of challenges and opportunities to improve operational efficiencies and sales productivity.A Business Analyst supports Field Sales and other Sales functions with fact based data to make informed decisions and recommendations. In addition, a Business Analyst is tasked with various projects utilizing Sales analysis to identify sustainable and profitable solutions. Through detailed research, our Business Analysts have the opportunity to lead our company in exciting directions.Job Responsibilities Support the Region Sales Directors, District Managers, and other Region Directors by providing routine sales reporting, ad hoc support, and sales / share / pricing analysis, drilling into root causes of performance gapsEvaluate brand / package sales promotions and suggest modifications to enhance sales and profitability. At AB we’re never satisfied and always looking for continued improvement.Create and update sales presentations for use in communication meetings, retailer visits, and planning meetingsDirect efforts to provide monthly sales performance review material and analysis to Sales Director and District Manager in support of a variety of report reviewsConduct training as required with region team and management on utilization of tools to monitor performance, understand competitive threats and results of actions in the marketplaceApply PDCA methods and lead projects to identify root causes to performance gaps and develop practical, field-oriented action plans that will address each issue About Anheuser-BuschBudweiser. Bud Light. Stella Artois. Over 19 billion dollar brands, to be exact. But there’s more to us than a portfolio of top notch brands.We are a company built on a dream. W e have a vision that we share with our wholesalers, retailers, consumers and partners. We want to brew great beers that can not only be enjoyed responsibly but which are also created with a low impact on the environment.We are a company of go-getters dedicated to providing unparalleled quality and results. We take pride in our work, regardless of the task or department. Over 160 years, we’ve grown to operate 15 breweries, 17 distributorships and 23 agricultural packaging facilities across the United States. And our Brewmasters still taste every batch made at every brewery before being packaged and sent to market.We are a company that believes our people are our greatest asset. We believe in the spirit of ownership because our employees take results personally and want to build something great together. We value talented employees who aren’t afraid to be bold, resourceful, and committed.At Anheuser-Busch, it’s not about what you studied or where you worked, it’s about what you can do. If you see yourself working for a company that allows you to excel at the pace of your talent, then a career at Anheuser-Busch may be for you.Want to learn more? Visit us at anheuser-busch.com/careers.As the leading global brewer, Anheuser-Busch InBev is committed to finding innovative ways to continually improve. It's this kind of thinking that creates a unique work environment by rewarding talent, celebrating diversity and encouraging forward thinking. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.Job Qualifications Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Economics, Math, Computer Science, Business, or related field1+ years' of experience reviewing and analyzing sales / pricing data and summarizing key takeaways for managementAbility to concisely summarize analytic findings and support with appropriate data, reports, and chartsAbility to relocate within the U.S. – We are looking for people that want to take their career to the next level regardless of location. title: Senior Royalty Analyst
description: We are EAAnd we make games – how cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. That’s why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry.Save the planet from alien invaders. Score the winning touchdown. Yup - it’s the coolest job on the planet!The Challenge AheadThe Senior Royalty Analyst and team manages all worldwide license and development contracts pertaining to product development for all Studios, as well as, third party and distribution. Global Royalty Accounting’s direct internal business partners are Studio Finance, Corporate Finance, Financial Planning & Analysis, Business Affairs and Legal. The group manages over 1100 contracts.Our mission is to affect profitable business strategy and increase the influence on license and developer agreements by designing and leading effective royalty processes and by providing timely insights. Critical processes owned include global monthly royalty calculations for accruals and estimated royalty rates, compilations of external statements & payments, interaction with external auditors and 3rd party auditors and business partners’ support.What a Senior Royalty Analyst Does At EAPrimary Responsibilities:Responsible for the accurate review, interpretation and set-up of development and licensing contracts.This IncludesInterpreting contractual terms and conditionsSetting-up & updating contracts in the Alliant Royalty SystemAssessing capitalization feasibility as it pertains to EA’s PolicyAnalyzing effective versus contractual royalty ratesCalculating development expensed advance amortization, if applicable Ensure 100% compliance to all financial commitments and obligations. This includes:Prepaid advancesDevelopment milestone paymentsMinimum guaranteesMonthly or quarterly royalty disbursementsMarketing and/or sponsorship feesPublisher assistance Responsible for enhancing Royalty Accounting’s relationships with internal and external business partners as it relates to the EA StudiosParticipate in the monthly, quarterly and year-end close processesAssist in monthly forecasting and annual planning process for RoyaltiesSupport 3rd. parties licensors & developers auditsAssist on compilation of management reporting packages & analysisPrepare and maintain assigned audit schedulesResponsible for reconciliation of Prepaid Royalties and Royalty Payable AccountsResponsible for the timely and accurate preparation and distribution of assigned Royalty Accounting reports to business partnersSpecial projects as assigned, these include, but are not limited to, ad hoc reporting for internal business partners, specifically Business Affairs, Legal and Finance.Assess Royalty Accounting processes, procedures and policies on a continuous basis and make recommendations where appropriate for process improvementsBehaviors / Competencies:Disciplined self-starter with strong attention to detailStrong drive for data integrity, process definition and alignmentExcellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong ability to work independently as well as to support team activitiesViews challenges as opportunitiesThe Next Great EA Senior Royalty Analyst Also Needs5 years of accounting experience Strong skills in MS Office (Excel) and OracleBachelor’s Degree in Accounting (CPA or MBA a plus)Royalty agreements and accounting experience a plus System user or system test experience a plus …and, in general, the potential to sweep us off our feet! What’s in it for you? Glad you asked!We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives off of creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the “work hard/play hard” credo every day.Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.

title: Sales Financial Analyst
description: Financial Analyst   Advantage Solutions is looking for a detailed and results-driven finance professional with a strong finance foundation who is capable of doing light accounting entries. The Financial Analyst analyzes financial information, data and statistics and utilizes accounting principles to ensure accurate reporting of financial results. This role is responsible for preparing journal entries for month end close, reconciling balance sheets, explaining variances and involved in forecasting and budgeting cycles.   Responsibilities (Blended (70/30) Financial Analyst and Senior Accountant)   Ensure accurate financial results by preparing the financial data for the closing of the monthly, quarterly, and annual accounting cycles Create General Ledger entries to record financial transactions including, revenue and expense accruals, intercompany transfers, prepaid entries and deferred rent Perform monthly balance sheet reconciliations Financial Analysis and Reporting Perform detailed review of divisional expenses to ensure appropriate coding Assist with the monthly fluctuation analysis of the Company’s divisional results versus budget, forecast, and prior year Assist in the monthly financial review process and forecast Contribute to a variety of ad-hoc projects for the company Assist Divisional Controller with forecasts/budgeting as needed   Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree, 3-5 years of experience in Accounting, Finance or equivalent job-related experience. MBA and/or CPA preferred Well-organized, detail-oriented, good interpersonal skills, and able to handle a fast-paced work environment Ability to complete multiple duties with accuracy shifting from one to another with frequent interruptions and competing deadlines Strong computer skills including proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook, and web-browsers Prior experience with a large ERP Systems (AX, SAP, JD Edwards, etc) Advantage Solutions is one of North America’s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management, and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods. We bridge the gap between manufacturers and retailers, providing consumers access to the best products available in the marketplace today.   Advantage Sales and Marketing, LLC dba Advantage Solutions is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
