title: Associate Data Analyst
description: Collider is a bunch of planners, anthropologists, trend experts and innovators collaborating on some pretty cool projects around the world. We work pretty intensely with Taco Bell, helping them come up with the next Doritos Locos Taco and reimagine the buying experience, among other fun things. We also help KFC rethink their brand in France, the UK, and in about 15 other countries. We’ve also had the good fortune to work closely with Nestlé, Pizza Hut, Verizon, Toyota and other great brands in the 5 years since we opened our doors.We’re currently looking for an Associate Data Analyst to join our team in Orange County, California. In this role, you’ll be working with strategy teams to help inspire and evaluate ideas for each project using intuitive, design-forward, and insightful analysis. You’ll also design and run new research approaches that leverage the latest science in human decision making. The ideal candidate should be a true data geek and know their way around questionnaire programing tools (e.g., Qualtrics), data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau), analysis tools (e.g., R, SPSS), and database management tools.We are a marketing strategy consultancy, fully owned by Yum! Brands, so we get to work on some pretty amazing global projects to Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and KFC. It's the perfect mix of agency life and client-side.

title: Data Analyst, Platform Operations-2
description: JobData Analyst, Platform Operations-2DepartmentDeluxe Medius OneDescriptionDeluxe Entertainment Services Group Inc. is a global leader in media and entertainment services for film, video and online content, from capture to consumption. Since 1915, Deluxe has been the trusted partner for the world’s most successful Hollywood studios, independent film companies, TV networks, exhibitors, advertisers and others, offering best-in-class solutions in production, post-production, distribution, asset and workflow management, and new digital solution-based technologies.With operations in Los Angeles, New York and around the globe, the company employs over 8,600 of the most talented, highly honored and recognized artists and industry veterans worldwide. Deluxe is a wholly owned subsidiary of MacAndrews & Forbes Holdings Inc. For more information, please visit www.bydeluxe.com We currently have an opening for a Data Analyst, Platform Operations. This position will be located in Burbank, CA. Position OverviewThe Data Analyst, Platform Operations will be responsible for normalizing, curating, & augmenting Title, Asset, Order, & Profile data in support of content fulfillment automation on the One platform. The position will enforce governance and compliance rules to ensure upstream data quality and enable end to end automation from source asset ingest to client delivery. The position will augment incoming Title & Asset data as needed based on established business rules. The Data Analyst will work with internal and external teams to ensure that data is accurate, timely, and structured properly for workflow automation in the One platform. This position is based out of Burbank, CA.Primary ResponsibilitiesEnter master data into systems and tools accurately, accommodating Operations’ deadlinesInterface with end users from various internal and external groups to ensure master data management excellenceDefine, prioritize, and communicate status and integrity of data; working with others to understand timelines and needsResponsible for updating and reporting problems that arise with Database issues by communicating via creating or updating incidents and email advisements, this involves problem solving through precise documentation and effective follow upMust have ability to make sound judgments when dealing with issues that arise during troubleshooting and have the skills to determine the appropriate action to be taken for a given situation; must be able to prioritize instantly to prevent missed deadlinesProvide timely, accurate, professional and responsive support, verbally and via email, to internal and external customer/clients to resolve all issues reported and take proactive steps to prevent the conflict/problem from reoccurringAbility to generate required reports from the system as well as read and utilize informationProvide feedback and suggestions to management for improved customer satisfaction, process improvements and system enhancementsPossess advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and experience with databases (Relational, SQL, Elastic)QualificationsMinimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent, Associate degree or above preferred2+ years in Data input related experienceExcellent attention to detail with strong organizational skills and ability to multitaskUnderstanding of content fulfilment, digital workflows, asset and data management systems/platforms.Excellent teamwork, written and verbal communication skills.Must demonstrate positive attitude, ability to maintain professionalism in a high stress situation, and project self as a team player.We offer competitive pay and benefits program including medical, dental & vision coverage, vacation & sick leave, 401(k), and more.Deluxe’s policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against, on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Deluxe will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and federal law.Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Deluxe. Please inform the company's personnel representative if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

title: Knowledge Analyst
description: We’re BCG Digital Ventures. Welcome.BCG Digital Ventures is a corporate investment and incubation firm. We are dedicated to inventing, building, scaling and investing in game-changing businesses at start-up speed for the world’s most influential companies, ensuring they are fit for the future. Founded in 2014, we have major innovation centers in Manhattan Beach, Berlin, London, Tokyo and Sydney, as well as a host of labs across the globe. Our centers and labs are home to a diverse range of entrepreneurs, investors, technologists, strategic thinkers, designers and engineers.Introducing our Venture Operations TeamOur Venture Operations Team is how we redefine what’s possible. It’s where organizational insight aligns with operational excellence to keep our business thriving and producing imaginative ventures. From human resources and information technology to marketing and operations management, the Venture Operations Team is the internal force that drives us forward, enabling us to expand the limits of human expectation with our compelling products, services and ventures.Knowledge AnalystDigital Ventures is looking for a Knowledge Analyst based in Manhattan Beach to enhance knowledge services for DV US and support global knowledge initiatives. They will work with US billable staff to support knowledge needs as they arise and work with the Global Knowledge Lead to implement global priorities. This person must work well in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining a high customer service orientation and the flexibility to support teams in different disciplines and industries.Know What We KnowThe Knowledge Team exists to help BCG Digital Ventures:Easily find people based on expertise, role, and past workNavigate complex systems to access stats on projects, ventures, and IPUnderstand what can/cannot be shared with whomFacilitate scenario-based searching (“A time when…”)Know How We Do ItBring clarity to when and how internal tools should be usedEnsure governance for applicable content on the company intranetChampion employee-friendly sanitization procedures for recently launched venturesSupport US staff in navigating knowledge materials, tools, processesEnrich What We KnowHow to access fresh thinking beyond DVDesign feedback loops that improve our outputEngage with BCG counterparts for improved collaborationAs a Knowledge Analyst, your main responsibilities will be as follows:Create Content:Support Business Development (Partners, Directors, Managers) with commercial propositions to be re-used (in particular for industry hot topics)Manage venture summary information for use in vignettes, product demos, and aggregate reportingLead retrospective sessions to document lessons learned and collect critical project data and assetsAuthor process and policy documentation for improved internal efficiencyOrganize ContentEnsure all relevant documents are shared among the Firm, define what is a “relevant” document, and in which form it should be sharedStructure the process for sharing (who does what and when, how to ensure it is done, define incentive or tracking system)Manage change in the organization to improve content sharing and collaborationReference And Guide For Information/data ResearchUnderstand how various research tools and services both within DV and at BCG can be leveraged by venture teams and sales teamsCoach and support staff for self-service usage of knowledge resourcesLeverage internal data sources to support leadership and operations teams with performance reportingAs a Knowledge Analyst, you will need:1 - 3 years of related experience; particularly in a professional services or matrix organizationTechnical experience with information management systemsExperience working with data cleansing, categorization, analysis, and visualizationDriven work ethic, service-mentality and able to work autonomouslyStrong written and verbal communicationAbility to work independently in a fast-paced environmentAdaptable in ambiguous or changing business situationsAble to manage multiple parallel tasksStrong interpersonal skillsCollaborative team playerBachelor’s Degree RequiredFluent in EnglishBCG Digital Ventures is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.BCG is an E-Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify

title: Data/BI Product Manager
description: About UsPantheon powers the world's professional websites. Our multi-tenant, container-based cloud platform enables businesses to run mission-critical Drupal & WordPress websites. Developers, Marketers and IT can instantly scale in response to unplanned traffic spikes, without upgrading VMs or clusters. Large enterprises use Pantheon, including Intel, Cisco, Arizona State University, and the United Nations.We value teamwork, humor, and hard work, balanced with solid social time together. We're enthusiastic participants in several open-source communities and have real relationships with many of our most active customers and that's where you come in.The RolePantheon is currently looking for a motivated, proactive and energetic individual to join the company's Product team as a full-time member. You deeply understand business intelligence, data pipelines, and analytics, with a desire to improve each through data engineering and data science while guiding teams to deeply impactful insights. Over the course of the next 12 months, you’ll be on the ground floor to grow a new business intelligence team, build an enterprise data warehouse, learn and deliver insights mined from the data warehouse, and operationalize data excellence with collaborators in each team.Cool Things You’ll Do Build and manage a modern data and analytics operation to power internal business intelligence and data-driven customer-facing products. Manage an engineering team practicing Scrum to build and manage business intelligence, analytics, and data infrastructure Work with key stakeholders on teams throughout the company to collect reporting requirements and create deliverables Discover intelligence insights that impact company strategy Build an enterprise data warehouse Partner with Finance to build company forecasts Explore, learn, and present how recent product releases performed Collaborate with Marketing to evaluate campaign performance What You Bring To The Table BA/BS or equivalent 1+ years experience as a product manager or equivalent role (e.g. product owner, lead analyst, etc). Enthusiasm and excitement about working with data all day every day. Demonstrated ability to use qualitative and quantitative data sources to inform product/project decisions Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Bonus Points For Data science or analytics experience Comfortable running your own queries A compelling cover letter telling us why you're the right person for the job and why Pantheon is the place for you Cool Stuff You'll Get in ReturnAnd Oh Yeah, Some Other Things To NoteWe have all the usual benefits and perks you'd expect from a high tech company, but what we can really offer you is a fantastic work environment powered by an amazing team. Fun at WordPress and Drupal community events Discounts on custom bicycles - the founders of Pantheon also founded Mission Bicycle Dog friendly office Fully loaded kitchen and daily catered lunches Monthly gym and book allowance Kombucha on tap and omg...did you say Its-Its are in the freezer? Pantheon complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: HR Analyst
description: Oracle Global HR Analyst The Oracle Global HR Analyst is the master handler of people processes and data. They hold the highest level of responsibility to ensure that employee records are accurately and efficiently compiled, reviewed, analyzed, submitted and secured in our proprietary Human Capital Management (HCM) system. Our analysts work as a team to manage HR workflows designed to support Oracle’s global workforce.  We collaborate across regions and continents to ensure the timely processing of people data; to analyze problems that surface from data errors; generate reports to account for large data uploads and transfers; provide solutions to line management, HR business partners and Oracle employees to ensure their personal information and records are accurate and secure.   The HR analyst is a critical asset in the flow of information necessary to recruit, hire and onboard new employees. We work together to ensure that employee’s data is updated when it changes as a result of organizational changes, job transfers, promotions and terminations.   Anything that could affect an employee’s record, must be handled and processed by at least one of our HR analysts. They bear a significant responsibility for the integrity of Oracle’s people data. Qualifications: ·         4+ years experience working in a data intensive environment, preferably in human resources, where data entry, record auditing and report generation are primary functions of your role.·         You get excited about systems and process and most of all, improving them.  You are uniquely comfortable having dozens of apps and tabs open simultaneously.·         You have a high attention to detail and the patience to pursue data anomalies that most of us miss.·         You believe that no jobs are too big ; no problems too complex.·         You can communicate effectively - directly and succinctly – across cubicles, organizational boundaries and cultures.  ·         You know how to represent a problem to others, and how to work with them effectively to solve problems.·         You volunteer - for new experiences, learning opportunities and to help others.·         BA preferred

title: Data Analyst
description: Position: Data AnalystLocation: Pasadena, CADuration: 3-6 month contract to hire Job ResponsibilitiesProvide Level 1 application support; identifies, analyzes, troubleshoots all assigned production application incidents.Provide Level 2 deep dive analysis on urgent and critical application related issues.Attends review meetings for new business initiatives inside of supported application areas to identify and highlight any issues from the Application Support perspective.Ensures all issues follow the production issue resolution process, and are logged, tracked, and resolved in the issue management tool.Manages and monitors trends related to production application issues; develops metrics and generates reports on a regular basis.Works with stakeholders on the proper identification and ranking of reported issues.Communicates urgent incident statuses to levels of Management as appropriate.Coordinates the deployment of hotfixes and scheduled development releases into the Testing and Production environments.Participates fully in application release management cycles, including scheduled/unscheduled maintenance activities impacting the Production environment.Supports major production application deployments as well as other critical change activities.Works closely with various technology groups to determine solutions to reported issues.Works with QA to test solutions as necessary. Job QualificationsMinimum of 5 years professional experience in an IT environment.Minimum of 3 years professional experience supporting multiple applications/systems.Must be able demonstrate the ability to code in an object oriented language such as PowerShell, Perl, Bash, or PythonAbility to lead resolution efforts for high-priority, high-visibility Production issues through utilization of members from multiple functional teams.Use of incident management logging/tracking systems (preferably Jira).Good knowledge and understanding of supporting client/server and Web based applications.Demonstrates excellent TSQL knowledge and appropriate situational / analytical use.Experience with MS SQL Server and related tools and technologies, MS Word, Excel, and Visio.Bachelor’s degree in a business or technical field or relevant experience.Banking and/or credit card systems (stored value systems) experience.Experience working in an IT development environment based on the Microsoft .NET framework; good understanding of .NET technologies and languages.

title: Data Analyst, Product
description: Join our growing product team in London and help us unlock the secrets of digital advertising. If you often wonder why people behave like they behave, if you wonder why the ads you are seeing online aren’t as great as they could be, if you love slicing through data to uncover meaning then you will really enjoy this position.We are a technology company with a creative DNA. Our mission is to measurably improve the effectiveness of digital advertising. We empower brand leaders, agencies, and media suppliers.We offer you a competitive salary and benefits package, a diverse and collaborative environment, focus on your growth and professional development and of course also a lot of fun along the way!Responsibilities Research user engagement with ads to uncover key elements that make great creative Analyze large amounts of Celtra’s unique data points covering in-depth interaction with display and video ads Execute brand lift and conversion lift studies for Fortune 500 brands Design and conduct experiments that will help you advance your research Author research articles relevant for the wider industry Collaborate across teams and partner with senior members of our organization Requirements 3 years experience as data analyst within market research or advertising industry B.S. from a quantitative field, statistics is ideal Fluent in SQL programming languages, R a plus Extensive experience with analysing advertising performance, experience with brand lift studies a plus Ability to be self-driven, pro-active, systematic, well organised and rigorous about details Ability to operate in a highly multidisciplinary and collaborative environment where effective exchange of knowledge between peers is crucial A “can-do” mindset pursuing excellence About CeltraCeltra is the Creative Management Platform for digital advertising. Brand and performance advertisers use our fully self-service platform to create, distribute and optimize the highest quality, data-driven ads at scale, across all channels and screens with great efficiency and control. We power the best video, native and rich media ads for 2/3 of Fortune 500 brands.If you have an interest in a company who’s interested in both your wellness and your wallet (medical, dental, vision, parental leave, education, fitness, commuter, 401k... you get the picture), you should apply. Celtra is headquartered in Boston (MA), with offices in New York City, San Francisco, London (UK), Sydney (AU) and Ljubljana (SI). For more information, visit Celtra at http://www.celtra.com or @CeltraMobile on Twitter.

title: Product Manager - API
description: If you enjoy transforming data into knowledge and knowledge into business insights, this is a great role for you. As a Data Analyst, you are responsible for the development of data driven strategies for our clients in the form of reports, research, analysis and recommendations. The Social Media Analyst will also be responsible for tracking key social media metrics, comparing our campaign results to the competition and analyzing the business impact of our social media marketing efforts.   Role and Responsibilities:Conduct in-depth analyses of qualitative and quantitative results to uncover actionable insights relevant to the client and objectives.Craft clear and concise stories, elevate findings into insightful reports that bring results to life.Utilize visual elements in reports including charts, graphs, imagery, and other creative visualization techniques to highlight key insights.Create and present insights to clients in a way that inspires them to take action on those learnings.Perform data analysis and help develop effective statistical models for segmentation, classification, optimization, time series, etc.External CollaborationCollaborate with clients to gather and translate business priorities and objectives into effective, actionable, and visually creative deliverables.Continuously improve standardized deliverables by surfacing questions relevant to client objectives and incorporating knowledge of industry trends and news.Internal CollaborationWork alongside team members (strategists, creatives, social, influencer, media, digital, and account teams) to develop and maintain a positive relationship with the client.Participate in internal initiatives to develop thought leadership and industry best practices related to analysis and reporting.  Requirements:  Experience utilizing qualitative analysis (i.e. content analysis, hypothesis testing) and quantitative analysis techniques (i.e. clustering, regression, pattern recognition, statistical modeling, and inferential statistics). Exceptional analytical abilities and high proficiency with SPSS and SQL. Experience in R, MATLAB, SAS, Python a plus. Experience with SQL database query writing or other data mining tools. Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel (i.e. spreadsheet formatting, pivot tables, vlookups, and other advanced functions) and PowerPoint required. Experience with site analytics tools such as Google or Adobe Analytics. Knowledge of social media monitoring tools such as Sysomos or Radian 6. Strong understanding of the social media space and main platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, and Twitch). Preferred experience with design thinking, UI design and BI visualization tools. Expert level attention to detail, as well as strong organizational, verbal/written communication and presentation skills. Self-starter with the ability to work independently on multiple assigned projects with limited direction. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment. Ability to strategically use consumer insights data, platform performance, and key social media and digital trends to inform the development of strategies and plans. Assertive and resourceful with a proven track record of getting things done. Extremely online savvy and socially active online with a solid understanding of social media and the dynamics of community interaction Self-starter with the ability to work independently on multiple assigned projects with limited direction.Great problem-solving skills and able to work in a team environment.Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment Ability to strategically use consumer insights data, platform performance, and key social media trends to inform the development of strategies and plansAssertive & resourceful with a proven track record of getting things done  We’re a Frontline agency. Creative, driven by data, shared with vision. It’s what we do for our clients, and here’s how we do it: We listen. Data is everywhere around us; the trick is turning that noise into insight. We’ve got pioneering analysts with proprietary cyborg ears all over the web and social media—curating and interpreting, informing everything we do in real-time, allowing us to stay always in front of what consumers want. We create. The best creative is born through Idea Darwinism. In our shop, concepts can come from anywhere and anyone. But when it’s time to execute, all our mingling people work, think, and create together, fluidly Voltroning into a slightly different super-machine for every project. The ecosystem we live in doesn’t stay in compartments, so neither do we. We share. We’re not above the trendiest trends, but our real passion is to stay in front of them. From the latest and greatest in culture to whatever sci-fi tech is coming around the bend, we care deeply about how we share your brand story. That’s why we include a social perspective in every one of our campaigns, so we can bring you to where your audience is engaged. Listening. Creating. Sharing. Nimbly bringing it all together: that’s what we do.

title: Senior Analyst- Sales Strategy
description: At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects - Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats - we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 32 countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.To support our continued growth, we’re looking for a Senior Analyst to support our Global Business Development team. In this highly collaborative role you will support the Business Development team through a strong business partnership with the Partner Operations / Channel Partner / OEM team and VP of Business Development. Each partnership will require you to analyze and deeply understand each teams Go-To-Market strategy for the current and future fiscal years. You will be heavily relied on for your analytical skills, attention to detail, efficiency, and enthusiasm.You thrive in navigating ambiguity, adapt quickly to a changing environment, take a regional view, are data-driven and have a real passion for optimizing process and structure. You balance critical, long-term thinking about how we scale the business with hands-on delivery to ensure what needs to happen today gets done. You love rolling up your sleeves and digging into the data to provide actionable insights. We’re looking for people with strong analytical and process skills, comfortable engaging with senior leadership, effective at collaborating with multiple teams and building positive relationships with business partners.What You Will Be Doing Responsible for providing strategic, operational, and tactical support to our VP of Business Development and Partner Operations / Channel Partner / OEM teams. Prepare weekly and monthly KPIs tailored to how each team prefers to track area, region, territory, and channel performance on a MTD/QTD/YTD basis. Drive and support semi-annual GTM planning, which includes headcount allocation and prioritization, target setting for the Channel and OEM teams, and territory carving. Partner with each Business Development team to develop growth plans for new geographies and market segments. Track partner portal metrics and health. Help oversee, prepare, and organize regional quarterly business reviews. This includes building templates, crafting the agenda, scheduling attendees, and capturing all metrics / performing all analysis needed for attendees to present their assessment of their business. Support the regional deployment of corporate objectives and programs to ensure cross-functional support and strategic alignment. Provide oversight to ensure corporate objectives are applied consistently and fairly while evening the needs of local markets. Support the weekly forecast calls for the Channel and OEM teams. Create dashboards to identify strengths and weaknesses in business trends.What You Bring Along: BS/BA required, MBA a plus, but not required. 3+ years of experience in Sales Operations, Partner Operations, Strategy, Management Consulting, Channel Sales, or similar field in SaaS organizations with strong exposure to go-to-market strategy. Experience building complex and dynamic models for scenario planning. Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions, and craft recommendations and results into easily digestible messages, communications, and executive presentations. Strong executive presence and engagement skills. Power user proficiency with MS Office suite (especially MS Excel and MS PowerPoint).Bonus Points: Ability to thrive in a dynamic start-up environment. Experience with the Salesforce.com platform Highly collaborative style with strong influencing skills and the ability to adjust on the fly to new demands with a sense of urgency.Additional Information:We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Stock options Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads) Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do. Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

title: Sourcing Financial Analyst
company: CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA Insurer
description: Are you looking for a caring company that is committed to extraordinary service? If so, be part of a community that works at CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA insurer, in our Walnut Creek office.While we’ve been named a ‘best place to work,’ our proudest accomplishment comes from serving nearly 17 million AAA members. Through our commitment to service, growth and our people, CSAA Insurance Group will create AAA members for life by fulfilling our promise to be there when they need us.The Strategic Sourcing team needs a highly motivated Financial Analyst to help the organization by delivering critical insights on supplier and spend data. The Sourcing Financial Analyst is a key role required to support Procurement activities by collecting, evaluating and analyzing sourcing information, along with providing reports and recommendations to stakeholders.Essential Functions / Principal Responsibilities Provide financial health and viability reviews of current and potential suppliers as required Develop supplier spend reports by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts Interface and collaborate with finance leaders from other divisions when analyzing sourcing deals or on other financial related matters Identify and implement ways to improve effectiveness and efficiency for Sourcing related financial processes Create financial models to facilitate information review and decision-making Provide financial expertise and advice to Sourcing team members Assist Sourcing team in high volume data analysis Assist Sourcing Leadership with financial related presentation materials as required Identify current & forecasted spend that is in scope and outside of scope for Sourcing Department budget and pacing forecasts Review and analyze bi-weekly status update submissions Required Skills To Succeed In This Role Client focus/customer service - ability to effectively engage and interact with all levels of organization Proficient in spreadsheets, databases, MS Office and financial software applications Strong analytical and financial/cost modeling skills Understanding of Sourcing & Procurement Processes Comfortable with spend analysis and working with the Sourcing group to develop category plans and sourcing strategies Strong research, statistical, analytical, processing and mathematical skills with ability to structure and conduct analyses. You will collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Ability to collaborate effectively and work as a team Strong communication and interpersonal skills in order to build relationships You will identify, develop, and implement self-service capabilities (e.g. Savings Submissions, Approvals) Help illustrate the impact of Opex vs Capex Savings Preferred Experience supporting the financial analysis needs of a Strategic Sourcing, Procurement, Purchasing, Supply Chain, or similar department You will work with cross-functional teams and projects and comfortable in delivering tough messages. You have the ability to identify and resolve problems and implementation barriers Confirmed leadership skills Ability to influence Senior Leadership decision-making and strategy Ability to work on multiple issues and tasksEducation, Work Experience, Licenses & CertificationsRequired Bachelor’s degree in Business / Finance or equivalent 3+ years of analytical experience Preferred Insurance industry experience Experience in a Finance role supporting the Sourcing/ProcurementCSAA Insurance Group offers many benefits, including Medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance coverage including benefits coverage for domestic partners. Company contributions into a Health Savings Account (HSA). 401(k) plus company matching dollar for dollar up to 6% and a cash balance retirement program. Company paid employee assistance plan and health support programs. Award-winning wellness programs including free onsite fitness classes. Paid bonding leave for birthing and non-birthing parent and paid adoption leave. Two weeks paid military leave. Paid time off, plus ten paid holidays and 24 hours of paid time off to volunteer. Tuition reimbursement, self-service training, career development and mentorship opportunities.Be part of a community that worksAt CSAA Insurance Group, we take pride in our values-based culture. Helping our employees lead enriched lives and satisfying careers is how we work. Our employees appreciate the integrity and inclusion that is evident throughout our everyday interactions. We respect the diverse range of perspectives, backgrounds and cultures of our teams, and join together when it comes to helping our members, community or one another.Headquartered in Walnut Creek, California, our community also works in Arizona, Colorado, Nevada, New Jersey and Oklahoma. Learn more about us at CSAA-Insurance.aaa.com/careersLet’s work together Please submit your application to be considered. We communicate via email, so please check your inbox to ensure you don’t miss important updates from us. Questions? Please email us at TalentAcquisition@csaa.com function. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Sourcing Financial Analyst Requisition Number R2704 Sourcing Financial Analyst (Open)LocationWalnut Creek, California Additional Locations

title: Data Analyst
description: The individual will provide support to the Division Data Steward in his/her oversight of the Bank's operational and regulatory compliance testing and reporting programs. The Data Analyst is responsible for playing a critical role in the execution of the Bank's operational and regulatory compliance programs, reporting on testing results, and performing validation.Primary responsibilities include: data validation (ensuring data input is equal to the output), data profiling; understanding of data lineage and data process flow; review and development of internal edit check reports, and maintaining other data quality monitoring processes in partnership with the Data Management Officers (DMOs), , including validation of the quality of source loan data provided for reporting; ownership of the quality of specific data elements (including pre- and post-booking reviews of loan approval and boarding documents); review, research and resolve edit check failures within established reporting timeframes in conjunction with the appropriate areas of the Bank; executing effective controls to ensure responsibility and accountability for all business data across the reports for which the line of business is responsible.*Minimum of 2 years of combined experience with compliance and/or audit experience with a focus on testing.*Minimum 2 years of experience with developing and performing testingCollege degree preferred.Demonstrated experience with regulations impacting consumer banking and/or business unit functions preferred.Strong experience in developing and performing testing.Demonstrated strong and sound decision making abilities about compliance risks and recommended corrective action.Ability to work well in a time-sensitive environment and handle a variety of matters or projects simultaneously.Proficiency in analyzing diverse business functions and processes to identify key risks and demonstrated success with implementing control improvement recommendations.Ability to interact with federal regulatory agencies.Proficiency of Microsoft Office applications such as Excel, Access, Word and PowerPoint., Visio preferredExcellent organizational and analytical skills.Ability to communicate clearly and professionally with all levels of an organization.Excellent written and verbal communications skills.Effective interpersonal skills.Proficiency in multi-tasking and prioritizing projects.Excellent time management skills and be accustomed to working with deadlines.Represents basic qualifications for the position. To be considered for this position you must at least meet the basic qualifications.City National Bank is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/VeteransNote: This preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.Note: Candidates should be advised that City National Bank does not pay interviewee travel expenses or relocation expenses for candidates who are hired unless previously agreed.Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Insights and Operations Analyst
description: OVERVIEWThe Kapor Center aims to enhance diversity and inclusion in the technology and entrepreneurship ecosystem through increasing access to tech and STEM education programs, conducting research on access and opportunity in computing, investing in community organizations and gap-closing social ventures, building diverse and inclusive companies, and increasing access to capital among diverse entrepreneurs.The Research Team at the Kapor Center aims to use research and data to inform the design and implementation of strategies, practices, and policies to diversify the technology and entrepreneurship ecosystem. By collaboratively building a body of empirical research and disseminating findings to key stakeholders, it is our belief that the implementation of research-driven practices and policies within the technology ecosystem can transform future opportunities for underrepresented individuals, families, and communities and strengthen the innovation and prosperity of our national economy. The research team's strategies include: 1) conducting original research; 2) funding external research; 3) sharing findings and best practices with practitioners, industry partners, and policymakers, and 4) building capacity among stakeholders. There are four key projects that the Insights and Operations Analyst will support:SMASH: The Summer Math and Science Honors Academy (SMASH) is a 5-week, 3-summer STEM immersion program for underrepresented students of color across 7 sites in the U.S. The SMASH program includes over 1,000 current students and alumni and we have tracked student data for the past 8 years.Leaky Tech Pipeline: The Leaky Tech Pipeline website is an interactive tool intended to provide an overview of the barriers for underrepresented groups in tech and data on participation of underrepresented populations in key areas of the pipeline--PreK-12 education, Post-Secondary Education, Tech Workforce, and Entrepreneurship/Venture Capital. CS for CA: CS for CA is a new cross-sector campaign to bring computer science education to all students across California. The research team is conducting a 3-year study of CS access and enrollment across CA and in 3 districts (OUSD, SFUSD, LAUSD).WOC in Computing: Our newest initiative, the Women of Color in Computing Research Collaborative, will build a body of research and data on women of color across the computing pipeline.POSITION SUMMARYInsights and Operations Analyst (One-Year Fellow)Reporting to the Director of Measurement, Evaluation, and Learning, the newly formed one-year fellowship role of the Insights & Operations Analyst will support process improvement related to data management and find innovative ways to synthesize, manage, and visualize data and insights related to diversity across the STEM and technology pipeline.ESSENTIAL DUTIESIdentify data sources, clean and merge data files, and create datasetsMaintain database (Qualtrics) and create effective systems to organize, clean, store, and pull SMASH program data, consisting of student demographics and longitudinal student outcome data.Maintain updated documentation on data systems Lead and support the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of standardized dashboards and reports with an emphasis on automation and scalability using database data, including development of systems for managing data and reporting requests. Develop standardized systems for gathering and storing large datasets related to STEM education, degree completion, workforce participation, and entrepreneurship.Develop products (e.g., dashboards, interactive visualizations, infographics) to publicly share data, trends, and insights to local, state, national and international audiences in compelling and digestible ways Collaborate with members of the Research team to communicate data trends from reports, data briefs, and research studiesCollaborate with Communications team to disseminate trends and insights across social media platformsCollaborate with the IT team to make recommendations for software, hardware and data storage upgrades and identify contractors for web product development (as needed)Desired Skills and Experience:Ideal Background/Experiences:Experience developing and maintaining large data sets and working with CRMs and other databases Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, R, etc.) Demonstrate broad technical knowledgeAbility to think strategically about data management solutions and creatively about data dissemination and visualization Strong knowledge of and experience with building dashboards and data visualizations with new or existing tools (e.g., Tableau) Ability to communicate data trends and insights to a variety of stakeholder audiences Strong attention to detail and accuracy and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and responsively while meeting project deadlines Excellent problem-solving ability and strong self-motivation Ability to work collaboratively across diverse teams Experience working in education-focused organizations or technology companies highly preferred Degree in statistics, computer programming, data science, information science, economics, or equivalent background highly preferred Passion for diversity and inclusion and impacting communities of color Benefits:The Kapor Center provides competitive compensation commensurate with experience, and an excellent benefits package including medical, dental, vision, basic life and disability insurance, 401K, paid time off, holiday benefits and more. The Kapor Center's office is located in the uptown district of Oakland, with excellent access to public transportation.

title: Data Analyst - SME
description: Evolver is a technology company serving the Federal, Commercial, and Legal markets that addresses client challenges in the present and transitions clients into the future by introducing efficient and effective IT solutions. Established in 2000, Evolver has successfully grown to be a trusted technology leader. Evolver’s efforts and growth have been recognized by leading publications and organizations, including Inc. 5000 for five consecutive years, and most recently “Future 50” from SmartCEO. With a dedicated focus on client satisfaction, Evolver has proven its value time and time again, from managing day-to-day operations to skillfully navigating the implementation and support of new technologies. Evolver’s core competencies are infrastructure, application development, cybersecurity, cloud, end-user support, data analytics and legal services.We believe our employees are key to our success and continued growth. We attract and retain our diverse workforce by promoting a work-life balance with generous and flexible time off, competitive compensation and benefits, and a commitment to professional development. When you join Evolver, you join a community of talented and dedicated individuals whose abilities, skills, and actions contribute to the success of the company.Evolver is seeking a Data Analyst SME to join our team and work in San Francisco, CA.The Data Analyst works with business and IT teams to provide the following:gather requirements,create functional requirements documents,work with developers to create files for either internal or external systems,develop detailed data flow diagrams,participate in the full development process life-cycle from concept, through testing and implementation.Serve as an expert in business metadata, experience in Collibra is a plusStrong communication, analytical, and problem solving skillsThis is an individual-contributor role and require interactions with data governance, business data subject matter experts and IT ownersManage communication between business partners and IT to communicate on matters pertaining to data definitions, data lineage and modeling workflowsAct as a lead and will be responsible for developing technical data lineage and populating into CollibraAct as a lead and facilitate the process of developing data definitions, issue resolution workflowsAssist in implement existing metadata model in CollibraComplete data mapping analysis and document data usage for existing data vendorsManage communication between business partners and IT to communicate on matters pertaining to data definitions, data lineage and modeling workflowsAct as a lead and will be responsible for developing technical data lineage and populating into CollibraCandidate will be detailed oriented and knowledge of writing basic queries, exporting output to EXCEL files for analysis. Candidate will have worked for either an asset management firm or custodian as an IT/Business data analyst. 4+ years of experience and in depth knowledge of financial products.Data Governance tool, Collibra knowledge preferred.Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Information Technology or related field.At Evolver, we foster teamwork, growth, individuality and entrepreneurialism. We value employee opinions and encourage them to make a difference by getting involved and being thought-leaders. As a part of the Evolver team, we actively promote a working and learning environment that supports a highly qualified workforce and a quality of work life that is based on trust and respect for all employees resulting in a healthy and trusting organizational culture.Evolver, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or veteran status. Evolver offers a comprehensive benefits plan including (but not limited to): medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life, AD&D and short term and long term disability insurance.

title: Senior Consultant, Data & Analytics
description: About FTI ConsultingFTI Consulting, Inc. is a global business advisory firm dedicated to helping organizations manage change, mitigate risk and resolve disputes financial, legal, operational, political & regulatory, reputational and transactional. With more than 4,600 employees located in 28 countries, FTI Consulting professionals work closely with clients to anticipate, illuminate and overcome complex business challenges and make the most of opportunities. The Company generated $1.81 billion in revenues during fiscal year 2017. For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Twitter (@FTIConsulting) , Facebook and LinkedIn .FTI Consulting continually strives to offer employees and eligible dependents, including domestic partners and eligible domestic partner children, a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Please click here for more information.FTI Consulting does not accept unsolicited resumes from external firms or agencies. FTI Consulting will not be responsible for placement fees associated with unsolicited resumes.FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.About Forensic & Litigation ConsultingThe Forensic and Litigation Consulting practice at FTI Consulting provides multidisciplinary, independent dispute advisory, investigative, data acquisition/analysis and forensic accounting services to the global business and legal community. Our team supports clients facing high stakes litigation, arbitration and compliance investigations, and regulatory scrutiny.About The OpportunityA Senior Consultant - Data & Analytics is responsible for providing accounting, economic and financial related consulting services as they relate to litigation, dispute resolution or financial investigations. He/she will assist businesses, government entities and law firms in complex, data-intensive analyses requiring the understanding of relationships between various information sources, complex modeling or information sharing.Working in the Data & Analytics practice provides the opportunity to work in a leveraged, team based model of diversely skilled, intelligent, driven and successful individuals. Team members regularly exceed expectations and are recognized accordingly; through promotion, compensation, public recognition and positive feedback.Primary DutiesAs a Senior Consultant, you will develop in-depth knowledge of your clients' objectives and challenges in order to design and implement innovative strategies to assist them through their current difficulties and prepare them for the future. Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to, the following Identifying, acquiring, synthesizing, mining and analyzing relevant data Identifying the relationships among multiple sources and types of data, and organizing this information to facilitate effective data analysis Designing and implementing complex financial database models to generate meaningful statistics and resolve disputes Analyzing and interpreting historical financial, operational, and transactional data Maintaining detailed work-paper records of assumptions, methodologies, and information sources utilized during the performance of all analytical tasks Performing the day to day activities of projects including interaction with client personnel, FTI team members, and professionals from other firms involved in the engagement Preparing written analyses, reports, presentations, and interrogatories for third parties on the project scope and/or results of activitiesBasic Qualifications Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree 2 years of experience in finance, accounting, or economics with an emphasis in complex problem solving, data analytics, or related competencies Experience working in a team oriented environmentRequired Skills Possess strong quantitative and qualitative research and analytical skills Able to work in a team as well as independently Able to demonstrate excellent communication (written and verbal), mathematical, and organizational skills Able to adapt quickly in handling multiple evolving tasks as a result of new engagements and/or re-prioritized deadlines Possess strong interpersonal skills Highly motivated, hard-working, eager to learn, willing to travel, and able to motivate others Able to utilize technology to solve complex problems Able to effectively execute work plans Able to effectively manage multiple staff and project responsibilities Able to provide quality assuranceAble to regularly communicate project/work stream status to both internal and external clients Able to produce high quality work product under strict deadlines Proficient in SQL, PL SQL, Oracle, VBA, and / or other technical skills related to data extraction, transformation and loading Possess a general understanding of financial and accounting principles and / or other quantitative skillsPreferred Skills Proficient in analyzing data within relational database systems such as MS Access, MS SQL Server Familiarity with tools such as Tableau, APEX, .NET, Java, Python and SharePoint Familiarity with common software packages; such as PeopleSoft, SAP, Great Plains, JD Edwards, Hyperion and Oracle FinancialsPosition Classification Exempt#CB#

title: Senior Manager, Analyst Relations
description: ServiceNow makes the world of work, work better for people. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.The Senior Manager for Influencer Relations will be responsible for building and executing an analyst and influencer engagement program in support of ServiceNow’s IT and Cloud solutions. In this role, the Senior Manager will be responsible for identifying and prioritizing analysts and influencers and for building a programmatic approach to long-term engagement and influence. The manager will also be responsible for executing high profile analyst evaluations; supporting go to market initiatives and advising the business on both analyst strategy and overall market dynamics.At ServiceNow, we are focused on a healthy and regular two-way dialog with influencers and analysts. The successful candidate will be able to communicate the company strategy, executive points of view, product vision and roadmap, successful customer implementation, partner strategy and beyond. In this role, you will influence how analysts think about our fast-growing products.In the end, the purpose of this position is to raise the profile of ServiceNow with analysts and influencers to increase brand awareness and preference for ServiceNow. The right candidate will bring a strategic and data-driven approach to working with analysts and have a focus on continuous improvement.What You Get To Do In This RoleBuild and lead planning for strategic programs for all aspects of influencer engagementExpand relationships with top analysts and influencers to ensure they understand ServiceNow’s company direction, C-level perspectives, product roadmaps and more.Identify, develop and manage the relationships with key analysts and company spokespersons while coordinating with product marketing, product management, engineering, sales etc. to ensure ServiceNow’s products are positioned well in analyst research reports, market share data and industry event presentationsAssist internal subject matter experts/spokespersons in preparing content that is tailored for an analyst audienceDevelop strategies for continuous improvement in competitive analyst reports.Make market research a part of our culture by ensuring analyst perspective/data is integrated into our product strategy, narratives and marketing materialsManage the collection and dissemination of major industry analyst reports such as Gartner Magic Quadrants, Forrester Waves & IDC MarketScapesIncrease ServiceNow’s visibility and influence amongst the analyst communitySupport and educate sales on analyst views and AR resources available to themSupport multiple activities around ServiceNow’s annual Industry Analyst Summit, Knowledge Conference, various regional NowForum events and Analyst Firm eventsHelp maintain internal AR databases, measurements and operations.Leadership Skills RequiredExperience running and executing high profile analyst relations programs, with a track record of success and positive feedback from analysts.Positive history of successfully interfacing with executives and influencers - both internal and external7-10+ years of experience as an entrepreneurial, strategic marketer with a background and proven success in developing high-impact relationships with analysts and other industry influencers.A team player that collaborates as standard practice and operates successfully with global and virtual working teamsHigh energy, “can do” personality and ability to thrive in a growth environmentProven experience blending high-level critical thinking with more tactical operational activitiesGreat project management skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams of varying sizes in a fast-paced and fluid environmentStrong bias towards action with the ability to make decisions quickly amidst multiple stakeholdersStrong written and verbal communicationsKnowledge of Cloud, IT Service Management, IT Operations Management, Project Portfolio Management or Software as a Service markets is a plusBachelor degree minimum, MBA a plusWe provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

title: Sales Data Analyst
description: Sales Data Analyst Lakeshore Learning Materials is one of the most innovative manufacturers of educational materials in the country. Specializing in top-quality products for the home and classroom, we are a thriving multichannel organization with a robust web business, multiple catalogs for early learning and elementary programs, 60 store locations plus a sales force that is second to none. Thanks to the daily contributions of the amazing people who make up our team, Lakeshore has experienced continuous growth since the day it was founded in 1954.   We…just…keep…expanding. We are currently searching for an experienced Sales Data Analyst to provide data management, reporting and analytical support for our Sales Analytics team. Under the direction of the Sales Analytics Manager, you will be responsible for helping Lakeshore meet its objectives to drive the growth and profitability of our business. Successful candidates will have previous experience with interpreting and analyzing data, advanced Microsoft Excel skills, a high focus on accuracy and data integrity, and outstanding problem-solving and communication skills. The right candidate will enjoy a workplace that can swiftly change focus—and will possess the skills to quickly adapt to evolving priorities. This position is based at our corporate office located in Carson, CA.   A day in the office looks like this: Working with technical data to extract, manipulate and analyze marketing campaigns Reviewing data sets and reports for accuracy, validity and data integrity Providing detailed and accurate reporting (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annually) Creating, completing and managing ad hoc reporting requests in a timely manner Organizing, analyzing and interpreting complex data Providing actionable analysis that will improve the performance of our sales efforts Assisting with the execution of campaigns, segmentation and targeting Assisting with list execution as it relates to deduplication, merge/purge and maintenance Communicating effectively across all levels of management throughout Retail, Marketing, E-Commerce and other departments Working independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment while handling multiple projects and deadlines with superb accuracy You gotta have… 3+ years of experience in data, analytics, reporting or marketing preferred BA/BS in computer science, math, business information systems, database management or marketing is a plus Knowledge of relational database technology (SQL Server, Oracle, MS Access), database marketing/data mining analytical applications, math, statistics and MS Office applications. Will work in SQL database to develop list generation requirements. Experience with web analytics and business intelligence tools (Adobe, Google, QlikView) Strong understanding of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Publisher, PowerPoint and Outlook), with advanced knowledge of Excel Outstanding problem-solving skills, high receptivity to feedback and a teamwork mentality Ability to think critically and make important decisions independently Ability to suggest ways to improve processes while keeping focus on long-term goals Highly organized, detail-oriented mind-set Strong written and verbal communication skills Proven ability to multitask, manage overlapping deadlines, and adapt to new situations and shifting priorities When you join Lakeshore, you’re joining hundreds of talented and dedicated individuals who believe that the materials we create really can make a difference. For over 60 years, we’ve been developing some of the best learning materials in the world—products that spark young imaginations, instill a sense of wonder and foster a lifelong love of learning. Products that make it possible for every child to enter school ready to succeed. Products that help children with disabilities make amazing educational strides and join their peers in the classroom. And we know that we couldn’t do the incredible things we’re doing without the people who are on our team. We’re continually making sure we have the right people in place to take us to the next level, and we’re always on the lookout for smart and enthusiastic people to join us. If you are a down-to-earth professional who shares our passion and our drive, we’d love to hear from you. Compensation depends on skills and experience. Family-owned and family-friendly, Lakeshore offers excellent medical/dental and vision coverage, 401(k), flexible benefits, plus a generous profit bonus plan, on-site preschool, employee discount and casual dress. To apply, please complete an online application at: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm02/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=LAKESHORE&cws=1&rid=2703 To learn more about Lakeshore, visit https://www.lakeshorelearning.com/about/careers Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Senior Associate, M&A Data & Analytics
description: Requisition Number: 35186 - 6DescriptionKnown for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. title: Pole Remediation Analyst 2
description: Job DescriptionENERGY FOR WHAT’S AHEADAre you looking to make a difference in your career? We’re working on smarter grids, cleaner energy and tools to help people manage energy more efficiently.About Transmission And DistributionSouthern California Edison’s (SCE's) Transmission and Distribution (T&D) Organizational Unit is responsible for planning, engineering, constructing, operating, and maintaining transmission and distribution facilities throughout the 50,000-square-mile territory. T&D is the steward of roughly $19 billion in assets that safely and reliably deliver electricity to 14 million residents via SCE’s 5 million customer accounts.Position OverviewThe position is part of Pole Program Management (PPM) within T&D that is responsible for pole scope processing, design remediation, and data reporting/tracking for any poles identified as deteriorated (Det) within SCE’s approximately 1.4 million pole portfolio. Our pole execution strategy takes into account annual pole targets, operation resources, budget commitments, and construction constraints.The Pole Remediation Analyst 2 position is in the Design Remediation work group within PPM that examines raw data for the purpose of deteriorated pole scoping, project management and quality control for T&D pole replacements and/or remediation.This position will dynamically facilitate the movement of pole scope from initiation to execution by actively reporting on and managing SAP notifications, reporting on High Fire and Priority Pole strategy and execution, supporting the initial creation of deteriorated pole products in Design Manager, validating and reporting on Pole Tracker data, and researching/removing roadblocks (constraints) of Det Pole work orders. The successful candidate will be responsible for evaluating processes to identify risks, recommending process improvements, performing data research and analytics to identify and resolve anomalies. Job responsibilities include sorting through huge data sets to identify relationships between various data elements such as asset, geospatial, and operational data.Responsibilities May Include Responsible for T&D's analytics, data interpretation, data extraction and modeling.Develops, and assists or makes presentation to senior management, department and division management on initiatives supporting T&D strategies and goals.Makes strategic recommendations on data collection, extraction, preparation, and integration all while maintaining data integrity.Ensures optimal resource allocation and completion of work. Performs analysis, testing, and/or measurement in specialized area of expertise. Responsible for providing, analyzing and interpreting data in support of GRC testimony.Provides analysis for AOR in support of on-going company operations or in response to changing business strategies. Contributes to the development, improvement and execution of processes that support T&D in the execution of performance and metrics. Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications Three or more years of experience in, or related to the field of analytics.Three or more years of experience with data preparation, data extraction using large structured and unstructured datasets and tools Three or more years’ experience working with ERP (SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Excel).Three or more years of experience using Excel functions such as V-lookups, Pivot Tables, and creating charts and graphsDesired qualifications Associates Degree or higher in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or Business major Two or more years’ experience working with SAS or Visual Analytics (VA).Two or more years’ experience in related technical field performing pole load calculations, consulting, and providing recommendations.Comments Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work directly as employees for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.Southern California Edison, an Edison International (NYSE:EIX) company, serves a population of nearly 14 million via 5 million customer accounts in a 50,000-square-mile service area within Central, Coastal and Southern California. Join the utility leader that is safely delivering reliable, affordable electricity to our customers for over 125 years.SCE is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status.

title: Technical Program Manager, Data Infrastructure and Analysis
description: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; Irvine, CA, USAGoogle's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.The Data Infrastructure & Analysis (DIA) team within Google is responsible for developing an end-to-end integrated stack that serves the internal data management and analysis needs for Google’s products and applications. We partner very closely with key Google products (including Google Ads, AdSense, Payments, Shopping) whose infrastructure is underpinned by products from this stack which offers a full spectrum of generic, highly extensible products for data ingestion, processing, storage, and analysis. Our systems are multi-homed, highly reliable and highly scalable. We also collaborate closely with academia and innovate relentlessly to ensure that this stack stays state of the art.Users come first at Google. Nowhere is this more important than on our Advertising & Commerce team: we believe that ads and commercial information can be highly useful to our users if, and only if, that information is relevant to what our users wish to find or do. Advertisers worldwide use Google Ads to promote their products; publishers use AdSense to serve relevant ads on their website; and business around the world use our products (like Google Shopping, and Google Wallet) to support their online businesses and bring users into their offline stores. We build and maintain the platforms that have made Google what it is today, and are constantly innovating to deliver the most effective advertising and commerce opportunities of tomorrow.Responsibilities Work closely with Technical/Product/Project leadership and align project priorities and schedules. Identify and solve cross-functional and inter-team issues quickly. Manage multiple interdependent projects of moderate to high complexity and scope. Exercise independent judgment and develop recommendations that translate into a course of action. Design and implement build and operational processes that help the teams/organization scale. QualificationsMinimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, related fields or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of cross-functional Program Management experience working among several technical groups; such as engineering teams and design teams. 3 years of experience with Data Infrastructure products (e.g., pipelines, storage, queries, business intelligence and analytics). Experience designing process improvements that tailor to specific project(s) needs. Preferred Qualifications Master of Science or 7 years of experience with Data Infrastructure products (e.g., pipelines, storage, queries, business intelligence and analytics). PMP Certification or equivalent demonstrated practical project management experience. Experience with backend systems development and integration. Working experience with data management systems (transactional and analytical). Ability to provide timely reports to stakeholders and executives; able to articulate thoughts clearly and follow up on tasks and questions on behalf of engineers. Ability to communicate across a wide variety of functions (e.g., Engineering, Product Product Management) and levels. Excellent interpersonal and analytical abilities. At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.To all recruitment agencies Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other company location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Senior Data Analyst, ITS
description: The San Francisco Health Plan (SFHP) Information Technology Services team has a tremendous opportunity for a driven, data-focused analyst who will have responsibility for the data integrity of SFHP’s core systems, e.g. QNXT (managed care system), Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) by performing regular audits of data in the core system along with audits of the data sources going into and out of these systems.What You Will DoPerform problem investigation, evaluation and recommendations of SFHP core data processes: eligibility, providers, claims/encounter and authorizations.Work closely with colleagues to identify data related problems and solve discrepancies or data integrity issues.Perform overall data analysis of inbound/outbound data into SFHP core systems, e.g. QNXT, EDW, including provider, members and claims/encounters for various data sources; i.e. files, SFHP transaction systems.Assist in data analysis in support of prototyping canned/scheduled reports/extracts and dashboard development.Work with business owners and IT resources to define data and document mapping rules.Proactively monitor source system changes for data impacts and communicate resulting data warehouse modifications.Work with developers to build or enhance data loads & extracts.Serve as QA resource as needed on projects pertaining to data flowing into and out of EDW and other core systems.Communicate data enhancement needs with management and development team.Mentor and coach junior ITS Data Analysts.What You Will BringA degree from a four-year college (e. g., BS), which may be substituted with equivalent work experience.Prior experience at a healthcare organization, particularly at a managed health plan.Minimum 3-5 years of experience as a Data Analyst in a healthcare environment using SQL.Demonstrated ability to analyze, evaluate and clearly present written information and findings.Ability to clearly and concisely communicate health care concepts and technical information to management personnel.Expert collaborator who can foster strong working relationships with co-workers and outside contacts.PC literacy and experience with MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Powerpoint).About UsEstablished in 1997, San Francisco Health Plan (SFHP) is a an award winning, managed care health plan whose mission is to provide affordable health care coverage to the underserved low and moderate-income residents in San Francisco county. SFHP is chosen by eight out of every ten San Francisco Medi-Cal managed care enrollees and its 145,000+ members have access to a full spectrum of medical services including preventive care, specialty care, hospitalization, prescription drugs, and family planning services. SFHP was designed by and for the residents it serves, and takes great pride in its ability to accommodate a diverse population that includes young adults, seniors, and people with disabilities.San Francisco Health Plan is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) M/F/D/V Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
