title: Business/Data Analyst – Support Operations
description: About Us VIDEOFounded in 2013, Pivotal Software, Inc., combines our leading cloud-native platform, tools, and methodology to empower the world’s largest organizations to adapt to change and build great software. Our technology unleashes developer productivity, while fulfilling our mission to transform how the world builds software.Get it done, make it work, and then make it sing. Pivotal is seeking a Sr. Business/Data Analyst to help Product Support operations by optimizing Support business processes and financial reporting. Do you enjoy bridging the worlds between Business, Support, Finance and IT? Do you hear a problem and run towards it? Then it’s time for us to talk.What does Pivotal do?We are transforming the way the world builds software. We’re building a Pivotal suite of software and services to help every company, large and small, create great software at startup speed.What does Pivotal Support do?We keep our products working so that our customers can focus on what they do best. We value personal communication, time, and helping each other learn. We are passionate about providing our customers with the highest level of service and work in small teams around the globe, supporting our customers 24x7. We believe in doing the right thing and working at a sustainable pace.What do we need from you?We are looking for a Business Analyst with a passion for optimizing business processes, enhancing customer experiences and improving Support’s performance metrics. The ideal candidate brings analytical rigor and business intelligence experience with a healthy dose of curiosity for driving performance improvement strategies. Strong communication, teamwork, and understanding of Support business and Finance experience are critical for success in this role.In this role, you will bring together data and business analytics that support critical people and financial decisions -- allowing our managers and executives to act with confidence and take our business to the next level.Qualifications And Factors For Success 5+ years of relevant experience Solid understanding of Support business and associated finance The ability to develop creative solutions to problems, both the complex and the mundane Experience working with globally distributed sites and teams Demonstrated ability to communicate inside and outside the organization, both verbally and in writing Self-starter requiring minimal direction for research and knowledge transfer Proven ability to collect, organize and analyze significant amounts of information, transforming the results into action items for a variety of audiences Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology or equivalent Ability to write and execute queries against databases is a plus This position requires US Citizen on US SoilResponsibilities Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns for large data sets. Track and manage performance improvement opportunities to prioritize efforts across the Support, Operations, Product Management and Development organizations. Build and maintain relationships with cross departmental stakeholders to increase collaboration and productivity Clearly articulate and document business requirements and validate proposed solutions. Recommend and support implementation of enhancements to systems and reporting functions

title: Senior Operations BI Analyst
description: Position SummaryThe Senior Operations Analyst will provide data analysis and data assessment to support and address the needs or concerns of the organization. The desired candidate should have the ability to break down information into components and determine the most appropriate analysis technique in order to find or propose a solution or to improve business process. This can involve working with several departments within the organization to find answers and using several analytical techniques to determine the cause of the issue and/or areas of concern. The Senior Operations Analyst will also be required to perform research, track trends, manage databases, integrate multiple sources of data, and prepare business reviews and presentations. After completion of analysis the Senior Operations Analyst must be able to provide detailed and summary information to the management team and make recommendations using reports, charts, graphs and other analytical and presentation tools.Essential Duties & Responsibilities Drive the analytic needs of the business by working with key business stakeholders to develop well defined reporting requests that drive business value. Lead projects on an as needed basis.Provide regular status reporting Key Executives Develop KPI dashboards in OBIEE Perform adhoc business analysis for operations as needed Perform all lot traceability analysis to support operations and Quality Develop BI reports and dashboardsKnowledge, Skills & Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication. Self-motivated & Proactive Creative problem solver and critical thinker; able to bring a solution to bear without having to be asked. title: Senior Data Security Analyst
description: Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the world’s creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world. Team DescriptionOur Engineering team is working to simplify the way people work together. They’re building a family of products that handle over a billion files a day for people around the world. With our broad mission and massive scale, there are countless opportunities to make an impact.Role DescriptionOur security engineering team helps keep our users and their stuff safe. We protect Dropbox, counsel Dropboxers on challenging problems, and deal with novel issues every day while standing up for users and helping the company and product grow.Protecting the data of Dropbox and our users is essential to maintaining the trust of our users. We’re looking for a Senior Data Security analyst to join the Data Security team within the security engineering organization. This is an individual contributor role that will work across the company to help protect the data of Dropbox and our users. You will work to create data security policies, define roles and permissions, approve and audit access to sensitive data, and remediate any deviations from policy. You will help create a data security architecture that includes all corporate systems and use your technical background to extend visibility to those systems. You will work with our Legal, People, and Physical Security teams to support internal investigations. Finally, you will support or manage internal data security projects to help mature the data security program at Dropbox.ResponsibilitiesContinuously improve our data security detection and audit capabilities across all business systemsWrite queries and scripts to pull data from internal systems, analytics tools and databases in an effort to scope security projectsCreate rational policies for access to sensitive data and toolsWork with our engineering partner teams to build and manage data security toolsIdentify gaps in our data security posture and scope and manage projects to close those gapsSupport internal data security investigationsRequirements8+ years of data security, audit, or IT experienceStrong experience writing analytics queries and working within analytics toolsProven experience managing and working with log analysis and data loss prevention tools at scaleExperience auditing business tools like Zendesk, Salesforce, Workday, and homegrown databasesStrong ability to code in python, write regex statements, and work with source code management systems within the past 4 yearsExperience building role-based permission models in a rapidly changing environmentAbility to influence outcomes and drive results across engineering and non-engineering teamsStrong track record of creating processes that scaleBenefits and Perks100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time off Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

title: Signal Processing & Data Analyst
description: At GenapSys we are working to change the world of healthcare and diagnostics. At GenapSys, we are developing a DNA-sequencing technology that will revolutionize the world of healthcare. Our system will enable fast, accurate, and ultra-low cost genetic tests in order to better understand (and ultimately treat) genetic diseases such as Cancer, Parkinson’s, Diabetes, and Alzheimer's, just to name a few. GenapSys was founded by Dr. Hesaam Esfandyarpour and incubated over 6 years (2004-2010) at Stanford University.Our team brings together an incredibly diverse and multidisciplinary set of backgrounds and skills – from electrical and mechanical engineers to physicists, chemists, microfluidic engineers, molecular biologists, bioinformaticians, mathematicians and more. Together we will advance scientific and medical knowledge and improve human health through cheaper, faster, and more accurate DNA sequencing technologies. We are working cross-functionally to make a great impact in the world – join us on that mission!We’re looking for talented and passionate team players to join our fast-paced startup company. Specifically, we are looking for an exceptional Ph.D. level candidate who has experience in Signal Processing and Data Analysis with a strong track record or extensive publication list and proven product development record in either academic or industry settings. If you want to help change the current paradigm of DNA sequencing and contributor to the GenapSys vision and goals this job is for you!Responsibilities Develop signal processing algorithms to extract information from many biomedical sensors Develop DNA sequencing base calling algorithms Develop DOE (design of experiments) for troubleshooting and failure mode analysis Perform in-depth data analysis and present results and conclusions for characterization and modeling of a complex physical system on a chip Present written and oral reports and proposals to peers and management Required Qualifications PhD level candidate in electrical engineering, computational biology, physics, mathematics, statistics. 4+ years of experience either as a postdoc or in industry after receiving PhD degree. Expert in signal processing algorithm development. Expert in Python, C/ C++. Working knowledge of regression analysis, statistical estimation and signal detection theories. Experienced in implementing clustering algorithms, PCA analysis, and Markov models.Familiar with data analysis and characterization of physical systems. Has the ability to model, simulate and validate dynamic systems. Machine learning experience is a big plus.Innovative, driven, results-oriented and methodical with a successful track record. Detail oriented with strong documentation skills. Strong team player who is flexible, adaptable and the ability to collaborate within a multidisciplinary organization. Ability to manage work within tight timelines. What We Offer An amazing mission: Enabling everyone to decode the living world! Competitive compensation and stock options Competitive benefits: medical, dental and vision benefits for employees and dependents, fully sponsored life, short and long-term disability insurance, and 401(k) retirement savings plan. Free daily catered gourmet lunches and snacks Weekly fancy High Tea and happy hoursFree complex onsite gym membership Casual, but high-performing work environment A diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is an integral part of GenapSys' culture. We actively welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a great place to work. Join us and help us achieve our mission!Note To Recruiters And Placement AgenciesGenapsys does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any Genapsys employee. Genapsys will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered the property of Genapsys.

title: Information Technology & Data Analytics – Analyst/Associate (DOE)
description: Wilshire Associates Incorporated is seeking an information technology professional to join the Wilshire Private Markets (WPM) Group. WPM is a global private markets solutions provider, offering discretionary fund of funds and non-discretionary advisory services to institutional clients worldwide. WPM currently manages approximately $8 billion of institutional capital, including investments in private partnerships, direct co-investments and secondary limited partnership interests spanning all private market strategies. As information technology and data analytics have become an increasingly important area of focus for our business, this individual will work alongside the WPM investment and operations teams to manage the initial implementation, integration and integrity of third party software, databases, and data across functions.Successful candidates will be responsible for analysis, design, implementation and maintenance of WPM’s third-party software and database systems, including applications for its investment management, accounting and investor reporting functions. She/he will provide support for internal and external clients by developing, maintaining and enhancing existing systems and processes related to data gathering, quality, and consumption.Key Responsibilities Perform a full range of database support including the initial implementation and ongoing support of WPM’s third party data and software platform AltaReturn. Develop and maintain internal processes for data gathering, quality control and consumption. Limited custom application development. Understand and interpret users and project stakeholder’s ideas into specific technology solutions. Work closely with end users to develop and enhance solutions. Develop technical documentation. Knowledge of MS Azure Cloud. Strong proficiency with SQL and its variation among popular databases. Concepts of database and system security. Principles and practices of database administration (DBA). Principles and practices of research methodology and data analysis. Our Offer An international, dynamic, entrepreneurial work environment. Competitive compensation package, including a bonus opportunity. 3 weeks of vacation, 8 paid holidays per year. 401(k)/Roth 401(k)/Medical/Dental/Vision & Life insurance.Visit Www.wilshire.com For Additional Company Information.Wilshire Associates Incorporated is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran.Wilshire Associates Incorporated is an SEC registered investment adviser and required to track certain political contributions under Rule 206(4)-5. As such, you may be required to disclose your prior political contributions.No phone calls.Required SkillsRequired Experience

title: Financial Analyst
description: POSITION TITLE  |  Finanicial Analytics REPORTS TO  |  Controller STATUS/ CLASSIFICATION  |   FT Non-ExemptPOSITION SUMMARY The Financial Analyst will work with the finance and accounting team to provide timely and accurate financial reports and to contribute key business and financial insights, analysis, and actionable data to our internal departments. This person will be responsible for providing information and insights that drive key business decisions, helping to drive profitable growth and goal achievement. Additionally, the Analyst will assist the Controller and CFO with facilitation of forecasts and the annual budget planning process, working to help create and disseminate annual budgets by time period and geography. This position collaborates closely with all aspects of the organization.POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES Provide analytics to the Controller and CFO related to major spend categories, trends, and variances. Support winery operations teams to achieve and deliver strategic initiatives and track KPIs as a part of the DOMO dashboard. Act as project lead on DOMO card creation and analysis, reporting. Assist with Wholesale program forecasting and analysis/approval (Billbacks, etc). Provide sales reports and variance analysis for individual departments that include the following: depletions, flash reporting, weekly sales reporting, revenues/sales projections, trend reports, and allocation reporting. Assist in the development of and maintain KPI reports and DOMO dashboard. Develop and maintain sales program trackers. Assist with new report development as needed. Assist the Controller and CFO with annual budget and forecast development initiatives. Assist the Controller and CFO with the processes, timelines and execution of budgeting, forecasting, and strategic planning. Support internal departments with reports, presentation templates, insight, and assist in project execution. ANALYSIS & RECOMMENDATIONS  |  60% Assist with monthly financial performance analysis and quarterly reviews. Financial reports design and development using Microsoft NAV/Dynamics in conjunction with service provider. Inventory management & allocations analysis. Marketing program post program analysis. Assist with various reports development and insight. Ad hoc analytical projects (workflow, ROI, scenarios, etc.) among Finance, Marketing and Sales. Expense Analysis: Depletion Allowance (DA), Samples, Sales Promo, and T&E. Manage the depletion reporting process through VIP (item mapping, accuracy, ad hoc reporting). PLANNING, FORECASTING, AND GOAL SETTING  |  40%Assist the Controller and CFO with the Management of the development of the annual budget (expense budget, CAPEX, Balance Sheet).Manage the development of the quarterly forecast with Finance, Marketing and Sales.Follow up calls/emails.Manage the DA and Sample Plan.POSITION REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s Degree in finance or accounting preferred.Minimum 2-5 years’ experience in a relevant position.Expert Excel and PowerPoint user, well versed in planning and reporting systems.Ability to manage time and prioritize tasks and effectively communicate at all levels in the organization.Highly motivated, results oriented individual who excels in a dynamic environment.Proactively gains commitment and initiates action.Occasional lifting up to 25 lbs.Sitting, working at desk/personal computer for extended periods of time.Primary work environment is professional corporate office.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.SUCCESS FACTORS/JOB COMPETENCIES Is a well-rounded individual, who has successfully performed within a winery.Is intellectually curious and continuously challenges the status quo in search of a better way.Has an entrepreneurial spirit, acts now, does it today.Is competitive, wants to succeed.Is a strong leader with solid communication skills – interacts equally well with experienced senior leaders and new associates.Can clearly articulate business issues, is comfortable with back of the envelope analysis in support of timely decisions.Hands-on style, detail orientation and strong work ethic.Has a passion for the work and wants to have fun. title: Sr. Supply Chain Business Intelligence Analyst
description: At Niagara, we’re looking for Team Members who want to be part of achieving our mission to provide our customers the highest quality most affordable bottled water.Consider Applying Here, If You Want ToWork in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact. Fluency in at least one high level programming language such as C++ or Python is a plus.Ability to seek and obtain information from a wide range of sources and individuals both within, and outside of, the Supply Chain departmentMust be detail oriented with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and projects and complete assignments quickly and accurately.Excellent presentation, communication (both oral and written) and interpersonal skills.Require strong fundamental understanding of components of Business Analytics and Supply Chain OptimizationProven ability to think critically about subject matter, and provide meaningful insights after analysisEducationMinimum Required:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, Economics, or Supply ChainPreferred:Master's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, Economics, or Supply ChainCertification/LicenseRequired: NonePreferred: NoneForeign Language Required: None Required,Preferred: None,Any employment agency, person or entity that submits a résumé into this career site or to a hiring manager does so with the understanding that the applicant's résumé will become the property of Niagara Bottling, LLC. title: Credit Analyst
description: BlueVine is looking for a Credit Analyst to provide an exceptional borrower experience throughout the application process. This person will be responsible for gathering and analyzing data to verify the creditworthiness of the borrower. Credit analysts work alongside an experienced and motivated underwriting team and are exposed to all aspects of FinTech operations in a high-growth startup environment.ResponsibilitiesWork with potential business borrowers and review applications to verify credit qualification criteria and financial data assessmentAnalyze bank data, public data and conduct KYC on all applicants Identify and implement process improvements in the borrower application processAssist the Loan Servicing department in maintenance of loan files, including payoffs, and closing requirements QualificationsBA / BS degree in Business Administration, Finance, or similar1+ years of experience in customer service, credit analyst, consumer/business lending, personal banking, or similarStrong analytical and problem solving skillsPassion for delivering a great customer experienceImpeccable judgment and acute attention to detailTrack record of high-performanceFamiliarity with underwriting loans, financial statements, tax documents is a plusBlueVine’s mission is to help business owners succeed and thrive by making sure they have convenient access to capital for their everyday funding needs. We’ve helped thousands of businesses since we started in 2013, funding more than $1 billion in working capital through our pioneering online platform. Our invoice factoring product allows business to receive cash advances on their outstanding invoices, offering factoring lines of up to $5 million. Our business line of credit product, called Flex Credit, offers financing based on 6-month and 12-month payment terms, and credit lines of up to $250,000. Based in Redwood City, Calif., BlueVine is backed by leading venture capital firms.

title: Data Analyst
description: Our client is currently seeking a Data Analyst.We are looking for a self-sufficient, independent, self-starter and adaptable Data Analytic Consultant to join us on our journey to improve the member experience. You will help us discover information hidden in vast amounts of data.Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analysis, and building models to help provide actionable insights. You will provide support in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data.W-2 Candidates Only**Please contact Gabriel at glane@judge.com for immediate consideration!This Job Will Have The Following Responsibilities Provide data architectural leadership in developing enterprise data/process models, and logical/physical database designs.Provide data and database development, maintenance, and production support. Participate in IT and Business project to define system requirements.Qualifications & Requirements: Ability to provide actionable insights from data mining, statistical modeling, segmentation, customer profiling and quantitative/qualitative analyses with the goal of improving the member experience, while making health care more affordable. Ability to develop experience dashboards to monitor existing programs and ensure that execution is aligned with objectives In-depth and extensive knowledge of statistical techniques and tool including but not limited to regressions, cluster analysis, factor analysis, and survival analysis. Hands on experience with structured and unstructured data sets. Hands on experience with SQL, Alteryx, Excel, and Tableau. Excellent SQL skills including writing complex queries, and expertise in data warehousing, data services development and business intelligence tools. Expertise using Hadoop technologies is a plus. Excellent skills using statistical packages including Alteryx, SAS, R or Python for data processing and modeling. Excellent presentation, simplification and storytelling skills

Advanced Degree in Math, Physics, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics or any quantitative fields.Expert SQL experience required.Proficiency with business intelligence tools like Tableau, Alteryx, Cognos, Crystal Reports or similarExperience with scripting languages: R, Python, Perl or programming languages.SalesForce knowledge is a big plusKnowledge and past experience in Finance, Accounting, Project Management.Experience with in-depth data analysis, data profiling and modelingExperience developing and designing aggregates used for modeling and analysisStrong understanding of statistics, descriptive data analysis and Data analysis techniques.A proven resource in developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures, and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines.Don't delay. Join the Software Resources team today!Software Resources specializes in connecting talented IT professionals with challenging job opportunities that transform jobs into careers. To meet our clients hiring needs, we continuously source talented IT Professionals with all levels of expertise and in all disciplines. We offer world class major medical, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) with match, short term disability, Life Insurance and AD&D. title: People Data Analyst
description: Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the world’s creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world. Team DescriptionOur Recruiting & People team grows and develops the Dropbox family. We find, hire, and support the people who will shape our product and our company. We believe people do their best work when they’re happy, so we work to make Dropbox a place where everyone can thrive.Role DescriptionWe're looking for someone who loves crafting, managing, and analyzing people surveys, digging into data, building analytics capability, and communicating HR and process recommendations to various audiences. You have the ability to balance multiple priorities, deep analytical rigor, and excellent interpersonal skills that can be tailored to cross-functional audiences at every level. As a People Data Analyst you will sit on our People Analytics & HR Technology team.ResponsibilitiesBe a leading authority on survey tooling, design, methodology, and analysis: work with partners to design surveys that are statistically sound and built to appropriately measure desired constructs. Use expertise in survey research to figure out the right audiences, sampling strategies, triggering events, and cadenceAnalyze survey data and other people data to identify trends, conduct root cause analysis, and find opportunities to improve people practicesWork with stakeholders to make recommendations and build action plans based on findingsSupport analytics projects focused on understanding drivers of performance, productivity, and happiness at Dropbox - either through survey analytics or other analytical techniquesBuild people analytics capability in the organization through data literacy trainings focused on root cause analysis, interpreting people data, storytelling with data, and action planningPrepare documents and materials for leadership meetings, reviewing results and modeling different strategic options for future people initiativesRequirements5+ years of data analytics in HR, Marketing, or Sales or equivalent experience in user research and survey design and analyticsExperience in survey design, analytics, and action planningProgram and project management expertiseExperience with different survey tools (e.g., Qualtrics, Glint, SurveyMonkey)Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel manipulating very large datasets is requiredComfort with ambiguity, uncertainty, and a dynamic business landscapeWillingness to shift from high-level critical thinking to stepping in and helping to drive implementation alongside functional teamsBasic knowledge in HR processesBA/BS preferably in Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Marketing Research, Behavioral Economics, Social Sciences (e.g., Anthropology, Sociology), or Data ScienceBenefits and Perks100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time off Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

title: Senior Data Analyst

title: Senior Data Engineer
location: 218A Clara Street , San Francisco, CA 94107, US
description: We are looking for a driven Senior Data Engineer, who is passionate about working with huge data sets to answer critical business questions. This position will build tools that collect, centralize and curate large volumes of data. Working closely with our Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, they will also build and maintain real-time data pipelines to support machine learning and predictive scoring algorithms.  As a subject matter expert in data architecture, they will mentor other engineers and team members to be self-serving.Roles and Responsibilities: Lead the development and maintenance of a scalable data pipeline Gather requirements, scope, architect, develop, build, release, and maintain data oriented projects for different parts of the organization, considering performance, stability, and an error-free operation Identify and resolve pipeline issues and discover opportunities for improvement Architect scalable and reliable data solutions to move data across systems from multiple products in nearly real time Create business dashboards in Looker Help evaluate new tools and technologies to keep technology stack at the cutting edge Help debug critical issues in complex designs or coding schemes Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and partner with other internal teams to solve difficult problems creating a better customer experience The Candidate: Solid understanding of CS concepts such as common data structures and algorithms Working with cross-functional teams and business customers 5+ years of experience building pipelines for processing large amounts of data Proficiency with Python and other scripting languages Solid experience with Athena, MySQL, Hadoop, Looker Extensive hands on experience with AWS and cloud-based computing such as EC2, EMR, Kinesis and Redshift You have built a data pipeline and the infrastructure required to deploy machine learning algorithms and real-time analytics in low latency environments Understanding of build systems, and other software configuration tools

title: Senior Data Management Analyst
description: About DexComFounded in 1999, DexCom, Inc. provides continuous glucose monitoring technology to help patients and their clinicians better manage diabetes. Since our inception, we have focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions for people with diabetes - while empowering our community to take control of diabetes.Summary: As a Senior Data Management Analyst at DexCom, you are a key contributor to the data platform driving the operations manufacturing, test, and reporting processes. By tapping into your data management expertise, you are responsible for design and development of the manufacturing test cases and test data that support the software development and verification process, reports that support production operations, pilot plant labs, and a variety of qualification systems, data workflow that support manufacturing data integration between various systems. You are a strong communicator, independent thinker and team player. You will work with cross-functional teams to define the requirement, lead the data development while ensuring record compliance at every step: bringing to light the data-driven insight of a multi-site manufacturing floor.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Develop test case and test data using mathematical methods for manufacturing production process needs. Work with database engineers to design databases using MS SQL Server. Production support, document and troubleshoot the data issues in an FDA-compliant manner. Follow software development process and qualification systems, develop qualification materials, including SRS, software validation and verification protocol and software validation report. Managing QA database environments. Gather requirement for Manufacturing dashboard. Design and develop reports using SSRS or Tableau. Architect data integration with the existing infrastructure and continuous improvement. Act as data liaison between cross-functional teams, closely collaborate with R&D, Operations, Quality Assurance, Contract Manufacturers, and other stakeholders to facilitate data access in terms of reporting, system analysis, and data integration. Required Qualifications 3+ years' experience as database developer. Experience with SQL Server 2012+. Proficient with database modeling and T-SQL programming. Familiar with waterfall and agile development approach. Exposure to test-driven development and experience with all test phases. Working knowledge with data management and data processing flowcharting techniques, and other tools, such as Jira, Jama and confluence. Good understanding of the organizations goals and objectives. Creative problem solver with attention to detail. Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Strong English written and oral communication skills Preferred Qualifications Working knowledge and other data platforms such as AWS, Google cloud or Microsoft Azure. Education Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Systems Analysis or related experience. Travel Required: NoAn Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com .To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Dexcom. Only authorized staffing and recruiting agencies may use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes on specific requisitions. Dexcom does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to the Talent Acquisition team, Dexcom employees or any other company location. Dexcom is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

title: Senior Data Analyst (Internal Audit)
description: 182148 Senior Data Analyst (Internal Audit) (Open)Job Title: Senior Data Analyst (Internal Audit)About The Role-You WillDevelop a strong understanding of key company systems and data sources.Identify business objectives and risks of the processes/functions being reviewed; and perform on-going data analytics to summarize and highlight risks, trends, patterns, and abnormalities using business intelligence technologies.Query data using SQL, Business Objects, and other data mining tools, and verify the completeness and accuracy of data extracted.Perform advanced data analytics and develop visualizations and continuous auditing dashboards using tools such as ACL, Tableau, Alteryx, Hadoop, Power BI, etc.Provide historical, current, and predictive views of business operations and risks, and develop preliminary findings and realistic recommendations for in-depth review, investigation, and root cause analysis.Quantify the impact of findings, present results of data analytics, and work with Management to develop acceptable solutions to address issues or gaps identified and follow-up with management to ensure remediation is adequately implemented.Prepare accurate, logical and detailed work-papers clearly describing the work performed, results and conclusions.Assist in maintaining a consultative relationship with business management and staff, serving as an Internal Audit Services (IAS) liaison.Assist team members as needed in sharing technical data analytic skills and special expertise with the other members of Internal Audit Services.About Our GroupThe Internal Audit Services (IAS) team provides independent, objective assurance and advisory services designed to add value. IAS is responsible for performing audits of Seagate’s operations with an emphasis on identifying and assisting Management in minimizing risks. All audits include the use of data analytics when possible to support risk assessments and audit conclusions. Additionally, in support of audit planning activities, IAS performs continuous auditing and monitoring through the use of data analytics.About YouAnalytical MindsetStrong Attention to DetailGood Persuasive CommunicatorSelf-MotivatedTeam PlayerProven Ability to Meet DeadlinesYour Experience IncludesUnderstanding data governance concepts including the people, process, and technology required for handling company dataPrevious experience in data analytics, information systems, SQL programming language, and auditing.Strong knowledge of Computer Assisted Audit Procedures (CAATs) including ACL, Tableau, Alteryx, Hadoop, Power BI, Excel, etc.Understanding and working through the complexities of structured and unstructured data from disparate sourcesSound judgement in analyzing problems, with the ability to distinguish between relevant and irrelevant informationAbility to handle sensitive / confidential matters in a tactful / discrete mannerExperience with Oracle Systems and related applications preferred.Certifications, such as CIA, CISA, CFE, CPA, or comparable is a plusBachelor's degree in relevant fields and/or equivalent work experienceLocation: Cupertino, CaliforniaTravel: domestic and international travel up to 25%Job Family: Professional

title: Scientific Data & Analysis Positions
description: Description INNOVIM, LLC is seeking a science data processing engineer who has experience working with science data processing system and can follow procedures for steps in data processing. Employee will be responsible for setting up data processing operations, managing input and output, and reporting to project lead regularly.This is a leading role with our company in supporting the Data Systems Implementation and Operations Program at the NASA/CALTECH Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California.INNOVIM provides science and engineering support to some of the government’s most important data systems impacting weather, public safety and space sciences. Candidates will provide leadership to INNOVIM’s program with JPL.The DSIO program provides information system development lifecycle, including supporting roles of systems engineering, operations, data management and archive to augment the JPL workforce in support of both flight and non-flight activities. title: Marketing Analyst
description: Who is Zume Pizza?We are innovators and food lovers obsessed with delivering the best food in the universe. Our passion for pizza (and technology) has led us to reinvent dozens of things about the way we create and deliver our food, from Bruno, one of our robots who puts our pies into the ovens, to our fleet of custom-built food trucks, to our patented compostable packaging. Food = love. We have an employee-first philosophy and we’re deeply committed to investing in the happiness, satisfaction and success of everyone we work with. We are looking for a team who feels the same way! We believe that our employees are our greatest strength and that is why we offer free health insurance for Zume employees and for their families. Zume Pizza is backed by Silicon Valley’s premier investors and we are poised for explosive growth. The RoleWe are looking for a Marketing Analyst to perform research and gather data to analyze the performance of all marketing programs. The Analyst will be responsible evaluating the effectiveness of all marketing programs and assist with forecasting. What you'll be doing: Analyze all marketing programs looking at: CAC/LTV ratios, ROI, open rates, CTRs, conversion rates, heat maps and videos Assist Marketing Manager with forecasting Develop customized marketing funnels based on findings Sales analyses Market segmentation (drip campaigns) Market survey development and analysis Help to flesh out buyer personas and provide demographic and psychographic info Competitive pricing analysis Point person for industry benchmarks Requirements You LOVE pizza 2-5 years proven track record in a Marketing Analytics role Resourceful, able to self manage Experience with SQL, Google Adwords, FB for Business, Google Analytics, Hotjar, Experian CPG experience a plus Excellent data analytics, communication and presentation skills Team player who is a self-starter and is able to thrive in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment BS/BA in related field

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Poshmark, Inc. seeksSenior Data Analyst to work at its office in Redwood City, CA.Are you the type of person who feels they could solve any problem if they just had the right data? Are you curious by nature? We are seeking a strong analyst to help us better understand and manage the Poshmark business through rigorous data analysis and insights.The ideal candidate will bring a strong business mindset for approaching problems and have basic technical skills in data extraction and manipulation. This is the perfect opportunity for someone to gain valuable experience and drive decisions at a high-growth, mobile commerce start-up.Responsibilities Perform operations research analysis duties in furtherance of the company’s data extraction and manipulation efforts.Formulate and apply mathematical modeling and other optimizing methods to develop and interpret business information and the key metrics that measure the performance of the company’s growth campaigns.Partner operations to collect and analyze data and contribute to growth analytics projects focused on delivering insights and dashboards.Extract required data from internal systems, develop reports, and analyze them to derive insights and understand and monitor key trends in relevant metrics.Perform validation and testing of data models to ensure data quality.Desired Skills Requires Bachelor’s degree in Operations Research or Management Information Systems, plus at least 2 years of experience in job offered or alternate occupation of Analyst or Consultant. In lieu of a Bachelor’s degree plus 2 years of experience, Employer will accept no degree plus 4 years of work experience in job offered or alternate occupation.Requires two (2) years of experience in the following: Building an analytical solution framework by defining scope, data requirements, key metrics and business goals;Extracting datasets required for analysis and checking for data quality/integrity issues;Applying sophisticated analytical techniques and statistical tools to analyze data; Building reports and visualizations to help summarize the analysis and share findings with clients.Why Poshmark?Founded in 2011, Poshmark is the largest social marketplace for fashion where anyone can buy, sell and share their style with others. Poshmark’s mission is to make shopping simple and fun by connecting people around a shared love of fashion, while empowering entrepreneurs to become the next generation of retailers. Recognized as the go-to shopping destination for millennials, Poshmark’s community of over three million Seller Stylists help shoppers discover the perfect look from over 25 million items and 5,000 brands. The company is backed by the world’s leading investment firms and venture capital institutions including Mayfield, Menlo Ventures, GGV Capital, Temasek, Inventus Capital, Uncork Capital, Union Grove Venture Partners, Shea Ventures and AngelList. For more information, please visit , or find us on Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest and Snapchat.Here’s What We’ll Set You Up With A team that is invested in your career growth and trainingCompetitive salary and equity, based on experienceFully sponsored health, dental and vision plansA 13” MacBook Air and smartphone reimbursementWork alongside world-class talentFlexible Vacation / Paid Time Off PolicyParental LeaveHealthy and exciting lunches and snacks offered dailyPersonal Style Encouraged (or not, whatever you’re in to)

title: Data Analyst - San Diego
description: Veyo is using its platform and app-based transportation services to reinvent the medical logistics world. Our company is using technology to pioneer new operational models to help make transportation more powerful and more reliable for the healthcare industry.When you work at Veyo, you’re helping to solve one of the nation’s growing healthcare challenges -- ensuring patients get to and from their medical appointments, safely and on-time. We are using smart design and innovative technology to make patient transportation safer and more connected. In the process, we’re transforming the entire industry.Primary Responsibilities Product Analytics: Work with our product management team on product analytics; identifying the business metrics the product will impact and measuring the product’s impact before and after product releases.Business Analytics: Work with our Operations and executive teams to create easy-to-use reports and analytics to untangle ambiguous business problems and find the insights that drive operational excellence.Client Reporting: Work with our Operations team to create client facing reports used by healthcare providers, passengers and drivers.Problem Solving: Write queries and perform ad hoc data analysis to keep the nerve center of our operations engine running at full speed; using your analytics skills to help dig into different business problems, offer solutions and make data driven decisions. Our ideal candidates will have some or all of the following:2+ years of work experience developing a best-in-class understanding of databases, data relationships and data integrity.BS in Math, Physics, CS, Statistics, Economics or other quantitative field is required, MS preferred.Comfortable and experienced working with large data sets.Expert SQL experience.Experienced in data analytics and visualization using R, Tableau or similar BI tools.Data analysis skills in a business context with demonstrated success in presenting large data sets in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action.Development experience in designing and delivering end-to-end data warehousing/business intelligence solutions.Strong oral and written communication skills; extremely attentive to detail.We like the following personality traits: Friendly, social, outgoing, positive, passionate, cool under pressure, detail-oriented, deadline oriented, quick learner, multi-tasker, great sense of humor.We’re looking for people that love the opportunity to be involved in strategy and management at the top level, but also aren’t scared to get their hands dirty and do what needs to be done to make things happen! We move quickly, and our team doesn’t know the meaning of “not my job.” We want people that want to get things done and can check their ego at the door.We thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position. This position is only for candidates legally allowed to work in the US. EOE.Veyo is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Additionally, Veyo participates in the E-Verify program for all locations.

title: Data Analyst
description: DescriptionEvery day at Perspecta, we enable hundreds of thousands of people to take on our nation’s most important work. We’re a company founded on a diverse set of capabilities and skills, bound together by a single promise: we never stop solving our nation’s most complex challenges. Our team of engineers, analysts, developers, investigators, integrators and architects work tirelessly to create innovative solutions. We continually push ourselves—to respond, to adapt, to go further. To look ahead to the changing landscape and develop new and innovative ways to serve our customers.Perspecta works with U.S. government customers in defense, intelligence, civilian, health care, and state and local markets. Our high-caliber employees are rewarded in many ways—not only through competitive salaries and benefits packages, but the opportunity to create a meaningful impact in jobs and on projects that matter.Perspecta’s talented and robust workforce—14,000 strong—stands ready to welcome you to the team. Let’s make an impact together.Perspecta has an immediate need in our US Public Sector group for a Data Analyst in Seaside, CA or Alexandria, VA Work under minimal direction; may lead small teams. Participate in proposals, feasibility studies, and new business development. Produce data dictionary for complex database and projects. Write complex database query, simple DB procedures, functions or packages to pull relevant data for analysis. Produce reports with medium complexity. Produce simple dimensional models.QualificationsEducation and Experience Required:Secret Or DOD Public Trust Clearance6+ years experience, can Produce data dictionary, physical and logical data model. Experienced with RDBMS. Experienced with the normalization process for data models.Knowledge And Skills Required Utilize DB tools and IDE to write complex database query, produce reports with medium complexity and prepare the date model. Structured analysis techniques (decomposition). Abstract detailed information; apply creativity for solving complex problems. Display superior verbal / written communication. Build internal and external relationships and work collaboratively to manage scope, schedule, budgets and expectations.EEO Tagline: Perspecta is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

title: Senior Analyst, Data Science
description: Job Title: Senior Analyst, Data Science Job Location: Los Angeles,CA Duration: 12 months  Our client a leading Video game publisher are actively investing in its audience capabilities in a way that will evolve the application of their data for use in product development, marketing, and monetization. They are looking for a thought-leader in analytical processes to lead this evolution.The Senior analyst will work closely with Product, Marketing, Studios, Engineering and Technology organizations to deliver world-class advanced analytics analyses of marketing activities and estimating their impact on sales. These projects will include, but are not limited to, Media Mix Optimization, Analysis of Covariance (test & control), Cluster Analysis, Unsupervised and Supervised Learning, Attribution Modeling of disaggregate event-stream data. What you’ll do: • Be the media measurement thought-leader and own the definition of KPI measuring, providing recommendations on new statistical/machine-learning approaches based on research and testing. • Design, build, validate and socialize advanced attribution models to optimize media mix • Develop meaningful cluster analysis based on both supervised and unsupervised learning models, driving actionable segmentation recommendations • Integrate with existing machine learning pipelines on propensity scoring and LTV projection to granularize the understanding of user journey and customer value • Build and improve ETL pipelines in support of data aggregation, movement and analysis • Establish through testing and experimentation the right statistical approach to delivering analytics insights • Provide thoroughly documented work products to enable smooth operations in production • Interpret and visualize model estimates and diagnostics • Work with senior management to answer strategic business questions through the use of behavioral data What you’ll bring: • 5+ years of experience in database mining/marketing with very large, complex and multi-dimensional datasets. • 2+ years of direct experience working in ad-tech with a proven track record of media mix optimization • Thorough understanding and ability to apply supervised and unsupervised learning models. • Must be able to synthesize disparate data to mine and communicate insights • Excellent collaboration and communication skills with a proven track record of working across all levels of the organization. • Experience with large individual customer behavioral data sets (gaming, retail, financial services) and expertise in communication channel best practices, including multi-channel marketing. • Technical mastery in advanced database mining tools such as SQL and SAS/R/Python (any of the three) with the ability to coach and train others on best practice. • Preferred experience working with Data Management Platforms, such as Adobe Audience Manager • Exceptional data analysis in Excel including ability to write macros

title: UDAAP Program Data Analytics & Emerging Risk Team - Compliance Consultant 5
description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We're looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you'll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas credit risk, operational risk and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.The Responsible Banking Compliance Team is part of the Consumer Compliance Team and is responsible for compliance risk oversight of UDAAP and Fair Lending across the enterprise.This is an exciting opportunity for a Compliance Consultant to join the Responsible Banking Compliance team in a leadership role to drive the development and implementation of the data analytics and emerging risk team in support of an effective and sustainable enterprise UDAAP Compliance Program. This person will play a critical role in developing, implementing and executing a sustainable, defined program for data analytics to proactively identify areas of emerging UDAAP risk, and to establish ongoing reporting on UDAAP risks and related issue management. This team will coordinate across the enterprise to work with business, risk and compliance leaders to fully implement a program to effectively identify emerging areas of emerging UDAAP risk, taking into account regulatory expectations and risk management practices. This position will be responsible in the building of the UDAAP data analytics and emerging risk program on well-defined and sustainable processes, supported by appropriate methodology, and to develop effective compliance reporting for the enterprise. This position will play a critically important role in assessing and mitigating UDAAP risks across the enterprise.The UDAAP Compliance Data Analytics and Emerging Risk Compliance Consultant 5 will be responsible to lead development of a data analytics and emerging risk program in support of an effective and sustainable enterprise UDAAP Compliance Program, and will take implementation through to sustainable business as usual with an effective and sustainable program.Responsibilities include Lead development, implementation and ongoing execution of a UDAAP data analytics and emerging risk program focused on proactively identifying potential UDAAP risks in large, highly complex business areas across the enterprise. Drive the coordination with senior compliance and business leaders, including heads of businesses, Wells Fargo Audit Services and the Law Department to develop and implement the UDAAP data analytics and emerging risk program, including coordination to identify emerging UDAAP risks. Drive the formulation and implementation of procedures and controls in support of the UDAAP data analytics and emerging risk program, as well as the process to identify emerging UDAAP risks. Drive the formulation and implementation of procedures for the analysis of reporting and underlying data from multiple vantage points to proactively identify area of potential UDAAP risk, as well as analysis of data quality for improvement and development of metrics for ongoing monitoring of potential UDAAP risk. Drive the coordination with Testing and Validation Center of Excellence to develop UDAAP testing activities as needed to address emerging risks, including establishing schedules and scopes, coordinating materials for specific activities and targeted reviews, supporting back end research as needed, and working with business on results and recommendations. Coordinate with New Business Initiatives (NBI) Process, working with enterprise systems of record (i.e. SHRP, RANBI), Third Party Compliance Oversight team in developing and implementing the UDAAP Compliance Program. Make key decisions guided by broad enterprise policies and objectives and guidance from compliance leadership, and coordinating activities across multiple businesses and risk areas, involving multiple systems and operating platforms. Responsible for issue management related to the UDAAP data analytics and emerging risk program, including coordination of targeted research and root cause analysis. Support strong and constructive relationships with regulators and WFAS. Mentor other members of Compliance, Risk and Business teams. Effectively managing change and creating a culture of “compliance awareness” where all team members share in accountability.Preferred locationNC – Charlotte; CA – San Francisco; MN – Minneapolis; IA – Des Moines; OPEN to other locations throughout the U.S.Required Qualifications10+ years of experience in compliance, operational risk management (includes audit, legal, credit risk, market risk, or the management of a process or business with accountability for compliance or operational risk), or a combination of both; or 10+ years of IT systems security, business process management or financial services industry experience, of which 5+ years must include direct experience in compliance, operational risk management, or a combination of bothDesired QualificationsAdvanced Microsoft Office skillsExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyAbility to interact with all levels of an organizationA BS/BA degree or higherExperience with governance and oversight requirements for regulatory and risk reportingExperience communicating in both written and verbal formats with senior executive-level leadersLeadership skills including the ability to influence effectively in a matrix environmentExperience successfully escalating complex issues and tracking follow-through to completionExposure to Wells Fargo s Shared Risk Platform (SHRP)Ability to work with limited supervisionExperience developing improvement processes and implementation strategiesLeadership skills including; coaching, training, and mentoringStrong root cause analysis skillsOther Desired Qualifications Extensive knowledge of risk-based regulatory compliance including the industry and laws and regulations that apply to areas of responsibility Strong operational skills and experience executing on implementation of complex initiatives Strong skills in coordinating across many business lines and working in an environment with multiple systems and processes Certifications or additional training applicable to areas of responsibility such as CRCM, CAMS, CIA, etc. UDAAP experience/expertiseDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.Reference Number 5420682-2

title: Scientist, Assays Design & Data Analytics (40)
description: Scientist – Assays design & Data analyticsHiring Manager: Assays and HTP LeaderJob DescriptionWe are seeking a knowledgeable senior scientist with experience in automated assay and high-throughput protein production. The candidate will be expected to establish the assay and HTP production group to assist in antibody lead generation using state-of-the-art automated platforms.Specific Responsibilities Establish a high functioning assay and protein production group. Streamline hybridoma, antibody hit identification, and functional assays. Leverage automation to scale routine assays. Establish an automated high-throughput protein production platform. Interface with multiple discovery projects and matrix teams across the organization. Excellent written and oral skills are necessary Accomplish goals under project team time linesRequirements Ph.D. in Cell Biology, Immunology, Molecular Biology, or related field with 4+ years’ experience or an advanced degree with 8+ years relevant experience. Extensive experience in homogeneous (HTRF), plate-bound, flow cytometry, and imaging based cellular assay formats. Experience in cell based immune activation assays is desirable. Experience in using automated systems to express and purify small-scale proteins from mammalian expression systems is required. Knowledge and experience in antibody structure-function and hybridoma screening is desirable. Excellent time management, record keeping and organizational skills. Demonstrated ability to work in a multidisciplinary biologics discovery team.

title: Operations Analyst - Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles
description: Are you interested in joining a progressive Hotel Management Company that promotes unlimited career growth from within? How about a jump start to a career in Hotel Operations?  If so, we have an amazing opportunity for you! We are currently searching for a bi-lingual (Mandarin Chinese and English speaking Operations Analyst to be based out of our Sheraton Gateway LAX Hotel in Los Angeles, CA! The Operations Analyst will directly assist the Chief Operating Officer and Senior Operations team in operating hotel and resort assets across the United States. The purpose of the position is to impact two areas. First to assist in the completion of operations related projects and help facilitate communication amongst the team (which the majority are remote office based). Second is to create a pipeline of future senior executives for our company that have the high level understanding of our culture and systems as they garnered additional position experiences. It is expected from this role you will go on to a management role in Operations and or an Assiant GM Role in one of our hotels. Duties include, but are not limited to, the following: Analyst to the Chief Operating Officer and members of the Senior Operations Team Operations:Daily review & operation of PHG portfolio: 50 +/- hotels across multiple asset classes in the US and Caribbean, workforce of 12,000 +/- and annual revenue generation of $900M +/- Direct daily support to COO for projects, problem resolution, and operational value enhancement initiatives Annual/ongoing budgeting and forecasting of operations for individual properties and multiple property funds Sales & Marketing, Revenue Management & E Commerce: Assist with sell strategy reviews for underperforming assets with corporate, regional, and property team members Assist with Sales and Revenue Management Initiatives i.e.; Direct Sales, P.R., Advertising, & E Commerce Capital Projects & Design Process: Liaison and analyst for COO and senior operations team with ownership during the analysis and execution of value-add capital projects Asset Transitions and New DevelopmentsAssist in the transition of assets into and out of the managed portfolio Assisted in the conceptualizing, underwriting, and execution of new hotels and restaurants Owner & Brand Services RelationsLiaison between PHG, capital partners, asset managers, and brand partners to maintain unilateral strategy Other TasksAssist senior members of the team on various a wide range of tasks during the week Report on all properties Guest Satisfaction and Online E Commerce Scores/Rankings Assist on transition of property management into the Pyramid family Assist in purchasing and compliance for new industry wide standards Assist Business Development with data gathering and interpretationRequirements:The ideal Operations Analyst candidate will bring the following required, desired and optional assets to the company: Bilingual in both Mandarin Chinese and English required. 4 year Undergraduate Hospitality School Degree or 1-3 years of on-property hotel operations experience. Desire to to be on a career path to becoming a General Manager and more with a progressive and fast growing management company. Highly proficient with Microsoft Office. Good communication skills especially corporate communication to a broad audience. Strong analytic skills in both hospitality operation and overall asset valuation. Very strong time management abilities due to multitude of projects. The Operations Analyst may from time to time be asked to perform other detailed functions that have not been addressed here that are reasonable and within the scope of his/her job.

title: Hospital Senior Financial Analyst

title: ArcGIS Data Scientist Product Engineer - Living Atlas
description: OverviewDo you enjoy turning data into meaningful information products to make a positive difference in the world? Are you the person who others come to when they need ArcGIS help to clean or transform data? If so, you should consider working at Esri to help build the ArcGIS Living Atlas of the World. The Living Atlas is the largest geospatial data collection in the world, is widely used across the ArcGIS platform, and is fast becoming the backbone of web GIS. As a data scientist for the team, you will be involved in building and creating new KPIs for the planet using live feed information from satellites, real time sensors, weather models, and opendata sources.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with a small team to develop, curate, and publish global datasets as web services to support mapping and analysisIntegrate new data sources, update existing services with new data, and help innovate new methodologies for publishing and consuming the Living Atlas servicesInvestigate emerging trends and techniques for modeling live feed information to better serve the needs of the ArcGIS communityBuild and curate content that enables the GIS community to work effectively, solve problems, and make better decisionsPrepare documentation, blogs, and white papers on analytic and publishing methods and trendsTeam with customers such as NOAA, USDA, NCAR, NASA, and other key content building organizations to help bring their data to life in the Living AtlasSupport Esri’s development teams to integrate Living Atlas services across the ArcGIS platformRequirements1-3 years of experience with high level programming languages such as Python or Java2+ years of experience with ArcGIS software, particularly geoprocessing tools in the data management, analysis, remote sensing, spatial analyst, and statistical toolboxesStrong communication skills; ability to effectively present and document relevant details about the data behind Living Atlas services to usersExperience managing and analyzing large, complex datasetsAbility to design and implement production workflows for real time data updatesKnowledge of the latest theories, concepts, and statistical methods for classification and evaluation of geographic data, including uncertainty and confidence measuresUnderstanding of machine learning as well as deep learning techniques and algorithms such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, CNNs, RNNs, LSTMsBachelor's or master's in data science, information technology, computer science, GIS, or related discipline, depending on position levelAbout ESRIOur passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email humanresources@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address.

title: Technical Data Analyst
description: Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and it’s for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience.We’re looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; you’re passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, aren’t afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.That's where you come in.As Technical Data Analyst, you'll provide expertise into bridging business and product needs with data solutions. As Riot strives to be a data informed company, you’ll ensure the quality of the data and the solutions provided. You’ll be integral in defining and maintaining data quality, in providing solutions for data in flight and at rest.You Are Data-experienced: over the years, you've earned scars and stripes designing, implementing and managing data systems for mission critical, large-scale applications; you understand data through-and-through; you have recommendations on how to ingest, model, and configure databases and tables to enable efficient access based on project requirements Analytical: you're able to expediently identify and analyze problems using a variety of intuitive, logical, and creative methods, but you don't spin your wheels too much, instead moving quickly to implement solutions Business savvy: you can think about data as a product; you understand it is a resource that is valuable to a company and therefore managed properly; as a consumer of data you can also view data from a user's point-of-view; you can help establish and measure data quality, data access, data compliance and you can tell that story to both engineers and stakeholders of data Collaborative: you're comfortable working through ambiguity, seeking out value, working without close supervision. You communicate effectively with the stakeholders to seek out the best data solutions. You're comfortable operating behind enemy lines, clearing the problem's fog of war, providing relevant intel to aid in decision making Diverse: your skillset is broad, born from a need of adopting whatever tech was relevant to solve a problem. You use the command line to quickly bend messy data to your will. Python or other programming languages are the cauldron in which you convert data to gold Technical: you want to work in the kitchen where the data is made; you have no problem working with engineers and are curious about data systems and how data goes from an event to rest and all the transforms in-between while in-flight Player-focused: as a gamer yourself, you know the importance of listening to player needs, especially the implicit needs that can only be uncovered by analyzing and understanding player data You Will Function as the Subject Matter Expert on enterprise data and set the standard on how to troubleshoot data issues, how to profile source data, how to build out scalable data quality checks, how to best meet business needs with data Work with data in HDFS and Vertica, understand data in a distributed system Help support and optimize our data ecosystem; be familiar with ETLs; have experience in one scripting language; be comfortable with Linux/Unix environment Work with data in real-time streaming, understand data pipeline in the cloud environment; have experience with Kafka, ElasticSearch or similar tools Have high aptitude in SQL; be an expert about database tech like MySQL, Postgres and NoSQL, etc Support and understand the story-telling for data consumers; be familiar with data visualization tools like Tableau and Kibana, etcEnsure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services; optimize performance of database and data warehouse infrastructure Work with architects, product managers, and engineers to ensure adherence to best practices and data standards Collaborate with analysts and data scientists as a front line contact for Big Data to help them extract even more value from data, and to help the engineers set data up for maximum value Act as the technical point of contact for architectural changes and improvements to a world-class data and analytics infrastructure Don’t forget to include a resume and cover letter. We receive a lot of applications, but we’ll notice a fun, well-written intro that shows us you take play seriously.

title: Data Integration Analyst
description: About The TeamAs the market leader in the online real estate industry, Zillow Group runs off of public records data. Our Data Services team is responsible for gathering, managing and delivering this data to the Zillow enterprise. We work with inconsistent sources of data and standardize them so they can be consumed by the rest of our organization.About The RoleZillow Group's Data Services Team in Irvine is looking for an exceptional Data Integration Analyst to help us deliver industry-best, high-quality data to our consumers. As a member of our team, you ll be part of one of the fastest growing and highly visible teams at Zillow Group. If you re looking for a challenge and want to work at an awesome company with amazing opportunities to learn and develop your skills, we welcome you to apply!Get to know usZillow Group houses a portfolio of the largest and most vibrant real estate and home-related brands on the web and mobile. We encourage one another at every level, and our efforts are supported by employee-driven, world-class benefits that enable us to enjoy our lives outside the office while building fulfilling careers that impact millions of individuals every day.Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. title: Data Analyst
