title: Account Analyst
description: Are you a data guru? Do you love garnering actionable insights that impact business decisions? Then BDSmktg is looking for you to join our team!   PURPOSE: The Account Analyst is a qualitatively-oriented position with analytical skills to develop strategic insights and tactical learnings in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. The purpose of this position is to be primary owner of all reporting and analytics for multiple programs. This position will focus on evaluating metrics and data from field execution data and external sources, and building a visual interpretation of the data. Further, this position will be responsible for analyzing the data; such as trend analysis, coverage model analysis, sharing strategic insights, and making actionable recommendations based on findings.   ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Collaborate and consult with client, internal account team, and Business Intelligence staff on regular basis to assess client needs and deliver robust data capture methodology, tools, and reporting packages Engage with field staff and account team on dedicated basis to gather insights and depth of program knowledge to enhance value of data being interpreted Assess trends and present insights and recommendations to both client and program management, highlighting opportunities to maximize marketing effectiveness Convert business problems into analytic projects with well-defined deliverables Proactively drive new reporting/analysis (measures, key success factors, metrics) and make recommendations to the account team Interpret data and analysis for incremental business and re-measure to proactively identify and size business opportunities Perform on-going data analysis in support of ad-hoc and standard account and customer requests, while maintaining the integrity of the data. Integrate external data sources for comparison to program data to assess effectiveness of activity Using available data sources, create data visualization dashboards, PPT, Word and Excel client reports that are content rich, actionable, and provide an accurate representation of client’s products and services in the channel Manage field data capture, coverage model analysis/ ROI analysis and tools, program analysis and evaluation Other tasks as requested by management   EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree in related quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Econometrics, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research); advanced degree preferred Minimum 3 years of data analysis experience or prior work in an analytical role Experience functioning in an analyst capacity within the retail environment or company Experience with a broad of research methodologies; knowledge in coverage model analysis, quality assurance and report analysis Advanced Excel, Access, and SQL skills; experience in Tableau, Power BI, or other data visualization tools; proficiency in statistical analysis tools (SAS, SPSS, R) desirable   SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS: Strong analytical skills and reasoning, ability to understand business situations and provide data backed analysis Able to thrive in heavy quantitative data and time-driven reporting environment Inquisitive nature and be able to “connect the dots” between disparate data sources Ability to evaluate data quality and produce a final output, while using a variety of analytical techniques to solve problems. Self-disciplined and motivated, ability to work autonomously when needed Ability to manage process and functions within both a traditional and progressive work environment Excellent verbal, written and presentation communication skills Excellent time management skills Able to communicate at multiple organizational levels – both internally and client facing Must meet all pre-and post-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check and motor vehicle review.     PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. title: GPS Configuration and Data Management Analyst
description: ResponsibilitiesThe Global Positioning System (GPS) Systems Engineering and Integration (SE&I) team is seeking qualified CM/DM analysts. The GPS SE&I team provides systems engineering, test, analysis, transition, and operations support to SMC/GP. The GPS program is exciting, fast-paced and critical to military/civil applications. REQUIRED: Current active DoD SECRET clearance required or held at least a DoD clearance within the last 2 years. Support Air Force Global Positioning System (GPS) Program Office’s Systems Engineering (SE) Configuration Management (CM) in support of creating/managing the GPS specification and interface control documents. Reviews specifications, and interfaces to determine documentation and material requirements, ensure compliance with engineering specifications, and to ensure engineering changes reflect latest requirements. Analyzes proposed changes in product design to determine effect on documents such as specifications, Interface Control Documents (ICDs) and ensures all documents have required approvals. Compiles release packages ensuring all documentation is present. Notifies appropriate departments of any new or updated data. Maintains audit trails. Researches and resolves inconsistencies with change request records. - Plans and coordinates preparation of project documentation, such as Request For Change (RFC), production specifications and schedules, and contract modifications, to ensure customer contract requirements are met - Reviews contract to determine documentation required for each phase of project, applying knowledge of engineering and manufacturing processes - Analyzes proposed changes to the Technical Baseline to determine effect on overall product and system - Establishes change request and prepares for change authorization and documentation - Reviews and analyzes released engineering change data and coordinates changes with engineering - Manages discrepancyreports resulting from test activitiesQualificationsCLEARANCE; SECRETOR HIGHER Requires 2 to 5 years with BS/BA or 0 to 2 years with MS/MA/MBA or 8 to 10 years with no degree. Secret Clearance Required

title: Management Analyst
location: 456 W. Olive Ave , Sunnyvale, CA 94086, US
description: This position is new to the Community Development Department and will provide analytical support to the Director of Community Development and program managers in Building, Housing, and Planning. Incumbent should be proficient in data management and analysis, able to work with a range of office tools such as spreadsheets, databases and presentations, and be a quick learner on a variety of issues. Qualifications include being able to create and manage pivot tables, graphs, charts, etc.; excellent writing and excellent organizational and interpersonal skills are a must.Initially the Management Analyst will take over management of several data sets (where streamlining of data collection and organization is desirable) such as development pipeline projects (e.g. net and gross housing units, hotel rooms, square footage) and assist the managers in budget development and monitoring. The Management Analyst will also have assignments to support special studies assigned to the Community Development Department, initially the Downtown Parking Analysis and Housing Strategy. The Management Analyst will also help with the tracking and analysis of regional, state and federal legislation and rulemaking and support community outreach efforts. The Management Analyst will work closely with the Department Director on tracking information requests and assignments.  The Management Analyst will also oversee the process of tracking and supporting Community Development with City Council-directed studies and with review and comments on state and federal legislation.Under direction, of an assigned supervisor or manager, performs a broad range of professional administrative and management duties requiring comprehensive analysis of moderate to complex issues and data including budget, contract administration and program administration; and performs related work as required.

title: Data Analytics & Reporting Analyst
description: About us Grail Insights, blends the best of strategy consulting (highly custom, insightful, rigorous, trustworthy) with the best of market research (cost effective, data rich, process-oriented, analytical) to provide organizations with accurate, succinct answers to their most important business questions. We specialize in conducting strategic research across areas such as benchmarking and identification of best practices, entering new markets, launching and enhancing new products, and due diligence support for making acquisitions and strategic investments. About roleThe Compliance, Security, and Investigations group is data driven and results focused. We are seeking a talented analyst with an almost obsessive focus on data collection and metrics and who thrives at the intersection of data, operations, and reporting. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical, analytical, and operational background. They will enjoy cataloging and visualizing large quantities of data for structured and often ad-hoc executive level reporting.If you are focused on results, a self-starter, and have demonstrated success in using analytics to guide operational teams and their processes, this may be the role you are looking for.  No. Of Open Positions - 2RequirementsBA/BS in related field of study (Math, Physics, Stats, CS, etc) 4+ years of quantitative or statistical analysis experience 4+ years experience with SQL/MSSQL/MySQL/Oracle SQL Strong experience in Tableau, Oracle, and Hadoop/Hive Strong experience in ETL, R, PHP, Python, and Excel Development experience in any scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.) Ability to process and analyze complex data sets, and interpret them for making business decisions Experience manipulating large data sets through statistical software or other methods. Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner with product and leadership teams to influence the overall strategy of the product Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance   Preferred Advanced degree in a related field of study   Responsibilities Leverage data to understand our operations in depth and identify areas of opportunity Use tools like Tableau, Hadoop/Hive, Oracle, ETL, R, PHP, Python, Excel, Informatica, MicroStrategy, and many other internal tools to work efficiently at scale Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our operations interact with internal and external stakeholders Inform, influence, support, and execute our process decisions Monitor key metrics for forecasting and understanding root causes of changes in metrics Build and analyze dashboards and reports Assist in defining metric goals while executing on reporting and visualizing those goals Understand ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends Identify new levers to help move key metrics Influence teams through presentation of data-based recommendations Take advantage of massive amounts of structured data to understand how to improve our operations and our teams’ efficiency Produce ad hoc analyses to aid the team in understanding behavior and POV Manage integration of disparate, user-level data sets into a unified view of stakeholder activities

title: Data Analyst - San Francisco
description: Overview Evolver is a technology company serving the Federal, Commercial, and Legal markets that addresses client challenges in the present and transitions clients into the future by introducing efficient and effective IT solutions. Established in 2000, Evolver has successfully grown to be a trusted technology leader. Evolver’s efforts and growth have been recognized by leading publications and organizations, including Inc. 5000 for five consecutive years, and most recently “Future 50” from SmartCEO. With a dedicated focus on client satisfaction, Evolver has proven its value time and time again, from managing day-to-day operations to skillfully navigating the implementation and support of new technologies. Evolver’s core competencies are infrastructure, application development, cybersecurity, cloud, end-user support, data analytics and legal services. We believe our employees are key to our success and continued growth. We attract and retain our diverse workforce by promoting a work-life balance with generous and flexible time off, competitive compensation and benefits, and a commitment to professional development. When you join Evolver, you join a community of talented and dedicated individuals whose abilities, skills, and actions contribute to the success of the company. Evolver is seeking a Data Analyst SMEto join our team and work in San Francisco, CA.Essential Job Duties And ResponsibilitiesThe Data Analyst works with business and IT teams to provide the following: gather requirements,create functional requirements documents,work with developers to create files for either internal or external systems,develop detailed data flow diagrams,participate in the full development process life-cycle from concept, through testing and implementation.Serve as an expert in business metadata, experience in Collibra is a plusStrong communication, analytical, and problem solving skillsThis is an individual-contributor role and require interactions with data governance, business data subject matter experts and IT ownersManage communication between business partners and IT to communicate on matters pertaining to data definitions, data lineage and modeling workflowsAct as a lead and will be responsible for developing technical data lineage and populating into CollibraAct as a lead and facilitate the process of developing data definitions, issue resolution workflowsAssist in implement existing metadata model in CollibraComplete data mapping analysis and document data usage for existing data vendorsMinimum Qualifications And Requirements Manage communication between business partners and IT to communicate on matters pertaining to data definitions, data lineage and modeling workflowsAct as a lead and will be responsible for developing technical data lineage and populating into CollibraCandidate will be detailed oriented and knowledge of writing basic queries, exporting output to EXCEL files for analysis.Candidate will have worked for either an asset management firm or custodian as an IT/Business data analyst. Technical Requirements (required And Desired) 4+ years of experience and in depth knowledge of financial products.Data Governance tool, Collibra knowledge preferred.Training And Certifications (required And Desired) Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Information Technology or related field.

title: Data Analyst-Product & Marketing
description: Calm - Apple 2017 iPhone App of the Year!Our mission is to make the world happier and healthier through the superpower of Calm. We are developing a range of digital and physical products that enhance mental fitness and alleviate some of the most important mental health issues of the modern age (anxiety, depression, insomnia, and stress). Calm has reached over 25 Million users, is profitable, and generated 22M in revenue in 2017 (10x revenue growth in two years).Mental Fitness is fast becoming the new Physical Fitness, and we believe a huge global brand will be built in this space. Our vision is to build Calm into one of the most valuable and meaningful brands of the 21st Century - “The Nike of the Mind.”Calm was co-founded by Alex Tew (Million Dollar Homepage) and Michael Acton Smith (Mind Candy, Moshi Monsters, Firebox).What You’ll Do: You will do deep data dives and track metrics around our product in order to understand how it is being used, how recent changes have affected metrics, and where optimization opportunities are for our business and product. You will also work on data-analytic projects with marketing, life-cycle, operations, the executive team, and even our PR team (e.g., finding stories in the data for journalists) that require you to have flexible quantitative skills. You will communicate your findings in presentations, build dashboards and visualizations, and be the go-to person for questions about data.Who You Are: You have an excellent product sense and 3+ years industry experience in product analytics. Given that you will work across a variety of domains in this role, the ideal person would also have some experience in business, marketing or operations analytics but that is not as important as product analytics. You should have strong SQL skills which will not only enable you to drill deep down into the data looking for insights but to also help others on the team gain access to more insightful data (e.g., dashboards). If you can supplement or mostly replace SQL with Python, that’s a plus but not necessary. Given that this role will require you to present your findings, visually in dashboards and in presentations, and to work with people across teams, it is critical that you are an excellent communicator. Ideally, you would have experience either with Mode, a similar visualization tool, or Pythonic approaches to data visualization. You should also have strong quantitative skills and a basic understanding in statistics (e.g., when you find an interesting pattern, you can figure out when it is just noise). We are not, however, looking for someone with a background in machine learning and advanced statistics. You should be able to work independently and take ownership of your projects Benefits: Competitive salary and equity Unlimited PTO We pay your medical, dental, & vision insurance premiums 401K Commuter benefits Life insurance and disability benefits Apple equipment Fun, energetic work environment, and daily perks - snacks, drinks, catered lunch twice a weekOpportunity to work with a product focused on making the world happier and healthier And much more!

title: Senior Staff Accountant

You will report into Operations and be a key partner in analyzing sales and pipeline trends and develop robust insights to drive productivity and efficiency. The Operations Analyst must be a collaborative problem-solver, who not only understands the numbers, but also the broader business context around them. Responsibilities Daily weekly monitoring of SFDC data and report on health of pipeline, shape and velocity of the sales funnel (lead to won opportunity), and bookings trends. Build statistical models of business trends and predictive models for sales forecast and pipeline building. Analyze key performance indicators to measure sales productivity and prepare reporting packages on monthly quarterly results/KPIs to executive management Deal Desk management to support internal approval for pricing, legal and services Partner with Sales, Marketing and Customer Success to access major steps/roadblocks in Sales Funnel and provide data driven insight for enhanced decision making Rigorous Support to a distributed Global sales team on all aspects of systems and processes to improving our sales execution, productivity and effectiveness Cross functional support & communication with Customer Success, Marketing, finance. title: Big Data Analytics Lead
description: Big Data Analytics Lead Lead the Global Data Analytics Practice at Globallogic. Responsible for interacting with prospects and customers managing senior, executive level (CIO/CTO/senior technology personnel) technical and business relationships, and working with a team of key architects in the Delivery organization and building a strong and effective presales/SME team. Key areas of responsibilities include: Work with key customers and with the account sales and delivery teams at presales stage to map and define technology solutions for Data/Analytics for large and complex enterprise programs or software products and platforms. Provide thought leadership to prospects and customers on Data and Analytics, the best technologies, products and platforms, and lead the assessment and design of current and future state architectures, perform gap analysis, and develop transformation roadmaps. Responsible for driving the technical excellence of the engineering organization and support the implementation of delivery pipelines with modern delivery technologies. Provide technical guidance to clients and engineering teams for building out their Analytics services The responsible person must demonstrate strong technical depth and be capable of leading technical solutions effort for Big Data Analytics pre-sales and support customer conversations. Other responsibilities will include evaluating new technologies and making recommendations and being a technical mentor to the engineering teams that work on the development of Big Data/Analytics applications. Must be able to actively participate in roadmap discussions and hands on technology evaluation to implement POCs or research.  Desired skills include: Solid understanding of Big Data Hadoop ecosystem & Analytics space. MS/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field. 8-10+ years of experience as a technology leader designing and developing data architecture solutions with more than 3+ years specializing in big data architecture or data analytics. Experience of implementing solutions on Big data technologies - Hadoop, MapReduce, Pig, Hive, Spark, Storm, Impala, Oozie, Mahout, Flume, ZooKeeper and/or Sqoop Proficient in the Map­Reduce programming paradigm Experience with Kafka and other distributed messaging systems Understanding of various file formats (Avro, Parquet, protobuf, etc…) Prior Data design experience using relational databases such as MySQL and with NOSQL data storage like MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, ElasticSearch, etc.   Come up with solutions based on open source Big Data Analytics framework. Closely follow the changes in the open source community specifically regarding Big Data, Data Science and Analytics Plus to have BI expertise—specially Enterprise BI--prior experience with Analytics platforms (e.g. Pentaho, Business Objects or similar), OLAP technologies and ETL tools such as Informatica, Talend and/or Pentaho Plus: Machine Learning Experience including design, code, train, test, deploy and iterate on large scale machine learning or AI systems. Help shape the direction of machine learning and artificial intelligence at Globallogic. Solid software engineering skills across multiple languages including but not limited to Python, C/C++ Experience with machine learning software packages ( e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Caffe, Theano, Torch) Experience with one or more of the following: natural language processing, deep learning, bayesian reasoning, recommendation systems, learning for search, speech processing, learning from semistructured data, reinforcement or active learning, ML software systems, machine learning on mobile devices

title: Analytics Developer/Analyst
description: DescriptionPalo Alto Networks® is the fastest-growing security company in history. We offer the chance to be part of an important mission: ending breaches and protecting our way of digital life. If you are a motivated, intelligent, creative, and hardworking individual, then this job is for you!We offer fantastic career and financial growth potential, thanks to our game-changing security platform, along with the chance to be part of the critical mission: to prevent cyber breaches and protect our digital way of life. Your chances of getting on board a company with this much growth potential are statistically similar to your chances of being struck by lightning.Palo Alto Networks is now looking for a data professional for the role of Business Intelligence Analyst. You will use your business acumen and technical knowledge to develop and deliver Business Intelligence and Analytics solutions for your internal customers, and you will work with the Business to understand their changing requirements and measure impacts of those changes.We are a very data-driven company. That creates a challenging but at the same time a unique position to get into high-level projects that truly help the business to drive its actions based on data insight and data-driven recommendations.As a part of the Support Operations team, you'll be using data to help the Business in making informed business process decisions. You’ll build data visualizations to automate reporting so support management can quickly and accurately see how support KPIs are performing. You’ll be involved from project inception to report design through to data delivery, ensuring that your reports are delivering high-quality and relevant data so that our business can grow intelligently.You will also be introducing data science capabilities into the Customer Support function and come up with new innovative predictive and actionable use cases to create business value with the help of the data. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with our internal data science community to share knowledge and best practices from different business functions.If you liked what you see, please apply - we’d be happy to meet you!ResponsibilitiesPartner with business stakeholders to understand and document business requirements for developing appropriate business analysis and reporting applicationsDevelop rich, interactive, visually striking graphics and data visualizations of large amounts of dataCreate groundbreaking predictive models to give actionable recommendations to your internal clients on how to best drive their business with the help of the data.Develop ad-hoc reporting and provide analytics services to support business decision making processesProvide support to the development of training materials and training activities related to the BI tools and applicationsProvide insight into leading analytic practices and foster best practices that are consistent with BI design standardsWork closely with IT teams to help develop business applications and tools QualificationsBachelor's degree (statistics, computer science, predictive analytics, or math preferred)5+ years’ experience in Analytics, within the relevant domains of customer service, product, social networks, etcExperience with data visualization and business intelligence tools or packages (Tableau, Qlikview, Looker, etc)5+ years’ experience with visualization design including dashboards, executive and operational, or front end visualizations4+ years’ experience in SQL databases or expert-level SQL coding/querying skillsPython or other scripting language experienceExcellent analytical and problem solving skills, combined with strong business judgment and an ability to present analysis in a clear and compelling mannerData manipulation and transformation skills.Big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Drill, Pig, etc.)Experience with CRM systems, eg. Salesforce.Knowledge on some Analytics Platforms/Tools like KNIME, Dataiku, Rapidminer, R, SAS, Alteryx, Mahout, etc. a plusCloud technologies (AWS, Azure, etc.) a plusMarketing Cloud solutions (Adobe, Marketo, etc.) a plusLearn more about Palo Alto Networks here and check out our fast facts

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: Job DescriptionThe Marketing Data Analyst is an instrumental part of Cloudera and is responsible for supporting the business with insights on sales and marketing. The Analyst will be responsible for testing theories against different hypotheses and making recommendations for action. A Data Analyst should be very comfortable with analyzing data, using statistical and mathematical methods for understanding data sets, and must be an expert in SQL. The role requires strong business acumen and the ability to ask questions to build concise reporting and useful/actionable visualizations in Tableau for executive leadership.The Marketing Data Analyst will be part of some of our top level projects around data governance, home-grown lead scoring models, and campaign success.Cloudera is a leader in the data space - so you will get to learn and explore cutting-edge Machine Learning modeling. We will enable you to work alongside the cream of the crop Data Scientists from Fast Forward Labs. If your career plans include wanting to learn more about Data Science, this is a great role to start that journey in.Technical Qualifications Experience using and querying big data or relational database technologies (at least one required)Strong grasp of SQL, including analytical functions, and data relationshipsAt least 3 years of working experience with Tableau OR a Tableau Qualified Associate Certification or higherSome experience coding in python or JavaWorking knowledge of Linux preferred, but not required Qualifications BS/BA degree (preferably in a technical or research field)Understanding of statistics and analytics3+ years of experience in analytics focused on turning questions into insight and owning and maintaining data setsAbility to develop useful analytical tools and effectively communicate complex findings and ideas in plain languageStrong desire to learn and Grow with ClouderaAbility to work with cross functional teamsGet stuff done attitudeComfortable with driving projects and taking initiative to lead a conversation and ask questionsAbility to adapt quickly to requirement changesStrong problem-solving and troubleshooting skillsCreative thinker - see the possibleRoll up your sleeves, can-do attitude (humor also greatly appreciated) Responsibilities Lead the analytics function, identifying key metrics across the funnel, and delivering actionable insights on our marketing performance and contribution to pipelineWork to understand the health of our business, delivering critical reporting and actionable insights for Marketing leadershipEnable marketing leaders to self serve and quickly grasp and report on Marketing successes and weaknessesActively monitor, analyze and report on the health of the marketing contribution to pipeline

title: Data Analyst
description: RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans and implementing technology to help transform organizations.Working as a consultant you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP and built on tangible accomplishments.If You Are Interested In Being Part Of Our Team, There a Few Things You Should KnowAs we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission.We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them.We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth-minded.We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more.The Rgp Consulting ExperienceRGP has a unique consulting model that provides opportunities for consultants to work in different ways. Most consultants work in a model where they have the flexibility and autonomy to choose projects that align with their experience, skills and desired lifestyle. Other opportunities exist in team-based, strategy and solutions work. In all models, you will feel the full support of RGP to assist you in your work and guide you on your chosen path.PURPOSE OF THE ROLEClients engage RGP for expertise in delivering large and complex projects to strengthen their business. As an experienced Data Analyst Consultant, you will analyze large data sets and make appropriate recommendations that assist business leaders in making improved business decisions.ATTRIBUTES OF DATA ANALYSTS WITH RGPIntegrity and respect for people and opinionsDedication to client serviceAbility to think in complex and ever-changing situationsStrong communication skillsAbility to solve problems and execute on initiativesDemonstrates RGP’s values – loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent Key Responsibilities Of The RoleAnalyzes, manipulates, profiles and extracts large data setsAssists with documenting requirementsBuilds, reviews and modifies reportsTransfers knowledge to enable identified internal employees to be self-sufficient in building and maintaining reports to meet future needsDesired Experience And RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting or other related business discipline required5 to 10 years of Data Analysis or Business Analysis experienceStrong understanding of financial statements and the interrelationship of the income statement, balance sheet and statement of cash flowsExcellent interpersonal and analytical skills, and high attention to detail Ability to work independently and is a self-starterAbility to interface with Senior Management and project manage the accumulation of reporting informationAccount reconciliation and financial analysis skills.Experience with SAP or Oracle software required, including the ability to access reports and data as neededExperience with ETL tools, such as Informatica, is a plus.Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills required, including strong data retrieval and downloading abilities, and proficiency with macros, PowerBI, PowerPivot, etc.Technical capability in one or more of the following: SQL, Tableau, QlikView, Cognos, ERWin, etc. a plusEqual Opportunity EmployerRGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst I
description: Position Summary/ PurposeUnder the direction of the Pharmaceutical Services Management team, the Healthcare Data Analyst (HDA) performs intermediately complex level of technical and analytical work to support IEHP’s Pharmaceutical Services Department The Healthcare Data Analyst (HDA) must be able to understand relational database concepts, table design and structure, joins, data normalization, and data types and combine that knowledge to IEHP business rules and compliance reporting requirements.Responsible for managing assigned projects, ensuring that data and analysis requests are completed timely, accurately, and presented in a way that meets the needs of the requesting department. The Healthcare Data Analyst (HDA) must be able to assess analysis requests and solicit feedback from requestors regarding any critical decision points that are necessary to complete requests accurately and timely. To do this effectively, the Healthcare Data Analyst (HDA) must have knowledge of the data sources available for reporting and must have a clear understanding of IEHP business operations in order to apply appropriate criteria and methodology to meet requestors’ needs. It is also necessary to understand how department deliverables - including standard reports, ad-hoc requests, studies, analyses, and recommendations - can affect business operations at IEHP.Major Duties/ ResponsibilitiesDevelop and prepare reports and analyses to support IEHP’s Pharmaceutical Services Department, utilizing available tools, including but not limited to Microsoft Office suite, SSRS, SAS, Power BI, IEHP system-specific BI reporting tools, or other related reporting software. Participate in the analysis, interpretation, and translation of complex data, issues, trends, and relationships into effective strategies and action plans. Exercises timely and accurate data mining techniques and develops new or modifies existing standardized and ad hoc reports that ensure consistent conclusions to data analysis. Responsible for analyzing report requests to determine users’ needs and objectives, identifying correct methodology for extracting data including data sources and criteria, and ensuring the delivered report is accurate, timely, and formatted appropriately. Design and enhance databases, including testing, validating, and maintaining data integrity and accuracy across multiple databases and systems. Responsible for acquiring and maintaining updated knowledge of the various data sources available within IEHP for reporting, as well as a clear understanding of IEHP business operations to be able to appropriately apply criteria and methodology to meet requestors’ reporting needs. Responsible for applying updated reporting criteria when changes to IEHP’s business rules and/or data sources change, in order to ensure consistent reporting outcomes. Responsible for managing assigned projects and effectively communicating with the Pharmaceutical Services Management team if any project deadlines will not be met well in advance of the project due date. Document all reporting projects and database objects within a project consistently, as instructed by the Pharmaceutical Services Management team. Update reporting documentation as updates to processes occur to ensure accurate documentation of all department standard reporting. Responsible for troubleshooting database issues, permissions issues, and incorrect data results. Provide technical support to database users and work as a liaison between database users and the IT department, as needed. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with others throughout the organization. Demonstrate a commitment to support IEHP’s strategic priorities to become a 5-Star Health Plan and incorporate LEAN principles into daily work. Ensure the privacy and security of PHI (Protected Health Information) as outlined in IEHP’s policies and procedures relating to HIPAA compliance. Pharmacy Informatics responsibilities include: Responsible for having a clear understanding of IEHP Pharmaceutical Services business operations and NDC codes in order to apply appropriate criteria and methodology to meet requestors’ needs. Any other duties as required to ensure the Health Plan operations are successful.Ensure the privacy and security of PHI (Protected Health Information) as outlined in IEHP's policies and procedures relating to HIPAA compliance.Experience RequirementBachelor's degree from an accredited four year institution required. Master's degree preferred. 3 - 5 years experience required, will accept Master's degree in lieu of experience.Specialized Knowledge/Skills Strong data analysis, data presentation, spreadsheet, and database capabilities. Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Access, Excel, word processing, SSRS, SAS, SPSS, or other statistical packages is essential. Will accept extensive knowledge of FDB MedKnowledge drug code data in lieu of SAS and MS Access. Must have strong critical thinking skills. Ability to handle multiple projects, data input, strong problem solving capability, excellent interpersonal/ communication skills. Strong attention to detail. Working knowledge of diagnosis and procedure coding, medical terminology, knowledge of managed care, claims payment processes, and insurance terminology required.Pay Range: $61,609 - $95,430Inland Empire Health Plan (IEHP) is the largest not-for-profit Medi-Cal and Medicare health plan in the Inland Empire. We are also one of the largest employers in the region. With a provider network of more than 6,000 and a team of more than 2,000 employees, IEHP provides quality, accessible healthcare services to more than 1.2 million members. And our mission and core values help guide us in the development of innovative programs and the creation of an award winning workplace. As the healthcare landscape is transformed, we’re ready to make a difference today and in the years to come. Join our Team and Make a Difference with us! IEHP offers a Competitive salary and a benefit package with a value estimated at 35% of the annual salary, including medical, dental, vision, team bonus, and retirement plan.

title: Senior Reporting Analyst
description: Who We Are: Build the Business. Build the Brand. At Havas Edge, we influence people to act by combining multi-channel marketing and commerce plus the creative and technology that powers them. Our work results in profitable growth and lasting relationships between customers and our client's brands. We are a full-service, direct response agency, headquartered in Carlsbad, CA with offices in Boston, MA; Los Angeles CA and New Your NY. This position is located in Carlsbad, CA or Boston, MA.Job Overview: This position reports to the Director of Analytics on the Analytics team within Havas Edge. This position may supervise the work of other Attribution Analysts.Summary: The analytics group is looking for a detail-oriented data enthusiast who will enjoy deploying and improving Edge's RAMP attribution models, and mentoring other RAMP analysts. The RAMP team is responsible for interpreting and transforming client business needs into insightful analyses that informs and supports business decision-making.   This is a solution-driven position that uses a variety of analytic methods to derive actionable insights from client and industry data. In addition to having strong analytic skills, the candidate should be able to independently lead analytic efforts, and to develop clear and concise communications for both internal and external clients. Knowledge of advertising and direct marketing concepts is also a plus. The Senior Analyst is also responsible for planning and maintaining work systems, procedures, and policies that enable and encourage the optimum performance of people and technical resources within the Analytics business unit.   Responsibilities:Establish relationships with internal and external clients and collaborate across Edge departments Utilize analytic and data management techniques to create actionable insights that impact the ROI of marketing campaigns Produce and optimize client-facing attribution results in a timely manner Research and resolve aberrant attribution model output Exhibit solution-seeking behavior to maximize each client's return on advertising spend Independently compose data enhancement/transformation requirements to enable attribution analyses Identify opportunities to enhance legacy models, quality control and reporting processes Partner with developers and data analysts to enhance and quality check client data flows Independently troubleshoot model issues of advanced complexity and partner with technical subject matter experts to resolve Independently lead the onboarding process of new clients with regard to attribution setup meet with internal and external clients to understand and interpret client needs which will be translated into model requirements, and assign onboarding tasks to be completed by various attribution analysts Mentor other analysts and provide ongoing feedback to facilitate each analyst's professional growth, and to encourage analytic output that meets or exceeds client expectations Participate in articulation of attribution product roadmap achievement of roadmap milestones Assist Director of Analytics in the prioritization of team projects and in the delegation of project tasks   Skills Required: Strong quantitative and qualitative analytic skills with aptitude for problem identification and resolution Thrives in a team environment in an open workspace Ability to meet aggressive deadlines with minimal or zero supervision Strong attention to detail, excellent organization skills, and ability to manage multiple projects and delegate responsibilities under deadlines Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to effectively present complex data and actionable insights to audiences with varying degrees of technical knowledge Proven ability to motivate others with vision, passion, and dedication to excellence Basic proficiency in:SSIS or SSRS. R, SAS, Stata, SPSS or equivalent Tableau, Power BI, QlikView or equivalent Intermediate proficiency in:T-SQL or SQL - with ability to perform complex queries Web analytics tools (Adobe Analytics, Coremetrics, Webtrends, Google Analytics, etc.) Advanced proficiency in:Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Access) Relational database and big data management conceptsQualifications: Bachelor's degree in Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Business, or related analytical field 5+ years experience in analytics 2+ years of people management  Experience as an analyst in an agency or marketing services organization Intermediate knowledge of statistics and significance testing Advanced knowledge of SQL or T-SQL

title: Agile Product Owner/Systems Analyst
description: We have vision of changing 20 million lives by 2020. We’re a team of thinkers and innovators, who see each day as a new day for ground-breaking ideas and unparalleled opportunity.We are an exciting and fast paced organization looking for individuals who are passionate about technology, who will help drive and develop the power of ResMed’s Healthcare Informatics (HI) suite of software solutions. Let’s talk about you: We are seeking talented individuals who are driven by a desire to change lives through innovative, human-centered product design. In this role you will be in the unique position to directly impact the lives of our patients and their families and thus you must possess both empathy and the technical nous to make big leaps in innovation and technology development. Our Systems Analysts work in dynamic development teams collaborating with Product Marketing, Architecture, Quality, Regulatory, Test and others. You must therefore be a team player with passion and enthusiasm to drive the future direction of ResMed products from concept through to delivery. To ensure success in the role, you will be able to demonstrate that you are a self-starter who is a detail-oriented, result-driven individual who works well within a fast paced team environment. You will be a key member of a collaborative software development team and you will be called upon to act as Product Owner of a SCRUM team. You will be responsible for requirements analysis, creating functional software specifications, and working with the development and quality analyst teams to support the development of the application. Your passion for learning will be demonstrated by your initiative to learn new tools and products as well as identify opportunities to improve current processes and standards. Responsibilities: Author requirements and user stories for new features, enhancements or fixes, ensuring that UX, stakeholder, Regulatory and market needs are met. Collaborate with Product Marketing on solution definition, prioritization, business goals and strategy realization. Collaborate across business units with Architects, Systems Analysts and Technical Leads on the System Design to provide desired System of Systems functionality. Ensure non-functional requirements including UX, scalability, performance, supportability and reliability are identified and followed. Work closely with development team to evaluate technical design alternatives to achieve desired functionality. Provide product leadership to the technical team members. Fulfil the role of Product Owner in and environment that follows Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) methodologies. Drive and own backlog management and grooming in collaboration with the Product Owner, other System Analysts and the technical team. Collaborate with Technical Leadership to identify and resolve technical issues with the software engineering disciplines and review issues with Leadership where required. Ensure full traceability of requirements. Collaborate with Program and Portfolio Management to help plan and manage risk. Define the system interface specifications and ensure the system components will integrate successfully. This may require collaboration with Architecture, other Systems Analysts, technical teams, external entities, standards bodies and Technical Leads. Facilitate design workshops and ongoing interaction with key stakeholders to determine detailed requirements. Work with the Quality Engineering and Validation team to develop test strategies and review test artefacts Develop and maintain a deep understanding of Healthcare Informatics processes and workflows, as well as an expertise in the functions and data of Healthcare Informatics systems and applicable regulatory guidance and regulations. Observe the principles of Occupational Health & Safety Legislation Let’s talk qualifications and experience: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Information Systems, Computer Science or related field 4 years of professional systems engineer or systems analyst experience Sound understanding of the product development process and life cycle Deep experience with SCRUM Agile development methodologies Equivalent combination of experience and/or education may be considered. Desirable experience: Experience with web or mobile development projects specifically using Java, .NET or applicable mobile languages Experience with BDD, Behaviour Driven Design preferred Experience in the medical device field Experience with Enterprise Software Systems

title: eCommerce Data Coordinator
description: FabFitFun is seeking an eCommerce Data Coordinator to proactively fill in data gaps that exist throughout our organization. This analyst will focus on researching industry standards for product-based data and setting processes to update that data for both past and current products. Our ideal candidate will be someone who is detail-oriented and up-to-date with current consumer trends. This person will work closely with both the Merchandising and Data Science teams.What You’ll Do Research industry standards for product metadata Develop clear processes for collection and storage of this data Work with the Merchandising team to correctly and consistently tag new productsCollaborate with Operations, Product Development, and Product management teams to ensure consistency in Product meta-tagging Explore website resources to find metadata tagging for product SKUs that are listed in other ecommerce sites Research PIM (Product information management) systems to build common Product taxonomy for FabFitFun Work with the Data Science team to create QA processes and start rudimentary analysis What You’ll Bring Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Mathematics, or equivalent is required1+ year of relevant Merchandising, Retail, or eCommerce experience Basic knowledge of Excel or Google Sheets Experience working with cross-functional teamsSelf-starter mindset with ability to take on projects with little direction Strong attention to detailWhat You’ll Get Ability to work with multiple high functioning teams to help better curate products for seasonal boxes Opportunity for a data enthusiast to experiment and pioneer new frontiers Amazing benefits including medical, dental, vision, FSA, and 401k Unlimited PTO Catered meals, kitchen stocked with great snacks and drinks Free FabFitFun subscription and and quarterly credit in the Add-Ons store

title: Senior Fraud Analyst
description: Senior Analyst - Operations is responsible for the receipt, deposit, disbursement and quality control of all money movement. The Fraud Sr. Analyst role will be responsible managing and reporting various types of fraud to comply with various regulations and guidance from the OCC, SEC, FINRA, FinCEN, OFAC and other governing bodies. Furthermore, the Sr. Analyst will partner with other analysts / management for reviewing and analyzing underlying data gathered to assess reasonable cause to escalate and manage an inquiry related to fraud. The data would be accompanied by full documentation, supporting artifacts to include internal and external due diligence checks as well as a business case justification. The Sr. Analyst will work primarily at an individual level, but will partner closely with members of the financial intelligence unit (FIU); governance risk and compliance (GRC), service trading and operations (STO) risk personnel as well as key business partners. In addition, the Sr. Analyst will have oversight into reoccurring metric dashboards, presentations and the ongoing training and development. Furthermore, the Sr. Analyst will assist the team or other business units on special project work, partner with business technology services (BTS) and reviewing regulatory changes to assess impacts on the LPL Financial and the cash management business unit.Essential Functions:Managing existing operational policies and procedures as well as the creation of new guidelines to more accurately identify and document fraud, fraud prevention and the like Manage and create case files for fraud investigations Develop key performance indicator (KPIs) dashboards using data analysis to help cash management develop a more proactive and anticipatory approach to fraud prevention Report outs to senior leadership Execute an ongoing analysis of risks, vulnerabilities and market trends as it pertains to fraud Ability to determine potential impact and assess risk (e.g. operational risk, financial risk, reputational risk, etc.) Manage the benchmarking fraud prevention effectiveness against industry standards and peer firms Collaborate within the team to implement initiatives and projects sponsored and approved by management Provide internal training on the Firm’s fraud prevention and awareness programs, policies and procedures Drive the implementation of tactical and strategic fraud prevention via systematic and straight thru processing improvements Participating in individual and department goal development and executing on tactical strategies for goal attainment Field and manage inquiries from financial advisors, members of service and/or operational areas related to fraud, fraud prevention, case files with the utmost emphasis on safety and security of information  Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Economics, Accounting/Finance and/or equivalent experience preferred Professional licenses/certifications (e.g. FINRA Series 7, 24 or CAMS,) preferred 3+ years of industry experience (preferably in financial services (broker-dealer)) Experience with Equifax, LexisNexis, TransUnion or other information security providers a plus  Required Skills:High level of analytical skills and problem-solving Ability to multi-task, work well under pressure with commitment to deliver under tight deadlines Working knowledge of regulatory requirements (preferably AML / Fraud) Proficient in MS Office (Word, Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) Assist Analysts with escalating potential risks Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present information in differing degrees of details and form depending on the audience Strong judgment and experience with escalation of matters and recommended solutions Able to adapt to changing priorities with attention to detail and quality assurance Our Culture:If you join LPL, you will join a culture that believes in delivering a world-class client experience and looks to all employees to contribute to that goal by sharing their creativity, experience, and passion for continuous improvement. As a destination of choice, our top priorities are growth and development, social responsibility, and financial health for our employees.We offer competitive compensation and industry leading benefits, including a wellness facility with onsite fitness classes, healthy meal choices, and a walk-in clinic. We support employee financial health through a 401k match, ESPP, and employee discounts. Work/life balance is our foundation and is supported through paid holidays, and paid time off (including time to volunteer). We foster a diverse work environment through Employee Resource Groups and diverse strategic partnerships. Join the LPL team and help us make a difference by turning life’s aspirations into financial realities. Please login or create an account to apply to this position. Principals only. EOE* As reported by Financial Planning magazine, June 1996-2016, based on total revenue.

title: Business Systems Analyst, People Systems
description: Pinterest is looking for a People technology Analyst to help accelerate the use of technology within our People and Payroll teams. This role will have a direct influence on bottom-line of the company by helping drive productivity, efficiency and insights in People Operations and processes. The right candidate will be a technologist with a strong business acumen and proven ability to design and develop complex business processes specifically around Hire-to-Retire data flow. The role is part Architect, part Product Manager, part Business Systems Analyst, and part hands-on Admin. You’ll be working alongside a talented team of developers and admins that will be able to build or buy solutions, depending on the business need.What You’ll Do Quickly ramp up and be productive by understanding the existing Workday implementation and current business process Translate business requirements into system solutions that produces well-quantified data Collaborate with different business functions, gather and understand requirements and propose scalable solutions that leverage full potential of the systems Own technical roadmap for Workday, and develop program to prioritize work with business stakeholders and communicate progress Analyze, design and develop best practice business processes through technology solutions. What We’re Looking For Minimum of 3 years of experience with Workday HCM implementation and configuration ADP Payroll and/or Workday Payroll experience a must Workday Time Tracking and/or Workday Absence Management experience desired Strong understanding of Business Process framework and Workday Security Strong experience building inbound and outbound integrations out of Workday

title: Lead BI Analyst
description: Job DescriptionNow is the perfect time to join a growing company with an extremely noble cause. At NuVasive, you will not only help to drive business value, but actually see its impact. As part of NuVasive’s IT organization, you will be joining the best IT business in the spine industry. In IT, we are in a unique position which allows us to positively impact patients’ lives. As a part of our team, you will truly make a difference in someone’s life.You will be joining a diverse team of business and IT professionals responsible for providing the solutions to support the organizations growth for data and analytical needs. Your experience and guidance will drive and shape the technical landscape of this growing and dynamic organization. The Sr BI Analyst requires "hands-on" business intelligence experience, gather requirements and designs, develops, modifies, debugs and evaluates BI/ EDW Solutions for various business functions.In addition, this role will require to build and maintain strong relationships with business partners while supporting and driving high-quality analytics solutions. The role will interface with organizations such as Finance, Sales, Operations and Product team to gather requirements and build out various reports, dashboards, and visualizations. Your experience and guidance will drive and shape the Business Intelligence and Analytics landscape of this growing and dynamic organization. Other responsibilities include providing user training and working with other teams to complete projects on schedule.ResponsibilitiesGather business requirements and translate them into functional and technical specifications.Works with key business partners to understand business priorities, identify strategic initiatives, and develop effective and timely analytic solutionsProactively mines data warehouse to identify trends and patterns and generates insights for business units and senior leadershipEnhance information visualization through development of dashboards and by partnering with development team on user interfacesStrong analytical and project management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into technical solutionsQuick to insights with the capability to perform all duties, end-to-end, to support rapid prototyping and iterative analysis.Drive standardization of key metrics across various business stakeholders to improve data governance maturity.Continually recommend, develop, and implement process improvements and tools to collect and analyze data, and visualize/present insights.Key point of contact continually driving the growth of the analytics and business intelligence community at NuVasivePartner with the data architects and ETL developers to ensure effective schemas are built for reporting applications.Help design EDW data marts by integrating data sources from disparate systemsUsing SQL development and querying tools, model and develop various data warehouse and BI /reporting solutions Design and develop BI reports, dashboards, cubes and various analytical solutionsPerform various BI administration tasks, development and change management tasksDetermine and develop the business intelligence solutions such as BI modeling, canned reports, distributed / burst reports, dashboards etc. required to support data mining, analytics, and reporting needs.Provide production support related to BI/ ETL tasks and work with other IT team members and service desk to resolve data refresh issues Provide off hours operational support as needed to ensure data, cubes refresh and report executions run smoothly as per schedule Performance tuning and enhancement of data loads, cubes and reports Continue to strive to provide innovative solutions for various BI/ EDW projects and tasks Mentor junior team members on various BI projects and to train them in the technical landscape and BI toolsHelp coordinate the development of necessary project documentation and standards required for compliance and identified best practices.Ensure business user issues are resolved in a timely manner.Able to train business users and help expand adoption of various BI solutions.Able to embrace and adapt to change while demonstrating flexibility and the ability to develop and follow new processes. Required SkillsBasic QualificationsBachelor's degree from a four-year college or university is required; majors in a Computer science or Information systems field preferred.Demonstrated 7+ yrs of BI experience and knowledge of the BI/ DW project lifecycle, including requirements gathering for BI/ DW projects, writing design specifications, development, testing and building reports and dashboard solutions Demonstrated experience in supporting and troubleshooting BI and data warehousing systems Strong SQL writing skills and relational database knowledge is desired (preferred SQL Server) Demonstrated ability to convert business requirements into effective functional and technical specificationsStrong data visualization, reporting, dash-boarding, and presentation skills with experience with Cognos (11 preferred), PowerBI, Tableau or equivalent BI tool in an Enterprise Data Warehouse environmentAnalytically independent with enough technical strengths to piece together various datasets for rapid prototypingProven track record of driving change through data-driven insightsExperience with agile projects and rapid delivery of features and functionsAbility to explain technical concepts to non-technical associates and vice-versaStrong understanding of dimensional modeling concepts Strong experience in Cognos including report studio and developing active reports Strong experience using Cognos Framework manager for modeling relational and DMR models. Experience in using Cognos Transformer to build and refresh cubes. Experience setting up object and row level security for end users to access relational models and cubes Experience in design and development of advanced Cognos/ Tableau or PowerBI reports using multiple queries, bursting, drill-through, conditional formatting, master-detail reports, etc. against both relational and OLAP data sources. Experience in trouble shooting data warehouse refresh issues and BI data validation with source systems.Demonstrated ability to produce high quality technical documentation.Knowledge of systems development and project management methodologies/processes.Preferred experience on implementing BI tools on mobile Preferred experience in Cognos 10 and above (V11 experience a plus) Preferred experience in Cognos Dynamics Cubes and admin activities to tune and use caching capabilities. Preferred experience in Cognos SDK, exposure to C#/ .Net environment a plus Preferred experience on Big Data projects and understanding of Big data concepts,Hadoop, R, Python or related Big Data technologies used. Preferred experience in healthcare or medical device industry – understanding of related business functions and Order to Cash process a plusPreferred Experience in Tableau / Power BI desktop and web – both building reports and administering Web user interface including maintaining data extracts and securityPreferred Qualifications Preferred experience on implementing Cognos on mobile solutions (preferably on iPad) Preferred experience in Cognos 10 and above (V11 exposure a plus) Preferred experience in Cognos Dynamics Cubes and admin activities to tune and use caching capabilities. Preferred experience in Cognos SDK, exposure to C#/ .Net environment a plus Preferred experience on Big Data projects and understanding of Big data concepts,Hadoop, R, Python or related Big Data technologies used. Preferred experience in healthcare or medical device industry – understanding of related business functions and Order to Cash process a plus Preferred Experience in Tableau desktop and web – both building reports and administering Web user interface including maintaining data extracts and security Preferred experience in Informatica or any other ETL tool Preferred experience with SAP ECC or related ERP applicationNuVasive is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. The “EEO is the Law” poster options are available here .About NuVasiveNuVasive, Inc. (NASDAQ: NUVA) is the leader in spine technology innovation, focused on transforming spine surgery and beyond with minimally invasive, procedurally-integrated solutions designed to deliver reproducible and clinically-proven surgical outcomes.The Company’s portfolio includes access instruments, implantable hardware, biologics, software systems for surgical planning, navigation and imaging solutions, magnetically adjustable implant systems for spine and orthopedics, and intraoperative monitoring service offerings. With $962 million in revenues (2016), NuVasive has an approximate 2,300 person workforce in more than 40 countries serving surgeons, hospitals and patients. For more information, please visit www.nuvasive.com.

title: Cloud Technical Product Marketing Manager
description: Job Title Cloud Technical Product Marketing ManagerLocationSan Diego, CAOverviewTeradata is looking to hire a Cloud Technical Product Marketing Manager to drive awareness and adoption of Teradata’s cloud offerings. This person will define and communicate positioning and differentiation via high-impact content and sales tools. Deliverables include technical product marketing materials for current and future capabilities, content to help customers and sales teams understand benefits and advantages, product demonstrations, partner co-marketing programs, and financial value calculations.This person will become a Subject Matter Expert on Teradata’s cloud and analytics capabilities with AWS and Azure and have frequent interactions with enterprise customers and sales teams. This role approaches marketing from both business and technology perspectives and possess a strong understanding of cloud consumption and the broader analytic ecosystem for data-driven organizations.You will Develop value proposition, positioning, and messaging that differentiates Teradata cloud capabilitiesWork closely with associates in other functional areas to plan and execute the launch of new offerings, including press releases, analyst briefings, internal and external announcements, and social mediaDevelop strong synergistic relationships with product management, sales, engineering, account-based marketing, and partner managementPromote cloud adoption through internal and external advocacy – and identify and resolve barriersWork with sales teams to develop a strong understanding of customer needs, pain points, and market alternativesOrchestrate and deliver technical demonstrations that illustrate cloud capabilities in a simple and intuitive mannerCreate collateral such as sales presentations, white papers, blog posts, proposal modules, data sheets, videos, web pages, webinars, training, pricing, competitive comparisons, FAQs, and best practicesRequirementsBachelor's degree in marketing, engineering, or computer science5+ years of experience in B2B technology marketing targeting enterprise customers2+ years of experience marketing cloud services to enterprise customers; title: Data Management Analyst I (90712)
description: Req Id 90712 - Posted 07/03/2018 - CA - San DiegoPosition: Data Management Analyst IDRS Daylight Solutions is a subsidiary of Leonardo DRS. Our mission at DRS Daylight Solutions is to be the leading provider of best-in-class, mid-infrared sources and systems for defense, commercial, and research markets. Our global leadership position in advanced, mid-IR technology means that DRSDaylight Solutions customers benefit from a sustainable, competitive advantage in molecular detection and imaging applications.Leonardo DRS is a leading supplier of integrated products, services and support to military forces, intelligence agencies and prime contractors worldwide. Focused on defense technology, we develop, manufacture and support a broad range of systems for mission critical and military sustainment requirements, as well as homeland security.Headquartered in Arlington, VA, the Company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Leonardo S.p.A. which employs more than 70,000 people worldwide. We offer a competitive compensation package and a business culture, which rewards performance. For additional information on DRS, please visit our website at .Company OverviewIn 2005, three high-tech entrepreneurs founded DRS Daylight Solutions in San Diego, California, with the goal of developing breakthrough technologies and products around the company’s core technology: mid-IR quantum cascade lasers (QCLs). Since then, the company has introduced three groundbreaking products.Are you an innovator that wants to be part of the solution?We’re looking for pioneers who bring great ideas from concept to reality.DRS Daylight Solutions culture is family oriented, innovative, and collaborative. We enjoy working hard and have fun doing it. Our purpose is to save lives with light.Job Location: San Diego, CAPosition SummaryOur growing technical business needs a temporary Data Management Analyst I to provide service-oriented support of configuration management and data management deliverables. We need a detail oriented resource who can assist with preparatory task in support of implementing a new MRP and PLM system. The ideal candidate will have experience working with Powerpoint and Word in support of training and process documentation specific to CM, PLM and ERP systems.OverviewConfiguration Management (CM) emphasizes the functional relation between parts, subsystems, and systems for effectively controlling system change. CM verifies that changes are carried out as prescribed through the Engineering Change (EC) process and that published documentation of items and systems reflects their true configuration. Support will include hands-on work organizing and preparing Engineering data and Program Management data. The CM/DM support resource will be responsible for timely participation in normal business operations to include, but not limited to daily tasking, email, status reporting, timesheets and training. The candidate will report to the CM/DM Manager.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesAssist with creation or updates of CM related training material in preparation of implementing Cost Point MRP and Omnify PLM systemsAssist with the creation or updates of CM related processes, procedures and work instructions in preparation of implementing Cost Point MRP and Omnify PLM systemsSupport request for inventory item set up and document naming in support of configuration identification requirements.Generate configuration status accounting (CSA) data from MRP reports and manipulation of excel spreadsheet to provide useable results.Evaluate CSA data (as-built) against as-planned baseline to identify deltas.Using MRP, research and note change artifacts authorizing CSA configuration variances.Create and sustain technical data package in preparation of upcoming audits.Qualifications2+ years of relevant experienceAssociates degree in Engineering or Related technical field (CAD data systems) or equivalent combination of education and experienceBasic understanding of engineering or manufacturing technical data packages Ability to work independently under supervision of othersGood oral and written communication skillsGeneral computer skills Experience with CAD data systems desirableKnowledge of product data management tools (Dynamics, Syteline, Cost Point, Omnify, ARAS, SAP, etc.)Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Word and Powerpoint preferred.Physical DemandsLifting: yes 0-20 lbs 0-25%Walking: yes 0-25%Climbing: yes 0-10%Bending: yes 0-10%Sitting: yes 0-75%Standing: yes 0-10%Stooping: yes 0-10%Kneeling: noOffice: yesTravel: yes 0-10%Leonardo DRS, Inc. and its subsidiaries and affiliates are equal opportunity employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. #DLS
