title: Talent Operations Data Analyst
description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with 125 million memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Netflix’s stunning colleagues impact to be able to bring the world’s stories to the world’s people.We’re currently on the hunt for a stunning Talent Operations Data Analyst. You’ll be responsible for designing and developing the data program for the talent acquisition team at Netflix. Netflix is rapidly growing and expanding globally and the recruiting team is partnering to support our global growth. While we prefer this person to be located in our Los Angeles office, we're open for them to be in the Los Gatos office.Why is it an exciting time to join Netflix? Talent Acquisition has a seat at the table, but now it’s time to scale without sacrificing quality. We’ll give you the context to be effective, the resources you’ll need to be efficient and we’ll get out of your way to be creative and innovative to elevate a high performing organization.Are you a storyteller?Being able to use data to tell a story, share insights and help us pivot is a powerful skill. Being able to share your analysis will help the organization make snap decisions and pivot when needed quickly.In this role you will Intimately know recruiting, be an effective thought partner and provide deep analysis and insightsEnsure data integrity by understanding business workflows and back-end data structureDevelop and maintain reports and design dashboards. Build the analytics infrastructure to identify macro and micro trendsPartner with the Netflix Science & Analytics team to develop the people analytics verticalWe Want Someone Who HasStrong analytical skills and ability to tell a story with insights and trendsStrong ability to plan proactively and react quicklyConfidence to rely on own judgment and discretion to work independently, take smart risksProactive and contributive; takes initiative and follows-through reliablyExperience working with HR leadership teamsAbility to think critically and be agile, as the Netflix recruiting approach is unique across the globe and business

title: Finance & Data Analyst
location: 10121 Barnes Canyon Road , San Diego, CA 92121, US
description: Position Overview The Finance & Data Analyst will be responsible for delivering reports and recommendations gathered from data derived from the ecoATM network and mined from other sources. ecoATM is the first and only company to create an automated self-serve kiosk system that uses patented, advanced machine vision, electronic diagnostics, and artificial intelligence to evaluate and buy-back used electronics directly from consumers for cash or store credit. The ecoATM network generates a broad range of data on transactions, locations, devices, demographics, pricing, etc. This data combined with data from external sources will be used by the Finance and Data Analyst to generate reports and ad hoc analysis across all of ecoATM’s functional areas. In addition, the position will be responsible for coordinating the work of other analysts and data scientists to produce other standard finance functions such as ROI, product and business forecasting and other strategic and tactical analysis.Key Responsibilities Develop complex automated and ad-hoc financial and decision models in support of financial analysis and forecasting for various groups within the company and to senior management Provide standardized reporting for the business Track and improve quality throughout the organization Make recommendations based upon data driven analysis Provides interpretation of financial policies, governmental legislation, accounting theory, or customer financial regulations Analyzes financial and other information to determine present and future financial performance Identify trends and recommendations for improvements to financial performance Establish databases of pertinent information for use in analyzing future plans and forecasts Make recommendations to management regarding cost saving or profit generating opportunities and profitability improvement strategies Will be responsible for developing presentation for senior management Education & Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field required; MBA strongly preferred 3+ years of financial, business, and/or strategy analyst experience with working knowledge of P&L required Proven analytics experience directly supporting Senior Management required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Expert in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint required SQL query development experience required Must have the ability to translate detailed and complex financial and data outcome models into company established goals and forecasts Proven analytic and quantitative decision-making skills when solving problems Able to synthesize complex and diverse data in order to draw logical conclusions Collaborative working style when partnering with customers and team members Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills Highly motivated to solve challenging business problems having a direct impact on top and bottom line Independent thinker with ability to move a project forward, draw key insights, and plan next steps Excellent verbal and written skills and the ability to interface effectively with all levels of management Tableau report writing and Alteryx experience are preferred This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. *This position is not accepting third-party recruiter or agency inquiries, principal only.*

title: Operations Business Analyst
description: DescriptionAbout the RoleAre you a rock star Business Operations Analyst who loves leading your team to deliver outstanding results to members? Are you working in a bank or financial services operations center and craving to leave for a fast-paced startup that is poised to change the banking world? Do you embrace hard work and a collegiate culture, and want to be paid well for delivering outstanding results? Then we want to talk to you.SoFi is looking for a Business Operations Analyst in Cottonwood Heights, Utah or Healdsburg, California. This role is responsible for providing analysis, reporting, and modeling to develop and interpret information that assists with operational decision-making, policy/procedure formation, growth management and other managerial functions. Management of the interval, daily, weekly and monthly reporting and analytics requirements for internal and external sites for a complex, high volume, multi-site contact center network.At SoFi, you’ll become part of a new kind of finance company based around speed, transparency, and alignment with our members’ interests. Our goal is to be at the center of our members’ financial lives. We created student loan refinancing, addressing the biggest financial challenge of a new generation through a modern approach to lending and personal finance. We expanded into other types of loans, and then into insurance and wealth management with similarly inventive products and soon to be launched SoFi money a modern take on a checking or savings account. As the company has grown, we’ve been able to help more people with these tools. SoFi has achieved significant growth, with ambitious plans ahead, but to continue this growth we need great talent.Job ResponsibilitiesDevelop and interpret information that assists management with decision-making, policy formulation, management of growth projections, and other managerial functions. Analyze data from various sources to compile a comprehensive picture of overall business unit performance.Develop recommendations, and prepare written and oral presentations to senior management.Ensure adequacy and accuracy of reporting by applying business knowledge and data analysis. Define specifications for reporting and partner with Engineering team to develop or improve performance-measuring capabilities. Develop performance measurements and analytical tools to improve operations.Act as operations analytics project lead on rollout of strategic initiatives.Job Qualifications2-5 years experience in an operations analyst position or equivalentBA/BS Degree strongly preferredExperience writing complex SQL queries against different databasesExperience developing comprehensive, flexible, dashboards that present key metrics for use by senior management.Some analytical modeling and data optimization experienceStrong data & root cause analysisStrong Microsoft Excel SkillsAbility to provide clear and concise feedbackExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to meet deliverables under tight deadlinesHigh attention to detailProven experience analyzing, interpreting and summarizing complex data setsExperience preparing and presenting reports, forecasts, trends and recommendations to senior managementBenefitsLunch program, a fully stocked kitchen, and subsidized gym membership.Competitive salary packages and bonuses.A flexible vacation policy allows you to truly relax and reboot. Comprehensive health, vision, dental, and life insurance as well as disability benefits.100% of health, vision, and dental premiums paid by SoFi for employees and their dependents. 401(k) and education on retirement planning. Tuition reimbursement on approved programs, up to $5,250 a year.Monthly contribution to help you pay off your student loans.

title: Sr. Financial Analyst
description: Job Description:  Reporting the CFO, this role will use industry standards and best practices necessary to compile, report, evaluate, analyze and recommend appropriate financial activities relative to the operation of the organization. This role will work closely with team members of other departments to obtain knowledge and data needed to produce timely and accurate reporting and analysis relative to the business, financial reporting, budgeting, variance reporting, forecast scenarios, and what-if scenarios on a timely basis.Essential Duties and Responsibilities: The Senior Financial Analyst will work directly with the CFO to integrate and develop processes that meet business needs, manage complex issues within functional area of expertise, be involved in long-term planning, and contribute to the overall business strategy. Work collaboratively with various departments to create and manage company financial forecast models. Further, you will collect and analyze financial data needed to create timely and accurate reports and presentations for internal and external stakeholders that facilitate well informed decisions Assist in the development of new tools and processes to support all aspects of financial planning and analysis, including forecasting, annual budgeting, long-range planning and monthly financial reporting Assist in the further development and maintenance of financial reports to clearly communicate actual results, forecasted performance, and variances to plan, forecast and budget Produce clear, well-formatted reports that communicate a compelling message for the stakeholders Know the business and understand the underlying drivers of revenue and expense Consolidate, load and validate financial data utilizing various databases Independently build complex financial models and present supporting analysis to executive audience   Qualifications: BA/BS in Finance or Accounting preferred Investment banking experience preferred 5+ years of financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting and analysis experience, including modeling capabilities required Strong financial acumen and demonstrated ability to analyze financial statements Advanced to expert proficiency in Microsoft Excel required Advanced to expert proficiency in Microsoft Power Point required Fintech and/or ecommerce industry experience preferred Analyze and manipulate large data sets utilizing programming languages such as R or MySQL preferred and derive key findings and insights Prior work experience anticipating accounting, financial reporting, forecasting, and operational issues, assessing their implications, and developing and implementing appropriate action plans Proven experience driving business performance in a high growth and fast-paced environment   Competencies: Analytical—synthesizes complex or diverse information. Business Acumen— has a sound understanding of the business and its strategy Problem solving—the individual identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner and gathers and analyzes information skillfully Oral and written communications—communicates effectively; prepares clear and concise reports and presentations for internal and external use Trustworthy/creditable— quickly establishes credibility, trust, and support within all levels of organization; respects other people’s opinions and suggestions; takes ownership of issues and is accountable Process effectiveness— looks for ways to continually improve processes Judgment— exhibits sound and accurate judgment Planning/organizing— prioritizes and plans work activities, uses time efficiently and develops realistic action plans. Safety and security— observes safety and security procedures and uses equipment and materials properly Attention to detail — demonstrates high level of accuracy and thoroughness Proactive – identifies individual and company priorities while expressing willingness to present new ideas for efficiency and improving current processesSupervisory Requirements: No Direct ReportsEducation Requirements: BA/BS in Finance or Accounting field preferredPhysical Requirements: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. In the performance of the duties of this job the employee may be required to travel domestically and communicate using telephone and e-mail.   Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

title: Data Quality Analyst (Contract)
description: AMN is a $2B healthcare staffing company that has grown rapidly through multiple acquisition. The company is working to integrate and optimize operations across many disparate businesses and systems, and data governance is a key enabler of this key corporate strategy.This Data Quality Analyst role will be responsible for creating policies and processes required to ensure data quality, including issue resolution, exception handling and change management. In addition, this role will be responsible for defining / categorizing and managing the lifecycle / relationships of AMN data assets. Tracking adherence to policies through objective metrics, and continuous process improvement will be key aspects of this role as well. You will be given the opportunity to take your proven experience and… Lead key aspects of data cleansing and integration efforts for strategic system harmonization project Formalize master data management policies and lead key aspects of operationalizing and monitoring effectiveness of policies Create a business glossary and document data lineage for data assets required for enterprise reporting Assist with on-going implementation of data governance policies, including hands-on data validation and issue resolution Understand core business processes, and work with cross-functional stakeholders to align on policies and processes that ensure data quality Work with IT and/or 3rd party vendors to install and validate tools needed to support data governance objectives Required Experience: Bachelor’s degree in related discipline 2-5 years’ experience in data-related roles Preferred Experience: Experience with Salesforce and/or Peoplesoft applications Proven experience in data management, stewarding, coupled with a passion to drive consistency and value from data assets Instinctual understanding of the value of data in an organization, and the ability to drive awareness across business leaders Strong technical acumen and attention to detail; understands databases and able to use SQL to run queries, etc. Effective collaboration and communication skills

title: Sr. Claim Analyst, Workers’ Compensation / Risk Management Accounts
description: TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.Job Summary/OverviewThe Senior Claim Analyst is responsible for oversight & monitoring activities for assigned Workers’ Compensation claims in multiple state jurisdictions. The person will manage claims for larger clients, mainly risk management clients by working directly with the TPA and assigned vendors. The position is responsible for financial monitoring of claims and data integrity, while managing claims costs and outcomes while providing excellent customer service to our clients and internal colleagues. The Senior Claim Analyst will in prepare and present occasional onsite claim reviews with the individual client(s).Essential Duties/Responsibilities This position acts as oversight by performing a thorough review for proper claim strategy and reserving of claims reported by a select group of clients across all states. Reviews are focused on ensurng the TPA adheres to Best Practice claims management and educating the client on claim outcomes and risks. Communicate with the TPA adjusters on a daily basis to develop strategies and document a clear plan of action to closure on all assigned claims. Ensure TPA is employing proper techniques to mitigate claims expense including, but not limited to: medical care is consistent to control for overutilization, defense attorneys are using using tactics to reduce litigation expense and all other vendors are properly utilized to avoid costs to the claim without value to the claim outcome. Review and approve all requests legal referrals, proper investigation and additional claims expense used to mitigate the cost of claims for the client. Review monthly loss runs and claim trends to identify opportunites with assigned clients. Engage all departments when retention efforts are necessary, including Senior Management. Document client conversations using Saleforce as client relationship software. Prepare and present client claim reviews, including the use of metrics and dashboard reports Escalate concerns regarding claim quality and outcomes to Manager. Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the manager’s discretion.Job Requirements And QualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s degree; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Training Requirements (licenses, Programs, Or Certificates) AIC, SCLA, claims certification preferred Casualty claim license required Workers’ Compensation Claims Adjuster License preferred.Experience Minimum five to seven years of claims adjusting experience required Multi-jurisdictional knowledge, including some experience in California.Other Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Excellent verbal and written communication skills, proper use of grammar and available tools to create presentations to clients. Strong communication skills with employees at all levels of the organization Strong knowledge and understanding of both state and federal employment laws Excellent interpersonal skills Excellent presentation and facilitation skills A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace Ability to adapt to a fast paced continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically PowerPoint and Excel. Knowledge of (RMIS) Risk Management Information Systems and SalesforceWORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION (Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.) Some travel required, approximately 30%. Travel will include both east and west coast. Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable office setting. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity.TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact a company manager, a company officer or a TriNet HR representative to request such an accommodation.Job CategoryInsurance Services

title: Senior QA Engineer
description: CallidusCloud Analytics & AI is built on an exciting ecosystem of multiple technologies running in the Cloud. We are looking for an outstanding Engineer like you to help us to build our distributed, highly-available analytics platform.  The ideal candidate must have a deep knowledge of software development and cloud infrastructures, microservices architectures and Big Data challenges. We expect you to be an excellent analyst, team builder and problem solver, having fluency in Scala and some other JVM based or functional programming languages.Responsibilities : Write automated tests using open-source tools/frameworks (ScalaTest,Junit,TestNG,PyTest,etc).Work closely with the rest of the agile team members (SW Engineers, QA Automation Engineers).Support and deploy builds in various QA environments with attention to detail about various settings and configurations.Be a problem solver: be able to understand the big picture, analyze problems and improvements and suggest solid alternatives and answers to our daily challenges.Be a team builder: you would prefer to collaborate with product owners, architects, quality assurance and infrastructure than being a lonely wolf.Be a mentor: you would mentor other team members within the engineering organization with respect to the automation and performance.Introduce and influence process improvements and act as an agent for change to the organization.Qualifications : At least 3 years hands-on experience in software development. Knowledge of at least one of the JVM languages: Scala, Java. Experience with at least one of the databases and storage systems. Load and performance testing using open source tools such as Gatling, Taurus, or JMeter. Successful history of implementing automated functional and regression based test frameworks utilizing open source tools. Strong UNIX/LINUX scripting and command-line troubleshooting background. Strong understanding of automated testing for web based API such as Rest and web services. Experience with server-side/back-end automation and automating web-services. Experience with XPath, XML, HTML & Regular Expressions. Experience with tools such as web monitoring, code coverage, memory tools. Experience using tools such as Apache, Maven, ANT, Jenkins. Knowledge and familiarity with Unix based OS. Strong sense of ownership, passionate, fast learner, detail oriented, analytical mindset, perfection seeker. Good verbal and written communication skills. BS or MS degree in Computer Science or related field. Nice to have: Experience with scalable automation development using docker, clusters and virtual machines/vagrant systems.

title: Data Analyst
description: About MyndMynd is the leading tech-enabled property management company in the US. The company’s mission is to make renting and owning real estate simple for everyone. Mynd’s technology is reinventing how property management works in the mid-market multi-family and single family markets, which constitute a large and highly fragmented industry. Our service enables smarter investment decisions, a more efficient and data-driven operation, and a better property owner and resident experience.Today, Mynd manages about 2,500 units in the Bay Area and San Diego with plans to grow nationwide. Our founders, Doug Brien and Colin Wiel, are experienced entrepreneurs that previously founded Waypoint Homes and took that company public (SWAY: NYSE) in 2014.Mynd’s Company Values Are Be Myndful Play like an A Team Think like an Investor Innovate at Every Opportunity Deliver Great Service Be Transparent Job SummaryThe Property Management industry is up for disruption with the help of advanced technology and data. Here, at Mynd, we take pride in being the thought-leaders in that space, and are looking for a passionate and talented analyst who can lead data analysis, leverage insights and help make data-driven improvements to our product and business. This role will work closely with the Product and Marketing teams to aggregate and analyze data from various sources. You will be key in identifying trends and communicating meaningful insightful findings to help shape Mynd’s strategy. A successful candidate will be ready and eager to guide Mynd to increased operational efficiency by leveraging your quantitative, analytical and modeling abilities.Responsibilities Leverage Mynd’s operational, marketing and financial data to analyze and identify key trends. Identify opportunities to improve operational efficiency based on Mynd’s operating data trends and patterns. Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Accounting and Operations teams to develop key metrics. Build predictive models to forecast trends, solve complex business problems, enhance existing products and develop new product offerings. Generate well-written, relevant and thought-provoking analysis, commentary and visualizations on residential property management and key markets. Work with Marketing team to design and run A/B testing; and further validating test hypothesis. Work closely with Product Managers and the Marketing team to develop hypotheses and implement solutions that optimize funnel conversion, acquisition channels and lower overall CAC while driving scale. Deliver on ambiguous projects with multiple stakeholders, unclear requirements and incomplete data. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other quantitative fields. Advanced degrees preferred.3-5 years of experience in data analysis/modeling. Fluency in SQL and knowledge of R/Python. Advanced proficiency in Excel. Strong statistical skills.Highly analytical and creative thinker comfortable working with ambiguity. Ability to form and test your own opinions based on data. Must be self-directed, and able to work on teams. High degree of accuracy and attention to detail. Ability to manage multiple projects, deliver on deadlines, and work effectively in a fast-paced environment. Excellent ability to communicate effectively with all levels in the company, written and verbal. Experience with Tableau is a plus.

title: Data Scientist, Marketing Analytics
description: Who Are We? Prosper is built on a simple idea: connect people who want to borrow money with those that have money to invest. Prosper is an online marketplace that gives borrowers access to individual and institutional investors. Borrowers get low, fixed rates with no hidden fees or prepayment penalties. Investors can earn great returns through the platform’s data-driven underwriting for personal loans, creating a new and diverse investment opportunity. Through Prosper, more than $12 billion in personal loans have helped borrowers consolidate their credit card debt, pay for large purchases, make home improvements and cover medical expenses. Prosper Marketplace is headquartered in San Francisco and operations in Phoenix.Prosper Marketplace is headquartered in San Francisco. The Prosper marketplace lending platform is owned by Prosper Funding LLC. For more information visit: www.prosper.com and follow Prosper on Twitter @ProsperLoans.What We NeedWe are seeking an experienced data scientist to join our Marketing Analytics team in San Francisco. The successful candidate is a rigorous data analyst with a passion for seeking truth and driving Prosper's omni-channel marketing strategy. You will apply statistical and economic models to inform spend decisions for Prosper's multi-million dollar marketing budget. You must be able to work both independently and in a collaborative environment with acute attention to detail. This role will be reporting to the Director, Marketing Analytics. What You Will DoLead investigations into marketing program economics - segmentation, targeting, messaging, conversion, and loan performance - to drive growth and increase efficiencies.Leverage models to inform key marketing initiatives such as cross-channel spend allocation (UA and retention), expected response, multi-touch attribution, and LTV.Partner with marketing, product & risk teams to create, develop and integrate marketing testing that align with product and risk strategies.Perform A/B test analysis and present test results and recommendations.Influence key decisions across marketing, product, and risk programs through robust data analysis, distilling and presenting actionable insights.  Align closely with business units to develop analysis and predictive modeling to drive critical business organizational decisions and optimization efforts. What You Will Need To HaveMaster’s Degree in STEM or other quantitative field. PhD preferred but not required.2+ years experience in a statistical modeling oriented role; marketing analytics experience preferred.Strong knowledge of Python / R or other mathematical programming languages; experience working with large data sets preferred.Knowledge of SQL preferred but not required.Proven experience with statistical modeling techniques.Desire to work in a fast paced, ever changing, start-up environment.Ability to drive solutions to complex problems quickly and successfully, both individually and as part of a team effort.Willingness to learn new skills and embrace a team-first culture. What’s In It For YouIn addition to working for a world class FinTech company and having a lot of fun doing it, Prosper provides it’s employees an excellent compensation and benefits plan. The plan includes incentive bonuses, stock options, company paid health, dental and vision insurance, paid vacation time, 401k with employer match and even fitness reimbursement and commuting reimbursement benefits.

title: Business Data Analyst (JP4384)
description: Job Title: Business Data Analyst (JP4384)Location: Thousand Oaks, CAEmployment Type: ContractBusiness Unit:Translational Sciences AdministrationDuration:1+ years (likely extensions)3Key Consulting Inc. is looking for role for a Business Data Analyst with 5 – 7 years’ experience in business data analytics (Tableau, etc.) within biotech/pharma financial analytics team for a global, CA-based, bio-pharmaceutical company.Job DescriptionThe ideal candidate will have a background in pharmaceuticals or Biotech within finance or business operations with experience in research forecasting, portfolio planning, and expense analytics.The position will require the individual to build and implement data infrastructure and reporting for portfolio and resource planning; provide technical expertise in business data analytics along with project management services (as mentioned below). The individual will create dashboards and data models to support prioritization of projects and resources. The individual will work in a matrixed environment to gather requirements and design solutions to enable both portfolio planning/prioritization as well as resource utilization and forecasting.Top Must-HaveData visualization expertise with financial data. Programming expertise with financial and portofolio data (cost and resource). Excellent soft skills (working well in teams, etc) Basic Qualifications Technical expertise with data management and analytics (both theory and application) Experience with financial analytics and analytical solutions design Project management experience. Works well in teams and in a matrix environment. Tableau analyst experience is a must. Finance, Portfolio Management experience, Data analytics and visualization, Programming experience. BSc, MBA preferred, 5-7 years in Business Data Analytics and handling Financial Data Day To Day Responsibilities Gathering requirements and designing solutions for business analytics with a focus on the Translational Sciences Product and Portfolio Management, implementation and resource and expense analytics. Leading the execution of the reporting workstream in support of the Translational Sciences Product and Portfolio Management implementation.Why This Position Is OpenPlanned Project.Employee Value PropositionIndividual will join a high performing team to drive value in productivity, continuous improvement in business analytics within the Translational Sciences organization as well as R&D strategic initiatives. This will be a high exposure role to many functions and stakeholders as this team is responsible for resource, study and budget planning, contract management support, and engaged in operational excellence and Amgen transformation initiatives. The group is divided among three subcategories: Budget Execution, Resource Management and Study Planning and Forecasting.Red Flags Low learning agility. Unable to work in a fast paced environment that changes rapidly. Unable to work well in teams (does not exhibit soft skills during interview process. Do not send candidates that do not have expertise in some analytics platforms like Tableau, Cognos, MicroStrategy, etc. or not familiar with financial data terminology Interview ProcessPhone interview followed by in-personWe invite qualified candidates to send your resume toIf you decide that you’re not interested in pursuing this particular position, please feel free to take a look at the other positions on our website www.3keyconsulting.com. You are also welcome to share this posting with anyone you think might be interested in applying for this role.Regards,3KC Talent Acquisition Team

title: Business Analyst, Data & Analytics - San Bruno, CA
description: Business Analyst, Data & Analytics - San Bruno, CA - 23272Analytics - USA San Bruno, CaliforniaHave you ever walked down an aisle in your local Walmart and wondered why your favorite beverage or food product moved? At Nielsen, we work with retailers to help them understand their consumers, and to optimize their business down every aisle. On the Nielsen Retail Team you will work face-to- face with major retail players and use Nielsen solutions to help answer questions such as finding the right assortment and guiding pricing strategies. Every day brings a new challenge when working in the fast paced retail environment.Be curious. Be collaborative. Be forward thinking. Join the Retail Team and work with our clients as a problem solver and the voice of Nielsen at our clients. When you join the Nielsen team, you’re signing up for an experience that requires flexibility, curiosity, and passion.As a Business Analyst You Will Work closely with Nielsen’s Walmart client service team to define information objectives and design appropriate analytic model solution Ensure pro-active insights and action oriented solutions are delivered to clients on time and without errors Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics analyses, dashboards, etc. Surface insights though polished visualizations to help guide critical business decision-making Maintain an organized workflow and actively contribute to team knowledge base Ensure data quality throughout all stages of acquisition and processing, including data collection, cleansing, normalization and transformation Background And Technical Skills Proficiency in at least one scripting/statistical language (R or Python preferred) Experience building tools and automated processes to extract, clean, and distill data Comfortable writing Linux OS shell scripts Advanced SQL knowledge (iterative functions, using WITH statements, performance tuning, etc.) Familiarity with Jupyter Notebooks a plus General Skills Strong logic, deductive reasoning, problem solving and critical thinking skillsExperience tackling vague problems, transforming unframed problems into algorithmic solutions. Scrappiness and independent troubleshooting ability Demonstrated mastery in data analysis & application to client business issues Strong project management skills Able to work collaboratively with internal and external teams Strong sense of urgency and accountability to drive client outcomes2+ years of professional experience This role is located in the San Francisco Bay area in San Bruno, CAAbout NielsenNielsen N.V. (NYSE: NLSN) is a global performance management company that provides a comprehensive understanding of what consumers Watch and Buy. Nielsen’s Watch segment provides media and advertising clients with Total Audience measurement services across all devices where content — video, audio, and text — is consumed. The Buy segment offers consumer packaged goods manufacturers and retailers the industry’s only global view of retail performance measurement.By integrating information from its Watch and Buy segments and other data sources, Nielsen provides its clients with both world-class measurement as well as analytics that help improve performance. Nielsen, an S&P 500 company, has operations in over 100 countries that cover more than 90 percent of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.nielsen.comNielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.Job Type: RegularPrimary Location: San Bruno , CaliforniaSecondary Locations: , , ,Travel: Yes, 5% of the Time

This role will provide oversight and on database design decisions, best practices, and processes for a team of data analysts. Work with a team of data analysts on a daily basis to provide input, guidance and oversight over database designs / models / processes.Skills And KnowledgeBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technologies strongly preferred.Prior hands-on experience in using ETL tools, Business Objects or other related BI toolsPrior hands-on experience in using ERWin a plusPrior experience in Financial Services industry a plus. Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to work in a team environment. Ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms. title: Data Analyst
description: Robert Half Technology is seeking a Data Analyst for a start-up company in the San Diego area. The ideal candidate will have a strong mathematical and statistical background with solid business analytics knowledge. Reporting experience is a must as they will need to understand and analyze data and put together reports in a visually compelling way. They will be providing analysis and information supporting different events, campaigns and initiatives for various clients. This person will enable data driven business decisions by performing business and data analyses using a number of various techniques varying from data aggression to complex statistical analysis. If this sounds like you, please send your resume to Mark.Ecal@rht.com.Qualifications: 2+ years of experience in data analytics, mining and visualization and quantitative techniques Strong understanding of Tableau, SQL, Excel and PowerPoint Ability to give recommendations on how data should be used Experience with visualization tools and Business Intelligence, emphasis on Tableau Strong mathematical and statistical background Must be a team player with a professional client-facing demeanorTechnology doesn't change the world. title: Sr. Data Analyst, Statistics (Customer Experience)
description: Customer Experience Senior Data AnalystWe are seeking an Analyst for the Customer Experience Voice of the Customer Program within Success Management organization. We are looking for someone who is excited to be part of a comprehensive and growing Customer Experience program for our brand.The ideal candidate should be passionate about customer data, with a proven history of driving insights that improve the customer experience. A can-do attitude, with the expertise to deliver. Willing to roll up their sleeves in a "start-up-like" environment, building from the ground up and facilitate quantitative and qualitative customer survey programs across multiple functional areas. Able to aggregate, analyze and interpret primary and disparate data across multiple data sources and formats. Execute new measurement programs and refresh existing programs as needed to provide a more holistic voice of customer assessment.Responsibilities:* The Customer Experience Data Analyst must utilize different technologies to gather and synthesize customer feedback data with associated business data to determine key drivers of customer success, loyalty, risk, churn and overall experience, and then translate that into actionable insights.* Top line and in-depth analysis of customer data to determine significance of trends and impact on business and customer health* Perform recurring statistical analysis on Voice of the Customer data and determine key insights* Aggregate and compare data from various sources for ad-hoc analyses* Collaborate with Data Science teams for predictive analytics and recommendations* Reconcile and validate data across systems* Maintain an awareness of key industry trends to provide context for the performance analysis and recommendationsRequired Skills / Experience:* Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Business, Data Science, Computer Science or similar field; Advanced degree preferred* At least 5-10 years direct experience, preferably in Customer Experience, or Market Research in an IT, SAAS, or Fortune 500 Company* Knowledge of a variety of survey design and research methods* Experience with multivariate techniques including correlation and regression; able to develop plans of analysis needed* Strong technical skills, and must be expert level in MS Excel, R, SPSS, SQL, or related analytic tools* Demonstrated passion for Customer Experience and acting as an advocate for customers* Strong organizational, critical thinking, influencing, and relationship management skills* Experience using Martiz, Qualtrics, Gainsight or similar enterprise level survey tools a plus

title: Public Relations Research Analyst
description: Are you passionate about data and metrics? Do you revel in research? Do you enjoy designing surveys that yield fascinating results? If so, we might have the perfect job for you! Robert Half is seeking a Public Relations Research & Data Analyst to identify workplace trends and topics for thought leadership and public relations programs, recommend ideal research approaches to get compelling data, and optimize research for existing programs. In this role, you’ll design and coordinate surveys with the PR team and survey vendor, analyze data, and recommend how to illustrate or convey key findings. You’ll also establish key performance indicators for evaluating the success of our PR programs, optimize reporting and work with our marketing analytics team to feed PR results into overall program performance dashboards.Specific responsibilities include:Identify trends and topics for new RH content or PR programs, and optimize research for existing programs. Track competitor and third-party research; conduct online research or leverage social media to help identify and engage with credible experts that could potentially be used for PR or content programs. Coordinate workplace research surveys with PR team and vendor; design surveys for RH-wide content programs; analyze, summarize and share insights with PR and content teams; make recommendations for how data should be displayed in visuals and content pieces. Review content drafts to ensure data is conveyed accurately; track survey questions and results. Serve as primary point of contact for survey vendor. Mine internal data for potential use in PR and content programs. Assist with ad hoc research requests from PR team and field leadership. Work with PR team and vendor to establish key performance indicators for evaluating our PR programs. Work with vendor to optimize quarterly and annual media coverage reports and set up real-time dashboards. Work with marketing analytics team to feed PR results into overall program dashboards. Run PR reports, as needed, for executive meetings or other ad hoc requests. Serve as primary point of contact for media monitoring vendors. Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree, preferably in statistics, business, economics or library science. 5+ years of statistics, market research or data analysis experience preferred. Background in business statistics and survey development (course work or work experience), media measurement, reporting, and KPI development preferred. Must have the ability to think strategically and analyze complex data. Ability to work in a fast-paced setting. Ability to communicate complex data and analyses in understandable terms and influence executive management. Must be able to produce compelling and persuasive communications, including but not limited to: media reports, research program recommendations and key findings, general correspondence. Understands business challenges and opportunities and can translate them into innovative research topics and surveys. Works effectively with employees at all levels of the organization in addition to external experts and vendors. Basic understanding of Google Analytics preferred. Experience with Domo or similar BI tool preferred. Analytical and mathematical skills required. Statistical package experience (SAS, SPSS) preferred. Business analytics software experience (Cognos, Business Objects) preferred. Experience with Salesforce a plus. MS Office including strong Excel and PowerPoint skills required. Ability to craft survey questions to get meaningful results; survey design experience required, including expertise with SurveyMonkey, Qualtrics or similar survey program. Experience with Cision and Public Relay media monitoring platforms. Experience with Workfront preferred. Knowledge of social media, including Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn. Creativity and an openness to new ideas and innovations. Overall thirst for knowledge. Good news sense. Ability to work independently and set priorities based on high-level direction of Sr. Director of Brand PR At Robert Half, there’s more to us than what we do. Learn about our values and what it’s like to work for the largest specialized staffing firm in the world at our San Ramon, California corporate office. We are Robert Half - Take a look!JOB LOCATION CA SAN RAMON CORP Follow us on Twitter @RH_Corp_Jobs for Robert Half Corporate job openings and career and workplace news! Robert Half International Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veteran As part of Robert Half’s corporate facility employment process, any offer of employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background check. You may apply for this position online, or by mail. Robert Half is committed to being an equal employment employer offering opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to corporaterecruiting@roberthalf.com for assistance.

title: HR Data Business Analyst
description: HR Data Business Analyst – Workforce Planning / HRWhat You'll DoAt Cisco, we believe a diverse workplace leads to innovation, better collaboration, and a high-performance culture where everyone is welcomed, respected, valued, and heard. In fact, our inclusion and collaboration objectives are integral to every segment of our business.We are looking for a HR Data Business Analyst to join Cisco’s Inclusion, Collaboration and People Planning Digitization and Business Intelligence team. You will work as part of the team to help identify drivers of highly inclusive, diverse, competitive and collaborative organizations helping to craft Cisco’s people strategies by leading analyses and summarizing key business insights. You will connect business, workforce, diversity, inclusion and collaboration information to create powerful insights that support HR and business strategy. You will find patterns in data as you draw from and build on your skillset of extensive data analysis techniques and help create stories that moves beyond the data and explains the why as business leaders plan their inclusion and collaboration focused people plans.Responsibilities Contribute to the detailed statistical analysis of our people data, in order to identify actionable insights through ad-hoc requests and operational solutions Manage and compile data from various sources to provide business insights across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data types Develop, run, and validate predictive models under mentorship from Senior Data Scientist and in partnership with analytics team Simplify and visualize results for mass consumption by non-technical audiences across the company Apply expertise in statistical modeling techniques like time-series, factor, principal component, regression analysis to deliver insightful findings Work with senior Data Scientist resources on the team to help prepare results to be communicated in a way that informs and drives the organization to action Connect the dots across a range of business, HR and workforce information to tell a story and provide insight, rather than just reporting the data Collaborate to further develop diversity and people planning frameworks, models and insights for understanding by the business, making quantitative decisions on complex business problemsWho You'll Work WithThis role is a highly collaborative, you'll be an integral part of a business intelligence team that has responsibilities across Inclusion, Collaboration and People Planning. You will work closely with cross functional teams including other COEs across Cisco to analyze a full spectrum of Business, HR and Collaboration data in support of a highly inclusive and collaborative organization.Who You AreOur Minimum Qualifications For The Role Are Demonstrable experience using data visualization to tell compelling stories with data Intellectual curiosity and ability to handle ambiguity but seek clarification when needed Strong hands-on data analysis, discovery and track record of delivering insights from data Able to sustain quick turnaround times for research and data analysis Strong SQL, data design / modeling, ETL / Database (objects) integration experience Data visualization (Tableau preferred , MicroStrategy nice to have) Strong written/oral business communication Excel, PowerPoint Data Integration scripting R or Python Curious, critical thinker, team-player Forecasting, predictive analysis (regression, cluster analysis, hypothesis testing, model training) Strong ability to translate large amounts of data into crisp business insights for technical and non-technical audiences Strong team-player who can execute effectively across the entire lifecycle of data analysis Experience in a matrixed organization, ability to form relationships with Stakeholders Master’s Degree or Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar field of study, and more than 3+ years of equivalent work experience in applying predictive analytics to solve business challengesAdditional Desired SkillsSAS, SPSS, statistical package exposure (time series, parametric, etc)Exposure to agile delivery methodologiesIllustratorAbility to influence, align StakeholdersAbility to manage risk, speak to evidence-based risk management strategiesWhy CiscoAt Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better. We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices. We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

title: Sales Engineer, Pentaho Partner Team (Big Data & Analytics) (Remote)

A key component of what we bring to our customers is based on the Pentaho platform, enabling IoT and Digital Transformation solutions across various industries. The Pentaho platform is a key component of Hitachi’s social innovation strategy that will change the world (https://www.hitachivantara.com/en-us/company/corporate-social-responsibility.html). This position is one of the most critical roles driving the future of our company’s IoT business. Pentaho experience a significant plus.3+ Years of experience supporting enterprise software sales cyclesStrong communication, presentation, and relationship skills; ability to provide more than simply technical assistance on callsProven track record working with a sales partner or team to drive revenueUnderstanding of cloud/virtualization technologies (e.g. Azure, Amazon, Google, Private cloud)Hands-on working experience with core technologies includingOperating systems (e.g. Linux, Windows, shell scripting),Analytical databases (e.g. Redshift, Netezza, Snowflake)Relational databases (e.g. Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, generic SQL, JDBC)Content (e.g. XML, JSON, text)Data engineeringAdvanced analytics (e.g., R, Python, Weka, SASSecurity systems (LDAP, SSO)Understanding of “Big Data” technologies (e.g. Hadoop, NoSQL, Spark).Understanding of Data Science and Machine LearningB.A. or B.S. Degree from an accredited university (may substitute an Associate degree plus 4 additional years of experience)Major or minor in computer science or MIS a plusQualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, place of origin, ethnic origin, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, genetic information, mental or physical disability, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable national, state, or local law.

title: Senior Manager of Marketing Data & Analysis
description: Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that combines content management, commerce, and customer insights. The Sitecore Experience Cloud™ empowers marketers to deliver personalized content in real time and at scale across every channel—before, during, and after a sale. More than 5,200 brands—including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, Dow Chemical, and L’Oréal—have trusted Sitecore to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.   Position Summary: You will take a leading role in the transformation of Marketing to a fully data-driven organization. Working cross-functionally, you will help develop and implement our data strategy including demand analytics in-depth, full understanding and analysis of our customer and prospect databases, collection and analysis of KPIs across marketing functions, and regular discussion with business leaders on understanding and taking action from our data.   You will also develop and drive a customer database strategy by analyzing our current prospect and customer databases; identify gaps in our account or contact data; work with marketing leadership to develop a segmentation strategy; and develop and implement a data quality and governance program.   You will develop a vision for data, analytics and insights in Marketing and the roadmap to execute the vision. Working with internal, external and cross-functional resources, you will deliver the technical infrastructure for data execution while providing ongoing business value through data-driven insights. You will form a close partnership with the IT’s BI group to ensure that Marketing data is accurately stored and reported in our global BI database. You will work in close alignment with each functional head in Marketing to ensure that operational metrics and KPIs are collected, stored, reported and regularly used for driving business improvements. Demand generation is our primary focus in Marketing, but you will also deliver KPI measurement across all Marketing functions including Content, Product, Enablement, Communications, Field and Web.   You must be an excellent communicator able to report to all levels of the organization from the Board to the front-line. You must also be able to create alignment and collaboration across functions and teams. As a global company, you will need to manage internal customers and stakeholders around the world. Although you are technically capable, you have a proven ability to engage and drive insights in a business context.   Responsibilities: Drive the transformation of Marketing to a data-driven organization. You will be the owner of the vision and execution roadmap. Partner with the Marketing leadership to build robust KPI and reporting infrastructure to provide a regular cadence of transparency to Marketing operations and effectiveness. Drive ongoing improvements by identifying insights from the data. Develop and execute a customer database strategy by analyzing our customer and prospect databases Own and derive business insights from marketing analytics and functional KPIs Develop and deploy a global CMO dashboard that provides clear understanding of all marketing functions and drills-down to specific objectives and measures Manage internal and external resources to execute the data, analytics and reporting requirements of all Marketing functions Develop demand metrics in-depth including multi-touch, cost-per-lead, velocity and related lead generation analytics In partnership with other Marketing functional leads, develop a segmentation strategy to support prospecting, nurturing, lead reconstitution, personalization and testing Work with IT to incorporate Marketing data to our global BI infrastructure Integrate the Sitecore Experience Platform’s intelligence tools to our analytics processes   Job Qualifications: 7 or more years of marketing analytics, especially in a B2B environment 2 or more years of experience managing teams Experience working in a matrix environment where creating collaboration and influence are required for generating results Proven track record of creating improved business results through analytics, data and insights Experience with managing and reporting on campaigns and activities in a B2B demand waterfall environment Experience with marketing automation, testing and optimization and segmentation technologies Experience and capability with SQL, Excel BI Tools, and data visualization tools such as Tableau or PowerBI   After an offer is made and accepted, E-verify will be utilized to establish your identity and employment eligibility as required by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.   Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst
description: Senior Business Data Analyst   Overview:   The Sr. Data Analyst will be responsible for the development and maintenance of business intelligence solutions to support business strategies across the functional organizations. Deliverables may include interactive reports, dashboards, as well as BI applications that enable self-service reporting capabilities to business power users.   Responsibilities:Work with source matter experts to understand application data structures and data flows between systems in order to determine best sources of data to support business intelligence and analytics. Conduct data profiling, including column analysis, structural analysis, business rule and content analysis Gather, extract, manipulate, analyze and reconcile data from various environments for ad-hoc analysis and development of repeatable processes Build new or enhance existing automation for customized data gathering, modeling, reporting and related processes Develop and maintain documentation related to data gathering, analytic activities and associated results Create presentation materials, dashboards and reports to summarize the output of analytic activities and models into an informative and concise format providing conclusions and recommendationsCollaborate with the other Business Intelligence and IT teams to ensure data accuracy, consistency and leveragability of analysis and dataAdvise and assist stakeholders in the use of data analytics tools and techniques  Required Skills/Competencies:   Ten (8) years of relevant experience Minimum of five (5) years hands-on in customer analytics or predictive modeling using data management, analytical and statistical tools. Proficient in predictive and statistical analytics, data mining and other data analysis techniques Hands-on experience with data modeling, visualization and query tools such as: SAS EG, SAS Miner, Toad for Oracle, Toad Data Point, PL/SQL, Tableau, MS Excel Experience in Data Warehouse methodology, dimensional modeling and ETL techniques Ability to handle and/or lead multiple projects with minimal oversight Proven analytical, planning, problem solving and decision-making skills Ability to resolve complex problems using analytic methodologies Excellent communication and presentation skills Bachelor's degree in Econometrics, Finance, Statistics, Math, Economics, Computer Science or related degree (additional years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree)   Education, Certifications Bachelor's degree in Econometrics, Finance, Statistics, Math, Economics, Computer Science or related degree (additional years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree)

title: Sr. Data Analyst
description: Bird is a last-mile electric vehicle sharing company dedicated to bringing safe, low-cost, environmentally-friendly transportation solutions to communities across the world. We provide a fleet of electric, shared scooters that can be accessed via smartphone. Bird is headquartered in Venice, California and is rapidly expanding across the country and the world.OverviewA Sr. Data Analyst will work across the organization to generate the data and analysis needed to make the best decisions as we grow and innovate. You’ll be responsible for pushing the business forward on all fronts, based on insights derived from your deep understanding of our data and operations. You’ll have exposure to our top executives with the opportunity to learn from their deep experience in transportation and technology as well as the opportunity to impact their decision making at a critical time as we scale the business.What You'll DoOwn the design, development, validation, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, experiments and related roadmaps, etc. to drive key business decisionsConduct hands-on modeling/analytics retrieving, compiling, and analyzing large volumes of data from disparate databases into distilled, actionable information and insightsCollaborate with product, operations & marketing to deliver on key projects. This will include data provisioning, exploratory data analysis, data visualization and in some instances, statistical modelingChampion the analytics process – from business understanding, data understanding, data preparation, data modeling, evaluation, and deployment; lead by example and by training business stakeholders with varying technical and non-technical backgroundsDesign and analyze A/B multivariate tests to drive KPI improvementWhat You'll Need:Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field from a highly competitive school, Masters degree preferredMinimum 5-10 years of experience using data to facilitate business decisions; High growth technology, strategy consulting, business intelligence, investment banking/private equity backgroundProficiency with SQL, and experience or familiarity with one additional scripting languageStrong background in, or comfort with, statistical conceptsAbility to develop and manage an experimentation roadmapSteadfast focus on the details, while keeping strategic priorities top-of-mindResponsible and reliable to the people you work with - this is a team effort!Growth mindset: you seek out learning opportunities for yourself and the teamEffective communication skills: you can build the story and then tell it just as wellProject management savvy: you expect best from your peers to get joint projects done wellSeize opportunities and willing to go beyond the task at handRadiate positivity and possess a “can-do” attitudeResponsiveness: you deliver timely, digestible answers to complex asksConstantly think of ways to improve our products and the businessBird Rides Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer, and we welcome everyone regardless of their race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or genetics. We are dedicated to providing an inclusive, open, and diverse work environment.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: ### Position InformationThe marketing data analyst is responsible for researching, implementing, evaluating, and overseeing a comprehensive analysis and research strategy for UC Riverside's University Communications department. University Communications is responsible for managing and stewarding UC Riverside's institutional brand and national reputation. The department produces award-winning multimedia content, publications, videos and social content. It provides a wide-range of consulting, writing/editing, video production, and graphic design services for colleges, centers, departments, and other campus partners. Reporting to the director of digital marketing and analytics, this position will support University Communications and its campus partners in developing data-driven solutions and maximizing the ROI for marketing and communications tactics, vehicles, and channels. This position will manage data collection, analysis, and reporting, as well as the assessment, and interpretation of information required for making critical marketing and communications decisions. He/she will oversee the department's primary web, social, and earned media analytics tools. This position will excel in data-driven segmentation strategies, and outline and refine best practices for key target groups. He/she will be instrumental in understanding, distilling, and disseminating digital analytics in a way that is meaningful and action-oriented. Remote/home-based work location will be considered.### Education#### Education RequirementsDegree RequirementBachelor's degree in related area and/or equivalent experience/training.RequiredDegree in Business, Statistics, Marketing or Related field.Preferred### ExperienceExperience Requirement3-5 years of progressive experience in related positions and in a data-driven, complex organizationPreferredMinimum of 5 years of related experience.Required### Minimum RequirementsProven ability to serve as a technical resource providing advice and counsel on business intelligence issues.Thorough knowledge of business intelligence functions, analytics, industry standards and best practices.Detail oriented, with ability to manage time and organize competing priorities.Strong interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with a broad range of professional and technical staff.Thorough knowledge of relevant internal databases, BI applications and tools. Ability to produce high-quality reports and documentation.Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey complex information in a clear, concise manner.Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to manage complex information, assess problems, and develop and effective solutions.Analytical ability to assess marketing environment and the competition, anticipate future business needs, and develop creative ideas regarding possible responses.Experience with qualitative and quantitative research development, conducting/fielding research studies (online and in person) and final research analysis.Proficient and up-to-date with constantly evolving web analytics methodologies, including, but not limited to: Google Analytics (including Google Tag Manager and google data studio), SEO/SEM tools, etc. FB, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and LinkedIn analytics.Marketing, strategic planning, organizational development, and analytical/problem-solving skills.Expertise in marketing reporting, data management, and analysis to derive meaningful insights.Must be able to take the initiative and be resourceful in an environment of constrained resources.Ability to exercise good judgment independently while maintaining composure in a fast-paced, service-oriented environment.### Preferred QualificationsProficiency in MS Office applications and database applications, including CRM databases, database marketing, experience in database languages/reporting, data visualization programs, and survey design platforms (for example, Qualtrics) a plus.### Additional InformationIn the Heart of Inland Southern California, UC Riverside is located on nearly 1,200 acres near Box Springs Mountain in Southern California; the park-like campus provides convenient access to the vibrant and growing Inland region. The campus is a living laboratory for the exploration of issues critical to growing communities'air, water, energy, transportation, politics, the arts, history and culture. UCR gives every student, faculty and staff member the resources to explore, engage, imagine and excel.UC Riverside is recognized as one of the most ethnically diverse research universities in the country boasting several key rankings of which we are extremely proud. Washington Monthly (August 2016) ranked UC Riverside 12th in the nation in its annual University and College Survey. Education Trust placed UC Riverside 9th in the nation for closing the graduation gap between black and white students by 1.7 percentage points. In QS World University Rankings 2016/2017, UC Riverside's Department of Philosophy is #1 in the world for the frequency with which published papers are cited by other philosophers. U.S. News and World Report Survey (September 2016) ranked UC Riverside 118th overall; earns "Great Schools, Great Prices." Shanghai Jiao Tong University (August 2016) Academic Ranking of World Universities ranked UC Riverside among the top 151 to 200 institutions. This survey bills itself as "the most trustworthy precursor of global rankings of the world's top 500 universities." U.S. News and World Report's Best Graduate Schools (2016) including: Graduate School of Education - 62nd among ranked schools Bourns College of Engineering - 71st among ranked schoolsThe University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer with a strong institutional commitment to the achievement of excellence and diversity among its faculty and staff. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.For information about our generous employee benefits package, visit: Employee Benefits OverviewJob Number:* 201806121065Full/Part Time:* Full TimeSchedule:* 8AM - 5PMSalary:* $67,300 - $83,600

title: Data Analytics Lead - Marketing

title: Data Analyst
description: We are seeking applications for the role of Data Analyst preferably with Supply Chain / Sales / Retail background, for one of our clients. title: Data Analyst - Santa Ana, CA
description: Primary Responsibilities: Develop programs of highest coding standards Participate in projects to completion by contributing to database creation, statistical modeling, program development, and producing client reports Interpret and analyze clinical data from various sources and recommend efficient and accurate methods Provide and summarize claims, provider, lab, pharmacy, and membership data in support of Business Operations, Analytics, and Clients Create and update automated processes Produce and review production reportsRequired Qualifications: Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 3+ years of work experience in a corporate setting 1+ years of experience in health care analytics and working with large data sets At least an intermediate level proficiency with SQL, SAS and/or other statistical programs At least an intermediate level of proficiency working with MS Excel including formulas, calculations, charts, graphs, etc. Preferred Qualifications: Medicare experience Careers with Optum.
