title: GIS Specialist/Analyst
description: This position reports to the Gas Transmission Data & Analytics Supervisor for Asset Knowledge Management, and is a critical position responsible for working with a cross-functional team of program managers, engineers, and GIS analysts in support of the Transmission Integrity Management Program (TIMP) annual Class Location and High Consequence Area (HCA) studies.The Class Location and HCA analysis requires a count of building structures meant for human occupancy within specified distances from client’s gas transmission lines. This project is designed to generate remote sensing data that will be used to analyze structure counts near client Gas Transmission pipelines.This individual will provide database development support by translating change detection activities utilizing advanced processing techniques in ArcGIS.The successful candidate must be an advocate for safety, lead by example, and help client attain its vision of being the leading utility by leveraging the skills and experience of a diverse team to focus on the successful delivery of assigned programs.Qualifications8 years of work experience in GIS, project management, process development, or related field.Bachelor’s Degree / equivalent or relevant experience with an emphasis in GIS preferred.3 years experience in ArcGIS 10.x or later.Utility or Pipeline industry experience.Remote Sensing data (LiDAR and Ortho) classification.Integrity Management and Risk Management experience.Strong interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills.Experience in developing, implementing, and documenting workflows and GIS best practices.Being proficient with Esri ArcGIS 10x with extensions Network Analyst, 3D Analyst and Spatial Analyst.Must work well in a close team environment.ResponsibilitiesDigitize, create, maintain, display and update GIS databases.Perform ortho photo-interpretation and change detection analysis using LiDAR derived building footprintsacquired and classified during the study period.Attribute structure type and determine occupancy information.Perform QC checks for structure review to ensure critical fields are present in database.Reconcile and post edits to production version and resolve conflicts.If interested please respond with your resume to :rohit(at)verismsystems(dot)com provided by Dice GIS, ArcGIS, Remote Sensing data

title: Senior Analyst Business Analytics (Remote within US)
description: Our Business Analytics Team is growing! We are pleased to announce that addition of two new positions to support our business growth.The Senior Analyst position for the CBRE Business Analytics group provides complex research, data mining/analysis, reporting and interpretation of global, national, regional, local and/or account performance metrics. The Senior Analyst acts as a technical lead and manages business intelligence projects focused on real estate data analyses for CBRE’s clients. Through data warehousing, visualization, and examination, this position helps our clients optimize their operations across all service lines: facilities management, project management, finance, portfolio administration, cost forecasting, etc.A senior analyst works closely with our clients and database technical team to automate data collection from source operational systems, aggregate and standardize the information in a data warehouse, and develop Tableau dashboards that leverage the warehouse to generate meaningful client insights.Additionally, the CBRE Business Analytics group helps our clients develop budgets, benchmark facility operating costs, and predict upcoming capital requirements. A senior analyst leads projects to collect the requisite client real estate data, build and refine cost models using CBRE tools, and present a meaningful financial story in formal reports and briefings.The ideal candidate possess a broad skill set. Required skills include: strong technical capabilities with data manipulation and data modeling; advanced Tableau knowledge; extensive project management experience; and client-facing communications. Experience in the corporate real estate outsourcing industry is strongly preferred. Minimum of five years of experience. Advanced degree not required but preferred. Office is based in Santa Barbara, CA but work from home or another CBRE office is an option.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesPerform both technical lead and project manager responsibilities for business intelligence projects that require both strong business acumen and SQL knowledge.Create, maintain and optimize creative data visualizations and dashboards (primarily in Tableau) to derive actionable intelligence.Aggregation and analysis of quantitative data; forecast and trending of performance data.Process mapping and efficiency analysis.Lead on problem solving team that develops recommendations based on data interpretations.Provide subject matter expertise on data-related processes and analyses.Prepare formal written reports describing project methodology, scope, key assumptions, and results.Present progress and results to clients (both in-person and virtually) and collects feedback for revisions.Miscellaneous technical support for marketing materials, and data support for CBRE software systems.Supervisory ResponsibilitiesNo formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May lead project teams and/or plan and supervise assignments of lower level employees.Based in Santa Barbara, CA, this office provides consulting services, cloud and server-based software tools, and statistical indices that solve real estate business problems through robust data analytics. While the work is fast paced and challenging, the environment is casual and flexible.QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.EDUCATION And EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree (BA/BS) from four-year college or university. Master’s degree or MBA preferred. Minimum 5+ years of related experience.Tableau Experience Highly PreferredCERTIFICATES and/or LICENSESNone required.Communication SkillsExcellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.DATA MANAGEMENT AND ANALYTICSExcellent data management, manipulation, and analysis skills. Ability to create integrated data models from disparate sources. Understanding of relational databases. Highly skilled in dashboard design and development. Advanced Tableau skills are required. Proficiency in database technologies such as Microsoft Access or SQL Server is preferred.FINANCIAL AND STATISTICAL KNOWLEDGERequires basic knowledge of financial and statistical terms and principles.REASONING ABILITYAbility to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex data sets. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires advanced analytical and quantitative skills.OTHER SKILLS And/or ABILITIESAdvanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite Products, particularly Excel. Comfortable working independently and collaboratively.SCOPE OFRESPONSIBILITYDecisions made with thorough understanding of procedures, company policies, and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines. Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to department.LOCATIONThe office is based out of Santa Barbara, CA however work from home or another CBRE location is an option.

title: Conduct Analyst, Judicial Affairs
description: Summary Of Job Duties(Note: This summary will be used for keyword search) Conduct Analyst, Judicial AffairsReporting to the director for Judicial Affairs, the conduct analyst works with a high degree of autonomy and is responsible for operational, research and analytical functions for the Office of Judicial Affairs. The conduct analyst works independently and is responsible for interpreting policy and exercising judgement in a confidential work environment and serves as the first level of analytical review for incoming cases. The position supports the work of a director, senior associate director, assistant director, conduct officer, and graduate assistant through the completion of moderate to complex analytical work necessary in the planning and implementation of a comprehensive student conduct program that addresses issues of behavioral misconduct and academic integrity. Responsible for maintaining operational and database functions of the Office of Judicial Affairs. This includes maintenance of the confidential student conduct database, judicial affairs website, student evaluations/surveys and creating annual reports using a variety of data resources and analytical tools.The conduct analyst is responsible for analyzing student conduct database requirements. The conduct analyst works with a variety of departments to provide confidential student conduct information and to solve complex registration, financial aid, billing, and academic issues related to a student's disciplinary process. This position also creates confidential statistical and comprehensive reports for University Counsel and UCOP. The position requires a high level of accuracy as carries a high consequence of error. The conduct analyst works independently, using judgment and discretion. This position interacts with and advises the campus community, campus leadership, and external stakeholders around student conduct issues.This position requires training in crisis intervention, in-depth knowledge of complex state and federal laws that protect the confidentiality of student files and FERPA. Incumbent must have in-depth knowledge of regulations that comply with University of California policies and Student Code of Conduct. This position requires a high level of discretion and confidentiality.Minimum Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Education, Counseling, or other related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience. In-depth knowledge of student conduct or related field. Experience implementing policies and procedures. Demonstrated experience in student disciplinary case management and working with faculty and students. Must possess excellent communication (interpersonal, written and verbal) skills, and unquestionable standards of ethics and confidentiality.Desirable Requirements Master's Degree in Education, Counseling, or other related field.Special Conditions of EmploymentA little help? Go to Driver's License Requirements or Background Check GuidelinesSatisfactory completion of a fingerprint background checkMandated reporting requirements of Child AbuseOther Special Conditions of Employment Some evening and weekends may be required.Other Recruitment NotesOptional Applicant Documents Other Document (1)Other Document (2)Other Document (3)Required Applicant Documents ResumeCover LetterJob DutiesTotal Percentage of Duties:1003 Records Order ofImpEssenDuty%Freq.FunctionDuties 1 Yes 50 Daily Operational Conduct Analytical SupportUnder the direction and supervision of the Director, serves as the primary contact person for the Office of Judicial Affairs and performs the initial assessment and analysis of each incoming case.Analyzes academic and behavioral conduct situations to determine appropriate referral or action; this includes corresponding with students, parents, attorneys, police and campus counsel and assessing the complexity of the case and appropriate next steps.Identifies, assesses, and responds to student needs for services or crisis intervention. Analyzes the unique needs of individual students, staff, faculty, parents, and advisors pertaining to student conduct cases and coordinates with other campus partners to resolve registration, financial aid, billing, and academic issues resulting from complexities of a student's judicial case.Analyzes campus and Systemwide policies related to student conduct and works independently to provide information and recommendations to the campus community. Generates a monthly report of students who have not completed assigned educational sanctions and determines appropriate follow-up.Utilizes professional judgment in the daily operations of the department.Communicates accurate and timely information to a diverse campus community on issues that could have severe impact on the university and the students. Coordinates the initial intake and review of student conduct reports; creates case files and assesses the needs of the conduct officer based on policy and procedures; assesses case load of conduct officers and assigns the appropriate officer to each case.Facilitates scheduling of weekly hearings of the Student-Faculty Committee on Student Conduct, prepares reports and analyzes the Committee's statistical data for the director to present to the Committee.Works under tight and shifting deadlines, while dealing with frequent interruptions.Advises and assists faculty, staff and community members in reporting academic or behavioral misconduct. Coordinates sanctioning, including timeline, materials for review, and analysis of recommendations or evidence for the Office of the Vice Chancellor for Student Affairs.2 Yes 40 Daily Database ManagementManages student conduct database including requests for access, annual updates and reports.Responsible for evaluation of the databases, develops and implements changes and/or reorganization when needed to meet needs of the department. Assists in the preparation of Clery and campus reports, including analysis of data to provide for Clery reportingAlong with the Director and control point, responds to requests from UCOP and campus counsel for sensitive/confidential data.Coordinates projects for the Director or Senior Associate Director; determines timelines, analyzes and provides appropriate policy; makes recommendationsMaintains files and complies data for mandated statistical reports to federal and campus agencies.Researches and generates solutions to complex problems and situations.Maintains/updates Office of Judicial Affairs website.Maintains/updates student conduct electronic evaluations/ surveys and complies annual report. Has full and independent responsibility for ensuring that all electronic student conduct records are complete and accurate. Serves as a "Campus Security Authority" as required by the federal Jeanne Clery Act. Serves as a "Responsible Employee" under the UC Sexual Violence and Sexual Harassment Policy, federal Violence Against Woman Act (VAWA), and Campus SAVE Act.May perform other analytical projects as assigned.3 Yes 10 Daily Special Projects & Other DutiesCompletes special projects and other duties as assigned.

title: Data Analyst
description: We exist to celebrate human originality.   Our goal is to create a culture where smart, ambitious, and positive people can thrive. We value our community and want to improve our local schools, neighborhoods, and businesses. People are the most important element of our business. Our actions, words, and relationships represent what we believe and what we value. Since culture is the collective nature of the people working at Stance, we place a premium on the environment that fosters freedom and accountability across both individual and community levels.   Entrepreneurship Creativity Performance Personal Responsibility Gratitude   These are the values we place above all others. We seek out individuals whose personal constitution of values overlaps with ours. We believe in living these values will bond our teams and create a company culture that our competitors can never duplicate. As a result, we hire and promote the individuals who get results in a way that aligns with our five core company values.   Summary of the Stance Data Analyst:   Stance has an immediate opportunity for a skilled and experienced Data Analyst to provide thought leadership in measurement and analysis for digital marketing, ecommerce, and optimization efforts. This person would be directly responsible for analyzing and reporting on large datasets of to uncover insights about our customers to help Stance make better marketing decisions.   This position reports directly to the Manager of E-Commerce Marketing.   As a Stance Data Analyst, you will:   Work with e-commerce marketing team and additional stakeholders to analyze data and report on findings from customer database platform (Amazon Redshift) and Domo (data visualization tool) Deliver customer analytics and reports including but not limited to: customer segmentation, lifetime value, repeat purchase, churn, cumulative revenue, and misc. acquisition and retention metrics related to the customer, product, or marketing channel Analyze data from multiple sources (online and offline data) from marketing campaigns (emails, paid social, loyalty, and other digital marketing efforts): response rates, web site conversions, multi-touch attribution, incremental sales revenue increases, ROI, etc. which relates to the customer Directly querying Redshift database to create data visualizations of reports and findings in Domo Generates daily, monthly, and quarterly reports from multiple sources to assist parties in analysis and marketing effectiveness Working closely with many cross-functional teams to educate on our customer based on data and insights from analysis Utilizing customer data to fuel/drive real-estate locations and decision-making May be involved in projects related to product assortment and demand planning decision-making in the future as the role evolves   We are looking for someone with the following skills and qualifications:   Bachelor’s degree in marketing, statistics, business, or related field Minimum 3+ years of experience working with data or marketing analytics Strong proficiency in working within Excel with large data sets, using a data visualization tool like Domo a plus. Experience in data mining and complex data analysis highly preferred Experience with Google Analytics and other web analytics tools preferred Knowledge of SQL and ability to write SQL queries is highly preferred; additional statistical modeling experience a plus Experience with CRM or Email marketing platforms is a plus Experience working in a marketing automation platform preferred Experience with customer data and analytics, including development of insights in customer behavior, loyalty, etc. Independent worker with a self-starter attitude and initiative

title: Reporting Analyst
description: KARL STORZ Endoscopy-America, Inc., is an affiliate of KARL STORZ SE & Co. KG is a family-owned company that designs, engineers, manufactures, and markets all its products with an emphasis on visionary design, precision craftsmanship and clinical effectiveness.Headquartered in El Segundo, California, KARL STORZ Endoscopy-America is responsible for all U.S. distribution of endoscopes, instruments, imaging systems, electromechanical devices and OR1® integration technologies.Job SummaryThe Reporting Analyst is a data analyst responsible for supporting Customer Support management by producing analytics and for production of reporting and ad-hoc assignments designed to ultimately drive the organization to improve customer experience.The role will be primarily focused on generating and maintaining department-wide operation reports, customer experience data modeling, and service level performance reports. The Reporting Analyst will also be responsible for recommending and implementing improvements in operational reporting by analyzing results and variances; identifying trends and supporting the Customer Support management team.Key Job Factors Level of accountability: Generally managed Level of decision making: Limited variety of independent decisions Has contact with: internal managers and VP of Operations Supervision: Reports to Director, Customer Support Physical Requirements: Light, occasional physical effort Travel: up to 10 percentJob Responsibilities Maintain and update reporting models for use in analyzing department performance and customer experience opportunities Create and maintain reports and key data elements for Customer Support Provide analysis to help identify cause and effect relationships in operational performance Provide empirical analyses for influencing business decisions and the achievement of strategic customer service goals Participate in the design of short term and long term reporting solutions that meet and/or exceed business expectations Track operational and customer survey data by monitoring trends & period to period variances Analyze reporting and data in the department and recommends enhancements; surface any operations issues that impact overall department's performance to Director, Customer Support Report on performance analysis at the individual contributor level Track and report on departmental service levels vs. objectives to improve service outcomes Determine customer experience performance by comparing and analyzing Voice of the Customer survey data Support CS management by gathering and analyzing data; preparing and distributing monthly reports to: individual contributors, supervisors, managers & director Respond to reporting issues surfaced by management, conducting root cause analysis to identify and help with resolving issues Increases department productivity by automating models and applications; and identifying and executing process improvements Establish distributor reports for execution Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; title: Head of Real Time Data Analytics Platform
description: UpLift operates at the intersection of travel, technology and alternative lending. Founded by luminaries from the travel industry, UpLift is a well-financed startup that provides point-­of-­sale financing for consumer travel. The consumer travel segment is a $1 Trillion global market that is under-financed relative to other key consumer verticals. UpLift is generating revenue and rapidly scaling, and yet is still small enough for the right candidate to make their mark in a fundamental way on the company.UpLift is looking for an outstanding individual who combines superb technical, communication, and analytical capabilities with a demonstrated ability to get the right things done quickly and effectively to join as Head of Real Time Data Analytics Platform. This Senior Data Engineer must be comfortable working with a team of data engineers / scientists and product managers to raise the bar of the data analytics UpLift builds and maintains for our customers.You'll automate our way to faster decision-making and create analytic products. We track every customer action and each byte of data transferred, so you'll work to enable analytic data platform at incredible scale and collaborate with best-in-class data engineers and analytic experts.The ideal candidate for our team is a thinker and a doer: someone who embraces the startup culture, you will drive real time / offline data analytics solution, but at the same time enjoys implementing real systems, and is motivated by the prospect of spectacular business returns that customers need. You will own design, build, maintain and operate the data analytic platform. You will grow into a manager role and will help scale and build the team.You HaveRequirementsDesire to work in a collaborative, intellectually curious environmentBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related fieldImplemented a platform that can help use cases like anomaly detection to surface metric shifts across multi-dimensional, highly cardinal time series dataBuilt a data discovery platform and made data accessible for various teams at UpLift.Worked with and contributed to internal tools for visualization and interaction with large datasets (sub-second response on billions of records)Comfort self-managing on projects that are often cross-functional and ambiguousYou have experience with and a high level of fluency with the following:Data manipulation (SQL, Python)Data processing at scale (Scala, Hive or Java)Large-scale storage and retrieval (Hadoop, ElasticSearch or Druid)Visualization techniques and toolsApplied statisticsMachine LearningAWSCharacter and Qualities that will help you succeedYou have a growth mindsetYou’re passionate about deeper learningYou’re a self starter & team playerYou do the right things and you do it the right wayYou have good interpersonal and communication skillsYou are comfortable working in the most agile of environments. Requirements might change and sometimes they may be vague. Iterations will be rapid. You will need to be nimble and take smart riskBenefitsFull-time salary and equityHealth and dental insuranceEasy commute steps from Menlo Park Caltrain stationFree lunch daily

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Finance
description: Snowflake started with a clear vision: make modern data warehousing effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Because traditional on-premises and cloud solutions struggle with this, Snowflake developed an innovative product with a new built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. Snowflake: Your data, no limits.The Financial Business Systems Analyst (BSA) role is responsible for driving improvements in the processes and technologies supporting financial systems. This role works closely with internal Financial Business Operations leaders to effectively manage project plans and implement change management to financial systems.ResponsibilitiesBuilds the foundation for the project efforts by capturing the business context – problem definition, current state definition, objectives, business case, desired future state definition, etc.Develop detailed requirements (business, user, process, system requirements – functional and non-functional) and establish traceability to business visionManage the requirements throughout the project lifecycle by establishing and maintaining agreements between the business users and the project teamFacilitate and act as a liaison between the technical team and the business teamAbility to navigate the project team, IT personnel and business sponsors through a level of ambiguity including business process change; building organization and structure to requirements to drive out and define detailed requirements in an efficient mannerAct as the project manager for implementation of the solution – identify stakeholders, risk identification and mitigation, communication, define and drive schedules, escalate internally and externally (as appropriate)Provision new users, manage workflows, manage system configuration, and general end user assistance.Collaborate with development teams and SaaS vendors to identify system improvements.Design, develop and test enhancements in alignment with internal business process requirements.Manage prioritization, implementation, and change management of application changes/enhancements.Document all changes to applications per internal controls.Create technical documentation and conduct end user training.Document all changes to the SaaS systems, ensuring SOX compliance readiness RequirementsBachelor’s Degree Financial ERP System Administration experience (Workday preferred)Understanding of business Financial processes, including but not limited to; Accounting, AR, AP, etc.Highly developed written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.Strong attention to detail, goal oriented.Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities.Commitment to excellent customer service.Successful in dealing with company personnel at all levelsAbility to work independently Project Management experienceNice To HaveFamiliarity with Avalara, Coupa, or credit card systemsUnderstanding of Global entities processes/challengesAbout SnowflakeSnowflake Computing, the cloud data warehousing company, has reinvented the data warehouse for the cloud and today’s data. The Snowflake Elastic Data Warehouse is built from the cloud up with a patent-pending new architecture that delivers the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms and the elasticity of the cloud – at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. Snowflake can be found online at snowflake.net .Snowflake has been voted as one of the Bay Area Best Places to Work in 2015, 2016, and 2017. We are a place where people work effectively with the same values and vision. We focus on doing what is right for our customers, shareholders, and employees. We create great products, individually and as a team.Snowflake is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

title: Senior Big Data Analyst
description: Affinity Solutions is looking for a hands-on and self-driven Senior Big Data Analyst, preferably with experience in the advertising/marketing/fin-tech space, to enhance and automate its data and analytics infrastructure to support its growing customer base and expanding partner ecosystem. The position is based in San Jose, CA., and reports into the Marketing Cloud business unit that spans Silicon Valley and New York. The ideal candidate is a passionate and highly skilled individual, who can utilize programming and analytics tools such as SQL, R, Python, and Tableau to query and process large data sets to produce high quality customer facing data deliverables and insights. If you have experience designing and building business intelligence/analytics applications, especially around unified consumer behavioral and profile data, and excited about leveraging your experience to catapult a venture-backed company into hyper-growth through a new business line, this job is for you. Responsibilities: * Design and maintain analytical database structures and requirements to manage and process various data sets (Affinity in-house and 3rd party data) * Convert OLTP data into OLAP for reporting/analytics/modeling purpose * Lead the development of analytical data assets with an eye towards process efficiency and automation * Communicate and present data to both internal and external customers by developing reports/dashboards/charts using BI tools such as Tableau * Work closely with a dynamic and growing team of data engineers and data scientists to perform quantitative analysis of customer data, including gathering data requirements and validate data, applying judgement and statistical analysis Qualifications: * Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related fields, preferably with focus on Data. * 3 years of hands-on experience in designing and building analytical data applications and BI Reporting * Proficient in SQL and Tableau, familiar with at least one coding language in Python/Php/Shell scripting. Nice to have R / SAS Programming experience. * Experience in using Cloud based managed services for data warehousing/analytics is a big plus – e.g. Amazon RedShift, etc. * Very strong written and verbal communication skills; Ability to tell a story with the data * Analytical thinker, with an ability to evaluate multiple products/technologies to address various aspects of a data platform. * Experience working on UNIX / Linux development and production environments * Experience working in Agile software development environments * Ability to manage multiple conflicting priorities, take proactive ownership of problems and outcomes, think outside the box * Knowledge of Retail and Financial verticals is useful but not required. * Experience in the AdTech/MarTech/FinTech industry, especially knowledge of DMPs, programmatic advertising/RTB is a big plus.

title: Sr. Manager, Marketing Strategy and Analytics
description: Company DescriptionOkta is the foundation for secure connections between people and technology. By harnessing the power of the cloud, Okta allows people to access applications on any device at any time, while still enforcing strong security protections. It integrates directly with an organization’s existing directories and identity systems, as well as 4,000+ applications.Because Okta runs on an integrated platform, organizations can implement the service quickly at large scale and low total cost.Thousands of customers, including Adobe, Allergan, Nasdaq, LinkedIn, and 20th Century Fox, trust Okta to help their organizations work faster, boost revenue, and stay secure.To learn more about Okta, visit: https://www.okta.com.Job PurposeThe opportunity for Okta is massive: any company is a company we can make more productive and more secure. As every company becomes a technology company, Okta is the foundation that lets them make this transition successfully. Our vision is to bring the benefits of Identity to every company.To help us achieve this ambitious growth objective we are seeking a strategic thinker and cross-functional leader to own the measurement of Okta's demand gen machine and create leverage for the business through insightful analysis, robust planning, and operational reporting.The Sr. Manager of Marketing Strategy and Analytics partners directly with Marketing Leadership and is responsible for helping a global team of 80 marketers to understand their performance, identifying opportunities for increased efficiency, and driving results through impeccable planning. Equal parts data analyst, product manager, and strategy consultant, this role will be an instrumental part of our strategy and operations team.The ideal candidate brings a deep understanding of B2B sales and demand gen (and empathy for demand marketers!), fluency working with data and quantitative reasoning, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and most importantly, a passion for teamwork and collaboration. The ideal profile will have experience in a fast paced high growth environment with technology companies, SaaS or enterprise software.Duties And Responsibilities Planning: Build the demand plan and budget. Help the team to organize a plan that enables optimal efficiency, balances priorities globally, and facilitates thoughtful decisionmaking. Metrics and Reporting: Take ownership of our demand gen metrics and serve as the product manager for marketing reporting. Make sure that every marketer and every executive up through the President understands their performance and can access the data they need to optimize their motion. Insights and Analysis: Be the go-to person for big challenging, strategic questions. Develop insightful analyses that guide decisions about all aspects of the Marketing engine. Qualifications 10+ years related work experience – marketing or sales operations, management consulting or related Excellent written and verbal communication Ability to communicate and influence at all levels of the organization from President to SDR Demonstrated ability to collaborate, build consensus, and influence with personable persistence Ability to prioritize in a fast paced highly demanding environment Expert Excel data modeling and analysis skills Expert Salesforce reporting skills Advanced SQL and fluency working with large data sets / data warehousing Experience with Tableau is a plus Direct work experience in demand gen and/or sales development preferred BA or BS in economics, math, computer science, finance or other quantitative discipline Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Core Competencies Bias for action Drive for results Risk taking Creativity Organization Apply nowU.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information (Completion is voluntary)Individuals seeking employment at this company are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. You are being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us comply with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements.Completion of the form is entirely voluntary. Whatever your decision, it will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file.Classification Of Protected Categories Is As FollowsIf you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below, please indicate by making the appropriate selection. As a government contractor subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA.A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service.An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.Why are you being asked to complete this form?Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities1. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.How do I know if I have a disability?You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.Disabilities Include, But Are Not Limited To Blindness Deafness Cancer Diabetes Epilepsy Autism Cerebral palsy HIV/AIDS Schizophrenia Muscular dystrophy Bipolar disorder Major depression Multiple sclerosis (MS) Missing limbs or partially missing limbs Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) Obsessive compulsive disorder Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)Reasonable Accommodation NoticeFederal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.1Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor’s Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.

title: Senior Business Manager
description: LendUp builds technology, credit products, and educational experiences for the 56% of the adults in the US, who are currently shut out of mainstream banking because of poor credit or volatile income. That’s a lot of hardworking, deserving people who we believe did not have good options, until now.Our mission is to provide anyone with a path to better financial health. Being a socially responsible, machine learning-enabled financial services company is a big job, but we’re driven by the challenge. Now in our sixth year, we’re growing each and every day as we continue to bring our mission to life. Join our passionate  team and help us turn our mission into a movement.LendUp is headquartered in downtown San Francisco with an office in Richmond, VA. We’re backed by prominent Silicon Valley investors including Y-Combinator, Google Ventures, PayPal, Susa Ventures, Data Collective, Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz Seed Fund, Kapor Capital, QED, Eagle Cliff Investors, Thomvest Ventures, Alexis Ohanian, Troy Carter, and many others.About the role:LendUp is seeking a Senior Business Manager to join our credit and revenue strategy team. The credit and revenue strategy team is an integral part of LendUp's business responsible for driving product strategy, improving credit losses and revenue, all while staying true to our mission. You will be expected to discover and propose critical business insights using analytics to optimize existing strategies, launch new products, and improve customer retention.You will:Lead the design, grounding, and build of customer level NPV models based on past performance dataDefine and execute on the roadmap for testing and in market strategy for our current product setCollaborate with data science, product, growth, and engineering to develop and launch new productsAnalyze new partnership opportunities through a holistic lens that could drive step changes in our growth trajectoryAct as a mentor to the broader organization help foster skill development within the analyst community at LendUpYou have:7+ years of complex analytical and management experienceExtensive experience with SQL or similar relational database toolAbility to solve problems and synthesize complex data into actionable business decisionsBS or MS in Economics, Finance, Engineering, Mathematics, Science, or similar quantitative analytical field; masters preferredPrior consumer lending experience in unsecured installment loans, credit cards, or other credit productWe have:LendUp has all of the things you’d expect, like a competitive salary; early stage equity; 100% company paid medical, dental and vision insurance; generous vacation/sick leave policy; catered, free lunch; fully stocked kitchens with free healthy snacks; free onsite gym; and a 401(k) program.But here’s what we really love about life at LendUp:We are driven by having a lasting impact on the world and knowing that our time is spent positively impacting the lives of others. We are strategists and doers, because we know that both matter when it comes to achieving our lofty missionOne of our values is Different Backgrounds, Same Mission. We’re committed to a diverse and inclusive culture that spurs innovation and creates a meaningful and impactful work environment. We are passionate participants in our employee resource groups (LeanIn, LGBTQ & Allies, and Black Ladders) and have Slack channels dedicated to everything from philosophy to sports to hip-hopWe have fun together at our weekly happy hours, quarterly team building events, company-sponsored volunteerism, hackathons, and sports teams.Our dog-friendly SF officeLendUp is an Equal Opportunity EmployerWe extend equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition, or any other reason protected by law.

title: Lead HRIS Analyst
location: 540 South Santa Fe Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 90013, US
description: The Lead HRIS Analyst is responsible for day-to-day system maintenance, data integrity and ongoing system testing and improvements. The Lead HRIS Analyst also supports reporting, report writing and data analysis for business initiatives and decision-making.   RESPONSIBILITIES ·         Analyze, design, evaluate, modify, test, and implement Workday Human Capital Management (HCM) functionality in coordination with the HR, Benefits, Payroll, and IT teams ·         Lead system update process, including making appropriate recommendations to process owners, leading configuration and testing, and training end users, when appropriate. ·         Support with vendor manager for the Workday HCM and iCIMS Applicant Tracking system. Conduct research and analysis regarding trends, patterns, and issues to identify opportunities and solve problems. Work closely with department leadership to fully maximize and enhance the system. Ensure consistent delivery of established service level agreements through active, ongoing management. ·         Ensure that system is configured accurately to support end user business needs ·         Configures and troubleshoots integrations with third parties ·         Partner with stakeholders to implement process modifications that support changing business and compliance requirements ·         Manage the ongoing maintenance and data integrity of existing systems, including all integrations and reports ·         Perform regular audits and participate in the development of new audits in the HCM system. Manage compliance with required audit corrections. ·         Write, maintain and support a variety of reports, simple and complex, to support strategic decision-making QUALFICIATIONS:BA/BS Preferred, not requiredMinimum 3-5 years HRIS experiencePrevious experience with reporting, data analytics and/or payroll requiredWorkday HCM configuration and reporting expereince requiredProficient in Microsoft Excel and/or AccessStrong Project Management skillsStrong analytical and critical thinking skillsStrong teamwork skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to organize and prioritizeAdaptability and flexibility

title: Senior Marketing Analyst
description: About the role: Strava exists to serve athletes and our goal is to build the world's most engaged community of athletes.  We are looking to hire a Marketing Analyst who is passionate about telling the Strava story with data, both to our athlete community and the world at large. This position partners with the Marketing team, which has global responsibility for driving brand awareness, user acquisition, and engaging our user base. The ideal candidate will be curious, collaborative, have strong initiative and a nose for uncovering interesting insights.   Day to day, the Sr. Marketing Analyst will be an important member of both the Marketing and Analytics teams, providing team members with information on the business, assessing market opportunity, and impact of all marketing initiatives, while working to help drive longer term strategy with a data oriented mindset. Responsibilities Use data to tell the Strava story, and develop insights about trends in athletics and health & wellness Analyze marketing initiatives, identify areas of opportunity, and proactively engage in setting strategy Help launch, optimize, and measure the impact of brand awareness, user acquisition, and user engagement projects Design experiments and measure outcomes Work on multi-touch attribution models leveraging all marketing channels, including social, PR, email, paid, and in-app messaging Champion data-driven decision-making and Analytics best practices within Marketing Own requirements and data quality for marketing launches and related engineering development processes Develop key metrics and dashboards that help the team manage their objectives Requirements BS/MS in Statistics, Economics, Math, Physics, or similar quantitative field, or equivalent experience 4+ years of relevant experience Strong SQL skills Experience measuring the impact of brand campaigns across social, blogs, video, email and other channels Ability to process and analyze complex data sets, and interpret them to make business decisions Strong communication skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage a project or product Experience with subscription businesses, growth efforts, and/or social ad tech is a plus Prior experience in consumer Marketing Analytics preferred Backed by Sequoia Capital, Madrone Partners and Jackson Square Ventures, Strava is expanding in order to exceed the needs of our growing community of global athletes. By joining our team, you will help push Strava forward in fresh, innovative ways. You will engage in interesting and challenging work that will improve the lives of our athletes every day. And in the same way that Strava is deeply committed to unlocking the potential of our athletes, we are dedicated to providing a world-class workplace where our employees can grow and thrive. Join us! Strava is an equal opportunity employer.  In keeping with the values of Strava, we make all employment decisions including hiring, evaluation, termination, promotional and training opportunities, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, physical handicap, mental disability, medical condition, disability, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, marital status, height and or weight.

title: Reporting Analyst (Financial Planning & Analysis)
location: 2151 E Grand Ave, El Segundo, CA 90245, US
description: SUMMARY:  The Reporting Analyst (Financial Planning & Analysis) is a data analyst responsible for supporting Customer Support management by producing analytics and for production of reporting and ad-hoc assignments designed to ultimately drive the organization to improve customer experience. The role will be primarily focused on generating and maintaining department-wide operation reports, customer experience data modeling, and service level performance reports. The Reporting Analyst will also be responsible for recommending and implementing improvements in operational reporting by analyzing results and variances; identifying trends and supporting the Customer Support management team. REQUIREMENTSMaintain and update reporting models for use in analyzing department performance and customer experience opportunities Create and maintain reports and key data elements for Customer Support Provide analysis to help identify cause and effect relationships in operational performance Provide empirical analyses for influencing business decisions and the achievement of strategic customer service goals Participate in the design of short term and long term reporting solutions that meet and/or exceed business expectations Track operational and customer survey data by monitoring trends & period to period variances Analyze reporting and data in the department and recommends enhancements; surface any operations issues that impact overall department's performance to Director, Customer Support Report on performance analysis at the individual contributor level Track and report on departmental service levels vs. objectives to improve service outcomes Determine customer experience performance by comparing and analyzing Voice of the Customer survey data Support CS management by gathering and analyzing data; preparing and distributing monthly reports to: individual contributors, supervisors, managers & director Respond to reporting issues surfaced by management, conducting root cause analysis to identify and help with resolving issues Increases department productivity by automating models and applications; and identifying and executing process improvements Establish distributor reports for execution Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; collaborate with Pricing Office to adopt and stay current on their reporting standards Liaison between Customer Support and IT Act as Subject Matter Expert (SME) for reporting outside of Customer Support Department but impacting Customer Support reporting and data models Collaborate with the CS leadership team on creating programs for staff development, SAP training, and business skills developmentQUALIFICATIONS:  Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, statistics, accounting or similar Minimum 2 to 4 years experience Formal training in data modeling and statistical analysis in Excel or similar applications (Tableau, Access, R, Python, SaaS) Possess exceptional organizational skills and the ability to multi-task KARL STORZ reserves the right to change or modify the employee’s job description whether orally or in writing, at any time during the employment relationship. title: Manager, Technical Product Marketing
location: 1825 Grant Street 5th Floor, San Mateo, CA 94402, US
description: The Role:   SnapLogic is seeking a talented Manager, Technical Product Marketing professional. This position provides an excellent opportunity to contribute to SnapLogic’s thought leadership in application and data integration. The ideal candidate will combine technical depth with a proven ability to communicate both internally and externally.   The incumbent will help craft messaging and positioning, contribute to product launches and enable the sales organization with competitive intelligence. The person in this role will provide content and create sales enablement tools, training, and resources including data sheets, presentations, and demos. The ability to translate complex technical capabilities into compelling business benefits is crucial. This role is based in our San Mateo, CA headquarters.   What You’ll Do:   Market intelligence – be an expert on key buyer personas and data and application integration technology trends Competitive intelligence - be an expert on the competition and how to beat them Product – collaborate with product management on product roadmap and prioritization Analyst relations – be an expert for analyst briefings and reports that require product knowledge. Sales and partner enablement – communicate the value of SnapLogic to sales teams and partners and develop the sales tools that support the selling process Content creation – collaborate with sales, sales development, and lead generation teams to prioritize and create effective, compelling content Approx. 10% travel   What We’re Looking For:   5+ years of experience in B2B technical product marketing, product management or pre-sales solution engineering, preferably with a SaaS company Must have technical knowledge of enterprise application integration APIs, B2B integration, ETL, ESB and cloud applications, as well as NoSQL and other analytical database platforms Understanding of big data frameworks and related technologies including Spark and AWS RedShift is a bonus Must be a self-starter and be comfortable working with a sense of urgency Strong oral, written and visual communication skills Comfort with being able to present to customers and at trade shows Thorough familiarity with enterprise technology sales processes Technical bachelor’s degree preferred; MBA a plus   Why Join Now:   There’s never been a better time to join SnapLogic. Here are the top 6 reasons to join the SnapLogic team:   Hot Market: With the proliferation of cloud apps, explosion of big data sources, emergence of IoT, and an increasingly complex data landscape, the need for integration technologies has risen to the top of the agenda for data-driven companies. According to industry analysts, the Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) market grew by 61% in 2016, the fastest growth area in the application infrastructure and middleware market.   Company Momentum: In 2016, SnapLogic doubled its year-over-year bookings revenue, added more than 300 new customers (bringing its total customer-count to 700+), raised an additional $40 million to accelerate innovation and growth, expanded globally with new offices in the UK and Australia and new channel partners in LATAM and APAC, and grew our global employee base to 225+ of the industry’s best and brightest.AI-fueled Product Innovation: SnapLogic’s modern, self-service, cloud-native platform makes integration fast and easy with no coding – for IT and LOB leaders alike. Earlier this year, SnapLogic took this product leadership to new heights by introducing industry-first artificial intelligence technology, called Iris, which will underpin a series of exciting innovations over the next 2-3 years to drive the future of autonomous integration.   Happy Customers: Our customers are seeing unmatched results with the SnapLogic platform. Adobe enabled 800+ “citizen integrators” and saved millions per year. AstraZeneca enabled 100+ self-service users globally on a single platform for both apps and data. Box connected 24+ apps in months with only 1.5 developers. SnapLogic’s customer retention rate is 95%+, and analysts recognize SnapLogic as the industry-leader in customer satisfaction.   Industry Recognition: In the first half of 2017, industry-watchers have recognized our company, products, customers and employees as best-in-class. Gartner recognized SnapLogic as a Leader in their Magic Quadrant for Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS), CRN Magazine picked SnapLogic as a top innovator in their 2017 Big Data 100 List, and DBTA Magazine named SnapLogic among the Top 100 Companies That Matter Most in Data.   Vibrant Company Culture:  We firmly believe that our people are our strongest asset as a company and we never lose sight of that fact. Our work environment and employee programs and services are all geared to ensure that our employees have challenging and meaningful roles and also a great place to do the best work of their careers. Our efforts to keep our culture thriving and strong are paying off: for two years’ running, we have been named a Bay Area Top Workplace by the Bay Area News Group and Mogul selected SnapLogic for their list of the Top 100 Companies for Millennial Women.   SnapLogic is headquartered in San Mateo, CA with offices in Boulder, CO; New York, NY; London, UK; Hyderabad, India; and Melbourne and Sydney, Australia. To all recruitment agencies: SnapLogic does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to SnapLogic employees or to any other company location. SnapLogic is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the company. SnapLogic provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. SnapLogic complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. SnapLogic expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of SnapLogic employees to perform their expected job duties is absolutely not tolerated.

title: Data Analyst
description: Module lead(Depends on the project)QualificationBachelors in science , engineering or equivalentResponsibilityRequirement Understanding and Analysis: Review the raw requirements to understand the key outcomes expected by the client. Identify data source and conduct data profiling to understand data and its quality. Create a logic that needs to be incorporated in the architecture to ensure the data meets the requirements. Create POC to conduct the feasibility of the requirement, as required.Data Discovery & Profiling Post signoff, design basic queries to analyze the existing data. Share sample data with the client to give a snapshot of the expected outcome. Create a low level design document capturing SQL queries to achieve the target stage. Share the document with the ETL team. Conduct system integration testing during data migration from the source to the target state to ensure the requirements are met. Conduct the root cause analysis of the issue to identify the solutions to resolve it. Conduct testing to ensure the issue has been resolved. In case of data issues, report it to the source team to fix the data. If data is corrupted during migration, identify ways to cleanup the data. Generate reports to fix the issues as required. Understand the impact on data based on the release schedule. Based on the understanding of the legacy system, provide inputs to the data modeler to map the attributes to the fields. Share the data mapping documents with the data modeling team. Support data modeling team to understand the data / data type in the legacy system. Support data modeling team in defining table name and table data type as per the standards and best practices defined within the project. In case of any new table in Data Warehouse, identify the source values to be uploaded in the table. Provide inputs to data modeling regarding the source data for the same.Knowledge Management Create and update knowledge articles (industry Point of View, Case studies, lessons learnt document etc) in the knowledge management repository. Maintain knowledge management database. Conduct training for team members on data profiling tools and techniques.Sales Support Based on the inputs shared by the stakeholders. share the inputs on RFPs on the data profiling and system analysis aspect. Evaluate/ identify the tools best fit for the customer requirement.Technical SkillsSNo Primary Skill Proficiency Level * Rqrd./Dsrd. 1 Agile PL1 Required Proficiency LegendsProficiency Level Generic Reference PL1 The associate has basic awareness and comprehension of the skill and is in the process of acquiring this skill through various channels. PL2 The associate possesses working knowledge of the skill, and can actively and independently apply this skill in engagements and projects. PL3 The associate has comprehensive, in-depth and specialized knowledge of the skill. She / he has extensively demonstrated successful application of the skill in engagements or projects. PL4 The associate can function as a subject matter expert for this skill. The associate is capable of analyzing, evaluating and synthesizing solutions using the skill.Job Location : San Jose, California, United StatesEmployee Status : Full Time EmployeeShift : Day JobTravel : NoJob Posting : Jun 26 2018Cognizant US Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions in the US, please send an email with your request to CareersNA2@cognizant.comAbout CognizantCognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: USJobsCognizant.Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service.

title: Business Systems Analyst / Data Analyst
description: Job SummaryOur client is currently seeking a Business Systems Analyst / Data Analyst II for a permanent opportunity located in Rocklin, CA.Relocation assistance can be provided.The Data Science & Insight team scours through massive amounts of data, looking for the story behind it. They query databases and analyze the results to help us find answers to some of our more challenging questions. Then they report it in a way that is useful to our execs. They use the most advanced analytical tools & their naturally inquisitive minds to provide practical insight.Our Data Science & Insight team is currently looking for a Business Analyst / Data Analyst who is more of a "systems thinker". This is a hybrid role, blending of the roles of business systems analyst, data analyst, and scrum master.In this role, you'll be working on requirements gathering and documentation, user story development, managing the kanban board and partially serving as the scrum master.Here's what we're looking for... 3-5+ years of professional experience as a Business Systems Analyst - gathering & documenting business requirements. Experience in the application & facilitation of Agile Methodologies and Scrum phases/ceremonies. Experience with Tableau, Alteryx, SQL, QDA Miner, Nielsen, Sitecore or equivalent analytics or research software is a plus. Understanding of qualitative and quantitative methodologies. Ability to discern and analyze the critical elements of large sets of information. Ability to work in a team-based environment or independently in fast-paced environment often with minimal supervision, sometimes under tight deadlines, with the ability to multi-task and prioritize appropriately while managing multiple projects concurrently. Exceptional written, presentation, and oral communication skills.
