title: Data Analyst, Platform Operations-1
description: JobData Analyst, Platform Operations-1DepartmentDeluxe Medius OneDescriptionDeluxe Entertainment Services Group Inc. is a global leader in media and entertainment services for film, video and online content, from capture to consumption. Since 1915, Deluxe has been the trusted partner for the world’s most successful Hollywood studios, independent film companies, TV networks, exhibitors, advertisers and others, offering best-in-class solutions in production, post-production, distribution, asset and workflow management, and new digital solution-based technologies.With operations in Los Angeles, New York and around the globe, the company employs over 8,600 of the most talented, highly honored and recognized artists and industry veterans worldwide. Deluxe is a wholly owned subsidiary of MacAndrews & Forbes Holdings Inc. For more information, please visit www.bydeluxe.com We currently have an opening for a Data Analyst, Platform Operations. This position will be located in Burbank, CA. Position OverviewThe Data Analyst, Platform Operations will be responsible for normalizing, curating, & augmenting Title, Asset, Order, & Profile data in support of content fulfillment automation on the One platform. The position will enforce governance and compliance rules to ensure upstream data quality and enable end to end automation from source asset ingest to client delivery. The position will augment incoming Title & Asset data as needed based on established business rules. The Data Analyst will work with internal and external teams to ensure that data is accurate, timely, and structured properly for workflow automation in the One platform. This position is based out of Burbank, CA.Primary ResponsibilitiesEnter master data into systems and tools accurately, accommodating Operations’ deadlinesInterface with end users from various internal and external groups to ensure master data management excellenceDefine, prioritize, and communicate status and integrity of data; working with others to understand timelines and needsResponsible for updating and reporting problems that arise with Database issues by communicating via creating or updating incidents and email advisements, this involves problem solving through precise documentation and effective follow upMust have ability to make sound judgments when dealing with issues that arise during troubleshooting and have the skills to determine the appropriate action to be taken for a given situation; must be able to prioritize instantly to prevent missed deadlinesProvide timely, accurate, professional and responsive support, verbally and via email, to internal and external customer/clients to resolve all issues reported and take proactive steps to prevent the conflict/problem from reoccurringAbility to generate required reports from the system as well as read and utilize informationProvide feedback and suggestions to management for improved customer satisfaction, process improvements and system enhancementsPossess advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and experience with databases (Relational, SQL, Elastic)QualificationsMinimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent, Associate degree or above preferred2+ years in Data input related experienceExcellent attention to detail with strong organizational skills and ability to multitaskUnderstanding of content fulfilment, digital workflows, asset and data management systems/platforms.Excellent teamwork, written and verbal communication skills.Must demonstrate positive attitude, ability to maintain professionalism in a high stress situation, and project self as a team player.We offer competitive pay and benefits program including medical, dental & vision coverage, vacation & sick leave, 401(k), and more.Deluxe’s policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against, on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Deluxe will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and federal law.Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Deluxe. Please inform the company's personnel representative if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

title: Senior Product Manager
description: NCSOFT West Mobile, a mobile game publisher focused on making high-quality, cutting-edge, and conceptually innovative free-to-play mobile games, is seeking a talented Senior Product Manager to join our team working on an unannounced Original IP built at our San Mateo studio. As a Senior Product Manager, you will guide and drive the long term revenue strategy for high fidelity, deeply monetizing, midcore mobile games.  You'll utilize a deep understanding of the competitor and market space, along with qualitative and quantitative data to optimize your game through new features, live events, sales, and economy balancing.  You will help drive the live success of your product, partnering with the marketing, data science, and development teams to hold the high level strategy and drive execution of a game-as-a-service. Responsibilities: Define, measure and deliver against game KPIs that achieve business goals, working closely with the data analytics team to create dashboards and deliver regular updates to executives and product owners Leverage all sources of information to drive product evolution and growth, including industry benchmarks, game data, marketing data, market research, community feedback and any more Guide the strategy for the product position, new features, and growth, including some feature design and wireframing to help illustrate product requirements as needed Build models and forecasts in excel to prioritize predict the impact of new features Drive and own new features, collaborating with designers, artists, and engineers to find the optimal implementation, ensuring that the features adhere to the high level strategy for the product Build models to forecast player engagement and behavior around game systems Run the live operations of the game through events, price optimization, and game balance Mentor other Product Managers in monetization design, the competitor space, and best practices in development, analysis and research Other duties may be assigned to meet business needs Requirements: 5+ years of product management experience in the development and/or live operations of free-to-play games. Strong communication skills.  You take complicated concepts and break them into comfortable pieces.  You're practically a mind reader in conversations, finding misunderstandings or miscommunications and resolving them effortlessly. Good collaboration and leadership.  You can find the right strategic vision for your colleagues and rally them behind it.  You help the team build the best solution to the problem, and keep everyone focused on the high level picture. Strong analytical skills.  You can crank out A/B test analyses in your sleep and dig into noisy data to find a strong signal. Strong Microsoft Excel skills.  You breathe formulas, charts, models, pivot tables, and forecasting. Pluses: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering Direct work experience on strategy or RPG mobile free-to-play games with deep and complex systems Experience as an economy designer, data analyst, software engineer, financial analyst or consultant SQL, tableau, and other data analysis and data visualization tools Basic programming and scripting knowledge

title: Senior Analyst, Product & Site
description: Upwork is the world's largest freelancing website. Each year $1.5 billion of work happens through Upwork, allowing businesses get more done and helping professionals break free of traditional time and place boundaries and work anytime, anywhere on projects they love. At Upwork, you'll help build on this momentum. Together, we'll create economic and social value on a global scale, providing a trusted online workplace for businesses to connect with extraordinary talent and work without limits.Are you motivated to make an impact in a high-growth company? Are you a hands-on entrepreneurial leader who loves to sit on the boundaries of business, product and technology? Are you passionate about solving challenging analytic problems? Upwork is looking for a Senior/Principal Analyst, Product and Site to find opportunities for growth in its Enterprise business. You will be part of the Business Management & Analytics team and will work closely with our Engineering and Product management team.Your ResponsibilitiesYou will be a strategic partner with the Product Management team and sales teams to drive data driven decisions. Provide comprehensive reporting, analytical and advisory services to the teams by generating insights into our product and services. You understand the business needs, and define KPI's to establish baseline understanding of our product, and to measure performance of different drivers of business. Design and develop standard dashboards to monitor the trends. You will go deep into the product and the data to develop hypothesis and conduct analysis to answer complex business questions and help improve our product. You will think strategically about how to scale the work that you and the team do. Develop tools and automated process that project the work out to a broader audience. Also, conduct training and mentoring to help people around you improve at what they do collectively so that we’re better off as a team. You will work with Engineering and Business Intelligence teams to define infrastructure and data needs. Write requirements on data logging and processes for automated reports.What It Takes To Catch Our Eye4+ years of work experience as analyst, strategy consulting or in an analytical role partnering with senior leaders to translate business questions into analytical actions Bachelor’s degree in economics, business, analytics, or in a quantitative discipline, MS/MBA preferred (or equivalent work experience). You are a creative problem-solver who thrives on challenges, and is accustomed to a working in a fast pace environment on multiple projects, fulfilling priorities and meeting deadlines.Expert level SQL knowledge, advanced excel concepts and experience with data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, DOMO) You have excellent communication skills – ability to communicate complex results findings and recommendations persuasively, in a compelling and easy to understand manner Statistical background and experience with statistical tools (R or Python)How To Really Knock Our Socks OffPassion for high-growth, Enterprise business and desire to contribute in an energizing environment Experience in marketplaces or e-commerce business a plus Expertise with Google Analytics and Google Tag ManagerModelling and Machine learning experience a plus Domain expertise in subjects such as experimental design and Multivariate/A-B testingCome Change How The World Works.At Upwork you’ll help shape the future of work. From our offices in San Francisco, Mountain View and Chicago, together we’re creating exciting new opportunities for a world of professionals. You’ll be part of a vibrant culture built on shared values: Inspire a boundless future of work, Put our community first, Have a bias towards action, and Build amazing teams. Along the way you’ll have fun and enjoy the perks of a people-first company: Work from Home Wednesday's, daily breakfast and lunch, regular in-office happy hours, top-notch benefits … and more. Check outUpwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Insurance Product Analyst
company: CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA Insurer
description: Imagine a career where you are able to use your analytical skills to make an impact, solve problems, and drive business results.Do you use Excel functions that most people do not even know exist? Are you a stickler for details who is passionate about data integrity and accurate analysis? Do you want to work in a collaborative environment and build your skills as a well-rounded analyst? Are you looking for a caring company that is committed to exceptional service? If so, we are looking for a high potential insurance analyst to join our State Product Management team who will help the organization deliver profitable growth.A typical day as an data analyst includes Maintaining and running operational processes on a scheduled basis, including troubleshooting potential issues with operational processes. Maintaining data relationships with vendors. Collaborating with other functional areas to develop safeguards and ensuring the process runs smoothly and accurately. Developing your knowledge and understanding of insurance operations to make recommendations for improvements in process and support program development. Developing new reports and performing statistical analysis as needed to measure performance against business goals and add insights to get results. Building monthly presentations of your findings and participating in presentations to leaders.As a valued member of our community, you will Join a team who has the ability to tell a story with facts and figures and get the audience to draw the conclusion as you intend. Work for a company recognized for dedication to community. 99% of our employees take advantage of our paid time off to volunteerRequired qualifications Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, business, or similar. 6 months - 2+ years of analytical experience and/or product experience in insurance or a similar industry, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Well-organized and dedicated to maintaining data quality standards while running multiple concurrent processes among different data sources. Strong research, statistical, analytical, processing and mathematical skills with ability to structure and conduct analyses. Ability to speak and write effectively. Desire to quickly establish yourself as a subject-matter expert with deep knowledge of your areas of responsibility.Preferred qualifications Knowledge of insurance products, accounting and rate-making concepts. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, SAS, SQL, Visual Basic and various structured analysis and design techniques.CSAA insurance group offers many benefits, including Medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance coverage. Employee assistance, healthy pregnancy and wellness programs. Paid time off, plus nine paid holidays and 24 hours of volunteer time off. 401(k) plus company matching up to 6% and a cash balance pension program. Tuition reimbursement, self-service training and career development opportunities.Be part of a community that worksAt CSAA Insurance Group, we take pride in our values-based culture. Helping our employees lead enriched lives and satisfying careers is how we work. Our employees appreciate the integrity and inclusion that is evident throughout our everyday interactions. We respect the diverse range of perspectives, backgrounds and cultures of our teams, and join together when it comes to helping our members, community or one another.Headquartered in Walnut Creek, California, our community also works in Arizona, Colorado, Nevada, New Jersey and Oklahoma. Learn more about us at CSAA-Insurance.aaa.com/careersLet’s work togetherPlease submit your application to be considered. We communicate via email, so please check your inbox to ensure you don’t miss important updates from us. Questions? Please email us at talentaquisition@csaa.comWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Insurance Product Analyst Requisition Number R2217 Insurance Product Analyst (Open)LocationWalnut Creek, California Additional Locations

title: Principal Data Engineer
description: SUMMARY: Functions as a database leader, responsible for populating the enterprise data warehouse so that Business Intelligence clients (Data Scientists, Data Analysts etc.) are making efficient use of the warehouse.DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: NOTE: The following are the duties performed by employees in this classification. However, employees may perform other related duties at an equivalent level. Not all duties listed are necessarily performed by each individual in the classification. Contributes to the short term and long term data warehouse architecture. Creates data environments and/or data sets to serve a wide range of data users, including but not limited to Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Business Analysts etc Creates data warehouses, using best practices to gather requirements, model data, and implement a system that is highly performant and near-real-time. Develops interactive reporting solutions using SSRS / Power BI / etc. Extends existing Data Warehouse infrastructures and SSAS cubes with new dimensionality and new data sources using SSIS, T-SQL, and SSAS Improves data governance and data quality using Master Data Management systems (MDS, DQS and others) Performs ETL work to pull data from source systems (both on prem and hosted), including manipulating data, and placing in the data warehouse environment. Programs complex SQL queries and stored procedures.Minimum QualificationsRequired Education: High School Diploma or G.E.D.Preferred Education: Bachelor's of Science degree in Information Management, Project Management, Engineering or related field preferred.Required Experience: Five of increasing technical experience in a / business intelligence position.Preferred Experience: Previous experience as a Data Engineer / Database Administrator and/or Business Intelligence Analyst.Experience in Microsoft SQL, Microsoft BI Stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS) and Microsoft Sharepoint; experience in developing Business Intelligence solutions (ETL, cubes, reports, dashboards, scorecards) using Microsoft SQL Server tools (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS) in a data warehousing environment.

By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Technical Analysis Analyst to join our team in Los Angeles, California (US-CA), United States (US).Job responsibilitiesProvides technical support and training to personal computer and PC network users. Assists users in solving problems using available hardware and software tools Supports, installs, and maintains personal computers, local area networks, server hardware, operating systems, software, and related IT sanctioned peripherals Installs and supports both hardware and software components for user group Performs preventive maintenance, test and repair of equipment Evaluates system configuration and software to ensure effective use of hardware resources Addresses and resolves hardware, software and customer issues Engages users to determine their potential future business requirements Provides positive customer experience with each customer interactionRequirements 4-6 years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and work experienceStrong ability to develop business relationships and communicate effectively with the user community Strong troubleshooting skills A+ and Apple Certification (ACSP) required, MCSE or ACTC equivalent is preferredGood understanding of the fundamentals of network and server/desktop administration, installations, upgrades, techniques, tools, materials, and equipment; Applies good knowledge of processes and resources required to perform analytical and technical tasks on PC systems Applies good understanding of customer service techniques as required to address PC/MacBasic Qualifications4+ years desktop support experienceThis position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. title: Project and Data Analyst, GSRS
description: Security is at the core of Google's design and development process - it is built into the DNA of our products. The same is true of our offices and data centers.As Project and Data Analyst, you'll bring an analytical mind to deliver innovative solutions that help our entire team keep pace with Google’s rapidly changing landscape. You believe that great just isn't good enough, and constantly seek out opportunities to improve Google’s security services, by leveraging data. Whether it’s finding a way to model and optimize security operations, or managing the launch of an innovative new tool, you identify and execute data-driven solutions to some of our thorniest challenges. Our team is comprised of people from a variety of backgrounds. We’d like to think that our eclectic experience helps us innovate, so don’t worry: we’ll teach you all you need to know about security and resilience services.From keeping Googlers safe and secure to managing disruptive events, the ability to anticipate, deter, detect, and act are the pillars of Google’s Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS) team. As a member of GSRS you will help develop a culture where safety, security and resiliency are integrated into every facet of Google, including the creative process. You will help us continually identify, evaluate and monitor enterprise risks that could affect business activities and provide business leaders the information they need to make critical decisions. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to create innovative strategies and develop best in class programs that drive sustainable effectiveness.ResponsibilitiesGather and analyze data on a myriad of security processes to measure impact, identify risks and highlight opportunities for improvement.Develop insightful solutions to address complex strategic and operational challenges.Evaluate the impact of proposed changes, with attention to scalability and sustainability over time.Manage cross-functional projects, from problem definition to implementation.Communicate findings and recommendations to a diverse set of stakeholders, leveraging data to tell a clear and compelling story.QualificationsMinimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.3 years of experience in data analysis.Preferred QualificationsExperience developing project plans to deliver customer-oriented results.Proficiency with spreadsheet data analysis, SQL, PLX, SPANNER, JavaScript and mathematical modeling.Ability to be personable yet persistent and lead cross-functional project teams without formal authority.Ability to creatively solve problems in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment.Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to convey quantitative insights to non-quantitative audiences.Attention to detail and ability to swiftly assimilate and understand new information.At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.To all recruitment agencies Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other company location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Senior Product Data Analyst
description: BOLD is an established and fast-growing technology company that transforms work lives. Since 2005, BOLD has delivered award-winning career services that have a meaningful and positive impact on job seekers and employers. BOLD's robust product line includes a professional resume and cover letter writing services, scientifically validated career tests, and employer tools that help companies hire, onboard, and communicate with their staff.Department SummaryThis role is in our Analytics team. This team supports product, marketing, and finance teams in presenting product performance metrics and providing key recommendations to promote growth.Position SummaryAs our Senior Product Data Analyst, you will lead the data reporting roadmap, become a strategic partner to various business units, and provide recommendations to the business for product growth. You will be responsible for driving the company's reporting capabilities, working with partner teams on ad-hoc analyses, and providing strategic support to the executive team. You will also be responsible for developing standardized metrics and reporting for the organization that keep us informed, and are the fingers on the pulse of our business. Through your insightful work and attention to detail, you will be the go-to person for information about performance and product development insights.The ideal candidate for this role will be highly motivated and will use not only their technical skills but their analytical and strategic direction to quickly make an impact ensuring that our growth curve extends into 2018 and beyond!Required Responsibilities Develop data roadmaps for supporting marketing, finance, product, and traffic acquisition teams with product performance, user engagement, and strategic direction. Conduct in-depth analysis to find opportunities for product development and enhancement. Provide recommendations to improve performance and KPIs via monitoring dashboards, scorecards, and ad hoc analysis. Work closely with analysts to extract meaningful insights using a variety of data sources – relational databases, front-end analytics tools, clickstream data, etc. Delegate responsibilities and tasks internally across a variety of concurrent projects. Train, educate, and guide analysts and external stakeholders on data extraction, consumption, and analysis. Present performance/engagement insights and recommendations to executive leadership via visualizations and concise messaging. Collaborate with BI and Engineering groups to advance data infrastructure, governance, and capabilities. Track and analyze website performance, click stream, and user paths to provide data for decision-making. Surface and analyze data to help us build more robust Customer Segmentation. Help create Customer Engagement reporting and modeling using our event stream.Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in CS, Statistics, Business, Economics, or related field. 4-6 years as an individual contributor performing quantitative analysis, preferably for an internet or technology company. Ability to write and execute complex SQL queries to extract data from a variety of internal sources. Experience implementing and using Google Analytics, MixPanel or other front-end analytical platforms to analyze product performance and engagement. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Self-starter with a desire to learn and the ability to rapidly understand the business and its drivers. High proficiency with Excel including pivoting capabilities and analysis modules. Ability to handle conflicting priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.Desired Qualifications Experience writing and optimizing complex SQL queries. Knowledge of programming languages (Python preferred). Proficiency with Sisense, Tableau, or other BI platforms. Proficiency with Web Analytics tools – Google Analytics, MixPanel, etc.About BoldBOLD is a fast-paced, innovative company full of smart, committed people who are passionate about our products and love helping people find the career of their dreams. We balance work and fun while continuing to build a successful, fast-growing company that is changing the way people get jobs.Our vision is to revolutionize the online career world by creating transformational products that help people find the careers they love and reach their full potential.BOLD is an equal opportunity employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, covered veteran status, status in the U.S. uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information or membership in any other legally protected category.Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance.SDL2017

title: Director, Data Analytics Operations
description: You will have-                                                                                       Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Business IT10+ years of overall technology industry experience5+ years of Big Data Analytics/Data Warehouse technical experience5+ years of leadership experience managing technical delivery, DevOPS or SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) TeamsAbility to manage versatile technical teams– tools, devOPS, automation, Big Data/AWS engineersFamiliarity with what it takes to run an analytics platform with an eye for cost and performance optimizationAbility to design and maintain production systems with optimum performance, scalability and resiliencyExperience running Service Operations for data warehousing or equivalent functionsDemonstrated strength with client Interactions and driving customer satisfactionExperience working with very large data setsFamiliarity implementing DevOps on cloud servicesNice to have-
