LinuxExtensive Perl, PHP and Python programmingStrong experience with Shell scriptingExperience with AWS EC2, S3, and other AWS components and servicesOperational familiarity with Elastic Search, EMR, Spark, Web ServicesExperience in building and maintaining Real Stream Analytical SolutionsExperience in developing and designing API based Analytical solutionsExperience with MongoDB or NoSQL databasesWorking Knowledge of Redshift and TableauOracle Database development expertise including creating complex SQL and PLSQL queriesExperience with Splunk architecture, deployment, data integration and Splunk dashboard designHadoop work experienceBird’s eye view of your role – The Data Operations team is responsible for running the Envestnet|Yodlee data processing and data warehouse platforms, which deliver key data analytics capabilities across Envestnet’s vast Wealth and Financial Wellness products.  In the midst of ever-growing data analytics scale, our team continually optimizes and automates our data warehouse processing pipeline to consistently exceed expectations on delivery SLAs.  Additionally, the Data Operations team is heavily involved in R&D activities and plays a key role in new product delivery in partnership with Product, Engineering, and Data Science teams.Envestnet|Yodlee is looking for a technically skilled, customer focused Director to manage the US Data Operations team, while leading interactions with onshore product, sales and customer service teams as well as off shore data analytics engineering teams.  This role spans from driving continually improvement in data analytics service delivery and troubleshooting complex production issues, to developing reliable data warehouse and processing systems and architecture to deliver new analytics capabilities to the business.You will be part of one of the top technical teams within Envestnet|Yodlee who are strongly focused on Data Analytics technical delivery, problem management, and solving operational challenges through innovative solutions.  This is a great opportunity to further your career in the rapidly growing data analytics space at Envestnet, while furthering your skills on big data analytics technologies and cloud infrastructure.What will you bring – You are a professional who enjoys people, possesses a great attitude, and is a self-starter with the desire to learn technology and grow teams. You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. You have exceptional leadership, analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills with the ability to pick up new software, frameworks and tools quickly.  You enjoy problem-solving and troubleshooting issues as they arise.  Performance objectives – Deliver daily data analytics processing completely and on timeDetect processing anomalies early and provide excellent customer service by pre-communicating any variances to standard processingImprove processing performance 20% year over yearPartner with Engineering, Product and Data Science teams to design, build and deliver new analytics capabilities with no production disruptionContinually enhance and tune monitoring and automation capabilitiesTroubleshoot complex technical processing and data issuesContinually grow the technical and professional capabilities of the Data Operations teamHow will your lofty goals be translated into specific actions / short term goals - Within first 30 days, you will learn the Envestnet|Yodlee data analytics system and manage the day-to-day processing pipeline and team activitiesBy the end of the first quarter, you will have participated in the full release of a new analytics capability from design to productionBy the end of first six months, you will have acquired the Envestnet|Yodlee business and technical environment knowledge necessary to drive the forward-looking vision for the departmentWhat’s in it for you? (EVP – Employee Value Proposition) - Continue to build your big data analytics technical skill setGrow your career as a leader in Envestnet, which is a rapidly growing company with literally an endless roadmap of new product, innovation and business opportunities in the Wealth and Financial Wellness industryWork in a fun, positive environment, with a collaborate culture

title: BI Architect
description: The BI/CI Solutions Architect’s role is to define, design, develop, test, analyze, and maintain complex database structures and analytical solutions that fully support the mission of actionable intelligence. The BI/CI Solutions Architect determines what data needs to be available, and creates a blueprint for creating, testing and maintaining that database; this includes writing SQL code, testing, and analyzing database design for maximum performance. This role is also instrumental in determining the proper configuration for information delivery tools that provide our customers with a positive experience, which allows them to utilize data to drive effective outcomes. This role interfaces with Analysts throughout IT as a consultant regarding effective database design and information delivery. The Architect will ensure architectural integrity for all solutions in accordance with Progenity’s Application Development Methodology (ADM). The BI/CI Solutions Architect will also research, design, document, and modify analytical and database solution specifications throughout the production life cycle.RESPONSIBILITIES:Strategy & Planning Determines database structural requirements by analyzing current operations, application and programming workflows, understanding clients’ objectives, required data states, and evaluating current solutions. Develops database solutions by designing proposed system, defining database physical structure, functional capabilities, data security, and disaster recovery specifications. Design and configures BI/CI analytical platforms to meet the needs of our clients. Maintains performance for database and BI/CI environments by identifying and resolving production and development issues. Critical thinking is required for calculating optimum parameter values, analyzing new releases, ensuring maintenance is up to date, and meeting clients SLAs. Frequently communicates and trains architectural standards to IT Analysts. Provides on-going support for IT Analysts outside of these sessions. Provides support by coding utilities that improves the performance and the delivery of information for our analytical solutions. Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations. Accomplishes information systems and organization mission by completing related results as needed. Collaborate with developers, programmers, and designers in conceptualizing and development of new solutions. Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures. Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments. Assist in defining project plans, including scoping, scheduling, testing, and implementation. Research, identify, analyze, and fulfill requirements of all internal and external program users. Acquisition & Deployment Conduct research on emerging technologies and standards in support of operational and development efficiencies. Liaise with vendors for efficient implementation of new software products or systems and for resolution of any adaptation issues. Recommend, schedule, and perform system improvements and upgrades. Operational Management Liaise with network administrators, systems analysts, and software engineers to assist in resolving problems with company systems. Write code and configure all database and analytical related tools according to specifications. Design, run and monitor tests on new and existing analytical solutions for the purposes of data quality, performance improvement, and general debugging. Generate statistics for management and team members regarding performance and usage. Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines. Train IT personnel on analytical solutions structure and design. Install software/tools as required. Provide guidance to business analyst on leveraging technology to analyze data. Design analytical solutions and processes that comply with all IT CAP, CLIA, HIPAA, Hitech and SOX compliance regulations. Comply with the Progenity's Polices/Procedures protecting patient information and the confidentiality of the information in accordance with the Federal and State regulations, including CAP, CLIA, HIPAA, Hitech and SOX. REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor of Science (or equivalent experience) is required. Database Design, Data Maintenance, Database Security, Database Management, Effective Information Delivery, Self-Service Analytic Tools, Requirements Analysis, Teamwork, Technical Zeal, Project Management, Presenting Technical Information, Training, Operating SystemsProficiency in a variety of programming languages, including but not limited to: c-sharp, XML and HTML. Excellent understanding of coding methods and best practices. Extensive database and operating systems experience with Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL and Microsoft Windows Server OS environments. Thorough understanding of platforms such as .NET Framework and Java. Solid working knowledge of current Internet technologies. Prior experience interviewing end-users for insight on functionality, interface, problems, and/or usability issues. Hands-on experience developing test cases and test plans. Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws. Mentor junior staff regarding technical architecture Able to communicate effectively with non-technical staff and with members of interdisciplinary teams. Flexible and adaptable to learning and understanding new technologies. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to conduct research into software-related issues and products. Highly self motivated and directed. Keen attention to detail. Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

title: Data Analytics Specialist
description: Align is the industry leader and innovator in medical devices which focuses on revolutionizing the dental and orthodontic industry. Align is looking for a Data Analytics Specialist for our San Jose, CA location. This role will be part of a culture that is helping to improve lives every day through digital dentistry.The Data Analytics Specialist should have exceptional skills with data analysis for product development. This role will be part of Align goal to deliver our clear aligners (Invisalign ®) and 3D scanners (iTero ®) to our customers. We would love for you to join a fun and cutting-edge technology company that has helped create over 5 Million Smiles (#5MILLIONSMILES #Work4Align).Job DescriptionThe Data Analytics Specialist is part of the Product Innovation group in R&D Department. The role will be working cross-functionally in R&D, marketing, clinical, and operation teams. You will leverages Align’s digital clinical database to develop and deliver data-driven insights, metrics, and recommendations to assist teams to drive the company’s product development roadmap. The roadmap that helps Align transform the orthodontic and Dental world with the Invisalign product.A successful candidate will be a strong analytical thinker with a solid engineering background to formulate critical technical hypothesis and drive complex analysis and innovation.ResponsibilitiesResponsible for constructing technical hypothesis, collecting, compiling, analyzing, and interpreting information from all available sources to advance product innovationUse state-of-the-art data science methods to derive insights from clinical database and contribute to product development projectsBe one of the product analytics expert within the Product Innovation group, including product engineering, materials, software, and clinical research teamsProduce data-sets and ad-hoc statistical reports for analysis from relational databases at the request of R&D and other business unitsPerform processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysisMaster complex components of Invisalign product and processes in all aspectsArticulate high-level business requirements into detailed product analysis plansFormulate study hypotheses and perform analysis independently or in collaboration with data teams/machine learning teams within the organizationIdentify key insights from data, prepare well-documented memos/presentations and share with internal/external stakeholdersInvestigate root causes of product deficiency and guide product development to address themProvide actionable plans to cross-functional teams based on product analysis resultsWork in a fast-paced environment and meet critical deadlinesWork on multiple ongoing projects, with minimal oversight, documentation, and defined processRequirementsBS or MS in computer science, machine learning, statistics or related technical field or equivilent years of experience.3+ years of Product engineering experience (medical device or pharmaceutical preferred)5+ years of experience in a related field, relevant industry experience in data mining and statistical analysis using analytic toolsProven ability to tailor statistical methods to given application fieldProficiency with querying relational databases (e.g. SQL)Nice to Have:Experience with business analytics tools such as Tableau, or Power BIExperience with scripting languages such as R or PythonExcellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithmsStrong command of Excel/spreadsheets including pivots, charts and other advanced functionsExcellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to explain complicated quantitative concepts to non-technical audiences and interact cross-functionally with both technical and non-technical peopleKnowledge or experience in Orthodontics or dental industryAt Align, the values Agility, Customer and Accountability define our culture. We develop solutions rapidly, hence the agile attitude typical of our employees. To delight our customers, we understand customer expectations, treat their problems as our own, and tailor our solutions to their needs. Accountability for delivering against our expectations is at the core of who we are. We hold ourselves to the highest standards with regard to our work, our professionalism, and our outcomes.Align Technology inventors and makers of Invisalign ®, the world leader of clear aligners for orthodontic therapy. Invisalign ® is a revolutionary way to replace wires & brackets by made-to-order plastic transparent aligners. Behind the scenes, we leverage new 3D computerized treatment simulation and artificial intelligence as well as 3D printing, complex bio-mechanics and advanced materials. We also invented the iTero scanner, which scans your mouth in a few minutes and generate a 3D model of your jaws and teeth to an incredible micron-level of precision.

title: Data Analyst
description: At SnackNation, we’re working hard to inspire more conscious food decisions at over 4,000 offices across the country every month. We’re shaking up the market by building the foremost source of snack preferences and recommendations to enable emerging brands to succeed and get better-for-you food into the hands of individuals such as yourself.The RoleSnackNation’s Technology team is seeking a Data Analyst (6-month contract) who will help gather, manipulate, clean, and analyze datasets to identify business insights that inform strategy to our leadership team.Who You AreB.S. or B.A. in Business, STEM, or other quantitative field1-3 years of analyst experience with a heavy focus on data1+ years of experience working with TableauAn absolute guru at MS ExcelExperience with extracting and manipulating data using SQLA stickler for the detailsConstantly seeking opportunities for growthExcellent oral and written communication skills with a proven ability to influence and articulate data stories to business and technical audiencesWhat You’ll Do:Work with stakeholders throughout the duration of a data project to gather requirements, develop timelines, communicate progress, and present findings/resultsTake on responsibility of existing internal reporting for various departments-Standardize reporting and define important metrics/KPIsRespond to ad-hoc reporting needs while ensuring data accuracy and integrityDesign reports that measure the success of campaigns and initiatives throughout their lifetimeAnalyze product feedback data to discover meaningful and actionable insightsOptimize complex reporting workflows by identifying inefficiencies in techniques and data collection methodsDevelop dashboards and design data visualizations that effectively communicate complex analyses and trends and that track performance over timeWrite efficient queries and stored procedures using SQL that will gather data in the right format to be used by the end user for various analysesAbout SnackNationWe exist to inspire more conscious food decisions by connecting healthier brands with engaged consumers through a smart marketplace. SnackNation cares about making a positive impact on the world, with a wellness-minded culture and values.We look for people who aren't afraid to be themselves. Because that's our vibe. Whether it's health or sales goals, our mantra is Better Every Day. In fact, we offer meditation, yoga and bootcamp during work hours, not after.If you're a wellness-loving professional that wants to do impactful work, take on a lot of responsibility and be a part of our driven company culture, join us. You'll be surrounded by good people wanting to do amazing work and make an impact in our booming CPG space. We promise to help you find your better you.

title: Ready to Return - Data Analyst (Software Development)
description: Company DescriptionCommon Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be.Job DescriptionThis opportunity is posted in relationship with Visa’s Ready to Return initiative. While you may have taken extended time away, Visa believes it doesn’t diminish your value or worth at work. If you are a professional who had to hit pause on your career, but are now ready to re-enter the workforce, we want to meet you! Learn if you're eligible for Visa's Ready to Return Program by going to the link below: https://careers.smartrecruiters.com/Visa/ready-to-returnImagine working for one of the pioneers in the payment technology space. The kind of company that’s been setting the bar for the way people pay and get paid for more than 50 years, and continues to innovate on a global scale. Now imagine that company is less than 15,000 employees worldwide, small enough that you’ll actually have an impact and do some amazing things. Sounds pretty awesome. Well, that company exists and it’s Visa.Yep, Visa.Imagine, in a single day, the diversity of transactions that Visa manages – from gaming enthusiasts who buy virtual goods to advance a level, to a small business merchant launching their first ecommerce business to a large consumer brand hitting their largest single-day sale. Now multiply transactions and interactions like that by millions on a global scale – that's Visa. It is a multi-billion dollar market that has experienced year over year growth!QualificationsAt Visa, everyone is a leader. The Visa Leadership Principles will be integrated into all we do, driving accountability for the way we act and the way we lead. So what are we looking for in our experienced hires?Exposure To Any Of The Following Highly driven and resourceful Strong ability to collaborate Adheres to Open Communication and fostering relationships across the enterprise Payments experience preferred but not always requiredFor more specific qualifications needed; your Recruiter will work with you to identify and assess your alignment to opportunities at Visa.Additional InformationVisa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Technology and OperationsUnited StatesVisa

title: Business Data Analyst
description: The Data Systems Analyst (DSA) is primarily responsible for drawing out the objectives and scope of Enterprise Data Management (EDM) business system solutions through a systematic analysis of the business needs and in-depth analysis of the data required to address such needs. The DSA liaises between the business community and IT, and works primarily with IT Data Integration and Business Intelligence engineers, as well as other IT technicians and analysts in architecting, designing, developing and testing automated solutions that meet the data needs of the organization. The candidate is also expected to assist in the planning, monitoring and progress assessment of the EDM development and maintenance efforts to ensure alignment with projects, department and overall organizational goals. DSAs guard and protect the organization's data, making sure that the data repositories produce consistent, reusable data. The DSA must be able to perform these tasks in a technical and systematic way, using the standard formulas and methods that are common in the industry and relevant to the current data. The DSA must have an excellent grasp of database concepts and principles within the enterprise, both the transactional, reporting and analytical system environments. The DSA must be an excellent analytical thinker and possess good problem-solving and communication skills. Project management, leadership, initiative and technical skills including some software development experience are integral.   Business Requirements (6-8 years of experience required)Work with business units/partners to gather, analyze and document business and data requirements using EDM recommended techniques (IBM Blueprint Director, IBM Discovery, etc.). Help evaluate the impact of corporate initiatives, goals, and vision upon existing EDM modules. Present and review findings to required project team members. Secure appropriate sign-offs. Perform as-is and to-be analysis on business process, workflows or systems, data flows and recommends quality improvement opportunities during the project planning and requirements gathering phases. Propose ideas for reports, dashboards, data analysis and ways to represent data in the most efficient and effective ways. Produce appropriate requirements artifacts such as Business Requirements Document (BRD), use cases, diagrams, logical design, screen mock-up, user guides and training materials.              Data Analysis (6-8 years of experience required)Conduct proactive data analysis using the EDM recommended techniques (IBM Information Analyzer) to identify trends using data and alert the business users, management and/or project team on risks and opportunities. Responsible for defining and owning the functional specifications, mapping documents using the EDM recommended techniques (IBM FastTrack). Act as the liaison and data domain-knowledge expert between the end users (Member customers), business partners and EDM engineers and technicians to articulate requirements from business to IT.             Quality Assurance (2-4 years of experience required)Create comprehensive Quality Assurance Plan along with different test scenarios, cases and scripts. Execute test plans, test scripts and test cases and ensures that quality meets design specifications prior to user testing. Secure appropriate sign-offs. Assist the business partners in developing the User Acceptance test Strategy. Triage the defect to appropriate development streams (Data Integration or Business Intelligence). Validate the fix is correct and doesn’t break any other functionality prior moving to the business user validation. Ensure continuous business/end user involvement in the analysis, development, and implementation process of new applications, enhancements, fixes through organization of cross-functional meetings.             Project Management (2-4 years of experience required)Manage and/or coordinates EDM projects, working with assigned project team and identified resources. Manage and/or leads end user training. Adhere to the EPMO guideline on the creation and maintenance of the assigned Project Dashboards on the EPMO site. Support and report on post-production implementations. Monitor performance of new systems and documents findings and recommendations for improvement, as needed.                        Production Support and Administration (6-8 years of experience required)Work with DBAs or developers to provide business analysis/impact on troubleshooting of data-related project or production issues, tests and ensures approved solution is deployed in accordance with existing release management process. Coordinate production support items with HelpDesk Support team. Adhere to the EDM Release calendar for production deployment of brand new/enhancement/production support projects. Conduct training and provide guidance and direction to new WCIRB Business Users/partners, as required. Enforce and adhere to organizational processes and standards. Create and deliver materials necessary to train other IT staff, help desk resources and application users that will use and support the application. Complete administration tasks such as Halogen, Dovico, ADP on time with excellent quality.General Requirements:College degree required, ideally in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Information Technology.Strong oral, written and interpersonal communications. Ability to work well in a team and lead when needed. Creative, flexible and self-motivated. Ability to handle fast-paced work flow and multi-task. Detail-oriented and accurate.Ability to demonstrate ownership over tasks and assignments.Ability to develop, understand and translate detailed requirements documentation from business client requirements. Adaptive and open to frequent changes in work environment and prioritization Able to successfully manage multiple competing deadlines. Ability to develop and recommend solutions to problems. Ability to discover insights from data.Strong understanding of databases, data models, database design. Ability to understand relationships that exist among organization’s various databases.Proficiency in writing SQL for querying databases. Ability to extract information from databases using complex query statements and advanced database tools. Experience in data warehouse, business intelligence and data analyticsExperience in creating, mapping and documenting data within organization (source, targets, transformation rules, etc.) Experience in various project and software development life cycle. Understanding of insurance (Workers Compensation) industry data domain is a plus.Experience as a product owner is a plus.

title: SR Data Analyst
description: Company Background: LQ Digital is a cross channel sales acceleration company, We help our clients acquire customers leveraging digital media channels like Google, Facebook, Bing, Yahoo, and the Display Ad Exchanges as well as develop and execute fully integrated marketing to sales campaigns with our U.S. based call center.We are looking for a data scientist / business analyst to lead the charge in leveraging our growing repository of marketing and sales ops data to develop actionable insights for our teams. The Sr. Data Analystwill work across the organization with projects such as building a consolidated reporting engine and dashboard and the call center operations team to build predictive models that will drive real time decision making to drive efficiency.Position Responsibilities Lead the development of business requirements to consolidate, aggregate and analyze marketing and operational data. Slice, dice and analyze the data to answer questions like: Which marketing channels are most effective? When should our outbound calls be made to maximize contact rates? How many people do we need to staff hour by hour for our call center? Work with multiple business stakeholders and owners to solve business problems with data. Develop and maintain the data reporting infrastructure for the organization.Position Expectations Demonstrated expertise and experience with business intelligence and data visualization tools. Ability to wear many hats and be self-driven in solving business challenges. Curiosity for business problems and desire to find the best, most elegant solution to a problem Attention to detail and a strong capacity for problem solving. Be a true team player with the ability to have fun!Qualifications 2-4 years of previous business analytics or data mining experience in a professional setting. Experience with relational databases (SQL Server etc.) Experience with data visualization and analytics planforms (Tableau or similar) Previous experience working with clients in an agency or call center setting, preferred but not required Familiarity with scripting languages is a plus (PHP, Python or similar) Experience with statistical models and predictive modeling algorithm development. (R, SAS, etc) Bachelor's degreeWe recruit only the most qualified candidates, and offer continual training and growth opportunities (not to mention all the snacks you can consume and a game room). We believe that a happy and productive team results in happy clients - and we love making our clients look awesome.SDL2017

title: Sr Business Systems Analyst
description: Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world with total assets of over $2.4 trillion (as ranked by SNL Financial, April 2016) and 140,000 colleagues in nearly 50 countries. In the U.S., we’re 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that’s working to fulfill its vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group.Job SummaryThe Sr. Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for supporting and managing the implementation of assigned system projects. Applies specific knowledge of the business and knowledge of systems technology capabilities to business problem solving. The primary objective is to meet the information needs of the business unit. Responsible for development of business system requirements. Participates in the design and maintenance of complex system projects.Major ResponsibilitiesBusiness technical support for the business systems used by the Operational Risk Management Department. Act as point of contact for day-to-day system issues, data questions, and report queries.The analyst will troubleshoot issues and work closely with MUFG Union Bank's Information Technology Group and vendors to resolve issues in a timely manner.Contribute to the development and implementation of strategic technology plans. Provide leadership and manage moderate to complex technical projects and ensure business needs are met.Ensure the design and integration of proposed system solutions is effective.Lead project efforts and make independent decisions to arrive at desired results.Leads, conducts and facilitates meetings.Develop reports which includes requirements gathering, writing queries, extracting data, and report layout. Validate data for accuracy and ensure the data accurately represents the intended purpose of the report.The analyst will also be required to develop a comprehensive knowledge of existing reports and determine the feasibility of new report requests.In some instances, the analyst will perform data extracts from various bank systems on multiple platforms using established software tools.Produce ad-hoc reports and perform data analysis based on requests from the business unit. Identify opportunities to standardize reports and automate on demand requests. Requires 8+ years of Business Systems Analyst experience. Requires 5+ years of report development.Experience with Tableau, Business Objects, Cognos or equivalent report writing tool.Experience with GRC systems is preferred. Software implementation experience is preferred. Experience with RSA Archer, OpenPages and/or SharePoint is a plus. Experience with Operational Risk Management and/or Third-Party Risk Management is a plus. Team player with strong planning and organizational skills. Strong analytical skills and project management skills.Strong written and interpersonal communication skills.Experience facilitating business requirement discussions. College degree is preferred. Financial industry experience preferred.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.A conviction is not an absolute bar to employment. Factors such as the age of the offense, evidence of rehabilitation, seriousness of violation, and job relatedness are considered in all employment decisions. Additionally, it’s the bank’s policy to only inquire into a candidate’s criminal history after an offer has been made. Federal law prohibits banks from employing individuals who have been convicted of, or received a pretrial diversion for, certain offenses.JobRisk & CompliancePrimary LocationCALIFORNIA-BreaOther LocationsARIZONA-Tempe, NEW JERSEY-Jersey CityJob PostingJul 10, 2018, 5:02:42 PMShiftDayScheduleFull Time

title: EDI Lead Developer
description: Job Description: EDI Lead Developer     Ariat is looking an EDI lead developer to join our growing EDI team. Ideal candidate will have 10 or more years of experience in business-critical interactions through the exchange of data flowing across the enterprise, B2B communities, great communication skills, and a positive attitude.   This position will be responsible for leading the technical execution of developing data integration solutions in an existing SAP PI / PO application environment using the SAP B2B add-on. The EDI developer lead will efficiently and effectively interact with the business analyst, software architect, and business users to translate the business requirements into data interface solutions. The candidate should be well versed in mapping various B2B integration patterns including EDI, AS2, AS3, FTP, SFTP, REST and SOAP to and from SAP. A background in manufacturing and distribution would be preferable, as would the successful completion of at least 5 EDI partner implementations with multiple maps.   Position Responsibilities: Manage IT vendor relationships with EDI VAN providers and eCommerce Portal partners. Manage Technical relationships with customers and vendors as related to eCommerce transactions. Work with SAP Business Systems analysts and business users to determine business requirements and perform system changes as required by the business. Perform EDI mapping for new B2B partners and EDI monitoring for existing B2B partners. Follow best practices in development methodology. Document changes in EDI maps as required by IT Change Management Policies and Procedures. Build new Enterprise Service Repository (ESR) and Integration Directory objects and modify existing ones Proven experience with multiple data transfer methods such as VAN, FTP / SFTP (with PGP), REST, SOAP and AS2 using the SAP B2B connector. Proven experience working with Portal partners to process POS data from customer retail locations. Provide guidance on support, monitoring, and troubleshooting SAP PI / PO production issues, optimizing performance, and resolving production issues based on previous experience and best practices. Provide 24x7 on call support, as necessary. Recommend new hardware and software solutions to keep the company up-to-date on ecommerce and data integration technology.   Job Requirements: B.S. in Business or Computer Science or equivalent work experience required. Expert knowledge in a variety of EDI mapping protocols in SAP PI / PO especially standard EDI X12 (850, 855, 856, 810, 860, 870, 846, 832, 940, 945, 997) and XML. At least 5 years of SAP experience in integration with SAP ECC. At least 6 years of experience in an EAI and SOA environment using SAP PI / PO. Strong planning, organizing, communication and presentation skills. Ability to work proficiently with little daily guidance. Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.     Desirable Qualifications: Proficiency in Java coding a plus 5 years of business experience with a focus on finance, materials management, or supply chain. Hands on experience with setup of new systems in SAP Systems Landscape Directory

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Agentology is the engine that powers client relationships for highly motivated, results-driven real estate agents by infusing technology with industry expertise. Our customers are more confident, prepared, and emboldened because, unlike static real estate solutions, we use a dynamic blend of automation and human touch to cultivate genuine interactions. We deeply care for our customer’s success and growth at each stage of their professional evolution.To sustain our explosive growth, we are looking for drivers—people who thrive on responsibility and live for the next big challenge. We seek to employ the brightest and most forward-thinking talent on the planet, and we want to hire people who have their best work ahead of them, not behind them. Accelerate your career and succeed in an environment where you can make an impact daily. We invite you to join in to stand out.Agentology is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our Finance team. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion to deliver data-driven insights. This position works alongside our executive team to deliver business results across all business lines using data for insights and optimization.The ideal candidate should be passionate about customer data, with a proven history of driving insights. We value:A can-do attitude, with the expertise to deliver.A willingness to roll up your sleeves in a startup environment, building from the ground up.The ability to aggregate, analyze and interpret primary and disparate data across multiple data sources and formats.High energy and intellectually curious individuals with a desire to work in a result oriented, dynamic, rapid growth environment.Independent thinkers with ability to move a project forward, draw key insights, and plan next steps.Excellent verbal and written skills and the ability to interface effectively with all levels of management.Essential Functions:Synthesize qualitative and quantitative prospect and customer data from multiple sources to develop comprehensive longitudinal views of customer behavior and attributes.Frame the right questions, write queries and perform ad-hoc analysis to support immediate business data needs supplemented with clear recommendations and next steps.Extensive experience in extracting, cleaning, preparing, and modeling data; data structures, and algorithms.Experience with SaaS specific metrics is a plus: customer acquisition, churn, customer cohorts and behavior, and other segmentations.Comfortable working with different datasets of different sizes and shapes, and be able to run algorithms on large size data effectively and efficiently.Ability to translate engagement objectives to a project plan with milestones, and resource/technology requirements, and teach, lead, and manage projects to successful execution.Understanding of traditional and new data analysis methods to build statistical models or Client patterns in data.Qualifications:4+ years experience within business/customer/marketing/data analytics.Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills.Candidate must possess strong data background with BI technologies to further automate data exploration and dashboards. Preferred experience with Excel and Google Sheets, Tableau, Salesforce, Redash, SQL, and Zapier in addition to making recommendations for other platforms.Flexibility and ability to adapt to evolving business objectives.Expertise in a query language such as SQL or equivalent.Experience working with various digital advertising platforms, including but not limited to AdWords, Facebook, Google Analytics.Organized with strong problem solving skills, attention to detail, communication skills, and time management abilities.Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver against aggressive deadlinesBachelor’s degree (Masters in a plus) in Statistics, Marketing Analytics, or other Quantitative fields is highly preferable.Why Agentology? Agentology is a mission-driven company. Our co-founder/CEO was a successful Real Estate Agent with numerous years of experience and a passionate resolve to transform and innovate the Real Estate space. We help our agents ascend to new levels of success through our platform.We are tackling a vast market and are unencumbered by a dominant competitor.Our goal is to build a $10 billion+ company that is a household name for all Real Estate agents across the globe.Competitive compensation and benefits.Equity in a growth stage startup backed by Venture Capital.San Diego is an idyllic place to live; our office is minutes away from hiking/biking trails, and the surf.Paid holidays and self-managed paid time off.Must be authorized to work in the U.S.No relocation assistance Please no recruiters

title: Analyst, Issue Analytics
description: High Lantern Group (HLG) is a strategic positioning and reputation management consultancy working for some of the world’s most notable businesses and organizations. We are hiring an analyst to support our growing Issue Analytics practice, which provides clients with strategic insights about their external landscape. Through this service offering, we help clients forecast and analyze reputational threats, CSR trends, stakeholder expectations, and external leadership opportunities. For more information about Issue Analytics, please consult hlganalytics.com. This is an exciting opportunity to join an expanding team that is pioneering a new approach to data-driven issues management. We're looking for a hybrid individual who can help bridge the gap between our analytic offering and our traditional consulting expertise – someone comfortable translating ambiguous problems into robust, meaningful metrics and insights that clients can use. The right candidate for this role will have an analyst’s mindset and comfort with data, as well as a natural curiosity about business strategy, corporate reputation, and public policy. Key ResponsibilitiesProduce regular analytic reports for internal and external audiences detailing key corporate reputation trends.Mine large, unstructured datasets to surface novel insights that will be meaningful to our clients.Contribute to development of visualizations and metrics that strengthen our ability to surface insights and provide guidance to our clients.Work with natural language processing tools to develop and manage client monitoring projects.Track the performance of our methodology, helping to document it, and propose ways to increase scalability of the tool, and actionability of the insights.Work with data scientists and other team members to increase accuracy of our natural language processing tools.Support product scalability by standardizing analytic and strategy-creation processes.Manage & train interns/summer associates.Required Skills Ideal candidates should have:1+ years’ professional experience analyzing social issues, public policy, or business strategyProven ability to translate data into meaningful insights.Ability to wrangle and visualize large datasets in R.Affinity for problem-solving; demonstrated resiliency in the face of challenges and set-backs.Passion for excellence and driving customer success.Excellent writing, research, and communication skills.Exemplary attention to detail.Exceptional candidates will have experience with Shiny apps, familiarity with SQL, and/or leveraging machine learning algorithms.Bachelor’s required. Candidates will likely have additional academic credentials such as an MA, MS, or completed certificate coursework.How to Apply Please apply online at www.highlanterngroup.com/careers. You are required to submit a cover letter and resume. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.In your cover letter, candidates should detail their creativity in problem-solving with particular regard to data wrangling / visualization and analysis of social, reputation, public policy, or business issues.About High Lantern Group In 2009, we imagined a new kind of consulting firm, one that delivers on the promise of new ideas and fresh perspectives; that feels like a natural extension of the client; that can complete your thoughts and push them further. We imagined a firm with the kind of consultants we always wanted to work with: smart, resourceful and driven to excellence. We built High Lantern Group from the ground up to deliver that – from our care in hiring, to our attention to development, to the services and processes we use to meet the challenges of our clients. Today, High Lantern Group is a leading public affairs consulting firm, specializing in positioning clients in the marketplace of ideas, with growing offices in Los Angeles, New York City, Washington, Philadelphia and Geneva, Switzerland. For more information on our people and capabilities, please visit us at www.highlanterngroup.com.

title: Director - Data & Analytics
description: About UsGE is the world's Digital Industrial Company, transforming industry with software-defined machines and solutions that are connected, responsive and predictive. Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, GE delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.Role SummaryThe Director, Data & Analytics will report to the Vice President, Data & Analytics Product Leader and will be a hands-on leader who will be responsible for the implementation of GE Digital data & analytics. The ideal candidate should be process oriented, and have a collaborative working-style to help accelerate the implementation of the digital platforms supporting one of the world’s largest, digital software businesses.Essential ResponsibilitiesLead the strategy and implementation of data & analytic products & tools for GE Digital.Own the preparation, curation & ongoing maintenance of data sets to support predictive analytics & business reportingDevelop architectural solutions for strategic GE Digital business initiativesDesign solutions for master data challenges and guide teams on application architecture, database and app designLead & manage data augmentation, clean up and data quality issue resolutionResponsible for providing line of sight to data quality and gaps where issues need to be addressedLead & manage a global team of technical resources aligned to the digital analytic projectsPartner with the Finance, Operations, Product & Engineering, & Commercial & Marketing organizations to design & implement data analytic solutionsPartner with both the Data & Analytics team & the GE Digital CIO to determine business priorities, outcomes, & implementation strategy.Actively work with cross functional teams, management and key stake holders to program manage, review progress and functional delivery on a regular committed basisBasic QualificationsQualifications/Requirements: Bachelor’s degreeMinimum 5 years of experience in implementing digital solutionsMinimum 5 years of direct experience implementing data management processes and capabilitiesMinimum 5 years of direct experience simplifying, designing, implementing systemsEligibility RequirementsLegal authorization to work in the US is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills.Desired CharacteristicsAbility to establish credibility and influence Executives, technical and non-technical team membersDemonstrated business acumen and the ability to apply technology solutions to solve business problemsUnderstanding of Change Management processes in a large IT environmentFamiliarity with iterative development methodologiesEnergetic, technical innovator who will bring their expertise along with a keen drive to learn new technologiesPossess an operational mindset to build out processes to digitize operationsAbility to hit tight deadlines and work under pressureStrong interpersonal skills: verbal, written and listeningStrong sense of ownership, urgency and driveDemonstrated customer focus - evaluate decisions through the eyes of the customer,Build strong customer relationships and create processes with customer viewpoints#DTRLocations:United States; California; San RamonGE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening.

title: Data Analyst
description: Position DescriptionCOMPANY PROFILE:The Clorox Company (NYSE: CLX) is a leading multinational manufacturer and marketer of consumer and professional products with approximately 8,700 employees worldwide and fiscal year 2017 sales of $6 billion. Clorox markets some of the most trusted and recognized consumer brand names, including its namesake bleach and cleaning products; Pine-Sol® cleaners; Liquid Plumr® clog removers; Poett® home care products; Fresh Step® cat litter; Glad® bags, wraps and containers; Kingsford® charcoal; Hidden Valley® dressings and sauces; Brita® water-filtration products; Burt's Bees® natural personal care products; RenewLife® digestive health products; and Rainbow Light®, Natural Vitality®, Neocell® and Stop Aging Now® dietary supplements. The company also markets brands for professional services, including Clorox Healthcare® and Clorox Commercial Solutions®. More than 80 percent of the company's sales are generated from brands that hold the No. 1 or No. 2 market share positions in their categories. Corporate headquarters are in Oakland, California with some functions located in Pleasanton, California -- we leverage our Bay Area location to drive innovation and progress in Marketing.Overall Job DescriptionPOSITION DESCRIPTION/OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN CLOROX:The AGIM is responsible for leveraging Consumer Insights knowledge to drive results for one or more brands, with assistance from their manager. The AGIM handles all aspects of projects with coaching from the manager, while starting to develop business knowledge and strong cross-functional relationships. The AGIM also participates in driving functional excellence and building a world-class organization. AGIM reports to the Global Insights Lead or Global Insights Manager.Key Job ResponsibilitiesDrive Functional Excellence Demonstrate working knowledge of research methods by designing, executing, and analyzing the following types of research with assistance from manager: Qualitative Concept/positioning Product Advertising Pricing Panel Syndicate Tracking Implement best practices to maximize efficiency and efficacy of efforts Participate in department initiatives to identify and evaluate innovations and leading edge methodsLeverage Consumer Insights to Achieve Develop research plans to address business objectives Manage research priorities and track spending to achieve budget Ensure full utilization of existing research information through data mining & integration of knowledge across diverse areas of consumer & marketplace research Design, execute and analyze research to deliver Consumer Insights that will drive business strategies and tactics Develop Business Knowledge to Provide Added Value to Key Business Partners Begin to develop broad-based business knowledge Begin to develop a strong cross-functional relationships and foster integration of knowledge Education And ExperiencePOSITION REQUIREMENTS: Enrollment in Bachelor or Masters Degree 2-4 years of previous business experience Marketing Research background or project work a plus Core Skill SetsDemonstration Of Strong Skills In The Following Areas Analytical/Problem Solving Results Oriented Communication Teamwork Leadership Planning & Organizing Position QualificationsCandidates must be must present, upon employment, proof of U.S. citizenship or legal right to regular employment in the U.S. Note: It is the policy of the Marketing organization with The Clorox Company and its affiliates not to employ students in practical training immigration status or persons with other employment-based non-immigrant visa status in regular positions.The Clorox Company and its subsidiaries is an EEO/AA/Protected title: Global Insights Data Analyst Data Science Internship

This position will entail interacting with Senior Management, presenting findings, and recommending solution based off data analysis conducted.Job Responsibilities: Leads a team of analyst that support various business functions across the enterprise Leads and manages cross functional projects as an analytics expert to ensure projects are aligned with the company strategy when developing solutions for our clients Develops, implements, and manages policies, procedures, and control to mitigate risk related to information management and provisioning Analyzes historical portfolio and industry trends that assist with the creation of predictive models that forecast performance Analyzes large, multi-dimensional datasets, identifying actionable insights and recommendations Performs consistently accurate, useful reports as well as an enthusiasm for translating data into actionable insight relevant to marketing program objectives Attention to detail and time management to deliver high quality work for multiple projects across several client engagements while meeting deadlines Excellent leadership and communication skills Must be a team player with strong attention to detail and able to work independently Proven track record at delivering timely and accurate information in a fast-paced environment Excellent critical thinking, problem solving, mathematical and sound judgment skills Financial services and, if possible, mortgage industry experience strongly preferred Strong business acumen and ability to interface with executive management  Qualified applicants please email resume to: schuyler.bacon@pnmac.com

title: Manager, Data Mgmt & Analytics
description: Give your career the best treatment. Ready to be part of the first and largest pediatric hospital in Southern California? This is Children's Hospital Los Angeles. A place where you can make a real difference in the lives of our patients and their families. A big responsibility? Absolutely. But if you’re up for the challenge, we’re on the lookout for amazing professionals to join our elite teams – talented individuals who can continue our high level of care.The Sr. Business Intelligence Developer is an expert in supporting enterprise Business Intelligence solutions and is responsible for overseeing and managing the team that design and develops business intelligence solutions, including reports, dashboards, and other data views, to meet the needs of customers for various data sources. The Developer will provide update status of work being done, assure compliance with CHLA’s software development policies, and will communicate activities to project resources and senior management. Provide technical leadership and expertise to project team(s), as necessary, during conceptual, detail design and implementation processes. Provide consultation and support in the development, analysis, design, and management of a variety of complex data sources to support quality process improvements and waste reduction.Responsibilities include data analysis and management reporting, utilizing software to generate metrics, data discovery applications, dashboards and scorecards. Provide exemplary troubleshooting, technical guidance and general direction to Information Services Analyst professionals and performs in a consulting and/or advisory capacity to our customers while meeting client service satisfaction expectations. Maintain documentation, test plans, code repository, tools, etc. Create and maintain standards (SOP, check lists, Service Desk Scripts, etc) for Departmental compliance and delivery. Manage vendor relationships, users and peers, to understand Business Intelligence support requirements. Perform at high-levels of design and support service levels. Work with various user groups across the hospital to enhance and utilize data and design solutions for business transformation purposes.Minimum Experience Required3-5 Years of progressive responsibility in a Development(Fundraising) Operations roleDemonstrated experience ensuring all data and data infrastructure meets needs across internal teams, including fund development, reporting & analytics, prospect research & management, finance, events and membershipUnderstanding of complex & unusual gift and pledge entries, to ensure compliance with best practicesExperience supporting integrations between CRM, fundraising and other related services 7 years providing production level support and/or development in business intelligence/enterprise data warehouse environment, demonstrated design and development experience in software programming 7 years of successful business intelligence application support and troubleshooting experience within the healthcare delivery environment. (Client/Server, Web Server, various/multiple Database environments, etc.) 7 years Oracle or SQLServer administration, development, and/or application experience. Experience in creating and modifying analytical applications using Business Intelligence tools and best practice visualization techniques. 7 years experience working with (developing, troubleshooting, maintaining, etc.) various databases (Oracle, SQL Server, etc.) 7 years Supervisory experience in a Healthcare Information Services support and/or development environment. 7 years experience developing detailed design specifications, policies/proceduresMinimum Education/Training Required:Bachelor's degree from an accredited university.Technologies, Skills And Abilities Required Must have knowledge of the following technologies: ASP.NET MVC, C#, OLAP, Sybase, Cache, SharePoint, Structural Map, SQL Reporting, Integration and Analysis Services. Must have the following skills: ETL, Data Modeling, Data, Warehousing, Predictive Analytics, Quantitative Analysis, Enterprise Architecture, Project Management, Dependency Injection, Design Patterns, Data Governance Project Liaison and Executive Liaison Excellent verbal and written communications skills and the ability to communicate with all levels of employees Demonstrated ability to work in a team Proven ability to lead and deliver projects on schedule and on budgetIn depth knowledge of Oracle or SQLServer application technologies Broad knowledge with various server administration functionsStrong ability to troubleshoot database functional and system issues. Must be a self-starter with strong analytical and problem-solving skills who is willing to take ownership of issues and see them through to resolution with little or no supervision.

title: Data Analyst
description: Position SummaryThe Data Processor/Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.Data processors spend the majority of their day inputting various data into computers. This data can originate on paper forms, or it could be electronic, such as email. The data processor will perform initial checks on the data contained in the form (spreadsheet, report, data sheet) to make sure it's complete and that required information isn't missing. Then enters this data into a system. Experience using the Microsoft Office suite is essential.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesGathers, proofreads, and organizes information, which is entered in the company database.Analyzes the information and examines the documents for accuracy. Errors are fixed or deleted first before being entered into the database.Works with various data processing software programs including Microsoft Suite (Excel, Word, and Access).Interprets data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reportsDevelop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and qualityAcquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsFilter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct problemsLocate and define new process improvement opportunitiesOffice administrative tasks as needed for the office.Other duties may be assignedSupervisory ResponsibilitiesThis position does not have supervisory responsibilities.Education / Experience / RegistrationsTwo years of proven working experience as a data processor/analyst requiredTechnical experience regarding data models, database development, data mining and segmentationBachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics desired, but not requiredKnowledge of the Corrosion, Cathodic Protection, Pipeline, or Utility industries desired, but not requiredValid driver's license with no prior DUI within 5yrs, acceptable driving record, and evidence of insurability for travel purposesUpon employment, this position is subject to random drug testing in compliance with federal, state and company guidelinesKnowledge/ Skills /AbilitiesProficient in and working experience with Microsoft Office SuiteMust possess strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyAdept at queries, report writing and presenting findingsExceptional computer skills and be very familiar with software programsAbility to focus practically on working with computer programs and database inputAbility to understand instructions quickly and master the required softwareMotivated and comfortable with repetitionAttention to detail is a very important trait because data processors typically enter a huge amount of dataPhysical Demands & Work EnvironmentApproximately 95% of the work may be performed in an office environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, and sit. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds unassisted. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus.The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.Company DescriptionAccurate Corrosion Control, Inc. “ACCI” is a full service Corrosion Control Mitigation Company specializing in providing corrosion control materials, construction and Cathodic Protection services working mainly in AZ and surrounding states as a cathodic protection utility contractor.

title: Java Developer (AMRD2082)
description: Req # AMRD2082Job Status Full Time RegularFunctional Area R&DPosition OverviewYou'll be working on the FortiCASB product, which aims to build a web application working as a cloud access security broker (CASB), monitoring cloud platforms and ensuring their configuration and file security. FortiCASB works in a distributed environment, processing high volume of transactions, managing configuration and data analytic. In the project, you'll have a good opportunity of learning and applying the cutting-edge technologies.We are looking for a talented, motivated engineer, with a passion for transforming complex data into compelling features.Job Responsibilities Work with the team lead, architect, business analyst to drive development work during the full life cycle of project Responsible for the design, coding, unit testing, defect fix, production support, etc. Aim to be full-stack engineer with continuous learning and project practice.Job Skill Requirement Solid knowledge of Java/J2EE and SOA, including but not limited to JSP, Servlets, JMS, EJB, Web Services (SOAP, REST).
