title: Director, Data & Analytics
description: About FTI ConsultingFTI Consulting, Inc. is a global business advisory firm dedicated to helping organizations manage change, mitigate risk and resolve disputes financial, legal, operational, political & regulatory, reputational and transactional. With more than 4,600 employees located in 28 countries, FTI Consulting professionals work closely with clients to anticipate, illuminate and overcome complex business challenges and make the most of opportunities. The Company generated $1.81 billion in revenues during fiscal year 2017. For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Twitter (@FTIConsulting) , Facebook and LinkedIn .FTI Consulting continually strives to offer employees and eligible dependents, including domestic partners and eligible domestic partner children, a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Please click here for more information.FTI Consulting does not accept unsolicited resumes from external firms or agencies. FTI Consulting will not be responsible for placement fees associated with unsolicited resumes.FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.About Forensic & Litigation ConsultingThe Forensic and Litigation Consulting practice at FTI Consulting provides multidisciplinary, independent dispute advisory, investigative, data acquisition/analysis and forensic accounting services to the global business and legal community. Our team supports clients facing high stakes litigation, arbitration and compliance investigations, and regulatory scrutiny.About The OpportunityA Director - Data & Analytics is responsible for providing accounting, economic and financial related consulting services as they relate to litigation, dispute resolution or financial investigations. He/she will assist businesses, government entities and law firms in complex, data-intensive analyses requiring the understanding of relationships between various information sources, complex modeling or information sharing. Working in the Data & Analytics practice provides the opportunity to work in a leveraged, team based model of diversely skilled, intelligent, driven and successful individuals. Team members regularly exceed expectations and are recognized accordingly; through promotion, compensation, public recognition and positive feedback.Primary DutiesAs a Director, you will develop in-depth knowledge of your clients' objectives and challenges in order to design and implement innovative strategies to assist them through their current difficulties and prepare them for the future. Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to, the following Effectively working with clients in order to develop the work plan for identifying, acquiring, synthesizing, mining and analyzing relevant data Identifying the relationships among multiple sources and types of data, and organizing this information to facilitate effective data analysis Designing and implementing complex financial database models to generate meaningful statistics and resolve disputes Analyzing and interpreting historical financial, operational, and transactional data. Supervising the day-to-day activities of projects including interaction with client personnel, FTI team members, and professionals from other firms involved in the engagement Reviewing and finalizing written analyses, reports, presentations, and interrogatories for third parties on the project scope and/or results of activities Identification of potential opportunities and effectively communicating service offerings through both internal and external channels Mentoring and developing team members Providing feedback and performance management to staffBasic Qualifications Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree 6 years of experience in finance, accounting, or economics with an emphasis in complex problem solving, data analytics, or related competencies Experience managing projects and teamsRequired Skills Possess strong quantitative and qualitative research and analytical skills Able to work in a team as well as independently Able to demonstrate excellent communication (written and verbal) and organizational skills Able to adapt quickly in handling multiple/evolving tasks as a result of new engagements and/or re-prioritized deadlines Possess strong interpersonal skills Highly motivated, hard-working, eager to learn, willing to travel, and able to motivate others Experience with large amounts of complex data, including data mining and result interpretation Able to utilize technology to solve complex problems Able to effectively develop and execute work plans and drive results Able to effectively manage multiple staff and projects Able to provide quality assurance and supervision Able to regularly communicate status (to both internal and external clients) Able to produce high quality and/or final work product under strict deadlines Proficient in financial, accounting, and / or other quantitative skillsPreferred Skills Proficient in analyzing data within relational database systems such as MS Access, MS SQL Server and Oracle Data Base Proficient in SQL, PL SQL, Oracle, VBA, and / or other ETL technical skills Familiarity with tools such as Tableau, APEX, .NET, Java, VBA, and SharePoint Understanding of common software packages; such as PeopleSoft, SAP, Great Plains, JD Edwards, Hyperion and Oracle Financials Understanding of the Litigation Life Cycle and the Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM)Knowledge of Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and anti-money laundering regulationsPosition Classification Exempt#CB#

title: Data Science Analyst, Strategic Pricing
description: Our vision at Petco is Healthier Pets. Happier People. Better World. We’re making things better for pets, people and the planet through our Think Adoption First philosophy, the Petco Foundation and other important initiatives that focus on putting animals first, educating pet parents and reducing our carbon footprint. The journey starts with knowledgeable, passionately engaged associates who are proud to recommend Petco as a place to work, who believe in our Vision and who are committed to delivering a superior customer experience.From our retail stores and our network of Distribution Centers to our Corporate offices, you'll work with others who share your values and commitment. We seek individuals who are passionate about animal welfare, have great people skills and are driven to grow and advance in their careers with us. Our ongoing growth is creating exceptional opportunities for professional development and personal enrichment throughout our organization.Position PurposeThe Data Science Analyst, Strategic Pricing will be in our San Diego, CA location and will be on the Merchandising Optimization team. The successful candidate is responsible for leveraging strategic insights and advanced analytics to understand financial trends, customer behavior, and the competitive landscape in order to make the best decisions about the products we carry and the promotions used to maximize financial performance.Within the team you help guide our pricing strategy by analyzing historical sales performance for key opportunities, creating accurate promotional forecasting models, and translating complex data and analysis into clear insights and tangible actions that can be executed by the business.Essential Job FunctionsThe incumbent must be able to perform all of the following duties and responsibilities with or without a reasonable accommodation. Develop new pricing models and initiatives that help the Merchandising team make the best decisions to maximize promotional lift, strengthen vendor performance, and drive strong return on investment (ROI). Leverage advanced analytical techniques and statistical programming languages to find patterns in customer purchase behaviors, competitive pricing, and sales performance trends (regression analysis, price elasticity, significance testing). Help design and develop automated dashboards and templates that accurately forecast multiple pricing and merchandising scenarios to streamline the decision-making and execution process. Utilize strong communication skills to present analyses and findings to merchants and vendors by effectively translating complex data into clear insights, opportunities, and tangible business recommendations. Collaborate with internal data science teams by providing direction on how to best utilize more advanced techniques and machine learning to achieve strategic objectives and business goals within the Merchandising organization. Display deep intellectual curiosity, creativity, and commitment to learning in order to solve critical business problems and push the boundary of our capabilities.Nature of SupervisionIncumbent is expected to make independent decisions within their functional area that align with corporate objectives. Analyst will be provided with expected project outcomes and general direction with little direct supervision on day-to-day process.Planning and Problem SolvingExpected to plan, prioritize and complete multiple projects with varying deadlines under minimal supervision. The incumbent will regularly be required to use their judgment when preparing analyses and determining best approaches to solve broad business problems, ensuring that all risks and opportunities have been evaluated.ImpactThe incumbent will help drive corporate strategies by ensuring data is accurate, providing reports on key metrics to senior leaders, and working with the broader analytics team to provide timely insights that improve overall company performance.Supervisory ResponsibilityNo direct reports. Incumbent will collaborate and lead cross-functional business projects.Education/Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Statistics, Math or related business field; Master’s Degree preferred. 1 or more years of experience in Analytics or Statistics capacity; 2 years ideal. Experience building data sets from multiple sources required (SQL preferred) Experience with statistical programming languages required (R, SQL, SAS, Python, VBA). Experience with pricing, merchandising or the retail industry strongly preferred. Ability to think conceptually and creatively about problems and solutions Strong interpersonal communication skills, verbal and written, required due to the nature and level of interaction with senior management Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and ability to manage multiple projects while meeting deadlines.Work EnvironmentThe majority of job duties are conducted while seated indoors at a computer terminal with little or no exposure to hazards. Occasional travel may be required for presentations, training, and conventions.ContactsIncumbents in this position regularly interact with the senior officers of the company in both written and verbal forms. Incumbents must have the ability to influence, resolve conflict, negotiate and communicate with all levels of associates at Petco.Primary LocationUnited States-California-SAN DIEGO-10850 Via Frontera - NSC Building 1 (0016)JobMarketing

title: Sr Analyst, Business Systems
description: TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.Job Summary/OverviewThe Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible for planning, conducting, and delivering the analysis and requirements to solve highly complex business problems through strategic technology solutions. The Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible for the production of business and system requirements for technology solutions and works directly with individuals from various functions and levels within the organization including senior management. This role is also responsible for creating and writing query and preparing the data in Excel formats for use by business partners and auditors. The Senior Business Analyst is considered the highest-level functioning expert of our current state and to-be Financial systems and provides subject matter expertise and thought leadership over these functions within the organization.Essential Duties/Responsibilities Elicits and manages business, user (stakeholder), transition and software needs and requirements for the ongoing configuration, support, upgrades, and new development of company’s internal applications, particularly in the Financial functions including GL, Tax, AP, AR and other core capabilities to support the delivery of business value and advance company goals. Creating and writing query and SQL against Oracle DB environments and preparing the data in Excel formats for use by business partners and auditors. Assesses requirements and defines solution options for best fit to the needs of the business. Identifies gaps, determines necessary workarounds or system changes, and assists in the determination of the justification for investment where needed. Becomes the system subject matter expert on the functionality of our systems. Responsible for determining the appropriate setup/configurations of software where requirements can be met without custom development. Defines and documents the business and system requirements and acceptance criteria when custom development is needed for technology components such as user interfaces (screen, and GUI designs), reports, data conversions, interfaces to other applications, (including customizations to and interfaces between applications), exception handling, security and other non-functional requirements (e.g., performance, system availability, etc.). Develops and maintains an intimate understanding of our business operations and identifies both opportunities and the impacts of change being introduced (level of effort, options, pros/cons, impacts if change not performed) Collaborates with the project team to identify and manage risks and issues Identifies and documents business scenarios for testing, validates the system functions as intended and determines the most appropriate response to defects. Assists in the preparation of deployment/implementation plans and transition of knowledge to application production support teams Provides leadership and mentoring to other members of the team Other responsibilities may be added at the manager’s discretionJob Requirements And QualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, business administration or related field.Training Requirements (licenses, Programs, Or Certificates) One of the following - Certification of Competency in Business Analysis™ (CCBATM), Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP), Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP™) desired but not required.Experience A minimum of 7-10 years of experience in a System Analyst role in the information technology field or equivalent experience A minimum of 5 years of experience in a project lead role working with PeopleSoft Financials and/or HR or other comparable systems in financial or payroll related disciplines (e.g. SAP, etc...)Other Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Very strong analytical and problem solving skills including knowledge of math, logic, programming Ability to explain ideas and technical terms clearly and concisely Skilled facilitator capable of planning and running requirements workshops across diverse cross-functional teams that may be in remote locations Able to do basic data analysis by writing basic queries in query tools such as PS Query Manager, SQL/SQL*Plus, Toad, SQL Navigator Working knowledge of PeopleSoft security Practical knowledge of PeopleTools In depth understanding of software development life cycle stages and key activities Strong oral and written communication skills Project management skillsWORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION (Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.) Minimum Travel Required. title: Senior Corporate Financial Planning Analyst
description: Job SummaryAt Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.Would you like to impact financial planning all the way up to the leadership and board of directors level? Are you passionate about bridging the gap between data and storytelling?As a Senior Financial Analyst, you’d use data to empower premier financial leaders so they make the best possible decisions.We want you to focus your strong communication skills on interpreting data and designing reports so the numbers come alive. Join us at Disney Corporate.You’d join a dynamic team of financial planners and analysts whose job is to work directly with finance leaders, both at Corporate and across the Disney businesses, by providing insight across the Company.Every single day as a Senior Financial Analyst is different! On any one day you might:Prepare dynamic messages for different audiences including corporate management and other high-level executivesPerform and analyze quarterly, annual or 5-year segment operating plans:Monitor segment operating performanceSupport/engage segment finance teams, in addition to corporate functions such as Corporate Strategy, Investor Relations, and Treasury:Evaluate Company’s long-term plan, including valuation analysis of different lines of businessSupport ongoing investor and financial communicationsAnalyze cash flow forecasts and business cases for major capital projectsEngage in ad-hoc financial analysis, including special projects at the request of the CFOInteract with extraordinary partners to whom we are dedicatedDemonstrate the ability to thrive in a dynamic environmentShowcase your leadership and confidence on a large teamTake advantage of “D Learn” opportunitiesEnjoy movie screenings, team building activities and regular lunch-and-learnsResponsibilitiesPreparation of forecasts, annual operating plans and five-year plans for the segments supportedAd hoc analytics as requested by the department stakeholdersBasic QualificationsPossess strong quantitative and analytical skillsDeveloped effective business and financial discernmentA highly professional "client service orientation"Experience as a reciprocal teammate who possesses social and organizational abilitiesExcellent communication skills in both oral and written settingsThe flexibility to work with different personalities -- we believe that makes our team specialProduced detailed work without data errorsSharp presentation and storytelling skills, and the ability to exercise critical thinkingA versatile "special-projects" orientation coupled with confirmed multi-tasking abilitiesAn inherent curiosity driving you to ask the right questionsExperience working in Excel and PowerPointPreferred QualificationsBackground in the media and entertainment industry is a plus, but is not requiredExperience developing presentations on a company’s financial performanceAnalyzed business trendsCapital investments reporting experienceRequired EducationMust possess a Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Accounting, or related fieldAbout The Walt Disney Company (Corporate)At Disney Corporate you can see how the businesses behind the Company’s powerful brands come together to create the most innovative, far-reaching and admired entertainment company in the world. As a member of a corporate team, you’ll work with world-class leaders driving the strategies that keep The Walt Disney Company at the leading edge of entertainment. See and be seen by other innovative thinkers as you enable the greatest storytellers in the world to create memories for millions of families around the globe.About The Walt Disney CompanyThe Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.This position is with The Walt Disney Company, which is part of a business segment we call The Walt Disney Company (Corporate).The Walt Disney Company is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.Job ID 557247BR

title: QI Nurse Specialist - Projects and PQI
description: Job DescriptionThis position serves as the quality improvement nurse for all Quality Improvement (QI) department projects. In the capacity of specialty projects, this position will be responsible to develop, collect, analyze data, and report findings for Provider Preventable Conditions, and other QI projects. This position may to report findings appropriate committees when deemed necessary. In the capacity of PQI review, the position is primarily responsible for the Initial Clinical Review of all new PQIs. In addition, the position will support the PQI case review process as needed.Position ResponsibilitiesSpecial ProjectsDevelop Policy and Procedures and desk tops for each project. Collaborate with QI Supervisor and QI Data Analyst to determine reporting actions. Collaborate with affected departments. Develop data elements in order to capture information for each project. Develop reports and Power Point for committee presentation. Conduct ongoing analysis/assessment of operational performance for continuous process improvements, improved efficiency, and improved customer satisfaction. Utilize findings and trends to improve policies, procedures and associate comprehension via training. Compile information and prepare reports for Supervisor and/or Director. Integrate data reporting systems to develop and maintain a variety of statistical reports in a format which enables management to report to committees. Ensure compliance with federal, state and other regulatory agency standards. Evaluate various types of information for integrity, accuracy and appropriateness. Other projects and duties as assigned. Potential Quality of Care Case Review Perform Initial Clinical Reviews within 3-5 business days of receipt PQIs. Perform investigations of unusual occurrences/events from sources (providers, staff, hotline, etc.) and assess criticality of events. Meet timeframes for performance while balancing the need to produce high quality work related to complex and sensitive member issues. Ensure integrity of departmental database by thorough, timely and accurate entry of cases. Participate in departmental meetings, trainings, and audits as requested. Maintain and support a culture of compliance, ethics, and integrity. Maintain knowledge of policies and procedures and perform in accordance with applicable regulatory requirements, external laws, and accreditation standards as they relate to business & clinical risk management.Other projects and duties as assigned.Required Skills Work with peers in self-managed teams to meet deadlines. Have excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrate conflict resolution and mediation skills with the ability to secure action from persons outside of their supervision. Use sound judgment to handle potentially charged issues independently, but with the knowledge and ability to escalate and ask for help when needed. Multitask and manage time in order to perform well on long-term projects while being flexible enough to assimilate short-term projects on an ongoing basis. Travel may be required locally within CalOptima’s health network. Manage competing priorities, integrate information from multiple sources, and maintain focus on organizational strategic goals. Identify issues, propose methodological solutions, thoroughly analyze information, and present findings with implications in a clear and direct manner. Required ExperienceExperience & Education: Bachelor’s degree in Nursing or equivalent experience preferred. Current, unrestricted RN license to practice in the State of California is required. Experience in quality management or equivalent experience preferred. Documented 1+ years in report creation and analysis, with strong analytical skills. 3+ years experience in a health care delivery system, including health plan, medical group, or hospital management. Valid California driver’s license and vehicle or other approved means of transportation, as well as auto insurance will be required for some assignments. Knowledge Of Regulatory and accreditation standards and guidelines- DHCS, DMHC, CMS, CDA, Joint Commission, and NCQA. Proficiency in Microsoft Office. Excellent project management, communication, written, and critical thinking skills. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills, with demonstrated decision making and management skills. Grade: N

Analytical and data management skills necessary to collect and analyze substantial sized data files. Consistently demonstrating the knowledge, skills, abilities, discretion and behaviors necessary to provide superior service to physicians, providers, team members and leadership. Must be able to demonstrate a great deal of independent judgment as it applies to discretion and decision making.Preferred Qualifications: 2-5 years in a Lead positionMicrosoft Reporting Services experience. Analytical and data management skills necessary to collect and analyze substantial sized data files. Consistently demonstrating the knowledge, skills, abilities, discretion and behaviors necessary to provide superior service to physicians, providers, team members and leadership. Must be able to demonstrate a great deal of independent judgement as it applies to discretion and decision making.

title: Senior Data Analytics Analyst— Senior Compliance Statistician
description: Job DescriptionWhat sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management.Position SummaryThis position reports to the Data Analytics Manager in the CIP Fair Lending Data Analytics Team.We are seeking a qualified, creative, self-motivated candidate with excellent analytical and quantitative skills to contribute to the growth of the CIP Fair Lending Testing Program.Essential Job Functions Perform fair lending statistical analysis for various lending products with minimal or no supervision. Analyze lending policies and processes for various products to design a fair lending test and provide specification. Generate thorough reports with the results of fair lending analyses, and present the report to senior management. Act as a lead analyst for specific projects, this includes managing the various aspect of a fair lending test including: planning, data acquisition, project schedule, and actively engaging with subject matter experts and business leaders to gain insight on policies and processes affecting the decisions on the products being studied. Perform matched pair analyses and produce file samples for manual fair lending review. Planning and execution of complex studies. Perform various complex ad-hoc analyses. A minimum of 7 years prior experience in banking or a financial institution in an analytical role. A minimum of 6 performing fair lending statistical analysis. A minimum 7 years of experience using SAS in a banking or financial institution. SAS certifications a plus. Experience performing statistical data analyses for credit risk, or finance in banking, a financial institution or related organization a plus. Experience and broad knowledge of project management Experience with spatial analysis a plus Experience developing maps with SAS/Graph a plus. Requires deep knowledge of job area.EducationBachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Math, Economics, or related field requiredMS or PhD degree in Statistics, Math, Economics, or related field required (PhD a plus)Knowledge And SkillsStrong knowledge of applied statistics and SAS programming required.Knowledge of fair and responsible banking is highly desirableDetail oriented with the ability to understand the broad context.Ability and willingness to pursue excellent results.Good inter-personal and partnering skills to facilitate effective working relationships.Ability to problem solve and swiftly escalate issues to senior staff when needed.Good management and control of work flows to produce deliverables within required timeframes and quality standards.Effective verbal and written communication skills.Ability to summarize complex information into simple to understand information.Ability to produce thorough description of analyses and results.Excellent analytic and quantitative skills.Ability to adjust to rapidly changing environment and prioritize deliverablesStrong SAS programing skills Base SAS, SAS/STAT, SAS/Graph and other packages required.Ability to develop maps with SAS/Graph a plus.Knowledge of KML a plus.Excellent ability for creating reports and analyzing data with SAS.Experience with UNIX or Linux is highly desiredGood MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word skills; experience with other data analysis tools is a plusCreativity, curiosity, and the desire to learn and innovateAbility to self-motivate, self-start, and a desire to work independently in a relatively unstructured environmentGood understanding of the banking and financial services industriesEqual Employment Opportunity Policy Bank of the West is an Equal Opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers without regard to any status protected by applicable law. Bank of the West is also an Affirmative Action employer - Minority / Female / Disabled / Veteran.Bank of the West will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations.Primary LocationUnited States-California-San RamonJobOperationsJob PostingFeb 2, 2018, 10:45:16 PMJob Qualifications Required Experience

title: Data Analyst
description: At Tala, we are connecting millions of people to the financial services they deserve. The Data Analytics team operates in a nimble working style, flexing between a variety of business questions and data needs at the company. We are asked to investigate and solve big questions other companies have yet to find solutions for such as digital identity management and understanding customers fully based on their mobile data. You will be part of an innovative and fast growing team that pushes to provide access, choice, and control to millions of customers.As a Data Analyst, your goal is to deeply understand internal client needs and to build out data products that provide the company with real-time and in-depth insights about our diverse customer base.This role will be based out of our Santa Monica, CA office.In This Role You Will Be a key resource: become an expert on Tala’s data infrastructure, analytics tools, and best practices in data-driven research for the company Be curious: investigate new data sets, identify strategic opportunities for improving servicing for our customers, and share your findings with our partner teams Be a multiplier: build out new data flows as our product changes, and produce high-value, timely analytics based the unique aspects of each of our markets What We’re Looking For BA/BS in a quantitative field Expert in at least one analytics language (ex. Python, R) Proficient in SQL, GitHub, bash commands Experience interning or working in a data-intensive role (or equivalent experience) Perfect Candidates Would Have Experience with multiple types of messy data in a business environment Experience in emerging markets (either personally or in professional scope) Modeling and machine learning expertise outside of school or Kaggle Ability to juggle multiple projects effectively in a fast-paced environment About TalaTala is a mobile technology and data science company that is working to deliver financial access, choice and control to underserved people around the world. Tala’s smartphone app instantly evaluates customers for credit using only the data on their devices and delivers customized loans in minutes.Tala, formerly known as InVenture, is backed by IVP, Ribbit Capital, Lowercase Capital, Data Collective, Collaborative Fund and other leading venture and impact investors. In 2016, Fast Company ranked Tala, formerly known as InVenture, as one of its top 10 companies in Money, and Forbes named Tala as one of the top 50 FinTech companies in the world. Additionally, Tala’s work has been highlighted by the New York Times, the Financial Times, the Wall Street Journal, TED, and Wired, among others.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description: Job Description TrueCar’s mission is to transform the car-buying experience for consumers and the way that dealers attract customers and sell cars. We have established an intelligent, data-driven online platform operating on a common technology infrastructure, powered by proprietary data and analytics. We operate our company-branded platform on our TrueCar.com website. In addition, we customize and operate our platform for affinity group marketing partners, such as USAA and Chase, Sam’s Club, financial institutions, and other large enterprises such as Boeing and Verizon. We enable users to obtain market-based pricing data on new and used cars, and to connect with our network of over 15,000 TrueCar Certified Dealers.We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to join our FP&A team and provide financial planning, budget vs. actual analysis, monthly reporting for General & Administrative and Product/Technology departments, as well as ad hoc analysis. This position will report to the FP&A Manager and will also work closely with senior executives to create forecasts, monthly reports, and various ad hoc analyses to support strategic decisions. We are looking for a highly-motivated self-starter who is extremely analytical, loves data, and has excellent interpersonal skills to collaborate with multiple teams within the company’s organization. The position requires strong technical and analytical skills in the areas of: Creating detailed bottoms-up forecasts at the department levelMonthly reporting and variance analysesInterpreting financial trends within large sets of data and communicating to executivesIntellectual curiosity with a desire to understand and solve problems  The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of experience in a financial analyst or accounting role and a solid understanding of the forecasting and planning process, with knowledge of accounting rules. As a critical member of a lean FP&A team, you are the ultimate data expert and thrive on solving highly analytical problems, driving operational insights, and communicating solutions directly to the department heads. A willingness to be mentored and learn all aspects of the business will be essential for success in the role.ABOUT THE JOB: Assist in developing the company’s annual and quarterly financial plans by working closely with functional groups across the General & Administrative and Product/Technology departmentsPrepare monthly reports for senior executives emphasizing operational / financial performance metrics, historical results, forecasts, and trendsParticipate in monthly financial close cycle to deliver accurate financial results and provide variance explanations for key revenue and expense driversDeliver timely, accurate, and effective analyses and financial metric reportsDevelop insightful findings, provide recommendations, and help facilitate decision-making process for our business partners and senior leadership teamDrive process and policy improvements for results that restructure workload for efficiency and effectiveness  WHAT YOU NEED: 2-3 years in a financial analyst or accounting role with a solid understanding of finance and accountingPossess excellent analytical, quantitative and investigative skillsDrive to develop a deep understanding of business issues and craft well thought-out solutions Advanced skills for utilizing Excel, analyzing data and creating financial or operational models and strong skills in Word and PowerPointBachelor’s degree required NICE TO HAVE: Degree with a major in engineering or other quantitative field (math, science, finance / accounting) preferredExposure to emerging, high-growth companies in the technology or internet sectors a plusExperience with Anaplan/Workday a plus

title: Sr Technical Business and Data Analyst
description: About UsGorilla Logic provides custom application development services on the ground and in the cloud to many of the world's leading software-driven organizations. We have a rich history of applying software engineering best practices to reduce the time and cost of delivering high-quality, full-featured applications with advanced functionality. Our technical leadership in mobile, rich Internet and enterprise applications showcases our broad commitment to software development best practices and quality.The DetailsContract or full time employment - you choose! If you choose full time employment, Gorilla Logic offers amazing health benefits and 401k with matching Location: San Jose, CALong term projectWork to start immediately; Flexible for a 2 week noticePerks: Product ownership, fun environment, close-knit team, and endless opportunities within Gorilla Logic! Sr. Technical Business and Data AnalystGorilla Logic is working exclusively with a highly stable and well-respected client in San Jose, CA to maintain and enhance their custom Tax Collection System. This role will focus on fleshing out requirements related to system enhancements and support requests. The Analyst works directly with system users and super users to elicit and document business rules and requirements for development initiatives. Because much of this role centers on reporting and responding to data requests from the business stakeholders, strong data analysis, including scripting and querying skills are a must. The Analyst is also responsible for creating and managing all documentation required by development including functional specifications, agile user stories, process flow diagrams and test plans. Additionally the Analyst is expected to manage the development and QA for modules within their purview, conduct structured user acceptance testing and provide ongoing support as needed. The Analyst works closely with Systems, the team and the business. The role therefore requires a strong collaborator with excellent multi-tasking, communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to actively contribute to multiple concurrent development efforts. This is an in-the-office position and requires constant collaboration with peers and client stakeholders.ResponsibilitiesPerform requirements analysis, documentation and managementStrong data analysis skills are requiredAbility to understand complex database structure, how to navigate through it, and connecting the data to business processes in an effort to report and respond to data requests from stakeholdersProvide direct user supportDiagnose and analyze system issues; determine if issues are data or code related and resolve data issues, as appropriateManage iterative development cycles with remote and local team membersManage QA testing efforts for all new features or systems issues, including test scenario/test case development and executionCreate user guide documentation and or training guide to support new features deliveredDevelop User Acceptance Testing (UAT) documentation and test plans on behalf of the end-usersFacilitate UAT with end-users and prioritize and communicate changes back to the development teamStrong desire and ability to learn and understand at a detailed level the business processes that support the tax billing and collection processRequirementsCandidate shall have in-depth experience with custom system development and delivery.Candidate shall also have solid experience with developing use cases, process flow diagrams, user interface mockups and agile user storiesCandidate should have the ability to translate user requirements into user stories for the development team (experience with agile requirements is a plus)Preferred Technical Experience: Relational databases including Oracle and a solid ability to script/query with SQLAdditional tools in use: Experience with Rally, Jira Agile and Fitnesse a plus.Collaborative mind-set with strong analytical skills; ability to build a strong rapport with system usersExperience driving projects to completion is a plus as there is a project management component to this role - provided by Dice uat; tax collection; data analysis; agile

title: Operations Analyst
description: Our CompanySure, we are leading innovation in Enterprise Planning Management software. Yes, our product is arguably the most sophisticated one in its class. But our product alone does not make heroes of our customers. Our Customer Success Team, and our Partner Ecosystem of Anaplan delivery consultants do. And these teams can’t function successfully without the support, direction, and guidance of our high performing Operations team!This important contributor role on the Anaplan Operations team gives you a fantastic opportunity to help scale our business through strengthening and growing our global Customer Success teams. Working to ensure our team is equipped with the best enablement, tools, processes, and communications they need to work with our Customers to make them successful.The RoleAre You Strong technically at building models in Anaplan, multi-dimensional environments, or excel (at a minimum)? Highly capable in managing data sets from multiple sources? Analytically minded, and able to build the tools, and bring together the data and metrics we need to track the health and scale of our partner ecosystem? Passionate about processes? Are you cool and calm under pressure, and able to remain focused on delivering to project plans and driving results? Excited by the prospect of being a key data custodian and insights author, in a company that makes its decisions in a data-driven way? Able to translate business requirements into technical specs, and able to able to elevate the data conversation to focus on outcomes and results Able to “see around corners”, ensuring the things you design and build are ready for scale? Able to see the meaning in the numbers, and capable of translating data into insights? Passionate about collaborating across teams on projects that really make an impact to the future of Anaplan and our customers? Then this job is for you.What You'll Be DoingAs a Customer Operations Analyst, you’ll report to the Senior Manager, Customer Operations and collaborate closely with the global Customer Success, Operational Excellence Group, and Sales Operations teams to help strengthen and scale the Customer Success team.You will be part of Anaplan’s Operations team that operate globally to provide the tools, processes, best-practice collateral, and operational support that make our Customer Success team, and ultimately customers successful. Design, build, and maintain the Anaplan models that are used by internal Anaplan teams Document standard operating procedures Be the chief steward of customer and services-related data with the support of Field Operations Provide cross-functional analytical support to programs being driven by the Customer Operations team Develop, track and evangelize the metrics that are critical for achieving customer success operational excellence Develop, track and evangelize the metrics that are critical for achieving customer success operational excellence Leverage insights from the data you own, to “tell the story” to help influence outcomes Interface with the Anaplan Finance team, to help share financial insights in business terms with our field leaders Own the User Experience and adoption of the tools and dashboards you create, thinking carefully about user interfaces, and seeking feedback from the user community The responsibilities aren’t always defined. It’s critical that you have the skills, motivation and initiative to really take ownership of the Customer Operations space to help drive us forward as a company. This role requires high levels of autonomy, accountability, and integrity!Who You Are BA/BS required. MA/MBA a bonus 3+ years of experience in an analytics role (Consulting, Operations, or similar) Excellent communication and presentation skills with attention to detail A proven record of developing high performing, highly technical models (financial, operational, or other) Data-driven with a commitment to process improvement Strong reputation working with inter-disciplinary teams as being innovative, accountable, reliable, and able to thrive in a constantly changing environment Prior experience building Anaplan models is highly preferred As understanding of Salesforce and ETL tools is a plus Advanced excel and analytical experience is a must Endless curiosity and need to dive deeper for understanding Do you align with Anaplan’s Values?Collaborative: We go out of our way to help others succeedExplore all of our Values on Anaplan.com/careers#AnaplanLOVE

title: Data Scientist, Marketing
description: Data Scientist- MarketingThe Marketing Data Scientist will collaborate with Rally marketing and the leadership teams to drive useful insights and improve marketing effectiveness through KPI development, experimentation, exploratory research, day-to-day data support, and acting as a data subject matter expert in marketing domain. The data scientist will also empower the marketing team to improve and develop machine learning driven customized communications in partnership with other data scientists and engineering teams.You:Passionate about marketingHave a demonstrated track record of solving business problems with a wide variety of data science tools in a fast-paced, agile environmentAble to QA and then vouch for the integrity of our data outputGreat at translating business requirements to minimal viable data action plans with clearly defined goals and success criteriaGreat at communicating insights to non-technical colleaguesRequirements:2+ years direct work experience as a data scientist or analyst in marketingDemonstrated experience with marketing analytics skills (campaign measurement, forecast and attribution, A/B/Multivariate testing, etc.); you know when a bar chart is good enough and when it’s notStrong SQL skill. Intermediate knowledge in Python or RExperience with email campaign operations is strongly preferredUnderstand web analytics best practices. Proficient in at least one web analytics tool, e.g. Google AnalyticsNice to Have:Proficient in TableauExperience with Salesforce and ExactTargetExperience using machine learning techniques to solve business problemsExperience in big data environment, like Hadoop or SparkAdvanced degrees in marketing or a quantitative fieldHealthcare or wellness specific business knowledgeRally Health is committed to ensuring that its workforce reflects America’s diverse population. Rally Health knows that such diversity will enrich us with the talent, energy, perspective and inspiration it needs to achieve its mission. It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote individuals in all job titles, and administer all programs, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, sex, age, marital status, pregnancy, child birth or related medical conditions, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, genetic information, disability, matriculation, political affiliation, veteran status, union affiliation, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

title: Data Engineer
description: The PurposeThe Data Engineer will be part of the Machine Intelligence & Analytics Group, within the Software Engineering department. This team works closely with all other teams to develop, deliver and maintain data driven products and backend analytics platforms for the discovery, interpretation, communication, and exploitation of meaningful patterns in data. In addition, this team will develop and maintain an analytics pipeline for acquisition, storage, and processing data types of interest to feed real-time artificial intelligent system behaviors. The Analytics team will architect data systems supporting machine learning applications, develop custom toolchains for analysis and exploration, and work with DevOps and IT to host and scale intelligent applications.Ultimately, we will design reliable, scalable, real-time (or near-real time) applications that make Virgin Hyperloop One a reality. We are seeking candidates with various levels of experience to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals at our Los Angeles facility.The Role Architect and implement data pipelines (ingestion, batch simulation infrastructure, real-time insights). Perform ETL operations on large datasets from many complex, heterogeneous data sources. Develop or implement tools to support analyst-driven machine learning analyses. Work closely with Algorithms team to prototype AI/ML proof of concepts. Participate in design/code reviews to ensure compatibility with architecture. Deploy monitoring solutions to detect and resolve problems in real-time. Build reporting functionality on results of pipeline analysis and monitoring. Maintain quality and accessibility of data products. Champion processes and procedures across the organization. Develop or modify existing machine learning tools and libraries as needed. Develop visualizations of key parameters and relationships to provide insight into data. Enhance, scale, and deploy real-time analytics capabilities, models, and visualizations within production environment on production compute architecture. Collaborate in a fast-changing environment and communicate clearly and effectively with colleagues who range from data scientists, developers, DevOps, hardware engineers, and product managers. Candidate Profile Strong written and oral communication skills.Strong interpersonal skills.Ability to conduct research into issues and products as required.Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language and visuals.Highly self-motivated and directed.Keen attention to detail.Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Customer-focused mindset, prioritizing developer productivity and application uptime. Ability to provide solutions to a variety of technical problems of increasing scope and complexity. Can identify potential bottlenecks and design systems appropriately. Ability to setup data pipelines from scratch. Ability with back-end data platforms and services. Minimum Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a highly quantitative discipline. Minimum 1-3 years experience working as a Data Engineer. Strong knowledge in software engineering principles. Hands on experience and expertise with cloud computing services (AWS, Azure, etc.) Working knowledge of distributed computing architectures and databases. Working knowledge in manipulating large datasets. Strong programming ability with Python, Go and web technologies. Agile, fast prototyping skills, including feature integration during all cycles of development. Working proficiency and excellent communication skills in verbal and written English. Preferred Experience MS Degree in Computer Science or equivalent field. Ability with the following programming languages: Scala, R Experience with the following software packages: Tableau, TensorFlow, SQLAlchemy, Flask, PostgreSQL, NoSQL, Apache products (Airflow, Spark, Hadoop, Hive, etc.) Familiarity with DevOps and CI pipelines. Experience with visualization tools: Seaborn, Bokeh, D3.js Experience working with front-end frameworks (Angular, React, etc.). Domain expertise and knowledge of transportation, logistics, and autonomous systems. Successfully delivered and maintained a major cloud service with a large numbers of end users. Hyperloop One is an Equal Employment Employer; employment is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other protected status. Hyperloop One will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with the “Ban the Box” legislation. We may access publicly available information as part of your application. For full information on how your personal information will be stored and processed, please click here.To all recruitment agencies: Virgin Hyperloop One does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Virgin Hyperloop One employees or any other company location. Virgin Hyperloop One is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Marketing Analyst II
description: DescriptionPosition at Ingram MicroIngram Micro helps businesses fully realize the promise of technology.TM No other company delivers the full spectrum of global technology and supply chain services to businesses around the world. Ingram Micro’s global infrastructure and deep expertise in technology solutions, supply chain, cloud and mobility enable its business partners to operate efficiently and successfully in the markets they serve. Combined with distinct market insights and the trust and dependability generated from decades of strong partner relationships, Ingram Micro stands apart as the global technology services provider for the future.As a Marketing Analyst II, you will provide financial and business information, analysis, and insight to the company’s leadership team around Marketing initiatives. You will be a member of a high-impact, fast paced, ROI team driven to show marketing results. We’re looking for an ambitious, focused professional who is comfortable with change and can provide great story-telling through data.The Marketing Analyst II is responsible for developing and analyzing data models that generate knowledge into the project owner’s business objectives. He or she will utilize reports of findings and create appropriate materials to communicate the findings. They will maintain a broad understanding of Ingram Micro’s business model along with becoming educated on vendors, customers, or internal division’s business models and needs. They must understand client’s objectives and translate business needs into the appropriate technical data models. Expertise to prepare data models and review output to ensure model accuracy, along with translating the trends and applying to business demands. They must have the ability to data-mine and aggregate data from multiple sources and provide a cohesive report back to associates and people managers. He or she must have strong business acumen and be able to work on most projects independently and lead projects with guidance from management. Effectively listen, communicate, recommend, and present data analytic solutions to internal and external clients, including over the phone meetings, in person presentations with PowerPoint, and other media sources.Requirements: Master’s degree in quantitative discipline (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or Econometrics) and 2 years of experience OR Bachelor’s degree in quantitative field with 5-10 years relevant experience. Experience in analysis of large data sets, identifying trends and patterns. Experience with Modeling Techniques (linear regression, logistic regression, decision tree), Query Languages (SQL, Python), Automation (SQL Stored Procedures, SSIS, APIs), Reporting (Excel, .Net, MicroStrategy), prior management of a project in which a relational database was built and utilized for analysis, Google Analytics, and Data Mining experienceIngram Micro Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable law.

title: Strategy and Innovation Associate
description: Strategy and Innovation AssociateEquinix (Nasdaq: EQIX, Market Cap: ~$35BN) is a rapidly growing, global cloud and interconnection platform and the world’s largest data center provider. With more than 145+ data centers on five continents and over $4 billion in annual revenue, Equinix is helping to shape the future of cloud computing and enterprise connectivity as one of the Fastest Growing Technology Companies in America (Forbes).Strategy And Innovation TeamThe Strategy and Innovation team plays a vital role in setting the direction for the company’s worldwide growth. As a member of the team, you will support corporate strategy development and innovation initiatives, forging relationships that enable Equinix to anticipate the future needs of customers and partners and develop game-changing services and solutions to meet them. You will work within a small direct team, but across a large, cross-functional organization, dedicated to driving corporate strategic planning and codifying Equinix’s strategic growth and innovation roadmap, leveraging data and market insights to inform critical investment decisions.As a member of the team, you will work collaboratively across functions on a wide variety of projects, including new market and technology assessments, growth opportunity evaluations, product innovation and strategy, and strategic rationale development and synergy analysis for technology M&A opportunities. The Strategy and Innovation Analyst will have opportunities to interact with senior leaders across various internal functions, working with minimal oversight to execute on projects that have significant scope and impact on our business. With an air of humility, you will also bring strong quantitative skills, strategic thinking and sound business judgment to help inform and influence major business decisions by Equinix’s executive team.ResponsibilitiesConduct deep analysis, manage complex data, demonstrate quantitative and analytical rigor, apply problem-solving and conceptual thinking skillsManage various projects and/or workstreams across a wide range of corporate strategy and innovation initiatives with minimal supervisionManage secondary research efforts utilizing tools and databases such as Gartner, IDC, 451 Group, CapitalIQ, ThomsonOne, etc.Perform detailed due diligence of potential strategic growth and investment opportunities by assessing the industry, financials, and operationsDevelop and apply appropriate methodologies for market segmentation and sizing, market trend and competitive landscape analysis, business modeling, financial modeling, and operations analysisSynthesize results of quantitative and qualitative research and analysis into implications, key trends and/or recommendationsDevelop storyboarding and content for executive level presentations and reports to communicate and achieve buy-in for strategic recommendationsQualificationsRecent graduate or experienced analyst with experience in corporate development, corporate strategy, strategy / management consulting, venture capital, private equity, or investment bankingPrior experience working with Fortune 500 internal strategy group, strategy / management consulting, or similar professional services, multi-functional environment a plusGeneral understanding of financial valuation methodologies and accountingAble to think critically, but also execute on the details; outstanding analytical, research and presentation skillsAbility to work well under pressure and act in utmost confidentiality with sensitive informationSuperior analytical (strategy and financial), project management, time management, and technical (i.e., PowerPoint, Excel) skillsAble to manage several projects simultaneously and autonomously, as well as prioritize as necessaryAble to synthesize results of quantitative and qualitative research and analysis into implications, key trends, and/or recommendationsSuperior written and verbal communication skills including developing presentations for executive audiences to communicate and achieve buy-in for strategic recommendationsExtremely strong interpersonal and team building skills. Able to foster a cohesive and effective work environmentHigh degree of self-confidence, poise, maturity, discretion, diplomacy and empathyEOE/M/F/Vet/Disability

title: Sr Professional, Data Analyst
description: Job DutiesThis position will supports business decisions through the development and delivery of value-added data and analytics. This requires the understanding of critical business issues and relevant actionable items, from a data perspective. This position supports various business units at all levels in sales operations, including executive management. This involves gathering requirements, drawing insights from data, preparing executive presentations, identifying inefficiencies and ensuring the data within the solutions is accurate. Provides reports to executives and sales operations department leaders that support business decision making, which involves:Provide Executive Management with visibility and insights into sales and sales operationsAbility to research, analyze and interrogate business processes in order to create KPI’s and dashboards that will identify operational bottlenecks and inefficienciesDrive standardization and consolidation of business operations functions through insights and analyticsMake recommendations to Executive Management on how to solve for inefficienciesCreate presentations for Executive Council and Board meetings with data insights and analyticsReport development – collaborates with end users to understand business requirements; develops analysis to map to existing data assets and develops a plan for report fulfillment through the use of automation where possible. Maintains reporting through product and platform changes.Provides accurate, insightful reporting – specifically reports on pipeline, operational productivity trends and product utilization trends.Ensures that the content is reflective of the business and operational direction of the companyHighly engaged to deliver reports on schedule and on timeProvides oversight of information to troubleshoot reporting issues and unusual trendsPerforms ad hoc analysis as requested and generates business insights using a wide variety of data sources and BI toolsBuilds and maintains relationships with users to ensure adoption and buy-in of reporting solutions.Supports change management

title: Data Scientist
description: Job Title: Data Science AnalystEstimated Length: 1 year with possible extension to 2 years. Pay: $55/hr. - $60/hr.Location: Mountain View, CA Job Description: The “World’s Largest Search Engine” is looking for a Data Science Analyst with distinctive analytical and problem-solving skills to develop a deep understanding of our process improvement. This role will collaborate with team members responsible for analyzing operation performance, uncovering cost, quality and scalability which leads planning to improve customer experience and reduce cost.Qualifications:Advanced experience with:● Database query, SQL● Spreadsheets (Google/Excel) and analysis experience● Data analytical skills combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate and influence effectively by presenting data in a compelling way● Incredibly strong skills to conceptualize experience within database relationships using diagrams and explain how databases interact with one another● Excellent cross-functional leadership; able to work independently, part of a team and interact professionally with the influence of all organizations● Preferred background in Python Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled  How to apply: Candidates that are interested in this great opportunity with Adecco should apply immediately.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: We are in search of a detail-oriented Senior Data Analyst to join our Analytics & Data Science team. If obscure Excel functions permeate your dreams, or you view your life as a series of complex joins, then this might be the role for you. You will be responsible for supporting our various product and business teams in making better decisions. Essential duties and responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: Work with product and business owners to define actionable reporting and visualization requirementsImplement and scale the tools, systems and processes for delivering data and insights to the relevant stakeholdersChallenge assumptions and push teams towards the right questions to ask, and then deliver the right answersTake the initiative to find patterns and propose experiments against core product and business goals QualificationsThe confidence to make quick decisions and the courage to fail forward in doing soAt least 4 years of experience as a product or data analyst. Experience with both consumer and advertising technologies is a big plusThe ability to teach a masterclass in query writing and data visualization, with an emphasis on choosing the best approach and tools for the jobExperience writing complex queries on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is a big plusComfort working in scripting languages such as Python and RStrong understanding of hypothesis testing and experiment designComfort dealing with an environment of organized chaos and quick, reversible decisionsA Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics (quantitative) or equivalentStories to tell of the impact you have had on other products and businesses in your career

title: Market Research Analyst
description: Kantar Millward Brown Digital, is seeking a Client Analyst for our Advertiser team, where you will be responsible for executing research projects for existing advertiser and agency client accounts. As a Client Analyst, you will design questionnaires, pull data, write reports, and understand how to tell a story from data. The Client Analyst role will tap into a variety of skillsets, including: strengthening your analytic approach, presentation skills, digital media fluency and project management. Our teams work with some of the top brands, publishers, and digital agencies and we are looking for someone who can help contribute to our continued success and rapid growth.     KEY OUTCOMES                                                                                       Communicate effectively: Utilize effective communication skills in-person, over the phone and via email with internal and external clients. Develop an approach/system for communicating key project considerations (i.e. recruitment concerns, technical issues) with team members Help grow client relationships: Build and strengthen client relationships by supporting accounts with excellent client service and listening to/anticipating their needsCreate and deliver actionable insights: With training and coaching, design survey drafts, analyze results, and write research reports that help inform client strategy while increasing competency with our interface and normative tools.Execute research: become responsible for any and all necessary aspects of research execution. Contributions include but are not limited to media plan review, working with Ad Operations and submitting report requests Manage projects: With supervision and coaching, you will be responsible for playing an integral role in overall project quality by the continuous monitoring of sample/data and creative activity while providing QA support for surveys and reports Hone your presentation skills: Practice and refine presentation skills through internal initiatives with team-members; move to client presentations when ready     CAPABILITIES  1 year of market research experienceBachelor’s degree (Psychology, Economics or Social Sciences preferred)Understanding of online advertising technology and brandingKnowledge of statistical software (SPSS, SAS etc.) a plusTrack record of managing multiple projects and meeting deadlinesStrong analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to tell a story from the dataExcellent written communication skillsThe ability to build and maintain internal and external relationshipsJOIN US At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: Loot Crate was founded in 2012 around a simple idea: put the awesomeness of Comic-Con in a box. Today, we ship the coolest geek, gaming, and pop-culture collectibles and accessories to a global subscriber base making us one of the top subscription box services in the world. We have assembled an amazing team of passionate, ambitious, impossibly nerdy people who cultivate products and experiences for our amazing fan community and provide the highest caliber of customer support. We are always on the lookout for fun, hard-working new people to join our team and make Loot Crate even better.Loot Crate is seeking a Marketing Analyst whose primary responsibility is supporting the Loot Crate Marketing teams as a strategic partner to monitor and optimize advertising data. The Marketing Analyst will take the lead in the discovery of best practices to optimize our digital marketing platforms and contribute in-depth analyses to help refine our communications to new and existing Loot Crate consumers. This position will work out of our office in Los Angeles, California.Key ResponsibilitiesDeliver insights, analytics, and reports on a recurring and ad hoc basis to support improving marketing performance and drive decisions that increase marketing and business objectives.Marketing AnalyticsCore Responsibilities Identify Loot Crate’s core marketing objectives and challenges and advise on measurement strategies Create, analyze and interpret data reports from multiple sources (SQL, Tableau, etc.) to highlight sales patterns and trends to track performance against revenue and subscriber
