title: Director, Product Marketing, Data Warehousing and Analytics
description: Job DescriptionAt Cloudera we passionately believe that with data we can make what is impossible today, possible tomorrow. We are building the modern platform for data warehousing, analytics, and machine learning optimized for the cloud to help our customers solve some of the world’s greatest challenges with data.Cloudera is looking for an exceptionally talented product marketer to lead marketing strategy and execution for our new Data Warehousing and Analytics business group. Spanning popular products like Impala, Hue, Hive, Workload Management, and Solr running on highly scalable storage systems like HDFS/S3/ADLS/Kudu, this role offers the opportunity to impact not only the future of Cloudera, but entire industries.You will be responsible for crafting Cloudera’s vision for customers, press, and analysts, arming sales with winning collateral, and creating systems to measure your product and market performance. You will synthesize market, product, and customer engagement data into compelling content, and partner with sales and marketing to promote Cloudera’s value across multiple channels. As part of the rapidly growing Data Warehousing and Analytics team, you will serve as an internal and external expert on customer’s journey towards Modern Data Warehousing, and work directly with customers and field teams to grow the business.You will possess a business and technical background that enables you to communicate advanced capabilities to audiences ranging from students to engineers to executives. The ideal candidate will have experience with Data Warehousing and Analytics platform products, as well as Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Integration (ETL) tools and practices.At Cloudera we get to work everyday with world-class customers, partners, technical field experts, business analysts, and software engineers to define and advocate for the future of Data Warehousing and Analytics in the enterprise. We value thoughtfulness, a love of learning new things, creativity, diverse perspectives, and a sense of humor.ResponsibilitiesInbound and outbound marketing - Create powerful messaging and collateral that highlights our product differentiation and market leadership to audiences ranging from developers to executives. Support demand generation initiatives and programs, including webinars, tradeshows, and events. Market development - Promote Cloudera’s product vision to press, analysts, and the wider big data ecosystem to create a strong tailwind for Sales. Work with product management team to create product demos and other technical sales tools. Deliver presentations to prospects, customer groups, analyst sessions, events, etc. Sales enablement - Serve as a central resource for the sales team in educating customers on the unique benefits of Cloudera. Manage Cloudera’s repository of Data Warehousing and Analytics assets and continuously share knowledge with all parts of the company. Develop internal and external facing content to help build strong sales pipeline and drive customer adoption and revenue growth. Market intelligence - Define and quantify the addressable market for Data Warehousing and Analytics and create metrics to track our progress. Conduct product and industry-based competitive analysis for your area. Community enablement - Create a scalable process to capture, organize, and update content created throughout the company and community (blog posts, demos, scripts, etc.) for efficient reuse. Whatever else is needed to help sell Cloudera products, delight our customers, support our field teams, and help the company grow. Skills And Qualifications At least 5 years of prior B2B software product marketing experience, or other business oriented / customer facing technical role supporting enterprise products. You should have experience taking innovative products to market and nurturing their continued success.Superlative written, verbal, and visual communication skills. Must be able to translate and simplify the technical details of our product suite into compelling benefits for potential buyer and user personas. Attention to details is a must.Working knowledge of various technologies, specifically Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, Data Integration, Cloud (PaaS and/or IaaS), and Big Data platform ecosystems.Relentless focus on making data-driven decisions while being a natural strategic thinker.Based in either San Francisco or Palo Alto, California.Able to travel as required. Personal CharacteristicsCurious - Approaches problems with an open mind Collegial - Partners well with peers in other functions Compelling - Able to get teams to organize and fly in formation Driven - Does whatever is needed to accomplish the mission without being told Empathic - Understands diverse stakeholder perspectives and what will help them Generous - Takes pleasure in the success of team members, shining in reflected light Judicious - Constantly assesses the top priorities for the product and for their own time Persistent - Can visualize what a win looks like and won’t accept anything less Poised - Earns respect with executive audiences that may include Cloudera customers, investors, partners, or employees Rigorous - Structured, framework-driven decision making that is clear and easy to follow

title: Data Analyst
description: Clear skin can be life-changing, but it's not easy to see a dermatologist. At Curology, we provide prescription medications custom-formulated for each patient's skin and shipped directly to their door. We tailor the entire Curology experience specifically for patients with acne and anti-aging concerns, allowing us to provide incredibly personalized, effective and affordable care at scale.We’re looking for an experienced and highly motivated data analyst who can identify actionable insights that drive business strategy. As the first member of the analytics team, you'll own data analytics and shape the evolution of the team. Potential projects include A/B testing, customer acquisition/retention optimization, survey design and analysis, and development of key operational metrics. The role requires someone who is highly proficient in SQL, approaches problems in a structured manner, and is comfortable with ambiguity.You will report to the VP of Strategy and Operations.What you'll do Collaborate with operations, marketing, engineering, medical, and fulfillment teams to identify opportunity areas, translate them into structured analyses, and generate actionable insightsBuild intuitive dashboards to empower other team members with actionable dataDesign A/B tests and analyze results to inform strategic decision makingMake conclusions from your analysis, present your results, and advocate for proposed next steps to key decision makersBe the go-to expert on SQL and data visualization toolsConstantly look for improvements in tools, data sources, data quality, and analytic techniques What we're looking for Passion for what we do!3-5 years of work experience in a role that required quantitative analysis, synthesizing insights, and using data to support strategic decisionsExpertise in SQL and understanding of statistics; experience with data visualization tools is a plusAnalytical mindset, with the ability to focus on a problem, ask insightful questions, and gain expertise quicklyAbility to effectively partner, collaborate, and communicate with technical and non-technical colleagues in various business functions at all levelsAbility to work independently in an unstructured environmentWillingness to do whatever is needed: we are a lean teamExperience with Python or R are a plusExperience at a high-growth startup is a plus Must be eligible to work in the U.S.

title: Senior Analyst
description: Senior Analyst for Capital AccessLocation: Santa Monica, CA Department: Center for Regional Economics The Milken Institute is looking for a Senior Analyst to join our Center for Regional Economics’ Strategic Initiatives team. The ideal candidate will have a background in microeconomics and knowledge of policies and programs related to regional capital access and small business economic development, as well as experience with data analysis and project management. This role will report to the Director of Strategic Initiatives. In addition to capital access projects, this role also will support the broader Center for Regional Economics team and Milken Institute staff at large to support Center and Institute-wide programming and events such as the annual Milken Institute Global Conference. The Senior Analyst role will provide an outstanding opportunity to hone one’s skills and contribute to reports and materials that will be considered by state and federal policymakers, business leaders, and other high-profile influencers.Responsibilities: Track and identify local and statewide policy trends and programs related to small business and capital access including historically underserved populations and markets, small business financing, and financial services regulation and legislation Research and analyze relevant qualitative and quantitative data and information (e.g., BLS, census, financial data) Write policy briefs, white papers, and reports for internal and external audiences Prepare presentations including basic data visualizations Manage projects Ad hoc support for broader Strategic Initiatives team, Center for Regional Economics, and Milken Institute events and programmingCandidates should possess the following characteristics: Master’s degree plus 3-5 years relevant work experience in related field Strong understanding of microeconomic concepts and applications Project management experience Articulate and concise writer Advanced Microsoft Excel a must. Some proficiency with with EViews or similar statistical, forecasting, and modeling software (e.g., SPSS, STATA) a plus. Proactive with a flexible attitude Note: The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer. Please submit a cover letter and resume - all applications materials should be attached as PDF files. Any application that does not include both a cover letter and a resume saved as PDFs will be rejected.

title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst
description: Job DescriptionVCA Inc. is seeking a Data Scientist/Data Analyst to join the IT Engineering team at our Support Office in West Los Angeles, California.About The CompanyVCA Inc. owns, operates and manages the largest network of freestanding veterinary hospitals and veterinary clinical reference laboratories in North America, with over 800 hospitals located in 43 U.S. states and 5 Canadian provinces and more than 55 clinical laboratories. VCA is also a leading supplier of diagnostic imaging equipment to the veterinary industry, as well as operating a franchisor of premier dog daycare facilities. www.VCA.comJob DescriptionVCA IT Department seeks an experienced data analyst with expertise in data management, statistical analysis and computer science and work closely with veterinarians of the organizations to manage, integrate and analyze health data. As a data analyst, you will work in a highly collaborative fashion as a core member of the BI Team to prioritize data collection, transformation, and advanced data analysis techniques. You will help define and measure key metrics, promote new analytical techniques, question assumptions, and tell the story behind the numbers. You will develop a deep understanding of our data, tools, and processes.ResponsibilitiesThis position is responsible for the analysis of health information, obtained from various sources, including clinical, financial and demographic data. It requires careful preparation, integration, analysis for the purpose of promoting information sharing and growing a foundational data science research effort with applications to pet health care. Perform complex data analysis in support of ad-hoc and standing user requests. Develop programs, methodologies, and data sets for analyzing and presenting data. Research new data sources and analytical tools; contribute to new application development and data quality improvement efforts. Use and support database applications and analytical tools: evaluate data quality, applications and functions, produce output, maintain operation and resolve data access and interface issues. Performs evaluation and analysis of data using standard statistical; prepares reports documenting results of findings and recommendations may participate in formal or informal presentation of research findings. Qualifications Experience with large scale data warehouse solutions and query languages like SQL. Experience in supporting BI/EDW Architecture, building data pipelines, and cloud platforms like Azure/AWS.Strong statistical knowledge and proficiency with a statistical analysis tool such as R preferred. Fluency in high-level programming languages such as Python preferred Fluency in one or more object oriented languages like C#, C++, Java preferred Proven experience writing queries regularly and using Power BI, SSIS and SSRS experience a plus. Pet health or human health experience preferred. Knowledge of or experience working with Azure ML and building and deploying predictive models 5+ years relevant experience as a data analyst with a proven track record on advanced analytics projects. MS/BS degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, CS, Econometrics or related field preferred. Physical Requirements And Working ConditionsMust possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer, stamina to maintain attention to detail despite interruptions, strength to lift and carry objects weighing up to 40 pounds; vision to read printed materials and a computer screen; and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone.If interested in this opportunity, please click the “Apply” link below.If you think this would be an ideal opportunity for someone you know, click “Share.”

title: Sr. Media Campaign Analyst
description: What part will you play?Warner Bros. engages with hundreds of millions of consumers around the world on web, mobile, television and movie screens. The Warner Bros. Consumer Intelligence team aggregates, analyzes, and activates data generated by these platforms to execute digital advertising strategies for Warner Bros. divisions.The Sr Media Campaign Analyst will be responsible for the day-to-day campaign reporting operations, including analyzing online and offline marketing data streams, defining reporting requirements, and developing reports and dashboards.You will support Media & Marketing teams to extract insights for campaign optimization and identify learnings to apply on future campaigns. Provide insights to optimize campaign performance and identify learnings for future campaigns.Stay current on digital media measurement tools, best practices and research with an emphasis on measurement issues such as attribution, data collection, and targeting.Work with internal Media & Marketing teams, Agencies, and internal Data Warehousing teams along the campaign reporting process.What do we require from you?Bachelor’s degree (B.A. or B.S.) required.Minimum of 2-3 years experience in campaign reporting or digital analytics.Knowledge of Adtech, Martech, and Social Platforms.Experience with marketing and/or ad operations.Deep knowledge of reporting/analytics process.Prior experience using BI/Visualization tools.Experience in consolidating and reconciling data across different systems.Familiarity with databases and segmentation.Ability to analyze and present campaign results effectively to media, marketing, and ad tech teams.Strong communications skills.Excellent ability to organize, multi-task, prioritize and schedule a high workload.To be results driven with an excellent attention to detail.SQL Query knowledge.Datorama and/or Tableau experience.

This is a great role for someone who thinks strategically, executes tactically, pays attention to details, and wants to flex their creative muscles (copy, visual layout, etc).What You'll DoHelp solve one of the company’s hardest and most critical challenges: Dasher acquisition, engagement, and retentionWork with large data sets to develop strategic, analysis-driven recommendations.Contribute to cross functional initiatives with product and brand teams to test and optimize innovative solutions to maximize channel impact.Collaborate with local teams to support market launches and Merchant promotions.Generate weekly and monthly reports to track campaign and channel results across all markets.Qualifications1-3 years of experience in management consulting and/or performance marketingStrong analytical skills: ability to manipulate data and use metrics to drive business resultsEffectively communicate objectives, strategy, and performance results across cross-functional teamsSelf-motivated, comfortable working independentlyNice to havesExperience working with paid acquisition channels such as Facebook, Instagram, job boards etc.Experience with SQLExperience in high-growth or early-stage startupsAbout UsFounded in 2013, DoorDash is a San Francisco-based technology company passionate about transforming local businesses and dedicated to enabling new ways of working, earning, and living. Today, DoorDash connects customers with their favorite local and national restaurants in more than 600 cities across the United States and Canada. By building intelligent, last-mile delivery technology for local cities, DoorDash aims to connect people with the things they care about — one dash at a time.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: Job DescriptionOVERVIEW OF THE COMPANYFox Digital Consumer Group Digital Marketing and CRM OperationsJob Description: Marketing Data AnalystFox Digital Consumer Group is looking for a Marketing Data Analyst with strong expertise and a passion for understanding marketing applications and uses for data, and managing data requirements against those applications. Includes sizing.Develop and manage scorecards on data quality and delivery.Ensure Marketing data documentation is up to date and accurate.Qualifications3-5 years of experience as a data analyst, preferably with an entertainment or digital media company working in Marketing, Product, or Technical/IT teams3+ years working with marketing campaign management tools - SAS, SFMC (Exact Target)Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills with ability to interpret and summarize complex data that drive actionable plans that add value to the businessExpert in MS Excel3-5 years of professional experience using advanced SQLPrior experience working in an Agile development model for data development and delivery2-3 years of experience with BI tools such as Looker, Tableau or AWS QuickSightDisciplined, analytical but creative thinker and problem solverStrong attention to detail, strong ability to complete work under pressure on tight deadlines, logical thinking, curious, self-motivatedSuperior verbal and written communication skills at all levels of an organization with the ability to present complex data, influence others and build relationships.Positive attitude and ability to operate in a fast-paced environmentWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Data and Research Analyst
description: DescriptionThe Rabobank, N.A. Data and Research Analyst is dedicated to research, knowledge of data structures, data mining and statistical modeling, benchmarking, and the ability to synthesize data and translate insights into clear, action-oriented recommendations that drive improvements in business processes.RequirementsResponsibilities will include and are not limited to the following: Understands data models, reads data dictionaries, and creates Structured Query Language (SQL) queries. Creates and designs new reports, dashboards, and measurement methods as needed. Compiles, analyzes and disseminates data via dashboards/scorecards and ad-hoc reports. Analyzes data with standard statistical methods, interpreting the results, and providing written summaries of the data analysis. Utilizes internal and external data sources to provide both relative and relevant information, including, but not limited to, benchmarking, competitive analysis, and trend analysis. Utilizes Lean Six Sigma, or similar, methodology and tools to identify improvement opportunities and measure the impact of their implementation. Prepares and delivers presentations that represent the data, the insights provided by the data, and the recommended actions and/or solutions. Resolves business, process and/or data issues with a data-driven, "roll up your sleeves" approach. Works proactively and cooperatively with business partners to pursue additional efficiency gains, enhancements, or modifications to overall data structure, processes and/or technology. Converts data-driven insights and helps manage change to incorporate data-driven insights in decision making process and deliver measurable results to the business. Performs all other job duties as assigned by supervisor.Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Communications, Statistics, Business Administration, Economics, or related scientific discipline or equivalent combination or education and experience. Proficiency with MS Office Suite. Advanced MS Excel, Access, and/or statistical modeling tools required. Familiarity with data models, data dictionaries, and relational databases. Intermediate to Advanced SQL. Demonstrated knowledge of Scientific Method, data presentation and the ability to communicate the story and create a call to action. Demonstrate teamwork in facilitating workflow. Must be able to travel throughout bank's footprint to perform required duties (less than 25%). Banking and lending experience preferred. Two + years of work experience in analytics, data management, or equivalent preferred.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Senior Data Analytics Engineer/SAS Developer

ResponsibilitiesThe Senior Data Analytics Engineer/SAS Developer will work with the Regulatory Affairs department to deliver analytical models to support rate case filings. The resource must have programming experience with statistical analysis and modeling projects. The resource must be comfortable interacting and communicating with both Business and IT project team members and needs to be a self-starter. The Data Analytics Engineer/SAS Developer must have expertise in mathematics and applied statistics with programming skills to create predictive models and tools on large scale data sets (in tens of TB) and operationalize the models on Big data clusters on AWSQualificationsData analysis: excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Have proactive and strategic thinking and ability to align research with the business and innovate research output.Modeling concepts: Machine Learning, Time series analysis, Clustering, Generalized Linear and Additive Models, Nonlinear Regression, Classification, Neural Networks, Decision trees, Text mining, OCRComputer Programming: excellent programming skill for complex algorithms. Must have good SQL skills.Other programming languages: SAS, R, Python, CAnalytical Tools: SAS, SQL (Netezza, SQL Server, Teradata), R, Excel, Python, Spark, HadoopUtility Or Regulated Industry Experience (preferred) provided by Dice SAS, SQL, Statistical Analysis, Modeling concept

title: Sr. Healthcare Business Intelligence Analyst
description: The Sr. Business Intelligence analyst designs, develops, implements and supports a wide range of reporting and analysis needs including the accurate presentation of information for internal staff and EXCEL MSO business partners in support of EXCEL MSO’s objectives, initiatives, and regulatory compliance. Maintain and automate existing reports and develop new reports to support organizational business needs including utilization management and claims processing. Utilize data analysis techniques and queries to support internal business functions through the generation of reports. Review reporting processes and recommend new or improved solutions that increase efficiency and accuracy and implement those solutions. Assess and troubleshoot production issues related to reports and data integrity of the information presented on reports. Identify, recommend, and implement reporting solutions. Collaborate with Business Systems technical team members and business users through the project life cycle to gather and understand requirements, determine best solutions, test solutions and demonstrate functionality to end users. Actively participate in design reviews and provide input to other Business Systems team members to ensure quality reporting solutions are developed, working with Executive Leadership, Business Systems Management, and business unit staff. Create technical requirements for reports based on review and analysis of requirement specifications supplied by business users, regulatory agencies, and EXCEL MSO business partners. Provide analysis and recommendations on business process improvements aimed at increasing the data quality of information reported upon.RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent experience, training or coursework.Minimum two years of experience in a report development or data analyst role. Minimum one year of experience with SQL programming, MS SQL database development, and T-SQL query generation. (R) 3+ years desired.Minimum one year of experience with MS SQL Business Intelligence tools (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS) or other enterprise business intelligence software.Minimum one year of experience with report writing software such as Tableau, Crystal Reports, or similar productsMinimum one year of experience with healthcare management information systems.Experience with the design and development of EDI solutions that meet HIPAA X12 standards.Knowledge of database concepts and data processes in order to understand, develop, analyze and support various new projects and make recommendations for improvements to existing processes.Ability to create and follow technical specificationsAbility to develop end-user documentation.Working knowledge of and the ability to efficiently operate all applicable computer software including computer applications such as Outlook, Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and Visio.Excellent communication skills including the ability to express oneself clearly and concisely when providing service to EXCEL MSO internal departments and outside entities over the telephone, in person or in writing.Ability to think and work effectively under pressure and accurately prioritize and complete tasks within established timeframes.One year of healthcare or financial services experience required. Interest in healthcare; specifically claims and utilization management.Ability to assume responsibility and exercise good judgment when making decisions within the scope of the position.Ability to maintain confidentiality.Ability to comply with EXCEL MSO’s policies and procedures.Ability to perform the job safely with respect to others, to property, and to individual safety.PMG / EXCEL provides comprehensive health care management services with a personalized approach to meet each clients needs. EXCEL combines advanced technological solutions with a sophisticated level of healthcare expertise to provide effective management and solutions to a rapidly changing health care environment. EXCEL has been operating as an independent health care management company since 2001, although originally rooted during 1980 as an institutional management arm.

title: Statistical Analyst, Data Analytics
description: Position DescriptionPosition: Statistical Analyst, Data AnalyticsJob Location: 2102 SE Simple Savings Drive, Bentonville, AR 72716Duties: Analyzes data to drive analytics projects by serving as a technical lead for analytics projects; gathering data from internal and external sources; synthesizing data into analytics datasets to support project goals; developing statistical models and computational algorithms to analyze and describe the data and its characteristics; coding, testing, and maintaining analytical software tools; identifying trends and patterns in data; identifying discrepancies in data based on project goals; and providing reports and data insights to support overall project deliverables. Participates in multiple analytics project teams by working with project teams and business partners to determine project goals and objectives; gathering and synthesizing data; developing reports as needed; utilizing business knowledge to ensure data supports project goals; analyzing data based on identified variables; reviewing data results with team members to ensure accuracy; and communicating results and insights to the project team and business partners. Presents data insights to key stakeholders by developing insights based on data analysis; applying analytical results to project goals; identifying trends and key insights; translating results into business actions; and presenting results and insights to key stakeholders.Minimum QualificationsMinimum education and experience required: Master’s degree or the equivalent in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field plus 1 year of experience in an analytics related field; OR Bachelor's degree or the equivalent in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field plus 3 years of experience in an analytics related field; OR 5 years of experience in an analytics related field.Skills required: Must have experience with: SQL; database platforms such as Teradata, DB2, SQL Server, Oracle DB; statistical modeling software such as SAS, R; Tableau; statistical modeling techniques multivariate regression and hypothesis testing; machine learning algorithms including classification, regression, clustering, and dimensionality reduction. Employer will accept any amount of experience with the required skills.Company SummaryAdditional Preferred QualificationsWhat started small, with a single discount store and the simple idea of selling more for less, has grown over the last 50 years into the largest retailer in the world. Each week, over 260 million customers and members visit our 11,695 stores under 59 banners in 28 countries and e-commerce websites in 11 countries. With fiscal year 2017 revenue of $485.9 billion, Walmart employs approximately 2.3 million associates worldwide. Walmart continues to be a leader in sustainability, corporate philanthropy and employment opportunity. It's all part of our unwavering commitment to creating opportunities and bringing value to customers and communities around the world.

Ability to write SQL queries recommended.Expert level knowledge of Google Analytics and TableauWorking knowledge of paid social media platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, LinkedIn and Twitter.Experience working with a multi- touch attribution platform a plus (i.e. Visual IQ, Marketshare) preferred.Knowledge of cross device, identity linking technologies and/or people based marketing (i.e. LiveRamp) a plus.A strong understanding of media buying models (i.e. CPA, CPC, CPM)Proactively can prioritize daily work efficiently with limited supervision.Strong verbal and communication skills that can work well within a cross functional team and a fast paced environment.

title: Sr. Data Analyst, Growth and Operations
description: 80% of small businesses fail in their first 18 months. At Infusionsoft, we aim to change that. We don’t just say it, we work to help small businesses succeed every day. Our full commitment to this mission means there will be long days days and incredible challenges. We expect you to bring hustle, grit and passion to the table. You will need to take proactive ownership and improve yourself constantly in a high-intensity startup atmosphere. But the reward? You will learn. You will grow your skills. And most importantly -- you may just contribute to something larger than yourself.Your Role and ImpactWe Expect Data Analysts To Fulfill Three Broad FunctionsWe are looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst who can make an immediate impact on our Analytics team. At Infusionsoft, we don’t just expect our data analysts to just provide reporting and KPI tracking. Automate dashboards and reports with ninja-like SQL and data transformation skills Provide statistical analysis on business questions using tools like R and Python Most importantly -- work as a peer with business stakeholders and help them answer meaningful business questions using data Responsibilities Write complex SQL queries to transform data at the data warehouse level -- yes, we expect our Analysts to create derived tables from raw table data Help define KPIs and develop dashboards to track business questions and metrics across the company Exploring data to find actionable insights and make recommendations Provide direct analytical support to help business stakeholders and leaders prioritize, execute, and analyze initiatives Serving as a best-practices and implementation owner for AB tests and other controlled experiments Perform ad-hoc statistical analysis (logistic regression, IV regression and quasi-experimental methods, and difference-of-means testing) Expertise Fluency in SQL, as well as a deep understanding of statistical analysis, experiment design, and common pitfalls of data analysis Experience with modern scalable data warehouses (BigQuery/Redshift/Hive/etc), BI tools (Looker) and enterprise sales/marketing automation tools (Salesforce/Marketo) is strongly preferred 3+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis for a technology company preferably in a Business Intelligence, Marketing Analytics, Customer Success Analytics or Data Science team Power user of analytical tools (Mixpanel, Optimizely, Google analytics, Python, etc) Degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields Self-starter: You drive projects with minimal guidance and focus on high impact work Strong communicator: You effectively synthesize, visualize, and communicate your ideas to others Critical thinker: You are thoughtful, self-aware, and use available evidence to make decisions Work effectively with teammates and win credibility quickly At Infusionsoft we celebrate diversity and inclusion for the benefit of our employees, our products, our community, and to help small businesses succeed. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, marital status or any legally protected status.

Any applicant for state employment will be expected to behave in accordance with this objective because the use of illegal drugs is inconsistent with the law of the State, the rules governing Civil Service, and the special trust placed in public servants.Position DetailsJob Code #:JC-115935Position #(s):913-660-5393-XXXWorking Title MATERIALS MANAGEMENT OPERATIONS ANALYST ClassificationASSOCIATE GOVERNMENTAL PROGRAM ANALYST$4,784.00 - $5,988.00 AWill ConsiderSTAFF SERVICES ANALYST (GENERAL)$3,063.00 - $3,838.00 A$3,317.00 - $4,152.00 B$3,977.00 - $4,980.00 C# of Positions:1Work Location:Sacramento CountyJob TypePermanent, Full TimeDepartment Information Caltrans Mission:Provide a safe, sustainable, integrated, and efficient transportation system to enhance California’s economy and livability. Department Website:www.dot.ca.gov Frequently Asked Questions for an Applicant:http://dot.ca.gov/jobs/docs/faq-ct-applicants-081617.pdfJob Description And DutiesUnder the general direction of the Staff Services Manager I, the Associate Governmental Program Analyst is independently responsible for performing a wide range of analytical administrative/analytical functions and special assignments to support the Division of Maintenance to include personnel, purchasing and tasks relating to the budgeting process. Maintains documentation as necessary for required reports and post-audit review. Accomplishes tasks in accordance with all applicable statutes, State Contracting Manual Volumes 1 and 2, the Caltrans Acquisitions Manual, the purchasing delegation from DGS, and the State Administrative Manual. Serves as liaison between the Warehouse and the Non-IT Procurement Branch.The incumbent will perform tracking, researching and managing budget encumbrances/dis-encumbrances to ensure accurate liquidation, Calcard purchases and purchase requests for materials. Incumbent will maintain the accuracy of all purchase order expenditures again the Division’s budget database.Research, analyze, and introduce new products into statewide distribution. Collects, analyzes and interprets data relating to quality, specifications, and standardization of commodities in accordance with all applicable statutes, such as Caltrans Material Management Manual, State Contracting Manuals, purchasing delegation from Department of General Services (DGS), the State Administrative Manual. Prepares weekly status reports on work in progress and assists in timely preparation of audit reports for external distribution and web posting.Performs other duties as assigned, which may include special assignments within the scope of the classification.You will find additional information about the job in theDuty Statement .Special RequirementsThe incumbent must be able to utilize the Caltrans Material Management System (Scope, Web-based Service & Supply (WSVS) and Service & Supply (SVS)) printouts utilized by the warehouse. Require the ability to assist warehouse staff involved in order processing activities. The incumbent must also possess intermediate computer skills (Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook) and other Caltrans' proprietary data bases such as Advantage, Exam & Cert Online System (ECOS) & WSVS.Statement Of QualificationsMaterials Distribution Operations Analyst – Products/Purchasing/BudgetAnswer the following questions. Please use Arial 12 point font, double spaced, using .5” margins in a one page document. title: Data Analyst
description: The opportunityOur Global Real Estate (GRE), Business Intelligence & Reporting team is currently looking for a Data Analyst to join the LA team with a primary focus of ensuring data quality across GRE Investment and Operational functional areas.The Data Analyst will work closely with GRE stakeholders to collect and validate data, produce information outputs and interpret data to produce actionable insights. The successful candidate will use their strong process skills to ensure outputs meet the relevant quality, governance and timetable requirements.The ideal candidateAs a strong candidate for this role you will have a passion for data, superb attention to detail and problem-solving skills with a drive to following issues through to final resolution. Strong relationship building and stakeholder engagement skills will complement your ability to critically analyse and prepare reports and models to suit your audience. You will have 2-5 years’ proven experience analysing data, using SQL and Excel, handling large and complex datasets and the ability to test and verify processes.Degree qualified and experience within the financial services, institutional real estate or energy experience is advantageous, as is a certification in data quality, experience in Microsoft Power BI and MS Access skills.This role requires the successful candidate to be a strong team player, as a significant part of the role will be interacting with business users, providing support, running training sessions and workshops. You will be required to develop and foster relationships with a variety of stakeholders.Why QIC & GREQIC is a global diversified alternative investment firm offering infrastructure, real estate, private equity, liquid strategies and multi-asset investments. It is one of the largest institutional investment managers in Australia, with US$65 billion (as at March 31, 2018)in funds under management. QIC has over 1000 employees and serves more than 115 clients including governments, pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurers, spanning Australia, Europe, Asia, Middle East and the US. Headquartered in Brisbane, Australia, QIC also has offices in Sydney, Melbourne, New York, Los Angeles, Cleveland, Fort Lauderdale, San Francisco, London and Copenhagen.At QIC our pursuit is to be an inclusive organisation – one in which every employee has a true voice. We want every employee to have a sense of belonging within QIC and this includes feeling like his or her difference is valued, whatever the difference. We want to build people leader capability to reduce unintended bias and ensure we are leveraging the uniqueness of all our people.With approximately US$11.9 billion (31 January 2018) invested in Australian and international retail and commercial properties and a reputation for delivering predictable outcomes for clients over the long term, GRE’s team has specialist in-depth experience from deal origination and execution to asset management, leasing, marketing and development.GRE originated in 1991 as part of QIC’s inception. Today, with more than280 professionals based in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Los Angeles and London, GRE is:Consistently ranked as a top performing client-focused investment manager vs peers.A stable, long-standing, respected team with specialist depth of expertise.Known for discipline, consistent returns and focus.To applyTo apply, please submit a cover letter and resume by 11pm, Friday July 13, 2018. Applications from Recruitment Agencies will not be considered.Follow QIC on LinkedIn to receive the latest industry news and job updated athttps://www.linkedin.com/company/qic

title: Inventory Control - Data Analysis - Vernon
description: Job Description﻿Located in sunny Southern California, PAFCO is a global, innovative food manufacturing company with 40 years of success. High quality products and integrity contribute to its steady growth, allowing PAFCO to consistently outperform competitors. PAFCO is dedicated to fostering the professional growth and development of its associates. Learn more about the company at www.pafco.net .We are currently looking for an outstanding supply chain IC Data Analysis to join our growing team! This person will be tasked to execute inventory strategies set forth by the Supply Chain team, track product shipments, and provide real-time inventory information. If you are professional, great with people, self-driven and entrepreneurial then we want to hear from you. This hands-on position will be responsible for developing and executing Company inventory plans that will enable the Company to meet sales and service objectives. For the right individual, PAFCO offers an outstanding compensation and benefits package, exceptional training, and a tremendous career opportunity.Position PurposeThe supply chain IC Data Analyst monitors movement of product in and out of our warehouse and distribution center. The clerk will keep records of product movement, reconcile inconsistencies, create reports, review processes, ensure policies are followed, and address discrepancies. The successful applicant needs to have excellent record-keeping abilities, must be detail-oriented, and have effective organizational and reporting skills.Although not required, a bachelor's degree is highly desired and preferred for this position.Compensation will be based on a combination of education, experience and job qualifications.Principal AccountabilitiesYou MUST be good in Math.Inventory reconciliation: analyze and amend discrepancies between counted physical inventory and system inventory dailyInvestigate inventory procedures: investigate receiving, inventory movement, production processes, and billing procedures to assist in inventory reconciliation as necessarySuggest process improvements: understand current state procedures and provide suggestions to improve warehouse efficiencies and reduce inventory varianceCreate reports and documentation: generate reports within Excel to provide inventory status reports to track progress of issues and inconsistenciesSKILLS And ATTRIBUTESBe a role model for Integrity, Courage and Conviction;Adapts to changing business needs, introduces new ways of thinking and behaving, applies new ideas. Comfortable to manage ambiguity;Practical /pragmatic approach to problem solving & timely solution execution;Manage conflicting priorities within tight deadlines;Excellent interpersonal skills;Strong collaboration skills to get things done within a matrix organization;Excellent networking skill to build internal and external networks.LOCATION :Local candidates only: Los Angeles, CALIFORNIA area.EducationPreferred: a four year college degree in business administration, statistics, applied mathematics or related discipline, with a minimum 3.40 GPA.Company DescriptionLocated in sunny Southern California, PAFCO is a global, innovative food manufacturing company with 40 years of success. High quality products and integrity contribute to its steady growth, allowing PAFCO to consistently outperform competitors. PAFCO is dedicated to fostering the professional growth and development of its associates. Learn more about the company at www.pafco.net.PAFCO is an Equal Opportunity/ Drug Free Employer.

title: Data Analyst
description: Bird’s eye view of your role -Yodlee’s Data Products team is driving innovations within the Financial Services Sector using Big Data. We have a high-caliber, focused, and mission-driven culture within our teams. The models we build and the analysis that we derive from financial data matters in crucial cutting-edge business decisions made daily across the global financial services firms and provides insight into real world problems. It is both challenging and fun. We are leveraging our deep expertise in financial data as well as alternative sources of data to launch innovative solutions into the Financial Services Industry.The Data Analyst is responsible for data cleansing, transforming, and analysis. You will be naturally curious and enjoy deep diving into the raw data to help figure out the best way to tag, manage and organize it. We have a small team of data scientists, data engineers, and analysts. You will be a key member interacting with the rest of the team in order to build world class products.You will have - Bachelor’s Degree in any field1 to 5 years of relevant experienceAn interest in learning about, or possessing some knowledge of the stock market is preferredYou Will Definitely Possess These Technical Skills -Experience/interest in analyzing dataHigh attention to detail, especially in regards to data cleansingProficiency in writing SQLExperience using any big data technology (RedShift, Athena, Spark, Hive, Hadoop, Big Query, Vertica, etc.) on any cloud (AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, etc.)What Will You Bring -You will be a thinker, a doer, and someone that likes to solve problems by analyzing data.What Are Your Performance Objectives -Receive questions from clients, understand the questions, and determines the data needed to answer themAnalyze query data results with a high level of precision and revise queries as necessary to clean data based on analysisSolve problems by taking a systemic approachMake objective decisions based on dataQuickly access problems and identify potential solutionsDerive analytical insights from dataWhat’s in it for you? (EVP - Employee Value Proposition) -An opportunity to work on investment research domain with real big dataAn opportunity to analyze data and build data productsOpen culture and technology agnostic which helps you be on top of the big data technology stack all of the timeAn opportunity to attend conferences related to big data, work on real world big data problems, and above all exposure to world class original data products which will have a huge impact on the investment research domainExperienced mentors, opportunity to work closely with bright minded people, weekly review of code/query, 1:1 in person sync-up with your manager and team leader, world class best data analytics practices, brainstorming, and exposure to strong software engineering practices applicable to data analytics

title: Business Intelligence Analyst

title: Research Associate - Data Analysis
location: 2575 Sand Hill Road , Menlo Park, CA 94025, US
description: POSITION OVERVIEW:Are you interested in a scientific career in big data analytics uncovering correlations and insights? We are seeking a passionate and talented Research Associate with strong programming skills to help develop analytical pipelines and frameworks for analyzing large volumes of scientific data at the Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS).LCLS is world’s premier x-ray free-electron laser (FEL) elucidating atomic structures and dynamics at the femtosecond timescale. LCLS currently produces as much as 1GB/s of scientific data and it is anticipated that this data volume will increase a thousand-fold with planned upgrades to the accelerator and detectors in order to support world-leading capabilities in FEL science and advance SLAC’s mission to address transformative science and technology solutions.As a Research Associate, you will be a members of the Controls and Data Systems Division (CDS) a multidisciplinary team comprised of physicists, electronic engineers and software developers focused on developing software and hardware solutions to support scientific instrumentation, laser systems, controls, and data analysis and acquisition systems. The evolution of science and experimental techniques on these instruments, along with upgrades in the x-ray FEL source and optical lasers for LCLS-II, require regular improvements to the supporting software and hardware platforms.See https://portal.slac.stanford.edu/sites/lcls_public for more on LCLS and the unique capabilities of our instrument facilities.            CORE DUTIES*:Participate in the design, development and deployment of hardware and software systems for big-data analytics.Development and optimization of data analytics code on exascale supercomputers (50 to 100 times faster than the fastest supercomputers available today).Deployment of monitoring tools to control behavior and measure performance of workflows and applications.Additional opportunities may also includeUnderstand complex scientific ideas enough to provide software solutions.Develop software that provides a simple user-friendly interface to complex systems so that software tools can quickly adapt to rapidly changing experimental configurations.Develop real-time and offline data analysis frameworks which run on Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) and many cores architectures (e.g. Phi).Develop machine-learning techniques for data processing/reduction.Investigate hardware-level data reduction and veto systems in custom FPGA based platform(s).Develop Graphical User Interfaces.* Other duties may also be assignedNote: The position is initially a 36-month term with the possibility of renewal.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:Education & Experience:Ph.D. in computer science, software engineering, physics or a related scientific computing field with demonstrated coursework or research in large software systems.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Ability to learn and understand the workings of a broad range of software.Demonstrated programming skills with Python, C and/or C++, Linux/Unix.Exceptional communication skills and ability to work well in a research and development team.Strong conceptual and problem solving skills as well as the ability to identify and recommend solutions.Excellent organizational skills and the ability to synthesize complex technical and scientific information.Experience in one or more of the following preferred.X-ray physics, crystallography or related imaging techniques.Large-scale software parallelization techniques, such as MPI or Spark.Parallel file systems, such as Lustre or GPFS.GPU clusters and machine learning frameworks is a plus.User-friendly GUI development with PyQt.Batch-processing systems such as slurm, LSF, torque/maui.Code revision systems, such as svn or git.Knowledge of tools used to call C++ from Python, such as boost-python, cython or pybind11.

title: Data Scientist/Analyst

Candidate must be able to explain complex problems to a variety of audience. Candidate must be able to drive meetings, presentation and lead discussions 1+ years hands-on experience in business analytics Successful candidate needs to have a strong passion in analytics and curiosity to learn new skills in a fast-paced environment Preferred Skills: Experience with Tableau or other visualization tools Advanced degree in quantitative fields - Computer Science, Engineering, Operational Research, Statistics, Economics, etc.

title: Data Modeling Analyst
description: Data Modeling AnalystIf you’re interested in a career within a customer-focused, team-oriented environment that rewards innovation, quality, integrity and collaboration, MedImpact Healthcare Systems, Inc. welcomes your application. Our solutions and services positively influence healthcare outcomes and expenditures, improving the position of our clients in the market. MedImpact offers high-value solutions to payers, providers and consumers of healthcare in the U.S. and foreign markets.Position SummaryThe Formulary Modeling Analyst provides timely and accurate analytical modeling and support services related to formulary changes for the sale and delivery of Clinical Analytics products and services to MedImpact internal customers, clients and prospects. This individual gathers and documents business requirements and utilizes sharp analytical skills to fulfill the needs of the business and clients. As a key player, they will need to act as a primary liaison between Clinical Programs and Analytics business unit and Clinical Account Services staff, and is an expert in a variety of desktop and server based database query tools. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.Utilizes advanced analytical skills to measure savings and client ROI from market share changes expected from formulary and other benefit design and clinical intervention programs and initiatives under consideration by MedImpact and/or MedImpact clientsWorks with Sales and Account Management, Industry Relations, Clinical Account Services, Clinical Programs and Analytics staff to measure expected client performance using sophisticated formulary modeling capabilitiesUtilizes Oracle, SAS, TOAD/Golden 32, IBM Cognos, Microsoft Excel, Word, and MedAccess skills to conduct analytics activities that assist MedImpact provide consultative services to clientsServes as a subject matter expert and resource to Clinical Programs and Analytics Services staff in developing queries and reports to answer complex clinical and utilization management questions often delivered to clients as a part of our service offering and/or fee based product and/or consultative servicesAnalyzes, defines, and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks and controls, and outputsSupports Clinical Programs and Analytics, Clinical Account Services, Industry Relations, and Account Management in the formulary modeling processes through validation of source data and interpretation of modeling results. Responsible for updating and maintaining the models, including making enhancements as required by the businessWrites and maintains business and technical specificationsAnalyzes and estimates feasibility, costs, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programsConsults with internal customers to develops prototypes and performs “proof of concept” testing and relays results to internal customers for approvalWrites and maintains documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and correctionEducation And/or ExperienceFor consideration candidates will need a Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university in statistics, mathematics, information technology/computer sciences or related discipline that includes programming, analytics, and modeling. It is also desired this individual have five (5) plus years job related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and job related experience.Computer SkillsStrong proficiency with MS Office / Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, Visio and Outlook to create complex documents, manage schedules, and analyze dataFamiliarity with relational databasesIntermediate experience in using analytic software programs, including hands on ability to code in SQLOther Skills And AbilitiesAble to build complex multi-table queries, reports, macros and computer code to support various reporting products and programsExperience analyzing medical and/or pharmacy claims including prior PBM experience are highly desiredThis position is eligible for Employee Referral Bonus at Level I EOE, M/F/D/V Osha/AdaTo perform this job successfully, the successful candidate must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. title: Data Analyst - Oakland
description: We’re looking for a high performing data analyst who's keen to become a data model expert in the growing cloud ecosystem. The role requires a mastery of SQL, an aptitude for understanding new schemas, and an ability to communicate best practices to our customer data teams.Fivetran is a Y-Combinator-backed startup based in Oakland, CA. Our product is zero-configuration data pipeline that hundreds of companies use to power their data warehouses and BI tools. We’re hiring our first analyst dedicated to building re-usable queries and dashboards for our customers. You will have support from our growing team of data analysts, data engineers and technical support gurus. As a data analyst, representing the voice of Fivetran customers, you will be a valuable stakeholder in product and communication decisions.The Data Analyst role will champion three main areas:Own the development and maintenance of re-usable dashboards and data models that run on top of Fivetran's standardized schemas. Our BI dashboards are built using Fivetran data connectors, and Looker. We also have access to other data warehouses and BI tools through partnerships.Validate Fivetran's standardized schemas for correctness and analytics utility. Provide feedback and insights to our development team to continually improve the schemas for our growing number of data connectors.Improve Fivetran documentation, blog, and customer support material by voicing the data analyst perspective. Provide sample SQL queries and sample analyses to showcase the functionality of Fivetran schemas and ERDs.Your Experience:At minimum 4 years experience as a data analystExpert SQL knowledge and abilityAbility to setup and maintain Looker dashboards for business stakeholdersExperience building Looker blocks preferredComfortable communicating with customers and industry partnersAbility to convey technical principles to a range of skill levels from novice data analysts to advanced IT professionals.Interest in becoming a sought after voice in the data analytics community.

Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, surpassing $1B in revenue at the end of 2017.The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pure’s technology literally in the driver’s seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power mission-critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation create a thriving company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love . This includes managing the change control process, documenting business requirements and process flow documentation, managing testing, and obtaining all necessary approvals associated with changes in production environments.Collaborate with stakeholders and users to understand the business requirements, translate into high-level design documents, and ensure the development of solutions (i.e. Workday or system configurations or integrations) and deliverables are met.Configure Workday reports including advanced reporting and dashboards for managers, executives and HR team membersBuild/refine integrations and enable process efficiencies.Build strong relationships with the business to anticipate needs, capitalize on opportunities, and deepen client relationshipsSupport Workday feature release updates and enhancementsWhat You Bring To The Team3 - 5 years of Workday’s various modules expertise is a mustUnderstanding of the HR processes and procedures (i.e. compensation, benefits, payroll, etc.)Personal passion for enabling effective scaling of Pure HRIT solutionsAbility to manage multiple, high priority tasks and adjust to shifting priorities, while meeting deadlinesMust be self-motivated and able to work independently as well as on a teamAbility to solve problems in a structured way, applying principles of systems thinkingAbility to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality and integrityStrong communication, interpersonal, analytical, organizational and problem solving skillsBachelor’s degree or equivalent years of industry experienceMust be willing and able to work in an open office, team environmentPure creates opportunities for your development and career growth.At Pure we believe that each Puritan is a leader contributing to the success of our business, regardless of role. We offer an assortment of learning options available to all Puritans, including workshops on leadership, management, career development and more! We’re here to change the world and we hope you join us!Popular PerksPure offers a flexible vacation policy, free lunches, meditation rooms, free yoga classes and employee resource groups, such as Pure Equality and Pure Vets, to encourage all of our employees to maintain mind and body wellness. We offer numerous volunteer opportunities for employees to give back not only to the Bay Area but across the globe.Pure is Committed to Equality Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitingops@purestorage.com.

title: Data Analyst
description: Roofstock is an innovative online marketplace that makes it easy for people to invest in the $3 trillion single-family rental sector. We are passionate about helping our customers build wealth through real estate. At Roofstock, collaboration and teamwork are the norm, as are frequent celebrations of our awesome accomplishments and each other!Roofstock was named as one of the top 50 Small Business Great Places to work by Fortune Magazine, and has been certified as a great workplace by the independent analysts at Great Place to Work® based on ratings provided by our employees. Check out our company review and see why our employees love working here!As a data analyst you generate insights from data. Analytics at Roofstock is a two way street: sure you use data to answer questions posed by others, but you also formulate and test your own hypotheses, and use your data sense to inform and influence the process. A key outcome of your analyses are the datasets you assemble: focusing on foresight, quality and maintainability are paramount to enable future re-use. You will build visualizations to communicate your results, and also to encourage future self-service by our partners. You thrive in a team environment, and are willing to pitch in wherever needed to help the team succeed.This is an excellent opportunity to join an established but small and quickly growing company working on a wide projects with talented data engineers, data scientists, and other data analysts in an integrated Data Team. We care about your career growth so you’ll have opportunities to develop along at least three paths in addition to maturing as an analyst and data architect: data engineering (more data processing & computational systems), data science (more modeling, ML, and algorithms), or product (more business).What You Will DoBuild pipelines to gather, refine, and transform large diverse datasets into simplified, meaningful, and actionable aggregations Analyze this data, to provide information that supports decision making across the companyDevelop reporting workbooks and dashboards (Tableau and others) Rapid prototyping and feasibility analyses to determine utility of more advanced machine learning. Some analyses will require basic statistical tests, and prototypes will occasionally involve building basic statistical and machine learning models (regression, random forests, etc.)Be responsible for data accuracy and integrity, implement data quality processesWork with varied structured and unstructured datasetsWrite robust python & SQL code, operating on a modern cloud stack (AWS, Azure, Snowflake)What You Bring With YouBS or MS statistics, computer science, analytics, economics, physical or social science, engineering, operations research, or similar quantitative and computational field3+ years of industry experienceIntermediate/advanced SQL, intermediate/advanced data modeling, novice/intermediate python and/or R, intermediate Tableau or other BI/viz toolStructured approach to problem solving: ability to take a broad challenge and break it down into solvable components, accounting for confounding variables and statistical challengesDemonstrated ability to work independently, prototype rapidly, and meet deadlinesStrong communication and collaboration skills to effectively explain, influence, and advise with interdisciplinary partnersWhat We OfferAn opportunity to be part of a well-funded early-stage start-upEquity incentives to give you a stake in our futureMedical, Vision and Dental for you (100%) and your dependents (65%)401kPre-tax commuter benefitsFlexible Time Off and sick daysAn upbeat and collaborative work cultureA fully stocked kitchen with snacks and mealsCompany-sponsored outingsDiscounted Gym MembershipsRoofstock is an equal opportunity employer. In keeping with the values of Roofstock, we make all employment decisions including hiring, evaluation, termination, promotional and training opportunities, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, physical handicap, mental disability, medical condition, disability, gender or identity or expression, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, marital status, height and/or weight.

title: Head of Data Analytics
description: About NTWRK:NTWRK is an evolutionary platform that moves with users from the digital world to the physical, offering unique experiences at every level. NTWRK provides unrestricted access to exclusive products with a deep connection through storytelling. Job Description:Data Analytics will play a crucial role across NTWRK. As we grow, we will approach problems inquisitively and with a desire to find solutions in our data. We believe that Analytics should drive business decisions across the company in order to keep our product simple and enjoyable.The Role:As the Head of Data Analytics, you will be charged with leading multiple cross-company initiatives and analyses to deliver quality work on time with multiple, competing priorities. You will also be responsible for establishing and implementing NTWRK’s data strategy. provide ongoing direction and analyses of trends and opportunities and ensure data integrity and service support levels by measuring key processes and integrating improvements.Evaluate and ensure that current procedures and practices are appropriate for accomplishing department objectives, and that supporting financial reporting requirements are adequately documented and operating within policy.Oversee specifications for proposed development and management of intellectual capital related to data outputs and capabilities.Guidance and leadership of processes and projects that will help to track, analyze and develop metrics to identify trends and patterns within the existing data as well as data acquired externally.Work in a Python (or R), SQL Data pipelines environment.What we are looking for:Bachelor and/or Masters in Computer Science or a related field of study.5+ years experience in Data Science or a related field.5+ years of experience in managing data teamsPrior experience working for a media or e-commerce organization.Deep statistical knowledge and experienceDeep knowledge of SQL and Python (or another language with object-oriented principles)Experience working with various types of data infrastructures (cloud, open-source, distributed systems, structured/unstructured databases)Ability to maintain focus and discipline in a fast paced and evolving industry / orgExperience leading and defining company-wide KPIsDeep understanding of how analytics drives / fits into projects and initiatives at all stagesExperience with creating data services and ETLs to cater to different types of end-users (analysts, data scientists, developers, PMs etc.)Experience leading teams implementing processes from business requirements through logical modeling; database design; data sourcing, transformation and loading; SQL; end-user tools; and performance tuningOutstanding communication skills, permitting complex technical matters to be understood by business professionalsAbility to communicate technical data and engineering concepts to non-technicalStrong communication, listening, and negotiation skills; able to convey important messages in a clear and compelling manner.
