title: Data Analyst - Anaheim
description: What We NeedJob DescriptionPurpose: This is a key position within the company that will assist in establishing and tracking key metrics while helping update our approach on how we manage and utilize our company data.Responsibilities & Measurements Help establish key metrics / KPI’s to monitor overall company performance. Interpret data and analyze results as produced. Identify and analyze trends or patterns in data sets. Provide daily / weekly / monthly reporting around metrics / key initiatives. Work on time studies to help identify overall performance on key products. Aide in developing additional financial tools and systems that can benefit the company. Work in preparing monthly financials and projections with senior management. Assist in developing additional financial systems that can benefit the company. Participate in developing new plans / opportunities for future company ventures.Who You AreFinance and Accounting Experience. Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance from accredited University.Education. Bachelor’s Degree required. Stable profile. Must demonstrate stability in past employment – preferably 2+ years or more at most recent job. Track record of integrity, loyalty and honesty. Throughout our company, we seek ethically-grounded individuals with whom we can grow over time.Attention to detail. Excellent organizational skills couple with the ability to prioritize workload.Additional skills: Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills coupled with excellent training skills. Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced dynamic work environment.Computer proficiency. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word. Experience with Microsoft PowerPoint, Sage Master Builder, and Salesforce.com a plus.Company DescriptionSince its founding in 1981, TL Fab has become one of the largest and most respected structural steel and miscellaneous steel fabricators in Southern California. Our talented team is experienced in a full range of metal fabrications and works closely with our clients to develop innovative solutions to design challenges. We offer a professional experience from start to finish, including design and estimating services, project management, manufacturing and installation.

title: Pricing Analyst II
description: Position DescriptionArconic Fastening Systems (AFS) holds the number one global position in aerospace fastening systems, and we’re the North American leader in commercial transportation fasteners. Our high-tech, multi-material fastening systems are found nose to tail on aircraft and aero engines. Our products are also critical components of industrial gas turbines, automobiles, commercial transportation vehicles, and construction and industrial equipment. Headquartered in Torrance, CA; we employ over 6,000 people in 11 countries at 31 locations. AFS is a business unit of Arconic (NYSE:ARNC).Join Arconic and join a network of people who are passionate about industry-changing technology that advances the world. You’ll have the opportunity to work with leading global companies that operate in world-changing industries—such as aerospace, automotive, building and construction, defense and commercial transportation. It’s not just a job. It’s a career and a path to the future. You’ll be part of a diverse culture of learning, teaching and mentorship. Arconic is fully committed to developing people: providing employees with the resources, and learning and development opportunities they need to excel and build a career.SummaryWorks under the direction of the Site Product Manager and Senior Pricing Analyst to analyze requests for quotations and developing a suggested selling price that reflects factory capability, manufacturing costs, competitive market conditions and site profitability goals.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesSupports goals and objectives of the Sales and Marketing Department.Develop price and prepares all quotations within department turn-around goals.Establishes and maintains Company Price Book.Ensures that quotation are consistent with all legal and industry requirements.Ensures that AFS maintains a competitive and profitable position.Retains sales and price statistics to provide historical data for reference and control purposes, maintaining consistent pricing to OEM and Distribution customers.Reviews daily exception reports for order defects, including price, sots, contract pricing and lead-times.Ensures pricing catalog tables are current and correct in CPO, GCS and Inventory systems.Enters prices, reviews and adjusts any anomalies and prices to reflect current market prices.Interfaces with product support departments concerning shop load, capacity, engineering and planning to ensure relevant data is available for pricing quotations.Participates in various projects analyzing data at request of and in support of Product Manager.Basic QualificationsMinimum Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.Minimum 3 years Pricing Analyst experienceEmployees must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.This position is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) which requires U.S. person status. ITAR defines U.S. person as an U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.Preferred QualificationsAdvanced Excel skillsExperience with AccessMinimum Education RequiredBachelorsMinimum Years Of Experience5Job FunctionSalesBusiness Unit GroupEngineered Products and SolutionsBusiness UnitArconic Fastening SystemsMinimum Travel Required0-25%Job TypeExperienced

title: Sr. HRIS Reporting and Analytics Analyst
description: Overview This position will analyze and interpret data in order to support the objectives of the Human Resources department and our business partners. The Sr. HRIS Reporting and Analytics Analyst will compile reports, analyze and synthesize data in order to communicate key HR metrics to stakeholders in HR and other stakeholders in the company. They will also analyze data in order to identify areas of concern or best practices for specialists to review in more detail.Essential Functions HR Reporting Manage timeliness and quality of recurring and ad hoc reports Interact with end users (HR and other departments) to understand business issues and provide advice about data that are available to support the business Develop simple to complex HR reports using data from multiple HR data sources Perform complex data manipulation and aggregation of data from multiple HR data sources. Design and develops dashboards to answer relevant business questions and communicate report data in a concise and easy to understand format. Integrate disparate data from multiple systems and tools Leverage technology to deliver the right information to the customer in a timely fashion. This would include creating dashboards and dynamic reporting. Use knowledge of relational databases to retrieve data from Core HR system Proactively work to improve reporting (value-add, efficiency, quality, speed) and delivery processes considering all available technologies Collaborate with HRIS to maintain data integrity HR Data Analytics Develop and interprets reports which clearly and concisely show key workforce trends and problem areas, including status and trends Review reports to identify trends or areas that may require further review by HR team. This could include ad hoc analysis or systematic analysis (for example, the Recruiting Activity Report) Plan and conduct end to end analysis including data gathering and validation HR Project Support Support would be inclusive of but not limited to: Support project lead on timeline and communication for HR technical projects Manage vendor directly to ensure technical deliverables are met Analyze project data to ensure optimal system operation, best use of time and resources as well as value of the project Design and create organizational feeds Identify and troubleshoot issues during project Partner with project stakeholders prepare, analyze, and communicate reports to identified audiences Support the technical documentation of project either by creating documents or reviewing vendor documents Manage any ad hoc analysis requests related to project and project dataCompetencies Analysis and Judgment Collaboration Business Acumen Technical competence CommunicationQualifications Knowledge of and experience in HR Recruiting process and metrics Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office applications - Word, Excel, Access, Outlook; experience with HR information systems and reporting modules preferred Compensation knowledge preferred Demonstrated ability to interface with both internal and external business partners and act as liaison when needed Bachelor’s degree Excellent organization skills and meticulous attention to detail; process oriented Excellent communication skills, written and oral, and interpersonal skills

title: Data Analyst
description: The Data Scientist will lead the charge in leveraging various data-driven technologies to deliver strategic insight and intelligence that can inform current and future programs on behalf of our clients. The candidate will act as source of knowledge to multiple cross-functional agency teams and to clients in order to further articulate the impact of digital, mobile and social strategies and how best to optimize performance.Essential Job Functions Deliver data-driven insights that can inform future strategy for clients and Uptown Treehouse. Conduct analysis to determine key performance trends and outliers as well as uncover challenges and opportunities to build solutions that drive growth against client and agency business objectives. Coordinate with the Strategy and Design teams to draft visually appealing reports, infographics and other related materials. Provide technical expertise in analytics methodologies, performance measurement and running research using advanced analytical and experimental social and digital platforms. Research and pitching of emerging technologies for improving digital and social intelligence. Query and manipulate data using advanced functions to deliver against specific objectives. Clearly and effectively articulate and communicate thoughts and ideas in a timely manner to both cross-functional agency teams and clients. Lead ad-hoc projects within the agency; collaborate with internal teams to quickly get up to speed on new technology, challenges and/or opportunities and help drive the solution. Qualifications Minimum 2-4 years in a digital and/or social analytics role. Clear understanding of key digital and social measurement metrics and reporting techniques required to optimize the effectiveness campaigns. Demonstrated ability to think critically in a strategic and creative manner. Strong research skills, both qualitative and quantitative. Basic to advanced skills with Python, SQL, XML, HTML, CSS, VBasic, Macros and others. Familiarity with digital management and reporting tools such as Google Analytics, Omniture / SiteCatalyst and CoreMetrics; social SaaS platforms such as Sprinklr and Spredfast and listening tools such as Radian6 and Crimson Hexagon a plus. Strong knowledge and/or experience building financial and marketing and other data formula models to track and forecast key points of interest. Ability to effectively multi-task and collaborate across teams in a deadline-driven environment. High level of attention to detail and emphasis on integrity of work. A strong communicator, both written and verbal.

title: ASSOCIATE GOVERNMENTAL PROGRAM ANALYST
description: Equal Opportunity EmployerThe State of California is an equal opportunity employer to all, regardless of age, ancestry, color, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation.It is an objective of the State of California to achieve a drug-free work place. Any applicant for state employment will be expected to behave in accordance with this objective because the use of illegal drugs is inconsistent with the law of the State, the rules governing Civil Service, and the special trust placed in public servants.Position DetailsJob Code #:JC-118401Position #(s):580-222-5393-XXXWorking Title Data Analyst ClassificationASSOCIATE GOVERNMENTAL PROGRAM ANALYST$4,784.00 - $5,988.00 AWill ConsiderSTAFF SERVICES ANALYST (GENERAL)$3,063.00 - $3,838.00 A$3,317.00 - $4,152.00 B$3,977.00 - $4,980.00 C# of Positions:1Work Location:Sacramento CountyJob TypePermanent, Full TimeDepartment Information Would you like to work for an energetic, high performing organization? If so, we invite you to come join us at CDPH. FREE PARKING The Public Health Policy and Research Branch (PHPRB), Health Information and Research Section supports the California Department of Public Health’s (CDPH) mission, “To optimize the health and wellbeing of the people of California.” HIRS is integral to this mission by collecting data for birth, death, and fetal death vital events, developing data products related to vital events, and creating and delivering custom data files to end users of these data.The Center for Health Statistics and Informatics (CHSI) is responsible for department-wide initiatives to improve the effectiveness of our work through better health information systems, increased application of epidemiologic methods of analysis, strong liaisons with public health organizations and schools of public health, and effective partnerships with local health agencies and professionals. CHSI houses the Office of Vital Records, responsible for registering all California vital events and providing birth, death, and marriage records to the public. In addition, CHSI is involved in many cross-cutting and innovative data projects including the statewide Open Data Portal and Health Information Exchange.Job Description And DutiesUnder the direction of the Research Manager I, Unit Chief of the DQA, the Associate Governmental Program Analyst independently performs complex data analysis and researches and resolves data anomalies to ensure data quality. Performs linkage of data files and identifies unlinked records for further analysis. Acts as team lead for the data quality assurance program, and leads the review and analysis of CDPH contracts with federal and other governmental agencies for compliance with statutes, program policies and procedures.You will find additional information about the job in theDuty Statement .Application InstructionsCompleted applications and all required documents must be received or postmarked by the Final Filing Date in order to be considered. description: In This Role You WillUse data to drive business decisions across multiple organizations within the companyDesign, automate, and optimize pipelines, dashboards, and insight delivery methodsSupport ideation of new features and business initiatives from beginning to end by evaluating potential impact, implementing new tracking, and performing post analysisConduct ad hoc analyses as well as deep dives with a focus on growing and improving the businessRecommend improvements and optimizations highlighted by data across all elements of company’s activities and eco-systemBecome an expert of our data and evangelize data driven decision makingBe flexible to manage other assignments as they come upWe Are Looking For2+ years experience in data analytics, ideally in e-commerce or at a startupMastery of SQLExcellent communication and relationship building skills with an ability to prioritize, negotiate, and work with a variety of internal and external stakeholdersA quick learner, a self-starter, able to work independently, and you're willing (and able) to handle the pressures of an increasing level of responsibilityBenefits And PerksJoin the early team and work closely with founders on all aspects of the companyMedical, dental and vision coverageCompetitive salary and generous equity grantsDaily catered lunches from LA’s best restaurantsUnlimited vacationFounded in 2015 and based in Los Angeles, California, GOAT is the safest way to buy and sell sneakers. title: Data Analyst
description: Jackson Lewis P.C. is an employment law firm that represents management exclusively in every aspect of employment, benefits, labor and immigration law and related litigation. The Firm is ranked in the First Tier nationally in the category of Labor and Employment Litigation, as well as in both Employment Law and Labor Law on behalf of Management, in the U.S. News - Best Lawyers® “Best Law Firms”.Jackson Lewis has offices across the United States and Puerto Rico. The Firm is comprised of individual local offices staffed by attorneys and support personnel. These offices are supported by the National Operations Center which includes Human Resources, Information Technology, Finance/Accounting, Facilities, Marketing and Information Services.Jackson Lewis is presently looking for a Data Analyst located at our Sacramento Office.Duties And ResponsibilitiesØ Analyze client data and workplace law issuesØ Design, create and analyze data reports for results, trends and variationsØ Design and create data summaries and/or databases from data obtained from various sources, including raw data and multiple forms of evidenceØ Written and verbal contact with HR and legal professionals at Fortune 500 companiesØ Collaborate with class action attorneys and paralegalsØ Organize and maintain electronic and hard copy data filesSkills And Educational RequirementsØ Bachelor’s Degree requiredØ 1 to 3 years data analyst experienceØ Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; Familiarity and Microsoft Office Professional SuiteØ Experience with Microsoft Access and Visual Basic for Applications preferredØ Experience With Statistics PreferredØ Critical thinking and problem solving skills requiredØ Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects, from start to finish, with shifting priority levelsØ Strong organizational and communication skillsØ Experience with routine billable time and cost capturing for analysis performedWe offer a competitive starting salary and a comprehensive benefits package, along with opportunity for growth. We are an equal opportunity (M/F/V/D) employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Transforming the future of healthcare isn’t something we take lightly. It takes teams of the best and the brightest, working together to make an impact. As one of the largest healthcare technology companies in the U.S., we are a catalyst to accelerate the journey toward improved lives and healthier communities.Here at Change Healthcare, we’re using our influence to drive positive changes across the industry, and we want motivated and passionate people like you to help us continue to bring new and innovative ideas to life.   If you’re ready to embrace your passion and do what you love with a company that’s committed to supporting your future, then you belong at Change Healthcare.Pursue purpose. Champion innovation. Earn trust. Be agile. Include all. Empower Your Future. Make a Difference. Seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. By leveraging large sets of data from our clients, this role will assist the corporate finance team by enabling timely and precise revenue recognition, will support sales by assessing and presenting the potential impact of our products, and will empower operations through the discovery of data-driven insights. Qualified candidates are comfortable working with large sets of electronic information from various sources, and are naturally inclined to seek answers in data. Key Responsibilities: Reconciles external data from clients to internal databases to produce accurate accounting entries for Finance Team. Loads, extracts, standardizes, and manipulates data originating outside and within the company. Maintains relationships with clients to promote timely receipt and transmission of invoicing data, in step with monthly accounting timelines. Designs and implements data-driven methods for facilitating payments from various clients. Assists Sales Team by obtaining data files from prospective clients. Processes prospective clients’ data and assesses opportunity. Creates reports and data visualizations for sales presentations. Responds to ad hoc reporting requests from business stakeholders and summarizes the information of large data into comprehendible insights. Works with Data Integrations Team to augment automated solutions for data reconciliation. Assists Software Development Team with creation of reports. Knowledge/Skills: 3-5 years working as a Business Intelligence Analyst. Intermediate knowledge of SQL. At least two years of experience authoring new database queries and maintaining existing queries. Experience with Microsoft SQL Server is a plus. Able to understand a relational data model and aggregate data from multiple tables for presentation through reporting tools. Knowledge of query optimization and stored procedures are a plus. Experience with healthcare data as it relates to medical claims is a plus. Use of reporting and data visualization tools such as TIBCO Spotfire, Tableau, SSRS, and Crystal Reports. Appreciation for data cleansing and standardization. Familiarity with ETL tools for importing and exporting data with Microsoft SQL Server, flat files, and Excel. Proficiency in Excel and other Microsoft Office products (Access, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Visio). Comfortable working with internal and external stakeholders, in technical and non-technical capacities. Basic knowledge of accounting principles. Familiarity with Statistical Modeling and Machine Learning is a plus. Experience with HIPAA compliance. Experience managing tasks through a ticketing system such as Jira or Salesforce. Familiarity working on local or remote desktops in a distributed computing environment. Capable of balancing priorities and managing multiple concurrent projects. Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to understand business workflows with natural tendency toward optimizing / enhancing existing processes. Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Data Analytics, Computer Information Systems, Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, or related subject fields. Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system!

title: Financial Analyst
description: Financial Analyst Job ResponsibilitiesAnalyzes financial status by collecting, monitoring, and studying data; recommending actions.Financial Analyst Job DutiesIdentifies financial status by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts.Monthly reporting and report productionPrepare and analyze account reconciliations promptly. Assure availability of timely and well-presented, high-quality actual P&L, balance sheet, and sales detail results vs. current and prior year benchmarks as well as trended information.Reconciles transactions by comparing and correcting dataMaintains database by entering, verifying, and backing up data.Increases productivity by developing automated accounting applications; coordinating information requirements.Analysis and approval of project expenditures as well as invoicing per contracted billing milestones.Review billing milestones upon each budget change to ensure data accuracy and consistency.Provide financial tracking and maintenance support to Plan Administrators.Reports directly to CFO.Financial Analyst Skills And QualificationsBachelor Degree in finance, accounting, economics or related fieldExpert-level analytical and financial modeling skillsStrategic thinkingGreat presentation skillsMust have extremely strong MS Excel skillsKnowledge of Netsuite systems and related technologiesExcellent time management and organizational abilityAbility to multitask and meet constant deadlinesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsMaturity, professionalism, and high level of discretion are requiredWith QBI's main headquarters located in Woodland Hills, CA, and its recent expansion into Orange County, we are an industry leader in the Third Party Administration (TPA) of retirement plans. QBI is seeking to fill various positions in our expanding network with qualified, energetic, self-starting individuals who are highly motivated to learn and thrives operating at a rapid pace. This is an opportunity to work with, and be trained by the best of the best in the retirement plan industry. We are constantly in need of strong candidates to service our expanding clientele. A successful candidate should share the mutual excitement about QBI's work and the willingness to work hard and learn with the commitment to making (keeping) our team #1!

title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Lead
description: OverviewBusiness Intelligence (BI) Analyst, LeadThe Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, Lead develops and supports the transformation of data into information to provide actionable insights to enhance and expand the quality, efficiency, and cost effectiveness of products and services provided by Meritage Medical Network to its members, physicians, health plans, and staff.The BI Analyst Lead utilizes established data sources within SQL, Access databases, Excel tables and Power BI to collect, integrate, extract, analyze and present information in reports, dashboards, and key data visualizations. The BI Analyst Lead, under direction of the IT Director, provides analytics staff work distribution, peer review, and coaching.The preferred candidate demonstrates advanced SQL, Access, Excel and Power BI skills to create data views, reports, extracts, and visualizations within a healthcare managed care environment.Essential Job FunctionsAbility to transform data into actionable and tailored information visualizations designed for specific issues, operational and/or executive decisions and insights.Regularly applies conceptual knowledge, analytical methods, and problem solving skills to perform assignments and improve efficiencies within existing systems, processes, functions, and applications.Provides IT solutions and services which ultimately contribute to physician efficiency, productivity, quality, and organizational clinical, operational, and financial performance.Advanced analytical and problem solving skills.Determines operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements collection, solution development, and proposed solutions.Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments, clear code and appropriate metrics.Project management training & skills to organize, document, monitor, manage, and communicate project status, issues, risks and associated mitigations and/or resolutions.Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.Improves operations by conducting complex systems analysis, tracking metrics, recommending changes in processes, policies and procedures.Develops advanced solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems/data flow; data usage, and work processes; investigates problem areas; follows industry standard/best practice for software development life cycle.Ability to be flexible in an environment of changing priorities and work both independently and in a team.Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities.Key ResponsibilitiesWorks closely with end users to understand their business needs in relation to software functionality.Analyzes software problems and business data requiring complex methods to ensure accurate findings and applicable recommendations.Designs, delivers, and improves software applications training programs and related courseware.Understands the end users’ business needs, works closely with them to provide solutions, and aligns end user business needs with high levels of application functionality.Provides technical support to less experienced information systems analysts.May serve as a liaison between vendors, IT, and internal customer to ensure service delivery agreements are met and that return on investment is realized.Updates job knowledge by studying state-of-the-art analysis, visualization, and development tools, programming techniques ;participates in educational opportunities; reads professional and technical publications; maintains personal networks; participates in professional organizationsComplies with MMN’s Policies/Procedures protecting patient information and the confidentiality of the information in accordance with the Federal and State regulations.QualificationsBachelor’s degree in related healthcare, business, computer science, information sciences, software development/analysis or related field preferred; experience or alternative degree or alternative knowledge acquisition may be considered in lieu of education.Minimum of 6 years of experience within a data analysis environment, with 4 of those years preferably within a healthcare related and/or managed healthcare setting preferred; alternative experience acquisition or a combination may be considered in lieu of required experience.Demonstrated knowledge of concepts, practices, processes and procedures used specifically within a managed healthcare environment.Previous experience in the analysis, development, support, maintenance and training of a OTF and developed systems required.Demonstrated advanced skills in developing solutions in environments that are most applicable to the project requirements, including but not limited or exclusive to: Database (SQL, Access); Spreadsheets (MS Excel); Data Visualization (Microsoft Power BI); FTP scripting; Crystal Reports; a plus to have: Web (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS, etc.); Desktop (.Net, C#, VB, etc.); etc.Strong skills using MS Office 365 - Outlook, Access, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Skype, Teams, and Visio.Familiarity with specialty applications for project and resource collaboration (e.g., SharePoint, Asana, MS Teams)Who We AreMeritage Medical Network (MMN) is a network of 700 primary care and specialist physicians working together with our hospital and other ancillary partners to provide quality health care for our patients. Meritage covers three counties: Marin, Sonoma and Napa. We contract with 7 HMOs and with the Centers for Medicare Services for a Medicare Shared Savings Program. All told, Meritage primary care physicians provide medical services to over nearly half a million residents of the San Francisco North Bay area.Working for MeritageMeritage Medical Network has been recognized as one of 2017's "Best Places to Work" by the North Bay Business Journal and 2017's "Healthiest Employer" by the San Francisco Business Times. Meritage offers a professional work environment where employees are valued. Full-time and part-time employees who work at least 30 hours per week receive a comprehensive benefits package including paid time off and holidays, medical, dental, vision, long term disability (LTD), life insurance, voluntary life insurance option, flexible spending accounts (FSA), employee assistance program (EAP) and a 401(k) retirement plan.Meritage also offers a voluntary wellness program called Meritage Health 360. These activities assist in improving your overall health and well-being. Areas of focus include physical, mental and financial health. We offer a variety of onsite wellness activities such as monthly chair massages, walking groups, yoga, fitness classes, mindful meditation and financial education

title: Data Analyst (Commercial)
description: Omada Health is on a mission to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease.Job OverviewThe Data Team is responsible for building quantitative narratives and data products that empower healthy behavior change for our users and smarter decisions for our stakeholders. We are deeply motivated to learn what works (and what doesn’t) for health behavior change at scale, especially since Omada is paid when we improve clinical outcomes for our users.As a Data Analyst, you will have significant say in what you do and how you do it, and you’ll be backed by a diverse team of analysts, scientists, and engineers from disciplines including epidemiology, economics, statistics, and computer science. Your work will drive business impact, alongside your own intellectual growth, and will ultimately inspire and enable participants in the Omada program to live free of chronic disease.Data Analysts at Omada own projects from end to end, translating raw, complex datasets into meaningful insights, visualizations, and narratives that help our business and clients make critical decisions.Your Impact Build analytic and reporting solutions for partners in finance, marketing, operations, commercial sales, and medical affairs Develop our client facing reporting product to flexibly and accurately demonstrate the progress and performance of users Perform ad-hoc analyses for internal stakeholders and current and prospective clients Assist in core Data Team initiatives Provide tool training and assistance to internal stakeholders to democratize data and champion a data driven culture You Will Love This Job If You Are/have Methodical: You systematically break large, abstract problems into intuitive steps that guide your solution Empathetic: Without communication, data insights are useless. You understand your audience and coherently present your findings in their language Curious: You ask enough “whys” to get to the root problem of a data request Efficient: You seek the most efficient and effective path to a quantitative answer. You constantly ask “what decision will this work drive?” Business-sense: You know that solving hard problems require contextual understanding to put numbers to good use. Revenue (and for us, this means participant health outcomes) and cost are in the back of your mind as you work through solutions. Detailed: You typically catch “gotchas” before they get you Collaborative: You can work both as part of team and in a self-directed manner You will be successful in this job if you have: BA/BS in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience 2-5 years of applicable industry experience in data analysis and visualization Confidence with SQL or other querying language Confidence with at least 1 analytical tool, such as Excel, R, or Python Familiarity with Tableau or other business intelligence tools Expertise in creating clear and concise presentations Expertise in addressing and prioritizing client inquiries Excellent written and verbal communication skill Bonus Points For Working knowledge of statistics, hypothesis testing, and experimental design Experience working with various types healthcare data, such as claims data, enrollment data, and clinical data Experience collaborating closely with engineers on data projects Experience in writing ETLs Benefits Competitive salary Stock options + extended post termination option exercise window (for Omadans who are with us 3 years or more) Flexible vacation Parental leave Health, dental, and vision Healthy snacks and meals Wellness events (e.g. running club) Community volunteering 401k retirement savings plan About Omada Health: We’ve pioneered digital behavioral medicine: an innovative approach to tackling the growing epidemic of type 2 diabetes, heart disease, and obesity. Our online programs combine world-class science, technology, and design to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. Named one of Fast Company’s “50 Most Innovative Companies in the World,” our team includes passionate and talented individuals. Our approach has been embraced by major employers across the country, including Costco and Iron Mountain, as well as leading health plans, such as Kaiser Permanente and BlueCross Blue Shield of Louisiana.We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Omada is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.

title: Data Analyst -
