title: Director of Systems & Data Analytics
description: Director of Systems & Data AnalyticsAccount Manager - Glas LLCCompany InformationGlas, LLCwww.glasvapor.comGlas, LLC is an extremely fast growing, manufacturing company in a high growth segment of the electronic cigarette industry. The company and brand are highly regarded and considered one of the leaders in high quality luxury devices and premium e-liquid.Over the course of the last two years, we have developed excellent manufacturing capabilities and an extremely vast domestic and international distribution network of brick-and-mortar stores and online retailers.Keys to Glas-Branded Success - Our PhilosophyA-List Players & Fierce Company CultureWe hire for talent and train for expertise. We love our company, our whole team does, and it shows in the finished product and the service we provide to every single customer and end-user.Best-in-Class SystemsFrom CRM to AI Marketing Platforms, we use some of the best systems in the world to drive our business and the results speak for themselves in terms of service rate and product availability.Data-Driven DecisionsWith a focus on market analytics and business intelligence, everything we do is based on quality research and highly-targeted, accurate data. It shows in the product and flavor development and in our territory-specific product launch strategies.Our Guiding Principles Collaboration: Leverage collective genius Leadership: The courage to shape a better future Quality: What we do, we do well! Pursue growth & learning Build a positive team and family spirit Embrace and drive change Be humble, Work hard, Have Fun! Deliver a WOW experience Stay focused & always do what you say you’re going to do Open and honest communication Be passionate and determined Be adventurous, creative, and open minded Think long term Committed to Greatness Celebrate Success!Role And ResponsibilitiesAs a consumer centric company, our systems and data analytics are a top priority here at Glas. We are looking for a Director of Systems & Data Analytics to help us design, build, and maintain the data-based systems in support of organizational analytics and customer data to optimize supply chain, improve operations, and manage various facilities to net more profit.This role requires the ability to lead high impact, high visibility work and to go both broad and deep simultaneously.You will work cross-functionally with our Finance, Operations, Supply Chain, Product, Sales and Marketing teams to coordinate the construction and expansion of our systems to ensure structural integrity and efficiency while providing analytical insights on customer, product, sales, & marketing trends. This includes not only the analysis of the data produced by our systems but the setting up of the data architecture to organize and produce quality data.Beyond just setting up and measuring system performance, you will help us estimate the end-to-end impact of sales & marketing decisions, manufacturing and supply chain changes on realized quality and model their customer experience and financial impact. Ideally you enjoy understanding and improving business processes and systems just as much as you thrive figuring out how to extract the right insights from complex datasets. In short, you should be a doer and a thinker.Core Activities Will IncludeWork with internal & external teams to ensure the smooth transition from Quickbooks Manufacturing & Salesforce CRM to Netsuites (Fully integrated inventory management, CRM, ERP, etc.)Work with web developers ensure a seamless flow of data and information between Netsuites and Magento for both our B2B & B2C websites.Work with teams across the company to map out systems and processes that impact the organizational workflow creating systematic efficiencyUnderstand the data sources we have to evaluate company performance, both internally (manufacturing, testing, etc) and externally (customer surveys, social media, etc)Work with other departments to integrate, clean, model and analyze these datasets, to extract key insights and to define standardized KPIsCreate a comprehensive product quality scorecard and run a regular process with business unit and company leaders to review progress and measure the impact of improvement projectsPersonal And Professional QualificationsBachelor’s degree or equivalent (ideally with an analytical background such as operations research, engineering, computer science or economics)Experience helping companies manufacture high-quality products and improve business processes5-10 years overall work experienceStrong track record of ownership and successExperience with data visualization, programming and scripting is a plusHighly analytical and process drivenOutstanding structured and critical thinking skills and a passion for understanding complex issues with a data driven approachExceptional communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionallyInnate drive to get things done and improve business outcomesYou have a long-term plan, but also like to iterate and make progress every weekGlas LLC was founded in Los Angeles in January of 2014 and is now one of the premiere e-cigarette hardware and e-liquid companies around the world in a high growth segment of the consumer products industry. We represent the very best of our industry, following a set of core values: a commitment to excellence, innovation, passion, and integrity - all of which has driven Glas to become an internationally recognizable, award-winning brand.Our sales & marketing office is located in West Los Angeles, with our manufacturing base here in Southern California, and distribution points all over the world. Our products are sold in 15+ countries and over 3,500 stores worldwide. Our brand is highly regarded with a strong reputation for producing incredible products thanks to our exquisite hardware, incredible flavors, iconic packaging, and unparalleled customer service.

title: Global Security Data Analyst
description: DescriptionThe RoleThe Global Security Data Analyst identifies and monitors data trends related to the safety and security of company personnel, assets and operations. The Global Security Data Analyst is proactive, consultative and business-minded, and reports to the Manager of Global Security Analysis.Responsibilities Monitor Tesla security data world-wide using industry tools and proprietary information; identify and monitor trends Create data platforms and tools for use by the Global Security Organization Write queries, perform ad hoc data analysis, and create data visualizations for Tesla security teams, including by not limited to, t ravel security, executive security, physical security andinternal investigations Build and maintain dashboards and other data visualizations of complex data sets andcalculations Formulate best practices for integrating security, health and safety, and operational data,proactively identifying opportunities for optimization Collaborate closely with Tesla internal investigations; identify data-driven opportunities to predict and prevent future security issues and/or incidents Collaborate with the security team to constantly improve analytic standards, workflows, and success metrics and develop/improve analytic products as appropriate Build collaborative relationships with other security data analysts in the region; build expertise on security data analysis best-practices and innovationsRequirementsBachelor's degree required Minimum of 3+ years managing, analyzing and reporting on large datasets; previousExperience In a Corporate Security Organization Highly Preferred Substantive experience working in SQL, Python, or R Exceptional communication skills; demonstrated success effectively deliveringdata-driven conclusions for consumers without expertise in data analysis Proven track record managing multiple projects, and the ability to flex quickly as requiredby evolving corporate priorities Collaborative work style and strong people skills Ability to balance attention to detail with a sense of urgency, and the need to, at times,execute quickly Approximately 10% global travel required

title: CCL Report Writer
description: Our client is looking for a CCL Report Writer. The Report Writer/Data Analyst is responsible for working with colleagues to analyze, design, build, test, deliver and maintain reports, dashboards and other data extracts requested. The position requires an understanding of the Cerner Millennium database and associated reporting tools: CCL, PowerInsight (Business Objects Webi/Rich Client). In order to be successful, the ideal candidate will be an expert in developing reports using Business Objects Webi as well as constructing complex SQL statements in a healthcare ‘payor’ environment. The analyst will also be responsible for working on reported production issues in addition to contributing reporting expertise while assigned to project teams. The analyst will work closely with clinical and revenue cycle architects, decision support power-users as well as report consumers across the organization. The analyst should thrive in a client-focused environment and demonstrate his/her dedication to implementing ‘best practices’ and systems improvements. Ideal candidate will also demonstrate strong analytical and problem solving skills as well as a willingness to learn new things. Documenting business and system processes and procedures through the use of industry standard process flow and flow charting techniques is also important. Job Requirements· Knowledge and hands-on experience using Business Objects Webi (branded as Cerner PowerInsight) as well as CCL programming language.· Knowledge of Cerner's data model and architecture.· Expert in constructing complex queries using SQL and strong understanding of database architecture and design (physical and logical). · Expertise with relational database query (SQL) skills and large databases.· Expertise with reporting tools (Business Objects Webi, SQL Server Reporting Services, Crystal) and ETL tools (SQL Server Integration Services).· Knowledge of project management and systems development lifecycle management.· · Good communication skills.· Good documentation skills.· Clinical workflow knowledge in a hospital setting a plus.Intermediate to advanced Cerner Clinical CCL development skill with heavy emphasis in these areas: Required - 5 yearsPathNetSurgiNetRadNetPowerChartPharmNetPage developmentRevCycle experience a big plusSolution build experience a big plusExperience & Education · Bachelor's degree in Information Systems/Computer Science or related field.· 5-6 years experience in healthcare provider industry.· 2-3 years experience with Business Objects, SQL, CCL, SSRS and SSIS experience.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: JOB DESCRIPTION     POSITION TITLE:          Digital Marketing Specialist   DIVISION/LOCATION:  LSC – Roseville, CA   REPORTS TO:                  Director of Marketing/VP of Sales & Marketing   POSITION SUMMARY:               As the Digital Marketing Specialist, this position will be charged with the incredible opportunity of taking our digital and social marketing efforts to a whole new level within our marketplace. Working with our regional and corporate communications teams on all initiatives and digital trends, knowing the latest trends within our marketplace, understanding our local market competition and keeping abreast of the latest in digital trends and trendsetters.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:   Lennar.com website Review and keep up to date the division market, community, plan – and all subpages pages of Lennar.com regularly for completeness, accuracy and quality of content. Become proficient in SiteCore (Lennar.com Content Management System) to be able to update all editable content and images. Work with division JDE Admin to make sure all relevant and accurate information is flowing into Lennar.com. Ensure photos are used as much as possible on the website (as opposed to renderings), and that interior and exterior photography is very well done, prevalent and of the appropriate size for web usage. If renderings are used on the website – work with one of our national suppliers to make sure they are photorealistic in nature. Ensure promotional banner ads on the site are being used and compliant from a branding and legal standpoint. Ensure Internet Sales Consultant banners are activated.   Division landing pages/landing page templateMaking sure division landing page templates are deployed using corporate templates and for all appropriate uses including: promotion, quick move in, Facebook, Next Gen, Realtors, etc. Making sure all content within the landing pages is accurate and up to date. Making sure landing pages are search engine optimization optimized. Making sure A/B testing occurs on landing pages to make sure they are optimized for ultimate performance.   Social Media SitesUpdate, monitor and enhance engagement on all division social media sites (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Pinterest, Instagram, ActiveRain and any new sites deemed effective). Make sure content is relevant and branded correctly. Post relevant industry and market specific content. Utilize Sprinklr for optimizing overall performance. Analyze and optimize monthly social engagement analytics and ad performance on all platforms. Monitor monthly social performance ensuring the yearly goals are met and exceeded. Review monthly social media spend and Review-Do-Review efficiency and effectiveness. Shop competitors relative to their social media efforts. Maintain list of all social media accounts log-in information and always make sure corporate has the most up-to-date information.   Third Party Listing Sites and Display AdvertisingMake sure the BDX feed to all partner sites is optimized with as much content as possible. Review and determine feasibility of division listing homes with enhanced listings on Realtor.com, Zillow and Trulia. Review and determine feasibility of display advertising on NewHomeSoure.com, Move.com, Realtor.com, Zillow and Trulia.   eMarketing (E-mail marketing)Work with Lennar corporate eMarketing Specialist to segment eMarketing list and optimize campaigns. Review monthly eMarketing reports and highlight best practices to optimize local division eMarketing performance. Keep and monitor eMarketing schedule for the division.   SEM (Search Engine Marketing)Participate on SEM calls, to review keywords and campaigns for the division. Act as conduit between the division and corporate communications ensuring the division is utilizing the latest in SEM strategies.   SEO (Search Engine Optimization)Ensure Lennar.com content is SEO optimized. Ensure division landing pages are SEO optimized. Make sure social media post are SEO optimized. Work with corporate digital data analyst to review and improve SEO ranking.   AnalyticsAnalyze and optimize all digital campaigns daily, weekly, monthly and yearly. Work with the regional and corporate digital marketing associates on; paid search, eMarketing, 3rd party listing sites, social media ads and engagement, website content, landing page content, website and landing pages – Google analytics, website and landing pages Brightedge SEO Tool.   Perform all other duties as assigned.   EDUCATION AND ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:   ·       Two (2) years’ experience minimum in similar position or related areas of the marketing industry ·       Two (2) years’ experience minimum in the home building/housing/real estate industry ·       High School diploma or GED required ·       Bachelor’s degree in Social Media Marketing, Marketing, Advertising, Communications or equivalent preferred ·       Valid driver’s license ·       Intermediate PC skills (proficient in Microsoft Office Suites including: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Photoshop, InDesign, Adobe, PhotoShop) ·       Up-to-date with major social media sites and digital trends required ·       Must have extensive internet exposure and/or internet consumer experience ·       Strong verbal and written communications skills ·       Committed to self-development of marketing and internet skills ·       Ability to self-manage activities with minimal supervision ·       Strong passion for digital marketing ·       Strong interpersonal and communication skills ·       Ability to problem solve ·       Arrive early and work late if necessary ·       Some weekend work required ·       Understand and follow work rules and procedures ·       Maintain regular attendance and punctuality relative to daily work schedule is required ·       Accept constructive feedback ·       Team player   PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:   This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the ability to occasionally bend, stoop, reach, lift, move and carry office materials and supplies weighing 25 pounds or less. Finger dexterity is required to operate a computer keyboard and telephone equipment, extensive phone and computer communication is required.      FLSA STATUS: Non-exempt

title: Operations Data Analyst
description: 181267 Operations Data Analyst (Open)The Seagate Cloud Systems Operations Team is seeking a highly motivated, resourceful and data-driven Operations Data Analyst in Longmont, CO. This role will play a key role in Business Operations Analytics activities. We are looking for an organized and detail-oriented person with a passion for analytics.This position will provide a highly motivated, engaged professional the opportunity to gain experience in developing analytical tools. The ideal candidate is someone who is a fast learner, innovative, wants a challenge, and is eager to make an impact. Excellent analytical skills, teamwork, and determination are the foundations of this role.A Day In The LifePerforming data validation to ensure integrity, accuracy and consistency, identifying the root cause of data inconsistencies and process defects, troubleshooting potential issues with new and existing data sources, implementing timely corrective actions, and driving closure with subject matter experts.Designing, developing, and documenting inventory reports and analysis to support S&OP processes. Multiple and often complex data sources will require a high degree of skill to recognize and understand relationships, organize data and deliver insightful analysis.Regular communication with global team members to understand requirements, recommend and make improvements, informal cross-functional leadership.About YouProven proficiency with Alteryx DesignerProven proficiency with Tableau DeveloperExperience gathering data from large scale data warehouses/data marts, understanding of relational database structure and conceptsProject management experiencePossess the ability to handle multiple projects in parallel and deliver them on timeStrong organizational and time management skills, and attention to detailProven expertise with MS Office Excel including pivot tables and macrosPossess excellent written and verbal communication skillsBachelor’s degree and/or equivalent experience in an Information Science, Analytics, Information Systems or related fieldYou Might Also HaveProven proficiency with Business ObjectsExperience with Oracle applications is a plusKnowledge of supply chain processes in a manufacturing environment is a plusOur culture is focused on our Corporate Values --People, Customer Success, Excellence, Innovation, Teamwork, Openness, Social Responsibility and Sustained Profitability. Join a worldwide team of talented, collaborative, innovative people who thrive in a work environment where people can share knowledge and learn from one another. You won’t find a more exciting place to build your career and challenge yourself. Accept the challenge and Go where innovation leads…Join Seagate. Apply now! Seagate Technology is committed to equal opportunity in employment and welcomes applications from all sections of the community, irrespective of sex, marital status, religious affiliation, age, disability, veteran status, or ethnic origin.Job Family: Professional

title: Data Analyst
description: As a Data Analyst, you will be the analytical data partner for our game studios. You will work closely with Game Designers & Product Managers to transform subjective discussions about product into concise analytic questions that deliver actionable answers. You will take a leadership role in managing studio relationships, mentoring junior analysts & shaping the evolution of our analytics infrastructure. This is a high visibility role that will have a direct impact on the success of some of our biggest titles. These are just some of the things you’ll get to do here:  Work with game teams to measure and optimize performance of titles in beta and after worldwide launch. Using state of the art big data tools such as Hive, Presto and Redshift, to sift through billions of rows of data to answer challenging business questions. Help design and analyze AB and multivariate experiments. Using Tableau to build dashboards that allow game teams to self serve custom data for their titles. Collaborate with game team to define telemetry of titles. Continuously learn new technologies that advance analytic function at Glu We’ve found that those with these passions and skills/experience are best setup for success. If you have: 3+ years experience as analyst, data scientist, or related quantitative role. High proficiency with SQL, especially in distributed environments (Hive/Presto). Experience in UNIX and Python An Understanding of statistical analysis and familiarity with core statistical functions. Excellent presentation and communication skills. And a passion for aggressively finding opportunity in data. Extra bonus points if you have: A passion for gaming. Experience with Hadoop, HP Vertica, and other big data technologies. Experience with modern programming languages (e.g. python, javascript) Experience with statistical packages such as R or SAS. Predictive analytics or machine learning experience. If all of this sounds exciting to you, then we think you might be someone who would succeed here on the team! If this sounds like the next chapter in the story of your career, we would love for you to apply so we can discuss your valuable skills and how we can benefit from each other!

title: Automotive Financial Data Analyst
description: Title: Auto Finance Data AnalyticsLocation: Costa Mesa, CaliforniaReports to: Director, Data AnalyticsThe RoleAs part of J.D. Power’s Power Information Network (PIN) Navigator (Lender) team, your primary focus will be supporting our automotive lending clients in optimizing their usage of the PIN Navigator Product. J.D. Power’s PIN data contains millions of data points of annual new and used vehicle purchase transactions, coupled with consumer credit scores, that we use to understand the dynamics of the automotive Lending industry. You will work directly with clients to optimize Navigator product usage via product training and Best Practices Sharing, Analyze Data to provide Industry Insights, support the Navigator Director in New Product Development and solicit New Client acquisitions. Our engagements support Lender Market Share, Product Pricing optimization for Loan and Lease and Risk Analysis for the financial services in the very exciting, dynamic and complex automotive lending industry.Responsibilities Provide support and training to automotive lending clients. (Ensure effective usage of the PIN tool, train clients new users, demonstrate new products and solutions) Evaluate and analyze the automotive lending marketplace to provide Industry Insights to be utilized by both clients and the automotive industry. Support the Director of PIN to create new products and enhance existing products. Solicit potential lender clients as well as demonstrate new product enhancements to existing clients. Assist in improving the quality, operation, and usability of the PIN Navigator database Qualifications Automotive Lending Industry Experience Required BA/BS degree in Business related field: Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Accounting, Business Administration, Computer Science etc. required [Masters / MBA desirable] 5+ years of relevant experience* Strong proficiency in Excel (ability to work with large, complex and dynamic datasets) and PowerPoint as well as balance of Microsoft Office Suite Knowledge of and interest in the automotive lending industry highly preferred, experience with consumer products or with management consulting firms also preferred Outstanding communication skills (written and oral) with ability to think quickly on feet Outstanding analytical/problem solving and data analysis skills (ability to see the story through the data) Ability to interact effectively with people including senior management both within clients and internally at J.D. Power Thrives on tackling difficult problems in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. A combination of an advanced degree and corporate work experience, or analytical extracurricular /entrepreneurial activities and corporate work experience, will also be considered The Career OpportunityThis role will use your analytical, business, and client-facing communication skills, while leveraging your knowledge of the automotive lending industry. You will also be comfortable with pursuing new business development opportunities enabling your career growth within the PIN Lending and Automotive Teams.J.D. Power is a global leader in consumer insights, data, analytics, and advisory services that helps clients drive growth and profitability. The company’s industry benchmarks and reputation for independence and integrity have established it as one of the world’s most well-known and trusted brands.Our ExperienceJ.D. Power has been capturing and analyzing the Voice of the Customer across more than a dozen industries globally for 50 years. We know measuring customer experience is not easy, but that’s where we come in. Through our proprietary index model, we identify the many drivers of customer experience, accurately measure and link their impact to business results, and uncover insights to drive results for our clients.Our Data, Analytics, and Resources Across 18 offices globally, our team of more than 800 professional analysts, statisticians, economists, consultants, and experts in demographics and consumer behavior focus on delivering insights clients can act on immediately. We serve an increasing number of countries and regions around the world, including Brazil, India, Japan, Taiwan, China, Philippines, Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Vietnam, South Korea, Canada, Mexico, Europe, Australia, Germany, and the UK.Beyond MeasureWe understand that the customer experience is vital and that simply measuring it is not enough. Our analysts focus on driving results that will improve customer loyalty and advocacy and our success is driven by how much we help improve your customer experience. But data is only as powerful as the analysis and insights tied to it—and we are putting that power in your hands through our interactive VoX reporting platform. The data, analytics, insights, best practices, and action plans you need are available whenever and wherever you need them, to help you make data-driven decisions that will improve your customer experience and drive positive financial results.

title: Data Analyst
description: Title: Data AnalystDuration: 6+ monthLocation: Sylmar, CA 91342Description This individual will work with the Data Analytics engineers and analysts to develop methods, templates, and reports for the Regultory reports. With the new European Medical Device Regulations (EU MDR) being rolled out, the monitoring of product performance (such as customer complaints) will increase significantly. To produce accurate, long-term performance data sets, mining of current and legacy databases will be required. This will require extensive use of Business Objects, Excel (including macros and pivot charts), MS Access, Word, and PowerPoint. Collaboration with the technical experts writing the responses will also be required, often under a tight deadline. This individual should have prior experience with medical devices, European medical device regulations (but not an expert), as well as a willingness to learn about clients’ products.

title: Data Analyst - Growth Team
description: Planning world domination? What a coincidence, we are too! With VRV recently reaching 1.5M registered users in less than one year, and Crunchyroll topping the 1M subscriber milestone; the team at Ellation is just getting started.Ellation is searching for a Data Analyst to join our Growth Team. As a key contributor, you will have the opportunity to directly impact the company’s growth. This role offers tremendous growth opportunity and is perfect for for individuals looking to refine their skills and team responsibilities over time.Benefits On-site gym, showers, yoga, and meditation classes Medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD, and life insurance Opportunity to participate in industry conferences Employer-sponsored training and certifications Contribute to multiple open source products Catered lunch and dinner 4 days per week Fun, passionate and skilled co-workers Health care and dependent care FSA 401(k) plan with employer match Pet-friendly environment Paid commuter benefit Competitive salary About You 3+ years in a Data Analyst role with 2+ years of Data Mining experience Experience in composing SQL queries to mine internal data Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Engineering or Sciences Able to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team Experience in analyzing A/B testing experiments Curious about user behavior & product UX Strong attention to detail and enthusiasm What To Expect On a Daily Basis Build and maintain recurring reports to evaluate performance of our product KPIs and guide strategic decision making Identify and recommend new ways generate (or save) revenue through our Crunchyroll and VRV platforms Generate useful business reports to assist leadership in measuring and articulating results Conduct ad-hoc analysis and build complex financial models to drive actionable insights Create Data Models that depict trends in the customer base and consumer population Assist with the creation of key presentations (experiment results, leadership reports) Support decision-making with the product org and cross-functional departments Utilize statistical methods and tools to analyze data Please beware of recent scams to online job seekers. Those applying to our job openings will only be contacted directly from @crunchyroll.com and @ellation.com email accounts. If you have any questions of the authenticity of an Ellation or Crunchyroll job offer, please contact jobs@crunchyroll.com before giving away any personal information.About CrunchyrollCrunchyroll is the world’s largest destination for anime and manga, boasting a global community of more than 25 million registered users and over 1 million subscribers. Fans connect through the most complete anime library including "Naruto Shippuden," "Attack on Titan," and “Dragon Ball Super,” events such as Crunchyroll Movie Nights, Crunchyroll News, and can purchase related merchandise through its online store. Through its app on game consoles, set-top boxes, mobile devices and more, Crunchyroll delivers content from leading media producers directly to viewers translated professionally in multiple languages. The service is available for free or through a premium offering that allows users to watch ad-free with access to simulcasts—top series available immediately after Japanese broadcast.Fans can also view Crunchyroll on VRV, an audience-focused aggregation platform featuring premium SVOD channels and a curated house channel, VRV Select.About EllationEllation, Inc. is a transformative entertainment company and home of industry-leading platforms Crunchyroll andVRV. With majority investment from Otter Media, a joint-venture between AT&T and The Chernin Group, Ellation operates at the intersection of technology and media to redefine the next wave of media interaction and consumption -- breaking down barriers to content experiences for passionate fans around the world. Ellation’s offices in San Francisco, Tokyo, and Chișinău develop the product, design, engineering, marketing and content that brings our communities of passionate fans together.About VRVVRV is a leading audience-focused aggregation platform featuring premium SVOD channels including Crunchyroll, Funimation, Rooster Teeth, and Shudder, alongside a curated house channel, VRV Select. Created to provide fans with a next-gen entertainment experience, VRV offers immersive content experiences in a digitally-driven environment via bundled subscription, a la carte subscription, or ad-supported options. As a platform, VRV helps partners extend their reach and distribute their premium content through a high-quality, branded experience on mobile, web, and popular living room devices.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: About: Primer In the News Fortune - http://fortune.com/2017/10/24/walmart-ai-startup-primer/ Axios - https://lnkd.in/gaHQzuA The Role: Senior Data ScientistThe Senior Data Scientist roles on the Solutions Architecture team will work with executives and leadership at customer organizations to understand their challenges and identify opportunities for Primer’s suite of technologies to support their needs. You will utilize your machine learning expertise to define, prototype, deploy, and maintain NLP/NLG solutions at Primer. Your goal – to build the machines that can tell stories to anyone in the world. The organization: Solutions Architecture Primer is an artificial intelligence company that organizes and analyzes text-based data sources, and generates analyst-grade natural language summaries for a variety of industries. Our objective is to help our customers understand the world around them ‐‐ whether it is emerging geopolitical events, development of a product line or area of research, or monitoring a portfolio of companies’ financial performances. The Solutions Architecture team is a jack-of-all-trades organization that serves as the interface between the customers and the company. Our charter is: (1) scope and deploy Primer’s suite of NLP/NLG solutions to our customers; (2) prototype new technologies and concepts to meet the needs of the customer; (3) maintain our current customer relationships and seek opportunities to improve customer usage and satisfaction; and (4) channel customer feedback and usage patterns back to Primer to drive future product development. Responsibilities: Support the ideation and implementation of solutions and feature sets for the customers, partner with Primer’s product and engineering organizations to create and deliver. Act as a full-stack everything: data scientist, engineer, and customer liaison for Primer. Partner with product and engineers at Primer to identify and prioritize new feature and algorithmic development based on customer engagement and feedback. Build ways to analyze and understand customer engagement and product performance through modeling and data visualization. Requirements: M.Sc. or Ph.D. in computer science, engineering, statistics, computational linguistics, or other quantitative field. 3+ years of professional experience in the areas of developing and deploying machine learning and NLP-based solutions. Hands-on experience with machine learning and NLP tools and libraries including  Numpy, Scipy, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, Tensorflow, Keras. Proven experience working with a variety of data sets, framing customer problems and use cases, building data science models, and analyzing product usage. Understanding of NLP topics: event and topic detection, relation, and extraction; pattern detection; entity recognition; semantic role labeling; and clustering and classification models. Ability to think about solutions from a customer perspective, establish conceptual connections between requirements and solutions. Experience working with AWS, the Elastic stack, and Docker. Excellent communication skills – you will be the face of Primer to customers’ organizations.

title: Sr Data Engineer
description: Our client is currently seeking a Project Manager for a 12-month, rolling contract engagement.If you'd like to know more, please send contact info and your current resume, as well as your availability for a 10-15 minute call to discuss this opportunity to jmason@judge.com. W2 CANDIDATES ONLY, NO C2C** This Job Will Have The Following Responsibilities And QualificationsSupport the full data life cycle of a project through requirement identification, prototyping, design, development, testing, and implementation using state of the art data analytics tools to create solutions for challenging problems in Financial ServicesDevelop, update, query, and mine large quantitative datasets to generate reports and formulate analyses to inform stakeholders.Retrieve, validate, format, and synthesize a variety of data from many different sources.Conduct detail-oriented tasks and perform analyses for projects under supervision of a Senior Data AnalystDocument analysis solutions, approaches, and results.Manage issue resolution with business users and technical support partners. Be the liaison with IT teams in troubleshooting, resolving, and preventing application downtime.Fully utilize a mentee-mentor relationship with a senior Data Analyst to hone your skills and gain industry certifications.Process Structured and Unstructured DataGathers and processes raw, structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data using batch and real-time data processing frameworks.Understands and enforces appropriate data master management techniques.Expert in profiling techniques likeDistinct counts & percentages, zero/blank/null percentages, min/max/avg, numerical/date range analysisKey integrity, cardinality, patterns, frequency distributions and domain analysisData Validation and QualityEnsures data quality and implements tools and frameworks for automating the identification of data quality issues.Work with internal and external data providers on data validation providing feedback and making customized changes to data feeds and data mappings.Agile PlanningUnderstands the challenges that the analytics organization faces in their day-to-day work and partner with them to design viable data solutions.Recommends improvements to processes, technology, and interfaces that improve the effectiveness of the team and reduce technical debt.Notes From ManagerThe general direction of a resource we’re looking for is a Data Engineer but not someone who is solely heads down. We will want this person to be able to work end to end (business client to post deployment). In other words, we don’t need someone who only does data analysis and data integration.Technical Skills to look for: SQL, ETL tools and tableau-like reporting/analytics would be great.

title: Data Analyst with SQL Developer Experience
description: Solugenix is a professional staffing and consulting firm, committed to its candidates and clients. When you work with Solugenix, you become part of an expert team making a difference by delivering value for some of the world’s largest firms in finance, medical device, pharmaceutical, consumer packaged goods industries and more. When you join Solugenix, you join the longest serving independent consulting firm in the nation, distinguished by a history of industry innovation.At Solugenix, you become part of an expert team making a difference by delivering value for some of the world’s largest firms. Join Solugenix today and become part of an established team poised to continue creating innovations for the future of our world.CHOOSE INNOVATION. CHOOSE VALUE. CHOOSE SOLUGENIX!Job Title: Data Analyst with SQL Developer ExperienceLocation: Irvine, CADuration: Long Term ContractInterview Mode: 2-3 Rounds of WebEx interviewsPrimarily skill will be data integration and Model building in Anaplan, with independently working with business partners and stakeholders to gather, implement and test requirements.Core SkillsExperience on Anaplan is preferredNeed someone with 9 Years of Experience.Strong logical analysis capability of business problemsStrong communication and presentation skills (written and verbal)Advanced SQL querying abilityAdvanced Spreadsheet usage (Excel chart, pivot tables, macros)Data ProfilingBackground in MDM projects is a plusInvestment industry/financial services knowledge is a strong plusSolugenix, the longest serving independent IT consulting firm in the nation, delivers comprehensive, managed-services IT solutions known for their innovation, value and dependability. Our custom IT services, including Application Lifecyle Management Services, Business Applications Support, Custom Inbound/Outbound Call Centers, IT Service Desk Operations and Support and Professional Staffing solutions are tailored to unique industry requirements and delivered with predictable, manageable costs to optimize mission-critical transactions, drive business value and support customer success.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst
description: OverviewAmTrust North America Claims is looking for an experienced Senior Business Analyst to build an operational reporting suite as well as deliver on several high impact and high visibility analytical projects.AmTrust, a Fortune 500 company has seen significant growth since inception fueled by numerous acquisitions over the years. While the company's revenue has grown, the number of claims as well as complexity of claims has grown with it. This has created an opportunity for us to better leverage our scale and vast amounts of data to identify opportunities to operate more efficiently.This position will report to the Director of Claims Operational Analytics and will support the Claims organization by providing data, analytics and reporting to identify opportunities to improve efficiency and effectiveness in the Claims organization. The right candidate will bring a balance of Claims technical expertise, analytical abilities, creativity and execution to the table.Responsibilities Identify, synthesize and recommend actionable analytical insights to drive improvement within Claims Deliver executive level presentations with actionable insights and recommendations Establish a monthly claims operational reporting package that includes dashboard, scorecards and reports utilizing Power BI, MS Excel and SQL Collaborate with IT on data cube development and SQL Server enhancements Support Claims leadership team with ad-hoc analytical requests Mentor junior members of the teamQualifications Bachelor's Degree from a top university 6+ years of Property and Casualty industry experience 3+ years of experience working with business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Cognos or Business Objects Ability to read and write SQL requiredOther Information Location Flexible: Dallas, TX; Alpharetta, GA; Chicago, IL; Irvine, CA; Concord, CA; Melville, NY; Southington, CT Up to 25% travelAmTrust Financial Services offers a competitive compensation package and excellent career advancement opportunities. Our benefits include: Medical & Dental Plans, Life Insurance, Health Care Flexible Spending, Dependent Care, 401k Savings Plans, Paid Vacation and Holidays.OptionsSDL2017

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: NVIDIA is looking for a Business Analyst who will provide hands on design and configuration expertise focusing on the Workday HR platform. In this role, you will work with global business users to identify requirements, help define scalable business processes, and implement standard methodologies in configuring and crafting the HR system. You will design functional solutions that are in line with NVIDIA’s needs while staying consistent with the application architecture. This position will be responsible for supporting HR applications, processes, and projects, as well as data gathering, testing, and communication throughout the implementation of configuration changes.What You'll Be DoingAs a hands-on analyst, you will provide the technical and functional expertise regarding our HRIS system (Workday)Support upgrades, improvements, testing, validation and overall system performance. Work and support semi-annual Workday updatesLead and execute full development life cycle: requirements gathering, design, build, test and deployProvide production support, investigate and resolve critical issues within defined SLAsContinually analyze current business processes and look for opportunities for improvementEngage with global HR Technology team members to knowledge share and ensure process consistencyEngage with Workday community to understand technology capabilities and recommend solutions that address business needsAbility to multitask in a fast paced, dynamic environmentWhat We Need To SeeFunctional knowledge of Workday HCM and Workday RecruitingKnowledge of Workday business process framework3+ years of application requirements gathering and design, including process mapping and gap analysis3+ years of experience in a technical environmentExcellent problem solving and critical thinking skillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsExperience working with a diverse set of partnersMinimum of a Bachelor's DegreeNVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative, innovative and passionate, we want to hear from you!What are you waiting for, apply today!NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: The San Francisco Health Plan (SFHP) Information Technology Services team has a tremendous opportunity for a driven, data-focused analyst who will have responsibility for the data integrity of SFHP’s core systems, e.g. QNXT (managed care system), Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) by performing regular audits of data in the core system along with audits of the data sources going into and out of these systems.   WHAT YOU WILL DO   Perform problem investigation, evaluation and recommendations of SFHP core data processes: eligibility, providers, claims/encounter and authorizations. Work closely with colleagues to identify data related problems and solve discrepancies or data integrity issues. Perform overall data analysis of inbound/outbound data into SFHP core systems, e.g. QNXT, EDW, including provider, members and claims/encounters for various data sources; i.e. files, SFHP transaction systems. Assist in data analysis in support of prototyping canned/scheduled reports/extracts and dashboard development. Work with business owners and IT resources to define data and document mapping rules. Proactively monitor source system changes for data impacts and communicate resulting data warehouse modifications. Work with developers to build or enhance data loads & extracts. Serve as QA resource as needed on projects pertaining to data flowing into and out of EDW and other core systems. Communicate data enhancement needs with management and development team. Mentor and coach junior ITS Data Analysts.   WHAT YOU WILL BRING A degree from a four-year college (e. g., BS), which may be substituted with equivalent work experience. Prior experience at a healthcare organization, particularly at a managed health plan. Minimum 3-5 years of experience as a Data Analyst in a healthcare environment using SQL. Demonstrated ability to analyze, evaluate and clearly present written information and findings. Ability to clearly and concisely communicate health care concepts and technical information to management personnel. Expert collaborator who can foster strong working relationships with co-workers and outside contacts.

title: SAS Developer
description: Technical LeadQualificationBachelors in science , engineering or equivalentResponsibilityProject Planning and Setup: Understand the project scope, identify activities/ tasks, task level estimates, schedule, dependencies, risks and provide inputs to Module Lead for review. Provide inputs to testing strategy, configuration, deployment, hardware/software requirement etc. Review plan and provide feedback on gaps, timeline and execution feasibility etc as required in the project. Participate in KT sessions conducted by customer/ other business teams and provide feedback on requirements.Requirement Understanding And Analysis Analyze functional/non functional requirements and seek clarifications for better understanding of requirements. Based on understanding of system upstream & downstream, provide feedback and inputs on gaps in requirements and technical feasibility of requirements.Design Prepare the LLD/ detailed design documents based on HLD and briefing from Module Lead. Seek inputs from the developers on specific modules as applicable. Consolidate all modules and provide to Module Lead/ Architects/ Designers for review. Suggest changes in design on technical grounds. Develop components inventory for the code to be developed tying it to the nonfunctional requirements. Perform sampling of data to understand the character/ quality of the data (project dependent in the absence of data analyst or designer). Identify tools and technologies to be used in the project as well as reusable objects that could be customized for the project.Coding Follow coding standards and best practices to develop code and check code quality. Share developed code with supervisor for review. Rework on the code based on inputs if required. Perform complex integration. Guide the developers in identifying, preparing and conducting unit test cases and fixing defects based on results. Consolidate the test results and share with supervisor. Provide periodic status update to supervisor and highlight / recommend any changes in design based on challenges faced. Anticipate unreported defects and raise the same to supervisor. Conduct technical troubleshooting. Conduct reviews for codes created by team.Testing Management Develop unit test case for each module. Conduct/ guide conducting of unit and integration testing and fix defects. Review/ approve code to be moved to testing environment. Provide support to the QA team and coordinate for various phases of testing. Address queries raised by QA within defined timelines. Investigate critical defects and establish need for fixing. Raise issues to leads/QA. Report defect status as per project standard process within agreed timelines. Share revised code with supervisor for review. Assist team lead and project manager on estimates around defect fixes.Configuration Management Maintain versions of the code or consolidate version maintained by the Developers. Provide support as required to the Administrators during configuration, code backups, deployment etc.Deployment Assess and create deployment/ roll back plan. Validate if all the components have been migrated and the right version is checked in. Maintain deployment tracker. Perform sanity checks post deployment to ensure smooth production. Share activity status with supervisor and highlight concerns if any.Project Execution Monitoring & closure (Support to Project Management activities): Monitor work of the developers and share work achieved with them. Provide guidance through SDLC. Provide status of progress to leads. In case of change requests, provide inputs on the plan.Service Support And MaintenanceSpecific to production and maintenance support: Provide support for 1 week and hand over to production team. Identify if the incoming request is a service request/ defect during the warranty or an incident. If it is code defect in the warranty, highlight to Lead and initiate defect fix process. Post warranty, support in transition to maintenance team.Knowledge Management Post release participate in project review call and discuss points on what went well and what didn't. Create and update knowledge articles (case studies, lessons learnt) in the knowledge management repository. Guide developers in creating such documents. Publish white papers/ blogs/ articles (if required).People Management Conduct training through academy or internally within the team. Conduct technical, face to face interviews for internal transfer or external hiring. Provide feedback on Developers form technical /domain standpoint to the module lead.Technical SkillsSNoPrimary SkillProficiency Level *Rqrd./Dsrd.1SAS Web Report StudioNARequired2SAS visual analyticsNARequired3Base SASNARequired4SASNARequired Proficiency LegendsProficiency LevelGeneric ReferencePL1The associate has basic awareness and comprehension of the skill and is in the process of acquiring this skill through various channels.PL2The associate possesses working knowledge of the skill, and can actively and independently apply this skill in engagements and projects.PL3The associate has comprehensive, in-depth and specialized knowledge of the skill. She / he has extensively demonstrated successful application of the skill in engagements or projects.PL4The associate can function as a subject matter expert for this skill.
