title: Senior Research Analyst
description: We are looking for an experienced analyst to help us expand our data offerings, forecasting, and analysis capabilities. This position is based out of Sacramento (Folsom), California and is part of our national team that advises real estate executives with strategic planning, market and consumer research, and trusted analysis. This position requires an individual who is organized, self-motivated, and has demonstrated the ability to support multiple projects. The candidate must be able to work independently and react quickly to changing priorities with a consistent sense of urgency. Requirements and Job Responsibilities:  • Bachelor’s degree• Minimum 2 years professional work experience in a research or data analysis environment• Assist in modeling and/or forecasting multiple data points• Data analyst or related experience; experience in reporting and data mining, as well as the ability to analyze large sets of data • Ability to consolidate and synthesize large amounts of data from various sources; must be able to translate a large group of raw numbers into succinct presentation points • Monitor trends in economic and real estate markets • Collect, filter, and graph relative real estate performance and fundamentals data • Support the production of monthly market reports and research papers • Experience with reporting detailed and summary status, milestones, and deliverables regarding project assignments • Ability to learn independently and quickly • Demonstrate critical thinking and initiative, reaching out to other team members and data providers in search of answers Required Skills: • Strong analytical skills, problem solving ability, and written and oral communication skills are required• Statistical or data analysis experience• Advanced to expert MS Excel skills • Ability to format and validate data • Attention to detail with the ability to check your own work • Ability to work independently and collaboratively • A passion for the data analysis profession • Develop and generate standard reporting Additional Desired Qualifications a Plus: • Experience with databases and dashboard tools • Interested in real estate, demographic, and related data • Analyze data post-database import to ensure accuracy • Experience creating SQL queries for retrieving data  If you enjoy challenges, take great pride in accuracy and professional appearance in all the work you complete, and enjoy working with a fantastic team that supports each other, this is the dynamic environment for you.John Burns Real Estate Consulting offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with employer contributions, paid vacation, holiday leave, etc. Compensation will be based on a candidate's market value and their ability to contribute to our business. For more information or to submit your resume, please reply to this post.

title: Sr. SAS Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer
description: PDI provides services across all verticals and continues to grow as a leader across every sector of data management, from Big Data to Data Science. Our team’s talent is what sets us apart from our competitors and we continuously seek out the foremost talent of the technology community to give you the best result possible.   At this moment we are hiring a Sr. SAS Data Analyst/Analytics Engineer for our client located in San Francisco, CA.   Job Description: The Senior Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer will work with the Regulatory Affairs department to deliver analytical models to support rate case filings. The resource must have programming experience with statistical analysis and modeling projects. The resource must be comfortable interacting and communicating with both Business and IT project team members and needs to be a self-starter. The Data Analyst/Engineer must have expertise in mathematics and applied statistics with programming skills to create predictive models and tools on large scale data sets (in tens of TB) and operationalize the models on Big data clusters on AWS.   Skills Required:  Data analysis: excellent analytical and problem solving skills. Have proactive and strategic thinking and ability to align research with the business and innovate research output. Modeling concepts: Machine Learning, Time series analysis, Clustering, Generalized Linear and Additive Models, Nonlinear Regression, Classification, Neural Networks, Decision trees, Text mining, OCR Computer Programming: excellent programming skill for complex algorithms. Must have good SQL skills. Other programming languages: SAS, R, Python, C Analytical Tools: SAS, SQL (Netezza, SQL Server, Teradata), R, Excel, Python, Spark, Hadoop Utility or regulated industry experience (preferred)

title: Senior Financial Analyst, Corporate FP&A
description: GROUP OVERVIEW: The Product Revenue Team is the business owner of Oracle’s global product revenue and product hierarchies. We provide reporting for Oracle’s top executives, own and maintain Oracle’s product hierarchies, and provide a world class data set that is the backbone of automated reporting for hundreds of analysts around the world. We own the monthly and quarterly close process and ensure the accuracy and quality of revenue data for all products and lines of business worldwide.   We own and manage the Oracle Product Hierarchies, manage revenue integration for mergers and acquisitions and work with multiple business groups across the company to ensure consistency and accuracy of product revenue.   RESPONSIBILITIES: As a Senior Financial Analyst your time will be primarily spent on product revenue analysis, data quality activities, systems testing in support of Oracle’s transition to the Cloud, plus reporting. Responsibilities may include and are not limited to the following: Monthly and quarterly close of product revenue, including data quality reviews, data cleansing, inclusion of customer and product details and preparation and analysis of monthly and quarterly reporting packages. Work closely with various teams including Corporate Finance, Mergers & Acquisitions, Corporate Development, Budgeting & Forecasting, Product Development, Consolidations, Accounting and others to identify data quality issues, streamline processes and drive continuous improvements. Ensure global business practices are followed and documentation is complete and current. Work with tools including Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition, Data Visualization and various dashboards and data marts to develop and streamline reporting structures for users worldwide. Assist with other special projects, including systems testing, new report development and ad hoc reporting for legal and tax inquiries. Assist our team with Oracle’s transition to the Cloud for all revenue-related processes through testing, data analysis and bug troubleshooting.   CANDIDATE PROFILE: Ability to thrive in high visibility, high complexity, deadline-driven environment. Superior organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple competing priorities. Comfortable working with very large data sets in a business intelligence database environment to create queries, troubleshoot complex data sets and produce concise analyses. Excellent excel skills with experience in producing flexible, repeatable, succinct reports that are highly automated and have few touch points. Business intelligence skills with experience in producing flexible, repeatable, succinct reports and dashboards that are highly automated and have few touch points. Data science / data mining experience or coursework is a plus. Team player with positive, can-do attitude willing to what it takes to get the job done right in the interest of the team. Extreme attention to detail, ability to tie out very large revenue amounts to the dollar Strong analysis and research skills. Ability to tenaciously pursue a problem to completion. Ability to effectively communicate, both written and verbally, with business partners and offshore resources. ***All Qualifications are preferred****   LOCATION:   Rocklin, CA   PROCESS: Interested candidates may e-mail resumes directly to Oracle Corporation Recruiting for immediate consideration, brock.musgrave@oracle.com. Prior to any consideration for this opportunity, Oracle requires that you complete the following 3-step process: · Logon to https://oracle.taleo.net/careersection/2/jobsearch.ftl?lang=en&alt=1. · Keyword search: 18000ONJ · Apply for the role by submitting resume As part of Oracle's standard employment process, candidates will undergo a complete background check prior to an offer being extended. These background checks are conducted by a professional third party firm at no charge to the applicant and include: prior employment verification, education verification, social security trace, criminal background check and motor vehicles records (where required for position).Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Chief Architect, Data, Analytics and Systems - Foster City, CA
description: Are you an experienced data warehouse and big data analytics specialist? Do you like to solve complex and high scale data challenges? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new data analytics technologies? We are seeking a senior software architect with at least 10 years of experience in designing scalable, distributed systems to join the Data and Analytics team. You will provide architectural guidance to the analytics team as it builds and evolves a Big Data Platform, and as analytics solutions are built on top of the platform. The architect is expected to be self-driven, take charge in identifying and fixing problems, and excel in a fast changing, growing environment.Guidewire Software NYSE: GWRE is a leading provider of software solutions to the global property-casualty insurance industry. We currently have over 150 customers, on six continents. We are developing a new suite of data analytics products that will enable insurance carriers to realize valuable insights. These products will be delivered as software managed by our customers and as hosted products managed by Guidewire.ResponsibilitiesDesign and develop a scalable data analytics platform and solutionsCollaborate with the other architects, product managers, data scientists, business analysts and other engineers to define requirements and design solutions. To be successful you must drive consensus and balance the needs of many different constituencies.Assess, benchmark and select data analytics technologies to be added to the big data platformWork with the SaaS Operations and Security teams to ensure solutions that can be deployed in a cloud architecture with excellent performance, reliability and securityIdentify areas of architectural risk and work with other architects to address themProvide guidance and mentor developers on the data analytics teamRepresent our technical strategy and architecture with prospective customers during sales visits (typically CIOs and Heads of IT)Desired Skills And ExperienceStrong understanding of data concepts: relational databases and performance, data warehousing, big data, analyticsExperience developing a distributed data processing platform with Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Accumulo, Yarn, etc.Financial and/or insurance data knowledge preferable. Specifically, bi-temporal modeling needed for insurance policesDeep, hands-on programming experience, preferably in complex enterprise systems.Experience with mixed real-time, message-based and ETL-based data environmentsExperience with Object-Oriented Analysis and Design using Java, Python, etc.Experience working with, processing and managing large data sets (multi TB scale)Experience with hosted, multi-tenant data platform specifically utilizing AWS or Azure-based technologies to support reporting, exploration and analysis.Experience with machine learning and operationalizing analytic modelsCollaborative leadership style and ability to earn the respect of a talented engineering team.Willingness to travel. The engineering team is split across two locations (West Coast and East Coast) so a willingness to travel up to once a month is requiredExcellent verbal and written communications skillsM.S preferred, B.Sc. degree required in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field pbrunner@guidewire.com

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Critical Care
description: This position will be an integral member of the Critical Care Finance team in Irvine supporting financial planning, forecasting, and reporting activities. Additionally, the position will contribute to the preparation of executive presentations and perform insightful analyses during key planning processes. A successful candidate will demonstrate a high level of interest in learning about Critical Care products and business strategy.Job ResponsibilitiesPartner with Critical Care business leaders in preparation of AOP and forecasts, inclusive of expense, capital, headcount planning. Perform month-end and quarterly accounting activities. Analyze period variances of actual results to budgets/forecasts and report performance to department managers and functional leaders. Provide management decision support through ad hoc reporting and analysis. Support Critical Care Finance in development of meaningful presentations of financial data and analyses to communicate financial results, recommendations and insights.Identify opportunities to streamline processes and increase efficiency for Critical Care Finance.Experience / EducationA Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or relevant field is required. MBA, CPA, CMA a plus. A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience is required for the Sr. Financial Analyst level, a minimum of 3 years’ experience required for a Financial Analyst level. Additional RequirementsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.Critical thinking and problem solving skills. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Highly adaptable, flexible and customer service focused. High degree of accuracy & efficiency. Proficiency in financial systems and tools, e.g. Excel, PowerPoint, ERP Systems.About EdwardsEdwards has been advancing the care of the acutely ill for more than 40 years. Starting with the development of Swan-Ganz advanced hemodynamic monitoring devices for measuring cardiovascular performance in high-risk surgical and critically ill patients, Edwards continues to evolve to less-invasive and noninvasive devices to provide valuable hemodynamic insight for an expanded patient population. Edwards has continued to advance hemodynamic monitoring platforms to enable proactive clinical decisions for surgical, anesthesia and critical care clinicians. Edwards is focused on helping clinicians enhance knowledge and standardize practice to improve the quality and efficiency of care. Edwards provides evidence-based programs such as Enhanced Surgical Recovery Program that support the implementation and compliance to protocolized care pathways in the OR and ICU.Our vascular therapies products, including genuine Fogarty catheters, continue this high standard. Developed and refined in close collaboration with surgeons and interventionalists for over 50 years, Fogarty catheters have been used in millions of procedures worldwide.Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world's leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs over 10,000 individuals worldwide.For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it's our life's work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life. Edwards is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.Job FunctionFinance and AccountingPrimary LocationUSA-USA-California - Irvine

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: Job SummaryThe main purpose of this position is to assist with and provide operational support in the formation and execution of the organization’s Data Governance function, including the Data Governance framework, principles, policy, procedures, and standards to drive adoption of DG capabilities across the organization.The Data Governance Analyst will mentor and guide technology application development teams, as well as business intelligence (BI) and analytics reporting individuals and teams to ensure they are following Data Governance policies, procedures, and standards. The Data Governance Analyst may also create and maintain or assist with creation and maintenance of common business glossaries, data dictionaries and the tools or methods that support data standards for the organization.In the absence of Metadata Management and/or Data Quality Management specialists within the Data Governance function, the Data Governance Analyst will provide operational support for development and execution of their related policies, standards, and procedures (e.g., data element definitions, data quality validation criteria, etc.).ESSENTIAL Job Duties & ResponsibilitiesData Governance ExecutionAssist with development and guide execution of industry best practice DG organizing framework (rules of the road) of the strategy, objectives, policies, procedures, and standards to effectively manage data in all the DM Framework components (e.g., Data Architecture, Metadata Management, Data Quality Management, Risk Management, Data Lifecycle Management, Data Security and Privacy, etc.).Assist with communication and education of DG framework artifacts (e.g. guiding principles, policies, standards, and procedures) to all relevant audiences.Assist with development and implementation and application of a “Data” track (of DG processes) through all organization solution development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies.Assist with development and implementation of a business data stewardship function (including a (technical) data custodian function where required).Assist with development and execution of effective and efficient coordination and facilitation processes to manage DG governing bodies (e.g., Data Governance Council, Data Stewardship groups, etc.).Assist with development and implementation of appropriately phased, incremental Metadata Management and Data Quality Management Programs that addresses development and maintenance of good business and technical metadata and both data’s quality assurance during its development stages, as well as data’s quality control monitoring data in production.Assist with organization’s business and technology planning functions when relevant - provide “data lens” guidance (e.g., where DG sees multiple planned initiatives may require same data).Leverage broad knowledge of the existing data landscape, as well as best practices, to leverage how existing or new data can be implemented with/within new initiatives to help improve quality of initiatives’ results as well as how results can be accelerated and/or completed at less cost.Provide guidance when/where there is an opportunity to leverage Master and/or Reference Data Management industry best practices.Assist with development of requirements for technologies of supporting functions (e.g., Metadata Management, Data Quality Management, Master Data Management, etc.).Assist with development and application of processes and criteria that guide how to prioritize what organization data will always be focus of DG functions - this is also generally referred to as what criteria is required to identify and define what are considered “critical data elements” (CDEs).Risk Management - Overall responsibility for the collection and management of data related risks and issuesAssist with development and application of effective and efficient processes for organization to identify and define data related risks and issues.Assist with processes to assess, prioritize, track, and monitor status of data related risks and issues.Assist data risks and issues owners - partner to help develop and define proportionate mitigation, resolution, and/or escalation strategiesAssist with monitoring, reporting, and escalation (as necessary) of overall data related risks and issues statusOrganization Change - Overall responsibility for the acceptance and adoption levels of Data Governance across the organizationAssist with development and delivery of DG marketing and education across the organization to relevant audiences on a “just in time” basis that includes DG awareness, education, and training (as training is relevant).Assist with tracking of organization participation for the above to understand who has and has not been exposed to DG.Assist with development and conducting of surveys to the organization to assess organization’s DG level of understanding, acceptance, adoption - assist with analysis and reporting of survey results.Assist with development or refinement of DG strategies to address DG adoption issues and/or alternative DG strategies that were discovered from survey results.ESSENTIAL CompetenciesBachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, a related discipline or equivalent work experience. Master’s degree or related industry certifications related to position are preferred.Minimum of three years of combined (or equivalent) Data Governance and/or Data Management related experience across multiple business disciplines as a Business Analyst, Reporting Analyst, Database Developer, or Application Designer/Developer.Minimum of three years of relational database development and/or analysis experience.Prior experience within insurance, mortgage, finance, or related industry is a plus.Proficient in Microsoft Office suite tools for productivity, analytics and presentations.Ability to effectively collaborate across broad parts of the organization.Must be a “self-starter “and comfortable working with relatively little initial guidance.Demonstrated experience producing presentations, status reports and other communications.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as ability to translate complex Data Management or technical concepts with all levels of an organization.Working knowledge of Master and Reference Data Management concepts including, but not limited to, duplicating handling, data quality, and data cleansing, including an understanding of the fundamentals of data bases and data structures (tables, hierarchical structures, flat files, etc.).Working knowledge of how data supports business processes, especially around the core business processes of the organization.Working knowledge of industry and regulatory data related policies, laws, and regulations.Experience in documenting and implementing policies around data quality and data privacy and security.Ability to successfully lead and collaborate with others through complex problem solving and collaborating with various functional and business teams, as well as technology teams.Proficient in Microsoft Office suite tools for productivity, analytics and presentations.Ability to manage multiple tasks, priorities, and responsibilities in a dynamic environment, while maintaining attention to detail.Maintain confidentiality of information and use information appropriately.

title: Principal Master Data Systems Specialist PSJH
description: **Providence St. Joseph is calling a Master Data Systems Specialist Principal – PSJH to one of the following locations: Renton WA, Seattle WA, Portland OR, Beaverton OR, Anaheim CA**We are seeking a Master Data Systems Specialist Principal – PSJH to serve as the most senior Subject Matter Expert (SME) for data domains of Enterprise Master Data Management and Reference Data. This includes integrating Enterprise Golden Records, Source of Truth, Hierarchies, Data standards and mappings into one or more PSJH solutions within and external to Healthcare Intelligence to reduce and avoid silos resulting in simplified data flow for efficient enterprise solutions. Master Data Systems Specialist Principal will partner both at the department and functional levels, including data stewards, to ensure alignment of master data rules and the operations of the application meet all requirements. This role also mentors other Specialist in variety of Master Data domains and Reference Data.In This Position You Will Have The Following ResponsibilitiesServes as a consultant and leader in collaboration with Data Owners, business and IT stakeholders, Data Stewards, Master Data Systems Architects, and Contractors to determine system business standards, rules, access solutions, and data quality indicators.Define implementation Master Data Management for core data assets including but not limited to Patient, Provider, Payor, and Supply Chain domainsInterfacing with end user work groups to understand requirements, and helping to define, develop and implement MDM standard operating procedures within targeted business and data domainsSet standards on System level Master Data Management Strategy, Implemention Plans, and Project Phases in collaboration with Master Data Systems ArchitectsSupport development of ongoing Master Data and Reference Data Governance & Administration for analytical needsProvide inputs and recommendations to multiple ongoing system level projects including risk management for data management application selections, data source identification, and data source development strategiesDevelop operational processes, tools, and delivery channels to audit and improve system Master Data and Reference DataRequired Qualifications For This Position IncludeMaster’s Degree in Data Management, MIS, Business Administration, and/or other data-related or healthcare related fields Or equivalent educ/experience.10years healthcare data management related disciplines10years data analysis, data integration, application integration, report development, or project management skills8 years software/system development lifecycles7 years Enterprise Data Warehouse and/or Master Data Management (MDM) - functional and/or technical experiences2 years MDM tools including but not limited to Siperian/Informatica MDM, IBM Initiate/MDM, Maestro MDS2 years Understanding of master data management, 360-degree view of data, and golden record concepts1 year Data profiling using packaged software a plus (Trillium, Informatica DQ Analyst, IBM QualityStage, SAS DataFlux, etc)Deep understanding of meta data sources, master data management practices/technology and how it supports business process, results and data lifecycle.Strong knowledge with master data management tools, data analysis, development of business requirements and reviews, quality assurance and user acceptance testing in rapid sprint cycles.Provides expert-level knowledge of data definitions, data relationships, business rules, data flows, data usage, and data quality indicators. Facilitates improved enterprise understanding of the data.Ability to identify system constraints or gaps in routine business requirements, and effectively communicate issues/risks.Exhibits good listening and strong communication skills. Able to communicate effectively with Data Stewards, stakeholders, project team members and Data Arhitects by providing a concise and balanced perspective.Successful experience working in a leadership capacity with virtual teams.Advanced analytical skills to analyze, define and maintain quality master data.Experience with successful organizational skills including prioritization and time management.Preferred Qualifications For This Position IncludeExperience with report development and data visualization tools (especially Tableau and SSRS)Project mgmt professionalCredentialing provider specEpic certificationHealth info mgmt system profSt. Joseph Health (SJH) is an integrated healthcare delivery system sponsored by the St. Joseph Health Ministry and organized into three regions: Northern California, Southern California, West Texas/Eastern New Mexico.SJH provides a full range of care from facilities including 14 acute care hospitals, home health agencies, hospice care, outpatient services, skilled nursing facilities, community clinics, and physician organizations.SJH maintains a 'continuum of care,' matched to the diverse needs of the urban centers, smaller cities and rural communities in three statesFor the third year in a row in 2009, the Gallup Organization awarded St. Joseph Health its highest honor - the Great Workplace Award.SJH provides exceptional benefits, opportunities for advancement and relocation within the system.St. Joseph Health is comprised of four core values: Service, Excellence, Dignity, and Justice are the guiding principles of all we do.Excellent compensation program and benefits provided.St. Joseph Health (SJH) provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.In addition to federal law requirements, St. Joseph Health (SJH) complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.Positions specified as “on call, per diem” refers to employment consisting of shifts scheduled on as “as needed basis” to fill in for staff vacancies.

title: Data Analyst- Private Wealth Management/Investment Management
description: This position reports to a Director of Wealth Management Technology and supports the development and implementation of Wealth Management’s technology roadmap.The Data Analyst works with subject matter experts from the project team to determine data requirements for PWM Data Warehouse systems, develop these requirements into functional specifications and detailed data flow design documents, and participates in the full development process life-cycle from concept, through testing, to implementation. This includes identifying necessary data, reconciling with the new application and the legacy data sources and ensuring a successful implementation of PWM Data Warehouse capability. This will include communicating business term definition, establishing data quality rules, writing and execute data quality checks, researching and analyzing data in support of business functions, process and workflow knowledge and user acceptance testing. Collaborate with Project Manager, business and technology/vendor partners to jointly identify data needs required to deliver the next generation of wealth management technology Data Warehouse solutions. Reconcile source data with data at vendor to support transition to PWM Data Warehouse Develop and verify data mapping as needed to support the PWM Data Warehouse project. Provide Technical specs to Development Team such that ETLs can be built to spec Write and execute data quality checks to:o Ensure that all and only the expected records appearo Ensure that calculated values are correcto Ensure that abnormal/edge cases are handled as expectedo Ensure that all values fall within expected rangeo Check null value handling, etc.Communicate standard calculation logic and business term definition Establish best practices and data quality rules benefiting all aspects of the business. Work closely with vendors to debug data issues Communicate results and insights with project teams and stakeholders (e.g., through live presentations and ongoing analysis/reports).Experience & EducationQUALIFICATIONSBA in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering required 5+ years of relevant work experience with background in wealth management and/or client/account holdings 5+ years of relevant experience in data analysis and/or data managementTechnical Skills Solid expertise writing SQL Excellent attention to detail and experience debugging code Knowledge of Private Wealth Management/Investment Management - with ability to interpret definitions and calculations from business language to developer logicProfessional Skills/Competency: Strong quantitative and analytical skills - ability to quickly analyze data to identify key insights and apply them to the businessClear, high-level understanding of complex data models and software integration/delivery Focus on development/ improvement of data to support continuous evolution of a more competitive and profitable Bank Excellent communication skills, including ability to present effectively to both business and technical audiences at all levels of the organization Strong orientation to clients, including demonstrated ability to understand needs and apply this knowledge to drive data enhancements Understanding of traditional and alternative asset class investment data, including but not limited to equity, fixed income, private equity, real estate, derivatives, mutual funds, ETFs, global assets, foreign exchange, etc.Personal Skills/Competency Consistently demonstrates and follows high standards of integrity in business decision-making Looks toward the broadest possible view of an issue/ challenge; can easily pose future scenarios; can think globally about all aspects of the Bank; can discuss multiple considerations of an issue and forecast them into the future; understands how the Bank works, competes, serves clients, and generates shareholder value Demonstrates excellent communication and interpersonal skills; able to communicate clearly and concisely in a variety of settings and styles; is effective in a variety of formal presentation and meeting settings Gains support for change by providing context and responding with sensitivity to concerns; takes initiative to recommend/ develop innovative approaches to getting things done Can quickly find common ground and solve problems for the good of all; is a team player and encourages collaboration SQL - Required Excel - Required Wealth Management/Investment Management data experience - Required TFS/JIRA or other issue tracking application preferredMental/Physical Requirements The ability to learn and comprehend basic instructions; understand the meanings of words and respond effectively; and perform basic arithmetic accurately and quickly. Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens. Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person. Speech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions. Position involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Must be able to travelThe Norman Group is recruiting these full time positions for one of our clients, a software technology provider to banks.The Norman Group is a management consulting firm providing project staffing and management consulting to banks and the financial services industry. The Norman Group was established in 1997 in Charlotte, NC. We offer management, project, and IT consulting, across specific domains; including treasury, payments, foreign exchange, factoring, risk & compliance and trade finance.Normans clients have access to an entire project team including analysts, developers, QA specialists, and project/ program managers. The Norman Group employs a talented group of consultants and though their backgrounds are diverse, they share common characteristics in their analytical abilities, ethics, and commitment to teamwork.

description: Candidates who can work on W2 only. No Third Party.Local candidates only! Utilizing analysis results from data mining to support decision making….The Digital Channels Group (DCG) manages the delivery of financial products and services to consumer and business customers via digital channels and leads Wells Fargo’s online channel and e-commerce activity across businesses and geographies.This position will be responsible for performing various complex activities related to fraud risk analysis, reporting and strategy development as it relates to the various Digital Channels. The position is responsible for supporting and collaborating with the Risk Portfolio Managers within FP&A, and ensuring the most current fraud trends and fraud risks are being considered within product development plans, and product life-cycles. The position is responsible for analyzing the current performance of fraud alerting strategies, optimizing alerting strategies and recommending new or additional actions for alerting strategies. The position will communicate regularly with team members internally and outside of FP&A, and even outside the DCG group in order to complete requests or analysis. The position must be able to communicate effectively and efficiently to large audiences and management.Duties May IncludePerforming more complex analysis and/or modeling that maximizes profits and/or asset growth and minimizes fraud and/or operating losses and other risk exposures; providing analytical support for Internet and mobile banking, operating losses and other product strategies to ensure company goals are met; segmenting and monitoring various risk, deposit and other product groups, vintages, concentration limits, etc. and making recommendations to management based on those trends; producing performance monitoring and benchmarks regarding growth, mix, losses and overall profitability and performance; coordinating the production of monthly, quarterly, and annual reports for senior management; reviewing and analyzing trends in current population distributions and recommending strategies. title: Data Analyst
description: ipsy is looking for an enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Analytics team. Candidates should have strong intellectual curiosity with the desire to go deep and understand the core drivers of customer behavior.Key Responsibilities: Report to Director of Analytics and support stakeholders in business verticals with high quality analysis and actionable recommendations. Effectively present analysis that gets to the heart of the most important business questions facing ipsy. Build and manage models to forecast key company metrics and to better understand the underlying drivers of their performance. Design and analyze A/B tests to drive KPI improvements. Develop dashboards to inform business decisions with an emphasis on automation and scalability. Partner with Engineering to optimize data tracking/quality and drive data warehouse improvements. Qualifications:Minimum 2 years of experience performing analysis for an ecommerce or internet company. Experience analyzing paid acquisition preferred. Great communicator with strong business acumen and interpersonal skills. Bachelors or Masters in Math, Engineering, Statistics or other quantitative field, with track record of academic excellence. History of deriving actionable insights from complex datasets. Solid understanding of Statistics with ability to explain statistical concepts to non-technical audiences. Excellent SQL and data warehouse skills. Experience writing complex queries on large data sets. Expertise with data visualization and dashboard tools such as Tableau, Looker, or equivalent. Experience with predictive modeling and scripting languages a plus.

title: Manager, Analytics Engineering
description: DescriptionPosition at MirumAt Mirum we ensure web analytics data used for monetization, user experience delivery and content distribution is actionable, complete and correct. We are looking for an experienced digital analyst to support analytics solutions using tag management software (Tealium) for automotive websites, apps and distributed content. The Manager, Analytics Engineering will become intimately familiar with clients’ Adobe Analytics architecture and implementation. The ideal candidate will have a technical understanding of analytics tools, JavaScript, have experience working with tag management solutions and mobile SDKs to implement analytics tracking.The successful candidate will be an early tech adopter, well organized, have the ability to see analytics projects through to completion, be comfortable interfacing with internal and external stakeholders to understand business challenges and desired outcomes. The successful candidate will be passionate about the quality of the data being delivered to our clients, and understand how to conduct analytics QA efficiently and effectively.  OverallWhat you do:Work with client to define business goals, KPIs, and reporting requirements Plan, implement, and configure analytics solutions that match the client's needs to include: reporting, analytics tracking, offline and online data integration Contribute insights to evaluate and optimize monetization, user experience delivery and content distribution efforts Create dashboards in Adobe Analytics Workspace for use by client and team Develop efficient data extraction and integration solutions for using Adobe Analytics data outside of the Adobe Analytics tool Share research findings and best practices with team, company and clients including customer insight, benchmarking, and industry updates Technical ResponsibilitiesBecome an expert in our client's Adobe Analytics and other relevant digital analytics solutionsLeverage existing implementation strategy while optimizing tag management instance Enforce conventions and best practices in tag management Test and debug JavaScript issues and legacy implementation not in tag management Laisse with development and engineering teams around technical communications & deliverables including but not limited to writing specifications, face-to-face troubleshooting, updating tickets in JIRA Document tribal knowledge, internal processes, client specific information in a centralized location accessible to the wider team and client, such as Confluence Keep up to date on advances in Adobe Analytics tools, process, & documentation Provide client and team support for issues or questions regarding their digital analytics solutions Analytics Quality AssuranceEnsure the quality of analytics projects from end to end, from initial documentation to the resulting data that is collected.  Ensure data is being collected accurately. Research potential bugs in order to provide the deployment engineers with the best possible information available to narrow down the necessary changes.  Manage bug lists and work with project managers to hold other team members accountable to meeting deadlines.  Document test plans and best practices.  Work with debugging tools, specifically Charles Proxy.  Help to research new tools and best practices, with an emphasis on building repeatable practices What You NeedBachelor's degree and a technical and analytical background Web/app (Javascript) development At least 3-6 years of dedicated experience working with Adobe Analytics and Tealium, or equivalent Excellent verbal and written skills Organized, self-motivated, and detail-oriented Experience working at an agency preferred Mirum provides competitive salaries, excellent benefits, 401k match & profit sharing, and is headquartered in Downtown San Diego. This position is based in San Diego. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: New Release Analyst (Consumer Products)
location: 21301 Burbank Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 91367, US
description: We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation, and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world. You’ll experience the following perks as a full-time UMG employee... Competitive Benefits – Your comprehensive benefits package will offer Medical, Dental, & Vision, as well as 30+ days of PTO, a 401k savings plan with company match, & more. Employee Development – We’re invested in growing your career within UMG. Your engagement in L&D programs will help expand your skill set. Also, you’ll be the first to be considered when new roles open. Culture and Environment – You’ll enjoy our branded offices that feature UMG artists and music 24/7, employee lounges complete with video games, musical instruments, couches, free soda and coffee, free merchandise, & more. Social Responsibility – Your good works and engagement in various causes will be amplified by UMG’s donation-match programs, strengthening our impact throughout the world. We are a leading Consumer Products Company in the Media and Entertainment Sector. We produce, distribute and promote the most acclaimed and commercially successful entertainment product to delight and entertain fans around the world. The specific group is responsible for managing the end to end Supply Chain to set up, manufacture and distribute time-sensitive media product to a very demanding retail and consumer market. The New Release Analyst is responsible for all operational processes related to the New Release Life Cycle of Media products to ensure that all key milestones are met, quality guidelines are adhered to, and that the New Product is launched into the marketplace on time as planned. This includes the development of both a shipment and POS forecast for the New Products for their assigned accounts, as well as related coordination of the inventory planning processes. This position will analyze account and SKU specific data to consistently improve forecast accuracy for both shipments and POS. They will coordinate item and BOM set-up and will aid in tracking new release-critical path milestones for assigned release/street dates including any required procurement of finished goods inventory and raw materials. This position will also track new release titles through manufacturing and distribution processes to ensure on-time delivery to customers. They will participate in ad hoc projects outside of their day to day activities and will participate in supply chain meetings, distribution review meetings, forecast consensus reviews, POS reviews, account specific meetings, and periodic forecast accuracy and inventory review sessions. Job FunctionsDaily Operations: The Analyst is responsible for ensuring that all activities required to support daily and ongoing client supply needs are executed: Item Master Data, Pricing: Management of specified New Release segment associated finished goods and raw material item set up and maintenance, bill of material set up and maintenance, product model set up and maintenance, manufacturing instruction set up and maintenance, and cost type and cost component set up and maintenance. Milestone Management: Manage and report on critical path milestones to ensure the successful launch of new release titles on the release date as required. Collaborate with all stakeholders collectively responsible for completing all Release Milestones. Participate in meetings, both internal and external, as required. Provide regular status updates on progress to the Release date, highlight potential risks, and participate in issue resolution/mitigation strategies and activities. Manufacturing: Management and execution of all specified manufacturing requirements, including print and label artwork distribution, print procurement, corrugate procurement, raw material procurement, and distribution services. Procurement: Management and execution of the procurement process for packaged media. Management of this process would include assuring the timeliness and accuracy of purchase order placement, pricing verification, monitoring due dates and delivery schedules, and the monitoring of the accounts payable balances and invoice reconciliation. Process Improvement, Documentation, and Training: The Analyst will participate in the evaluation of current systems and processes, recommendations for enhancements/modifications to management, and implementation projects/efforts as needed. Operational and KPI Reporting: The Analyst will prepare and distribute operational reports used by department managers. They must provide planned and ad hoc reporting as scheduled and/or requested. Develop and provide materials that may be used in presentations to Platform client departments (Sales, Marketing, Production), and/or customers.Vendor/Partner Relationships: The Analyst is responsible for maintaining Vendor/Partner relationships, including issue resolution, status briefings, performance reporting, and escalating issues to management as required.Job RequirementsSkills/Abilities: − Analytical Skills Ability to analyze data and trends, make educated conclusions based upon data Pays attention to detail Execute transactions driving tangible results Knows how or where to obtain information; is resourceful. Working knowledge of Supply Chain analytical concepts − Team Work & Communication Skills Embraces teamwork; shares ideas/methods to improve performance Proven interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills − Time Management Skills Prioritizes work activities; plans and stays organized in order to meet commitment and productivity standards Can seamlessly manage multiple projects and priorities Develops well thought out action plans Manages timelines; deals effectively with the challenges of a fast pace, high-pressure environment, and deadlines − Other Required Skills Takes ownership and responsibility for work progress Takes independent action and works autonomously Takes initiative and seeks increased responsibilities General understanding of manufacturing, and supply chain operations Can troubleshoot problems and develop solutions − Languages Required: English Any other language is an asset − Key Attributes Service delivery orientation Analytical, data-driven approach End to end supply chain services orientation Positive mindset, attitude, and behavior Embraces and drives change in alignment with an ever-changing business environment Strong working knowledge of Enterprise systems and Microsoft Office applications (MS, Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Visio) Strong Excel skills requiredExperience: 1-3 years of experience preferred in a production planning and execution environment with a key focus on Master Data Maintenance, Production Planning, Procurement, Inventory Management Experience in consumer products, wholesale, retail, or manufacturing environment is preferred Demand analyst or inventory planning experience preferred Demand Planning and/or procurement system experience preferredEducation: BA/BS in Business, Finance, Economics or related field; or equivalent experience

title: Data Analyst - Temporary (Full-Time 40 Hours)
description: DescriptionThe Rabobank, N.A. Data and Research Analyst is dedicated to research, knowledge of data structures, data mining and statistical modeling, benchmarking, and the ability to synthesize data and translate insights into clear, action-oriented recommendations that drive improvements in business processes.RequirementsResponsibilities will include and are not limited to the following: Understands data models, reads data dictionaries, and creates Structured Query Language (SQL) queries. Creates and designs new reports, dashboards, and measurement methods as needed. Compiles, analyzes and disseminates data via dashboards/scorecards and ad-hoc reports. Analyzes data with standard statistical methods, interpreting the results, and providing written summaries of the data analysis. Utilizes internal and external data sources to provide both relative and relevant information, including, but not limited to, benchmarking, competitive analysis, and trend analysis. Utilizes Lean Six Sigma, or similar, methodology and tools to identify improvement opportunities and measure the impact of their implementation. Prepares and delivers presentations that represent the data, the insights provided by the data, and the recommended actions and/or solutions. Resolves business, process and/or data issues with a data-driven, "roll up your sleeves" approach. Works proactively and cooperatively with business partners to pursue additional efficiency gains, enhancements, or modifications to overall data structure, processes and/or technology. Converts data-driven insights and helps manage change to incorporate data-driven insights in decision making process and deliver measurable results to the business.Performs all other job duties as assigned by supervisor.Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Communications, Statistics, Business Administration, Economics, or related scientific discipline or equivalent combination or education and experience. Proficiency with MS Office Suite. Advanced MS Excel, Access, and/or statistical modeling tools required. Familiarity with data models, data dictionaries, and relational databases. Intermediate to Advanced SQL. Demonstrated knowledge of Scientific Method, data presentation and the ability to communicate the story and create a call to action. Demonstrate teamwork in facilitating workflow. Must be able to travel throughout bank's footprint to perform required duties (less than 25%). Banking and lending experience preferred. Two + years of work experience in analytics, data management, or equivalent preferred.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Analyst Global Retail Capabilities - RFID
description: Job DescriptionWe believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.Since 1853, we’ve been obsessed with innovation to meet people’s needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.A company doesn’t last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values.We employ more than 17,000 people around the world – supporting great brands, including Levi’s®, Dockers® and Denizen®. Our employees are committed to innovation, creativity and collaboration. Put simply, if you’re looking for a new opportunity, this is a great place to grow your career.The mandate of the Global Retail Capabilities team is to improve the operations and profitability of our retail stores. Our focus is on technology and tools that empower our store associates. We work directly with senior leadership to develop strategies and lead cross-functionally with operations, supply chain, finance and IT on delivery. The group is on the vanguard of change for our retail stores and is pivotal to ensuring growth in LS&Co’s retail channel.The position is a key member of the global RFID program. They will support the retail RFID program by: maintaining metric dashboards, evaluating and testing RFID applications, defining and testing business processes, coordinating with cross-functional partners on key activities, preforming ad-hoc analysis and tracking adoption of the RFID capabilities. This role is the global analyst in terms of RFID and interfaces with global partners to bridge data with facts on the ground.Key Responsibilities / TasksThe Analyst Will Perform The Following FunctionsDevelop and maintain dashboards for global communicationCoordinate RFID activities with cross-functional groupsTrack progress of global rollout of stores and analyze resultsReconcile data with field teams to qualify analysisAnalyze financial benefits with respect to RFIDLeverage data to identify opportunities and drive process changeLead in-store testing and use of RFIDDevelop and master inventory processes with respect to RFIDTrack the adoption of RFID capability globallyDesired Skills & QualificationsBS/BAMinimum of 2 -3 years of experience in: Retail Operations, Consulting or Equivalent ExperienceSpecialized knowledge of RFID, Inventory Management and Store OperationsExperience analyzing data using Excel, VBA experience a plusPowerPoint experienceFinancial acumenRelentlessly resourceful and able to drive deliverables autonomouslyAbility to clearly explain complex issues to a range of audiencesEEO STATEMENTThe Company's policy is to provide equal opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, marital status, Vietnam era/disabled veteran status, physical or mental disability, or other protected classes prohibited by applicable law. Company policy prohibits harassment of applicants or employees on the basis of any protected classes. The Company has established a continuing Affirmative Action Program to assure equal employment opportunity in all its policy decisions affecting recruitment, selection, assignment, promotion, training, and all other terms and conditions of employment.­ LOCATION1155 Battery St. San Francisco, CA, 94111FULL TIME/PART TIMEFull time

title: Data Analyst - Verity

title: Software Engineer - Data Mining/Data Analysis/Machine Learning
description: LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume – we transform lives through innovative products and technology.Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.If you are an applied research engineer/scientist with a passion for working on massive semi-structured text and graph datasets, then the LinkedIn Data Team is the place for you. The ideal candidate will have domain experience (data mining, information retrieval, security data science, natural language processing, advanced statistics, and/or machine learning), a strong systems orientation, and experience in building data mining products. The work you put forth will directly impact and fuel LinkedIn’s search relevance, ad targeting, information extraction, and recommendations.Responsibilities:●Work with BIG data, crunching millions of samples for modeling data mining, recommendation, or search relevance solutions.Basic Qualifications:● BA/BS. Degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline, or related practical experience.● 1+ year of relevant work experience.Preferred Qualifications:● 2+ years of relevant work experience.● MS or PhD in Computer Science or related technical discipline●Working knowledge in one or more of the following: machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, security data science, advanced statistics or natural language processing.●Experience with iterative, test-driven development.●Experience with configuration management (SVN, GIT, ant, maven, etc.).●Experience with developing and designing consumer-facing products.●Experience with Hadoop, Pig, or other MapReduce paradigms.●Knowledge of internals Lucene/SOLR or other information retrieval systems.●Published work in academic conferences or industry circles.

title: Lead Business Intelligence Analyst
description: SymphonyRM helps health systems thrive in the rapidly evolving US Healthcare industry by keeping patients healthy and physicians happy. By analyzing large amounts of data from many sources, we empower clients to make smarter decisions at every turn in their business. Our clients love SymphonyRM’s ability to guide them to take the next best action for both patients and physicians.This Lead Business Intelligence Analyst will play a critical role at SymphonyRM. Data analytics is core to every aspect of our solution and it underpins the value that we deliver to clients. The person in this role will Use our sophisticated reporting platform built on Looker to produce reports and dashboards Work directly with clients to on-board healthcare data from many sources Electronic Medical Records, Insurance Providers, and various third-party systems Use a powerful data wrangling tool (Trifacta) to clean and prepare data for production use Present analytical results to clients; help them track and improve metrics through dashboards The Lead Business Intelligence Analyst will on-board client data, prepare data for use in production systems, and discover insights by analyzing multiple data sets. You’ll have access to vast amounts of data, great analysis tools, and a powerful reporting platform. Your work will improve the lives of patients and increase physician satisfaction. As a member of our Client Success team, you’ll use the latest tools and techniques for manipulating and analyzing data.Requirements Perform analysis on a variety of data sets to discover new insights, help clients understand trends in key metrics, and answer questions with data Using our reporting platform, analyze data and produce reports/dashboards for clients to gain insight into results and metrics Work with clients to describe our data needs, understand available data sources, and validate client data Prepare data for production use scrub and transform data, normalize and standardize it to make high-quality data available to our clients in our web-based CRM platform Work closely with our Client Success executives to deliver analytical results to clients Collaborate with our data scientists and data engineersThis position is based out of our Palo Alto, CA office Skills And Qualifications Data orientation demonstrated experience working with data to understand, analyze, and produce insights from complex data sets 3+ years of work experience with some Business Intelligence/Reporting platform, e.g. Tableau, Looker, etc. 3+ years of data analysis using business tools, e.g. Excel Detail orientation ability to work carefully to achieve an accurate result Excellent communication skills ability to convey results and concepts directly to clients in both verbal and written form Willingness to learn and quickly grow in your career as part of our small, but rapidly growing team Bonus Qualifications Experience using SQL databases Familiarity with healthcare data Interest in leading a team as we grow BenefitsSymphonyRM is a small, but rapidly growing start-up. We've already achieved great product-market fit with clients paying us large monthly fees for our SaaS product. Clients love the results they are achieving using our product.Our team loves working at SymphonyRM because we have A cohesive, diverse team with a mix of experienced veterans along with younger people all focused on building a great product Cutting edge tools applied to large sets of data to deliver valuable insights A product that helps achieve meaningful results that improves the lives of patients and physicians Great learning opportunities and the ability to grow in your career A huge opportunity to be the leader in Healthcare CRM Great location -- our NorCal headquarters is in downtown Palo Alto on University Ave right next to shops and restaurants Competitive compensation and equity in an early stage, fast growing start-up

title: Business Data Analyst (Data Pipelining)
description: Business Data Analyst (Data Pipelining)San Francisco, CA This is a full time permanent role with a very hot start up companyUsing data to uncover insight has become the lifeblood of modern industry. Yet data-driven commerce can often feel like more burden than benefit. Our client, they believe it’s time for a change: they are building managed systems to take on the busywork of acquiring, exploring, transforming, and distributing data for their customers. Whether it’s through integrated integrated web services, a team of dedicated data engineers, or an online cloud platform, they want to cure the shared headaches of this industry.Because the future depends on data. Let’s make it delightful.Here’s How We Help Our Clients Overcome The Challenges Of DataOur client helps people work in harmony with data. Our services empower companies to harness data with ease and delight.Informatics platformWe offer a secure, scalable platform where companies can store, explore, and transform data. This cloud environment helps our clients develop, implement, and manage business initiatives and workflows with much greater efficiency.Data concierge serviceWe offer a managed service for data engineering. Our team of skilled data engineers supports our clients by applying machine learning technologies to wrangle data at scale. These data concierges onboard, clean, and normalize raw data to bring our clients data that’s ready for action.Data networkOur network helps companies discover, evaluate, and harness high-quality data for success. We aggregate data from a wealth of sources, provide insights into vendors and datasets, and help companies gain access to data that can improve competitive advantage.Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst role is an important part of the Data Engineering team to research data use cases and compile detailed documentation. You will be able to take charge of multiple projects to work directly with vendors to understand and document the information within datasets. You will have the opportunity to work closely with our business teams, product, and engineering to help drive our most critical projects.ResponsibilitiesResearch the industry for data providers to meet specific use casesWork closely with vendor resources to understand the activities related to writing technical and business rulesDrive dataset onboarding including design, process, testing, and learning about the data fascinatingIdeal candidates are most likely at a leading consultancy, investment bank, or technology company, but anyone with an analytical mindset and hunger to make immediate impact at a rapidly growing company is encouraged to apply.QualificationsMust Have5 years or more experience in financial services project, operations, or support functionsSpecific experience delivering design, business analysis, requirements documentation, and / or QA testing across numerous finance or operational platformsExperience working on a large system implementation including the BetterExperience working with analysis tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Scikit, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, RKnowledge of and experience in machine learning or other statistical methodsBig data and cloud processing experience, e.g. HDFS, SparkExperience working in a cloud based environment, such as GCP (Google Compute Platform) or the AWSKeywords: Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Business Systems
