working with ETL tools, HDFS, Spark, SQL and NOSQL

title: Operations Analyst
description: AbacusNext is looking for an Operations Coordinator for our San Diego location. AbacusNext® helps businesses with stringent security and compliance needs grow by providing Compliance-Ready turnkey technology solutions, allowing our clients to leverage the power of cloud computing without the added challenges and expenses of managing complex IT infrastructures on their own.What does that all mean? Think about the average SMB’s IT environment—it’s a messy spaghetti of vendors, suppliers, and consultants, all with their own agenda, technology and support. We simplify that complexity with a single solution, taking full ownership of the client’s technology outcomes so they can focus on their business.We are a 35 year old organization with offices in California, Utah, Virginia, Toronto and Scotland. Our user based is 1.5M users worldwide and includes the full spectrum, from solo proprietors to Fortune 100 clients.Who We AreAs an end-to-end solutions provider, our products and services portfolio includes virtual desktop (DaaS), private cloud, case management software (CMS), email hosting services, security endpoint protection, business continuity (BCP), and on premise solutions. Since 1983, we have delivered on-demand services to over 1.5 million users worldwide, and are recognized by Forbes as one of America’s fastest growing companies.We were founded on one simple concept: improving the lives of professionals through the use of technology. Our core competencies serve to simplify the adoption, implementation, and management of technology to quickly increase revenues, reduce costs, and maximize efficiencies, while keeping security and compliance at the forefront.What We DoWe serve clients at every level of their organization, in whatever capacity we can be most useful, whether as a trusted advisor to large firm executive management or as a hands-on coach for sole practitioners. Target verticals include lawyers, general counsel, accounting firms, CPAs, government, and other private professional service organizations. For every engagement, we propose a solution tailored to meet their unique business needs and provide the utmost care in the implementation process.No matter the challenge, we focus on delivering practical and enduring results, and equipping our clients to grow and lead. We collaborate with clients to put solution recommendations into practice and grow their businesses through the leverage of highly secure, compliant and functional business systems.Key ResponsibilitiesAssembles routine operational control and KPI reports for supervisorCompliance management - Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards with direction of supervisor.Vendor managementSystem status trackingTimecardsDescribing process in a work-flowchart and assisting in the writing standard operating procedures (SOPs).Assisting in process improvements by (internal and external); by analyzing operational data and as-is documentationPrepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information.Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.What You NeedBachelor's Degree in Business Administration or related field preferredMust be able to work effectively with minimal supervision3+ years' experience in operations monitoring2 years’ experience as an operations analyst, in an operation or research analyst role, or in a related positionAble to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficientlyGood interpersonal and presentation skills for interaction with all levels of managementGoal-oriented, organized team playerExcellent verbal and written communication skillsPays strict attention to detailPerksExperience great professional and personal growth, we also offer:MedicalDentalHealth401kShort Term DisabilityUnlimited PTOAccess to two gyms and free yoga, CrossFit, and Bootcamp classesCovered parkingWeekly masseuse and chiropractor onsiteEmployee discount to 24 Hour FitnessClose proximity to UTC mall (La Jolla/Miramar) and 805/5AbacusNext® is a smoke free workplaceEqual Employment OpportunityAbacusNext® is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Doximity is transforming the healthcare industry. Our mission is to help doctors save time so they can provide better care for patients.We value diversity — in backgrounds and in experiences. Healthcare is a universal concern, and we need people from all backgrounds to help build the future of healthcare. Our data analytics team is deliberate and self-reflective about the kind of data team and culture that we are building, seeking data analysts that are not only strong in their own aptitudes but care deeply about supporting each other's growth. We have one of the richest healthcare datasets in the world, and our team brings a diverse set of technical and cultural backgrounds.How You’ll Make An Impact Collaborate with a team of product managers, analysts, data scientists, and other developers to define and complete data projects. Show off your coding skills by creating data products from scratch and streamlining/automating existing code. Leverage Doximity's extensive data sets to identify and classify behavioral patterns of medical professionals on our platform. Play a key role in creating both product- and client-facing analytics. Grow into a presentation/communication-focused role or dive deeper into more-involved technical challenges - the choice is yours. Learn from experienced mentors and build your technical and non-technical skill sets. What We’re Looking For B.S. or M.S. in quantitative field with 10+ years of experience Expert knowledge of statistics and visualization Strong understanding of SQL optimization techniques Strong foundation in OOP and FP in Python Fluent in SQL, Python, PySpark, scikit-learn. These skills are an absolute must. Comfortable with UNIX command line interface and standard programming tools (vim/emacs, git, etc.) Excellent problem solving skills and a strong attention to detail Ability to manage time well and prioritize incoming tasks from different stakeholders Fast learner; curiosity about and passion for data Prior exposure to machine learning techniques (regressors, classifiers, etc) is required. About DoximityWe’re thrilled to be named the Fastest Growing Company in the Bay Area, and one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies. Joining Doximity means being part of an incredibly talented and humble team. We work on amazing products that over 70% of US doctors (and over one million healthcare professionals) use to make their busy lives a little easier. We’re driven by the goal of improving inefficiencies in our $2.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system and love creating technology that has a real, meaningful impact on people’s lives. To learn more about our team, culture, and users, check out our careers page, company blog, and engineering blog. We’re growing fast, and there’s plenty of opportunity for you to make an impact—join us!Doximity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: Hadoop Data Analyst/Data Engineer
description: We are looking for Data/Analysts/Data Engineers to join our analytics platform team in designing and developing the next generation data and analytics solutions. The candidate should have deep technical skills as well as the ability to understand data and analytics, and an openness to working with disparate platforms, data sources and data formats.ResponsibilitiesExperience with MySQL, MS SQL Server, MongoDB, Hadoop.AWS, python, java, bash shell scriptingMUST be proficient in SQLMUST have hands on experience with TableauDB Redesign, improving SQL, scalability, nodes.Analyze data, system and data flows and develop effective ways to store and present data in BI applicationsWork with data from disparate environments including Hadoop, MongoDB and other SQL and NoSQL data storesWrite scripts/programs to extract from and publish data using APIs (SOAP, REST etc.), working with data in various formats such as relational, JSON, XML etc.Help develop the next generation analytics platformProactively ensure data integrity and focus on continuous performance improvements of existing processesWe are skilled in combining the science of recruiting and the art of matchmaking. We connect talented individuals in all areas of technology, finance and accounting and administration with respected employers in growing industries. Our employer network allows qualified applicants access to their industries most exciting career opportunities.

title: Director, Technical Product Marketing
description: Ridecell (www.ridecell.com) is powering next generation of ridesharing, carsharing and autonomous new mobility services. As the world shifts to a mobility on-demand model and new companies rush to enter as service providers, Ridecell is ready to support these initiatives. Already 20 customers, including BMW, VW, Renault and AAA use our proven platform to launch, operate, and scale their new mobility services.We’re looking for a Director of Technical Product Marketing with a passion for new mobility who wants to be at the center of new mobility and the coming change from private vehicle ownership to shared mobility. You will have a successful record of working with product and engineering teams to understand the product deeply and help shape the product roadmap on product line program teams. We are looking for someone to build deep product knowledge develop the demos and technical sales materials that connects with customers. We are also looking for this person to own the relationship with the technical ecosystem partners for Ridecell. You would be the lead for the hardware program for vehicle connectivity which would put you in a role of being an evangelist to hardware makers and a contract negotiator when we need to license in key technical components. Were looking for someone who creates, manages, and owns the technical product marketing initiatives, and manages key technical partnerships for Ridecell. Does that sound like you?Responsibilities Industry and Product Knowledge Build deep knowledge of the Ridecell new mobility solution Maintain competitive intelligence and positioning landscape documents Rapidly brief on industry-related news Develop data driven insight into product usage to develop shareable insights that educate and convert new customers Develop the external product roadmap that communicates solution vision Develop a market growth model for global, regional, and corporate activity Stay current with the latest analyst reports and share internallyCustomer Insight Understand the customer purchasing process and roles within the team for the RideCell core markets: Auto OEM new mobility, corporate campus mobility, university mobility and public transit Develop purchase criteria and buy team profilesTechnical Product Marketing Represent product marketing in the PLP process Develop and own the overall demo experience Create deep dive technical materials for sales workshops Represent Ridecell at events and customer meetings as an industry expert Create a metrics driven ROI model Write byline articles and abstracts for PR to pitch to leading media outlets2nd and 3rd Party Relationships Identify key partnerships for Ridecell ecosystem Initiate discussions with new potential partners Negotiate contracts with chosen partners Manage ongoing partner relationships with key partnersRequirements BA/BS/MS degree in engineering. Excellent written and oral speaking skills 10-15 years of product marketing experience with recent experience in automotive industry Experience in new mobility: ridesharing, carsharing or autonomous Program management experience Experience managing vendor and partner relationships Strong organizational skills, with high attention to detail Demonstrated ability to operate both strategically and tactically in a high-energy, fast-paced environment Must currently be located in SF Bay area. No relocations.

title: Senior Business Analyst, Marketing Systems and Operations
description: Who We AreMalwarebytes is the next-gen cybersecurity company that millions worldwide trust. Malwarebytes proactively protects people and businesses against dangerous threats such as malware, ransomware, and exploits that escape detection by traditional antivirus solutions. The company’s flagship product combines advanced heuristic threat detection with signature less technologies to detect and stop a cyberattack before damage occurs. More than 10,000 businesses worldwide use, trust, and recommend Malwarebytes. Founded in 2008, the company is headquartered in California, with offices in Europe and Asia, and a global team of threat researchers and security experts.We’ve created a fantastic culture that our employees love and were recently named in the top 10 of Fortune Magazine’s “Great Place to Work” list. We’re growing fast and are looking for some great people to join us.Who We NeedYour role will be to help implement, administer, and optimize our Marketing Systems and own the business process designs, system implementations, change management, training, and compliance. You will partner with teams In Marketing, Sales, Product, Data Science and Engineering, IT to transform business challenges into process and systems-driven solutions. You must be able to pro-actively engage business, build relationships and solve problems. This position will require problem solving skills, data analytics and thought leadership to come up with creative solutions for the business.What You’ll Do Own the functional development of solutions that support Marketing, working with Global Marketing, Sales Operations, Business Applications, and other teams as needed. Develop and document functional solution design specifications for various analytics projects, dashboards and reports in alignment with unified data architecture standards. Functional solution design on big data technologies is desired. Perform business requirement analysis and data profiling required for the solution design, with the help of Looker, Tableau and PowerBI. Lead projects end-to-end from design, build, test, to deploy. Understand design trade-offs between declarative, code, and 3rd party tools. Serve as the primary contact with end-users (field questions, triage feature requests, troubleshoot issues) and cross-functional stakeholders. Use and recommend best practices while delivering scalable high-quality solutions. Assist with data management and governance. Support reporting requirements and leverage Marketo, Salesforce for data-driven decisions. Assist in designing, implementing, reviewing and/or maintaining both requirements and testing solutions. Regular interaction with business communicating the project portfolio, technology roadmap, and planning on future business objectives. Work within the framework of the Scrum standards to deliver business needs. Work in a matrix & collaborative environment with solution management, architects and “virtual” functional teams across multiple geographies Work in a fast-paced startup like environment. Manage internalSLA communications and coordinate the handling/escalation of issues in a timely and efficient manner. Planning and establishing data training, UAT and other post go live activities including documentation. Responsible for driving adoption of technology and process changes. Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills. Skills You’ll Need To Have 10+ years of business/technical analyst experience within a sales or marketing function. A proven track record for designing and delivering solutions that are focused on usability, flexibility, and scalability. Strong understanding of the Salesforce, Marketo or Eloqua Sales and Marketing platform (data model, declarative functions, business processes). Familiarity with data wranglers and reporting/analysis/visualization tools such Trifacta, Tableau, Looker, Flexplore and Integration tools such as Tibco or Boomi. Familiarity with API framworks. Large scale technology implementation experience. Experience documenting and maintaining business, functional, and/or technical requirements. Ability to manage and cleanse Marketo data using various data management tools. Comfortable working in a fast-paced, agile environment. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Experience working with a distributed team across time zones. Ability to manage cross-department stakeholders with unique needs and competing priorities. What We Offer An opportunity to do something great for yourself and the world A great work environment that supports growth and development Competitive compensation and benefit packages 401(k) matching program Open time off policy Stocked kitchen with healthy (and some unhealthy) drinks, snacks, fruit and lunch options A company who enjoys having fun; holiday and summer parties, annual global company off-site, sporting events and lots of other great stuff

title: Growth Data Scientist / Analyst - San Francisco
description: Blockchain is the world's leading software platform for digital assets. Offering the largest production blockchain platform in the world, we share the passion to code, create, and ultimately build an open, accessible and fair financial future, one piece of software at a time. We are looking to add a Data Scientist / Analyst to our Growth Team as we expand our tens of millions of users into the hundreds across our web, and mobile properties. This role will support mapping top funnel insights and in-product usage to deploy experiments that delight our users and drive meaningful engagement. You will strategically analyse and produce value-added insight from our unique datasets to support the continued growth of Blockchain, and communicate it effectively to the broader organisation. This is a hands-on position where you will be empowered to be ambitious, bold to solve some of the most challenging problems in the cryptocurrency space.WHAT YOU WILL DO: Apply statistical techniques to complex data sets to understand our users across geographies and their engagement across our platforms. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns and provide ongoing reports and data visualisations, in order to make recommendations to the wider business. Work with internal stakeholders and external business partners to ensure accurate collection and logging of data needed to provide insights on user engagement and help drive business decisions. Analyze performance of marketing campaigns and customer referral programs. Build data pipelines that import traffic data on a daily basis. Deploy machine learning models for email targeting, content recommendation algorithms, delivery & targeting infrastructure, and the in-product notification experience across iOS, Android and Web.WHAT YOU WILL NEED: The foremost quality for this position or any position at Blockchain is integrity. Passion for data exploration as it applies to cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. Familiarity with data automation tools and ability to write queries to solve complex data challenges. Ability to rapidly iterate on experiments based on data insights You believe that you can achieve more on a team - that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. Experience automating growth workflows. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the needs of our massive growth and rapidly evolving business environment. Experience working with data tools - R, python, or equivalent, SQL databases, Java. Quantitative degree - computer science, engineering mathematics, economics or physics or psychology. Bonus for experience working on attribution models. Bonus if you can write production-level code for the pipeline.COMPENSATION & PERKS: Amazing and accessible office location in the heart of London (Shoreditch), New York (SoHo) or San Francisco (Soma). Unlimited vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it. Catered team lunch every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Apple equipment. Full-time salary based on experience and meaningful equity in an industry-leading company. London Benefits: Private Medical Insurance (BUPA), Dental, Pension, Life, Short Term & Long Term Disability. New York and San Francisco Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Flexible Spending Account, Commuter, Life, Short Term & Long Term Disability.

title: Business Insights Analyst
description: AppleOne has partnered with a client in Aliso Viejo, Ca. who is looking for a local candidate as a Business Insights Analyst. The Business Insights Analyst conceptualizes, develops, implements and evaluates major market and customer research, using the Baldrige performance excellence criteria as a foundation. The analyst also uses internally generated data to evaluate organizational effectiveness, including strategic operational processes and high-level product and program performance trends. Through analysis and synthesis of multiple data sources, the analyst communicates observations, conclusions and recommendations that drive strategic thinking and decision making for the Association. The Business Insights Analyst plays a critical role in developing business plans that advance the organization's strategic goals. This position works collaboratively with all areas of the Association. Education and/or Experience: o Bachelor's degree in business, statistics, marketing, finance or economics. Advanced degree preferred. o Minimum 5 years' experience in a comparable role

title: DATA ANALYST
description: DescriptionJob DescriptionFirst Data is a global leader in commerce-enabling technology solutions, serving more than six million business locations and 4,000 financial institutions in 118 countries around the world. Our 23,000 owner-associates are dedicated to helping companies, from start-ups to the world's largest corporations, conduct commerce every day by securing and processing more than 2,300 transactions per second and $1.9 trillion per year. First Data is committed to staying at the forefront of our industry, and we are innovating a wide range of next-generation commerce technology solutions to help our clients better detect fraud, gain insights into consumer spending patterns and build customer loyalty.First Data is looking for a Data Analyst for a full-time role.You will be part of an agile team using Scrum. Our teams include software engineers, QA engineers, product development managers, and scrum masters. A typical day consists of brief standup meetings, roughly 80% coding & building new features on your own and sometimes in a pair programming environment. The other 20% of your time will be spent helping with technical issues, planning for releases, or assisting with technical issues.Responsibilities Use Data mining, analytics and business judgment to help identify, prioritize, structure and solve complex data problemsï»¿Create dashboards, reports, and analyses that explain what happened and whyPerform ad hoc analyses and data extraction requests; actively build processes, tools and metrics dashboard to make data more accessibleExtract insights from data to improve the product experience and operational efficiencyActively build processes and tools to make data more accessibleDrive the monitoring, analysis, and improvement of website and other products performanceWork in a cross functional team to implement data-driven plans designed to maximize ROI Requirements Undergraduate degree in either Computer Science, Operation Research, Applied Mathematics, Economics or another quantitative discipline; Masters preferred2+ years of experience analyzing very large, multi-dimensional data sets using SQL/PSQL2+ years of experience creating visualization using Looker(preferred), Chartio, Tableau, QlikView.Solid experience in Excel for data analysis and visualizationComfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while juggling multiple projectsGood interpersonal communication and presentation skillsSelf-motivated, detail-oriented and passionate Nice To Have ETLData VisualizationSQLPythonData Analysis and ModelingAWS Nice To Have ETLData VisualizationSQLPythonData Analysis and ModelingAWS

title: Business Intelligence Platform Specialist
description: WHO WE ARE:Freedom Financial Network is a family of companies that takes a people-first approach to financial services, using technology to empower consumers to overcome debt and create a brighter financial future. The company was founded in 2002 by Brad Stroh and Andrew Housser on the belief that by staying committed to helping people, you can ensure better financial outcomes for both the customer and the business. This Heart/$ philosophy still guides the vision of our growing company, which has helped millions of people find solutions for their financial needs.What began with 2 people in a spare bedroom has now rapidly expanded to a vibrant business that employs over 1800 employees (known internally as The Freedom Family) in two locations: San Mateo, CA and Tempe, AZ. When you visit either of our offices, you’ll understand why our employees have voted us the Best Place to Work for the last several years. It’s a place where the Heart/$ philosophy continues to thrive, where we believe that success is only achieved by doing what’s right for our customers, our employees, and our communities.THE OPPORTUNITY:We are looking for an experienced Data Warehouse Engineer or Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to act in a Product Manager capacity for our BI Platforms. In this role, you will hold the product vision, gather requirements, prioritize execution and evangelize the platform with business users and executives. This is an individual contributor role, but requires excellent cross-functional leadership skills to succeed. While we’re looking for someone with strong BI and/or Data Warehouse experience, you must also have the desire to evolve into the Product Manager role—we will train and develop the right person on the Product Management skill set! We are building a BI platform to provide a single and consistent source of truth in a fast-growing organization (1,800 employees, adding 100+ every month), and will do so with:Best in breed technology – Google Big Query & TableauSmall, smart team of engineers and analystsWell executed dashboards, self-service modules, alerting and real-time monitoring toolsEvangelizing the incremental business value to aid platform adoptionTHE ROLE:Owning decisions on the BI product area on the road-map and what to roll outPrioritize and lead BI Engineering and Analyst team through daily and weekly check-insTransform the way business users consume data and insights through well-designed dashboards and self-service modulesBe a strategic partner and influencer with wide cross functional team of business users and engineersREQUIREMENTS/CHARACTERISTICS:5+ years of relevant experience in either Data Warehouse Engineering or Business Intelligence, ideally in a consumer facing data driven organizationProven experience at delivering data solutions that have driven business value—preferably in a small to medium sized company where you were a participated in and/or lead the initial startup of a BI platform.Advanced SQL skills and experience working with modern BI tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.)Working knowledge of Data warehousing concepts and ETLYou can hold your own with executives, engineers and analysts when it comes to defining metrics, designing solutions and providing insightsYou can make pragmatic trade-offs based on business context and time constraintsYou get the important details right and are able to connect and articulate how details relate to the big pictureYou are curious, relentless and an excellent communicatorCULTURAL FIT (Our Core Values): Care (for everyone): We show compassion and contribute to the well-being and growth of those around us. We only pursue products that improve the financial lives of our clients.Act with Integrity (every time): We take the right action even when it is hard and even when no one is watching. We treat our employees, clients, and communities the way they wish to be treated.Get Better (every day): We innovate, iterate, and improve each day. We are creative, take thoughtful risks, and ultimately learn and recover from failures.COLLABORATE (with everybody): We strive to work together toward a common purpose by proactively sharing information and inviting participation. We recognize the perspective of various groups and embrace healthy, constructive debate. WHY JOIN THE FREEDOM FAMILY?Fast, continued growth – there’s a lot of opportunity for advancementVoted a Best Place to Work multiple times by our employees, most recently #1 in Phoenix for the 2nd year in a row!Benefits start within 30 days401k with employer match3 weeks’ paid vacation (increased with tenure)9 paid holidays & 5 sick daysPaid time off for volunteer work and on your birthday This is your opportunity to be part of a growing company where dedicated professionals strive to help customers and each other succeed every day. If that sounds exciting, we want to talk to you. Apply today!
